The MGM is big, I don't know how old it is, but the casino looks nice. The bars are nice too, though they don't have necessarily a big selection of premium alcohol (at least at the one we walked by). It has the compliment of slots and table games. It was easy to find a decent minimum bid on the tables. I think it has a decent selection of restaurants (always important to me). Though I am sold more on rooms at other hotel\/casinos, I wouldn't be opposed to staying here if there was not room at other places. Unlike other casino's I would go back here and do much more exploring!

This property offers so much given their rates. There are many restaurants, and the rooms are well appointed. Even though it is not in the center of the strip, the walk even as far as Caesars Palace or The Venetian doesn't seem too bad, and this hotel has a monorail stop too. I've stayed here many times, and find it better than Paris, TI, and Bally's among the strip hotels.

Paid $70\/night.  DO THE $10\/night UPGRADE to the GRAND TOWER - Hotel fees for 3 night upgrade ended up being $80.  Grand tower is the only decent tower.    Even in the grand tower the bed was medium firmness not super soft as I would normally like. The room had a flat screen TV and a sofa.  Upon check out Hotel Fees were $100.80 for 3 days.  So for 3 nights I paid a total of $426.47.  We signed up for the "m life" card and got a $20 discount on the Jabowokeez show.  Pretty decent restaurants.

5 night stay, reasonably priced, clean, decent rooms.  Shower handle fell off, took two days to re-attach.  Maids helped themselves to my petty change and bills left out in plain sight.  But they left me the pennies.  But good service all in all.

Nothing extraodinary in my stay, really.  Heavily scented casino and lobby to mask the smoke.  Everyone smokes here as in all casinos, generally. The scent here is extra heavy and sticks to items in the convenience store so wipe your beer can before drinking. 

The building itself is an engineering marvel and there is so much going on that its kinda overwhelming.  Verry impressive though.  Could easily stay inside for a few days.

I would return, especially if the lihhyen up on the air freshner.

Skip this hotel.  Arrived to what I thougth was a spa room, except it was a smoking room.  What part of spa evokes smoking.  When I tried to move, they said they were sold out.  The operator offered me a 50 food credit which was something but really, a smoking room.  They did finally move me the next day but I'm still fried about the whole thing.  I found an actual cig lighter under the bed.  gross.  I will not be staying at this hotel again.

The beds were very firm, and the pillows too. The room was  nice and clean. Very noisy in the halls at night. 
The staff was excellent. no problems there.
The casino was a problem when security is there it was fine as well as the other employees on the floor. But as soon as they moved to another area the hookers came and bothered you. this never happened before  (drunks too).  I came to MGM for gambling, not hookers. 
 We went to see the Aria a drunk wanted money from me while I was playing a machine, that really scared me . he was in my face big time. NO SECURITY in sight.  
 My friend played the same machine for over 2 hrs and got dozens of Bonus rounds and always got the same prize 2.50 cents.  It happened to me on a different type slot.  We thought it odd the same lousy prize so many time. I played quick hits for a long time too and had the same problem.  We both thought the games are rigged. Its no fun any more.
 I was at the Wynn and there were no hookers or drunks bothering us at all. Had a nice relaxed time.  If I can afford it I might stay there next trip. or try the Bellagio.
 We went to see the Aria and I was playing a machine.  A drunk wanted my money.  There was no security any where.  We left.. Las Vegas is not as much fun as it used to be.

This is my favorite place to stay in Vegas. There's so much packed into this place that you wouldn't even need to leave the hotel if you didn't want to. I love being able to eat, shop, and stay all in one place.

This place is ok- I got comped there so I'm not sure what the rates would have been during my stay. The room was nice and check in and check out were a breeze. Food choices were pretty good and it's connected to NYNY.

Bad choice! The room is so small, so old, not clean, smells so bad. The bed is hard and the pillows are so uncomfortable.....  The hallway to your room it's so scary. If they give you a room at west wing, Please don't take it. This is the Eighth trips LV, worse rooms  at all! We are not going to stay there again for sure! However the location is really convenient if you plan to stay there, upgrade your room please!

Blah. MGM. I prefer places like Imperial Palace. It might be dirtier and have a bad odor BUT it's where the action is. I must admit, it takes a little longer to walk from MGM to where the good part of the strip is. But I am lazy so that doesn't say much. If you are staying here in the summer when Vegas is unbearably hot then you might want to take the tram or something. Walking is not fun, even at night you'll want to kill yourself. MGM has a beautiful exterior but the rooms are pretty mediocre. The bathroom is a little fancier than usual but besides an extra painting on the wall of the room, it's pretty much the same thing as any cheap hotel in Vegas, except, you know, MGM isn't that cheap.

POSITIVES? LION! although that lazy piece of sht is always sleeping or refuses to move. ENTERTAIN US! Just kidding. The lion is pretty cool though. Other than that, if you have other choices to stay, I would stay away from the MGM.

FINAL COMPLAINT, THE PARKING LOT IS FAR FROM THE HOTEL ITSELF. WALK WALK WALK. Bring some Heelys

Awww man...what a let down this place has become. We just left after spending 4 nights for the Thanksgiving holiday. They now CHARGE for parking. What the hell does the resort fee cover then?! And why was I not told when I booked about this new policy? I asked that and was told by the customer service girl that "we expect you to read the terms and conditions in your reservation." Ok, will do next time I am booking at a different resort chain that doesn't charge me to park my car! On to the room...When did they switch out the beds for giant bricks?! You expect a nice soft bed after a long night of gambling and I could not get comfortable. Definitely a different bed than I have ever slept on there. Shower was only two options: Freezing cold or scalding hot! I asked them to fix it and the way they did was obviously just turning down the water heater so we had to leave the knob all the way on hot to even then have lukewarm water. Whatever, at least I can shower now. Food prices have become outrageous. Getting a cup of regular coffee will cost you no less than $5.00 anywhere in the hotel. Also, spent over $500.00 gambling, just on machines alone and never won. Like, once playing a $1 machine I put in $50, played the max every time and NEVER WON, not on any spin. Not even a dollar. Good thing my husband kicked ass at the craps table and we broke even! We are so sad at what has become of MGM. It's not even Vegas style fun anymore, just an overpriced tourist trap. The paid parking really put us off. We are now in search of a new Vegas hotel for next time.

Standard hotel. Came here for a conference, hotel was nothing special. Nothing bad, but nothing stood out. Amenities weren't as much as other hotels... They didn't even provide a bathrobe. Bed was comfy but pillow a little lumpy for me.

Maybe I'm not high maintenance? I don't know....
I just don't get all the bad reviews. Room was fine, bars were great, what else?
Was here for work, so didn't get a chance to do much....

Was here for a convention so i spent most of my time in the arena, which was HUGGGEE, the ballroom and some of the conference rooms.

Besides the seminars, I slept for 3 hrs a night and went bar hopping in the casino....I like MGM.

This has become the hip hop hotel on the strip. If you're into that you'll love it here, otherwise stay away. I had dinner at Hecha en Las Vegas. That was about the worst Mexican I ever had. Rooms were nice, pools were fine, not too crowded. 

It seems MGM is trying to brand itself toward a younger, high energy, party crowd. So there is constant loud tween music in elevators, casino floor and pool area. The clientele have become a bit more low class.

Not to mention the stampede after an alleged shooting right after the Mayweather fight.

Wow. I thought I posted this review months ago. Guess not. Here goes anyway!

Came to town for a bachelor party in late August. I frequent Vegas at least twice a year, but until recently was a Total Rewards guy. Their program went downhill and they screwed me out of being rated on my table play, so I decided to give Mlife a shot, and what better place to begin than the MGM?

Thanks to the Mlife Mastercard, checking in was a breeze. Bypassed the atrocious check in line for express check in, where I was greeted by Marni. (If she hasn't gotten a raise by now, it should be a criminal offense). Mentioning that it was my first time with Mlife, she immediately got me checked in, despite being a few hours early. Complimentary fridge? Sure. Move the groom and best man up to my floor? No problem. Honestly, a lot of front desk employees at Strip casinos frequently seem harried and rushed. Not so with Marni. Took the time and effort to check in periodically to make sure our stay was a pleasant one, and it was, thanks in no small part to her.

I stayed in a tower spa suite on the 20th floor, and I'm sure I had one of the few decent views from MGM that doesn't cost $800 a night. The room was good, spacious and clean. Housekeeping did an excellent job. The "spa" tub was excellent as well, made a little disappointing only in the weird gurgling noise that could be heard even from the room as it drained. A minor detail, but one that should probably be addressed.

My only gripe came when it was time to checkout. I had paid for late checkout with my reservation, booked months in advance, and when I called the reservation line I was told it was 3 pm. Lol and behold, I had my door loudly knocked on at 11 am by housekeeping, telling me I had to leave immediately or I would be charged another day. Turns out late checkout is actually at 1 pm. Not 3 pm as the phone operator assured me. Again, a minor detail, but housekeeping not being in sync with room details and waking me up when I had gotten into bed 5 hours prior sucked. 

I would have knocked this review down to 3 stars for waking a guy up like that, but the pristine service provided by Marni kept it at a solid 4. All in all, the MGM provides great service, a city's worth of things to do, and fantastic food (looking at you, Craftsteak!)

Would absolutely stay again. Mlife for life because of Marni!

We stayed here when we were attending a friend's wedding. Check in was easy and they also have an M-rewards card that gives you points for spending money within the hotel that you can use towards purchases. I think this is a great hotel if you're only staying with adults. There isn't really anything for kids, if you have any. There's a food court with McDonald's, Pan Asian, and other types of foods if you're on a budget or need a late night snack, but they also have Craft Steak, Emeril's, Hecho, and other nicer restaurants in case you wanted a romantic or higher end dinner. They have 3 shows, David Copperfield, Ka, and Jabbowockees. We saw Ka and Jabbowockees (both amazing) so we saw the David Copperfield show, which was one of the greatest illusionist shows I've ever seen. Plenty of places to gamble and nice interior, lots of bars, and great service. Our room was gorgeous, with a view of the strip. We didn't get to use the pool (it was closed in November when we went), but their Signature Towers hotel that's associated with M-life hotels had one open that we visited for an afternoon. The only drawback was the last day when cigarette smoke was coming into the ventilation that we told the front desk about to ensure we didn't get charged and that they could fix. I'm also pregnant so it was a pretty strong odor for me. Still, we would definitely stay here again.
tons of stuff in here. from shops to the hottest restaurants... everything is here. but it STILL lacks a lot. the BUFFET is amazing! that was probably the best part of the whole experience there.

We were here from August 14th through the 18th, 2016-west wing tower -28th floor -with an upgraded room with great panoramic views of the Las Vegas strip.  The views were breathtaking specially at night time ---all the hotel & city lights look so beautiful!

The valet attendants were very courteous & prompt.

Our room was nice & spacious.  Upon our first arrival to our room, we noticed that our bedding was clean & comfy but the white sheets had old blood stains.   We called room service to replace our sheets.  The sheets were replaced later at the time when the cleaning crew was scheduled to clean our room.

On day two, our room wasn't cleaned.  We called room service & again they forgot about us.  We had to call for status several times.   Finally, by 10 pmish, our replacement towels were brought in. 
The room was cleaned on the following day at their scheduled cleaning time.

Our bathroom had really poor water pressure in the sink and in the shower.  The pipe holding the shower head was coming undone --off the wall.   The sink water stopper was broken.

There was a $25 daily fee to store items in our room's refrigerator.  

The waterpark is very nice with five pools, a lazy river, waterfalls, plenty of drink bars & food concessions.   Unfortunately,  the lazy river gets crowded & many people are not considerate of their surroundings & bump into one another a lot.   The on site lifeguards did nothing to help mediate the lazy river crowding situation.

The waterpark restrooms are not easily accessible & the women's restrooms were dark inside and stinky.

The hotel & casino is grand with a lot of shops, Starbucks on almost every corner & a lot of choices to eat & drink.

My husband enjoyed the blackjack tables & the dealers were great.

For a fee, we had the opportunity to meet baseball legend Pete Rose at the MGM's sports memorabilia shop & he signed our commemorative baseball bat.

Overall, we made the best of our stay here.  Our room had awesome views & our kids enjoyed the waterpark.

However, based on our experience,  we wouldn't consider staying here again.
This place is seriously a dump. They first started charging for parking and then moved their rideshare pickup a mile from the casino. This place is nothing but a scam.

MGM was a pretty awful place to stay this past weekend in Vegas, 4\/24 - 4\/27. I've stayed in Cosmo and Encore previously and both blow MGM out of the water. I seriously should've saved my money and stayed at the airport Travelodge. 

The casino smells like a weird combo of smoke (standard) and The Victoria's Secret Vanilla Lace scent that all 7th graders used in 2002 (kinda weird\/gave me painful pubescent flashbacks). 

Our room on the first floor of the West Wing was like a dungeon. Tiny, gray, and dingy with low ceilings. The one window in the room looked out into a barren area between buildings, with a single cactus growing. The view was so bad that it actually became a joke on our trip. The lighting was dim and cheap-- it was impossible for 2 girls to get ready comfortably. The bathroom area has no door so have fun getting extra comfortable with your roommate's bodily functions. There are doors to the toilet and shower area, but they don't go from floor to ceiling and they slam shut every time. 

No robes.
No iPod dock. 
Crappy toiletries that you won't want to take home 
Tiny and fuzzy TV screen in the bathroom mirror-- try again MGM
Heard absolutely everything in the halls like there wasn't a wall 
Water only got warm sometimes 
Did I mention the view of a single cactus? 

There was absolutely nothing luxurious about this hotel, and my friend and I paid more for it than any other hotel we've stayed at in Vegas. There are Best Westerns in Minnesota with more modern fixtures. 

The only good thing about our room was that the bed was super comfortable. Also, Hakkasan and Craftsteak are great. Never again MGM. Bye.

Can't think of anything that is good about this room that they have given us for so much money.

1) There are just two lights of which one is not working
2) The room looks extremely outdated
3) The passage to the wing looks like a fire exit door
4) They said its a king size bed and there are two queens
5) The bed is so hard, my bed is way better... hotels are supposed to have amazing beds for a relaxing sleep. 

Never coming back, I dont mind paying a huge price for a room, but I expect comfort for the money I pay.

after reading all the review about the MGM, i was hesistant to stay at the hotel, but since my friends and i already got the rooms reserved and all we wanted to give it a shot. i give this hotel a 1 star because the manager wasnt really helpful whatsoever!!  the first day my friend and i  arrive at the hotel the bell hop guy commented to us that tipping the other guy who brings up your luggage is separate from his, and that kinda bothered us. the 2nd day that we were there the boys' room was damaged, water damaged.. We didnt get comped, the boys couldnt even go to a nicer room, due to we reserved the room through hotels.com. and i think thats whack!! overall i'd rather stay at another hotel.

Not too bad.  I would give it 3.5 stars if I could.  The room was not bad at all and the overall hotel experience was ok.  The only thing I didn't like was that the lazy river area gets really crowded so get there early and the prices for food and drinks in the pool area are very expensive.  If you're trying to save money and spend it on gambling, jump out of the pool and dry off then head to the food courts to get something to eat.  The food in the pool area didn't look like it was enough for the price they were selling them for.

This place is getting a little outdated, but they do have construction going on. The casino is dark and stuffy, but the rooms were very nice. I was in the West tower, where the rooms are smaller but I had quick access to the West Bar and the exit out the west side for quick escapes from that smoky recirculated air.

If I went again in the near future I'd definitely look at the Tropicana - they're remodel is great - bright, fresh, and clean.

30th birthday spent at the pool and reluctantly bought two of the the $25 inner tubes... to float around the pool. I turned around to grab a towel and had both of my tubes stolen. $50 down the drain just trying to hang out at the pool. No cocktail service, no refunds or replacement tubes and was treated like shit. Sad I choose this hotel for my birthday, I'll never stay here again. I don't enjoy getting robbed and having terrible management. I was a die hard MGM Grand fan and have always spent my money here- never again! Looks like my family and friends will be moving hotels for the future. You lost my business treating me poorly for my birthday festivities.It would have behoved your manager to comp my stolen tubes on my birthday. Or perhaps not make hotel guests pay to enjoy the pool? Cheap and ridiculous and then you get robbed too! Over you MGM, there's way too many hotels to give my money to, you guys fucked up.

By far one of the best places in Vegas to spend your vacation.  With cheap rooms (esp during the week), HUGE casino floor plan, and delicious food, you won't be disappointed.  I left wanting to stay another week, always helps when you win money :)

EVERYONE! MGM has been remodeled! We stayed this past weekend (1\/20-1\/22).
I love the new furniture, NEW FLAT SCREENS(finally), the scheme is elegant and super modern, everything was clean, holy crap the bathroom is nice. 

If you don't have m life, sign up to get cheap rooms. We got really good rates! Customer service is great. Housekeeping was up to par. 

I would totally recommend these new upgraded rooms (we stayed in the regular rooms).  

We also ate at the MGM buffet...idk why everyone doesn't like the food. I loved it. Wasn't to salty wasn't to bland. Yum

It seems that no one knows about these new remodeled rooms. So I posted a picture

This was the hotel I stayed at for my 21st birthday and I almost think that was the last time as well and to be honest I don't think I really notice much of a difference in their gaming, amentities, or layout. The rooms to this hotel really reminded me of a Holiday Inn or something of that caliber.

Let me preface this review by saying MGM was once one of my favorite spots on the strip prior to this last visit.  This place seems to have  been run down into the ground.  The carpets are filthy, worn, and disgusting.  What once was the best smelling aroma pumped in throughout the casino is now overpowered by stale cigarettes.  Even the high limit room on the main level had worn tables and just an overall worn down vibe about it.  

This is an honest fresh perspective from a guest who previous put the MGM grand in the top echelon of must visits while in Vegas.  Take your hard earned money to the Venetian or the Bellagio (which is also an MGM property)

Mgm has the shittiest service ever. The staff is rude starting from housekeeping to managers. Waited in line almost an hour to check in. Then they had the wrong room booked. I had to wait till the next day to get the right room.the next day my room was not ready by 12pm as promised, I had to wait till 4pm. They wouldn't give me extra towels because they said house keeping left me enough in the morning when they cleaned my room. Room device took 1hour and 45 min to deliver a pizza....and finally my shot glasses I had bought from my travels around the world and my drink shaker disappeared and no one could tell me what happened. Management said they can't do anything and I can make a police report if I want to. All in all MGM is the worst hotel it sucks ass. Including the management.

I stayed here a while ago and was quite shocked with the experience I had. I went during spring break the other year with my boyfriend at the time. 

When we got there, we had to wait in line for about 15-20 minutes to get checked in. When we finally got to our room, I discovered there was a wet pillowcase next to the sink. My boyfriend discovered that the toilet did not work whatsoever. Something was stuck in it. When he took off the lid, he discovered a chilled can of beer resting inside!

When we called for maintenance, they suggested to get another room, explaining that "whatever is in the toilet is REALLY stuck in there."

I had been starving for hours and felt like crap. So we had to stand in the line again, and told the lady at the front desk what happened. She moved us to another room and we asked if we could be compensated. She did give us each one free buffet meal worth $60.

The lion exhibit was really small and the place was just okay. I wouldn't come back...

This review is a little tough to give because at first I thought it would be a five star review. After our visit is over though and I've had time to ponder the full gamut of errors, I almost have difficulty with two stars.

Check in was fabulous! We waited in a very long line and it took quite awhile but the gal that checked us in was so funny and kind that we totally forgot the wait and just enjoyed her company.  The room was beautifully furnished and clean with a great view. Room service was timely and the food was delivered piping hot.  And yeah... that's about it! So when you think about it, those are all things that are to be expected when you're checking into a place like the MGM Grand.

Here's the two star review:  Just as I sit down to enjoy my room service meal, I hear dripping. I investigate and find the ceiling is leaking in three different places. Within minutes it really starts pouring in! I try to call the front desk and housekeeping and maintenance and one other button only to be put on hold!  For quite awhile!  Eugene, the maintenance man, was a God send! He helped me move rooms and made me call room service back to get a replacement meal since mine was getting wet by the fourth leak! Mind you my meal was already "free" due to comps received during check in, they kindly told me they would comp my meal for all my troubles!  Gee, how kind and generous of them after me having to move rooms in my jammies!  Oh, and they comped the $45 upgrade fee for the one night!  Again, gee, how kind and generous!

During this fiasco, my husband was at the UFC fights and had his own tale of MGM failures! He paid $750 for a seat that they failed to install! Yep, no seat!  Now, Bob was great and friendly and apologetic but basically, they couldn't do much because it was a sold out event. So they thought moving him from chair to chair was a good fix! They put him in a great seat on the floor but when whoever the seat belonged to would show up he'd have to move. No other solution or compensation was offered.

Basically, in my mind, a place like the MGM Grand should be five stars in all areas. I have certain expectations when I stay at a place like the MGM Grand and pay the price for a suite. To have to move rooms at 9:30 at night, by myself, have my meal interrupted and my husband to not have a seat when paying $750 for one, and only be comped $45, is outrageous. 

MGM Grand obviously does not care about loyalty and customer satisfaction. We'll be back for UFC events but we definitely will not be staying at the MGM Grand.

The glory days of the MGM are sadly gone. I haven't been here for 7 years and it has really changed. Not for the better. It has been inundated with a seedy ghetto crowd. I didn't really feel safe and was worried about being a casualty of crossfire from a gang shooting or a witness to multitudes of fashion crimes. It's strange because the hotel itself hasn't changed much in terms of how it looks but the patrons have taken a turn for the worse. It may have been a bad night or weekend but what I saw makes me want to not go back. It's sad as I used to love MGM and it appears the phrase "All good things must come to an end" applies.

MGM used to be one of my all time favorite casinos and go to spots when in vegas.  Unfortunately it's just not the same.  Everything feels old and outdated,  and not in the "awwwwww it's now become a classic staple"  but more like "this place needs a facelift" 

I will always love MGM for the place that it was and all my passed visits there but now it's time to say goodbye.  With all the newer hotels there are better spots to stay at.  Sorry MGM!

stayed here for the justin timberlake concert last year...
we had 4 rooms and they it to us all together, which was nice. 

only problems we had were checking in - some people at the desk aren't the nicest, but keep talking and they'll eventually insist that the customer is right. although being on one end of strip, still convenient to a lot of things - especially walgreens..for some jugs of water!! 

the massive space of MGM allows you to see, play, eat and drink practically anything you desire.

Arguably one of the worst customer service experiences I've ever had;  Three different people at the Checking area were rude with me or ignored me completely, they never changed our towels in the room and when I wrote them both aa letter and email requesting a follow-up call I did not receive any word from them but a canned letter response.

But the biggest issue was this: we had two rooms booked and both cardholders had mysterious ~$5 charges on our cards due to "drink orders".  However, none of us ordered drinks thru our room.  They reversed the charges AFTER we waited 45 minutes in line to get to the checkout desk and all they said was, "we'll remove it for you."  They did not acknowledge the mistake nor were they surprised by the charges.  It seems like they created that mystery charge knowing that most people would not want to sit in line to get it figured out when they checkout.  That's shady business.  Again, this was not mentioned at all in the BS letter I received from them.

Seriously, terrible experience.  I would not stay in this hotel again if they paid me.

"Ka" was a pretty good show though.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the MGM! My favorite party hotel to stay at. The rooms in the Grand tower are gorgeous and this hotel is always lively. And to be quite honest, I have never seen so many beautiful, gorgeous youth all together, staying under the same roof. Perfect for the young singles, bachelor\/bachelorette partiers, young couples, etc.  Unlike other Vegas casinos where I tend to see a lot of older folk playing the slots and tables, it looks more like your college frat house here. Great atmosphere at reasonable prices...

Also, the Grand Pool complex is fun and hip and a great way to chill and get some sun for the day. Additionally, Hakkasan, their on-site night club is jumping! Great music and a great crowd. I had a blast here with my husband and our friends. 

The food options are good too! Plenty to choose from. Parking is good, although we tend to park and never see our car again until it's time to start the drive home. 

Overall, great hotel--my absolute FAVORITE!

Horrible, horrible checking in process. Two hours waiting, still standing in line and waiting and waiting. It's one of the most famous casinos in Las Vegas but it's days has passed. Should of booked some other hotel. You can't make people wait this long after their long trip to get here!!! There should be more receptionist!!! Awful, words can't express  my feelings.

When I travel to Vegas for work, I basically move in.  I'll stay at the hotel anywhere from 4-7 days at a time, which is FOREVER in Vegas hours.  

Honestly, of all the casino-hotels that I've stayed in, MGM is at the top so far (although I will be staying at the Venetian and Mandalay Bay later this year...so we'll see how it compares).  My standards are different than other people's since I'm NOT there do get wasted and go crazy at clubs.  I'm always there for work.

Here are the pros for MGM:
1) The elevators to the Grand\/West towers are RIGHT by the lobby check-in.  There is nothing I hate more than dragging my suitcase through the casino for 10 minutes, or having to walk through the casino every time I want to leave the hotel.  It was really nice that the elevators were convenient and quick to get to.
2) The casino didn't seem as smokey as other casinos, such as Caesars or the Mirage.  My eyes didn't get irritated in the walk from my room to the conference area, which was nice. 
3) There is a good mix of restaurants -- cheap places to eat like McDonalds (where I'd get my morning coffee for cheap) and really expensive restaurants like Shibuya sushi or Knob Hill.
4) My room was QUIET!  Normally I'm woken up once a night while staying in Vegas -- either by outside noise, noise from the room next door, or from the hallway.  I wasn't woken up even once during my 4 nights\/5 days at the MGM.  Be aware, the rooms are basic if you're staying in the Grand Tower.  (But black-out blinds are the best.)
5) The resort rate includes the use of the 4th floor cardio room.  If you stay at Caesar's, it's $25 PER DAY to use their fitness center, which is the only place you can exercise.  The cardio room is VERY VERY SMALL for the size of the hotel, however--just 12 or so machines.  Luckily, I had free access to the spa fitness center thanks to the conference I was attending.
6) I was able to get a 1pm late checkout and the folks at the check-in area were very nice.

Cons:
1) If you're there for a conference, the conference area + ballroom is pretty far away from the Grand tower hotel rooms.  You walk through the casino, through The District (the area of restaurants\/shops), down an escalator, through a hallway (past the outdoor pool area), and then outside and to the ballroom which is a separate building.  It's a little odd, but luckily the weather was nice and didn't affect our walks outside.  
2) The District area closes pretty early by Vegas standards.  I really wanted froyo one evening after a business dinner, and they were closed!  It was kind of a bummer for someone like me who doesn't get wasted and gamble a ton in Vegas.
3) My bed was squeaky, which would only have been really annoying if my boyfriend had come with me on the trip.  :-)

We spent about 8hrs watching the circuit MMA finals. We had a blast! Drinks were limited and only overpriced snacks were offered.  The crowd was awesome. After the fight MGM did not seem to be prepared for such a large crowd! Great night.

We got a pretty good deal for this past weekend, so decided we owed ourselves another Vegas trip.  The MGM is a pretty great place to stay - always clean with a great casino and decent cafe.  Our shower broke this past time around (constantly flowing, almost OVERflowing) and we placed a call to maintenance.  They were there in about 20 minutes and fixed our problem in about 10.  Pretty efficient, and nice to boot.

The rooms are perfect for 4, but pretty packed at 6 (tried both scenarios).  The pool is a reason to stay here alone - the lazy river just doesn't get old.  It doesn't really matter how hot it is (try 109 this past weekend), the lazy river is a perfect way to cool down.  The other pools kinda suck, but it's okay.  The River will never fail you.

BUT DO NOTE:  If you're checking out at 11 (especially on a Sunday) TRY TRY TRY to leave earlier.  There will be a line and you'll end up on an elevator going up just so you can go down.  It took us about 15 minutes to get on an elevator and I'm pretty positive that wasn't a bad wait compared to some.

So come prepared.  Drink.  Relax.  Enjoy.  Or just drink.  Up to you.

2.75 stars. 

The MGM Grand is a sprawling behemoth whose 5,000 hotel rooms feature atrocious, inconsistent cleaning service, weak shower pressure, worn furniture, anemic sound proofing, and paltry amenities (most rooms do not even have refrigerators). But, the room service is reasonably priced and remarkably prompt, with food that is better seasoned than expected (the chicken quesadillas are redolent of cinnamon, cocoa, and ground peppers). And, the fainting couches in the rooms are nicely situated and comfortable, while the pools are irresistible. However, there is nothing special about a stay at the MGM except the plethora of excessively expensive restaurants and the moody black and white photos of classic Hollywood stars who stare eerily at you in the middle of the night. And, while saying that you're sweet, the front desk will blame you because you checked into a rumpled, uncleaned room that still isn't clean later that evening. There are much better themed hotel and casino choices in Las Vegas.

I am absolutely amazed at how well MGM Grand was able to turn a crappy situation around. I am writing this review not for the hotel overall, which I am satisfied with (it is clean, modern, great location), but for the customer service resolution.

It was a rough weekend to say the least. A friend lost her purse on the first night. She used the hotel phone to call her family to recover money, etc (a lot more than I knew about). She could not participate in 'Vegas' activities without an ID. We were not told that calling out of the Vegas area code would result in long distance charges. My card happened to be on the room for deposit. I checked out over the phone and was not notified of any charges until I specifically asked. I found out they automatically charged ~$500 in fees for the calls, which I would not have known had I not asked. I was incredibly mad to say the least. Even if my friend had not lost all of her money, paying me back $500 for phone calls is ridiculous.

I went down to the customer service desk and spoke to a wonderful agent (I think named Melissa). I explained the entire situation, that I was charged for calls I didn't make. That those calls were made because my friend lost everything. That we did not know to avoid the calls because we were not told about the fee. She empathized with me and told me that she was going to take all of the charges off. She also assured me that my deposit would come off of my card. I was so relieved and grateful and practically moved to tears with he kindness.

I followed up on my bank account and did not notice any of the charges refunded. I called MGM Grand and they assured me they would look into it. The following day instead of refunding the fee charges they were taken out again. At that point I was charged $500 twice and the deposit was still withdrawn. It was ridiculous and frustrating. I called back again and was told that the situation would be resolved. At this point I lost hope. Finally, a week later they removed the double charge and the deposit from my card.

I appreciate MGM Grand for being responsive and understanding over the phone, for owning their mistake and following through with a solution. I have worked both a "front-desk" customer service role and a "contact center" customer service role and have full appreciation for the work that they have done for me!

This is a nice place to visit, Rainforest cafe is a good eat but otherwise i wouldn't stay here. I have to be honest, I havent stayed here but the feel that I get from this place, i have definitely seen better in Vegas!!

Didn't STAY here, too rich for my blood.  But the whole damn place is NIIIICE.

My fav is the Rouge martini lounge.  Didn't feel like paying cover for Tabu, Studio 54, or Diego (for salsa dancing Friday nights).

2 happy lions in the Lion Habitat that spends a few hours there on a daily basis.

Only looked at the pool at MGM which is humongous.  Next time...  :)

Recently stayed here for the 4th of July and the trip was off the wall amazing. Room quality and service was top notch. Special thanks to Victor Holmes our bellman who helped us with all our bags super quickly to the room and gave us the MGM grand treatment. Will stay here over and over.

Worst hotel guest service ever! Tried to up charge room for "complimentary" champagne, double charge for room service that we paid cash for, and initially got to hotel with the media console pulled out 3 feet from the wall! Informed front desk rep of the loud partying coming from next room and she indicated that we basically had to deal with it for the weekend. Had to continuously call security all hours of the day and night and nothing was done. Informed the hotel that we had the same issues from previous stay last year and we were assured it wouldn't happen again. Will not be returning to this hotel, and am disappointed that they wouldn't help us out for the amount of money we paid for the suites!! Would never recommend this hotel!

This was a "ok" stay. I would think it would have been better considering all the events they have. The west wing sucks. Too far of a walk. The restroom sucks. Its right next to the door so make sure your not changing if housekeeping comes in.

When a group of us decided to hit Vegas, we booked into the MGM by default since one of our friends stays there regularly and belongs to the Players Club: rooms were comped, so I'm not gonna complain on that front.  I also have a friend who works in Vegas hospitality and managed to finagle an upgrade for husband and me to a 26th floor, Strip-view, "Celebrity Spa" suite which was enormous, nicely appointed, had a fantastic whirlpool tub b-room and perfectly comfortable bed, and a night view that dazzled like a fully lit Christmas tree.  So again, I'm not gonna complain about the room.  As others have mentioned, water pressure might be better, shower head a little higher, and the furniture could use some sprucing.  All in all just fine, tho.

The casino itself, however, is one of the more uninspired on the Strip and finding your way around is like getting dropped off in the Sierras without a topo map and being told to orienteer your way out.  Ridiculously and unnecessarily confusing.  And check-in is a gigantic, frustratingly long cluster.   I find MGM's casino a bit boring and "low key" for the Strip, too -- if your theme is Hollywood, let's play it up a bit shall we?  I don't think anyone visiting Vegas is going to poo-poo an over-the-top, themed casino.  I will say the lion habitat is entertaining, though I always worry about quality of life for caged animals.  I was much relieved to learn that many different lions are rotated in and out on a regular basis, so they're never in the enclosure longer than 5 hours daily, aren't there every day, and live on a free-range ranch outside the city when they're not at MGM.

Dealers and croupiers (for the most part) are great here, though.  Funny, charming, and personable well-oiled machines throwing out cards and spinning roulette wheels with panache.

I've never sayed at the MGM before.  I thought everything was very wonderful overall.  I saw room pictures online, so I knew they newly remodelled the rooms and they looked nice:  Modern with clean lines.  I booked the room through Priceline and stayed during the last week of Dec.  For $87\/night & getting a $75 dining credit, I was very satisfied.  Sure, there's newer, swankier hotels, but I stayed here because the price was good & I knew it would be like new due to the recent remodeling of the rooms.

My boyfriend and I stayed in the Grand King room on the 27th floor and it's definitely roomy enough for two people.  The bed was nice and your head really sinks into the pillow.  They have 37' or 42' inch flat screen Samsung TVs.  The room was nicely decorated and the bathroom had great chrome fixtures.  They sure do have very, very hot water, which is good.

I saw the Cirque du Solilel KA show here and it was fabulous!  The theatre is quite huge.  I ate at the MGM Grand buffet one night and it was nice and no wait.  We were there at about 9:20pm.

Check-in was a bit of a wait since I was there very close to the 3pm check-in time, but check-out was much quicker since I was there about 2 hours before the 11am check-out time.  The procedures themselves were simple.  I was asked if I wanted a lower or higher floor.  The view from the room was OK.  We faced the back of the strip, but that's alright.  Room service prices were high, as expected.  I think the cheapest food on it were $17 sandwiches.

The MGM is perfectly acceptable, thus the three star review. (We stayed in the main tower on the 9th floor)  The rooms have nothing to wow you, but they're mostly clean and quiet. Unlike many reviews I read, the elevators were seriously some of the fastest elevators I've ever used.  WAAAY faster then the place I work or any apartment building I've ever lived in.

There's a bunch of celebrity chef restaurants as well as the standard Cirque du Soleil show.  We tried a few places in the casino, but my personal favorite was Diego's in the Studio Walk.

The casino itself is safe, open and clean with only the occasional stinky smoker cloud hanging about.  The cocktail waitresses are few and far between, so drinks at the slots come SLOW.  Don't expect to be catered to even when leaving a good tip, they've just got too much ground to cover.

The room rates are a bit more reasonable then some other spots on the strip.  Check in was a breeze and all the staff I dealt with were great.

Negatives: the rooms are all marked sell-by 1989. 

The television is a big honkin tube with about five worthwhile channels and an unexplained assortment of Asian-language selections. The furniture is fine, but is certainly late 1980's. There are some shoddy linens here and there, our bedspread had what looked like pizza stains on the outside and our sheets were shredded up in one part.  Also noticed some crust on a few towels.  To me, it looked like someone left gunks of self-tanner on a sheet that didn't come out in the wash (so I wouldn't expect that to be common).

Our shower head was busted up and it wouldn't work without also dumping a bathtub full of water into the tub at the same time. The main light in the bathroom was out and the second light periodically failed to work.  We called the front desk and it was fixed very quickly while we went to dinner.  

After staying in a total dump (the Imperial Palace), I can appreciate a quiet and clean hotel, but for the money I'd really want a bit more luxury. 

How about some actual basic cable?

MGM Grand is a landmark hotel and location for Las Vegas. It was the prize of the 90's that has withstood the test of time and the slew of newer more high-end casino's that have popped up around it. As dingy as the lions look and how not attractive it looks from the outside it's a world class casino even at its age and that it's out of its glory days. How many countless prize fights were held there?, when the heavyweights ruled the world. I can't even name the buffet or the club that is there, and yes it's been a while since I've stayed there. The floorplan is what keeps it from looking too dated, but the rooms were so cutting edge back then they aren't nearly as bad as NYNY today. Some minor upgrades are what makes this more of the Stratosphere of the south strip. There were no games or tables that I can remember as if I wanted to come check out next time. This is one of these places that are a must go to if your in Vegas. Yes there are bigger, new, nicer, hotels, but not many with more history and when you go H2H against what's out there and talk to some older people they'll tell you MGM stood tall and proud for many years before they started going to Caesars, Bellagio, Venetian, Wynn, and the like.
They running a woman's wallet sting operation in the casini where they leave a woman's wallet on a chair in front of a slot machine...whom ever picks it up is charged with grand larceny beware

For the inaugural Yelp Spring Break, the girlfriend & I stayed 3 nights at the MGM Grand. I booked the room through the YSB link on the Las Vegas Elite Events page which was triply convenient: Yelp had secured a group rate, booking with the link guaranteed YEE admission & MGM was only a short walk from the 1st YSB YEE.

In addition to all the the Yelp-y convenience, the MGM Grand was an overall nice to place to stay on the Strip for a few days. The highlights were the room & all the amenities available in & around this vast & cavernous building. The not-so-greats were the resort fee & a labyrinthine layout seemingly designed to make exits hard to find.

Our room had smart, modern decor, flat-panel TV & was spotlessly clean. Lowering the blackout shade over the wall-to-wall window could turn the room totally pitch black in the middle of the blazing bright day, which was much appreciated since we were keeping vampires' hours. The bed was comfortable enough to induce coma.

There were miscues to the room, however. There was no coffee maker or microwave or mini-fridge in the room. There was a refrigerated mini-bar in the room, but don't touch anything inside of it unless you want to pay for it. That also goes for just moving stuff around in there. Apparently, MGM will charge some kind of $ fine to your hotel bill if you move the contents of the mini-bar to refrigerate your own stuff.

As far as amenities go, the sprawling MGM Grand property has: nearly 2 dozen eateries, bars & clubs, cardio room, a gigantic multi-level parking garage, a monorail station, the Grand Pool, the Grand Garden Arena & of course, the huge gaming areas of the casino. I don't gamble at all, so no comment on that last feature. The Grand Pool is cool, definitely worth checking out during any stay here.

All of this stuff on premises contributes to the aforementioned labyrinthine layout. There are no signs anywhere with directions to any exit. Even on our 3rd day there, the girlfriend & I were finding new, unplanned & unintended ways to get from our room to outside of the building & vice versa. I guess it's not in the best interest of MGM's profits to make it easy to leave.

Then there's the resort fee. A minor complaint, really. It's $25\/ day for parking, Wi-Fi in the room & use of the cardio room + access to the Grand Pool could be considered something "resort." I got a good enough basic rate on the room that an added $25 was still a good deal for the level of the amenities. Just be aware when booking here that what you really pay is the room rate + the resort fee.

The MGM Grand was home away from home for the girlfriend & I during Yelp Spring Break. Using the Yelp arranged group rate, it was a comfortable & convenient home away from home for not a whole lot of $. Thank you MGM Grand & Yelp for the hospitality.
Don't waste your time and money. The odds will always be against you. There is one serving attendant for the entire casino I think!

I reserved the Mansion at MGM Grand through tripadvisor.com on 12\/6\/14. The confirmation email only stated a standard room at the MGM Grand. The room at the mansion is not the same as booking a standard room at the MGM  Grand. I tried contacting MGM Grand Hotel several times regarding this matter. They could not do anything about the reservation because it was booked through a third party called Cancelon.com. I tried contacting Cancelon.com several times to cancel the reservation with no resolution. My only option was to dispute the charge with my credit card company. DO NOT BOOK THE MANSION through cancelon.com with tripadisor! THIS IS FALSE and MISLEADING ADVERTISING.

Booked my trip at the MGM on Expedia from July 14 - 19. My girlfriend graduated from school and I decided I'd take her on a vacation to one of my favourite spots.

MGM was my choice as I'd stayed their in the past and love the amenities. When I got here I upgraded my room to the "strip view" (Biggest waste of money ever). As I've stayed at the Cosmopolitan before I had a different expectation of what strip view was. Needless to say I get a nice view of the highway and some buildings woo! (Not worth an extra $35\/night).

Anyways I sucked up the room, didn't want to complain as well I opt'ed in for it. Just like eating at a restaurant if you eat all your food it's too late to tell them you didn't enjoy it.

July 18 is where the trip went from good to not so good. I had a TD Bank envelope with about $400 sitting in my room which was STOLEN. (didn't know there was a safe in here til I spoke to security, it's apparently in a drawer). Now I know the maids leave the door open when they clean our room so this may have led to the theft or they themselves decided to help themselves to my money but somehow the money had gone missing.

In an attempt to speak with security I was told in a nice way that there wasn't much that they could do and that I would have to file a police report. I went ahead and filled out a police report however after reading the reviews of many other people I'd say it's a lost cause.

The frustrating part is not the loss of the money but it's the response by the hotel, although friendly the nonchalant there is nothing we can do attitude is one that is frustrating. 

Two Important Notes:

1) Don't upgrade to their strip view in the "Grand Tower". Save your money and see the pictures below, you'll get a nice view of some buildings thats about it.

2) Look for the safe, and if there isn't request one. If all else fails hide your money but don't leave it lying out. Learn from my experience this happened on the last day of my trip and it's only $400 but it's still money and when staying in a hotel your stuff should be safe.

The sad part is it ruined the trip for my girlfriend. She doesn't even feel comfortable leaving our stuff in the room now because of this situation.

Stayed in a penthouse suite during one of my recent visits. Of all the penthouse suites I've stayed at in Las Vegas, this is by far the quietest.

Though this is only a guess, I believe that MGM staggers its penthouse assignments for as long as it can. That way you don't have people to the left and right or on top of each other until it's absolutely necessary. Regardless, whatever MGM is doing, I hope it continues. And this tip: when you get a penthouse suite, try to get a corner. Makes the experience even better. 

As for the rooms, they are spacious and nice. The amenities, accessories, etc., of the room, though, do not live up to what I expect from a true penthouse suite. The place that does have accessories and amenities that are penthouse quality is the Aria hotel. Top notch.

Anyhow, if you're looking for a very nice penthouse to stay in, be sure to check out the MGM. 

The next time I stay at the MGM, meanwhile, I am getting a SkyLoft. Look for that review in the next couple of months.

I stayed here for five nights and this is a great hotel but the Hakkasan club needs improvement. I went to see Kaskade preform and the club was super packed. We could hardly move because it was so packed.

The hotel and casino is really nice. The resort fee is around $33.67 a night and the deposit is around $598(five nights). The deposit is refunded at the end of your stay if you don't ruin the room you stayed in. They have mobile check in and it's faster than waiting in the regular line. I also went to the wet republic pool and it was amazing. The tickets were cheap as well. I also went to the regular pool to get a tan.

The rooms are nice and spacious. The mini bar in my room did not open. For some reason it was locked. They also have a safe and it's by your bed. This hotel is around a 15 minute walk to all the shops.i would recommend this hotel. This hotel also has a Starbucks, pretzel place,Subway ( 24 hours) and a pizza place.

Cons: 
Check-In:
I was definitely disappointed in my stay. Check in took forever. Guest services advised this wasn't normal; however, with now reading other customers comments, I see this is a common theme. We were definitely in line over 30 minutes after a very long commute. 

The room:
We were moved to a king bed room, in the Grand Tower, it wasn't far from the lobby. It was very dim in the room, terrible visibility, so at first glance it looked fine. The next morning, it was pretty apparent that the room wasn't well taken care of. The bathroom door was broken, the shower knob was extremely temperamental (scolding hot or cold). There was a patched hole in the wall, the toilet paper holder was broken. Several areas of the room weren't clean (the desk, the bathroom vanity, stuff was missing from the mini bar).

The Bed:
There were stains on the decor pillow placed in the middle of my bed. Stains all over the mattress itself including a very large yellow stain right smack dab in the middle of the bed under this mattress protector they had on top of the mattress covering it up. I was mortified after seeing that, I couldn't believe I slept a night in the bed. 

Service:
I asked for house keeping to resolve the mattress issue, while we were at a convention, we got back 10 hours later, House keeping had came in attempted to clean the visible stains on the edges of the mattress and remade the bed (putting the nasty decor pillow right back on top). I had been assured that it would have be taken care of that someone would call my cell phone since I was at a convention. No one called me, they called my hotel room and left a message. I had to end up calling 3-4 times to get the mattress removed. Guest services didn't seem to care and stated it was a house keeping concern. She also said there were no notes indicating House keeping was going to try and clean the mattress, and that I was mistaken. When we checked to see if maybe they flipped the mattress,since the original stains we saw were gone, that's when we encountered the huge stain on the middle of the bed. It took house keeping another 30 minutes from the last call to replace the bed. 

Casino:
Was very outdated, looked old and dirty. During our stay we walked around quite a bit and the MGM was not grand in comparison to the other nearby hotels. If I had to do it all over again, I would definitely not stay there. 

Pros:
The ladies at the concierge desk were super nice and welcoming. 
The location, is within walking distance of everything including the monorail.
The restaurants within the hotel (although pricey) had decent food.

We got a great deal to stay in the MGM from Hotwire. It was 50 dollars a night with an amazing view of the strip. I could not believe how cheap the hotel was. The interior of the hotel was really beautiful. It was nice and clean it had a huge wall size window. The view of the strip was best seen at night. 

I did get annoyed of the green light. But it wasn't a big deal. i think I got use to it after the second night we stayed... They offered us 20 bucks off on the MGM buffet which was totally worth it because the food was pretty good. It was not the best buffet in Vegas but it was very good. The mimosas in the morning was a perfect hangover remedy. haha

I would definitely book MGM through Hotwire again. This place was exactly what I expected from a Vegas Hotel. Clean and Affordable and Great Location!

This hotel SUCKS!!!  The first night they put us in a room that had a very loud sound that sounded like a plane was landing in our room.  Try could not change our room.  The next day they changed our room to a room with ripped sheets and backed up toilet.  Would never stay here again
The pool is great and clean. Staff is awesome...Halls are long. Saw someone passed out in their own puke

Ok so this place has some really great things about it and not so great. 
PROS: 
Hakkasan 
Wet Republic
Great eye candy
Joel Robuchon 
Craft Steak
Shibuya (foie gras dumplings) 

CONS: 
Older hotel so ventilation is terrible
A lot of people come for the clubs so getting taxis can be trying 
I had a Grand Queen suite. It was a closet with two full size beds. 

I don't know about you... But Vegas has too many Great hotels to stay and not be completely satisfied. Chive on

The room is really nice and comfortable (stay well) ! I just have a problem, I have been here for the last four days. The housekeeping service is not doing a good job. They forget  to empty the trash and stock tissue!

Disappointed. Booked a room for 3 nights at MGM Grand from July 3-6. We selected the "grand queen" which if I'm not mistaken, wasn't even the lowest option of rooms. Upon arrival, we were told we were in the north tower in room 112 on floor 2. We looked at the map in the direction of north tower. Ended up in a different direction several times. Asked 4 security guards where the north tower was, it was only the last guard who actually knew where the tower was. How do your guards not know where the tower is?! After finally finding our tower (which looked like we were entering a janitor's closet or something!), we used our key to enter the "tower" which was actually just a hallway with 3 floors. There were even rooms on the 1st floor. We got to our room which was decent. Pretty small, but was decorated and taken pretty well care of. We opened the blinds to see our view and our "view" was ventilation systems and extra tables that they probably use for their venues. We never opened our blinds again as there was literally nothing to look at. After coming back to our room on Saturday, we noticed a heap of gum stuck to the top of one of our beds - which was not there before we left (the maids had come and cleaned up). Although they did promptly come change the linen which was good. Overall, I will likely not stay again unless I'm guaranteed to be in a real tower\/room, and that doesn't feel like it's in a janitors closet. We'll be back to the Venetian!

Hotel is mostly fine, its at the far end of the strip but has the monorail attached which is almost impossible to find.  I was certainly surprised by the secret extra fees!  I've been to Vegas many times and have stayed at many hotels, much nicer hotels, and have never experienced getting charged an extra $130 after my stay and after receiving a $0 balance bill at checkout.  We arrived early and were treated like we were special at check in even receiving a free early check in but no one told us about the extra $70\/day we were about to be charged for "remodeled room, resort fee and taxes".  We never asked for or agreed to a "remodeled room" and if the room we stayed in was remodeled, I'd hate to see a room that wasn't.  I called and sat on hold for about 20 minutes until I finally spoke to a woman that was incredibly rude and condescending to me basically calling me stupid for thinking I could stay at the MGM without paying these fees.   I will never stay at the MGM or a sister hotel ever again and do not recommend it.  I've stayed at better hotels in Vegas and around the world for much less and no surprises!  Highly DO NOT recommend!

Check-in line was long, and slow.  I was shockingly informed that I was the only one registered for the room eventhough my partner in crime did pay for her flight+hotel.  Was asked if I wanted her name added to the room, which is why we got 2 Queen beds, duh!.  Nonesense.

The room itself was good, but the airconditioning vent was small and not strong enough.  There was some long black slab on the window you slide to let the air in.  And ifcourse, there was no refrigerator nor microwave... major bummer.

The casino is smoke filled; I guess America's smokers converged on MGM for a last puff as youngsters have turned to vaping.  I prefer a non-smoking casino so I could keep the Angel of Death from me for 50 years.

MGM seemed like it wants to be all things to all people; clubers, families, oldsters, sports fans, gamers, etc.  Add to that the fancy restaurants like Hakkasan, which is strictly for white yuppies and girls in high heels, black dresses with half their breasts exposed...  which I am hoping will be gone by next year. 

Oh, and their lion habitat is gone.  I guess free shows are too much for Vegas these days as they are moving away from family entertainment and back to gambling and adult themes not friendly for kids.  That is why the Brazil shows in Rio and TI's pirate shows are gone as well.

Their buffet voucher system was confusing.  We used it for dinner, and then we had bathroom time for some 2 hours to expel the horrible food.  Thankfuly, I came well stocked with Alka-Seltzer.  However, MGM's breakfast buffet was good.

You'll be asked to pay the following charges at the hotel:
Deposit: USD 100.00 per night
Resort fee: USD 35.84 per accommodation, per night
The hotel resort fee includes:
Fitness center access
Internet access
Phone calls
Oh boy, I get charged even if I dont use it?  Major rip-off.  And I never asked for new cookies or chips, for which $8 daily was added to my hotel bill.  
Their so-called "mini-bar" nonesense: the girl said she has to re-stock it, so she opens it, which contained soda, beer and liquor bottles; says I have to talk to front desk to open it.  Uh, if I never opened it why do you need to "re-stock" it?

The check-out time is 11am, but my flight is at 10pm, well there go $5 tip to the luggage man to haul it into storage; and then another $5 to get it out because he has to feed the kiddies?... No, its a ripoff!

It was all just too much, I'd rather pay less and stay at less crowded props like Luxor, Bally's, Trop, than this mashup.

Spent lots of bucks but received horrible service. When we first entered our room we found that minibar is locked and remote control was not responding. We called the front desk and those issues were solved. On the second day we got locked out for about 40 minutes since the keys were not working, which totally disrupted our schedule. We went to the front desk. The agent swiped our cards on a machine and told us it should have been okay. However when we get back to our room we stIll failed to enter our room.We called the front desk to request for replacement of keys. The guy coming up opened the door for us by using his "master card" but did not bring the alternative keys and told us to go to the front desk to ask for replacement by ourselves. There were only 3-5 guests lining in front of us but we waited another 30 minutes because the agent dealing with them was so inefficient! Eventually we replaced our keys but they did not even give us a sorry.

Pros: ostentatious luxury, great vista of Las Vegas

Cons: Inefficient front desk, apathetic crew, no coffee, overpriced beverages

Ugh...we paid extra for a deluxe room and got sooo ripped off. No bathtub, got bug bites all over me from sleeping in their bed, and the sheets like gave me weird rug burns cuz it was a bit rough.

But if you stay here, you're paying extra for the bomb ass shows and restaurants. I mean then again, you could just stay nearby and walk over here.
Brady at the valet is a pos.  I will never come here again.  However the toro at sushi was amazing but I will never come here thanks to Brady. Rude ass dude

We booked our honeymoon\/graduation\/husband birthday at MGM for our first trip to Las Vegas. We had originally booked a west wing room for 4 nights, but when we arrived and checked into our room, we were on the second floor, with no view of anything. I was pretty sunken down and thought this trip wasn't gonna be worth it. 

So, I made my way back to the lobby and spoke to girl and explained to her why we were on this trip and how unhappy we were with the room. Within a few minutes, she was able to speak to her manager and offer us a celebrity suite on the 20th floor with no extra charge!! (It was a smoking room and we don't smoke, but it didn't bother us) The room was great and we enjoyed our stay.

Mind you, but Vegas is where tips rule and I tipped her $20 for doing us that favor.

this is really a 3.5 but I figured i'd round up since I had such a great vegas weekend

+ bell service was super friendly and punctual
+ nice sized bathroom and lots of room for four ladies to get ready (definitely not like HRH's standard room!)
+ room was clean! 
- no iHome, or something you can plug your blackberry\/ipod into via an auxillary cord
- no mirror outside the bathroom
+ comfy bed
+ simple yet not bland decor
+ being guests wet republic was free...
- wet republic was kinda weak, especially the hot pool

bottom line: i'd stay here again.  this place was definitely a better representation of vegas compared to my first time at the Hard Rock Hotel (yuck)


Holy crap I almost forgot...they have a lion habitat there!!! I felt like a little kid watching the lioness play.  On the flip side, it is really sad that they're stuck in a hotel...in vegas... = (

Awesome casino associated with Mlife hotel chain. Sat down to play blackjack a few times. The dealers I encountered were great to talk to and made the experience that much better. Cocktail girls came in a timely fashion and drinks were good. The only down side isn't even too bad. I can't hold this against them because this is the design casinos should have BUT, it is soooooo easy to get lost. I had no trouble running into blackjack tables and slots. But trying to walk through the hotel to the strip...impossible. But again, that's how they want it. Easy to get in, tough to leave. All in all, some good times here. Would recommend as a stop for some gaming.
I have stayed here many of times maybe it was the heat maybe the desk just didn't give a care. I do know after my experience there is  a 98% chance this was my last stay at the MGM Grand

A giant ashtray that ironically says "stay well" everywhere. The rooms are updated and the convention center is nice, but walking from and to you get smoked and cured. If you are looking for premature wrinkles with a side of lung cancer, stay here. In addition, all surfaces in the room were covered with a thick layer of dust which was never cleaned, you could write "wipe me" on furniture. Cosmetic products smelled awful I couldn't use any of them as they had a very strong "masculine" smell to them and they don't provide shower gel. Room service tables were left in hallways with uneaten food for a day and a half, pretty sure it's a health code violation, there was smeared food on the carpet for at lest a day (I think someone dropped a cake and stepped on it). It felt depressing. Some people got stuck in elevators.They charge $25 for late checkout, $8 for a bottle of water. I was happy to check out.

Without a doubt, this is a nice hotel with much to offer those on vacation or even just a getaway.

The casino has that typical fun Vegas feel and I enjoyed playing some video roulette.  I'm not much of a gambler, but I do a little for fun sometimes and made a whopping $8 by the end of this trip.  Woo hoo!

My room was nice, there are good restaurants, fun bars, entertainment, shopping, etc. and most folks seemed to be enjoying themselves.

However, I was not there on vacation or a getaway.  I was there on business, attending a convention at the hotel, so while I can write about what enjoyed about the trip, this is only a 3 star review because of one negative that put a downer on the convention for many of us attendees who were also staying at the hotel.  The convention areas is simply too far from all of the rooms.

It may seem petty to someone who has not been to a convention at a hotel before; but there can be a lot of walking and you usually have things to carry, be it a briefcase or maybe much more if you are an exhibitor or speaker.

There are a lot of rooms, many floors and long hallways.  Once you leave the area where your room is located and get into the public area, you will have to trek through the casino, the mall (including the food court), downstairs into another long hallway for another long walk to the convention area.  How much longer the walk is will then depend on which floor(s) and which hall(s) the event you are attending is located.

One or 2 long walks like this might not be so bad, but having to make multiple walks like this back and forth to your room, other parts of the hotel, the strip, etc. is just too much and can also cost you time at your event.

The hotel has a great pool area, but it is located on the outside of that last long hallway I mentioned, which means people were having to make most of the same walk I just described, through the casino, mall, etc., just to get between their rooms and the pool.

This a great and classic Vegas hotel that I plan to visit and maybe even stay at again sometime, but I hope I never get stuck at another convention there and I understand that the convention host got enough similar complaints from the other attendees that this particular event is not likely to be held there again.

ummm. everything was okay... we stay here for two nights because they have the special that $150 for 2 nights. everything was okay except there is no fridge and coffee maker... when i request for the hot water, they ask for $10.50 for just hot water!!!! i am like WTH? 
the restroom is so so...no fan, and the shower head looks pretty cheap and suck. no plasma TV,  but the furnitures looks pretty good. the bed was not too soft which i love it. 
staffs are pretty friendly here. the bath essential are pretty good, i love the jasmine shower gel, lotion, shampoo, and conditioner.

Frustrating check in, and when we got to our suite it was filthy dirty, and not the one we reserved. After more than 4 he's they moved us to another one. No upgrade, just one that was clean.  Hotel is short staffed in many areas. Our room had broken ac\/heat, non functioning TV, broken telephone, and other issues. Wouldn't gave been so bad if maintenance came immediately, but it takes 1 to 2 days to get someone to come for repairs. They don't clean the rooms everyday either.. Which is  strange...Short on towels and scrimping on bathroom toiletries. Beds are comfortable. Furniture is fairly good, but not High end.
  The restaurants in the hotel are very good with lots of choices. Casino is okay..a little too smokey in areas..but  lots of slots and tables. Very good food court. Common areas are kept clean. Hotel needs to address shirt staffed situation.
The hotel was ok. It was at the end of the strip so we Uber and walked everywhere. The main area of the strip is where's it at.

My goodness it gets crowded. VERY CROWDED. I haven't stayed in a suite yet, just visited the hotel. I think it's a cool hotel......Loved the turkey wrap I had at the Rainforest Cafe....and I love the lions!
Well,stayed there on new years day and I would not say that it was a bad experience with the rooms but not awesome as well. I would say it's about three and a half star. Check in crew was nice.

I have been staying at various MGM properties to explore new places to stay with My Vegas points. We haven't been disappointed anywhere except for the MGM Grande. I feel like the other properties showed us their best wanting us to return. The Grande did just the opposite. Not only were the room and accommodations lacking, it took SO long to get from one area to another. Only one section in the vast hallway with elevators. Poor signage, leaving us confused and lost during the majority of our stay. We do not plan to ever stay at this resort again. There are other MGM resorts that make us feel pampered and special - MGM is definitely does not meet the expectation of pampered or special. Such a disappointing stay.

These rooms are clean and dead on the strip.  There is plenty to do and a good number of restraunts to choose from.  We ate at the Rain Forest cafe and  L'Atelier de Joël Robuchon.  Plenty of tables and slot machines and Studio 54 and the west wing Bar were fun and entertaining.  I think it is cute to have the Lion display and I love how this was the last stop on the monorail.  The structure is easy to navigate thru as well.

I booked my trip through Expedia and choose the West Wing, however during check in I was "upgraded" to the North Tower because there weren't any more rooms available in the West Wing. My friend and I were being upgraded for free so I was happy. Until, we fount the North Tower. The moment we walked in it had a horrible smell, since we were on the first floor and only the second room from the entrance, it was smelly when we opened our doors as well. First night, we discovered our air conditioner wasn't working, but it magically started working the next day. The next morning, I realized our shower was clogged, called for maintenance to fix it, maintenance came and claimed they fixed it-- my next shower was less clogged but water still pooled up my leg. Ppl are allowed to smoke in the casino, so you will smell like smoke just walking throughout the casino to get where you're are going. Now on to the positive, the pool!! Mgm has 5 pools which includes a lazy river and 3 jacuzzis. Which is the ONLY reason they get 3 stars. I would probably book here again just for the pools. Just a heads up, unless you have your own tube, it's going to cost you $26 to buy one. There are several bars in the pool area as well, delicious drinks as well. They have some great, although a lil pricey, restaurants. I would recommend you avoid the food court with Jonny rockets, pizza, etc unless you're on a real low budget because your tastebuds and stomach will hate you. The hotel is huge and you can literally find things to do that will easily take up your entire vacation if you don't plan well. Since we were only in our rooms to sleep, it wasn't too bad. Oh yeah, resort fees are $40 a day and are not included in your rate, it's added after checkout.

I originally booked a king room but when my boyfriend and I check into our room it was tiny!  Felt like a shoe box and when I called the front desk to complain that it was smaller then the layout I saw online she said 'Oh, you must be in the west wing'.  I was pretty mad at the fact that they advertise one size room but have vastly different options.  I was able to change my room to a two queen suite which had around 100 sq ft more.  
I thought the hotel itself was nice, clean and the restaurants were good.  I like that its connected by pedestrian walkway to New York.  We ate at two restaurants at MGM.  Emerials for lunch - good food a bit pricey but hey its Vegas.  We also had dinner at the food court.  Tasty, nothing too fancy.  We saw the Crazy Horse Paris burlesque show which was fantastic.  We got half price tickets on the strip ($32) so I was happy about that.
I was pretty upset after booking though.  MGM tried to say that I booked a $450 a night room (It was New Years weekend)  .  Trust me I didn't I booked $450 for two nights.  But in the end it cost around $520 after all the taxes and fees.  They refunded me the overcharge.

I've stayed here many many times but this time around I've never felt as disrespected as I had today. I had a dealer talk to me in a rude disrespectful manner and I took my concern to the "Pit Boss" ( Kevin Beers ) and his boss Ken and also to Katherine Corona ( hotel operation manager ) which they all gave me the whole "it has been addressed" talk. The dealer Ian Nelson repeatedly disrespected my wife and I with his choice of word out of nowhere and we took our concern to the upper management WHICH they TRIED to sweep it under the rug. I've been here over 7 times since last year and I spent nearly $2000 within 8 hours. For my wife and I to get disrespected the way we did and on her birthday is unacceptable. They "OFFERED" FREE BREAKFAST BUFFET to my wife and I as if we cared for a free $50 breakfast. I spent 12 times that amount in less then 24 hours gambling. I feel like nobody cares at this resort. I fee like the customer service is completely gone here. I remember back in the days they would make sure their guest would have a pleasant stay. Not anymore. Now a days all they care about is making money, taking money and not care about their guests. I truly feel upset and disrespected especially when I was looking forward to this trip with my wife. MGM has officially fell of the Favorite hotel list for me. I've always picked this resort over any other but it's evident that they no longer value their guests. All in all SAVE your money and DIGNITY and go book rooms at a NON MGM RESORT or better yet avoid MGM Hotel itself. I don't think anybody will understand my frustration with this situation and it's obvious they truly don't care. These so called managers are just simply here to collect a paycheck and not care about their guests well being. THANK YOU MGM FOR RUINING MY ENTIRE TRIP & ALSO THANK YOU FOR MAKING ME REALIZE YOU GUYS ONLY CARE YOURSELVES  AND NOT YOUR GUESTS. Shame on you!!! We were better off booking rooms at Cosmopolitan or Caesar Palace.

My husband and I go to Las Vegas on average 6-8 times a year and we love this hotel. this place has many good restaurants, few cool lounges, Starbucks, one of  the biggest casinos on the strip. Service is always good and if you gamble  enough they will comp your room, food, drinks and offer you nice limo to the airport. 
Rooms are always clean, beds are super comfortable and I think that's all what you need, because you don't sleep in Vegas, you PARTY IN VEGAS!

Im not a huge fan of MGM. The players club associates have attitudes. The servers are rude. The same server asked me for my ID 3 times. They don't give you a bracelet like the Venetian to let other severs and security know your 21+

My goal is to hit up Joel Robuchon next time we visit, but THIS time, we tried Tom Colicchio's Craftsteak.  It was quite good (see separate review).  We didn't stay at the hotel this time, nor did we utilize any of their other services, but we enjoyed our meal, so that's worth it alone.
