I'm not saying that this is a horrible place to stay, however, there were a few drawbacks that made me NOT want to put this on my priority list of places to stay again.  We paid a little extra for the west wing rooms which claimed to be updated and nicer than the grand tower rooms.  I've stayed in the grand tower rooms before and thought they were pretty nice but I decided to check these rooms out this time.  Although, they are more modern, they are way smaller and the bathrooms lack any privacy.  I also hurt my toe on the stupid "modern" door that closes off the toilet.  
POSITIVES:
-Not too expensive
-Pools are awesome!
-Won BIG in casino
-Maids and Room service staff were extremely helpful and courteous!
-Bar tenders and waitresses in the West Wing bar\/lobby were so nice and fun!!
-Some of the restaurants were pretty good and not to pricey

NEGATIVES:
-Front desk staff at check in were rude! (the lady that helped us was rushing to get out of there or something)
-The MGM is huge!  It felt like we walked a mile to get to our room
-The lamp in our room would randomly turn on and off which scared me to death the first time it happened!
-There are not very many channels on the TV(I know, I know who needs the TV when you're in Vegas?  I do, it helps me go to sleep)
-A few of the dealers and pit bosses were horribly RUDE!!  Even though I won money in that casino, they made me never want to gamble in that casino again.
-At check out, the front desk staff was once again extremely RUDE!!!!! Bad way to end our trip

Overall, the front desk staff is horrible!!!!!!!!!  The same goes for a few of the dealers and pit bosses.  Decently priced hotel but don't pay extra for the west wing room, it's not worth it.

Does not honor reservations.  I reserved a City Penthouse suite weeks in advance and literally less than 36 hours before our trip they called to tell me that they yanked my suite out from under me.  Their "suite utilization committee" had gone over their suite availability and decided that they needed mine, so tough you know what for me.  I said "so, apparently a reservation doesn't mean a reservation" and they said "it means you have reserved A room not any PARTICULAR room."  They then proceeded to tell me they would be happy to do me the favor of "allowing" me to book a lesser room.  And they couldn't care less about how unhappy I was.  And this was with the Mlife tier benefits and all.  Imagine how they treat regular folks.

I slammed the phone down, pulled up the Four Seasons site and booked my suite there in about one minute.  They treat you like gold, and if they screw up they act like it's THEIR fault, not yours.

Book MGM Grand Las Vegas only if you hate yourself and you don't mind wondering if you'll actually get your room or not.

This is one of the best hotels to stay at in Vegas. Location is perfect, right on the strip close to all the other iconic hotels - New York New York, Monte Carlo, Caesar's, Luxor, Monte Carlo, among others and it's got everything you could want. The rooms have recently been renovated and even their "basic" room is comfortable and let's be honest you just need a place to pass out because you can't sleep in those nice comfortable chairs at the sports book! The pool area is fantastic too, we've rented a cabana here before and they seriously take good care of you and you can't beat the lazy river. 

The MGM can get busy on holiday weekends, or even just a usual Friday afternoon\/night check in, but there's a reason for that, it's popular because it's one of the best, and you can usually find good deals online making it an affordable experience. I would recommend the MGM for anyone making a trip to Vegas.

Stayed at the MGM (first time) but didn't really since we didn't sleep Friday night... or Saturday... but we had to put our luggage somewhere, right?  Spent more time at the pool than our room but what a lovely room it was.  Funny thing, we wanted to extend our stay but they said they were sold out?!?  What recession right?!?

That Patricia sure gave us some attitude on the phone.

The whole, "what happens in Las Vegas stays in Las Vegas" concept must be this hotel's business model.  Outdated accommodations (no coffee in the rooms), serious scary security concerns and THE LOUDEST HOTEL I'VE STAYED IN. 

I was napping one afternoon and the minibar refill guy busted into my room and proceeded to go through the minibar for 3 minutes insisting I ate the peanut M and M's even though they were still in the minibar.  Then he validated the expiration date on every item.  Thanks for that.

One of my co-workers was sleeping (in the middle of the night) and Security let a drunk guy into her room because drunk guy insisted it was his room (he was in the wrong hotel, right room number).  She had to run out of the room and chase down the security guard because he opened the door and took off.

Did I mention the construction and drilling noises since 5am this morning?

I stayed here twice this year, once when I went to Vegas with a friend, and once with my family. This hotel tries to be all things to all people - it houses a Cirque show (Ka), a venue for concerts, a venue for fights, a lounge (Tabu), a club (Studio 54), a spa, what seems like a dozen restaurants, a lion habitat, and, of course, a massive casino. The only thing it lacks is decent shopping. The rooms and service generally are fine. It does get crowded, but that's like all of Vegas. It's not the Bellagio, but it's not Excalibur either - it's an affordable yet relatively hip place to rest your head when you're living it up in Vegas.

Oh MGM Grand, for such a wonderful hotel you have seriously disappointed me. My boyfriend decided to book a room here for his 23rd birthday and wanted to do it big so he got a Skyline Terrace Suite for the weekend which cost about $2,000. 

Upon arrival, the front desk receptionist told him that he couldn't come into the room because the air conditioning was broken. First of all, it is the middle of November so we wouldn't have even used the air conditioning. And second of all, why exactly would we NOT be allowed into the room for something as simple as that? When we stayed at the Bellagio our AC was also broken in the summer and they let us check in and come into our room with no problem. Kind of surprising but whatever, we complied and we were told to come back an hour later. 

An hour goes by and my boyfriend decides to go check in on the room and the receptionist makes him wait and places a call, saying that she has to check if housekeeping is finished. Um, check-in is at 3pm and it was 4:30pm when we came back. Shouldn't housekeeping be finished BEFORE check-in? What kind of lame excuse was that? Not impressed. 

When we finally get into the room we quickly realized that we actually booked the wrong one. We thought we had booked a 2-bedroom suite but we only had one. So he calls and asks if they have any rollaway beds available and the woman on the phone says that there aren't any available and they don't do that at this hotel. Uh, since when did hotels NOT have rollaway beds...? Luckily there were a lot of couches in the suite so his best friend just decided he would sleep on that instead. Why ruin a trip when everything else was going on, right?

So the skyline terrace suite is absolutely gorgeous. It's got two stories and a beautiful terrace with a breathtaking view. One of the things I loved most about it was the patio speaker which also played indoors. Not really going to comment on the outdated electronics in the room but let's just say we got lucky cuz I had my auxiliary cord on me. 

Now with a room like that we're bound to go and host a party of our own. So we invited a couple of friends over to pre-game before heading over to the nightclubs for the evening. I go and give housekeeping a call and ask for 4 toilet paper rolls because we have a lot of friends coming over and let's be honest, when you've got a bunch of drunk people over they're gonna pee every five minutes so we knew we would need a few rolls. The person on the phone, I think her name was Maria, rudely said that she could only provide the room with the exact number of guests that were in there and then hung up. I mean, I understand that there's a policy about how many amenities guests can ask for but did she really have to be rude about it? 

We also decided to call for extra pillows and blankets since my boyfriend's best friend had to sleep on the couch and though the guy was really nice about it, it took over an hour and a half before we even received our things. 

I can't say that we didn't have an amazing time because despite the terrible things that happened our group made the most of our trip. But I will not sugarcoat it when I say that I am so beyond disappointed by the customer service at MGM grand that I do not plan on EVER staying at this hotel again. At $2,000 dollars for one of their best rooms, to have been treated with such rude behavior is such an insult and disappointment and whenever I look back at this experience I will always remember MGM grand at having the worst customer service compared to other hotels on the strip at significantly lower prices.

I've stayed at MGM three times this year and I probably won't stay there again just becasue of the location. Overall I do like the hotel but the location is too far south on the strip. It's somewhat far from the middle of the strip where there is more to do IMO. It's a long trek to get to some of the hotels where a lot of fun clubs and restaurants are so that is one of my main issues with the MGM. In 100 degree heat or in the winter, all that walking is no fun. 

The prices are reasonable IMO. For my three stays at MGM which were all for 3 days each, the average total for a basic room was between around $250-$280.

The front desk clerks are nice, no issues with checking in or out, my rooms have always been clean, etc. My parents on their last two trips to the MGM had problems, one being  that there toilet overflowed for which they were moved to another room nearby, given a free upgrade on their next trip as well as  free buffets passes. The 2nd issue was something with plumbing and they could hear the pipes making noise all night so after mentioning it to the front desk they got free buffet passes. So overall the guest services have been pretty on point. They also have the business center where you can print out your boarding passes for free. At check in, the clerk was nice enough not to charge us those ridiculous resort fees, which I appreciated.

The hotel is very large and it's easy to get a bit lost but once you've been there awhile you get used to it. I like that the monorail is located in the hotel so it's nice to be able to have that alternative to taking taxi's or walking. Also there are a lot of dining options, from low end McDonald's to higher end restaurants like Joel Rubuchon.

If MGM was in the middle of the strip, it would be perfect.

Well got here yesterday to find they don't have coffee facilities in the room and we haven't had any wi fi yet noisy at night bit of a let down we were so excited 
One plus it might snow today

Casino review.  Disgusting smell.  I had a horrible head cold, could barely smell or taste a thing and even I was nauseated by the smell.  What IS that smell?  We couldn't get out of there fast enough.  We considered dining at one of their many restaurants and based on the smell decided against that.

So many great locations in Vegas it seems like a shame to waste your money here. I come here for conferences and always dread the half our trek it takes to get anywhere within the hotel (especially from room to conference center). Most of the hotel feels outdate, I'm not sure they're doing anything to restore the rooms and hotel. A better slogan for MGM would be "There's a charge for thtat". Charge for storing your personal belongings in the mini-fridge, charge for using the pool, resort fees. Customer support and their mobile site are also pretty useless.

EDIT. Came back from the strip to find all my personal belongings missing from my room. Took two hours for staff to track them down and then acted like I was crazy for misplacing my belongings. Thanks MGM, very classy.

We were on the 19th floor and we still could hear the traffic below and ambulance sirens going down Tropicana Blvd. The walls and windows are extremely thin. We could hear everything our neighbors did and said. The mattresses were very firm and the piloows were goose down rocks. The decor was lovely, though. No shower cap. Very, very long walk from the elevators to our room. They really need to install a few more elevators because that walk from room 200 to room 335 was ridiculous. They need more shade by the pools, otherwise you will burn like hell in 117+ degree weather, which is what it was this past weekend. The buffet was $40 for lunch and dinner, $30 for breakfast and brunch, and it wasnt the best, but it wasnt horrible. Crab legs were water logged. Good dessert bar though. But what really makes me never want to return was the $28\/night resort fee they charge you upon check out.  Add that to the room tax of $15.25, and there is an additional $43\/night on top of your room fee. Oh, and you couldnt use the in-room fridge without paying and using a combination to unlock it.  And the TV kept losing reception, along with the internet, which made that resort fee even more absurd. Definitely wont be back.  Trump Towers, Vdara, and Wynn are much better for the money.

This was the worst hotel room stay ever. I got bed bugs last night and they have tried to place me and my coworker into two new rooms that weren't clean and they smelled like smoke. I'm still waiting after 2 hours to get a new room. DO NOT book a room here.

Great hotel but avoid the Wet Republic Club\/Pool portion the employees will try to sell you on. It's a 3+ hour wait in line for nothing but an expensive entree fee, expensive liquor and half of your day wasted. Avoid this bullshit at all costs and just go to the regular pool.

Ohh la la....3.5 stars. Some snazzy renovations going on at the MGM Grand! 

We stayed on the MGM Grand the weekend before Thanksgiving. Really good rates that weekend. Tip: sign up for the MGM resorts promo emails and you can check their calendars for special weekends that are cheaper then normal. I usually find a cheap weekend, then do an online search on hotels.com or priceline and book the deals. Often times you might find a cheaper rate online. But MGM often offers food and beverage credits if you book through them. 

I got the executive queen suite in one of their newly renovated towers. It was $88 for a Sunday night off of priceline. Not too shabby! The check in process was pretty quick. The line looked long but moved quickly and the lady that checked us in was super nice. 

The renovated rooms are very modern. It feels high end. The queen suite (675 sq ft) was just big enough for 4 people. I was very spoiled by the MGM Signature suite I stayed in earlier this year. It was 980 sq ft. =P
The beds were comfy, it was nice to have two flat panel TVs in the suite and a generous sitting area. The bathroom was also nice, it had a tub and a shower. The towels were a tad rough, but they gave us tons, which was nice. The floor was nice and quiet.

No real complaints, except for the fact that the wifi was a bit slow and even with a $28 dollar resort fee, we didn't have access to the gym! It us an additional $15 more. We only had access to a small cardio room that held maybe about 10 tread mills and 10 ellipticals. My cousin said that it was very packed in the morning. As a paying guest, I was expecting more. Considering the MGM Grand are also advertising "wellness" rooms. Well, why not let us exercise too! 

Anyways, aside from my wellness rant, the MGM is located in a fairly good location. Even though it is one of the older hotels on the strip, they have made strides in upgrading. Oh and the KA theater is right down stairs. Great show! =)

OMG THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!!!!!!!!!

so they don't have the room i reserved and they move me to a really noisey room next to the elevator...then to a room that looked like a jail cell...then to a room with someone already in it...then to a room with water damage to the curtains.

(i am soooo not picky at all but the rooms they sent us to were awful)

then on the last night my room flooded and they wouldn't tell me what caused it and didn't change my room so i had to walk around with my shoes on.

HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

the rooms are really big compared to other hotels i've been to...but i'm still never going to stay there again.

Is this place the Holiday Inn of Las Vegas?    I really didnt care for my overall experience here.  It was nice, but middle of the pack to be sure compared to other Vegas hotels.  In terms of pricing I would call the weekdays cheap and the weekends expensive, which all in all averages out to fairly priced I suppose.  The gaming area is fine, although there were a few weeknights Tuesday\/Wednesday when I felt they didnt have enough tables open (i.e. many players standing around waiting for a spot even though there were empty non-used tables around).   We actually LEFT and went to another casino just so we could play.  The sportsbook is very clean, big, and nice and the breakfast at the Studio Cafe was very good, although pretty expensive.  All in all, MGM is a decent place, but I dont think it does anything so outstanding to merit more than 3 stars.

We spent some time in here at bars, snacking, and for our Cirque show.  

Redeeming our ticket vouchers was so easy & fast!  They have great signage to find your way through the casino too, so that's good.  Large, clean restrooms, and open areas to chill & figure out what you wanna do next.  

We liked the relaxed feel of their bars, particularly Centrifuge, for one, & Whiskey Down, for two.  (Will review individually).

Had no trouble finding the Ka Theater and entry & seating was quick.  The show itself though?  Meh, another review.

MGM Grand is now the second largest hotel\/resort complex in the world now behind the Venetian\/Palazzo (Which is considered one resort).  They consider the three buildings of The Signature at MGM Grand and The Mansion at MGM Grand to be apart of the resort as well.....but I am only reviewing the main hotel.

Now, I booked MGM Grand for four days in September of 2009 and I believe I can give a solid un-biased review.

The Room: I was booked into room 18-124.  Which is room 124 on the 18th floor.  Our room was facing the pool and towards Boulder Highway.  The first thing I noticed is that the room was quite nice considering the negative reviews I've read on Yelp and TripAdvisor.  The queen bed I had was VERY comfortable and each day I woke up I didn't want to get out of the bed.  The bed was far superior to the one at Mandalay Bay where I stayed in June.....and that was hard to beat.

The room had a nice flat screen LCD TV......but it was in what I refer to as a TV coffin.  Armoires are tacky in my opinion and especially when you jam a very nice flat screen in it.  It would have been better served mounted on the wall.  No biggie, it was nice considering the basic rooms at the Bellagio still contain the older CRT Tube Televisions.  

The bathroom was smaller than I had anticipated but that was no issue really.  The sink had a crack in it, but did not effect the use of it.  I kept in mind this resort was built in 1993 and even after remodeling things are bound to have some flaws.  I personally feel that the room was worth what I paid.  ($55 per night)

The Food: Now the offer I got with my room included 3 free buffets per day, per person.  I will review the buffet separately, but lets just say the buffet is average.  On the final day I had booked a separate promo which gave me a $50 resort credit.  Since I wasn't interested in seeing any shows or going to the Spa or retail stores, I used this at Wolfgang Puck's restaurant.  I feel that Wolfgang Puck's was delicious, albeit the servings were VERY small.  I had the Maine Crab cakes which are no longer served on their menu.  The price was $20 for 4 silver dollar sized crab cakes.  Not a good value, but very delicious.   I would come here again even with the prices I don't like because it meal was delightful.

Gambling:  Here is where MGM Grand and I differ in our views.  I am a low roller.  I have plenty of cash, but when I gamble or play in a casino I don't like to throw all my money on the table.  I am in Vegas for the food, the sights and the shows.  The gambling part is another factor.  MGM Grand has average limits at most times, but if you want good odds the price goes up on the minimums.  

Not once did I see a $5 blackjack table..........and I can understand that because if you put out a $5 BJ Table that pays 3:2 with 6-deck shoe,H17, Late Surrender, and Resplitting Aces......the house edge of 0.46%.  Which is a theoretical\/expected loss of 46 cents per $100 played.  Now, if they had $5 tables with such rules on the strip at MGM Grand........it would not be very profitable for them.  That's why the limits jingle from $10-25 at the Pit Boss's digression. So, no blackjack here for Brian.

I was able to find a $5 craps table which maintains a house edge of 1.41% and offered the strip usual x3-4-5 odds.  Not too bad, but after 6pm the minimum went up to $10-15.  Understandable.  The dealers were lukewarm and decent I suppose.  I didn't make any money playing here and had an average time.  I have more fun playing craps at the Excalibur and Tropicana though......which may shock some people.  The dealers are more energetic and funny to be around and talk to.  (See my Tropicana Review). 

I suppose if you have a decent bankroll the MGM Grand could be a nice place to play.........but it's a large casino floor and there are so many people here that you're just another number to the employees of the casino.  The size of the casino causes the feeling that there is a lack of personal touch or personality. 

Design: This place is huge.  They did an walking survey that from the main entrance on the strip all the way to your hotel room on the middle of the tower is about one mile long.  The hallways of the hotel where the rooms are located bring that feeling from the movie Vertigo by Alfred Hitchcock.  It seems like the end never comes no matter how far you walk.  It takes a long time to go from the front end to the monorail entrance or from the rooms to the buffet.

Conclusion: The MGM Grand is great if you get promotion codes online.....like from Slickdeals.net or FatWallet.  MGM Grand is a nice hotel\/casino.  It's size and popularity is a positive thing in my opinion.  The overall vibe of this place is positive and in a good location in my view.  I am returning for one night in February for $55 with a $100 fine dining credit at Aria in CityCenter.  SCORE!

Those lions are wayyyyyyyy cute and I have to say those guys who baby(lion?)sit those beautiful animals are really brave. They played with those lions like they are just big innocent and non dangerous cats.

MGM's casino is hugeeeeeeeeeeee and we got lost when we tried to get out of it. I love the Greyhound simulation betting game. $5 will last you a while and sometimes I even won few dollars. The cocktail waitress was super nice and we got delicious Shirley Temples. 

One thing that kinda a bummer about this place, you can't get out from the casino unless you are circling this place all over again. I think on my next trip, I'm going to try one of the restaurants here. This is the home of the celebrities chefs. I'm not a big fan of celebrities chefs, but I think it will be fun to do just for the experience. Till next time, MGM.

We've been to Vegas about 15+ times always have stayed at Aria, Cosmopolitan and a few at PH. This time we decided to give The MGM a try but what a huge mistake. Horrible customer service they didn't handle our concern well. They rather please themselves than a guest, others hotels might be a few extra dollars but worth it. We will never be back to the MGM.

The MGM definitely has a lot to offer but it's not one of my favorite Strip hotels.  Firstly, it feels relatively dark and dreary inside.  Secondly, the food court area feels like a mall food court with lots of cheap options and lots of crowds.  The pool area is actually very nice but it gets a lot of crowds.  If you have kids, I would not advise taking them to the pool as it felt like a large messy college party.  
This is probably a good hotel to go to if you're interested in having a room close to the party, but it's not a very nice place to be in the afternoon.

MGM Grand has one of the best pools in Vegas. A lot of other mega hotels have okay, pools but MGM has what you'd expect in Vegas.  It's extra large, over the top with tons of stuff to do! My favorite part is the lazy river with plenty of tubes, water falls, bars everywhere, and friendly staff are never far away to get you drinks\/food.
The rooms are priced right. Not too expensive for what you get. I've always recieved a super clean room and the staff make you feel important. 
The casino is super large with high ceilings so if smoke bothers you, this is one of the more open hotels so chainsmoking grandma won't make you gag as you walk by.
Hakkasan night club is fun, although it will get PACKED so if you don't like being crammed into a sweaty cluster of hot bodies, then go on a night when there isn't a major DJ playing. Or go super early. It's located at MGM so if you're staying there, it's worth checking out if you like that scene. 
Location is okay. The good thing is that parking is easy to get to since it's near the end of the strip.  The problem is that you're not exactly in the middle of all the crazyness so plan on getting a cab or walking a few miles.

worst room ever.... (West Wing)

I stayed at the MGM a couple times before. This was the worst room I've ever had. I can't recommend this room at all. Absolutely no view! I had a small building directly in front of my window. Very noicy from all the helicopters! No electric blinds, tiny toom. Even the mattress and the pillows are cheap! I felt and heard the box spring when I was breathing! Bad customer service unfriendly and I Had to wait a long time on the line On top of that they didn't clean my room one day. I called up and complained to the customer service, 6h later the room still wasn't cleaned up! So I had to complain again! After midnight somebody came and made the bed! That's it...! Sorry MGM next time I stay somewhere else!

I stayed at the MGM a couple times before. This was the worst room I've ever had. I can't recommend this room at all. Absolutely no view! I had a small building directly in front of my window. Very noicy from all the helicopters! No electric blinds, tiny toom. Even the mattress and the pillows are cheap! I felt and heard the box spring when I was breathing! Bad customer service unfriendly and I Had to wait a long time on the line On top of that they didn't clean my room one day. I called up and complained to the customer service, 6h later the room still wasn't cleaned up! So I had to complain again! After midnight somebody came and made the bed! That's it...! Sorry MGM next time I stay somewhere else!

Traveled there when the person I traveled with was attending the Marketo conference.  The hotel is very close to McCarran airport.  The check-in process can be a bit slow but I think this was due to the peak check-in prior to the conference.  The rooms were listed as Luxury and are nice, but I think you can find nicer in the same class.  If you are there for pleasure, the nightclubs and pool scene are great.  When we upgraded to a nicer room (next class up), the experience was much nicer.  Hotel staff were courteous and tried to answer issues quickly.  Food was expensive, even when trying to stay within a budget, if you stay in the MGM complex, be prepared for a bit of sticker shock when checking out...WiFi was good in every room we stayed in (a total of 3) during the course of the week.

Seriously old worn out hotel. I had to change rooms 3x because they stank! Finally settled. When we checked in after, a 40 minute wait at 10 pm,...we wanted to eat. No..most of the restaurants were closed! Really this is Vegas! Then upon calling room service it was over an 1 wait! I considered giving this a 2 star only because I did not visibly see bugs. ..but opted for only 1....because in Vegas sheets should not be rough, food should be available and I shouldn't have to wait for 1 hour for a,Starbucks Coffee at 7 am!  Ridiculous.  The only redeeming quality is most of the service staff are friendly and helpful. They don't have a training problem but an operations problem.   Maybe they should take the course of the Riviera ....

The lines to check-in was long and it was 20min wait to get the room. I stayed at executive queen suite on Mother's Day. The room is like a suite w\/ living room and includes sofa bed. It's very nice and updated suite. The bathroom had a shower and tub w\/ shower faucet kinda weird and 2 double sinks. Its a nice size bathroom. Our view was the rooftop. The queen beds were kinda soft. The best thing about the room is the wifi. Also, our room was a short walk to elevator. The casino floor looks different since they got rid of lions den (now a sports bar), less slots and tables, Starbucks in middle of floor, redo of food court, added hakkasan club. It's across from New York casino and Tropicana. The self parking is long from parking to reservation desk. Otherwise, I had a nice pleasant stay at MGM Grand.

4.5 

 So this was my first time in Vegas since being 13. Came here with my PIC and told him this was the place I knew I wanted to go to since they have a TON of spots to eat within the hotel. Sadly I only ate at two of them LOL. My ass slept most of my Vegas trip actually. 

  Anyway we arrive and go to the front desk. Check in seemed easy breezy. We were on the westside so there wasn't this crazy walk to the elevators.  I wasn't used to the hustle and bustle of getting to it . Anywho we get to the 17th floor and man our  walk to the room was a fuckin long walk! Well the bigger rooms are in the back because when we opened the door it was a nice suite!!!! I loved the large couch with that spot you can stretch your legs and sleep on. We had the his and hers sinks and a jacuzzi! Not the best view (Hooters hotel across the street lol) So it would have been niceto get the view on the side with all the other hotels. No worries, The room was off the hook and the bed was so comfortable. So comfortable, my ass slept more than anything in Vegas. I shit you not I got my rest FOOOOOO SHOOOO! 

I didn't care for any of the gambling. I gambled 6 bucks. I don't get off pressin buttons gettin nothin. Tables scare the shit out of me way to intimidating.  But I enjoyed going to Fat tuesdays about 5 times :D 

I was very comfortable here. I just think next time I need to stay in the middle of the strip because I refused to walk around. I felt like MGM was back of the bus of all the good stuff on the strip.  Oh well I still slept good and I enjoyed that Jacuzzi tub!

My best friend from high schools little sister turned 21 recently so we all headed to vegas to some fun.  They all booked rooms here based on the pool, so I went on hotwire and booked a room for my boyfriend and myself.  While hotwire is all about not telling you what the hotel is they give you a map and its pretty easy to tell which hotel you will be in.  So that was all pretty easy.  I called them and specifically asked for a smoke free room with a king bed.  That was all pretty easy and nice.

Our room was in the West Wing, which is pretty reviled on yelp and I understand why.  While nothing was super bad about our stay, some things made it not a place I would pay to stay in again:
-the valet, there are like 5 entrances to the MGM by car, but only one of them takes you to the valet. WTF
-the west wing hallways are seriously dark and kinda skeevy looking
-no mini fridges in the room
-horrible cable, they have like 7 channels and 5 of them not in english
-security came and scolded my friend for leaving the door to her room open while we were in it
-the rooms have absolutely no sound proofing at all. you can hear everything in the hallway and in the rooms next to you.  
-$15 a day for wifi.  
-no robes
-i tried to move the side table closer to the bed and it was super sticky, since we had just gotten there, that was pretty gross

MGM is supposed to be nice, but they obviously put all the people who purchase rooms on the internet in lame rooms with absolutely no amenities.  If I were to ever stay here again I would have to make sure it would not be in one of these rooms.

The overall hotel was nice and clean and we had a good stay. We chose to stay here for a wedding and blocked a cluster of rooms (10+) about 4 months in advance. When we arrived, our rooms weren't ready. We arranged for early check-in and had several members of our party waiting for hours to get checked in. I personally did not get into my room until after 5:00pm even though standard check-in time is 3:00. I booked a suite and they kept telling me to come back to the desk to see if it was ready. Mind you we arrived at 10:00am. I suggested they call me when it was ready since I had to keep waiting for hours. They said they didn't usually do that. They called me 3 times to tell me my check-in was being delayed because the current occupant kept requesting a later check out. The customer service to handle the matter was not accommodating. One of the people staying with us even found bed bugs in their room!!! This was highly upsetting considering the status of the hotel. We brought a lot of business to the hotel for a wedding and our guests rooms were not ready upon arrival. 

Once we got to our suite it stunk! We had to call someone to come spray a deodorizing spray. We called down to the front desk and someone came up within 45 minutes to fix it. That worked!  The wall plugs did not work to charge our phones, they kept "spitting" them out. The convenience USB portals on the TV stand didn't work either. 
Wi-fi connection was very weak. We couldn't stay connected even while sitting in our room. 

Forever Grand Chapel - The wedding ceremony was nice but, a lot of what we discussed with the coordinator leading up to the event did not flow correctly. It felt rushed behind the scenes. 

The pool was cold but, staff was friendly and we enjoyed our time there!

Christophe Salon staff was awesome! They exceeded our expectations with the services we received. The staff was friendly and exceeded our expectations with makeup and hair services as we prepared for my sister's wedding. They got us in and out and we looked awesome!

Fiamma - The staff handled our huge party with ease and class. The food was amazing!! We enjoyed everything that was brought out!

Avenue Café - Staff was accommodating and friendly! Food was delicious and exceeded what I thought it would be. This was our last meal in the hotel and it was great!

The only issues we had was the rooms overall and customer service handling that. We prepared months in advance so and our wedding guests would have a smooth stay. Our issues weren't the hotels issues. They were more concerned about how they looked rather than accommodating us.

Stayed at the MGM from 12\/26-12\/29. 
Check in took about 15 minutes, receptionist was very nice. We were in room 25-330, and could have gotten a better view since that what we had paid for. 
Room is nice and updated. Shower pressure was kind of low. Bed was comfortable. 
I recommend this hotel.

The room was nice, we were in the new suites, however. The pool is amazing - love the lazy river!  The downside to staying here is that the parking garage is so far away from where you check in and get to the rooms; let alone how far it is from the strip! It took us about 15 minutes to get from our room in the Grand Tower to the bridges to get to either the Tropicana or NYNY - and we are quick walkers.

The hotel is okay... they don't seem to have any particularly outstanding theme or decorum and there isn't much shopping in the hotel. I don't think I would bother staying here ever. My mom, my fiancé, and I came here just to see KA, which was amazing! Otherwise, I don't think we would have spent much time here in this hotel.

Went to Vegas for a girls weekend getaway. I booked a room at the MGM Grand because I had previously stayed there and it seemed pretty decent for what we could afford and they had this promotion going on where we get all these great credits like 25 slot credit, 2 for 1 at the spa, and free drinks at the pool.

The front desk lady was so rude. When I presented my debit card, she told me there would be a $200 charge if I wanted to charge things to the room since it wasn't a credit card. When I was looked confused about it and asked her to explain, she told me they would CHARGE me 200 so I could charge to my room. MY friend and I were even more confused after that, then the girl looks at us and says,"Do you want it, or not?" Of course we say no. Remember those great resort credits? Can't use them cuz we can't charge to the room! And she FAILED to mention that.

We get into our room and it is ok...til we get into the bathroom and realize that the toilet is leaking. We got a room on the 4th floor....so our view was really craptacular. I also requested a smoking room, and we got placed in a non smoking room. When we called to complain, they said they were at full capacity and would send up ashtrays. Vegas was fun, but MGM was not. I will definitely stay somewhere else next time.

If I could give this review zero star I would not hesitate. Below is the whole story if you care to read it :(
  My wife and I just stayed here for 6 nights for a business trip checked in to the hotel on behalf of our retail store the room was paid for and all incidentals were included with the credit authorization form the hotel provided. which I also had a copy of just in case. Immediately they told us we needed another form of payment so I provided them the credit authorization form. "Alright you guys are all good, you'll be able to charge to the room no problem enjoy your stay" if you have been to Las Vegas you know everything is double to triple the price it should be. so after 3 days we had charged a few items to the room. And there's a wonderful blinking message light on the phone in our room. I call to see what the message is. I get the run around by 3 different ppl ending the call with "there's no message on your account please disregard" okay.... 
The next night we order room service. "Sorry you are not set up to charge to your room" alright time to take a trip to the front desk. 
    The guy at the front desk calls the cashier " sorry about that you guys are all set, I just had the clear something up with the cashier enjoy the rest of your stay" I knew this was not the end of it because I could clearly see on the itemized bill they were only allowing our credit card to be charge for the cost of the room but apparently this was far to much for the staff to grasp. 
 Our last day arrives, 530 am there's the message light on the phone again this time guest services says your card was declined..infuriated but calm, I work customer service and know all to well getting mad generally doesn't help any situation. I head to the front desk level headed, where the manager insists the card is declining. Not the case there was plenty of room on the card the hotel Is just declining to use my card for reasons I cannot understand, they want another form of payment. So I provide them my other card which DOES decline because my Michigan credit union does not know I'm traveling. Sweet..he takes my card to the cashier and say "we can try the emergency line" comes back to tell me the emergency services line does not open until later. Which was a flat out lie. It's a 24hr line and I called it immediately after they did just to insure I was not about to pay them twice. the manager proceeds to tell me that he is going to have security escort my wife and I out of the room and we will not be able to take our luggage, since we cannot pay our bill. We are talking about $300 and they're are going to steal our personally belongings rather than just sending us a bill after we fly home. seriously. I will just pay you cash, the last bit of cash I have to make it home....luckily I did not gamble away all my cash and did have enough to cover the room charge balance. 
 Bottom line this place had such a complete lack of respect and willingness to help a customer that paid hard earned money to be there. We were lied to multiple times and threatened at 530 in the morning the day of check out. I have never been part of such a completely terrible hotel experience and with never again be staying at the MGM grand.

My 1st and last time staying at MGM. This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at in Vegas. I'm glad I decided to hop hotels this vacation or I would've been miserable the whole time. First, upon checking in, the pretentious desk clerk was rude right from the start, with his nose high-in-the-sky the whole time. He assigns me my room after I told him it was my first time staying here and he gave me keys without pointing me in the right direction. The rooms are so far away from everything. So after about an hour of trying to find my room, I finally find the general hallway and it's disgusting! He put me in the west wing which is totally gross! I put up with it since it was only for one night and at a great rate. The halls look like skid row. The walls and carpets are very dark, gloomy, and have funky smells.

When I walk into my room, it is worst. Again it's very dark and gloomy, even with every light on. The entire room is smaller than your standard hotel room, the bathroom is terrible for getting ready in (if you're a girl), and at about 3am I found cockroaches!! IIICK! I ended up switching rooms but same scenario in the new room. Once again, the desk clerks could care less.

The only plus of staying in the West Wing at MGM is that you can get the hell out of there.

The pools were ok; the lazy river was small, nothing like Casino Morongo's in San Bernardino. Wet Republic was cool but you still had to pay a cover even if you're a guest at MGM. LAME. Hard Rock doesn't make you pay a cover if you go to Rehab. The limits on the gambling floor were also pretty high so I didn't gamble here as much.

This was the first and last time I'll ever stay at MGM. It blows.

I came here for my bachelor party last weekend (and I still hurt). I stayed in a suite on the 10th floor for three nights. There are a lot of great things about the hotel\/casino and a few things that could use improvements. My group had two other rooms booked as well, a deluxe room on the 10th floor and another on the 21st.

We were promptly whisked away from the airport by their limo service which was fantastic. The valet\/taxi\/driver service is impeccable at the hotel. The front desk staff were hit or miss depending on the time of day\/level of hotel activity. Some were outstanding some were just okay. 

The rooms were very clean, the 21st floor is a little less modern than the 10th. No iPhone dock\/ stereo in the rooms was frustrating and their TVs had no premium channels making downtime and pre-gaming in the rooms less than thrilling. The decor of the suite was kinda all over the place. Beds were great, although I spent very little time sleeping in mine. Room service options were also less than desirable. 

Their pool area was huge, although the water was a little cold for swimming. We spent some time in the sun and hot tubs. A lovely server brought us buckets of beer. Check-out was easy with no surprises on the bill and the limo service back to the airport was on par with the pickup. 

The hotel is on my preferred side of the strip. Hooters (is a dump) but has cheap fare. New York New York is right across the way, Excalibur and Luxor aren't too far. You really can't go wrong with the MGM. I remember when it first opened and the improvements they have made over the years have always been in the right direction. 

I had an amazing bachelor party and I have the MGM Grand to thank.

Really liked the MGM, team was great.  Bell service and ballet were awesome, they even tried to recruit me after we retire.  We had to pay for a fridge which I thought was crazy, especially what we paid for the room.  No microwave, I really was unpleased with that.  I was never offered a drink when I was at the tables, not cool.  Otherwise, great hotel.  The pool was very nice, hot and sexy girls...
Had a terrible conference experience at this location.  The food was not good at all and The facility felt very dirty.

I'll try to make this chronological since I have kind of a lot to say about this experience.  

Check In:

We arrived in Vegas Thursday but our room wasn't booked till Friday so we stayed at the Luxor our first night in vegas.  This is an important detail cause it tempered my expectations of MGM the next day.  We were in no real rush to check in since my car was already parked in the garage and I had stuff to do Friday night.  When we checked in some time around 8pm Friday line wasn't bad and staff was courteous enough.  One thing that caught my attention was, the lady checking us in informed me that we checked in late and because of that we had a room on the first floor and a 'long walk'.  In other words, had we not been busy spending money on their casino floor and drinking in their bars we could have had a better room.  I doubt she knew where were spending our money aside from the room but it's worth noting.  

Room: 

The room we got was on the first floor down a pretty long hallway.  It was literally the LAST room in the hall all the way at the end (1558).  There were no windows, and it was sweltering hot.  Again, had I not wasted all that time spending money in their casino, I could have gotten a better $350\/night room.  When the time came to go to bed on night one, our room was pretty hot.  I had the AC and thermostat set to 65, after about an hour the temp in the room was 85 with the fan on high.  I called the front desk and after about a 15 minute hold was able to request some assistance.  Maintenance was nice and arrived about 10 minutes after my call.  They replaced an air filter and the temp was better but not great.  With the AC on at all times, I never got the temp below 77 degrees.  I didn't sleep well both nights... too hot.  On a positive note, the room setup and decor were actually very nice, I just had a shitty location.

Casino: 

The casino was pretty sweet.  I did notice while playing slots (I know, dumb) for a very long time, not once was I offered a drink of any kind, a phenomena I didn't not encounter in any of the other casinos I wasted my money in all weekend.  I gambled in their for a few hours.  Half the time I went to a bar and ordered a bourbon and coke I got Jack Daniels.  It's a bartender's job to know their craft and they can't make the distinction between bourbon and tennessee whiskey... shameful.  Aside from that staff was very nice, and food was good.

Overall:

I don't know if it was me or they had an off weekend but this was not a good experience by any stretch.  I spent over a thousand dollars at this casino and left feeling duped.  Again, the service itself was friendly and good for the most part.  I don't think I'll be staying here again.  I certainly wouldn't recommend it to anyone.  Weird thing is, I spent a night in the much cheaper Luxor and my experience was superior in almost every way.  If this is the modus operandi at most casinos in Vegas, my inclination is too go cheap next time.  At least then I'll feel like I got what I paid for.  Hope this helps.

Upgraded my room here for 3 nights for the "newly renovated rooms" at $20 a night, which I'm thinking was worth it because I've heard the other rooms are ghetto.  I had no problems with the service at this hotel, but I probably won't be staying here again in Vegas.  For one, it's location is not ideal unless you want to spend most of your time walking back and forth between Caesars \/ Bellagio area, and the fact that the Casino is confusing AS ALL HELL to navigate, my friends and I literally got lost every night. Plus, the free Wi-Fi sucked (I know, first world problems) but I was expecting to get work done and ended up having to go downstairs because I could barely get one bar of 4G let alone wireless. Overall my experience was just meh, concierge was helpful though.

The MGM Grand is a nice hotel.  Walking around in here was not too confusing... like other hotels I've been to.  But, if you're new to this hotel, the parking lot is a little confusing.  And, trying to get to valet from the self parking is confusing as well!  

I like the MGM Grand because there are a ton of things to do here for adults as well as kids.  A big BONUS, is that this hotel does a pretty good job at getting rid of the cigarette smoke that dominates the air space of many hotels.

The rooms are nice and clean.  The bed sheets were soft.  And the bed was comfortable.  

The pools here are nice.  There are a few different pools you can go to.  I would stay here for their pools!  This is a good place!

Don't even open the mini fridge!  If you take an item out to look at it out of curiosity, and then put it right back, you will be automatically charged for it by the computerized fridge!  Then the customer service phone number makes it almost impossible to contest the charges.  My husband even spoke with the front desk immediately after taking something out of the fridge and then seeing the sign that said you'll be charged automatically.  The front desk promised to remove the charges, but then sure enough the charges showed up on the credit card statement later.  The charges weren't even included in the itemized bill, I assume because this slimy hotel doesn't want you to see that you're being swindled.  I guess this is what you can expect from a business that makes its money by ripping people off (gambling).  I'm disgusted.
Nice rooms and a good selection of restaurants. But checkin takes forever. They need a better system. :o(
Always THE place to park when walking the strip. You can pick up a drink on your way out too.

The mansions at the MGM are really the only great thing here in my eyes. Every thing else is just okay. Unfortunately most people will never get to experience the Mansions but let me just say they are amazing and it is like being in a whole different world. 

I have been to every restaurant in this place and only one stood out and was worth mentioning and that was Joël Robuchon. If you can go here, then you must try this experience. The sixteen course starts at $425 a person and let me tell up it will rock your world. This is my favorite place about the MGM. 

I don't really like anything else here. The casino is very large and you just can't get personal service unless you are playing in the high limit areas. It is also very hard to get out of the parking lot after a concert or show in the Grand Arena. They also have the show KA which I thought used to be very good, but now just okay. They have changed it so much over the years. I was disappointed the last time I saw it.

Has really gone downhill.  Upgraded to the Staywell rooms, save your money.  The only thing that was more special than a Holiday Inn was the mattress and that's one of the reasons  I give it 2 stars.   The other is the staff was friendly.   We booked staying at MGM specifically for the lazy river which ended up being closed Mon-Thur.   I have a timeshare,  could have stayed there, but wanted the lazy river.  Ran into several couples, said the same thing, I my booked here for that.  Tried using pools, 1 of 3 closed,  not 1 place to sit, it was completely crowded.  When I mentioned this to staff,  was told to just wait around until someone left.. really!  Way overpriced for what you get.....almost forgot, no refrigerator or coffee maker in room, but they do have a refrigerator (honor bar) with seriously expensive snacks and drinks.  We moved a few of their waters out to make room for our drinks and got charged $7 for each bottle of water.  However, they did reverse it.  MGM is set up to get every nickel out of you.  Will never stay here again or recommend it.  Way nicer places to stay for the cost.

We stayed here for three nights in the tower spa suite. Wonderful room!  Clean and roomy.  The whole casino had clean restrooms and plenty of restaurants to choose from. We also went to the show "KA" which was fabulous!  Recommend to anyone wanting to stay on the strip.

I have mixed review about this place. This past visit, along with the Yelp group, it was excellent even though I was only here for one night. One night that , we think, MGM made an error in pricing. 
http:\/\/s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com\/bphoto\/jx3mnLJNQtMzcU2d46Vbng\/l.jpg
I booked it anyways and was pleasantly surprised that they had honor the reservation. 
Not only that, I got to shake the hand of the manager on duty. If I had any concerns, I could just phone in. I was placed in their newer rooms, a Grand Queen room
http:\/\/www.mgmgrand.com\/hotel\/new-grand-queen.aspx

Now, I have stayed here before in the same type room. So I know exactly how it was before. It wasn't bad but it was dull, lacked color. Well, there is now an abundance of color splashed on the walls with art. I noticed the walls were actually the same (look closely, they are actually a little dirty) , they just remodeled pretty much everything else, including all the cabinetry and the fixtures. It had lots of energy and vibrance to it. Not bad for a remodel. 

The cons of this room was that they had that mini electronic fridge bar. The one that is really sensitive. So when my bill came upon checkout, I had to make an extra call to let them know nothing was taken. 

Something also really strange was that when we came back after dinner, the TV was on. Huh? Someone came inside the room and dropped off robes and slippers. Oh, a night turndown perhaps? Or someone just got bored and watched TV because the beds weren't made. 

But there were plenty of positives. The Yelp rate, like my elite friends who stayed here, got a bottle of Veuve Clicquot. 
http:\/\/www.wine.com\/v6\/wineshop\/Detail.aspx?product_id=528&state=CA
Yes, it is crisp and refreshing, one of the better brands I've tasted. 
Yes, I did get chocolate and Fuji water too. 
I was given a late checkout considering the Billboard awards was the next day. 
http:\/\/www.billboard.com\/bbma\/

My only gripe for this trip was the pool here could use a little help. From the last time I was here, it has changed quite a bit. It is now louder, more people, and the theme of the pools doesn't help the guests navigating through it. I have no idea how to get to the pool I wanted and help was non existent. It was just a clusterf*ck of people drinking and fighting. I'm not condoning it, it was just way too many people and by the time I got there, the lazy river was closing even though the pool is supposed to be closed at 7pm. 

Another gripe is that the Lion exhibit is closed currently. Why????

My past stay here have consisted of getaways with friends and roommates. 
I have also booked a group of rooms here before and had a really horrific experience, including lack of hot water and being forced to prepay for all the room for all the days. 

This stay, by comparison, was terrific for the most part. If it can be like this everytime, I would be coming back for sure. Until then, I will wait for the renovations be over. I somehow always stay at MGM when they're doing some sort of renovations, maybe I just have bad timing. Either that or they are always doing these Renos. I will make sure I checked the calendar from their website next time.

2nd time in Vegas. First time staying at MGM.

Luckily, missed the line for check in. So got checked in fairly quickly. Started our trek to the room and we got to the hallway and our room was all the way at the end. My mom has a bad knee currently and I went back down to ask for a new room. Got a room right next to the elevator on a different floor very quickly.

Liked the layout of MGM. Rooms were nice and hotel hallways were less smoky than New York New York.

Didn't have hot water for our shower and we said something about it. A work order got put in and they said nothing was wrong...still no hot water. I decided to leave it running for a half an hour and it finally started to get warm. Shouldn't have to wait that long...what a waste of water. Told the hotel desk about this upon checkout and she waived the resort fees which was nice.

Overall, will stay here again. Just hope they have the hot water on!

The MGM Grand was the site of one of the worst hotel fires in US history. Early in the morning of November 21, 1980, a fire started in the wall of one of the restaurants. It burned for hours without anyone knowing, which is basically what happened in The Towering Inferno. By the time it was noticed it was out of control, and 85 people were killed. The building was repaired and sold (it's now Ballys) and MGM built a new 5,000-room hotel on the next block south, which remains the largest hotel in the United States to this day.

I kind of like the MGM Grand, partly because of this crazy history, and partly because it's such a weird, humungous, strangely colored green monstrosity. It's not really themed (the one that burned down had a seriously in-your-face Wizard of Oz thing happening) but it still has touches that reference its old Hollywood Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer roots. My nana worked for Metro-Goldwyn in the '30s and was David O'Selznick's secretary when he made Gone With the Wind; one day she took Vivien Leigh shopping in Manhattan and Ms. Leigh bought her a cocktail glass with a seagull on it. 

But it's not a perfect hotel. The rooms are very comfortable, but when we upgraded to a strip view  for sixty bucks I was disappointed to find that the windows had a dark screen built into them which takes away from the vista. 

The casino smells like a cougar's perfume. It's also a very long walk to get anywhere -- God forbid you get to the pool and forget your copy of Bonfire of the Vanities. It's also the only Vegas pool I've ever been to where you don't have to fight to the death for a lounge chair. The sound system is very high quality, which is one of those things you don't think is a big deal until you get stuck with one that isn't.

A spin down the lazy river is like floating through It's a Small World After All except it's 11 a.m., everyone's hammered and the dolls all wax their chests.

If ever there was a three-star hotel, this is it. It is absolutely a step above Luxor, Excalibur, and Monte Carlo -- and an unmistakable step down from Caesar's, Mandalay Bay and the Venetian. The MGM Grand is the hotel version of your middle-aged, middle-class brother-in-law who works as a regional manager for a decent-sized company and earns a high-five-figure salary. Which is to say, he's doing just fine, he's comfortable, he drives a car with a sunroof and his wife is a solid six. But at the end of the day, would you really want to be him?

I have stayed at Excalibur, Tropicana, Treasure Island, Mirage, Caesar's, Paris and this past week MGM Grand Las Vegas. I can safely say, without hesitation, MGM Grand is THE best hotel I've every stayed in. 

The valet guys, housekeeping, the employees at all the restaurants, the check-in process and everyone in between... were INCREDIBLE! The customer service was stellar from the minute we walked in the door, to the minute we left. I felt pampered, appreciated and truly satisfied with the entire experience. 

We arrived around noon and there were multiple people in line for check-in.  However, they had a full staff of about 10 people checking people in, so it went very quick.  The young lady at the desk was extremely pleasant and helpful with all of our quesitons.  We booked and paid for our reservation in full through United Vacations.  Upon check-in, we were offered a suite upgrade for a total of $140 for our a 4 night stay. I jumped on that chance.

For the amount of people in and out of the hotel daily, it was always clean enough to eat off the floor. The suite was superior, very spacious and the bed was super comfy!  The bathroom featured a separate tub and glass enclosed shower (see photos).  The water pressure was good and the water was actually HOT!  I am most of the time dissatisfied with water temperature, but I was pleasantly surprised this time around.

I personally won quite a bit in the casino and didn't spend much, so I was pretty stoked about that. I liked the selection of 1 cent through $5 slot machines and the video roulette was pretty cool.  

We had free WiFi, which hasn't been offered at any other hotel on the strip. There is faster WiFi available for a fee, but the free one suited my needs (to upload pictures and view the airline website) just fine.

I had one issue (brought on by myself) on the last day here.  I received an email with my receipt for the hotel charges. I viewed it and pressed the button to "accept."  I didn't realize until a minute later, I had just checked myself out of the hotel at 5am.  Grr.  The room keys were no longer working (that was a quick and easy process, I must say!)  A trip down to the lobby fixed the issue very quickly.  We had two new keys in under 5 minutes and the customer service was great!  We called down to check out when we were really leaving later that afternoon.  

I can't say enough about this place..the food, the drinks, the casino and the atmosphere..I never expected it would be so good. I felt they had a good amount of people on staff for everything, to suit my every need. Whether it was to park my car, get help\/directions, keeping the bathrooms clean (never once did I see one that wasn't) or housekeeping for our room, the service was stellar. Everyone went above and beyond to make sure my stay was great. 

I hope if you decide to stay here, you'll have the same experience.

My first impression was "Wow, definitely not what I remembered".  I visited MGM Grand years ago and remember having a horrible experience - leaking water pipes, huge water beattles in the room, ugh.  So this visit initially was a pleasant surprise.  Nice rooms, really comfy bed, decent room service.  So far, so good.  Then we start to take a little tail spin:

- Shower and tub were draining slow.  By the second night, they wouldnt drain at all. I don't want to "gore" you with the details - maintenance had to be called and we weren't happy.  They comp'ed one night stay for the inconvenience, which was a nice gesture

- The elevators, oh the elevators!  Half the time they weren't working or would take too long.  i would try and re-route myself by going to another floor and trying to catch and elevator there.  Or riding the elevator up just to get down.  Ugh, what a debacle.  Seriously, it was annoying knowing that I had to give myself a 15 minute lead time just to get to the lobby.  Then the thought crossed my mind - fire.  Hmmm... thanks for making it blantantly obvious that I'm screwed if there is an emergency.  That comfy bed didn't seem to make me sleep so well after that revelation

The best part about the MGM was the fact that everything that I wanted to do was right there - pool, concerts, casino, shows... But I am sure that is true of any of the hotel\/casinos in Vegas.  Its average.  I would consider staying there again if all the attractions\/concerts that I want to see are there... otherwise, I think I'm gonna cruise the strip.  Maybe I'll get lucky somewhere else ;)

When I think of big fights, whether UFC or boxing, I think MGM Grand. For gambling, their tables are decent ($25 minimum at just about everything after 10pm), but why is there no kiosk to check your comps anywhere in the building? I had to ask like 3 people where the machine was (standard in every other casino and there's one seemingly around every corner), and found out at the end that I had to pick up a courtesy phone to speak to a customer service rep who gave me my comp total over the phone...seems terribly antiquated for a supposedly high-end casino. Otherwise, it's fine to get your gambling on (and the craps table, call it beginner's luck, was very good to me, so MGM will always have a soft place in my heart).

One of the best features in the hotel rooms are the black out shades! OMG! Its crazy how good they work. If you are out all night and dont want to be waken up by the sun peaking through the crack in the curtains, you have to stay here! You will never know what time of day it is outside with the black out shades down. 

The beds are also very comfy, as well as the pillows. I hardly noticed my fiance moving around during the night. So its pretty easy to get a good nights sleep here. 

Another awesome bonus, walking in from the parking structure up to the lobby, you pass a Fat Tuesdays! Yum! Dont forget to keep your glass and save a couple bucks on refills!

One drawback, the casino floor is very large so you can definitely get lost. But there are alot of employees around that are helpful. 

Overall, I cant wait to stay here again!

The only downside to this hotel is it's size. I say downside because one night I was really drunk, I was frustrated because I wanted to get back to my room, it seemed like a mile to the elevator, and I was doing this in heels I had been walking on for 7 hours (it's Vegas you are suppose to be out late and get your party on). 
MGM has it all! A fantastic restaurant assortment, great bars (my favorite casino bar is Centrefuge), huge casino, big pool complex (two words - lazy river), and fun nightlife. For you foodies (like I am) Joel Robuchon has 2 restaurants there, as well as, James Beard, Michael Mina, Tom Colicchio offer their take on fine dining. 
When I've stayed there the rooms were spotless and the staff more than helpful.
Very nice hotel! I didn't stay here, but we cut through just to sightsee and visit Fatz Cafe while walking the strip. Huge and nice! Take a gander

This place is Huge...I mean HUGE! 
It was originally of the Wizard of Oz theme as seen as the Emeral City though none of the original theme exists anymore.
It is still a lot of fun to wak around.
Prepare to get lost, but if so you can always ask a staff member for directions.
My favorite places to eat are CraftSteak and WitchCraft.Sandwich Shop for yummy gourmet sandwiches.

Came here for our franchise convention for the week. 
The staff were all friendly and eager to help with anything we needed.
Checking in went smooth the room was nice and clean.
I would have been a easy five star review except our room had no hot water for the whole duration of our stay! We notified the staff ( multiple times ) and they let us know they knew that and would see what they could do...

They actually did nothing and we took cold showers and had to bath our 6 month old son in a cold sink bath. The MGM is a massive facially with a lot of resources I'm at a loss why they couldn't get the issue fixed. For some people this may not have been that much of a issue since the weather was over a hundred everyday but, a family with a infant it was no fun.

At the end of our stay money was taken off when we talked to the manager. I would have rather had the hot water.

1. The paid parking even for Las Vegas residents is garbage. They should at least make parking free for residents for the first 24 hrs just like Caesars owned hotels. 

2. The parking garage is the most confusing garage in all the strip. The layout is just not practical especially during events. You'll be stuck in the garage for hours. Just like how I am right now writing this review. And 80% of the elevators and escalators are broken. The MGM parking employees don't know how to direct traffic.

Holy crap this place is HUGE! It is like its own city?! There were a ton of people just walking around in here. We were just trying to get to the Wet Republic Pool party and felt like I was walking a mile. It was a little bit on the smoky side and it is being renovated. I am just glad we weren't staying here.
Great place to stay for a great time clean in environment great room and awesome crap tables people are very nice on the tables drink come free when gambling

I checked in to the hotel at around 3:30.  When I got to my room, the bathroom was not clean.  There were towels spread on the sink, someone's Starbucks cup was still sitting on the bathroom counter, the toilet seat was up and there was no shampoo, etc.   I called both housekeeping and the front desk.  Front desk offered to change my room, but I had already unpacked and didn't want to move.  I also had a nice room location (thanks to a $20 tip at check-in) and they stated they wouldn't upgrade me, only change to a different room.  Fearing they would stick me in an undesirable location, I just asked them to clean the bathroom.  Simple, and makes sense, right? Again, that was about 3:45pm.  8:30pm and the bathroom is still not cleaned.  Finally at 9:30, someone comes up to clean.  For that poor service, I give 2 stars.  Rooms are outdated with old school furniture, warn out chairs, electrical plugs which are too loose to hold a plug and a (very tiny) wetbar for which I never got the combo.  And the iron is so old that it left white lyme\/calcium (or similar) marks on my dark pants.  This resort \/ property is not a very convenient.  The gym and pool are a long walk, which I don't mind so much, but one has to trek through the casino, past restaurants and among the crowds just to go for a dip.  This resort is huge with tons of restaurants for all walks of life, shows, activities (Top Golf), and a nice casino.  They even have $10 tables!! (Which is why I give two instead of 1 star). However, I'm very disappointed in this place and will most likely never stay here, or recommend this to others.  Update:  My neighbors are pot smokers.  I called the front desk and they stated they would not move us and that they would call security.  I really didn't want that (in fear for our safety), but they stated they had to call.  They should have moved us immediately.

We watch Ka Cirque du Soleil at this hotel.  

This review is mainly for the show.  

We got to take a picture before the show and we actually ended up buying them at the end $45 for 3 5 x 7 photos.  

The show had a nice staging and it will be hard to explaining it to someone who have not watch the show before.  I give them 5 stars for costume\/staging.  I was a little disappointed with music choice because it got so repetitive and it kinda drag.  Also, there are no stories involve so I keep hoping for betting ending but it never happen.  Talks were gibberish........no dialog what so ever and no plot.  If there was, it was not clear.

I do have positive to say however,  the staging is excellent.  The transition is amazing and all the stunts are unbelievable.  I can't imagine how the stage moved and design to see all angles and sides.  Nice part on the actors and stunt men.

There were moments that I found couple of my friends dozing off.  I thought it was just me.  For the amount if money spent.....I should of invested more on LeReve and be satisfied, I heard good reviews. 

Don't get me wrong, Ka is not bad at all. It's just different from how I imagine it to be. Maybe you will like it so don't take my word for it.

I always choose to stay here at the MGM Grand when I do my twice yearly Vegas run.. Heres the thing.. Its central.. Its got all that you need... late night craving for McD's.. or Haagen Dazs.. its here.. Upscale dining.. yep., that too.. Awesome night clubs.. and always alot going on.. 
This time I stayed in the West Wing rooms.. They had a very "W Hotels" feel to them.. nice, retro meets modern feel. Not crazy about the layout of the shower, watercloset.. But thats because Im super private! EVEN with my best friend ; I still need a bit of my space not invaded.. but a tv over my vanity.. loved that.. 

Not crazy about the buffet...but it was a promo I had.. so went, we tried , we feasted and not liking buffets anyway.. Ill pass next time. 
The bell boy.. he was rude.. point blank.. he actually rolled his eyes and huffed.. bc he was a different guy then who valet'd and took our bags downstairs.. we tipped all of our cash to him.. YES we looked and felt like losers.. but come on.. a tip is that.. its a tip for great service.. okay.. i write this feeling egg in my face! 
Ill go back to the suites.. or the Grand Tower rooms.. the 'basic' room at the MGM now that the Emerald Tower is no more.. and yes.. I will continue to say here.. I love the MGM:-)

MGM is a great hotel in general, for the most part I can get a really good deal and choose this location over others because of its location on the strip but also because it has everything you  need, nightclubs, restaurants, shows, pool, spa. 
This review is for the Wellness Room in the grand tower, The internet was horrible I had to call down to IT for mgm twice and it didn't work. I ended up having to take my work into the lobby and was able to get better service, I usually don't have much work to do while in Vegas but this time I did and it was a huge let down that I wasn't able to work in the privacy of my room. The TV had bad connection as well. (Room 14-125)As far as the layout of the room it was pretty basic to a mgm king grand room. The bed was nice but wasn't as luxury as I imagined and it is a low platform style. The shower was nice. We also got woken up at about 230am asking about room service, it was a mistake and the front desk compensated for the inconvenience of the call as well as the internet service.  

Pro: separate check in\/check out area. There was no line when we came in! You don't have to wait in those lines
free waters!! Complimentary waters for Wellness guests
Con: bad wifi and no wired availability in the room

....I had business in Vegas and signed up for 5 nights in May 2017 for $950 for room with King...less than half the Aria...my wife called me she couldn't make it for few days because Mom's health took turn....they cancelled with class....have earned my return

Dear god, could this place BE any bigger? Shit. Kind of a cheesy Vegas decor, and extremley overpriced. Obviously, anything at the casino will be a rip off...restuarants...I was NOT expecting to pay 14 bucks anywhere for a side salad. 
I was there for a conference and mark my words it was 15 minutes to get from the rooms to the conference center...a huge pain in the ass and on my feet. 
Rooms...ok...obviously I had the bottom of the barrel rooms, but for 209 a night I mean it was as nice as a new Marriot would be...but it was VERY clean and the bed was also very comfortable...and BOO no HBO in the room? Shit, even the Motel 6 down the street had that...but I know, I know, they want you gambling not watching TV in your room.
The live lion display, cool as was the sports book place...but overall I am glad this conference is at the Venetian next year.

We stay at the MGM Grand hotel which the casino was very nice but the hotel basic. Then you are in vegas, you dont spend that much time in your hotel. I would say its was average hotel. I was sad to here they got rid of the loin exhibit

Stayed here for spring break years ago. I love the resort. This place is huge. I used to always come here for fat Tuesdays to get drinks and to check out the lions habitat. Too bad its gone now. The hotel rooms where a little above average. The signature is much better. Of coarse the price is a little more there also. This is a great location though. I like there is also a lot to do in this casino. Its huge.

MGM is a great place to stay, right on the strip and this time of year the weather is perfect for strolling outside. MGM has this Spring Fling special going on right now which you can get to by clicking http:\/\/clk.atdmt.com\/MGM\/go\/129286735\/direct\/01\/

Have Fun!
What hotel in 2017 doesn't have USB equipped outlets? I couldn't even charge all my electronics as I only travel with one plug. Disappointing at best.

Old on the review but my hubby and I booked a  room for to celebrate our birthday. Loved it. Its pretty huge and you feel as if you're walking in a circle but your not because their are a lot of shops, restaurants and shows inside the hotel not to mention casinos. 

We wanted to eat at their Buffet but the line was way toooooo long so we decided to eat at the  Avenue Cafe  (inside the hotel as well). Very great on the food and customer service. But IF you're on a budget, they have McDonalds and other reasonable fast-food joints in the hotel, other hotels along the strip.

ALSO, the drinks are awesome! 


Oh and the our room was nice & Clean.

$18 to park for 4 hours? When we have already paid for a pool pass, I show ticket, and to eat in the fancy restaurant? Best advice is to avoid all MGM properties until they figure out how not to charge their customers for gambling and visiting their properties.

Update: After seeing the response that was responded to my above post, I did some checking. It seems the MGM properties in the past five weeks have dropped considerably in terms of revenue. I'm interested to see what happens six months from now.

MGM is going downhill. I stayed here three times but this time was the worst. The staff is rude. There are a lot of obviously homeless people hanging out, and it doesn't feel safe. At one point, i saw an altercation between two men. A cocktail lady was screaming for security, and no one came. Stains on bed sheets. Rude people. Smells like weed and urine everywhere. I spent a lot on gambling and once asked a cocktail lady for a drink. She told me with an attitude to ask someone else. Spend a little more and book Wynn or Bellagio instead.

I stayed at the MGM Grand the first time I went to Vegas, and overall it was ok. The bedrooms and bathrooms are renovated, but the walls are paper thin!! You can hear EVERYTHING, literally EVERYTHING around you!! It is also at one end of the strip, so don't stay there if you have trouble walking!! The only really cool thing was the complementary Cirque du solei tickets!!! Awesome!!!

Are you kdding me with this?? We've been here for 9 hrs already and have yet to be checked in  Why? Because their systems are down and everyone has to be checked in manually  while I could normally be sympathetic in this situation, this has apparently been going on for THREE days now!! AND we booked a suite with 2 beds because we have 4 people and now they want to give us a room with 1 king bed!! Really?? This is customer service?? Has anyone in their IT department heard of redundancy??  Or of testing a system before you go live with it??  Or, worst case scenario, when the ish hits the fan after Day 1, pulling the upgrade down and reverting to the old system???  Do they not have a disaster recovery plan???  The Pacquiao fight is this weekend and there are 100,000 ravers in town for the country's largest EDM event for the whole weekend.  That's just this property, god knows what's happening at the others around the country.  VERY displeased with the run-around we've gotten and the lack of customer service.  Will not EVER stay at this place again.  EVER!!!!
