The problem is the paid parking!  We always use the valet when we visit the MGM Grand, it is fast, and closer to the entrance.  It was great.  We don't usually stay here, but have seen shows, gambled, and eaten here.  We were pretty shocked to have to pay for parking at all, but our plans were made so we paid to self park.  We had tickets that evening for a show at the Mirage, stayed to eat, and shop, and gamble.  $18 to park!  Just read that it is only the MGM owned hotels that are charging.  Will double check which ones before our next visit.  Will spend my money elsewhere.  I'd rather gamble it away!

I stayed here for a work event last week, and will be back again in two weeks for a similar events. The check-in process was painless, and the front desk is just around the corner from the elevators to our room. My first time in the room was to just put my stuff down and head back to the conference area. I was able to more closely inspect the room later that night :)

The bedroom area of the room (2 queen room) was pretty nice. The beds and pillows were comfortable, enough plugs to plug in all of my chargers. The tv doesn't really match the caliber of the hotel in my opinion, but it worked and did the job. The decor of the bathroom was also a little disjunct, but it was big and nice. 

The one thing that really grinded my gears though is that I had some leftover pizza from Wolfgang Puck's that I was planning to eat the next evening. Since there are no fridges in the rooms, I left it on my desk and came back that afternoon to find it gone. Major disappointment. Either way, my standards for Vegas hotels are pretty basic since I mainly need them to sleep and shower, and the MGM did the job.

We have been here for about an hour and not very happy. We stayed here last year and had a great time but it seems consistency is not a feature here. 

My primary beef is with all of the incidental charges and the lack of basic amenities. $15 per night extra to get a king instead of two queens and I sort of had to twist arms to find one at all. I wasn't even bothered by the charge until later. 

Forgot to get cash on the long drive here so had to use the ATM so I could tip the bellman, $8 ATM fee. 

Room service: a $20 sandwich and the guy asks me if I wanted to "upgrade to fries" for an extra $5. Seriously? Then the sandwich arrived, it was a basic club with cheap cold cuts on white bread. The quesadilla was inedible. I will post a picture. $60 for a crappy sandwich and an inedible quesadilla.

Look, I don't mind paying for a great experience, but I have had better stays in a holiday inn express. 

Let's get to the room. Despite the fact that it looks out onto what appears to be the exhaust vents of restaurants, the room is just ok. Again, just as nice as a holiday inn and express. The holiday inn at least knows what I is. 

The mattress is hard and lumpy. I always look forward to hotel beds, but this one sucks. 

In the bathroom there was one shampoo, one bar of soap, one conditioner and one lotion. No shower gel or extra bar of soap, meaning if you take the soap into the shower then there is nothing at the sink to wash your hands. You are left with a Sophie's choice of "do I leave a soap so he can wash his hands and use up the one bottle of shampoo on my body? Or do I bring the soap into the shower and risk him being stuck within toilet hands? 

Like I said, I don't mind at all paying a premium for a premium experience, this however is far from ideal let alone premium. The room is meh, the mattress sucks, the food is horrible and there isn't enough soap for two adults to have a shower. I don't see myself ever staying here again. Just two nights. I can make it. 

There's no place like home.

Reading reviews of hotels on Yelp is so funny. People will give one star because their room was far from the elevator, or because people in the lobby are drunk, or because there is a resort fee (every single hotel has this on the strip....). Gosh you negative nancies! It's VEGAS! 

OK ANYWAY

I loved the MGM! Maybe I am going easy on them because we had a comped room, but I thought it was a super nice hotel, with tons of food and club options. Wet Republic is one of my all time faves and Hakkassan brings the BEST DJs in the world (Calvin Harris! Aoki! I'm lookin at YOU!). You can check in on your phone and check out on your tv. Lots of convenience here for sure! 

Minus one star because the vanilla smell they pump through the hotel was disgusting. I don't have a sensitive nose at all but it was seriously awful!! I couldn't imagine working there and smelling that all day! I would have to take Aleve daily to prevent a headache Lol

Only like $11 Uber to the airport! Yassssssssssss

We are a couple who travel extensively and are used to the challenges.  It takes a lot to make us write on a review.  We recently booked in advance 5 months for a room at the MGM.  We had stayed there in the past with not particular problems but it was several years ago.  We checked in and then began the journey to the room receiving a room in the "West Wing".  It is a long walk and we were hosting a couple with a room next to us.  The general upkeep and appearance of that section is old, dark, rundown and dirty.  Our room keys actually worked after several attempts.  The room was old, carpets and walls dirty.  Our guests room which was next door failed to open with the room cards.  We phoned the front desk and were put on hold.  One of the cleaners said they would call security but they failed to arrive.  Our guest ended up walking all the way back to check in after waiting 45 minutes.  Security arrived and basically the lock was broken.  They told us to come back in an hour and out cards would work.  We returned in 3 hours and nothing worked again.  We then had to walk again all  they way to check in and wait another 45 minutes only to be told they would have to move to another room which  was worse than ours.  Basically this place is worn out and it is a disgrace to rent for $300 per night.  Worst stay I have had in Las Vegas.  No excuses.

This is the spot for young revelers looking for a well maintained but in-expensive stay on the Strip.

Recently refurbished the giant lion bearing hotel is probably one of the most famous on the strip.

The decor is simple and too fabulous but since its refurb it is more modern than some of the competitors. 

If your looking for something Basic and not fussed about having a central location then this is a good choice

i'll start by saying that this isn't a fair review.
i did not stay here.
and i'm not a die hard animal activist. but...

seriously what is this the eighties? this place has two miserable-looking lions in a plexiglass cage filled with plastic terrain probably not much bigger than my apartment... there are obnoxious tourists suction-cupped against the glass in hoards slapping and kicking at them and snapping a thousand pictures a minute like they've never seen a flipping animal before. 

i got half way past and almost started crying (liked las vegas isn't depressing enough)

Stayed here back in June and had the worst experience ever. Called every day for someone to clean the room and fresh towels. Everyday I called no one showed up to even clean the room. One day we got clean glasses. Then next day we got 2 towels. It was a joke. I was hung up on by Franky at the front desk and transferred to room service when I tried to bring this to the front desks attention. Then they gave me a free room which I can use at a later time but every time I call the number to book the room for a future stay it just rings and rings for like 5 minutes and no one ever picks up. This hotel has the worst service, maid service and customer service ever. I expected a little more for the price I paid to stay at this hotel. 

Also when I was at the pool I wanted to order drinks and food but the waitress just ignored me every time I tried to ask her or wave her down. I just got up and got my own food. This hotel need to learn to treat the average hard working person like their money matters too. I work very hard to save to take a vacation to Vegas and felt my time was ruined by this horrible experience and service.

Took my grandparents here for their first Vegas experience. Since it was right before Christmas, everything was even glitzier than normal. 

The check-in took over 30 minutes. The front desk staff was friendly. 

The rooms were really nothing special, plain. At least they were clean. 

The casino is huge and poorly designed. There is never a quick way from point A to point B. I gambled quite frequently butmwas never once offered a free drink. Lame. 

The lion habitat is nothing special. All, we saw were sleeping lions. 

I aprreciate that there were a lot of dining options. I like the Rain Forest Cafe bloodies and cheap breakfast in the morning. The sushi place was good too. 

If you can get a cheap deal on the room, go for it! Otherwise try somewhere else.

Update:  We went back to MGM after their renovation.  This time we stayed in the West Wing.

After our amazing experience the first time, my wife and I were less than impressed with the West Wing rooms.  They're pretty small and far away.  Definitely the "low rent district" rooms.  Our room had a broken lamp, stains on the carpet, and stains (maybe paint?) on the comforter and sheets.

We'll might stay here again because the service is great.  If we do, we'll avoid the West Wing rooms.

My family decided to have a 3 day luxury vacation on 2\/20\/2013 - 2\/22\/2013.  I made a big mistake; a huge mistake to picked MGM.  On 2\/1, I reserved the room (they named it Skyline Marquee Suite), paid a fairly high price.  On 2\/3, I sent an email to reserve 4 tickets for the show "KA" in the hotel.  On 2\/5, I called in and confirmed that the tickets will be ready at the time we check in.
Finally, the day arrived and we drove to MGM with a great happy holiday mood.  We arrive at 4pm and the room was not ready.  When asked, "Please wait around, we don't know when will it be ready but I will call you."  Of course, there were no show tickets.  2 adults and 2 kids, we were walking around the hotel (with our bags and cases) from front desk to concierge desk to box office (each of them following a line), still no show tickets.
Finally we got into our suites.  I need some robe.  I called the housekeeping requesting 4 pairs of sleepers.  The housekeeping told me there are sleepers in the bathroom.  After seriously searching around all the 2 bathrooms while talking on the phone, I still find no sleepers.  After a lot of conversation finally I have to yell "could you please bring us 4 pairs of sleepers anyways? 30 minutes later, the sleepers were delivered.  The sleepers are inside the robe inside the closet, not in the bathroom.
Next morning, I walked my family to a Grand Canyon Tour downstairs at 6:00.  Partially dressed; still sleepy like hell, at 6:10, I could not open the door because the room key decided to quit working.  I went to the front desk and was asked to show ID to help me get back into my room.  I had no ID with me.  MGM computer was down and cannot verify my key and give me another key.  I had no ID, no money, no room, no working key, was so sleepy and so poorly dressed.  I surrender.  I wanted to sleep on the carpet.  The manager heard my horrible experience and decided to waive some money from my bill.  I don't want money; I want my show, my bed, and my nice luxury trip back.
It is my first visit to MGM and of course the last visit too.  Next time if someone invites me there, I would sleep in my car instead.  At least I can always open my car with my key without showing my ID.

I come from a family of gamblers, my dad has been a strong supporter of MGM and all of Mlife casinos, he's a noir card holder member.  MGM has always been like a second home to me because I'm here a least once every 4 months.  This weekend however, has been one of the most horrible experiences of my Las Vegas life.  
1.  They downgraded my two bedroom suite to two connecting rooms.  I asked to speak to a manager, they no longer have supervisors or managers on site.  When you ask to speak to management they pick up the phone and have you speak with them.  Ok, you guys want to act more balsy over the phone since you don't have to face your customers? Ok, that's fine.  I've had downgrades about 3 times in my whole Las Vegas experiences, why was I ok with it then and not now? Well, each inconvenience I've been awarded food and beverage credit towards the room, free buffet, free spa, and was even awarded complimentary stay for the whole weekend without having to ask for a thing!  It was all done just to keep me, the customer, happy.  What was I offered this time?  A complimentary cancellation of my whole weekend.  The woman who I spoke with said she would grant us food and beverage credit which was never added to our room credit but even getting that credit was like pulling teeth, getting responses like "don't let a room dictate your experience here, if I had to give food and beverage to everyone who had an inconvenience we would be broke".  That was probably the most ignorant response from a manager I have ever heard.  Not even a 5 year old would believe that.  Or how about "ma'am we can't control high rollers who want to stay another night we can't kick them out" *facepalm.  What am I chopped liver?  Should I have came with my dad? Would he get more respect than I do?  Apparently so, someone at the casino even told us what really goes down at the MGM.  I wish I'd known before.  
2.  We arrived to our room and it's not even clean.  We had to call someone to come and finish the job.   
3.  The elevators.  It's not an elevator it's a moving sauna.  The hallway to the elevators was a sneak peak into how hot the elevators really were.  They were moving saunas.  No joke, EVERYONE in the elevator complained.  We joked that we were all struggling to share the air.  The whole weekend stay it was like this and we brought it up to the staff 3 times.  The bathroom of our room was also extremely stuffy, no ventilation whatsoever.  I was sweating while trying to put my makeup on.  
4.  Taxi\/valet service.  The first guy was awesome, complimented how gorgeous our group was and because I'm a platinum card holder I'm able to get priority in the taxi line, so they were able to get a limo the first night and 4 cabs the following night to dinner.  When we went out again that night after dinner everyone was excited because we didn't have to stand in that huge hour long line.  Here come mister sour puss, "we gettin a limo?" I tell him the girls just wanna do cabs this time and he says "it's only 1 cab per Mlife card".  Out of allllllllll the years I have been coming here, not once has this been an issue.  Ever.  I explained this to him and he says he would do it "just this time".  What it was is he was too lazy to call 4 cabs which takes you less than 5 min to do. 
5.  Went to top golf Saturday night because my husband was also in LV golfing at all the different golf courses and decided to check this place out because it's more of like a cosmic bowling experience and he didn't want to bring his golf clubs.  Coincidentally, we were at the bar talking about how horrible MGM has been and I accidentally dropped a drink on my lap.  Not much but I needed a napkin, I asked the bartender for a napkin to which he replies "we don't have napkins" and walks away.  I laughed, my husband laughed, we thought he was joking.  Nope, he looks at us like we are stupid for THINKING the bar would have napkins.  I see another bartender a young lady and I called her over and asked her for a napkin.  "Sure, here ya go" hands me a handful of napkins from the bar where I was told there were none.  I know people who read this will be like "it's just napkins" to me this was the last straw.  The perfect ending to a horrible weekend.
6.  Oh and we paid 60 dollars for parking.  First time ever having to pay for parking.  
Please, customer relations spare me your generic responses.  If you want to make a difference reach out and make things right.  
*google MGM grand and you'll see all the unannounced changes.

Second time staying here and I had a blast! I do miss the lions though. I would always stop and see them even when I wasn't staying at this particular hotel. Hopefully they bring another exhibit sometime. I tried out a different room this time and it was pretty nice. I wish it were equipped with a mini fridge and the shower didn't leak horribly. There was a huge puddle on the floor after every shower. Overall the staff was very helpful and nice and I would come back. It is a nice hotel.

Checked into hotel for the labor day weekend with my family,being we rented the stay well grand room there is fast check in,check in was suppose to be at 3 and we were allowed in at noon.the rooms were clean and had many cool features like premium light throughout,vitamin c infused shower hea,the beds and pillows were excellent they also had a air purifier with this room was also free gym access which was located clear across the hotel from the rooms.everyday our room was cleaned but left without empting the trash which was bad.as for the gym it's a little on the small side for the size of the hotel.it was packed only machines available was spin bikes\/exercise bikes all weights were taken and there were no clean towels,and I didn't see anyone there bring any the 30 minutes that I was there,the pile of dirty towels was sitting there the whole time.so I then decided to take my kids to the pool every pool and lazy river was full of people drinking there is not a family pool for kids which they should have to accommodate all paying guests we did find a jacuzzi that had cold water that we were able to use for about 1 hour before the drinkers took over,there language was not good for kids!after a while the crowd started getting rowdy security had to start arresting a few people for getting out of hand.i will try another casino and maybe thinking twice on taking kids, $660 for a 4 day holiday weekend was ok I'm sure I could find something just as nice but with a mellow crowd  more suitable for kids.

Stayed here on Sunday Sep 4. Idk if they were so disorganized because it was a busy weekend but thus was a wayyyy worse experience than my visit in MGM grand 5 years ago.
NO CURTAINS in the room (see pic). Apart from the privacy issue, that meant I had a rude awakening from the sun at 6am. It's first time in my life I stay in a hotel that doesn't have means to block the sun.
Room cleanliness left much to be desired. Dust on the furniture, sawdust on the floor (see pics), spots on the badly laid bedsheets, rust on the bathroom tiles....
These would be ok if we were talking about a 50$ per night off the strip hotel. For the premium price of 220$ that I paid which is close to what other top notch hotels like the Cosmopolitan and the Venetian charge, I cannot imagine myself ever stsying here again

Wow has MGM stepped it up a couple levels since I've last been here. My Room was totally pimp, the staff was amazingly helpful and accommodating, and the night life here is awesome!!!! This stay here totally made me rethink my prior experiences at MGM Grand & we will most certainly be back again!!! So excited for tonight!! Way to go MGM!

Great hotel experience especially during big fight weekends, from their pools to the gym to its hakkasan club, this hotel has it all and host some of the best venues in town, The suite I stayed in had two level rooms with a great view the customer service was the best. Be prepared to run into celebrities during the fighting events there. Highly recommend this hotel,

Nice room. We got upgraded when we checked in. The room is clean and spacious. Cool pool. Not far from the airport. We took Uber, only cost $10. The hotel is so big and needs a lot of walking. Wifi is free.

We stayed at MGM Grand April 2015 for 5 nights.. and this was our first here. We were very very pleased with our stay.... We were long time Caesars guests and players, but with the decline of their properties we opted to try the MGM properties out. We are glad we did! I have always noticed that the MGM hotels and casinos kept a higher standard so we were hoping to find this true for our first stay. We were celebrating our 12th anniversary and selected a Tower Spa Suite several months in advance and booked it. I had a little correspondence with the concierge Veronica Cruz in advance as I was somewhat nervous about getting the type of room we reserved... Ms. Cruz responded quickly, kindly and professionally and took care of my concerns. I was so impressed with her punctuality and especially since I was to be a first time guest with no real gaming track record with MGM! What a great ambassador for MGM she is!  Thank you again Veronica Cruz. Once we got to he hotel there was an enormous line Sunday morning...many guests checking out. But there was cold fruit infused water stations for the guests, and staff checking with people in line and directing them to the next available desk clerk... this all looked to me like MGM actually cares about their guest...we appreciated it, and the line moved quite quickly. Once we approached the desk receptionist Marie... her bright smile and cheery demeanor immediately welcomed us. She called me by name, recognized our anniversary and had us checked in in moments...and even made sure we had just the view we wanted...she was another shining ambassador for MGM...Thanks again to Marie at the front desk!!  When we arrived to our room we found champagne waiting for us courtesy Marie and MGM !! The suite was delightful... large and light. Clean as a whistle too! All lamps and electronics worked fine as did the A\/C. Bed was exceptionally comfortable and I wanted to steal the down pillows.... they were PERFECT. I seriously want those pillows... The spa bathroom was wonderful. The bath products good as were the quantity and quality of the towels. Housekeeping came daily and did a fine job and we tipped them daily. Wifi worked fine. TV was nice with enough channels. The halls and all common areas were always clean. The common areas had a nice scent to them which I like when hotels do that.  The pool was fantastic. Plenty of seats..and yes the earlier you get there the better the selection. Loved the lazy river and variation of different pools. The drink service was fine.  The MGM features plenty of food options ranging from food court to high end more haute cuisne. We patronized the whole range believe me! There is also a nice little selection of gift, convienience shops which we also enjoyed. The location of the MGM is fine and close to NYNY, Aria, Excaliber etc...and we used the Monorail for further destinations. We enjoyed every single day of our stay... and as if the bottle of champagne we received from Marie at the the front desk wasnt kind enough... toward the end of our stay we received another anniversary gift bottle from concierge Veronica Cruz!!  I am sorry that this is so long.... I usually am not this wordy... But we were just so impressed and grateful to the MGM, Veronica , Marie and all the wonderful hotel staff for making our stay so memorable!!! I absolutely guarantee our return.... you really exceeded our expectations!

This isn't my first choice of hotels in vegas, but for the right price, it's my second or third....

Good:
Pools - amazing - lots of them, plenty of seats and a lazy river.
Lots of bars and restaurants - Wichcraft was nice and loved the convenience of McDonalds in the food Court
The Front Desk Manager - did a great job

BAD:
The rooms are definitely worn - the light was out in our bathroom - they did quickly change it.
Plumbing was weird - strange noises and slow drains

Make sure you text to the "Offers" number they display all over the property - you get 2 for 1 drinks, etc.

Not my style, but what might work for some is the all you can eat all day buffett offers - 29 bucks during the week - 40 I think on the weekends.

Have fun!

We decided on a spur-of-the-moment trip to Vegas for my birthday because I really wanted to see Ka. Since we were going for less than 24-hours we decided to stay at the MGM Grand for convenience. Our room was nice looking but there was a disgusting sulfur smell coming from the bathroom area and the shower drain did not drain well. We would have requested a room move if had been in our room longer but considering the trek from the lobby to the room, we decided to turn the fan on and leave the doors closed. I won't stay here again.

Bought a deal to take wide to Vegas for her birthday and he MGM is as great place to stay.   We had a grand king room which was very nice and comfortable and was recently updated.  There are plenty of food choices.  Our hotel deal included two buffets and we went to the champagne brunch buffet which was very good.  We also dined at Craftsteak a nice steakhouse. The food there was a bit pricey but very good.  The pool area is huge and has a lazy river, which is where we camped for a more relaxed atmosphere

I was appalled at how I was treated by MGM Grand. I was disappointed by the hotels service at every turn of my experience. My husband and I arrived on Valentine's Day to check into our hotel at 6:30pm. After waiting 20 minutes in line and then another 10 minutes for the rep to go talk to the manager, she finally informed us that our room (a celebrity spa suite) was not available. She offered to put us in a bungalow suite (TBD on whether this room was of equal or better value than what we booked and paid for), but that it wouldn't be ready for at least an hour. To her credit, she did offer us $100 credit in food\/beverage at the hotel but since I was there for a conference, most of my food was already covered either by conference meals or expensable by work. But whatever... Since we didn't have a room to change, we were forced to change in the bathroom and check our bags with the bell hop in order to get to our dinner reservation on time (which also couldn't be cancelled since it was Valentine's Day). She rep promised that they would call me once our room was ready, but 4 hours later, we still hadn't received any call, so I called them only to be told that it still wasn't ready. It was 10:30pm at that point, and I had an early morning conference to get to. After some arguing it was discovered (after being on hold for 15 min and having to wait another 10 minutes for them to call me back) that the room was ready, it just wasn't showing as ready in their system. 

So we finally get into our room at 11pm. We decide to order room service in advance for breakfast the next morning, but the phone in our room doesn't work, so I call the hotel on my cell. But they refuse to take my order since I haven't called them on an in-hotel phone. We sit on hold for several minutes while we argue with the manager (again) that all we want to do is order breakfast for the next morning and go to bed. Finally, they're able to accommodate  us, but only after they put us on hold 3 times and disconnected us twice.

Luckily in the morning the food arrived on time (15 min early, actually) and they replaced our phone. Great to finally have something go right! 

That night, we decide to order breakfast in advance again. We wait on hold for room service for 5 minutes and then the man who takes our order is rude and insists that the Grand Breakfast only comes with your choice of pork or chicken sausage OR bacon OR ham -- despite the fact that the menu states (quoting word-for-word), "pork or chicken sausage, bacon or grilled ham" and the night before we'd ordered pork sausage and bacon. After 15 minutes of arguing, they finally consented but insisted we were wrong and the in-room dining captain we'd ordered from the night before was wrong in giving us that. At this point, we're arguing on principle. If you only get the choice of one meat instead of two, maybe they should change the wording on the menu? 

What's the most frustrating is that throughout the entire process, I think we only heard one single apology. At every other encounter with a an employee we heard arguing and disdain. I work in customer service and know full well what a difficult job it is, but I've also learned that a sincere apology will go a long way. 

Needless to say that we'll never be staying here again an will actively recommend that our friends and co-workers (I work for an airline) stay far, far away.

I really do not know why MGM has employed Security officers when they are clearly not interested in Securing anything. My friend and I stayed at the MGM the pass weekend (23-25 Sep 2016) and on first arrival we noticed how rundown the place looked. I was expecting a lot more for the money we paid and for how it is advertised as a luxury resort. The carpet is dirty, some slot machines were not working...the food was horrible(Except the pizza place in the Underground). My friend forgot her toothpaste and ended up paying $9.00!!! for a small tube of Crest at the gift shop...talk about your rip off...the Security guards are more interested in trying to get your number than securing the building. We came in one night after a night out on the town to discover our key no longer worked. No wanting to be left alone on a deserted looking floor my friend called security to come up so she could go to the guest services for another key....Security reply was "we'll get to you when we get to you"...what kind of service is that??...Needless to say this is my first and last time staying here.....
Where in the heck happened to the ventilation??? If you don't smoke, definitely don't come here. OMG. I thought I was in a weed house minus the weed. Way too much smoke!!

Back in September I visited the Wet Republic Ultra Pool establishment at the MGM Grand and signed for a $1100.00 tab and the waitress fraudulently signed my name for me and a $400.00 tip. Be careful spending your money here and with the Mgm grand.

Overall great hotel! Stayed for 4 nights from Thursday to Monday with 4 ladies in our mid 20s. Houses many high quality restaurants and entertainment\/stores namely the Cirque du Soleil "KA" production, Hakkasan night club, Wet Republic and a Michelin Star(Joel Robuchon) restaurant-so there is much to do without leaving the hotel which is great and extremely convenient. Many of the top DJs also play at Hakkasan and Wet Republic so this is a very attractive perk to those interested! They also had a very nice pool with multiple pools, lazy river, lane swimming, bar and many areas where you can relax in the sunshine listening to music. Rooms were clean and well styled with a modern feel. The negatives of this hotel is that this hotel is located near the end of the strip, which meant spending money on cabs if you don't want to walk in the heat for over 10 min to the centre of the main strip. Another interesting point is that they turned off the running water right at 12pm (check out time) which meant no running faucets\/toilets-not sure if this was the hotel encouraging us to leave or if it was accidental! Overall, I will definitely stay at this hotel again!

I just had a convention here for my company, second time here and boy are my stays consistent. TV always loses signal, room is too hot, none of the staff follow through with what they say they'll do. That's probably the worst of it. I booked an extra 2 nights after the convention, next year I'm switching hotels. I hear my companies contract is close to ending with them. *crossing my fingers*

I will never stay in these hotels ever again. I have to pay to park when I stay at my hotel!? Are you serious? Whoever the genius was who thought of that should be fired immediately. I will take my business else where. Bad over priced hotel rooms and I have to pay to park. No thank you!

Wow talk about Vegas fever, we just got back home and we're already thinking about planning our next Vegas getaway! My boyfriend and I were in town for Yelp Spring Break and decided to stay at the MGM one night and at another M Life partner the other two nights. What were we thinking?!? The lavishness of the rooms and VIP treatment made us feel like so special it made me wonder "Who IS this guy (my bf)?" We arrived at the MGM 3 hours prior to check in and were initially told a room was reserved for us but not ready yet. Shortly after a quick call and a click of a button we were told a room was available and we could head on up! Score! The room was very free and clean (without any weird scents) nicely designed and the bed and pillows were super comfy. We spent a couple hours at the pool. There were a lot of people there so it took a while to find two open seats but it was prime pool time. Staff was friendly and available if you had any questions or wanted to buy drinks. Later that night when my boyfriend and I returned to the room we were surprised to find a welcome card on a tray with a bottle of complimentary champagne, desserts and Figi water. Wow! Neither of us had ever gotten this kind of treatment before. As we stared at the tray wondering why we were delivered such an awesome welcome package we heard a knock at the door and looked at each other wondering who it could be. Housekeeping had come to deliver robes and fuzzy slippers! We felt so VIP we didn't know what to do! We've stayed at at least 5 different hotels in Vegas in the past 2 years and MGM has now become one of our favorites. We've got out M Life club cards, I'm sure we'll be returning to Vegas again soon and MGM will be our hotel of choice.

Stayed in a basic King room.  Nothing super fancy, but it was very clean and very well kept.  We didn't use the room much anyway, but I would have no problem paying for the accommodation again.  Hotel and casino are quite large, takes a day to find your way around but you eventually get the hang on it.  It's easy to connect to the hotels right next door and across the street (Trop, NY NY, Luxor).

We went to the pool and lazy river on two of the days we were there.  Pool was well kept and very scenic.  I'm not even much of a pool person anyway, as I don't like laying around but I even enjoyed this.  Tubes cost $16 dollars to rent. Save your money.  You can just walk the lazy river, or most of the time when people leave the pool for the day they will give their tubes away.  You can take food and drink into the pool, just no glass bottles.  We bought some sandwiches and frozen drinks and took them down to the pool as pool prices were more expensive.  There is a frozen drink stand on the walk to the pool.  You can buy the yardstick drink and take it in with you, and then take it back later for $11 refills.  Just requires a bit of extra walking.

Casino is average.  It's a casino, so it does what it is supposed to do. Entertain you and collect your money.  If you like vintage things, there is a Sigma Derby (one of only two that I think are in the city) buried in the slot machines near the sports book.  It's an old horse racing game where plastic horses race around the track and you bet quarters (yes, real quarters) on which horses will come in first and second.  It's a goofy way to spend an hour with $20 bucks if you are looking for something different or something cheap and entertaining to pass the time.

Most of the food is pricy for what it actually is.  I'm not a high end foodie, but even some of the regular sandwich shops had just average food for what they charged. Nothing that blew my socks off.  Out the back doors (red doors) of the west wing bar, there is a little market store where you can but drinks, booze to go, and snacks for your room pretty cheap.

Overall, if I ever land in Vegas again I would not hesitate at all to head back to the MGM.

I don't know why I gave this place a second chance. Overrated and definitely overpriced (even before you tack on the ridiculous  $30+ per night "resort fee"). Both times I have stayed here, the customer service during check-in was abysmal. In the room, we requested a blanket that never arrived, the toilet paper dispenser was broken, and the walls are paper thin. They block out NO sound and it is very hard to get any sleep--yes, some people do try to sleep in Las Vegas. All night and day, the door to the room would shake and rattle, as if someone were wrapping loudly. And at all hours I could hear the lady next door hacking up a lung, watching TV, etc. I promised myself  last time I wouldn't come back, this time I intend to nake good on it. When I want to spend a lot of my hard-earned money in Vegas, I'll stick to the far-more impressive Venetian.

Let me start by saying that i wish i could give them negative stars...

FIRST when we checked in and went into our room there was CRUSTED BLOOD on our freakinh sheets...so the cleaning people obviously do not change sheets in between the guests which is beyond disgusting. Not to mention they failed to tell me when i booked our room that we also had to have an extra 100 bucks for the depostot along with the 25 dollar charge which i figured out.

Second it took me contacting not only the frot desk to have our nasty sheets changed and waiting about an hour, but i had to go downstairs and track down a manager to comp me for their mistake. Then checkout was a nightmare because i had to wait in line for an hour to make sure they used the $75 credit she gave me and sure enough they did not and i had to fight with the guy to removed what she had promised.

Finally the day after checkout, i checked my bank statement and an extra $50 is missing from my account on the card i only used for my deposit. I got my full deposit back and at the time the money was taken we were in a friends room getting ready for a wedding..i talked to 3 different people over the past few days and none know where this charge came from and the hotel has no record. One tried to tell me if i went to a bar or resteraunt (which not only did i not go anywhere but what do you buythat is $50 flat..) then the accounting lady which i had to wait 3 days to talk to due to the holiday, had no idea what the description even meant. Then of course, the system went down and she couldnt tell me more. So now i have to go back to the hotel and fight to get my money back!

I will NEVER EVER IN A MILLION YEARS stay here again. Im so disappointed with my whole experience...

Aging casino...not much flair... The smell is atrocious, you can tell they are trying to cover up years and years of heavy smoking... Just replace the carpets already. I wasn't impressed with the MGM but their new swanky hakkasan club and the amazing pool with lazy river makes almost makes me want to stay here to gain access. Seriously just not what a casino should be like at this point in time, with places like the Aria and Cosmopolitan practically next door... MGM needs to do some updating.
I love the west wing rooms, very clean and modern. Great restaurants and clean casinos. I wish they had an entertaining lounge with music and dancing.

Never stayed here before. Stayed for the rodeo and it was a blast! The restaurants were great, casino floor was fun, and all of the staff were helpful and kind. The room was good, nothing amazing but clean, comfortable bed, and a good shower. We stayed in the Grand Tower, as we were told to avoid the West Tower as the rooms are small. I'm glad we switched. We'll stay here again at some point.

ok. here we go.

My First time in Vegas last June, we stayed in MGM. when we arrived there, one of the check-in clerks was pretty rude ( maybe she was on her period) she made some comment and my friend ( who needs to learn to keep that NY "IDGAF" attitude back home) my friend started going off! way to start a vacation right, smh.

you will see why i gave it 4 stars.

after going out the first night, we come back to the hotel room and realized the there was a leak in the shower that came onto the carpet that is between the wall and the bed closest to the bathroom. called front desk and they had a bell hop come grab our luggage and take us to another room. (mind you its like 5 am) we go through employee elevators and into a room that was FILTHY! bed was made, garbage everywhere! we were pissed. so we call again, and they bring us into room #3! it seemed fine. i was wrong. the shower had a leakage and our floor was all wet in the bathroom. i went to the front desk and they told us an engineer would go fix it. and gave us 1 night off! woot woot! 

then, we went out the next night, and guess what . the faucet was leaking! and ruined all our makeup! we were beyond upset!

i went down to the manager and had a big talk about our entire experience. i didnt yell , but he can tell i was upset and it was really just RIDICULOUS. he was like "oh im from NY too! imma hook u guys up since its your last night here" he gave us 100 dollars room service and upgraded us to a BEAUTIFUL 2 BEDROOM SUITE WITH PANORAMIC VIEWS OF THE STRIP. 

so one night off, room service and a great upgrade, not bad. :)

My gf and I have been here 4 days and overall we've had a great time! 
The service was great when we ordered in,we were given free passes to Hakassan club  & the front desk was prompt when we needed anything. 
I recommend MGM and would come back...:)

I lost my car keys at MGM...and I cannot express enough how helpful and absolutely wonderful the Lost & Found staff were as well as security.  They comforted me when I was an absolute wreck, and were such a support as I was panicking.  They were completely professional but also very compassionate and so willing to go out of their way to help.  Security Officer Marcus Morrison was the best help I could ask for.  He did everything he could for me and seriously gave me the best service I've ever had at any hotel.  They ultimately found my keys the next day and Officer Morrison was able to give them to me himself.  I was so thrilled...not just with the find but with the overall experience and how the staff especially Officer Morrison treated me and my situation.  
Officer Walker in Security also was such an incredible help to me and truly assisted me with such professionalism and a genuine will to help me out.  
I live in Vegas...but if I were to use a hotel I would pick MGM just based on how gracious the staff was to me.  I am truly thankful.  THANK YOU Officer Morrison, Officer Walker, and staff!!

Always staying at this place during SEMA show.
They completely remodeled everything! No more old Hollywood type pictures, all modernized now.

It definitely went through a great makeover. The rooms..everything was nice. 

Customer service was fantastic. 

Can I just tell you all my story? I almost won a million fackin' dollars. I was literally about |   | that close to winning! Just those little spaces right there. SO DAMN CLOSE. Thought I was going to have a damn heart attack! Won 35 dollars instead :'[ 

Anyway..the little mart inside is overly-priced of course. But, I'm glad that the cashier helped me. 
She told me the cheaper options of razors compared to the ridiculously expensive ones. Thanks guuurl.

R U Kidding me? We just spent 3 nights at MGM not so grand. The first night the ac wasn't working which they took care of. 2nd night problem free. Came back to a sewer smell on day 3. Housekeeping put deodorizer in all drains and air freshener spray everywhere. They said this is a problem they have when it's hot. Nice, it's always hot in Vegas!  Problem also reported to engineering. Came back from dinner and the smell was back. We asked to be moved and they gave us a room on bottom floor next to elevator. Asked for help moving as it was 10 pm. Nope. Then the key didn't work, so I left my wife with luggage to wait in hallway as I made 10 minute walk to get hers fixed and 10 minutes back. I will never set foot on this property again and don't think anyone else should. Very poor customer service

My wife, daughter and I stayed here over the Easter weekend.  We had a nice room (I tried the $20 trick, and was 'upgraded' to high floor view room).  I know others have complained about the non-flat screen tvs in the room but honestly we didn't turn the tv on for more than 15 minutes during the whole trip.  When not in use it was tucked neatly away in the cabinet. Not a big deal.  We ate in GREAT restaurants at the MGM and spent our days at the lazy river part of the pool, which was really fun.  My only concern that kept this from a 4 star rating was the mis-information we got at the concierge desk.  We were in town to see the Lion King at Mandalay Bay (fantastic!), and I thought it would be cool to see and hopefully hold one of the MGM lion cubs.  I had read on-line that this was a possibility for a fee and a long wait.  We waited about 15-20 at the concierge desk to be helped and while in line another hotel employee approached the growing crowd waiting for the concierge and asked if we had a question she could answer.  I asked about having our daughter's picture taken with a lion cub and she said that they used to do that, but that the cubs were too big now.  Disappointed we walked away and decided to go check out the adult lion exhibit.  I asked the young woman working in the gift shop about the lion cub photo opportunity and she said, "sure, just get here before 11:00 tomorrow!".  We did, and my wife and daughter waited in a line for about 75 minutes before their "once in a life time opportunity" to pet a lion cub and have their picture taken.  Glad we didn't listen to the concierge!?!

The recently updated room is sleek, modern, and comfortable.
Pros:
1. Comfortable bed
2. Electric blinds with blackout or sheer option
3. Spacious bathroom
4. Cleaning staff was friendly 

Cons:
1. Most of the eateries are overpriced
2. There is a mandatory $28 resort fee that includes super slow wi-fi. It took forever to load web pages such as Facebook
3. The cardio room is small and needs AC (had a musty odor)
4. Tried to call the front desk on the morning of checkout and was on hold for more than 10 minutes and no one ever answered the phone-wth
5. If you check in early, they charge you an extra $20 (this is complimentary at other hotels)
6. Not much kid friendly things besides the pool
7. The "special" deal we got came with 2 free buffet passes however when you check in, the lady at the front desk didn't even mention that to us. I had to ask then she said its ONLY good for breakfast which is 7-10 a.m. It's Vegas!! Who likes to get up early?
8. No refridgerator to store your drinks.

Overall, my room was nicely furnished but this is not a family friendly hotel. There is nothing for kids to do here beside the pool. I have no plans to come back. Check out other hotels first.
You can lost in this place. For the most part, nice but showing sides of age. My room had a huge armoire & no flat screen tv. Like I said, very nice but becoming dated.

Great rooms. Great service. Great location. 

It was nice having the monorail station located inside the hotel. McDonald's is open all night. It is a large building so it is easy to get a little confused on the direction you should be walking. But it probably didn't help being a bit intoxicated. 

I would definitely stay there again.

Not only do the charge you to valet ($13 for the first four hours and then $18 after that) they are understaffed inside and out and the staff they have working are rude. Takes over 1\/2 an hour at minimum to get car. No thanks!

Most of the hotel staff is amazing - particularly restaurants, bell hop, taxi area, and stores. Over the top awesome. But I do have a huge issue with how a complaint was dealt with ... I was there for a business conference alone, my door lock was busted. I alerted the floor manager I was not comfortable not having this lock in place, particularly being alone - she acknowledged and understood. Never followed up and I was at all day conferences. This is not okay. WiFi in rooms is very poor (I have at&t). You'll burn through data.

Stayed here for 2 nights (8\/11 & 8\/12) and loved it! This was my second stay at the MGM grand and I'll definitely keep coming back. This hotel has got it ALL! Amazing pool and lazy river, various dining & shopping options, entertainment, gambling, spas, easy access to the monorail, right next to the airport, clean rooms, friendly service... What more could you ask for?

THE POOLS - I think they have 4 or 5 pools (including wet republic), the main pool\/river being their best. Not too many kids around which is nice. If you plan to stay for a few days, buy the 24 oz plastic cup at the pool for cheaper refills. The cup and your first drink is $25 and refills are $18. YES, it expensive... but you're in Vegas at a legit pool, so get over it and enjoy yourself! 

THE ROOMS - Get a tower room! Easy in and out and the elevators are quick, you rarely have to wait even a minute. The rooms themselves are large, clean and the beds are heavenly. My husband had to pry me out of bed each day. TIP: Even if you get in early on your arrival day, be sure to check in when you get there. If its not a Saturday, they are likely to have your room ready early. We got there at 10am and was able to check in and head to our room! If your room isnt ready, you can still check in and your key will be activated as soon as your room is ready. There is an area to check your bags (free) and you'll get pool access too :) They make it easy for ya!

DINING\/SHOPPING - MGM Grand offers everything you need. From a quick slice of pizza to Michelin dining, they have it all! Pub food, mexican, italian, asian, buffet, seafood, etc. You wont be disappointed. I especially love Wolfgang Puck B&G which is open till 6am. Gnocchi at 4am post clubbing?!? ugh yes please! 

MONORAIL - If you haven't been to vegas you'll learn very quickly that walking places (such as from hotel to hotel) is not favorable or comfortable when its 105 degrees out. This is where the monorail comes in. MGM conveniently has a stop in the hotel (in the underground area). You can buy a one way pass, daily pass or multi day pass. I recommend getting a pass for the number of days you'll be staying. Say you want to go to Caesar's Palace... its over a mile away (25\/30 minute walk) and by cab would cost you approx. $10-13 each way. You can get an unlimited day pass for $12 on the monorail and the trains come every 7 minutes ( it runs till 2am). Granted, it doesn't take you directly to each hotel, but it gets you close enough. 

P.S. If you're there on a Thursday night you can likely get in free to Hakkasan (the night club). There are promoters offering tickets in the main lobby area.

We stayed here for the NYE 2013\/ 2014. When we walked into the room we found stains on the comforter and a dirty bathroom.  The day before we left no one came to clean our room.  When we came back we had to call twice and wait until close to midnight before someone came by.  The front desk was very unhelpful with the situation amd wanted to blame us for the mishap.  We will not be booking with the MGM again.

this was once my favorite place to stay on the strip. 

they casino it's self is so enormous you really never have to leave if you don't want to....i guess that was their point. there are so many restaurants, activities, shows, bars, clubs, casino machines, lions, buffet, pools....you could make it a city on it's own! 

the rooms are so\/so, but who really cares when you're there to do stuff. on the last day of our trip i was so tired i just watched the lions for a long time. it was a nice way to detach from the loud casino noises and smoke. 

3 stars for mgm giving horrible offers lately and not helping a sister out when she was so loyal!

The only thing I will mention... the walls are very, VERY thin. I hear you room next door sounding like y'all keep stubbing your toe over and over again. ‍

Updated: Check in was easy, and the staff is courteous. You can tell that this hotel is getting older (peeling wall paper, etc.). We stayed in the Grand tower which was fine, but dark, so I can't imagine how dingy the West Wing must be. Location of the hotel however is fantastic and I love all the activities they have right downstairs. New game area is a fun way to relax during the day. Our room seemed very clean. The only thing that was a pain is there is no fridge or coffee maker in the room.

I stayed at this hotel over the past weekend. VERY BAD DECISION!!!!!!Before arriving I was told that I had to pay $280.00 as a deposit for the hotel but I would get that back when I checked out. When arriving I was told that was just part of the fee and I would have to pay the remaining balance. Which was like 500 and something. So I paid that amount no problem. When I got off the elevator my impression of this hotel was a total disaster. The carpet was horrible and that was only the beginning. I opened the door which was filthy only to enter the room and it looked gross. The carpet was dirty, it was dark, the sink was dirty and I was totally upset. I called the front desk and they gave me another room. Only this was on a different floor. This one was even worse. The room number was slanted and it stunk in the room. At this point I was furious and wanted my money bk but was told that I couldn't get a refund because I had already checked in. So I talked to 2 different managers all which told me there was nothing they could do about it because the west wing is what I reserved. I had no idea it looked like I was staying at a motel 6. This is not what I was expecting from the mgm. So finally I just went to the front desk with all of my stuff one of the managers told me I could upgrade for an additional $30 per night for the grand towers. Reminding you that over the phone they told me it was nothing they could do. At this point I'm really still just wanting my money back. I've stayed at treasure island before and it was 10x better than this. I'm very disappointed that I spent a total of $906 dollars on my entire stay. Oh and the manager laughed at me when I told them the room looked like shit. His response was yeah it is the oldest and it was last updated in 2008. Well I was not impressed at all and I'm glad he thought it was funny. I was next to another family and they were pissed as well and they were told that there were no more rooms available but clearly that was a lie and the managers seem to like playing games with people and their money. I will never stay here again. This was the worst experience I've ever had here.
Sorry for such a long complaint but I think you all deserve to know what you're getting yourself into at mgm grand before spending your money.

The Grand is a great value if you book with a promotional code.  I don't regret staying here at all, but there are a few things that bugged me that will lead me to shell out some more money for a newer hotel next time I go to Vegas.

- They ran out of the room I requested, so I had to negotiate for a cheap upgrade to a suite.  I know this happens all the time, but it still pisses me off.  
- Casino is pretty smoky, not necessarily because people are actively smoking but probably because it's an older casino.  It definitely isn't as bad as others. 
- No thermostat in the room.  You could adjust the fan to "on or off" and "heat or cold".  Basically you were either hot or it was painfully dry in the room.  
- The showers in my room can't vary the level of water pressure.  Not everyone likes their water to shoot out at full speed!  I had no problem, however, with getting hot water. 
- Last, but not least, the walls are VERY VERY thin.  I could hear my neighbor's conversations.

One tip -- because the Grand is on one end of the Strip, I'd recommend buying a Monorail pass for a day w\/ unlimited rides if you know you're going to be going back and forth from the Grand to other parts of the strip.  

http:\/\/www.lvmonorail.com\/

On the 20th floor. Was lying in bed reading when I heard something strange. Got up to investigate & the roof was dripping water. Called down TWICE, & NO ONE EVER CAME! Have since found out there are ONLY TWO Maintenance Workers for 5000 ROOMS! Dangerous! Would not let me attach video. Mmmmmm

Overall, the it wasn't a bad stay.  The redesigned rooms are modern and clean.  Wifi connection was a bit sketchy from where we were staying.  I would have given this place 4 stars.  Except that on check out, they got the billing wrong.  I cannot stand hotels that get the billing wrong.  They charged for 2 nights when the hotel was already prepaid.

nice
clean
nothing really special
it was nice to walk downstairs and see the lions
big room even with an extra cot in it
big bathroom

Reviewing the petite king:
The check in was painful with a guy in training who was acting like a used car salesman. ugh...
The room is well not that petite but very dark. Barely no natural light. NO FRIDGE are you kidding me???? In the US???
The restroom door made such a noise we had to leave it open in the night or we would have woken up the neighbors. 
The hallway was so longggggg.
The talent pool: The service there was ridiculous. Waited like 20\/25 mins after ordering a drink. That's unacceptable. 
$16 for a water doghnut??? 
Will not go back for sure...
Oh bedding was outstanding I must say
The worst hotel I have ever lived. If there is a negative score. I definitely will give negative score. Checkin took forever and two bottle water cost $14 which outside is only 3.

I've got to say, I was a little apprehensive that Vegas would be a bit tacky and possibly a bit too 'in your face' for me but after staying in the MGM I truly loved the place! The hotel was beautiful, sheek, well laid out and the rooms were stunning with fantastic views. I found American service left much to be desired in many places but every place I visited in the MGM the service was friendly and much faster! I was pleasantly surprised that regardless of allowing smoking the casino maintained a clean, clear atmosphere unlike a few others sadly. The facilities available were great athough I didn't get the chance to use them all! Would definately reccomend this place and hope to stay again soon!

Ok.  You have to know what you're getting into when you stay here.  This is a mid range hotel.  It's at the far end of the strip but it does have a monorail stop so you can pretty easily get around if you need to.  The casino is huge and you're probably going to get lost in it the first few times you visit.  The crowd here is mixed but during summer when we stayed here it was a lot of college age kids.  It's a fun place to stay.  But it's loud.  All the time.  

We stayed in one of the suites and we had a huge room (comparable to some of The Venetian suites) and a huge bathroom.  The room had a king bed and huge windows with views of McCarren airport and the desert.  The living room area was nice enough but the only weird thing is that there was one tube tv that simply swiveled around so you could have it face the bedroom area or the living room area.  That's kind of ridiculous in this day and age and for the price you'll pay for a suite.  

The bathroom was large with lots of mirrors, a stand alone shower, and a jacuzzi tub.  We didn't have any noise complaints but our room was at the far end of the hallway away from the elevators so that could be why.  

We stayed here in July of 2010 and the pool area was so much fun.  Lots of different pools, and a lazy river.  They want you to pay to rent inner tubes or buy them but if you go down to the pool in the afternoon you can always snatch one that drunk people have left behind.  The lazy river is fun but gets kinda gross as the day goes on and starts getting littered with Bud Light lime cans.  It's kinda like being at a big frat party which is fine because you're in Vegas.  Good music, good drinks, good times.

We visited the pool area yesterday and it was amazing! Couple different pools, lazy river, and trees all around! We spent the majority of our time the lazy river, which my two year old loved! The water was clean, the waterfalls were fun, but their was trash on poolside of the lazy river all the way. Ppl setting their empty alcoholic beverages down. I watched workers clean it up throughout the day, but boy o boy does it build up fast! Other than that it was an amazing time!

I have stayed here several times and loved the service. This last time, we checked in and got the key to our room we found  "guests" still in the room smoking in a non smoking room and waiting for the bus boy to arrive for pick up. We had to wait in the casino until the staff cleaned up the mess! This is not acceptable with an MGM property. The management did issue me and the wife a coupon for the buffet for the convenience, but still disappointed.

I stayed there 3 nights with family on a sort of reunion.  We stayed last time at the Venetian, but I chose the MGM Grand as other reviews said the pool scene was great.  Yuck.  Check in was a snarl of desks with a crowd in front of each one - no order or lines.   Rooms are a few miles away from the front desk - no problem, but the room was not right, which necessitated another trip down to the front desk crowd (to be fair I did have the option of waiting 35 minutes for a bellman)  Room rates on the website are comparable to other hotels - but when you get there, EVERYTHING but the air is $25 extra.   Add all of the charges and you not only feel ripped off but poorer.

We booked a cabana at the pool - Cabana is an optimistic idea for a little curtain and some stained furniture.  My quoted rate was a $400 minimum of food and drink - the posted rate was $600, going up to $800 on weekends.  Lackluster ordinary food was delivered by a nice waiter who also brought towels (gee, no $25 charge for those), but 7 of us found it tough to drink that much in the middle of the day.  

Breakfast was a mall style food court where we had the choice of Nathans, McDonalds, or Starbucks -  On Friday, a group of conventioneers arrived, and the hotel did not provide a separate room for their breakfast -- so they were all in line at the various breakfast venues - making the wait from 30 - 45 minutes.  

UNBELIEVABLY LOUD AND HORRIBLE MUSIC PLAYED ABSOLUTELY EVERYWHERE BUT IN OUR ROOMS - IN THE FOOD COURT, THE RESTAURANTS, THE POOL.    TWO DAYS LATER I AM STILL KIND OF DEAF.  

Maybe celebrities and reality stars get treated well here, but I would not recommend it to anyone else.

Paid 283.00 for a room in the west wing , went to the room all the way at the end of the tunnel(long walk ) wall paper changed and looked very dirty. Once I opened door  the smell was horrible. Housekeeping left a open soap on the sink. Went to front desk and they said that was what I paid for, which is not true because my sister paid for the same thing and they received better rooms. Ended up paying for an upgrade to the north tower and although it was better ROOM , the room was still dusty but I dealt with it since  it was not compared to the west wing.  I would not stay here again for 300.00 +18 valet per night Not worth the money !

Oh dear - where to begin.  

Check in was fairly smooth because we have the Mlife Gold Card and had a much shorter line.  The regular line was extremely long.

Check in was very unmemorable except when we asked for a complimentary upgrade, which comes with the Gold Card, and she quickly responded with "not for 3 nights".  She didn't even look.   We wrote it off as she already checked before.  She also didn't really give directions to our room so we had to ask someone as we got closer to the elevators.  Even then we had to work to flag someone down as the 3 people behind the counter seemed more interested in whatever conversation they were having than helping us.  This place is HUGE so it's easy to get turned around.  Finally figured out there's only one major bank of elevators for the main towers.

Our room was a different story.  After just settling in, I notice the carpet was dirty and didn't look like it was vacuumed.  Next, the bed had hair under the pillow!  When we called to complain, they only offered to change the sheets for us.  We then noticed it didn't appear to have been dusted either.  After that, we decided to go down to the desk and ask for a different room.   

Well, we got our different room, and it was an upgraded room.  WAIT A MINUTE?!?  There wasn't any upgraded rooms available an hour ago.  Hmmmm.   This particular front desk employee was super nice and extremely apologetic.  Much better than the first one.

The new room was clean.  The upgrade was a strip view which was nice.  Turns out it's right next to the housekeeping prep room so we heard them setting up in the AM and also occasionally using the room at night.  

The USB charger port in the room was broken.  You couldn't even plug anything to charge.  Luckily I had my own power strip \/charger.  

On day 2, when we returned from a day on the strip and the thermostat was set to 85!  That's a little warm.  We tried to turn it down, but even 68 was still blowing hot air.  Another call to the front desk.  

Well they fixed it all right, this time only cool air came out.  It wasn't A\/C cool, more like the heat was turned off and just the air was coming through.  Luckily the beds kept up warm as it was down to the low 40's\/upper 30's that night.  

From a gambling perspective, if you like table games, min bet at night goes up to $25 for blackjack, $15 for others like 3 Card Poker.  The food court is nice but busy.  McD's and the Pizza place are open later.  Note these places are more like airport prices.  The pizza place was $9 for a slice and drink.   It was nice to have choices like this though.  A lot of the nicer hotels don't have 24 hour quick service restaurants.  

We did see KA which was amazing!  We also purchased a multi-day monorail pass for easy access to the center strip.  It was nice to walk across the bridge to New York, New York, and catch the tram to Mandalay Bay from the Excalibur. 

Overall, we might return here, but there are better locations and service elsewhere on the strip.

So we decided to let a manger know about our experience as we checked out. We spoke to I believe he was African American, not sure, however we told him our situation.... Throughout the whole explanation of my experience he was very non chalant. No reaction, almost like a soldier...stone cold face, not a care in the world and I realized that about the customer service at the MGM, they seem to not care much about their guests. I will say he refunded only the first night, that was nice of him but he seemed uninterested in what I had to say. His apology was not sincere at all....MGM staff needs to do better with being more friendly especially Ken! Ken I found out that you ARE NOT the owner of the hotel.... Keep on dreaming buddy! Anyway, I will never stay at the MGM .

The MGM is a nice hotel and resort property - a great place to start if you're beginning your exploration of the nicer resorts and hotels in Vegas.  It's actually one of the better mid-level properties despite some minor frustrations you might encounter.  You will get a nice comfortable room on a property where something is always happening, but with year-round specials at the premier resorts, I'd explore options before making a decision.

Pros:
Nice room, clean and comfortable
Events and attractions
Cocktail waitresses
Pool area

Cons:
Inefficient check-in system
Unsympathetic floor manager

My last MGM experience began with a sour taste, but once I got past the horribly inefficient check-in, I settled down and enjoyed some of the amenities on the property.  It would be an understatement to call the registration process chaotic - they really need to create a system that doesn't stress out the folks waiting in line.  To make things worse, the floor manager was unsympathetic and totally useless.  When they couldn't find my reservation, she told me to go to the pay-internet station and search for the reservation, myself.  She did everything to avoid offering any customer service, and did everything to redirect the blame onto me.  If a person waits in the registration line for 30-45 minutes, the least you can offer is fake sympathy.  After being unable to retrieve the reservation, she "offered" me the walkup non-discounted rate...not even the internet rate or any manager's special.  

The rooms are actually nice: large enough, comfortable, clean - comparable to a nice Marriott or a simpler version of the regular guest rooms at the Bellagio.  The Pool area is large and provides multiple ways to enjoy the water and plenty of spaces to layout under the sun - I'm a sucker for a lazy river.  The waitresses around the pools ignore people they assume won't be ordering, but they were good about coming by once I started a tab.  I can't speak for all of them, but the cocktail waitresses (casino floor) that served me were some of the best in Vegas - friendly, came by often, remembered drinks, and attractive.  

The MGM is a good destination for any Vegas traveler except for those expecting a little more luxury or Vegas pizzazz.  In my opinion, the MGM fits somewhere right below the premier resorts (like the Wynn) and definitely above the likes of the Monte Carlo or Luxor.  Fortunately for Vegas travelers, the premier resorts run specials that bring their price point in line with the MGM's.  Don't forget, the MGM does offer some nice alternatives with the Signature and Skylofts - both offering a better check-in experience and level of service that is missing at the MGM.  If you do end up at the MGM, don't forget to walk around and take in the sites.

A very solid Vegas resort with plenty of attractions - if you can handle the initial chaos, you can expect a nice stay.  3.5 stars for the room and property, but 1.5 stars for the service.

Stayed here for a conference and was very pleased!

ROOM: Had a standard king room that was very large and comfy! Great value for the price.  LOVED the Jasmine scented toiletries! I can't take those that smell too strong but these were just perfect!  I had a nice strip view and at night, since the whole hotel is lighted green, it gave my room a nice green shade.  I have to agree with other reviews that the photos of dead celebrities on the wall were kinda creepy.

SERVICE:  Front desk was good (I'm in the service industry so I can be  biased).  Concierge was amazing!  I went twice and both associates were very friendly, efficient, patient and knowledgeable!  My housekeeper was great.  I left her a note along with a tip and she not only fulfilled my request but surprised me with more!

CONFERENCE CENTER: It was quite a walk from the hotel side, but hey, I guess that's just Vegas size.  All the meeting rooms I went into were in good condition (we were freezing in some, but I guess that's controllable ).  Food was decent.

ENTERTAINMENT & DINING: I liked the variety of show options available: KA by Cirque Du Soleil, a David Copperfield magic show and Crazy Horse (adult show).  I also liked the dining options: from Fancy Dandy Joel Robuchon to the typical Vegas buffet (and all in between: Starbucks, Tom Colicchio's craftsteak, Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill, lounges such as Tabu and Rouge, etc)

All in all, GREAT stay in a great hotel in a great location! Would totally go back!

I've stayed at MGM signature twice and was always pleased. This time stayed here with hopes of just being closer to the strip and casino. We stayed in the one bedroom tower. Which i was informed had spa tub but no it doesn't just separate shower and tub. Room is basic. The good thing is you do have two TV's during down time. But our one TV Never had a signal. I ignored it initially because we were in and out. However, i did call one night and was told someone would service us. Guess what we never saw anyone.

Nice room, nice hotel. Good service. They also have EXPRESS CHECKOUT - so you don't have to friggen wait on the 1st floor on your last day as you're in a rush to leave.

Insider's Tip: Wait until days before, and book from the website directly. Again, booking at the last minute is usually cheaper than booking ahead of time - don't ask me why.

We enjoyed our stay overall. However, we did have issues with the room being extremely warm at times  despite the air being low as it could go. We also had issues at certain times with the water backing up in the sink and having a sewage smell, we had no issues outside of the room. We enjoyed the lounge with a live dj nightly. This is a huge hotel with lots to do inside without having to venture out. Plenty restaurants, stores, and gambling!

I stood at the MGM during the St.Patricks Day weekend in the Tower Spa Suite. 

I understand some people are frustrated with paying a $25 a day resort fee but again it stated that I'd have to pay that on my hotels.com receipt so I can only be upset with myself.

The employees at the check in and check out desk were really friendly. I arrived 30min before check in time and they told me that they were going to rush for my room to be cleaned. By the time I made it to the Grand Tower entrance I called and my room was ready.

The room was very clean and neat for having to be rushed for a cleaning. Beautiful view and at night it was pretty to leave the curtains open while the green illuminated through the room.The curtains are operated by switches. FYI the couch turns into a sleeper sofa which helps if you have extra guests. The room is dim but not terrible to where you cant stand it. The bathroom has a jet tub and a single shower.

Our room did come with 2 free buffet tickets. However, I was upset to find out the buffet charges you then the hotel is suppose to reimburse you. I'm still waiting for my reimbursement and I checked out Tuesday today being Friday. 

The only place we ate here was late night at the Mcd's which seems to be popular lol.

I know my review may sound boring but its the straight truth.I saw all these negative reviews on MgM on Yelp and I was scared that I made the wrong hotel choice. But everything was fine. I'd have to say my favorite suite in vegas is still the standard suite at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay but even that had its cons with being far from the strip.

I came here with $400 and left with nothing. I went to the manager to complain but he was unsympathetic. I got to play some fun games but they would not return my deposit when I lost. This enrages me and I do not seek to return. Why, then, did I keep playing?? WHY?

i was seriously dissapointed here boys. the room was great .....that is when i got to my room after my epic journey overthere. i really liked the bathroom though i had a tv in there.also they told me i was getting a flatscreen but it was a tube place inside the wall. the waitresses in the bars were allways rude. when i order an ice tea that doesnt mean im going to jipp you on a tip. the only reason she got a dollar was because i always tip. and that was the first day.

The rooms are all reasonably priced. For checking in, the line can get pretty long, so being a Gold+ Mlife member comes in handy. And for the craps players, The tables are never too crowded, and there is a TV at the tables to watch sports.

Types of Rooms I've stayed in:
Grand King - Nice size space for a basic room
Tower Spa Suite - Was expecting a better layout of the room

All is not well in the Emerald City of Las Vegas. It seems that the nickel and dime mentality has settled in here leaving guests wondering what other unforeseen charges or overlooked amenities will be discovered.  I DO NOT recommend staying here. My friend and I have had too many unpleasant surprises in just two days. It is a shame really that a  prominent hotel like this has sunk to cheapness and frankly, some dishonesty thrown in. We are here attending a convention and the convention center itself has been wonderful. It is sparkling clean, with great meeting rooms and halls. Our time at the convention is enjoyable without a doubt. But then.....

Something is incredibly amiss at the hotel. The MGM is undergoing construction and that is part of the problem This is a BIG reason to avoid this place for now. Their website attempts to gloss over this fact. It says that the MGM is getting a "grand renovation" and then proceeds to tell you to check out what is new. Oh how exciting!  However, it isn't the kind of excitement you want; a letter placed on your bed, informing you to expect construction noise as well as the water supply being shut off on certain days. Why are guests paying $200 a night and being checked onto a floor where the water is being shut off? This is truly a first for me. For this incredible inconvenience (which you pay for) you receive a letter thanking you in advance for understanding the difficulties of renovating this hotel. They offer you a 15% discount on a future stay....WHAT!  After checking in and being encouraged to spend an additional $15 per day to experience the "grand renovation' experience, you get your water shut off and construction noise during the day! When I called guest services to ask for my 15% discount today, I was lectured on how unemployment is a problem and I should be glad that the hotel did not close to renovate. Can it get any more bizarre? Is there a Wizard behind a curtain spinning politically correct excuses in this Emerald City? Is this mega-million dollar corporation so greedy that it cannot absorb a few empty rooms?   How about closing one wing? How about honestly updating future guests on your website like other hotels do that there is construction going on and it may be noisy, and for this inconvenience we are offering a sale?  Is it because there is deeply planted nickel and dime antics going on? The strict mini fridge "touch it and you own it" rule, charging $50 per day if any personal items are found in this fridge(I guess rental fee added to $200?) , $10 fee for $80 ATM withdrawal, lack of in-room coffee maker, and mandatory resort fee of $25 per day, even though the "resort" pools and grounds are closed for the season, are all signs of a grand hotel where the customer comes last. Any good things about my stay? The hotel is clean and the staff is exceptionally pleasant, but one can hardly notice these things when one is staying in a hell of a renovation resort. We have 4 more days here. We will update you on whether the MGM Grand is Grand enough to discount our stay for this inconvenience of renovation,  or instead,  will be passing out complimentary construction hats.  Stay tuned, and stay away!

Worst hotel ive ever stayed in. I was given a code for 2 complimentary buffets, i had to contact the hotel to figure out why they hadnt added them to my itinerary. I had to email 4 different times because everyone would just give me a run around. I show up to check in, they say theres no note of it so theres nothing they could do. 

I called to ask if they have early check in they said no. We decided to play while we make time till check in and when we arrive what do you know - people are checking in early. 

We stayed in a grand king. To a view of some type of ac system i dont really know what it was but it was ugly. Atleast we got a tiny little glimpse of the monte carlo. We were stayin in the 12th floor room 125.

The room was eh no fridge no safe no coffee machine. I dont understand how a motel has more then this place...  Then you turned on the tv watch tv for about 15 min and you'd be hit with a message "signal lost" try again later or wait about 5 min for the signal to come back. 

At&t carriers you might as well have been stayin in a mine there was no signal at all.
