FREE WIFI!!!! (Ya right) Make sure you read the fine print they give you 3mgps free after that, they charged you. 

Parking was one of the worst ive ever had to deal with in vegas. Definately need valet at this place cuz its horrible. Monte carlo has by far the best one. 

Tv tells you how great they are with their fast check out. you can check out from your tv just press a button. Didnt work of course. 

Bottom line. I will NEVER stay in this place again.

What happened here? Used to be a great hotel with great service. Valet and self parking is now $18 and $10 a day. It used to be free. Took 15 minutes just to get valet. The line to check in is at least an hour and a half wait!

Giving 2 stars only because MOST of the staff were friendly. 

I had booked a room over the phone some time in advanced and specifically requested for a smoking room after the concierge offered a choice. When I arrived to check in I was asked if I wanted a smoking or non-smoking again, just to be told all the smoking rooms were booked but "to make up for it" the concierge told me he would put us close to an elevator so we could get back to the lobby to smoke. Got to the room which was indeed close to an elevator but had an unsightly view of rocks on a rooftop and green lights. 
I asked the concierge at the information desk if at any point I could switch to a smoking room and she recommended that I call during checkout the next morning to see if anything became available. 

My fiancé and I are chain smokers so we didn't spend much time in our room. At one point my fiancé forgot the card to the room and was locked out for an hour as I was asleep because he needed to go to the lobby to smoke. One staff member was kind enough to give him his phone so he could call me but I was out cold.

I called at 11 AM and nothing had opened up. I called again about an hour later and the gentleman was kind enough to offer to call as soon as a room became available. I called again a little over an hour later because we needed to meet with family and I had no intentions of spending my vacation playing the waiting game. The concierge told me there was nothing she could do for me and from what she was saying it appeared there was no note about giving me a call as soon as a room became available.

After spending time with family and touring the strip I came back to the information desk  hoping a miracle could happen and a room became available. The was a glimmer of hope as I saw her write down another room number, but after speaking with the housekeeping manager she told me nothing was available. 

I don't understand why an establishment would even offer a smoking or non-smoking option while booking the room if nothing is gonna be available. When I book a smoking room, I would hope a smoking room has been saved for me when I check in. Are those rooms just on a first come first serve basis? If so, why even tease the guest by offering it while booking the room? I also find it hard to believe that out of the several hundred people that checked out, no smoking rooms became available at any of the times I called.

I have stayed at the MGM Grand twice, the first trip we stayed in the Bungalow Suites... which was pretty nice. This last trip we stayed in the West Wing. 

The rooms are tiny and you can hear every little noise the neighbor makes. The hallways are weird and the placement of the rooms is odd. When we checked in one of the lights in the room was out and they had to come fix it.

The only thing I really liked about the room was the stand up shower with the dual shower heads, and the frosted glass. It's the right environment for the kinkier couples ;)

The room feels dated and biggest let down of all NO REFRIGERATOR!!!! That alone has me never coming back.

The MGM Grand itself is fantastic but if it means staying in the West Wing again, then I will not be back.

So this is my first review but I'll make it as short and sweet and helpful as I can. MGM Grand is definitely a place that I'll come back to in the future. Hotel staff was very friendly, lag time is short when you're waiting for the cocktail waitress (unlike at the Luxor). Rooms were very nice, comfy bed and just enough space for 2 people (petite king room). Kind of odd that for the standard room, it lacks a refrigerator. But then again I heard you get ridiculously charged for moving the in room goodies in the fridge so maybe it's better that I didn't have to worry about tampering with anything. 

Champagne brunch buffet was awesome. Great food and all the champagne or mimosa that you want. Breakfast buffet was decent, nothing too special for the price. Speaking of food, there's a ton of options here at the hotel. Sushi, fine or casual dining, quick eats and of course Starbucks. I didn't have a chance to check out the clubs, but all of the bars seem really chill and have a good vibe.

On a side note, I recommend seeing KA by Cirque de soleil while staying here. Great storytelling and the stunts and visuals were amazing. It was my first time seeing anything by Cirque de soleil so I was very impressed. Also, you can usually get complimentary tickets depending on your package deal. Doing some research while planning a vegas trip can save you a lot of money and you can get some pretty sweet deals. FYI, there's a $25 per night resort fee that's usually not included in hotel and flight packages.

Overall this was a great hotel. Only cons for me was that fat Tuesdays was closed for remodeling, the lion habitat is either gone or is also being remodeled (construction on the west wing), and for some reason the tv in the room constantly loses signal. It's not like I'm in vegas just to watch tv anyways, but I enjoy seeing national and sports news while getting ready in the morning. Other than that, I would highly recommend staying here. Hope this review is helpful to you all!
decent rooms and comfortable beds, but please clean the carpet!

So I am a professional wedding planner so I plan a lot of events, stayed in a lot of hotels and my experience here was by far the worst. Of course, when I tell people about my experience here and yes I have been talking they are all shocked that its the MGM & thats what I thought too. The world famous MGM Grand where boxing legends and celebs hang out, where the experience should be amazing. WRONG! 

I had two agendas on a recent trip to vegas. One, view meeting space for an upcoming conference that I am planning and attend an engagement dinner. The couple was planning to marry in Vegas so hey I could refer them to MGM Grand after my tour. 

I checked in on my phone so when I got to the hotel it was a breeze. However, once I got in the hotel discovered there was no remote (go back to my agenda, I planned to relax) I called they couldn't believe there wasnt a remote, came to check themselves, then broke back a remote. 

Day two, we are still on Ohio time woke up at 5am to watch the soccer match TV isn't working, tech came, couldnt fix the issue so we don't have tv for hours. In this case I wish I had brought a book. 

So, we decide to dress and hit the strip. Well, the hot water isn't working. I call the tech comes and he tells us the trick to the hot water. At the world famous MGM Grand there is a trick to the hot water??? He shows us the trick and walah we have hot water. 

The hot water trick, if anyone is interested is to turn the sink water on hot 1st for 60 seconds then the tub water let them both run then hot water!! 

Day Three, I figure the hot water trick out all by myself and we hit the strip for shopping. When we get back the room the isn't clean!! No fresh towels & the bed isn't made. I call, they send someone she asks us to leave while she cleans, I decline. During the evening of day three we cant figure out the hot water trick for awhile, finally we leave the faucet sink on by it self, cut it off then try the tub & walah. We are magicians at this point. 

Day four, we cant figure the hot trick out but its check out so we decide to just cold shower, because clearly we lost our magic touch. I have a great tour of the property with Aram, he is very nice and treats me to breakfast. I learned about his family and it was a great experience. He had gave me new hope for MGM. 

I checked out on the TV, which was pretty cool. Check my credit card & notice I have a weird charge it says something like "mail order purchase" I assume its MGM but call amex to double check, they say its MGM but the charge is larger than should be so I go to front desk and ask for a manger she says its not MGM, call amex again they say it is. Are you dizzy because I was. Finally, I say forget because at this point I am back over MGM (sorry Aram) 

I am in Vegas quite often, I was just there in October and came back November and plan to be back in the next month or so because I am still planning a conference. It is terrible as famous as this hotel is and highly recommended it is I had such a terrible experience. The manager offered no empathy she was total blah to my concerns as if this happens all the time. I expected more but got less than anyone deserves. 

So, you guessed you not recommended this hotel to anyone...
I loved this hotel!  Great customer service, and our room was a great deal with a huge comfy bed and a great view.  What more do you need?

We were traveling with our kids and it was the perfect hotel for them. Great pool and food court. Good dining options. In many hotels you feel like kids are a nuisance to to others but not here. 
Check out took about 45 minutes but remember this is the largest hotel in Vegas so that is to be expected. Check out was a breeze. Friendly staff, good size room.
We typically like mid-strip so this was a bit far down for us but ok for the 2 nights we stayed. The only downfall is the size of the hotel, it is huge so you have to walk a long way to get anywhere although Grand tower wasn't bad. Cable went out a few times but not for long. Also, be prepared as Valet takes a LONG time to get your car. Bell desk was amazing and prompt. 
If you are military they give you 25% off in food court - HUGE discount! 
Good place if you have the kids along for a short stay!

My family and I attended a Wedding and stayed at MGM Grand. We booked through a travel agent so we save a good deal of money and stayed in the West Wing.
1. Room: Our room was on the 3rd floor. The halls of the West Wing were the longest, thinnest hallways I have ever seen. This is the oldest part of the hotel and are part of the original that MGM was built around and it definatly showed. You could see NOTHING out our window and the room was 350 square feet. After 1am the shower in the room would NOT run hot water. The sink was so small you could not even run it enough to splash your face. There was hair in the shower stall and the phone was covered in grime. There was a gigantic splash of something on the roman blind which I try not to think about to much. There were burn holes in the carpet. The Bed was the saving grace of the room - very comfortable and there was an extra pillow.
2. Buffet: Vegas is known for their Buffets. MGM was 30\/person for Dinner and it was very disappointing. The food was no better than a Golden Corral - In fact the food at Golden Corral is BETTER and HOT! There were supposed to be crab legs but all they ever had was the pot of water to put them in. we were there over an hour and they didn't even cook any until we were leaving. Waste of Money - the food in general was overpriced at every restaraunt and better was found at other hotels [Circus Circus for Steak and New York New York for 800 degree Pizza]
The best parts were as followed: I will probably review seperately....
3. Grand Spa - 25\/day or 60 3-day pass....Jacuzi, hot sauna, dry sauna - wonderful locker and shower rooms with everything provided... this was the BEST part of my stay [see other review]
4. TopGolf - Driving Range at the far end of the hotel - Shuttle provided [see other review]

Ka did not preform while we were there - apparently they do not perform Thursday or Friday [WHAT]

Calling the front desk for assistance was a bust. I called about the best way to get to TopGolf and they told be to find a bus or attempt the walk. FYI: TopGolf has a Lounge - Right in the LOBBY!!!! A shuttle leave every hour on the hour and every 20 minutes.

While a lot in the Hotel was Expensive - $5 water, No coffee pot in room etc. There was a shop right outside the hotel that said Grand Canyon - Souveniers were Cheap [Hats 2\/9.98 Shot glasses 2\/2.98 etc] and Water 2\/1.00]

Room Tip: West Wing King is OLD, Outdated and the farthest from anything. Pick south tower or other.
See more room tips
Stayed June 2016, traveled with family
This place is definitely a classic.  A fairly well run casino and hotel, lots of great shows.  But the rooms definitely need an update.  I was half expecting Sinatra to pop in at any moment.

Vegas is all about being extravagant and over the top and this is exactly how I felt about the MGM Grand.  We walked over here from Bally's, which wasn't really that far.  I didn't really read much about the MGM before we came and had no idea how big the hotel\/casino were!  My goodness, it was really overwhelming!  We actually got lost trying to get out of the casino back to the strip.  

We checked into a Celebrity Spa Suite for our one night at the hotel.  The room was very spacious and decorated well. The Gustav Klimt prints and the bronze wallpaper were sophisticated embellishments. Our view of the East and the airport was magnificent, night and day.  

I'm going to be honest, we got the room for the hot tub and we were not disappointed.  However, I was worried about slipping while getting in and out of the tub.  We didn't, but I wish there were steps or a better railing to help get into the tub.  

For the price, we got a great room.  The MGM is a really neat hotel.  I was not really impressed with the lion habitat and I liked the location of Bally's better (because it was located in the middle of the strip).  But I would come back because the hotel is truly grand and I love Vegas!
They haven't updated their ventilation system\/renovated and almost passed out due to the amount of smoke in the casino. Think LA smog indoors. Negative 3 stars.

Follow the yellow brick road to the emerald city and you'll find the golden lion! It's the first thing you see as you enter the main lobby.

This hotel is pretty grand, alright, at least in size. Being the largest hotel and casino in Las Vegas, maybe they feel they don't need to be the best in customer service. Granted, there were over 15,000 people from my company for a huge convention, but they should be equipped to handle as many guests as can fit in the hotel, right? They're just lucky the other 15,000 people went elsewhere.

Need to Spend $?
---------------------
Plenty of restaurants, touristy shops, and of course... massive casino space. Many vehicles for spending dolla bills! The food court gets wicked crowded so I tended to opt for **Blizz**, which is just around the corner and has some healthy juice options (see Blizz review here - http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/blizz-las-vegas?hrid=9pL5NN9VJ-YEqvD0mBJjBA). Also MGM is home to **Cirque Du Soleil's 'Ka'**. Not my favorite Cirque show, but still an interesting one. My favorite Cirque show is the Beatles' 'LOVE', which you can only catch in Las Vegas. (see LOVE review here - http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/cirque-du-soleil-the-beatles-love-las-vegas?hrid=FBWaEYnI5TPtpuBeePDZdA).

Need to Catch Some Sun?
-------------------------------
They have not one, not two, but FOUR pools! If those weren't enough fun for you, they have 3 whirlpools and waterfalls too. It's a 6.5 acre complex of pool action and also includes a quarter mile lazy river. As if you hadn't already consumed enough food and alcohol, they have 5 bars and a full service Cabana grill. You can even get a poolside massage. What?!

Need to Feel Large and In Charge?
----------------------------------------
The **MGM Grand Garden Arena** is there for you! When you're here, you can't help but feel the power and energy of thousands of people in one space. Amazing sound systems and visual effects really enhance the experience. If your company is cool enough to play EDM (electronic dance music) for 5 hours, I can guarantee you'll have a great time here. Arena staff are friendly and helpful, which is a huge contrast compared to much of the hotel.

Need to Dance?
-------------------
Other than partying with my company's EDM fix, you can also hit up **Hakkasan**, one of the hottest nightclubs in Vegas. No wonder this place won the title of "#1 Nightclub in the World" by Playboy Magazine. All the top DJ's spin here, including resident DJ's Tiesto and Calvin Harris. Then of course there's also **Wet Republic** at the ultra pool, complete with the resident DJ's, a newly expanded 95-foot bar (neverending alcohol), a huge LED display, party cabanas\/bungalows, and of course tons of people ready to party in their bathing suits. A super fun day party! (see Wet Republic review here - http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/wet-republic-ultra-pool-las-vegas?hrid=KRe8TmiGoVdgNzKIFNxjgw)

All in all, the MGM Grand has a LOT to offer. Just wish their customer service could keep up.

TIP: Be prepared when asking for extra towels. Staff may sound as shocked as if you had asked for their firstborn child.

DATE TIP: Plenty of venues here for a hot date!

I redeemed 2 Comp nights in Las Vegas.   Checked in on the 24th of December for 2 nights.  I was only paying for resort fees for both nights.  Upon check out my bill was 260.00.  When I tried to resolve the issue I called and was placed on hold for 1 hour. I was transferred to 6 different people and transferred to 1 person twice. I was told they were aware of my comp nights but we're trying to see how they would redeem the stay. Basically who was going to pay.  This was ridiculous. Why not charge me the correct amount and MGM deal with the issue on their side!  I used 100 minutes on my cell phone. And when it was all over they fixed the problem and then charged me for the 2 nights resort fees.  but never reimbursed me for the processing fee that I had already paid when I made the reservation.   I was not going to call back and wait another hour for that!  I am very upset that I had to go through this.  And if anyone asks me about our stay there, I will definitely tell them to stay away.  Customer service was terrible!   Please reimburse me my processing fee that I paid twice for.
Very nice hotel and rooms that are so dark you sleep like you have never slept before.  I will stay here again. My only complaint is they spray so much air fresher in the casino

I have not stayed at MGM.  Stayed at Signature for I heart radio music festival- we only slept at Signature and were at MGM all weekend, so my reviews are strictly for everything EXCEPT the rooms
.  
1. Pool- We floated the lazy river.  My husband and I are twenty somethings and expected a "normal"  (adult) vegas pool.  The lazy river  felt identical to a KIDS WATER PARK.  They shuffle you through like cattle (kids), and send you on your way.  The only restaurant at the lazy river is kiddie park style... you wait in a line of metal aisles, place your order at the window and wait for your number.  The "pool bar" is the same way.  Next come the pool lockers!  I'll admit, they were very handy when you get to the river and realize, "why did I bring my purse, I'm floating a river and won't be in the pool right next to my belongings that I can keep an eye on all day".  Thank God for the lockers.  They are in broad daylight- not in the back of some wet room, so they were in great view of everyone and I trusted no one would break in.  Next come the TUBES!  Tube rental to float the river was a ridiculous $16.00\/each.  I will say there was AMPLE seating- no one wants to hunt for a layout chair or place to eat!  Especially when you're walking around in wedge heels and a bikini trying to suck in and look good.  Lots of seating (+)!  The river itself is pretty narrow.  This wouldn't be a problem if 3\/4 of the crowd weren't using it as a pool and parked on the sides.  We just bumped into everyone, but we didn't care.  What we did care about were the kids.... I've never seen so many kids at a Vegas pool in my life... with their mom... on an apparent girls weekend and didn't care if her 7 year old intentionally kicked and splashed everyone.  Bummer :(.  Babies in floats coming by you, kids diving for rings... I. Am. Not. Kidding.  In Vegas in September, I expect to spent majority of my time at the pool, and I will definitely not be back to this one.  

PROS:
1.Poolside drink service was AWESOME!! They have servers all over and get your drinks quickly.
2. You can drink in the pool!! Some hotels these days (ahem, ARIA!) won't even let you get 2 feet near the pool with a drink.  They provided clear plastic cups and we were set.  

CONS
1. Kids :(
2. Felt like we were at disney world, but I guess MGM never claimed to be a high end luxory hotel
3. Someone pooped in the pool... or vomitted...r so we heard- first came the life guards yelling, then came everyone rushing out of the pool, which was closed for the rest of the day.  Is it weird that this is not the first time I've witnessed this in Vegas??

2. Shopping-Do not expect to find anything nicer than Forever 21 clothes in MGM.  Cheap glitter dresses and plastic heels are about all you'll find.  Oh and Ed Hardy hats :)

3. Sports Book- we were in the sports book are for about 4 hours watching football.  Seating is a 4 on my scale, it was packed, you had to fight for a seat.  Cocktail servers were BEYOND terrible- that's why we ended up leaving.  $2,000 bet and you get 2 free drink tickets.  Not right if you ask me, but that's the rules.  SO here we are PAYING for drinks, and the service was awful. End of story.

3. Restaurants- MGM's only saving grace!!  PLENTY of dining options and they are all beautiful appointed.  We ate a Craftsteak which is awesome.  Also, dine at Diego which is HIGHLY underrated! The best Tex-Mex i've ever had. Really wish we could have tried out Shibuya sushi!

Point being- I will only revisit MGM for a meal.

WHAT I LOVED:

I did not go to fancy hotels growing up. But when I moved to Richardson\/Dallas TX with a swank job I developed an obsession with the MGM Grand. At least 40 visits here. Because it always stays miles ahead of the competition. Correction....no competition.

The 360 Degree remodel in 2013 was an overwhelming success! This resort has had a few minor sprucing up remodels, but this was tearing every inch of the US largest hotel to the rafters and re-inventing opulence, excitement and TRUE luxury! They highest paid architects kept the great stuff and replaced everything else.

The guest rooms and suites already looked new but with an MGM Grand Studio slant such as movie photos. The rooms and suites were rebuilt with an eye towards, comfort, style, efficiency and modern design.

The modern artwork throughout the resort slows down any trip to your room. Thousands and thousands of large designer prints and posters.

New restaurants such as TAP are phenomenal and less expensive than leaving the resort. Why bother when everything is already at the "City Of Entertainment"? at a fraction of the cost of off strip options?

The planners did an incredible job of maximizing room space! Just right sized closets. Wildly beautiful and cosseting bathrooms with customer comfort and space in mind.

The beds!

Monorail access is the most convenient on the strip. No walking miles. Two entrances and deep discounts!

Adult libations so vast you could indulge in one every week and never visit the same one twice. I especially love Centrifuge!

Good looking staff! Don't laugh! Everyone enjoys a hot looking young man delivering your luggage.

The largest abundance of dining options under one roof in the world! Even the food-court was refurbished. Clean, multiple options and terrific lighting effects. No one in Vegas gets this right. The MGM Grand does.

Great slot payout! I won $1,000 my first night recently! Wheel Of Fortune.

Stellar cocktail service! Be sure to tip GENEROUSLY all staff members. It is how they earn an income.

WHAT NEEDS IMPROVEMENT:

My fault but lost my wallet and spent hours talking to over a dozen staff members. I was so humiliated and embarrassed I took a shuttle back to the airport to leave the same day after all the angst. The Players Club even printed my Photo Drivers License. I was going to be sleeping on a park bench, but a kind lady at SupperShuttle had the safe opened and I was able to check in. But again - I was crying and humiliated and just wanted to go home after the MGM policies but it turned out well. Resort fees were comped, and I even booked an additional night and now a stay in June.

Room Tip: Book through VIP Marketing. Be specific.

I came here with my girlfriends for a bachelorette party last year--the service was good. the rooms were clean, decent size. 

Came back this year with the BF with a VIP Host--everything was AWESOME. They know your name when you call for room service. They tell you room service will take 45 minutes--you tell them you're heading out to dinner in an hour. 10 minutes later--champagne in hand = a happy girl. They gave us a Terrace Suites - two-story vaulted ceilings and outdoor patio overlooking the strip. Its like staying in mini condo but better! The dining area, living room, a bathroom, and the outdoor patio is downstairs then you go up this big spiral stair case that takes you up to the master bedroom with a huge master bathroom that is way bigger than the actual bedroom. I could live here forever and you would never hear a complaint from me! : ) The VIP host did an awesome job bc she got us the best seats in the house for all the shows--right smack in the middle up front (close enough to get a view of the entire stage but not too close where your neck will hurt from looking up). Made us reservations for dinner at Shibuya & Joel Rebuchon. I felt like royalty with all the special treatments. Staying in Vegas any other way wouldn't be the same!

Chris the bartender at Casino bar was very friendly and welcoming! Would come back to the Casino bar just to experience his great customer service again!! We also stayed at the hotel. It was my best experience compared to other Vegas hotels I stayed at in the past.
Very clean and nice rooms, but if you don't like walking, do not stay at the MGM, by the time you leave your room and get to the strip, you will be exhausted.  But overall it is nice.

If I could give it no stars I would I travel to Vegas at least 9to 10 times a year I stayed at MGM this time for five days it was the worse trip I have ever had checking in was a  3and a half hour wait then bell service was over a hour a\/c in the room did not work tv did not work when I told the front desk all that was said is sorry for that but nothing was fixed checkout was over three hours as well and to top it off after being charged a security deposit of $500 the balance was to be returned to my card and they put the money in someone else card not mine then when I brought it up they said they never make that mistake but it was corrected I will see my money in 7-10 days bell service once again and valet were a two hour wait I asked the bell men what was the problem and he said there was 98 workers but now only 29 mgm cut back on all departments so I will never stay here again ps when I asked to speak to a supervisor four time I was ignored stay away from mgm grand Las Vegas
MGM is my favorite hotel in las vegas just because i've stayed here so many times its like home to me. The rooms are a little bigger then your avg room size.
This was my 1st trip to vegas, so my only reference is all the the stories I had heard.  Everything is very nice except that the dealers at the crap tables seemed to be a little rude.

Maybe it's nostalgia, because my boyfriend and I stayed here on our first trip to Vegas together, but after staying at Caesar's this past weekend, I really think the MGM Grand deserves 4 stars.   For our purposes, it was really just as good as Caesar's and it's much cheaper.  The only really undesirable thing is the location, but that can be mitigated by using the monorail.  It's also not a big deal if you've been to Vegas and don't feel the need to walk up and down and see all the hotels on the strip, because there's more than enough to do in the hotel between the attractions on StudioWalk and the pool complex.   

MGM is really awesome in terms of having things to actually DO in the hotel.  I didn't realize how important this in until staying in Caesar's, which is a beautiful hotel but really has nothing to do in it.   MGM has both the lion habitat and Television City, which are both fun for kids or families (or even for adults who don't really drink or gamble).    There's also tons of cheaper food options, including a whole food court with fast food (Haagen Dazs, McDonalds, Nathans, etc), 'Wichcraft, Rainforest Cafe, Studio Cafe, etc, which is really nice because you don't have to leave the hotel every time you don't feel like dropping $25+ for a meal.

Positives:  the casino, the pool (there's 5 of them!), the Ka show.  Negatives:  why is there no mirror outside the bathroom in the deluxe room!?  Not having a mirror in the room made getting four girls ready on time difficult!

PS, the deluxe room I was in looked nothing like the picture posted on MGM's website - our room was kind of dingy!

Best beds I've ever slept in on the Vegas strip!

The hotel is older, the clubs are not as happening, the atmosphere is dark, and the layout is a little confusing, but I would say this is a solid three star hotel. The beds just made it a little bit better even though the rooms are a little boring. 

The location is pretty much at the end of the strip so that might be a negative for people who walk everywhere. It is probably the best hotel at that end next to Mandalay. After those hotels, you start seeing open land and old casinos.

This can be a pretty much all-inclusive hotel\/casino in Las Vegas.  You have the top LV restaurants all here, the largest casino floor in town, Ka runs here, and there are lots of places to get your drink and dance on.  We stayed in both the West Wing and the regular rooms during our stay, and I preferred the regular rooms.

Check-in and out here is pretty much a breeze, the rooms are very well kept and laid out, and again, the restaurants here are incredible.  I thought the gaming selection was also good, and they have a really nice poker room to boot.  

I think this is one of the top tier 2 hotels in Las Vegas...you get much more for your $ than comparably priced tier 2 hotels in Las Vegas like TI, Monte Carlo, Paris, Mirage, etc...

I love the MGM Grand. Stayed Friday-Sunday for around $170 on an apparently popular weekend and got adjoining rooms with plus double queens and a California king plus two twin rollaways (mattresses on wheels). Maybe I'm weird, but I loved their hotel linens; they didn't make me wake up in the middle of the night sweating, even with the pillowtops.

+ $35 credit on each room for the food court, not applicable at Emeril's restaurant, etc. But it WAS valid at Wolfgang Puck's, and their burgers were amaaazing. I think we devoured 3 in total. 
+ The staff, specifically the guards, were so nice. So nice, in fact, they were borderline baby-talking to me. This is referring to when I fainted waiting for food at Wolfgang's from possible shock of the heat outside and cold inside. Who knows.
- Wet Republic: maybe it's fun when it's sunny and there are actual DJs spinning, but I would have no idea bc the weekend I went was rainy and the pools were closed for a good while due to lightning. Literally rained on our parade.
? Casino: like any other.
+ (Multiple) Pools: plenty of lounge chairs, and you can bring in your own booze provided the cans are emptied into cups. Tip: buy plastic sports bottles and fill it up before you get to the pool for additional alcohol.
+ Lazy river: love it.
+ Food court: pretty good during the day, and definitely not bad at 4am.
- No late check-out, even when leaving on a Monday afternoon
- The ELEVATORS! Oh, the elevators. We must have spent about half an hour waiting for a non-occupied elevator to get down to the lobby and check out on time, and the stairs were emergency only. Not that I'd want to carry luggage down 8 flights of stairs, but I'm just saying I'd at least like the option so I don't feel trapped.

This is one Monster of a resort! Fun fact, its actually the largest hotel on the strip and i believe 3rd in the world. They have about 30 different dining options, from fast food, casual, to fine dining. My favorites are Fiamma's Italian restaurant and Original Chicken Tender in their food court. Feels like every time i come there is a different show, but currently its Jabbawokeez, David Copperfield, Brad Garrett's Comedy Club, and KA Cirque du Soleil. During the warm season they have Wet Republic, which is an outdoor day club. Pretty fun but you have to be in the water to survive the heat. But year round they do have Hakkasan which seems to be one of the most popular clubs in Las Vegas. 

My friend that was staying here stayed in a West Wing King room, they are only on the first 15 floors and specifically on the 2nd half of the hallway. I will say that west hallway is a little long, but the upside is that there is another elevator at the end of the hallway which is the best and super convenient  because it takes you right on to the strip. So that way u don't necessarily have to go thru the casino. And i thought the West Wing room was a pretty good size, and it has everything you need for your basic stay.

*We stay here when we go to concerts and the Pac12 tournament. If it wasn't for the convenience of the location, I would never stay here. 
* I am guessing that because the hotel is so big, that's why they make so many mistakes. We have stayed here six times and even though we confirm our reservation ahead of time, there's always a problem. They usually have the check out date wrong, the billing is incorrect, or we get a smoking room when we ask for nonsmoking. 
* This weekend we had booked & paid for five rooms yet when our friends got to the hotel, they were asked for a credit card for a deposit even though I had already given them my card at registration. Each time one of our friends checked in, I would have to go downstairs to correct the billing which took close to an hour. 
* As an example of their poor customer service, when I was going downstairs yesterday afternoon, there was a guy passed out on one of the chairs by the elevators & he had thrown up. I told someone about it at the front desk & they said they would take care of it. The man was gone but the puke was still on the floor this morning. Sooooo disgusting!!!
* I would have given them one star but the awesome service, consistent food quality & long hours at Wolfgang Pucks merits an extra star

I stayed here from Aug 2-7th night for a bachelorette. We had a 6 person suite for 5 girls. 

ROOMS

We were in the west wing. Out of the 6 days we were here, we never had our room cleaned once, despite asking for it to be cleaned several times. I called down to tell them that our room had never been cleaned and to send up 5 towels. The lady responded with - the maximum is 4. That's great, but there's 5 of us, who all paid to be in this 6 person suite so we need 5. I argued with her for 5 mins to be able to get one extra towel. ON top of that when they brought up towels there was a manager in the hall and I told her that our room had not been cleaned ONCE and we had been there 3 days. She made a note and did nothing, still for the remaining 3 days they never cleaned it once. The hotel overall is nice, but compared to Aria and hardrock which I have also stayed at I do prefer the cleanliness of their hotels better. Our showers were both practically broken, our mirrors were rusted, and we had to throw our garbage and dirty towels into the hall for them to be actually removed from our room and someone to clean it up. Final remarks: go anywhere else where you will actually get the service you deserve for your money. 

POOLS

The pools had a nice vibe however the pool chairs are made out of a dark brown almost black rubber. Obviously they are very old because this concept is idiotic, we all literally burned our asses on these chairs. Not joking, like I had to put aloe on my ass. 

RESTAURANTS

I'm not a fast food person and that's mostly what they had. Yes they had a few restaurants, italian, asian, steak, none of them had really healthy options and I felt sick the whole week from the lack of better food options. 

CASINO\/LOUNGES

The casino isn't as fancy as other casinos in Vegas and the lounges were OK. Overall there was a good vibe going around, the crowd is mostly younger. I would say 20s to 30s. 

Out of all that I've stayed at I would choose to go to Aria again, not MGM, and if I had no other choice then I would choose Hard Rock before MGM.

Wir hatten bereits renovierte Zimmer und ich finde es gehört mit zu den besten am Strip. Unvergleichlich was hier am Wochenende abgeht. Party ohne Ende in den Clubs und an der Bar oder am großen Pool.

My family loves going here and lucky (maybe) for us, my dad loves gambling in Vegas. My dad usually gets a skyline marquee suite for us as a family and it's a pretty big suite that gives a family of 6 decent room to run around and have our own space (except bedtime then it gets crowded). The dinner table was huge and the seating area was decent. We could clearly see outside as the windows were huge and lit up the place during daytime. The lighting is great at night and isn't too bright and has that perfect light especially if you're drunk. You can have the lights as bright as day but who the heck does that in Vegas. You're not supposed to be reading books while in Vegas, you know what I mean? It was pretty great staying here and we all felt like VIPs as we lounged around.

The suite has two rooms, each across the suite. My parents and the youngest shared the bigger one and the rest of us three shared the other. My sister and I were on the bed and the other one had to have a bed ordered for herself.

We stayed here for three nights and my younger siblings enjoyed exploring around the hotel. We had to pay for the internet connection by the day and I think it was $14 per day. The service everywhere was good. Valet was decent, checking in was fast enough, bellman did his job, cleaning ladies were good, and the room service was pretty quick to get us our food. Everything was pricey but hey, it's Vegas.

The restaurants we tried downstairs in the hotel had very good sushi and drinks. Pricey again and we all dressed up with cocktail dresses and suits. Great service and attentive staff. The restaurants looked very upscale and most everyone was dressed up at dinner.

After dinner, we tried the clubs in the hotel. There were people around handing out free "passes" to women who look like they're dressed up for clubbing. The clubs were decent with good tunes and good fun vibes mostly. We went to a club that was kinda lame but the crowd was just a tad bit younger but who knows, it was pretty dark in there. We went to another club that seemed more fun and had good tunes to dance to. There were a lot of middle aged guys clearly trying to get laid but most were failing miserably. There were some middle aged women who were also trying to get laid and had a good possibility despite acting like nasty skanks. It was fun except my dad made it awkward by getting us a table service and dancing with my parents isn't exactly what I had in mind when I think Vegas. He bought a cheap tequila bottle and it really sucked to drink it. I don't remember what tequila it was but it was like drinking rubbing alcohol (probably was). I felt that I had to be drunk to drink it if you know what I mean.

At the end of our Vegas trip, we decided to check out the shops for souvenirs. I got two beer glasses for 8 bucks each and a small gold MGM pen for another 8 bucks. I really liked that pen. It wrote well and it felt fancy when I wrote with it.

This place is ridiculously luxurious. Many people don't even know it exists. Once you\/re inside it doesn't even feel like you are in Las Vegas anymore. The whole courtyard is enclosed and it smells like lemons.

What a monstrosity.  This place is huuuuuuge!  If you enter from the sidewalk on the strip and try walking all the way through the casino to try to find either the lobby or the monorail, you're bound to become lost.  The signs have arrows pointing this way or that way, but they are sometimes contradictory.  You can end right back up where you started at and not have a clue as to how you arrived back there.

It's a lovely hotel and pretty well maintained, but starting to show its age in some ways.  At one time it had a Wizard of Oz\/Hollywood theme.  Now that's completely vanished, and I'm not sure if it even has a theme anymore.  If there is one, it's not apparent.  

Everything is also green.........veeeeeerrryyyy green.

Stayed here or my 21st birthday a couple weeks ago!! casino is always buzy...... tabu and studio 54 sucks!  Lots of Resturants! 
but tell me why when we came back to our room one night .. our safe was open!  and extra pillows on the bed when we didnt request them! and the do not enter sign was on the door!! same happened to my moms room and my cousins!!! dont trust the security and dont use the safe!! probably wouldnt stay here again!

After thinking about my poor experience at The Mirage gonna rate MGM Grand a four star.  In comparison is was almost night and day. MGM needs to add more light to the rooms but really cool place.  Only reason not a five star is the lazy river is open to the public and was overcrowded.  They should have a cap on allowing public in an overcrowded pool on busy weekends.  Maybe the weekdays are better.

I heard that the MGM did a whole new renovation\/ makeover of some of the rooms! I decided to see what everything was like. I've stayed at the MGM some years ago and wasn't too impressed! However this time around it was a 360 degree change! I was suprinsgly upgraded to a Executive King Suite! Why? Not sure! But who would ask questions right? The room was absolutely fantastic! Very spacious, clean, and the decorations and layout were very stunning. i stayed on the 27th floor and had an exceptional view! I would recommend this hotel to anybody!

MGM is like one of the classics of the strip.  I remember coming to Vegas as a kid and amazed by the grandeur and greeness of  MGM.  To me it was the creme de la creme of hotels back in the day.  While it doesn't have the wow factor like Bellagio or Cosmo now, it seems to be one of the hotels you always cruise through for a photo op with the gold lion, boxing matches, cirque de soleil KA, and the lions habitat.  I've also checked out Crazy Horse Paris here, which was decent. See my review ;-)  Otherwise, like others have said, the hotel is pretty standard with its casinos and restaurants.

Though I've only stayed in the deluxe rooms and queen bungalow suites. These rooms smelled either old and moldy or like stale cigarettes.  Even though I requested non smoking rooms.   I don't know why these rooms are still going for over 200 a night.  These are worth more like mid 100s, bc they're kinda old.  I heard the remodeled west wing rooms are better.  So I recommend getting those or even those fancy shmancy sky lofts if you stay at the MGM.   

I will say the lazy river and Wet Republic is a-mazing.  Def. check this out if you are staying here or even if you're not!
Stayed her for a work convention. The hotel is large and beautiful. I would recommend and would stay here again. It's location on the strip is perfect.

It had been over a decade since I last stayed at the MGM.  Came here during Yelps Spring break and was hoping to get into one of the newly renovated rooms but I ended up in the regular ones.  It was the same weekend as the Billboard Music award.  Too bad I didn't see any celebs.

We got the first room right off the elevator.  I was thinking it was going to be noisy with all the peeps coming and going and the up and down of the elevator but it was actually pretty quite.  The 2 queens size beds were comfortable and the room spacious enough for 2 people.  Big bathroom with plenty of counter space for all the hair and makeup stuff.  

On the evening of the 2nd day we were surprised with a special delivery of champagne and sweets.  We almost made the guy leave stating to him that we didn't order anything LOL.  Well he got our names right and it was a little something from the hotel to welcome us.  

Im not very picky when it comes to hotel accommodations.  As I don't tend to spend much time in the hotel room.  As long as it had a comfortable bed, a TV, nice size shower with good water pressure Im happy.  That said the one thing I was disappointed about was the WiFi.  It was struggling a bit.

Local ~ On the Strip
Room ~ 2 Queen beds and on the 18th floor.
Stay ~ Clean and comfortable.
Extras ~ WiFi struggled a bit.

3.5 stars, but rounded down, because ultimately, I won't be back here until they finish construction. When that happens, it might actually be a 4 star experience.

Check in was quick and painless (service overall in the hotel was very good), and the room was ready when we arrived at 2:30PM. Room itself was pretty nice. The recent renovations certainly give an air of newness to the room, and nothing looked run down or gross. One of the towels did have a yellow stain on them. That towel went straight to the floor.

Casino is decent, and I was asked if I wanted a drink consistently whenever I decided to start losing money, so that's good.

However, being awoken from 6-8am in the morning by trucks beeping and dumping things is no bueno. I mentioned it at check out and they comped me the resort fee, which was nice, but bad sleep is one of my big pet peeves, so I'm actually being nice by not giving them 1 star, haha.

Their pool facilities are actually pretty grand. The lazy river is cool, but the opposite of lazy. Lots of young 20s something getting drunk and rowdy. Definitely a younger place. They do have other pools, some designated for family, for water volleyball, and for lounging. Definitely something for everybody.

And while you're here, definitely check out Ka, which is a great show.

All in all, if construction finished and the price was right, I'd come back here, but for now, I need to try the other hotels on the strip.

My favorite place to stay when I go to Vegas. I used to stay at the Rio a lot, but it is too far off the strip for me now that the monorail is there. Yet, you still have to walk quite a ways here to get to the monorail. 

The rooms are very nice and quiet. I don't see a lot of drunk people running up and down the halls here. They have pictures of some of the MGM stars from back in the early days of TV and movies. Very cool to see when walking down the halls and in your room. 

Along that path to the monorail, they have quite a few restaurants, including some high end places as well as some fast food type places (which are open late). The line up of restaurants they have is pretty impressive, as two of them are run by Joel Robuchon and have a 3 Michelin Star and a 1 Michelin star rating.

I've stayed here several times and never left the building all weekend.

This place was so big but the rooms were beautiful. The pool area was amazing. They had several pools and even a lazy river. The service out by the pool was great. The waitress was attentive and quick and very pleasant. The room we had was in the West Tower on the 18th floor. Beautiful spacious bathroom with jacuzzi tub and nice shower. Loved the black out shades. Really worked for when you wanted to sleep in after a long night! The bed was very comfy. Nice big flat screen tv that can be turned either towards the bed or the sitting area. My only complaint is that they don't actually have a mini fridge you can use. The one they have is all sensor driven so you can't move anything or you will be charged. When staying a couple of days I like to have a fridge available for keeping drinks cool instead of just ice. Definitely would stay there again.

My phone was stolen from my room (iPhone 6s) and their "security" couldn't have been more useless.  

I realize all resorts on the strip solely exist to separate you from your money, but this place does an exceptional job at letting you know how little they care about you.
A very nice hotel for the value.  I don't gamble so the casino looked fine to me.  The hotel is HUGE.  A city inside of a hotel.

We had a very nice room with comfortable beds. I appreciated that it was both dark and quiet... these are very important qualities for hotel rooms in Las Vegas as you'll want to be able to sleep at any hour of the day or night.

We also had a nice view up on the 23rd floor... it was kind of a pain waiting for the elevator every time we wanted to go up and down, but once there the view was nice.

The decor was Old Hollywood themed... pictures of old stars, etc. The theme was not over the top though.

The pool, as you'll read in a separate review, is AWESOME.

The only reason this place is not getting five stars is that the casino is an absolute MAZE... it drove me crazy to try to walk from my room to the pool and back. I mean, like, *CRAZY.*

Stayed at the MGM for the first time, this year for my 24th birthday. I loved the room, we got the spa king, very spacious with excellent views of New York New York, Monte Carlo and City Center. The restaurants were awesome, food was excellent. Now lets get to the bad part. Prices for bottled water and other things at the small shops by the elevators are insane. $9 for a smart water, even after the MLife discount, which is a joke. Bring a case of water up to your room or visit one of the local CVS stores on the strip to buy water, don't waste your money. Souvenirs were expensive as well, $20 for a plastic gold painted lion that probably cost them 50 cents to make in China. Look, I know they have to make money but c'mon, that's crazy expensive. Gambling in the casino was just okay, as with all casinos it was a smokers paradise. The MGM seems to have a bad ventilation system because out of all the casinos we visited, the MGM seemed to smell the worst. If you're a non smoker, be prepared. You'll be coughing for weeks after visiting the MGM. The roulette and black jack dealers were okay, most were nice however I did run into a couple that were rude. Didn't smile, didn't make eye contact, sort of makes you feel like you're forcing them to make you have a good time or something....my assumption was if you work in entertainment, whether that's being a dealer or a actual entertainer, you're supposed to put on a happy face and make the customer feel welcomed. These dealers seemed like they hated life and just wanted to leave. I didn't bother tipping any of them. I'm glad I walked over to the New York, New York, the dealers there were very friendly, talkative, really had a great time there. A couple days into my stay we visited the pool, it was just okay. Most of the places where you could sit and relax were covered in bird poop. I had to turn over the cushions on the metal chairs just to sit down. Even still I couldn't lean back because bird poop was all over the chair. I was irritated that the lazy river opens at 10am rather then 8am like the rest of the pool. We had to stand in a huge line of about 50 people waiting to get into the lazy river before it opened. Then burst into the complex like a black Friday sale just to get a good chair. Absolutely insane. This isn't vacation to me, that's stressful. The drinks at the pool bars were reasonably priced and discounts given after your first drink. Our pool experience was ruined when someone first threw up in the lazy river which resulted in the life guards forcing everyone out and closing it down for two hours and then thirty minutes later someone pooping in the river, again closing it for two hours. There has got to be a way to prevent this. Maybe like not serving food at the pool? Duh. When we were allowed to get back in the water it reeked of chlorine and when I undressed in my room later that day, I found out my swim trunks had changed color. GROSS. Lastly, there are way too many people allowed into the river at once, you basically cannot swim comfortably. Fights were breaking out, a guy pushed me and my raft for no reason. It wasn't fun. On my last night at the MGM, upon walking to my room, as soon as I entered the hallway, I was bombarded with the smell of Marijuana. Now it was my understanding that my floor was non smoking, which it was and that consuming illegal substances in public hotels was not allowed? I guess not. I called security, they never came and I had to put up with the bad small all night which I thought was unfair. Thankfully I don't have any job interviews or drug tests to do, because THC is probably still in my system thanks to the second hand exposer. My thoughts about the MGM are its simply a party paradise for young, reckless, alcoholic kids. Its not for respectable, people with manners and relaxation in mind. Ya know. A vacation.....I won't be staying here again.

MGM Grand. The hotel with all the big boxing matches and the lion "habitat". It was the first time I stayed here and we found it for a pretty reasonable price. 

A big heads up when parking in their structure is to remember exactly where you parked. It could get kind of confusing and you may get lost. Checking in was really quick and rooms are pretty spacious. One of the biggest downers was that when we made room reservations online the website said we would have free buffet tickets. When my husband went to check in the girl at the front desk said she had no indication of that special on the system. She stated that if there was something on the confirmation email or if we have proof she could give it to us. I was totally bummed even though my husband screenshot it on his ipad from the website we didn't decide to pursue it. We kind of forgot about it. Still a big let down though.

The room was pretty spacious but the television was a little dated. One of the big things I look for in a hotel room is a flat screen and this television was a little old school. The room was fairly clean minus the pillow with "stains" on it. Yes, I know. I have watched all those little news specials about how disgustingly dirty 5 star hotel rooms are and how many stains are on the walls and comforters using a blacklight. The only thing is I didn't have a blacklight and the stains were just there. Mind you it was only the decoration pillow but it was pressed up against the pillows we were supposed to sleep on. I threw it on the side of the room and opted to not have the room service clean so they don't put it back on the bed. Aside from that the bed was amazing and I had the best sleep there on my vacation.

The hotel is location is pretty good too especially if you are driving since its more toward the beginning of the strip. There's lots of restaurants and lounges in the hotel that you can choose from but the hotel is currently under some renovation. You can also walk next door to New York New York or to the other nearby hotels. Great thing is that it is located at the beginning of the monorail if you want to blow $15 bucks for an all day pass to use the monorail on the strip. Overall good experience for the price.

Bring your walking shoes!  The MGM Grand is almost a city of it's own, and it is a long walk to anything.  The rooms are quite nice, large with good views and comfortable beds. Only real complaints would be that there is no coffee pot or refrigerator in the room, and that the doors are paper thin so you hear every little noise from the hall . I was attending a conference at the hotel. From my room to the conference center walking at a pretty brisk pace took 9 minutes. There is a soda machine and an ice machine on each floor. Sodas (or water) is $3.00 a bottle, but don't worry, the machine takes credit cards! Plenty of good restaurants, a couple with several big TV cooking show names (Tom Colicchio's CraftSteak and 'whichCraft and Emeril Lagasse's Emeril Restaurant). For the more budget minded there is also a food court with a couple fast food choices, like McDonalds. If you get a good deal on room rates, it's not a bad place to stay.
Not impressed. The iced tea was old. The floor was lack luster for what you pay (coming from the venetian)... I order iced tea every place, I'm not picky. Just make a fresh pot, so simple.

I have been a guest of the MGM Grand since it opened. I left about 3 years ago to stay at other hotels for a lot of reasons. We are gamblers and have never had to pay for our room or meals. So this review is to help management and those who have never stayed there. The rooms have been remodeled and new bedding. 
Even though the temperature out side never got above 100 before memorial day. The room never cooled off enough to sleep under the covers. We had to keep the black out down to keep out some of the heat. 
The provided refrigerator was full of things that were way over priced. and had a $50.00 restocking charge? I wondered if I took a bottle of water if it was going to cost me $58.00?. 
I ran my hand over the top of the mirror in the bath and dust poured down. I let it hang for a week and it never went away. Not a lot of attention to detail for a high end resort. The ceiling above to sink had stains and  built up grime. 
    The pillows were very big and hard. We called and received smaller pillows that were low quality foam. 
    Everything at the hotel is way overpriced for what you get. It was a holiday weekend so I expected a crowd. The problem is the layout of the hotel and surrounding area cannot handle the traffic. The valet was a really long wait, as much as twenty minutes  as was the taxis.  Bringing our car back from an outing we had to wait to just get to the valet drop off. 
Lines to all of the food service was really long. Lines to everything was to long. When the foot traffic was slower, there were less people to serve you. So if you wait for off peak hours you don't save a lot of time because the staff has been cut down. We had a lot of room service so we didn't have to stand in line for 45 minutes to an hour. Room service was faster and pretty good for the price by comparison. 
We had VIP passes that allowed us to go to the head of the lines and that earned us a lot of stares that were not friendly. We chose not to use the passes because it made us feel uncomfortable. I really don't think I will stay there again even though I have made friends over the years with a lot of the staff in the gaming area. 5034 rooms plus convention and concerts are to much for the floor plan. I was knocked down in the restroom. Bumped into countless time by drunks. Stepped on in the crush of the people running . 
     Cost is not a factor for us, but I come from humble roots and even though I have the means to pay for anything I want. I will not be robbed in the name of a resort. I don't see MGM lowering their prices because they have a line waiting to pay. 
Good luck, You'll need it.

We arrived on a Sunday afternoon. The check in line was extremely long, however, my mother is wheelchair bound and the concierge immediately approached us to come to another window to be assisted for check in.  Although, we wouldn't mind to have waited with everyone else, we appreciated the extra help.

When we got to our room, we were pleased with the size of the room.  There were two televisions, two telephones, automatic window shades, a nice huge big bathroom with a separate shower and bathtub, two sinks, marble bathroom floors.  The part of the room that was carpet was disappointing.  The carpet needed to be cleaned, as it was dirty.

We decided to get ready and hit the city...we proceeded to the lobby and w-a-l-k-e-d all around the hotel to find our spot to gamble. Although, we didn't win millions, we had a good time. With many people smoking, it wasn't apparent. The fresh\/scent in the air made the gambling area pleasant. 

The kids decided to hit "The Lazy River" and immediately were disappointed, as there is a fee for getting an inner tube.  

Since there is a daily Resort fee ($25.00), this fee should cover the inner tube cost. Oh, you do get a "free" inner tube when you pay for a cabana...for a ridiculous fee!

When we got up and out of the room for the day at 9:00 AM,  we made sure to take the "Recharging IN Progress" off the door, so the maid could clean our room.  When we returned at 4:00 PM, to get ready for the evening our room still wasn't cleaned.  I'm not sure what time the room was cleaned, as we didn't return until 12:30AM.  When I woke up in the middle of the night, I could not see the clock from the bed, as it is on top of the telephone facing towards the ceiling.

We were really disappointed upon our return to the room, as we had left overs and when we opened the refrigerator, there was no place to put the food.  The refrigerator was already stocked by the hotel with drinks.  If one of us moved any items, there would be a re-stock fee!

We had to use the pull out couch and it was apparent that since the couch was placed there, it has not been vacuumed underneath.  There was enough trash, if or when cleaned it would take up a trash can.

The next day, we stopped by Starbucks for our morning coffee, as there is not a coffee pot in the room.  I saw one of the hotel employees and asked if there was a comment card.  I was told "we don't have those, and I could speak to a manager."  This is why I am leaving my comments on Yelp. 

CONS:
No coffee pot
No inner tube, should be part of "Resort fee"
Too long to service room
Carpet needs to be cleaned
Carpet under pull out bed extremely dirty with trash
No additional refrigerator for personal use
Clock unable to see when in bed
Lion  Exhibit closed and lions moved to an offsite, where you have to pay a fee to see them.)

PROS:
Enjoyed fresh smell of hotel
Easy check out

This review is specifically about the fitness center, gym, cardio room situation at the MGM Grand.

Everyone knows when you come to Vegas you're going to ingest far more calories and bad-for-you food & drinks than you would ever intend to. So its probably a good idea to have a plan to at least control the damage. For me, that means I need a gym.

When I booked my stay at MGM Grand they told me there was a gym. That is not completely true. There is a CARDIO ROOM. That means a couple of treadmills and bikes. NO WEIGHTS. NO MACHINES. Nothing to get an actual weight lifting style workout.

So I went to the front desk when I realized this and asked if there was a "real gym". There is - unfortunately its part of the grand spa. Which means you have to pay extra. $10 per day. What the heck? Seriously? Oh yes - after all the room costs, crazy food & drink prices, resort fees, etc. - they want more. They want more money for you to use a gym like just about every other hotel offers for free. Hope you're listening MGM - your fitness center should be free!

I won't get further into it, but I'll definitely say that I'm totally upset about this and will never stay here again simply because they don't have a free ("real") gym or fitness center to use. If I want cardio I'll go swim in one of the 4 pools.

Pros:
My stay was pleasant and the staff was curious and friendly. 
Coms:
I wish this was enough for me to rate the hotel higher. The rooms (at least the one I stayed in) looked like it underwent some minor freshening, however the renovation were poorly done and the layout (open concept bathroom & toilet) seemed counter intuitive.

Overall:
The cost to stay is on par with other hotels in the area, if room aesthetics is a focus, I'd recommend looking at other hotels like the Bellagio or Luxor.

My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon 12\/5-12\/9 and had a blast! The first day.. not so much. As a gift, my mother was going to add a $200 credit to our room, and since the room was paid for already, would be given back to us as cash. The MGM has you fill out a credit authorization form, fax it to their offices, then wait for an hour to see if the credit has been applied. We went through this literally 4 TIMES! each time there was some issue with the fax.. they NEVER called to let us know of an issue, we always had to call and check the status of our credit. Each time we called, we spoke with someone new.. had to remain on hold while they tried to figure out what we were talking about, etc.. it was just too much going on. On the 2nd day of our trip, my husband and I decided to go down to the business center and get this straight. My poor mother was trying to give us a gift, and was getting frustrated! it literally took them 5 minutes to issue the credit, but we couldn't get cash! We had to spend the credit in their hotel on a MGM gift card! WOW... 
This place is beautiful, however it may be TOO big. For such a small thing as a credit to your hotel room that took 5 minutes to do.. there were too many hands in the pot. No reason for that to take 24 hours. 

One place i would recommend eating there is Diego's... amazing happy hour! And their Sangria is the BEST! The bar 32 degrees is nice too, make sure you get a few jello shots! 

Overall, i might stay here again. I just wont have anyone adding anything to our room..too much of a hassle!
It was a nice place to stay but a bit over crowded because of the Mayweather vs Mcgregor fight , it was really relaxing , we enjoyed the stay

I had a pretty bad experience at MGM that made my weekend trip to Vegas the worst trip ever. It seemed like the securities did not know what they were doing. I was talking with roughly 10 different people in 2-3 hours regarding the incident I had, but except for the last lady, it never felt like I was getting helped at all. Oh, also it was not too hard to figure that THEY LIED TO ME just to avoid the situation (if they didn't lie, it means their workers have no idea about their duties and how the systems work).

WOW, was I bamboozled when I booked this place! Not only did they misrepresent what the actual room s you book look like online but the place was anything but clean!
I booked a room at the MGM for my 30th birthday thinking that this hotel was going to be awesome and I was WRONG!  When my boyfriend and I walked into our room we were a bit shocked at the decor! This place really has not been updated at ALL like they said and to top it off there was BLOOD in our bathroom! That's right BLOOD!  We called housekeeping before dinner to comae and clean it and when we arrived back at our room a few HOURS later it was STILL THERE (GROSS)!  I finally had to get a hold of a manager to take care of it.  Once they "cleaned" it we went back out and to my surprise when I returned, I noticed there was blood stains on the shower curtain and stained in the cracks of the marble! 
Also, beware of the "resort fee" you 'll be charged EVERY night you stay (it's $10 a day)!  I was shocked when I saw an extra $50 added to my bill at check out because we were told we paid the fee when we arrived!
Needless to say, we will NEVER return here again! I would however recommend The Mirage, it's clean, fun and the employee's like they're jobs there!

The check in was terrible. On my birthday the front desk gave me attitude. She was lucky I didn't call for the manager and decide to cancel my reservation. The room was clean but the bathroom clogged all the time and when I called housekeeping they didn't freaking respond and one of the other guest in the same hall was smoking weed. When I called the front desk they hung me up several times. Oh the last part whiskey down didn't even go to our table to provide any type of service. After spending a lot of money for my suite. I would rather stay at the Venetian. At least over there they attend to your needs.

5 star service from our recent stay at the MGM for the Yelp Elite national event!

I was so impressed with how we were treated by the staff, especially by the Assistant Manager Darren.  He took care of the issues with the invoice error and also let us check-out at a later time since we were going to the Billboard music awards that night even if the hotel was at full capacity.

The renovated rooms were modern and clean, smaller than the Venetian similar decor.  

What topped off the stay was delivery of champagne and sweets to our room compliments from the hotel. Awesome! We felt like we were VIP!

I wouldn't have stayed at MGM if it wasn't for the Yelp promo but I'm definitely glad I did! 

Thanks MGM, I'll see you again!

For some reason, I kept coming back here one year.

I'm not sure why.  Maybe I like the color green.

Alright games, alright bar type lounge places.  Never saw the rooms.

Buffet reviewed separately.

There are a couple of chill places away from the whole usual Vegas freakout, but this isn't my pick for the strip.

Pretty cool experience. Came here for my son's 21st birthday, and they carded him immediately. They made a big deal about about his birthday, it was a great experience. He won a lot on the machines, which made him happy.

I stayed at the MGM for three days to attend a conference, so I wasn't able to experience all the resort had to offer, but I feel I got a good taste of things.  The room I stayed in was a standard King bed room, I believe the call it a "Grand King".  It was nice, had a desk, chairs, and bed.  The bathroom was nice, clean and spacious.  

I had a couple of hours to hit the pool, but since it was still March the big lazy river wasn't open yet, but the main pool areas were nice.

As far as dining, I actually only stopped at the Starbucks when heading from my room to the conference center, but it appeared there were a lot of options with different menu types.

Entertainment wise I saw David Copperfield which was a great show.  The theater offers tabled seating, not full meals, but drinks and snacks which was nice.

Over all I enjoyed staying at the MGM and would probably stay there again if the need arised, but there are so many options in Las Vegas it's nice to hop around.

So here we are in a suite on the 17th floor. No refrigerator or coffee pot. Are you kidding me. Having stayed in hotels around the world in the past year this is the only one not to supply a refrigerator or coffee pot. Maybe I may be spoiled but the lack of these two conveniences would prevent me from staying here again. Even the golden gate hotel provided these amenities in their penthouse suites. 

Did I mention we are platinum members?

I waited over 6 months to post this........

Will never stay here again......i dont think.

Positive:
- Large Suite with nice spa. Great layout, looked amazing,
- Great vibe, so much to do and see.
- Great price on room.
- Customer Service was willing to remove charges, add credits to try and make up for wrongs.


Negative: ( I really am sad i had so many problems, i wanted to love this place)

- TV didnt work at all for two days. Day three it kind of worked after we changed rooms.
- Drain fulled room with the smell of RAW SEWAGE.
- Sink water leaked straight threw onto our feet in bathroom, like a major leak, not just drips. 
- Room 5-140 is right over the loading dock and trash compactor. 24 hours of 18 wheeler beeping, honking, dumpsters being compressed and taken out. So so loud all day, all night.

- Had to change rooms, but had to wait half a day just to be downgraded from our spa suite since NOTHING WORKED!

- NOTHING WORKED, I mean, nothing. looked good but drains don't drain, TV doesn't work, sinks leak, noise is loud, phone was broken........and its a resort!

THE STORY: (its a great bad story.)

Of course we are suckers and already had a major delay with our one hour Spirit Airline. (don't ever use them)
 
First night no TV, trash compactors and Dumpster and 18 wheeler's unloading\/ loading all night, honk, honk!

Second day: Sewage smell coming out of the upgraded spa suite. Sink water leaks straight onto your feet threw the huge hole in the sink fittings. TV hasn't worked in 48 hours, even after changing rooms to a lower grade suite. Dumpster and 18 wheeler's unloading\/ loading all night. LOUD 

Third day: couldn't take the trucks, TV and fear to use anything with water we needed a different room. Took about 4 hours and a lot of phone calls but we did move into another suite, but it has no spa upgrade. which was fine since we didn't have a great time in the other one since it smelled like RAW SEWAGE!

Hands down the worst hotel stay of my life.

In my second room at the hotel mid day trying to relax and watch a movie with my wife and we can't because they can't make the TV work.......and they call this a resort? Bullshit, this place really ruined the idea of the possibility of a relaxing vacations.

Oh and I must type this on my phone because they can't get there internet working either. STAY AWAY FROM THIS DUMP!

They waived the ridiculous resort fees for the whole stay and gave us a $75 room credit which was a good attempt to right the wrongs but it was far from enough because when you have the limited time like we do and spend such a long time saving up for those few days you get to go on vacation issues like the ones we had are just simply unacceptable and none repairable. Such a let down.

We stayed at the Presidential suite and WOW it was amazing! From start to finish, our stay at MGM was fantastic.

At the valet, we had a ton of bags and "provisions" for the weekend and the bellhop was very efficient and friendly, directing us to the right area to check in. As we walked into the lobby, the smell of perfume and friendly faces greeted us. Throughout our stay, the concierge and people we talked to throughout the hotel and at the nightclub, Hakkasan, treated us very well. Even our room service was fast, delicious, and served with good service.  

Our room had a beautiful view of the desert and airport, a change of scenery from the strip, but it was lovely. We had a GIANT living room\/kitchenette\/bar\/sofa\/seating arrangement. The sofa was a big sectional and was SO comfortable with tons of pillows and situated in front of a giant flatscreen and music docks, etc. The pool table was an awesome addition, as well. There was a seating area around a table for about 6 people, very nice furnishings with white leather seats. Also, there was a desk area with another chair to do some "business" but we didn't need to use it. Our kitchenette\/bar had plenty of storage on the counter, with well-appointment glassware, a jigger, martini shaker, bottle opener, and another giant flatscreen above it. Only complaint was that they locked the mini fridge because we didn't want to use their food\/drinks (since we brought so much of our own) but that meant we had to keep replenishing our coolers with ice from the far away ice maker. We saw a mini fridge being delivered to another room, but I guess there was miscommunication and we didn't order one...but next time we know!

Our two bathrooms had amazing products from Bulgari, plenty of fluffy towels, and we found comfy robes and slippers in the nicely sized closet. The room that I shared with a friend had a corner view and amazing blackout curtains for those hangover kind of mornings, a nice wardrobe of drawers for folded clothes, a giant flatscreen tv, and a king-size bed was SO comfortable we didn't want to get out of it! we were provided with tons of pillows and extra towels with no problem! Many hotels I've stayed at before were cheap with linens, but MGM has very nice towels and linens- I was impressed. The room was a generous size and very clean. The bathroom adjoined to our room also had a door to the living room. It was HUGE with a full bath\/shower combo, another walk in shower with a glass door, and a HUGE vanity with two sinks and PLENTY of room and storage for all of our girly products. The lighting was also perfect. 

I drunkenly ordered room service at 3am on Thursday night of our stay (make sure to eat dinner before you go clubbing and have bottle service- whoops) and the burger I got was worth every penny, although it was huge and I only ate half. It came with fries which were delicious, too! I ordered ranch which was $5 extra (yikes!) but even that was so good, too!

During the day, we went to Wet Republic which is always so much fun. Our second day we spent at the lazy river which was packed, but definitely fun to people watch and relax. Again, everything was just perfect. 

I had never stayed here before but I would definitely return! Thanks everyone at MGM for making our stay memorable!

I have to say that I'm a huge fan of the MGM. I remember this place from back in the day when we thought that a big emerald green building with a massive gold lion's head outside was just about the most impressive thing you'd ever see. Fast forward 10 years later and you have the Bellaigo, followed by Paris, followed by the Venetian, and the MGM is not so impressive. However, after a massive facelift about 6 - 7 years ago the MGM really stands out. They have a GREAT assortment of restaurants to choose from, the KA theater that hosts one of the many Cirque du Soliel shows in Vegas, the Lion Habitat, and of course, hotel rooms. I have stayed here before and the rooms were fairly standard. I'm sure the suites are much more impressive, but rating the hotel based on the facility as a whole I am going with four stars. The greatest part about this hotel? The lazy river pool (s) and the fact that you can catch the monorail here and take it up and down the strip as far at the Stratosphere Hotel. That's a HUGE bonus in my book.

I really have no problems with MGM except that it is SO expansive.  I totally get the Vegas thing and how each hotel\/casino is supposed to be its own city, but MGM may as well have its own zip code.  It is so far away from the rest of the strip and even more so depending on where you are staying in the hotel.  I have stayed in the towers and the hotel part, both times sharing a room with my friends.  The rooms are nice and spacious and the beds are comfortable.  It's really just the location that gets me every time we stay there. Mostly because we never end up going out at the MGM clubs which makes a whole other to do.  Their beach club pool party looked pretty fun though! Thank goodness for the cabs, right?

MGM used to be the ish...not anymore...They try really hard to remain in the top 5 list of Vegas's finest with the new clubs, restaurants, room renovations etc but I have been to vegas 4 times this year and stayed at different hotels each time (the newer ones) and I gotta say, MGM is like a "nanna" compared to those. They always have issues with billing, this time around they overcharged me $80 for using a drink from my room fridge which I did not even open during my whole stay. I know the whole bullshit behind even if you touch anything that is attached to the magnetic stand you get charged. Then the lines for checking in and out are RIDICULOUS! There are maybe 400 people waiting to get checked in and only 3 people working behind the check in desks. Some are walking around like they are taking care of something important then they just stand and have a friendly chat with the other people who SHOULD BE CHECKING PEOPLE IN!
