Anyways, I prefer exploring other hotels from now on. I think this was my last stay at the MGM.

MGM you should be ashamed to call yourself a Hotel. What a dump! 


I was sentenced, yes sentenced to a room in the West Wing. They should have escalators to get you there since the walk to the room was so far from the check in area that you were exhausted by time you arrived in your room. The hallways had low ceilings and were dark. Honestly a bit scary.

The room reminded me of an inside cabin on a cruise ship. It has the smallest window with barely any light that was located above the bed. The bathroom area looked just like the bathroom on a cruise ship. No privacy at all! The room was dirty with hair in the shower from the last guests. The shower itself had chunks out of the floor pan. 

I felt dirty staying in the room. I tried calling the front desk to complain or at least have someone come clean the nasty room, guess what the phone didn't work.

I visit Vegas about 10 times a year and honestly I would stay at a Motel 6 before even stepping foot in the door of this dump! 

Do yourself a favor stay else where!

This is quite possibly one of the worst places to stay on the strip. Why? Because the service is terrible and the hotel has just horrible policies and whatever their management is does not know how to run a hotel. 

My previous company contracted this place for a few years in a row to do their sales convention, so you would think they have spent enough money to keep MGM happy, but for some reason that's just not enough to get their people to break out a smile.

Their systems were down once, and hundreds, and hundreds of people going to the conference tried to check in, and the check in took 10 hours. Let me tell you how agonizing it is to wait for 10 hours in line because you want to gnaw your eyes out from having to wake up early to catch the flight to begin with.

So you would think, with this epic mess up, that they would comp. They turned people away, people who had reservations were turned away because they couldn't find any paper trails. What?? Are you kidding me?

I think a few people got a $25 restaurant credit. For waiting in line for 8 hours? I think I can pay for that $25 myself.

They had horrible management of the whole event and really screwed things up despite how much I'm sure they were being paid for the whole ordeal. I don't even care much if their rooms are comfortable or not. Don't bother with this place.

Awful experience. I'm an MLife VIP and booked through the Mlife website and made sure to request late check out for 3pm. I arrive to celebrate my birthday just to be told that I could not have it and that it is no guarantee. So why did I request it and agree to pay the $30 fee online? Then we finally get checked in after requesting a manager who approved a 1pm complimentary check out. The hotel was decent but the employees were so rude that it completely ruined my hotel experience. When it came time to check out, I reviewed the bill and noticed that their were additional charges. They tried charging me for room service that I did not order. I called and of course they say they will correct this and of course they sent me a corrected invoice but NOPE I look at my account today and the charge went through to my account for double the amount it should have been! Terrible experience, terrible customer service, this still has not been corrected. I should have trusted the bad reviews here especially the ones that stated they always have billing problems. This will be my last time staying at MGM. Incredibly dissatisfied!!!

The hotel is nice. It's gigantic. 
The rooms are great. Recently done over and good sized.
There are great restaurants inside, I've never seen the shows there but have heard  good things. 
The pool is awesome. Great area. Huge with a large lazy river and several other pools. 

Down side is the casino smells like smoke more than some of the newer spots. It's a great party hotel, awesome for a bachelor party more than a romantic weekend. But overall, a great spot.

We had 4 rooms at the MGM Grand for 3 nights in August.  I should have realized when we had to wait in a long check in line for 45 minutes, that the hotel has problems.  I didn't realize how big.  My mom was in the hospital in Vegas, so I left one day at 7 am and when I returned at 6:30 pm, hotel workers were in my room.  They told me the room above mine had flooded, and they were cleaning up the walls, floors etc.  They showed me my suitcase filled with wet clothes, and that the ones in the closet were wet also,  Some of my St John Knits even had mold on them already.  They changed my room, sent about half the items off to cleaning, (which they later billed me for), and took pictures of my ruined clothes.  It has been three weeks and I have spent over 15 hours waiting in their long lines, or on the telephone trying to find out when they will reimburse me for my clothes.  No one has ever called to apologize.  I got ahold of one person who said my clothes were expensive and they didn't know when they would figure out how this happened, as if it could be my fault that water came through the ceiling.  Horrible experience that could have been better if the hotel management cared at all.

For a large hotel they do a good job to keep things moving.  It's expensive to stay here unless you get a really good deal for flight and hotel, which I did over the Thanksgiving 2013 holidays.  The place is fast paced and noisy.  Even early in the morning while trying to get Starbucks, the music is loudly jamming at near concert levels.  The staff were courteous and helpful.  Room service for one (1) pot of coffee -- that's it -- was $31.00  It's advertised less, but by the time they tack on fees, ouch!

Lots of kids here in strollers.  Don't know why parents bring their young children to Vegas, but they do.  Be prepared to deal with the screaming and crying.

Upon checking in we were given a hard time.  Our reservation was unexpectedly canceled.  We spoke to the representative and they refused to honor our rate.  We had to pay extra despite speaking with management.  Fortunately, this was the only issue we had on our stay.

The hotel amenities were surprising given my expectations.   The room was much larger than expected and the staff was very helpful.  Their room service was extremely quick and accommodating.   

The pools were nice, but the cocktail service was extremely slow.  I only saw one cocktail waitress working, so I did not hold that against them.  Another annoying issue was that the hotel had not upgraded to flat screen TVs.  The signal was definitely not suitable for their TVs, and most stations' feed was off center.  This is only a small issue, but annoying nonetheless.

Overall, The hotel was nice and I would consider staying there again.

First time staying here.
The lobby area is huge and nice.
This place is like a maze so be prepared to get lost.
The pool area is insanely far from the nearest elevators.
Rouge (bar) kicked us out like at about 4 am - ghetto.
The lion exhibit is cool but i feel bad for the animals. This is not 
a place\/home for lions. Poor smoke filtration system. Not the best location on the strip. Rooms are nice but once you pay attention to details you are disappointed.  Long hold times when calling the operator\/room service. Ok place but will probably never return.

Since I wrote this review, the MGM has found the time to write a response saying how much they "value my patronage;"  however, despite sending a message through Yelp with my full name, they have not responded in any way, not by Yelp message, phone, email or letter (assuming they should still have my information as I was not only a hotel guest but a member of their players club for years).  I have subsequently written review on another popular trip review site, mentioning that MGM customer service places no email or physical addresses on their website, suggesting they may not want to hear about any problems, and MGM had the audacity to write a response to that review suggesting I "contact our main number and ask to speak to a member of our management team regarding your concerns."  You mean call the same number I called in the first place?  The same number I called that told me they couldn't do anything for me despite keeping me detained in a hotel room without power for an entire night?  And tell them what?  If the people at MGM management were in any way interested in solving the problems and not just trying to smooth over bad reviews with empty apologies they would return a message, offer some way of contact someone who isn't just a phone operator (most likely in India) and actually provide some semblance of customer service.   The "Guest Experience Department" at the MGM is a propaganda generator and nothing more.  Sad for a Company that used to value their guests and now dismisses them without so much as a reach around.

Really a surprise because this hotel hosts all these fights but can keep their hotel up to a clean and orderly location.  It may be sometime before my wife and I return but we will definitely stay at a better kept hotel.

Terrible experience! Very unorganized for an alleged "upscale" hotel.  Was not able to check in early like promised and when time came to check in they no longer had our room available.  When we happily went into our new room it turns out there was a leak in the upstairs room which in turn started flooding ours, to top it off the hotel failed to follow state regulations by failing to display a working smoke detector. Alas we were moved to a different room on the next level up! We were fine with it until we noticed the shutters were not working, we had to call maintenance yet again.  I understand things "happen" but the hotel staff overall should be more sympathetic towards their guests whether it is their fault these things happen or not! BE AWARE OF THE TERRIBLE GUEST SERVICE! Save your money and stay somewhere else! Oh yeah parking is just as terrible! 

07\/10\/2016 Update!

Horrible experience, BUT with time they were able to take care of us! The experience is not going to change but we are very grateful that they followed through and did their best to satisfy us! Yes this particular experience was bad, but they made up for it! THANK YOU

The MGM is situated right on the strip. It is HUGE. The MGM has one of the biggest casino floor on the strip and the place feels a bit like a mall. There are shops situated in the hotel and the restaurants are top notch. Foodies take note: they Have Tom Collichio, Michael Mina, and other notable chefs, type restaurants in the hotel. I hear that Michael Mina's is one of the best restaurants on the strip.

The hotel also features Wet Republic and Cirque du Soleil. Other entertainment features include CSI: The Experience.

I loved walking around this hotel. It's really big! And the lobby is cool.
One of my favorite places to stay in Vegas; you can't go wrong with the MGM.

Just stayed here over the 4th of July weekend. Originally I booked the west king room but ended up getting a upgrade to the South Tower for free since we have arrived so late in the night. Front Desk was really nice and helpful after our 10 hour drive! The room was super nice and spacious for 2 people, but we didn't have any sort of view. We looked out the window and It was the other buildings wall.. Room service was awesome beside the prices but that was expected for Vegas. On our 2nd day there the elevators at the south tower took forever to come up and down! We had to wait over 20 mins for it. The last day there we had to wait for the elevator another 15 mins just to go down to the lobby. I did stop by the starbucks in the main lobby and the cashier there was super rude, I had to ask for a bag 3 times and the last time he didn't even bother to bag my items. I had to do it myself. I wont be coming back to that starbucks again. Overall MGM is great place to stay, I would stay there again!

We came here on a business\/pleasure trip as Dude had to do business while I tagged along to go shopping, have dinner with friends and enjoy the meals.  I reminded Dude to put me on the hotel room check in since he was going to be working so he did and we preregistered for check in and the hotel responded that he would get an email to say the room would be available.  Resort fee only includes free internet, phone calls and fitness center.

So I arrived at the hotel and checked in my bag at the bell desk.  As check in was at 3 pm, I texted Dude to find out if he received an email about the check in but he never responded.  So I went into the check in line after 3 pm and it was long but went rather quickly as every reservation station was being utilized.  Check in was smooth; however, Dude had reserved a room in the West Wing and I got rather confused on where to find it because I went to the elevators for The Grand Tower and West Wings floors 4 and up, but couldn't find the West Wing, Floor 3, Room 528.  Finally I asked a person from the concierge, who happened to be walking around when I was bewildered, where the West Wing, floor 3 was.  She walked me to where it was located.  It is a narrow hallway between The Crush Bar and the high roller area.  From there, you use your room key to go through a door, through a long dingy low ceiling hallway, which goes on forever.  Then you find the elevator to the 3rd floor.  Once I got to the 3rd floor, I had to walk another long hallway to get to my room.  The hallways and low ceilings reminded me of a dormitory.  

Once I got to my room, I was surprised there were no windows, like I was underwater on a cruise ship with no portals to look out of.  Then I realized that this room in the West Wing was far far away from the casino and the things I enjoy doing, like working out at the Fitness Center or going to the pool.  

Speaking of the fitness center which is located in the spa and salon, it is fabulous for us gym rats on vacay!  It is huge, with a variety of machines, has a water fill up station, towels, free weights area and a stretch area with stability and medicine balls as well as free weights!  

Later that evening, when Dude and I returned to the hotel, he went to a separate line at the front desk for checked in guests and asked them if we could change rooms because of the room being far away and me not being happy.  We were lucky that the manager was sympathetic to his request as Dude said "he would be in the dog house with me".  We were quickly changed to a older room in the Grand Tower with a view of the roof and Mandalay Bay, my favorite hotel.

I have stayed in the MGM before the lion was removed at the entrance, many years ago and haven't stayed here since.  It still is a huge hotel to walk through and I'm glad we were able to get a room in the Grand Tower, that wasn't guaranteed so good customer service at the front desk and smooth check in.  However, the MGM needs to update their rooms in the Grand Tower to keep up with other hotels.  They have a sign in the bathroom about conserving water by hanging up your towels to reuse; however, there is a fridge which has drinks inside but you have to pay for them. The safe is hidden in one of the drawers of the nightstand which is totally unexpected

If you don't mind walking or having no view no window,  "West Wing" between The Crush and high roller area is your spot to reserve.  I, however, have other hotels to compare with and I prefer to stay elsewhere on future trips.  We only stayed here to be close to our friends, who are staying here.

Mgm is the cleanest hotel I've stayed on the strip. Booked a night here with a great deal. Resort fees was 40$. Check in was fast and friendly front desk clerk. She gave me 2 passes for hakkasan night club too! The room was clean. Very modern looking.  The bed was so comfortable. If I ever wanna look for a get away again. I'll stay here again.

This place was in the middle of renovations when I stayed in Vegas.  They charged my debit card a hundred dollars and my credit $300, instead of figuring a way to get that on my bosses card, as I was on a business trip.  The place was confusing and advertised restaurants were no longer in operation.  I liked my room fine and the little bar under the non smoking tower, but I found the service overall to be lackluster and nothing special.

Excellent hotel. Service at front desk was excellent and when we used their concierge service over the week we were there it was always a pleasure.

Grand Tower Room was roomy, clean and the beds were excellent, the most comfortable. 

No problems at all whilst we were there and the guys who worked the bar at Rouge were great company.

I just returned from my second stay at the MGM Grand and I really can't think of anything bad to say about it.  

I think the main reason we chose to stay here was the value of the place.  There were three girls in our room and it ended up being only $170 per person for a 3 night stay.  The rooms are simple yet modern with GREAT bedding.  We were on the 17th floor and had a nice view of the strip even though it was mostly construction...

My favorite part of the whole place is the new pool.  The main pool is nice because it's so big you can definitely find a spot somewhere.  If you want something much better, try Wet Republic, the MGM's new "ultra pool".  We were able to go on Friday morning and get in for free...not sure what the regular price is, but it's probably worth it.  There are really nice lounge chairs around the pool AND these great chairs that are actually in the pool.  Good drinks and an ok food menu.  They could have a couple more choices on the menu, because there were only 4 things (including $14 chips and salsa...what?!?).  I loved it though.  No screaming kids anywhere in sight and great service...soo relaxing.  

I think the MGM is one of the best hotels on the strip in it's price range.  It's not the Bellagio, but it's also not $500\/night.

Been to Vegas 3 times now & have stayed in different places each time. My biggest reservation about the MGM Grand & the main reason I have to give it 3 stars is because of the location! At the end of the strip, it loses its Vegas glamour! The view from some areas is the Hooters hotel, or even worse..desert, or the airport.

However, the actual Hotel is nice. Well equipped with nice restaurants, busy casino, shops, bars, nightclubs, & pools.

I ordered room service twice during my stay, the food was good & reasonably priced.

I also highly recommend the pool parties at Wet Republic. Even if you're not staying at the MGM, it's worth the hike over there!

I just spent 4 nights at the MGM and was pretty happy with it. This is one of those mega hotel\/casinos in Vegas like Caesar's and the Venetian. Expect a lot more people than in the smaller hotel\/casinos. MGM handles the big crowds well and the hotel is a real good value considering its location and amenities. I love the automatic blackout shades and the bed and linens are top notch.  You'll definitely get a good nights sleep at the MGM which you'll need after playing the tables or dancing at Hakkasan until the sun rises.

We checked in for my sisters birthday weekend!! The executive suite upgrade was wonderful. We all got our own beds!! Darla at the M-LIFE check in counter is great. She is so cheerful and positive. It made the beginning of our weekend so pleasant. She was informative, and just someone you would love to see to start things off right!! She's a keeper!!

I just love the MGM Grand  It is just so...functional. Good location, things work, it's diverse, people are nice, bars are cool, gaming is fun, crowd is upbeat, rooms are brilliant. 

This is definitely our go-to in Vegas. You really can't go wrong.

Upgrade!

First time staying at the MGM, and we get upgraded to one of the newer rooms. Score! I was impressed. Nicely decorated, decent size and automated blinds. I'm a sucker for automated anything, and the blackout blinds were a huge plus.

The bathroom was a great size and there were also plenty of outlets for all of our gadgets. The overall grounds are not my favorite, but there are plenty of amenities and restaurants to keep all types of people entertained. We noticed that many areas of the property were being updated, so I'm sure it will be even nicer in the near future. It is definitely one of the older hotels on the Strip, but still a classic. The monorail stop was a nice plus as well. 

It wouldn't be my first choice for hotel in Vegas, but the room was comfortable and the shows and food at this property are great. Looking forward to seeing it again in the future after the renovations.

Came here for a wedding and everything was fantastic from the decor to the service and the food.  MGM Grand definately gives you a luxury feel of a Vegas hotel - if you're looking for a cheap escape to Italy or France, there are other hotels to stay at.  We also saw Cirque du Soleil's KA there and the experience was amazing - KA had the most intrique set design that I've ever seen and the action packed sequences and acrobatics were definately edge of the seat!
This place s so bad , dealer are so fucking rude , I got the worst experience ever never go to this place anymore , such of bad customer service,

I did not stay in the hotel, only stopped in for a spin through the casino. This was one of the nicer atmospheres on the strip. The smoke was not out of control and there was a lot of places to eat and shop once inside. I'm sure I'll be back as this is my boyfriend's usual haunt while in Vegas, I'll be happy to explore more next time.

Simply too much money for what they offer.  The rooms are old and outdated (at least our wing was) Old CRT TVs, old toilets, tubs with problems and generally a lack of anything being nice and new.  (Again, for the money with what you can get elsewhere in Vegas) I didn't know it was so crappy like this at MGM so make sure you know and investigate before.  One positive is the bed was nice and comfy, but again, just too much money for what you get.  I will be staying elsewhere next year.

Although I am a Vegas veteran and have been to MGM many times, I stayed here for the first time this Christmas. We stayed in the West Wing for 2 nights. 

I had originally booked the very basic room, but at check in I was upgraded for free to the West Wing. (FYI - you can check in at the airport. Look for the MGM desk behind baggage claim.) The West Wing rooms were modern but small, reminding me of rooms in cities like NY and SF. The bathroom was especially cramped - no tub, little vanity space, toilet and shower separated by an opaque glass divider. We couldn't find room for the trash can without blocking the door of either the shower or the toilet closet. The room also featured a scale. Note to MGM - I don't want to weigh myself in Vegas. 

But I will say the West Wing is conveniently located with good signage directing you to it throughout the casino. One concern I had with MGM is that it would be too, too big, and the West Wing took you away from the monstrosity of the main hotel tower. 

I think MGM has one of the best sports books in Vegas, and I like the Stage Deli that is immediately next to it. The buffet was yummy (my surprising favorite selection? brussel sprouts!) and the food court had a Nathan's Hot Dogs! The pedestrian bridge between MGM and NYNY is a handy way to get to the other side of the strip. 

I'm convinced the lions on display are drugged, but interestingly the motorized alligator at the Rainforest Cafe seemed to be a more popular attraction. 

As far as fine dining, the selection there is growing. I've eaten at Emeril's place there and enjoyed it, but it was ten years ago so I don't feel I'm qualified to give a thorough review. The resident Cirque show, KA, is excellent. 

In a nutshell - MGM is a solid, albeit nothing special, choice.

Hey people DO NOT STAY at MGM GRAND the service is terrible rooms are dirty, showers don't work and the once do work water barely comes u can't even take a shower. They don't clean the rooms don't bring new towels , beds are not made and housekeeping is rude and they don't care. Very very bad stay away. I stayed here for last 20 years and this is last time.

I stayed here for a conference in a West King "suite."  The line was so long to check in they had seats for people that just couldn't stand any longer.  After waiting for 30 minuets to check in you have to walk down these long corridors to get to your room.  The hotel is HUGE.  For some reason the elevators on the West End are tore up on the inside.  Not sure whats going on in there.  The room itself was small and needed updating, but otherwise clean.  The TV lost signal all the time, and the walls are thin. For some reason the maids will just open up your door and do a room check. Bottom line the MGM Grand is old and needs a refresh (at least the West End dose). I would recommend staying at another MGM properly like the Vdara or ARIA.

Worst experience at a hotel I've stayed at, this includes one that had a mouse in the room. 

The blinds block ZERO, light meaning when the sun rises you are rudely awoken, something you don't want at 6am in Las Vegas. 

The windows of the room are made of some futuristic glass because it is so thin that on the nineteenth floor we were able to here car horns, trucks backing up and woo girls getting in and out of taxis. 

Finally we came to enjoy the lazy river, but were never told that during our stay that the hotel actually shut down the pool and lazy river, even through it was still 80+ degrees out. 

I highly recommend you avoid this resort and stay at one of the better resorts on the strip.

If I could give this hotel zero stars, I would. My sister in law checked in for us and we were guaranteed a room by 3pm and by 4pm a room still wasn't ready! She called and complained and then all of a sudden a room was ready. Then because we had so much stuff we needed a cart to help get everything up to the room but they don't allow you to bring the carts up yourself, so we had to wait well over an hour just to receive our belongings, and on top of that, you have to tip your bellhop! Then, our sinks were clogged and stunk of rotten eggs, and our air only worked one side of room and that took maintenance and room service over 2 hours to come tend to! Our pullout bed wasn't fully clean from the previous guests..and now to top it off, we are locked out of our room for the second time..but because my sister in law(whose name is on the room) isn't with us, they will not let us in our room! Even after we identified everything we own in our room! We have wasted so much time just sitting here waiting just to change! I know no staff member here gives two shits about this review but I hope other people read this and are swayed away from staying here! For how much money it is, it is not worth it at all whatsoever! Go somewhere who value their guests and who actually know how to handle a busy hotel! Quite frankly this has been the worst part of our trip, being in this bullshit hotel!

A. Stayed in a suite and it was worth the cabbage
B. I stay here about 75% of the time, 100% in the summer due to the pool
C. Casino is big enough and the patrons are pretty normal looking (except for the fat southerners)
D. Studio cafe is always a welcome sight at 5 am
E. The pool is the draw; tues-thurs there are obsese southerners there but on fri-sat, the nyc\/la crowd flocks and drunken good times ensue

I will always hit in the summer.

Was soll man zum MGM Grand noch sagen.
Unsere Top 1 bei Las Vegas besuchen.
Die Zimmer sind einfach nur spitze.

Loved it! The room was nice and modern! Just the way I like it! Bathrooms were clean and everything was just downstairs! Casino and food court!  In the early morning they brought us a 6pack fuji water since our room was a VIP member room and it was great! Scared the shit out of us but man the  water saved us! We called for so much stuff, q tips, towels, toothbrush lol. They probably hated us but they were so nice about it. 

We ordered room service at like 7 in the morning and the soup was gross, Hashbrown was great and the tenders were good. Overall, I would definitely stay here again! Far from stuff but walk able!

Did not stay here, but sure did play here.  Great table games, but 1 star for the pit boss telling us to "keep it down, no yelling" as we were having a good time.  No "yelling" in Vegas?  C'mon now, thats BS!  Yet, the table next to us was "ok" to yell.  I don't like to pull the racial card, but don't tell the Asians to keep it down and the White Boys to keep it up. HmmM...should of made a complaint, but decided against it as we wanted to enjoy ourselves.  Damn you MGM!

I've always wanted to stay at the MGM Grand Hotel. I thought bringing my daughter for a graduation present would be the perfect time to experience the hotel. MISTAKE!!!!
From the moment we stepped onto the MGM grounds it was HELL, the long lines and the rude customer service was very disappointing. I was aware that I would have to pay resort fees, but wasn't aware that I would have to pay a daily fee of over $100 for incidentals.
I didn't budget that into our trip and was pissed when the "lady" at the desk had no remorse or care. She continued to say that because I booked the reservation with a third party (Southwest Vacations) that's why I was being charged the additional fees. I book through Southwest Vacations every time I travel to Vegas and have never had a problem like this.

I was hoping things would get better once we finally got to our room, I was wrong. The vacation package folks are placed in what looked like the dungeon, it's called West Wing. This section is the worst, it was on the complete opposite side of the hotel. The West Wing carpet is disgusting,floors smell bad, there's no security on that end. They have a sign asking you to swipe your room key to enter, but it's broken. I couldn't sleep well at night knowing that anyone could just walk onto our floor. I also couldn't sleep well because house keeping banged on my door at 8am, wanting to clean the room. If, I could've changed hotels, I truly would've. This was the worst hotel experience EVER. I tried to make the best of this trip for my daughter (she' worked so hard in school and deserved to have a great trip),but this hotel made things unbearable for us.

There are several other hotels to choose from when booking a trip to Vegas, PLEASE DON"T CHOOSE THIS HOTEL.

If this was the 90's, I'd be rating this 5\/5 with pictures of me hiding in the displays scattered in our photo album.  Alas, now I just come here to gamble, which is why the 2\/5.

There's a lot of people here.  Always.  No matter what, we can never seem to get a seat at a table.  So we resort to the video roulette and slots, which equally are disappointing.  The only thing that's really giving this thing 1\/5 stars is the horse race.  I'd rate that 5\/5.  Hands down.

The other 1\/5 stars (for a whopping total of 2\/5) is for the size of the place.  It's sprawling and wide.  Definitely a larger sized casino, so plenty of walking around, which is nice.  

Parking is no bueno.  Can never seem to find a cocktail waitress.  Haven't dined here, so no comment on that, and haven't stayed here since I was a kid, so no comment on that either.  I'd recommend for families and all sorts of travelers though, they still have the lions and the rainforest cafe and all that fun stuff.  It's just not as fun for grown-ups.

I haven't have my own hotel room in... omg, I don't even remember when was the last time I have my own room?!

So I brought my lucky charm, to deter eeeviillll, and made sure I stayed up late with my coworkers so all I do when I head back to the room, is to sleep.

The room was nice and pretty good size.  I found the dead celebrity portraits a little disturbing.  There's a $10 resort fee, and they charge you to go to the exercise room.  What the _____?  Well, but then we got the $15 credit in drink, I guess that kind of offset it.

The 2:30am explosion next door at the Tropicana woke me up and I thought it was one of those 911 event and I was debating whether or not I should pack my stuff and bounce?!  But then I realized that the building would be crumbling by now if that's the case.

Anyhow, I kept having nightmare afterward.  Like ghostly nightmare.  That made me miss the bf and the dogs a WHOLE LOT MORE.  Nope, i do not want to have my own room next time, thank you.

As for hotel rooms, it's not the place you want to stay if you need to sleep between midnight to 6. We had loud drunk guests on our hall around 3-4am. I think the boxing matches have attractive a lower caliber crowd.  It's really a very, very large two star hotel with hundreds of vendors inside competing to take note of your money.

Nice hotel, very comfortable beds one of the best showers. Room felt a bit cluttered. Hated the glass doors for the toilet as it slammed closed each time I was too intoxicated to remember to baby it. Safe didn't work in the room, and the staff that worked for tips was great, the rest didn't seem to care. For this I will go pros and cons...

Pros: Trendy, modern rooms. Pricing was good. Hotel appears clean, and casino doesn't smell of cigarettes. Lion habitat was fun, and has monorail at the hotel.

Cons: Food court is far, and poor offering of choices. Elevators are positioned way away from rooms, and we had to walk far to and from the elevator. Smaller, cluttered room. Buffet charged my friend's card 9 times and it took 4 days to get it back. Staff seems unorganized, check in people were lined up, and a couple bypassed the line and they helped them anyway.

All in all I have to try another hotel next time. I once stayed at Emerial Palace though, and MGM is bounds better than them and many others.

I am writing this for my wife,  because if she wrote it out would be extremely ugly.  Took her,  and my son,  over an hour waiting in line to check in.  When she got to the desk,  she found that the email rate needed to be reserved on line and she would be gouged at the standard rate, which didn't include the resort fee, room tax, and $100 for incidentals. Others waiting in line were yelling because of the excessive wait times and heat. No water was available. My son has a headache from dehydration due to the lack of facilities. Now she finds out that the Lazy River area closed at 6 pm only to open at 10am after she leaves. My son's 11th birthday will be memorable for the terrible treatment and excruciatingly atrocious customer service. Stay away.
Amazing hotel!! Very easy to get lost in but there is lots to do any time of the day. Amazing pool and and great food! But beware when you check in, had to wait 40 minutes in line

I noticed the same thing at the Excalibur and New York New York also - also MGM properties: the doorman actually delays the boarding process of taxicabs rather than speeds it up. It seems to be just a way to gather tips by making you board one at a time and first asking you where you want to go, and then telling the taxi driver. Would have been 7-8 times more efficient to have 7-8 cabs pull up simultaneously and direct guests to the cab they should board, as they do in some great airports.

We stayed overnight at the MGM in Las Vegas on the way back from Lake Powell to So. Cal. First, the check in line was literally over 1 hour. We had to pay for an upgrade to get a decent room (hate to see what we might have gotten otherwise). There is no coffee available in the room. We will not stay in Las Vegas again, it's become so over priced and trashy. The bed was very cozy...that can be said.  Use caution when booking in Las Vegas!

We booked a 5-night stay (yeah, excessive for Vegas, I know!) in a room at the MGM Grand Tower. Now, I was aware that we'd saved a bit of money by booking their lower-end option. However, I don't think that justifies the lousy hotel quality.

Maid service was terrible. Regardless of the "Privacy Please" sign that we hung on the door, they knocked on our door repeatedly, and would open our door if we didn't answer the knocks. Sometimes they'd stop by early enough that this woke us up or interrupted us while getting ready for brunch. To top it off, they called us on our super-loud room phone in the afternoon to confirm that we didn't want our room tidied that day.

Maybe we were the ones being weird by not wanting them to come into our room for days at a time, but I think a hotel needs to be able to accommodate that. I know that you want our daily tips, but we paid for the room; let us stay in it!

Finally, the elevator smelled really, really bad. When your elevator smells vaguely of sewage for one afternoon, maybe it's a bad coincidence with smelly food or some frequent farters who are staying there on the same night. When the poovator stinks up the hallway up to 20 feet away, every single night of a 5-night stay, that is no coincidence; that's negligent building maintenance.

Despite the extremely smelly elevator, there were apparently cleaning staff in the Grand Tower at all hours, because we tried to sleep early on the night before our flight and were kept awake past 1 am by vacuums and other noises in the hallway.
Very comfy beds, cool photos on walls, great art deco carpet, Nathan's hotdogs, lion cubs friendly staff. Worst thing is drink prices in food court and cost in toiletries shop.

Seriously - can you make the parking further away from the casino?  It is a pain in the butt - especially if you go with three senior citizens (like my BF and I did).  We went during the rodeo (ugh) and there were cowboys everywhere.  The hotel is over priced and mediocre.  The casino is tight as well.

Carlos at Casino Bar is amazing...some drunk girl threw up and all the patrons were complaining about the smell (I thought was nonexistent) and were botching that drinks should be free even if u only put a buck in machine and that guy not only was juggling making drinks and calling a cleaner but dealing with these peoples who wanted FREE stuff.  Solid Guy!!!!  Great Service!

I've always loved staying at the MGM Grand Hotel in Las Vegas,  From the time I was a newly "legal" 21 to even a decade later.  It's a perfect middle-ground resort with something for everyone in my opinion. 
It's not as "chi chi" and pricey as some others on the strip, nor anywhere near as ghetto as some others (which shall not be named).  The rooms are always clean, spacious, and comfy!  Our kind sized bed was phenomenal on this last trip - I could stay in bed for days!
This recent trip consisted of a group of 17 of us (for a cousin reunion) and the reservations were able to get us all in our rooms quickly and ALL ON THE SAME FLOOR!  This was incredible since it was much easier to corral the group together in the central area of our shared floor and visit each others' rooms instead of picking a meeting place in the casino or lobby.  One cousin has a baby and the hotel brought them a mini fridge for them to store milk and baby foods.  
The pool area and lazy pool has long been my favorite thing about MGM.  There are plenty of pools to choose from - from a family and kid friendly pool to the raging pool party\/club at Wet Republic!  For $10 you can rent an inner tube to float along the lazy river for half the day.  That's really my fave place to hang out.  
On the way to the pool, there's a food court and several great eating options from the casual to the fancy.  It was easy for everyone to find something they wanted and come out to the pool to hang out afterwards.
After a looong night out on Sat. - we were pleased that the hotel offered us a 1\/2 day option with checkout at 6pm at a half-day rate!  This option proved invaluable to those of us with evening flights out. We were able to eat brunch, clean up, lounge around, and check out close to our flight time! 
It's definitely not my first nor last time at MGM!  Overall a gem of a deal on the Strip!

The service was better then the room and the room wasn't bad.  I've stayed in better rooms but to have the UFC fight right downstairs while I'm there and to get comped for that night and NYE I couldn't complain.  I even left my airport router there and was able to call and have it found and held for me on my next trip.  It was a bit of a pain in the ass process getting it back, but that will make it easier to remember next time.  I look forward to going into this resort whether I'm playing, eating, staying or seeing an event.
I love the smell of the MGM Grand in the morning. Smells like... bachelorette parties.

I just can't win with MGM. I have two previous reviews that range from awful to ok. The last time we stayed here was two years ago with my husband's company and the rooms that his boss booked were very nice. This time I booked one night in the West Wing. DO NOT BOOK A ROOM IN THE WEST WING.

WTF MGM? It is 2017 and you STILL have rooms that haven't been updated since I am assuming at least the late 1990's?? The West Wing King was listed for $125, but I got it for $80 with my M Life membership. It should have been listed for $50 and I should have gotten it for free!

You walk into the bathroom. I really should have taken pictures of this disaster. The sink and "counter" - more like ledge - are a shitty blue green glass. The paint\/glue\/whatever is under the glass was peeling or deteriorating somehow so there were black splotches everywhere. THERE IS NO COUNTER. We couldn't leave anything out in the bathroom cause there was no room. The toilet area had a door made of glass that didn't provide one ounce of privacy. The shower leaked water all over the bathroom floor. The towels felt like sandpaper. 

The room was TINY, just enough room for the king bed and a small desk and chair. My room at home is bigger than this one. The lighting was AWFUL. Super dark in the bedroom, and nasty, bright fluorescent in the bathroom. MIRRORS EVERYWHERE. Two mirrored walls in the bedroom, the walls next to and behind the bed were mirrors. 

The bed was like sleeping on a piece of wood. You are given two awful pillows, with one extra pillow in the closet that was somewhat better. Thankfully I brought muscle relaxers and was able to sleep, cause I could not get comfortable to save my life. If we had stayed more than one night I would have complained and asked to switch rooms, but it didn't seem worth the hassle for one night. I think I am done giving MGM a chance when booking rooms in Vegas.

My husband and I booked this room for two nights. (Monday and Tuesday) Before coming, I read plenty of reviews on Yelp and Expedia and knew that check in and check out COULD have been a nightmare! You have to expect this from a hotel that has over 6,000 rooms! We went with a plan. Instead of arriving at the usual check out time of 3, we arrived around 1:00. The line was not very long to check in during this time because we beat the check out crowd at 11 and check in crowd at 3. We bit the bullet and paid the $20 extra fee for early check in. Our whole check in time took about 20 minutes. Not very long compared to the 45 minutes that I've read on here! We were surprised by the $100 deposit fee for each night's stay, but once again it seems to be the norm here if you are staying on the Vegas strip. 

We arrived at our room and loved the layout and all the features it offered. We're not a fan of hotel pillows (too soft) so we brought our own. We loved our very comfortable king size bed. I especially loved the lamps on the nightstands because they had electric plug access. It made our phones easy to charge each night. Our view was looking towards the foothills and pool area. Still very pretty at night. The bathroom was spacious with a beautiful mirror. It served it's purpose for us. In my opinion, the BEST part of this hotel room was the blackout shades. With these down the first night there, my husband and I slept in till 11:00! We didn't even realize it was that late because the room was pitch black! We were exhausted from our ride there. 

Our room was cleaned and restocked with fresh towels on the day that we we were there. They also changed the linens and redid the bed. Loved how clean and fresh the room was. 

On check-out day, we opted to check out early at 9:00. Once again, we wanted to beat the crowd. We called the bellhop to come get our luggage and it literally only took them 10 minutes to get up to our room and collect our belongings. Our check out time didn't take long at all. 10 minutes max! When we went out to valet to pick up our car, the bellhop was already out there waiting for us. 

Overall, we had a GREAT experience at the MGM. It is called the MGM GRAND for a reason, it's MASSIVE, so be prepared to walk! 

PROS:

*great rooms at a fair price (we got a king for 75\/night)
*modern decor was aesthetically pleasing
*room shades
*clean
*good location (at the beginning of strip making it easy to get in and out of)
*you can call valet ahead of time if you are guest at the hotel and when you get down to pick up your car, you will be placed ahead of other guests - this was extremely helpful! 
*very attentive staff
*many restaurants to choose from 


CONS:

*pools are crowded and offers little shade
*it can get really crowded and busy because it is such a huge hotel 
*layout of hotel (most restaurants and pool is on the other side of hotel)
*weak WI-FI signal, if you want stronger, you have to pay an extra $15
*$25 resort fee to use the "cardio center" (we never saw this as we didn't care about working out on our vacation!), a daily newspaper, incoming and outgoing calls (big BOO for this)

I love the MGM Grand. I have always been a fan but I recently had an experience that put it over the top! 

I had made reservations online and secured the reservation with a credit card because I knew I would be arriving late. It turned out that I arrived even later than normal due to my flight in San Francisco being delayed. Anyways, I finally got to the MGM and must have looked exhausted. The front desk clerk asked about my flight and I told him I had been delayed and hadn't eaten because I was saving my appitite for my favorite LV restaurant. The clerk excused himeself to the back and came back and offered me an upgrade! THAT HAS NEVER HAPPENED TO ME BEFORE! I was so thrilled! 

The room was amazing. It was like a tiny apartment with a living room, seperate bedroom, and huge marble bathroom. So nice and the perfect spot to land after a hell'ish flight in. 

I spent the next day at the pool. The pool is really why I fell in love with the MGM. It is huge and has a current that you can ride around on all day going from water fall to water fall. They also have pool side cocktail service and allow drinks in the pool! 

This most recent time we happened to see a conecert there also. 

The MGM is really a one-stop-shop. Every visit I make to the MGM I swear I'll never leave!

Out of all my years of coming to Vegas this is THE WORST hotel in Vegas history. I'd been better off at a Marriott. From the crappy and worn rooms, no hot water and\/or luke warm showers, mediocre housekeeping and just lack of good service. I will never stay here again. Period

I had a great time at MGM. The rooms are clean and spacious. You do have to let housekeeping know that you want your sheets changed every day but they will do it. The restaurants are great, we tried a different restaurant every night. Still going to have enough time to go to the buffet maybe next time. I was too busy enjoying winning in the casino.

We enjoyed our night at the MGM. We checked in early and since a room wasn't available for us on a nonsmoking floor we were given an upgrade which was great. The room was clean and comfortable, but the hotel is huge! Rarely had enough time to explore, but we hope to come back soon. Our stay included a $50 credit to hotel restaurants which was also really nice.

We checked into the West Wing for a Saturday night stay (after a disappointing Friday night at the Luxor). The room was nice, but I'm not sure I liked the bathroom set up. No privacy at all. The bed was so comfortable, we fell asleep at 7pm and woke up at 7am (bummer that we missed a Saturday night out though!!). The hotel was a huge maze and the best part was the pool. I can't even remember how many pools they had, but the best was the lazy river. Plus, the pool wasn't crazy crowded and we could even find two seats next to each other. I'd definitely consider staying here again, but probably not in the west wing.

To all yelpers,

I had a really bad experience with the customer service team. Keeping a long story short, me and my gf bought tickets for our anniversary to watch KA. We notified staff in regards to our experience with the people around us they offered to refund back the price of one of the tickets . That was nice of them said it would take 7-10 business days . I didnt think much of it 1 month later nothing so I got transferred and stayed on call for 1 hour to hear from upper mgmt telling me there was a computer glitch but it is being processed now . Being in banking knew it was complete bs !!! I advised mgmt after being on the phone that long I rather be told the truth , that you guys didn't process it. Long story short we start getting into it and at the end he ( which out of respect will be nameless) terrible service mgmt needs training . Admitted to me that the guy I spoke with didnt process it. Just annoyed  No protocol ...... Bad experience from staying here with customer service to box office . Never again .

Ive watched this casino & hotel change over the years. I personally really like the place! Especially since their rooms have been renovated into a fancier & modern theme. But! Their prices have stayed on the lower spectrum. Mgm also has one of the funnest pools (multiple, rafts, lazy river you can drink in). Us locals wish we dont need a roomkey to enjoy the pool though. Its really family friendly yet caters to those who came to party. One of the main downsides is the inconvenient parking garage. How annoying it is when you forget something in your car! Theres fat tuesdays, a CSI attraction, food court, romantic restaurants, & more. Besides, its in the center of vegas!

This place is HUGE!  We wanted a place which is kids friendly.  With 5 different pools and a lazy river, my son was having a blast!  As with any large casinos in the area, they REALLY don't want you to leave.  It has many restaurant choices with good selections, including a food court.  If you don't have a rental car, there is monorail stop at the hotel also.  All and all, we had a great time.  Oh yeah.. the casino is good too of course.

I just got back from another great stay at the MGM Grand! I am always surprised at the low ratings this place gets on Yelp. We used the Airport Check-in and got our room set up just the way we wanted, including getting a room early.  If you are flying into Vegas, take advantage of this service because the lines at the hotel front desk are crazy long!

The MGM is huge, but contrary to other reviews on here, I believe it is well designed and easy to navigate. I use a wheelchair and it never takes me more than a few minutes to get anywhere on the property.  Just a reminder to all my Yelp friends out there...ALL casinos are designed to make you walk by those pretty little Slot Machines as much as possible. That's how they make their money. Don't expect anything different.

Our room didn't have all the bells and whistles of some Casinos, but at $49 a night, I am not complaining. It was well designed for a wheelchair user, except for the Shower, which had the bench, hand held unit and the controls all jammed into one corner, which would've made things a little difficult if I'd been alone.  Luckily, my Girlfriend and I turned it into a positive (wink, wink!). Ok, sorry if that was Too Much Information.

Every time I've stayed here the staff has been friendly and helpful. This trip was no different.  When we had problems with our Rental Car (no fault of MGM), the Concierge we spoke with went out of her way to help us!

The MGM provides quality accommodations, great Customer Service and outstanding convenience to Las Vegas visitors. It continues to my first choice on my trips to Sin City!
At least 250$ a night and they nickel and dime you and a coke is 3$ at the 15$ black jack tables. Not very impressed. Although, some of the staff is nice. Located in a great place.

What is with the horrible potpourri smell they are pumping into the casino?  Made me sick. We left after 5 minutes.

I was here a little over a year ago and was not nauseated by the smell.  However, when I arrived here last weekend, I walked in and immediately had to walk out.  We had to pass through the casino multiple times, but never stopped to gamble or eat b\/c the old lady perfume smell was giving me a headache.  

Please stop pumping this horrific smell into your hotel\/casino so that I can stop and stay for a while on my next visit.  Thank you.

I understand that most hotels have some sort of air freshener type sent because of the smoke, but this is just really strong and really bad.  Worse than any other hotel I went to on the strip.  Unbearable.

I noticed the mixed reviews, so I had concerns about staying here - but I enjoyed it! I think it may be about the room location: I stayed in the Grand Tower, which is the closest to the main area.  With the heat outside  reaching 115 degrees, it was nice to be in the biggest hotel\/casinos adjacent to the other hotel\/casinos.  Check in was easy, checkout was crowded (but I avoided it), the room was clean and nicely done,  and the lazy river is awesome.  And I assisted David Copperfield with one of his illusions - maybe that's why I liked the place...

My wonderful stay began at check-in. While standing in line, I noticed an area for M Life members and wondered why that line was shorter than the one I was standing in. If you've never been to MGM Grand, they have huge screens behind the check-in desk that flash various attractions in the hotel. A "commercial" for M Life just happened to show and said check out Mlife.com. I figured I should check it out right then and there on my phone.

In the span of 5 minutes, I became a member of M Life and secured a lower hotel room rate for my stay! The best part was the front desk employee who honored my new reservation. I saved $100 just by joining M Life.

My hotel room was decent (view totally sucked, but who cares since I saved $100). The beds were comfortable and clean. I thoroughly enjoyed the pool area (stayed out there for four hours and was probably in the lazy river for an hour). The tube rental price, however, should be a little less ($16 for the day, but it goes down to $10 after 1 p.m.)

My only negative is the shower. The water temperature was fine the first day; the second day it took a few before it warmed up. On the third day, however, it never warmed up. We called maintenance and within a few minutes, the water began warming up. I'm not sure if they control the water temperature remotely, but a maintenance person did show up to fix a problem that seemed to correct itself.

I absolutely LOVE the toiletries! They have the best smelling lotion out of any hotel I've ever stayed in. I also enjoyed the shampoo and conditioner.

Breakfast buffet is fabulous. If you go right before they are about to switch over for lunch, you'll get to taste some great food as well. I almost forgot about Fat Tuesdays downstairs. If you love to drink, stop by here, buy a refillable container and drink away (don't forget the extra shot for $1!)

This is my third time staying here and I don't see any reason to stay anywhere else -- unless the room is free!

This is primarily a review of the hotel. My friend and I stayed here over a long weekend after thanksgiving. The check in process was relatively painless, and the desk staff was very friendly. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and very pleasant. Lots of good restaurants inside, some great shows including Copperfield, and easy access to the monorail. The prices were very reasonable, although I am sure coming during an "off" weekend helped. Able to check out electronically, which was a nice perk. Would definitely stay here again.

Came by for a 1 night stay the other night at the MGM and the experience was world class!

Signed up for e-mail offers and made a reservation for a regular room + $10 for an upgrade to an Executive Suite. Upon arrival, the line of ~40 folks was relatively quick at ~15 minutes. Did the $20 trick to my front desk agent, Paige, and she went to work, first upgrading me to a 1 Bedroom Suite, then to the Grand Marquis 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom pool table 1500+ sq ft suite.

The room itself was the largest and most luxurious suite that I've enjoyed in. There were a few minor hiccups, one of the in-room safes was non-operational and one o the 4 LED TVs were non-operational...all 1st world problems...

Check out was a breeze with Express Checkout via my Mobile phone.

The walk from Self-Parking can be quite a trek...do valet if you have a lot of luggage!

i really like this hotel. it is nothing super special about it but it always fits my needs. the beds are really comfortable and i loved their suites before they got remodeled because they had a nice suede pillow that they have since taken out of the rooms. never had a complaint staying here. i love the mgm hotel chain. every mgm hotel ive stayed at has treated my well. everytime i decide to stray from them i get slapped in the face. so take it from someone who knows, this hotel chain is just the greatest. i love that you can use their mlife card in all their hotels and rack up points to even greater benefits. i have won at the casino a few times at this specific hotel as well. i think the odds are pretty generous. all in all it is a great hotel.

Stayed for valentines day weekend, thought me and my wife got a good deal on a room for the weekend I  was way off. Stayed in the west wing way in the back thought we were staying with the help lol room was really small bathroom pretty much a glass door with hardly any privacy. Small vanity area for my wife to do her makeup Won't be staying here again. Only good part of our stay was the casino it had a awesome atmosphere very lively. Maybe I'll come 2 play but not to stay.

This Hotel is very fun atmosphere nice clean rooms except for the west wing thats the dungeon! Lol those rooms are dark drab and depressing always stay at the Grand TowerIf i have 1 complaint it is all the Shady activity at night seems like Security doesn't care if there's pimps and prostitutes everywhere they just turn the other way and let it happen maybe they just feel it's easier not to do their job!!i think this makes its an uncomfortable and unsafe environment late night when walking back to your room being approached by so many shady characters. This makes me sad because I used to give this place such high props

I really like this hotel over all..but like with anything there is a mix of good and bad.

Positives: 
1. This hotel is very clean.
2. The staff are very friendly and helpful
3. There is a wide variety of dining options.
4. The pool is fantastic.
5. Free parking.

Negatives:
1. Very over priced. If they can find a way into your wallet, they'll do it..
2. Lots of hidden fees...upon checking out you find out there is a "resort fee" of $30 per person plus tax. This is complete BS in my opinion..I mean come on wtf is a "resort fee"; we've already paid once.
3. It reeks of smoke everywhere..I guess that's a Las Vegas thing, but still it was gross.
4. It was sketchy on the strip in front of the Hotel..at night it's very dimly lit and there is no security.

Wrong...just wrong. 
One huge reason.

We came from LA for a wedding at the hotel and decided to stay here for the weekend. It was convenient and we thought that it would be nice to try a different hotel on the Strip. We usually do the Monte Carlo which has always been fun. Everything was going fairly well until.....

We woke up at 3am to a HORRIBLE and NOXIOUS smell emanating from the hallway. It was soooo bad, there really are no words. When we called downstairs to find out what was going on, the front desk said that they would take care of it. 

As we were both, at this point, wide awake, tossing and turning in bed and fighting back nausea, we decided to leave the room and go down to the casino, giving the odor a chance to go away. So we trekked down the quarter mile hallway to the elevators where we could STILL smell it. Aaaahh! When we got down to the first floor (from th 11th) we could STILL smell it. I can only describe it as the funk of forty-thousand years, but this was no Thriller. 

Finally, we realized that there was no escape from the horror of this experience, so we decided to just go home. At 4:00am, we started the 4 hour drive back to Los Angeles.

Upon checking out, I informed the nice lady at the front desk that we were leaving due to the bad bad smell that had infiltrated our room. She then proceeded to tell us that a lot of other guests had  checked out that same night because of the same smell. When we asked what could possibly be causing such a bad smell, she said......wait for it.....wait for it.... THAT THEY WERE CLEANING THE RESTAURANT. NO! Say it aint so. That such a smell could be coming from a place where people eat. What's worse, that such a smell could travel up 11 floors to our room, wake us up, and force us to cut our trip short to drive back to Los Angeles before the sun came up. 

Unfortunately our two night stay was over $400, and we only got our resort fee comped which was $22. Wrong, just wrong. 

I'm sorry MGM I really wanted it to work, but after that experience, I can't ever go back.

Ok, unless you want a hot shower when it's busy. Went on a weekend in May when the hotel was full, and at both 10am and 7pm the water was tepid at best. And yes, front desk person, I let it run. Not your fault, of course. 

The rooms aren't cheap. Management should be able to afford an upgraded hot water heater.

We stayed here on our recent Vegas trip.  Their renovation is almost finished and everything looks great.  Best of all, they freed those lions!  It's about time!  Our room was very nice and looked great.  One thing: be sure to wipe down those headboards!  They're beautiful but I don't want to see smudges of questionable origin anywhere in my hotel room, let alone near where I sleep!  The spa is great.  HUGE pool area.  Lots of restaurants to choose from in the hotel.  The waitresses are still some of the most attentive in Vegas.  The casino itself is enormous and offers plenty of gaming choices.  No loose slots this time around, though.  Must be paying for that renovation!

Most fun slot machine on this trip: Grease!

Avoid room service.  We thought about having breakfast in the room one morning only to find that eggs, bacon and pancakes go for $29 plus tip and room service fee.  That is RIDICULOUS.  We passed on those prices and found breakfast elsewhere.

The rooms are nice. Always clean. The hotel hallways are scented which is great because I hate the smell of cigarettes. Not the best buffet in town. When there is a big fight in town valet shuts down. Lots to do here.

I've stayed at the MGM Grand on business twice in the last 2 months and found it to be less than grand on both occasions. There were 3,000 people from my company at the first event in June and virtually none of the coworkers that I know liked the hotel; like me, almost none of them wanted to come back to the place at our most recent company event in September.

For starters, the hotel rooms on both visits were extremely bland, if not outdated. They have worn carpet, ugly wallpaper and limited wall power outlets. There were so many other things plugged into the outlet by the room's only desk that I had to unplug one of the room lamps in order to charge my laptop and\/or cell phone.

The bathroom on my second visit was absolutely gross. While "clean," there were long, black hairs EVERYWHERE...on the floor...on the counter...even on the hand towels. On two of the three nights I was there I had to use a towel to mop the hairs off the floor. I finally realized that they must be coming from the cleaning staff.

The other thing that everyone in our company hated was that you have to walk for at least 10-15 minutes in order to get anywhere in the hotel complex (except the casino floor of course). To get to any of the meeting rooms or exhibition hall is nearly 15 minutes from your room. The pool area isn't much closer.

The shops are hideously over-priced with thin, cheap "party" shirts made in China selling for as much as $190. I forgot a couple of personal health products at home and paid $15 for a box of Rolaids (3 x tablets) and a box of Tylenol (2 x tablets). So definitely don't forget any items that you can buy at home or it will cost you through the nose.

There is a food court with fast food options, but be warned, you get what you pay for; there are lots of young, loud-mouth punks posturing and trying to show off. In general, the MGM Grand seems to have a lot of young "party people" trying to vacation on a budget. The food court is okay for breakfast, but avoid it for lunch or dinner. Unfortunately, the other restaurants are mostly high-end places where you can easily drop a C-Note per person on dinner.

The casino floor is actually the nicest part of the entire complex. It is clean, well-lit and I can smoke cigars at most of the tables. The only complaint I have is that there aren't enough $5 tables, and then, they only open around 10pm or so. I like to gamble, but am no high-roller by any means.

All in all, I don't care much for the MGM Grand. It is large (6,000 rooms), too spread out, over-priced and appears to cater to the young, unsophisticated travelers who equate "quality" with spending a lot of money. Our company has taken us to the Venetian in the past and I would much, much rather go back there. And the next time I go back to Vegas for pleasure I will definitely stay at another venue that nicer and more updated.

Horrible....parking is overpriced....bathroom had broken sink and shower...maintenance came up to fix the sink and left water running...came back an hour later and water everywhere!  Staff tried to make things right but not good enough in my opinion.  Horrible location.  Won't be back.

I had previously reviewed the MGM Grand in Las Vegas and gave it four stars. Well, after staying there for five nights and experiencing all the bullshit we went through, it got dropped down to two stars. And that's ONLY because the staff there was friendly.

So we lock in the rate of $50 per night in February to travel in May. We book a king bed. When we get there--"we're all out of king beds, we can upgrade you into the west wing for no charge. But a lot of people don't like the west wing, so if you don't like it, we can move you guys tomorrow." Okay fine, we go to the west wing..even though I've been told by many people the West Wing rooms are shitty. So we get to the room, it's a dingy piece of crap. You walk in and literally walk right into the bathroom. Plus the room is SMALL!  

So the next day, we call the front desk. They say we can move between 2 and 4pm. So I check back at 2 they tell me to check back at 3:30. I call back at 3:30, "okay we can move you to a king room (WHICH IS WHAT WE ORIGINALLY RESERVED!)--however it will be an hour before a bellhop can get your bags." Are you f'ing kidding me!??! An hour!!?? Christ, I know the hotel is big, but still! We wound up carrying our bags from the West Wing to the front desk. Anyone who has stayed there knows that's a long freaking walk!  We complained to the front desk and told them at this point, we'd rather be staying at South Point (where we usually stay.) They got a manager and upgraded us to a suite.

So we get to the new room, turn the A\/C on full blast and head out for our anniversary dinner at the fabulous T-Bones Steak House in Red Rock (read my review for that!)  We get back to the room around 11:00pm and it feels like we walked into a goddamn sauna! I call the front desk to let them know our A\/C is not working. Okay,  we'll have someone right up. Couldn't give me a time frame. So now it's midnight, we're both tired so we call back and tell them to forget about it. Unbelievable. The A\/C works, but it worked half-assed. The TV sucked as well, they're not HD TV's and the picture was very fuzzy. Also, our room safe was competely useless since the battery on it was low, so we couldn't use it. We also had no Do Not Disturb thing for the door, so I made one myself. If I called the front desk to ask for any of these things to be fixed, I'd probably be still waiting.

Oh it gets better. The kicker was the next night when we get into the elevator. There are like four people on the elevator, we are on the 11th floor. The four other people get off at 6. The elevator goes to 10 and then DROPS two floors. My wife and I had our lives flashing before our eyes. The elevator made a creaking noise and just dropped! Reminded me of the old Edge at Six Flags Great America.

We went to the Rainforest Cafe here one night, it was ok, nothing special. The lines for the breakfast and dinner buffets were absolutely ridiculous. We waited over 30 minutes for breakfast on a Tuesday morning and over 45 minutes for dinner on a Monday night. On Friday, we went to the Rio Buffet (The best I've ever had, again read my review for that) and waited all of 2 MINUTES. Take that! 

Again, I only gave this place two stars because the employees are very friendly especially the dealers in the poker room. Stay away from here. Go to South Point instead.

Is it possible to give zero stars. If so, MGM is a complete zero. Dirty. Broken mirror in the bathroom, broken lamp on the bedside table and broken AC. The bedside table is dirty with some white substance. Don't venture to guess. The staff, customer service isn't in their vocabulary. Stay somewhere else.

Wanted a good little getaway to Vegas with my wife and friends. Stayed at MGM before and loved it. Very disappointing with this trip as it started with the check in. 2 hour wait to check in is ridiculous. We checked our bags and came back later only to find the line was longer than before. 

They set up cheap rates but then you get hit with resort fees (about $30\/per night). Seems like everything is nickel and dime to the consumer now. They now charge for parking plus charge for a late check out. Everything comes with a price. 

It wouldn't be all that bad if the rooms were nice, but the West Wing is not something I'd stay in again. 7ft tall ceilings and endless hallways make you feel like you are stuck in a maze. The rooms are small, and bathrooms barely have any counter top space for any type of bag and it's right by the room entry door and no door to the bathroom.  

Casino is nice, but the table limits just keep raising the bar. Didn't gamble here much as Downtown had the $5 tables and MGM was starting at $10-15.  

We had a great trip to Vegas and plan to return, but staying somewhere else.

The Service: Front desk staffs were friendly; however, service was not efficient. Arrived before 3pm check-in time, however still waiting in line for over 20 minutes when there were only 6 people in front of me. 

Walking in the hallway, none of the housekeepers acknowledged or greet any hotel guests.

The Room: Rooms at West Wing are old and outdated. Deluxe room has no bath tub, no coffee machine and no refrigerator. Room is not well maintained. 

The Parking: Valet parking (free, tips only, however, can be a long wait) and Self-park (free, about 5 minutes walk to the lobby)

Let's start with the good:
1. Front desk was fast and efficient. Husband and I got to Vegas Friday around 10:30 pm and there was a long-ass line for check in, (maybe 3 or 4 rows deep) but it probably took around 15 - 20 minutes. Once we got to the front, it was one of the fastest check-in process we've ever gone through.
2. Front desk lady was so nice and helpful, also upgraded us to a grand tower for free since they ran out of non-smoking rooms. (We were supposed to be in a west wing room which is smaller) Wish I got her name! 
3. The hotel itself is clean and easily navigated. Clear signs and directions. 
4. A lot of options for food ($$$$ to $) and most of them open late or 24 hours. There's a Project Pie here - easily one of the best deals on the Strip.

The bad:
1. The buffet was so bad. $40 for a Saturday dinner - not worth it at all. Most of the items are either too salty, too dry, or too sweet. Towards the end of my meal I felt queasy and it wasn't from eating too much; something in the food gave me mild food poisoning. 
2. I'm still a little pissed as I'm writing this. This hotel has possibly the thinnest walls out of all I've ever stayed at. The first night I thought, hmm they put us on a floor with the loudest most obnoxious people it seems. The second night, it became clear that I could hear ANY kind of noise outside my room, whether it's right outside the door or at the end of the hallway. While I understand it's not the hotel's fault that people are loud, I feel that they should keep in mind this is VEGAS. People party and come back drunk; some of them get loud and obnoxious. Why can't they make the walls and door a little more soundproof? 
We were put on the 9th floor, in a room with a connecting door. Around 5:45 a.m on Sunday, a couple hours before we had to wake up and drive back to LA, someone in the room next to us took a shower, then proceeded to use the blowdryer. I could hear the WHOLE fucking thing. The shower noise woke me up and I seriously thought someone went into our room and took a shower; it was that loud. I could also hear a guy moaning, and talking, appreciating his wife\/ girlfriend\/ booty call's body as she came out of the shower. Disturbing.

Bottom line, if you're not planning on sleeping during your Vegas trip, MGM Grand is for you. If you're an old fart like me who goes to Vegas for relaxation, find another hotel.

Well, I do have fond memories of this hotel from 16 years ago but this trip was the reality check that it has aged in the "not so gracefully" way.  It is tired and smokey and just filled with drunk 20-somethings.  We did not stay here this trip, we came in to go to dinner at a restaurant there.  The restaurants were dead.  I felt bad for them.

This was my first time staying at MGM, and my second time to Vegas. Previously, I have stayed Downtown at the Cal. The MGM is HUGE, first of all. If you are old or traveling with someone old, or with a child, or have physical problems walking, you should probably request a room closest to the elevator as the hallways are really long. We stayed in the Grand Tower and were there with our 2 month old and were able to upgrade to a room about 5 rooms away from the elevator area.
Overall, our experience was just ok. The only real good thing was that all of the staff we encountered were really nice and the lion in the lobby was cool.
Our room, although supposedly non-smoking, reeked of cigarette smoked. Which was really shitty being that we were with our 2 month old baby. The air conditioner just circulated the stink around the room so that sucked. We didn't have hot water in our shower until the last day we were there. We paid $100 to have a small fridge brought into our room so we could refrigerate the baby's formula, and even at the lowest setting all the bottles froze. 
Just a warning to people who have never stayed here before. Your mini fridge will be stocked with all kinds of goodies (soda, Jack Daniels, champagne, even a can of "love" goodies) but don't pick anything up! The mini fridge is computerized, and everything you lift up they will charge you for. We didn't realize this at first, we were going to use the fridge to store the baby formula and we were kind of in awe of all the stuff in the fridge so we were lifting everything out to look at it and see what we could move. Well we came across the tag on the door that said anything removed from fridge will be automatically added to your bill. We called the front desk and they were able to reset the fridge for us and did not charge us thankfully. Just be warned.
The casino is massive. Just when you think you've seen the gaming area in its entirety, I guarantee you you have not...And the odds are awful. The slots are not forgiving, and there were no winners while I was there. Maybe some small fry wins (100-200) but nothing big. Terrible place to gamble, IMO.
There are lots of good restaurants. I had my two year old and my husband along, so they had to stay in the room while I got takeout. My favorite was the Grand Wok. Lots of options throughout the hotel though, from casual food court stuff to fine dining (Morimoto, etc.)
Overall it was an ok experience. I felt like the MGM was a grand money-suck, but then again it's Vegas so what do you really expect.

We just got back form 5 nights in Vegas at the MGM.  I was getting worried because of all the negative reviews on here, but as usually that was all in vain.  No worries here, we LOVED it!!!  However, we did get off to a bumpy start, but it was soon rectified.  My husband and I went to Vegas with another couple, so we had booked 2 rooms, (1 smoking, 1 non-smoking).  Upon arrival at the hotel (about  11am) we checked our bags with a bell hop, which we actually didn't have to do because we paid $20 extra for early check in, so we went right to our room.  But the bell hop was free, we just tipped him and then they brought the bags to the room in about 5 minutes.  So we didn't have to schlep them, which was kind of nice.  We got a room on the 8th floor.  Our friends got a room on the 20th floor.  I kind of thought to myself that they would probably have a better view, but I was trying to be positive.  Well, I was right!  We get to our room and open the curtain and it's a giant stucco wall!  Our friends immediately call us and tell us how freakin'  awesome his room was.  I was LIVID!  I booked this entire trip, made all the reservations and paid the same price they did for a "City View" room!!!!  I called the front desk and they told me to call back around 3.  I wasn't happy, but we got changed and went down to the pool. 
The pool complex at the MGM is amazing.  They have about 5 pools, including a lazy river.  Music is playing, tons of chairs and plenty of bars!  But drinks are EXPENSIVE!  We paid $34 for 2 drinks.  Ridiculous!  I didn't even get a slight buzz.  This was the only time all week we made it to the pool.  I wish I had 3 more days just to lay by the pool.
After the pool I went back down to the front desk.  I told them my story and we got a room on the 20th floor.  I had already unpacked a little in the old room, so I threw everything back in the suitcases.  I felt like criminal running form the police!  So we ended up schlepping our bags anyway, our friends helped us move to our new room.   The 20th floor was a smoking floor, but you would never know.  We never smelled any cigarettes.   They must have a super deluxe exhaust fan that was probably the incessant humming I heard.  The beds were so amazingly comfortable I fell asleep in moments and didn't hear the humming anymore.  I was very happy with our new room.  However, our friends' view was still slightly better than ours!
