It was kind of crap, with an ancient TV set with loose cables that we had to keep adjusting in order to get a clear picture, and shower heads positioned for Prince.  Given that my companion and I are both quite tall, showers were an exercise in contortion that would've qualified us for Cirque du Soleil tryouts.

Uh, yeah, there are lions downstairs.  You can see those without paying to stay here.  You can also go to the restaurants and shows here without paying to stay here.  Now that I'm a grown-up, I'll be moving on to one of the nicer options farther up the Strip.

Nobody I know stays here, but after I stayed here - I quite enjoyed it. The staff is friendly, the hotel guests are relatively young and affluent. WET Republic is a top 4 pool party in Vegas, behind Tao Beach, Surrender, and maybe Rehab. Their is plenty of food options and the food court is very affordable. There are always big fights and events here. It's close to the airport. The only downside is it's far from Tao and the Northern Strip which has much more to do for us mid twenty somethings. Overall a great hotel though. I still prefer the Venetian though.

Great rooms! Very clean and comfortable. Only 2 negatives with our room would be that the adjoining room door is very thin. Our neighbors were up partying until at least 5:30 am. Again...I know it's Vegas, but we were in town for the 50th Anniversary SEMA show for work and needed our sleep. It sounded like the neighbors were literally in my bed. And for a non-smoking floor, why did it smell like a bar???

They messed up our Suite... we booked it online and when we showed up Friday 3\/16\/12, they didn't have it for us.

SERIOUSLY?!

They gave us 2 smaller rooms instead and $100 credit for both rooms each night. 

Well.. can you just credit the rooms instead? 

No.. just the $100 credit for both rooms each night so you have a total $400. 

This is effin bulls*@#! Everyone has to split up now rather than having one huge suite to party in. And they won't even credit our rooms!!

Oh well.  Guess that's $400 to spend on alcohol!!

So disappointed this trip. We stayed in a grand kin g room. Never again! It's so tiny and so hot in the room and you cant adjust the thermostat below 65. seriously MGM? We're in the middle of the desert and you lock the lowest possible temp at 65?  I called front desk several times about it as it affects breathing and they sent me a service man at 1:00 in the morning. Really? You said right away at 9:00 and he shows up banging on my door atv v1:00 am only to tell me the thermostat cant go below 65.  I'm so undecided if I would go back here or not.  First time I stayed here we got an executive suite and were treated like royalty. I feel we were completely ignored this time around because we didn't book a suite. Very disheartening.

Our "SUITE" was awful!!!

The outlets were falling out of the walls, the room smelled awful, and the room was VERY dated.

WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!

The staff was very nice and friendly.  We stayed in a Grand King and my parents were in the One Bedroom Suite.  Very nice and comfortable renovated rooms and the staff was very nice.  I just don't like having to pay, in addition to the room rate, a $25 per day Resort Fee.  I was told the Resort Fee is mandatory and it covers the use of the business center, ability to print boarding passes, the cardio room, pool, and the USA Today newspaper delivered to your room every day.  I was also shocked to learn the rooms, including the Suites, do not include a coffee maker.  I was told by Concierge that I can order a pot of coffee every morning for $23.  I opted to just purchase a $15 coffee maker from the local Target.  I also didn't appreciate not getting complete information from the front desk at check-in.  It wasn't until the day before checking-out, I was informed by someone at Valet, that as a guest, I can call from my room and request to have my car brought out in order to reduce the average 30 minute wait time.

I stayed at the MGM Grand for five days two weeks ago and had the time of my life. From the time we checked in to the time we checked out it was amazing. Checking in barely took five minutes. Checking out took less than two! 

We got to our room on the 22nd floor without any hassle. The room itself was gorgeous. The view was incredible. We had two queen sized beds full of fluffy pillows and amazing comforters. After nights spent gambling and partying it was very refreshing to be able to come back to a comfortable beds.

The hotel is huge. It's easy to get lost, but there are signs throughout the hotel to help you on your way, plus the staff is really friendly. This hotel has a great selection of restaurants and nightlife from clubs to lounges and they have cute shops too. They have a few different pools, but they can get pretty crowded. I recommend getting there before noon if you plan on swimming, before it gets too crowded. 

The worst part was the number of children running around. But I can't blame that on the hotel, I blame the parents who thought a place nicknamed "Sin City" would be a good place to take their children.

Overall I found my stay to be quite pleasant. I would stay there again.

Would like to have given five stars: 17th Anniversary MGM Grand, Las Vegas, Long Time Customer
We visit Las Vegas yearly for our anniversary. For our 17th we returned to MGM Grand (where we spent our honeymoon). We have stayed at MGM Grand 15-20 times and various MGM Grand properties perhaps 40 times. Fabulous trip other than morose clerk & buffet.

MGM has a beautiful grand pool complex, several pools,lazy river, whirlpools, waterfalls, beach shops, 5 bars & outdoor restaurant + 2 additional adult pools (The Wet Republic (PRICEY, long lines, loud, impolite staff & questionable practices), and a private pool which requires a fee (the fee is for the padded chairs, nice quite beautiful area). I recommend all of the pools, (including rental of pod, cabanas, day bed, most pod, Cabana, day bed rates are a food and beverage minimum that you may spend anyway and on busy days spend a half hour of more looking for a chair crammed in with a bunch of other people) With the EXCEPTION of The Wet Republic, NEVER The Wet Republic.

Our planes were delayed, thus arrived several hours late & our room of choice was gone but the reservation desk promised that we could move to a Wellness room or Suite in the morning after 11:00 am. At 11:00 am there were tremendous lines. We were guided to the Wellness office to check in for VIP. The pompous snippy clerk at the Wellness office said even though we are M Life Gold Members with an M Life Credit card they no longer honor room upgrades, we received a lower level strip view room NOT a wellness room or suite. 

MGM has an outstanding huge casino, beautiful pools, inviting spa (pricey) and salon, outstanding sports book (we bet on & watched the Predators game), convenient essentials (pricy) shops, excellent concierge service (you may purchase tickets for any of the MGM properties), descent shopping, fine, casual, buffet and in room dining, Starbucks and other quick bites, & uber, cab and limo's available. Don't recommend Hakkasan night club (replaced studio 54) nor Hakkasan restaurant. This time the buffet was very bad, it is usually great.

Stayed here last week for a work event. The hotel is clean and the smell of smoke isn't as bad as other hotels on the strip. The room was clean and the bed and pillows were comfy. The AC never really got the room down to the temp that I wanted, so I'm not sure how well it would work during the summer heat 

The conference center at the hotel is roughly a half mile walk from the hotel, so be prepared to do some walking. 

There is a food court that has some fast food options, which isn't bad for Vegas.

We booked through Expedia and upgraded to a "StayWell" room, which seemed like it would have everything we needed. We were staying for several days, and planned on being able to keep drinks and possibly leftovers to reheat later, since we planned to do a "foodie tour" of Vegas. (We're not rich people and planned on doing very little gambling.) Upon check-in, we learned that there were no refrigerators (except the ones stocked with egregiously priced "amenities") or microwaves in our room, despite the upgrade we paid for. On top of that, we were charged a $400 "deposit fee", despite the fact that we had already paid for our room in full, AND a "resort fee" despite the fact that we didn't use the resort. So basically, they took half of our trip money. The Staywell room was just a typical room, I've stayed in other towns for WAY less money and had FAR more amenities. (Seriously, what kind of greedy establishment charges $25\/day for a refrigerator?!) We thought about getting room service, but the prices were absolutely offensive...($18 for chips and salsa that cost like $5 at the store and then they add on a $4.99 "fee" for God knows what per person AND a gratuity?!) The hotel offered a lot of really great restaurants that weren't so desperate for money, but I would NEVER stay here again. Honestly, the egregious greed made us not want to ever go to Vegas again, and that breaks my heart because I was SO excited to go. 

There were good things about the actual room, but honestly I'm so upset over the above that they don't even deserve to be pointed out.

Great hotel to stay at if you want to be dead in the middle of the action. You can usually score a good deal online if you stay here. The smoke smell in my opinion in the casino area is not as bad as at other spots on the strip. I will say that is what I really strongly dislike about staying on the strip in general. Love the huge casino area and our room was very swanky. Beds were super comfortable and plenty of room to move around. Also love the pool and lounge areas. For sure consider MGM during your stay in Vegas...you will not regret it. For the amount you pay you get a lot of great amenities and I very much enjoyed the stay.

Old, old, and old. I booked through Vegas.com because they had a deal.

This hotel was dated and sad on the interior.
This was my 1st time in Vegas and came recommended due to its history of events. 

Check-in was sufficient but the clerk was not overly friendly. My husband told him it was my birthday weekend and what could he offer. Well the clerks response was we USED to give a bottle of champagne and chocolates but we don't anymore. He gave us a $20 voucher to the onsite bakery. Well it's Vegas so $20 didn't cover anything.
 
The room was clean but had strange wiring near the TV that looked like maybe a VCR sat there at one time or another. 

The fridge was supposed to be fully stocked with alcohol l however my husband noticed 5 bottles missing. He called the front desk and they acknowledged the missing items. Well guess what they put it on our bill the next day. We had to dispute it and I informed them they need to have better hiring practices since I am pretty sure the maid staff may have taken it.
They eventually took it off the bill but not a fun part to our stay.

I was not impressed and think the hotel needs a MAJOR update ASAP. 

If you are on the fence book at another hotel, maybe one mid-strip like Planet Hollywood or the Venetian.  Remember cheap is just that cheap and does not necessarily leads to a  pleasing experience.

This hotel is a has been.  Line to check in is 30+ min.  Room dirty, found someone's dirty sock near bed. Broken plastic in room hasn't been cleaned up after multiple requests.  Room smells moldy, towels with stains, house keeping sometimes didn't show up even after multiple requests.  Ac works poorly.  Casino smoke does not ventilate and lingers getting into clothes and hair.  Buffet is ok, no crab legs even at dinner.  Staff is a joke.  Pay more to stay at another hotel, this one is history in my opinion.

I've been here about an hour and I'm already over this place. When you first walk in the smell of cigarettes chokes you, not good for anyone who has health issues, or you know, just doesn't like cancer. We get to our room and it's a mess. Towels everywhere, questionable fluids on the floor, just completely dirty. They moved our room, but the time spent moving was the time we were going to use for dining out at dinner. So, going to bed hungry with smoke covered clothes, and still wondering what the hell kind of fluid was covering the bathroom floor of our original room.

I thought the place was a real letdown. Room was dated with lots of odd features. A painted concrete shower floor? Who am I, el Chapo? The sink has no hot or cold- turn up the pressure and turn up the heat. No fridge in the room. Extremely dark with a cruise ship small window. Service was lacking- asked for someone to bring me some toothpaste and waited a half hour; nobody showed up. And I gotta say, the south end of the strip just kinda sucks. 

Only positive was the price, and I think that the Flamingo gives you at least equal room amenities for a lower price with a much better location. Wouldn't stay here again.

Booked hotel more than a month ahead of arrival. Two days before arriving we get an email saying our room rate has gone up. So what was the point of making a reservation? To their credit I called and they changed it back to the original rate, but it was a total waste of time. 
Checking in was no better. Room size we reserved was not available at check in again why? 
Room was just okay. Faucet falling off wall in shower. Maid service not so good did not change sheets or finish cleaning room. We are two fifty year olds not like we made a huge mess. Coffee cups?
Hotel is large not labeled well especially West Lobby where all tours leave from. 
Pools were very nice and pool grill was good. 
TV's signal went down a lot. Wifi just okay.

This is my second time staying at the MGM in Las Vegas. I stayed in the west wing, not facing the strip and I wouldn't recommend it. It's facing the airport so you're constantly hearing loud planes taking off or landing, and not to mention they were doing construction on a building which woke me up bright and early. The room was as expected, Grand king with a couch. Bed was comfortable except when I pulled out the extra pillows I noticed hair and eyelashes on them, so that was gross. The shower drain was clogged so I had to take quick showers otherwise I'd be standing in a pool, and the shower also took a long time to heat up. I will stay at the MGM on my next visit because I like the location, but definitely will be getting a room that isn't facing the airport..

OK, so check this out.  I know I have been long dormant with the Yelp reviews (bad girl, BAD GIRL!), so to make it up to ya'll, I am now embarking on a casino-by-casino tour of my new hometown of LV, NV, and will include reviews of each as I tour them.  Now, these will not include room stays, but just schlepping around the premises - eating, drinking, and checking out anything that moves or doesn't move.  Got it? OK, let's proceed...

Review #17:
this place is huge!; the story about getting lost in the casino rings true here; I actually got locked out of the place during my exploring, but luckily an employee rescued me and let me into the adjacent convention center (which is quite grand as well); there is a walkway to the 3 Signature Towers of high-end condos; the outdoor\/pool areas are extensive & top notch; love the massive hotel lobby with the classic MGM lion sculpture; many scenic high end eateries, including 2 Joel Robuchon restaurants; the West End bar is kind of dark & sexy and tucked away, but not always open; armies of hotties headed to Hakkasan nightclub - wowza!; best craft beer bet = Michael Mina's Pub 1842 for sure, but you will pay to play!; Tap Sports Bar also has a few, but prices aren't much better there

Meh, mediocre experience staying here. At check-in, I asked for a higher floor or nicer view because we're celebrating a birthday but the rep didn't even crack a smile and said there's nothing available. She put us in the West Wing where the rooms are updated to a more modern\/hip design. But the work was pretty poorly done and room was not well maintained at all. There were at least 3 light bulbs that were out, the sink didn't drain well, bathroom fixture was falling apart, the ironing board was broken, and so was the wall hook for our towel\/clothes. Plus side is that I have a really high cleanliness standard for hotel, and everything seems to be alright. 

I wouldn't stay here again. I'd recommend upgrading your standard room or staying at the Signature instead.

I really wanted to like this place. I had friends who raved about the rooms and I love the color green... so really, I expected SO much more. I've had better luck at the Luxor and that place is old. :P

The front desk was RUDE and the "package deal" only happens if you charge things to your room... which costs 200$. Silly lady wouldn't even explain properly even though there was no line behind us (was it was 1am). Rude people should not be at the front desk. Maybe scrubbing floors... 

My friend and I reserved a smoking room (not for me...) but we were given a non-smoking room. When asked about this they said they would just send up ash-trays. Interesting, but atleast they were given the okay to smoke. 

When I called to ask the name of the person who said it was okay to smoke so we wouldn't be charged they rushed into saying we wouldn't be charged and wouldn't give me a name. For hospitality "specialists" they were not hospitable.

The bathroom toilet leaked. We had requested a higher floor but were given a 4th floor room with a view of the A\/C and rock roof. Nice for LV I guess... if you like rocks. 

The redeeming factors are the maid service and bell boy (is that what it is called?) they were prompt when we needed towels (BECAUSE THE TOILET WAS LEAKING)

Overall, they fail and I won't be staying there again.

It was my first Vegas hotel experience.  I knew what things to expect: no fridge, no coffee maker, resort fees, long walks to parking garage, and small rooms in West Wing.  So - my review is not based on these things.  I stayed for 4 nights and wished I would have asked for some sort of upgrade.  
The line to check in was quite long.  I believe longer than usual because of a large group of college kids.  The staff was very nice.  
After the long walk from front desk to our room... walked in and noticed that someone had urinated in "our clean bathroom" and left it unflushed.  I am assuming that housekeeping just overlooked this.  The shower floor was slimy.  The water never got hot.  We called and they told us to run it for 10 minutes.  Okay - it got lukewarm.  
The bathroom counter is more of a ledge.  There is no room to put anything.  There is the crazy design of glass doors to the shower and toilet beside each other.  Basically you can hear any and everything going on in the bathroom.  Why is there a phone in the bathroom? 
Bed was pretty comfortable but had a stained comforter.  
Nice flat screen tv but for some reason, some channels lost a signal.  
There are mirrors everywhere.  Not a complaint - just strange.  
Would I stay here again? Probably not.  I enjoyed the casino.  And I enjoyed the location.  I liked the access to the monorail.  
It is possible that the other areas of the hotel are nicer.  However, I feel like even though I got one of the "cheaper" rooms that it still should have been better.

We are here currently for our honeymoon. Very disappointed. As guests we park our car in the hotel's self parking and were told at check-in the fee is $12 per day. We had to pay for the parking upfront to get unlimited in\/out or every time we left we had to pay $12. We had leftovers from dinner the first night, put it in the refrigerator and when we returned to our room, the food was on the table with a note that said if we used this refrigerator we would fined $50. It was only for their  mini bar items, but for $25 a day we could rent a refrigerator from housekeeping. I called room service and asked for coffee. The carafe was $18 and I was told it would be an additional $6.85 to deliver it to our room. Really!!! $24.85 for a carafe of coffee! As for the TV in the room, it continues to turn off and have a message "no signal."  Maintenance checked it out for us and said this is normal. He blamed it on a modem not functioning properly. There is no safe in the room either. For such an upscale hotel we are not happy.

So upon checkout we find extra charges on our account...room service...mini bar...none of what we used!!!!  This place price gouges and then tries to add things you don't use. All I can say is check your bill upon leaving! Sooooooo disappointed

What a dump! This place was packed solid and crawling with tourists.  You can't even move around.  Nothing about this is entertaining. And they have tigers in the basement for amusement.  Don't support this business!

The check in experience was fairly quick and painless. The only negative would be that there is supposed to be a staff member directing you to the next available check in station but there was not anyone there. So, I walk up to what looks like an available station only to be told by the employee that they were not ready yet and was directed to rejoin the line. If you're not going to have someone telling guests where to go to check in, at least have a sign saying to wait for assistance.

Our booking included 2 free buffets that in order to redeem you must charge to your room. The buffet charges were not removed from my bill and my credit card was promptly charged for about $65. I was on hold with their customer service line for 15 minutes with no answer. I sent an email to customer service asking for my refund and upon submission of the form was advised I'd get a response in 7-10 days. Wow. 

I would skip the buffet if I ever come here again as it was very hit and miss -- not worth the price. There are plenty of other dining options in this hotel to try in lieu of the buffet.

Our room was clean and comfortable. The only downside is that there is no refrigerator for personal use so forget about any leftovers or snacks that you over pay for to eat later unless you'd like to rent a fridge for $25\/day. 

We had a red eye flight and checked out about 10 hours before we had to be at the airport. The hotel does offer luggage storage so that was nice. However, we didn't have enough things planned to fill up 10 hours so we found ourselves looking for a place to relax.. which does not exist. The lobby is huge with no place to sit. We were stuck in the food court or in one of the many bars. Keep in mind people are allowed to smoke in the casino and bars, so for non smokers, it was pretty awful to spend several hours in the bar because there was no other option.

Overall this is one of the better hotels I have stayed at but I'm not sure if I would be back due to the buffet credit not being given coupled with the insane hassle of contacting customer service.

Do not waste your money here. I have stayed at many of the other hotels on the strip but this is by far the worst. There are next to zero amenities. The room is ugh. They nickel and dime you to death. I needed hot water and all they could offer me was a kettle for $29! Really? You couldn't just have coffee makers or you couldn't just bring me a tea pot of hot water (I would have paid). They almost charged me for even a fridge (tip: They do not charge you if it is for medication). The room was not the cleanest, there were stains on the pillows and some sheets. There were marks all over the walls in the room and bathroom. Some of the staff is really nice. Most of the staff ignores you. You get one or the other... friendly or rude. I MAY try the Signature at MGM as it seems like there are more amenities readily available.

Decent hotel, especially for the rate we got. 

Sometimes the lines get long for cabs, but remember it's also a monorail stop, which is an easy way to get around Vegas.

The one creepy thing is that there was a picture of Patrick Stewart staring at where I slept. Freaked me out a little bit.

MGM has some amazing food though. Went to Nob Hill and had some of the best fries ever, accompanied by a Dark 'n Stormy.

Also visited The Grand Wok and had an amazing cocktail. Was tart and tasty for sure.

Breakfast at the Studio Cafe was just what I needed after a long night of drinking and was fairly reasonable.

All in all, it's a solid hotel. I do prefer a place like the Hard Rock though.

The MGM Grand is huge. Even after a 4 day\/3 night visit, I was still struggling to find my way around. Although getting lost is not fun, having a large property with a lot to offer is a good thing. 

Since I was a hotel guest, I'll speak to that first. Our grand queen comfortably fit four ladies and our stuff. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean and the décor was stylish but basic. I really liked the remote control blinds that had varying levels of darkness. 

We did have two issues with the room though.  The handle of the shower that controls the temperature fell off during my first shower. I had to jam it back on while trying to not freeze or burn myself. Maintenance was called to handle the issue and it was fine after that. We also had to call maintenance because the AC just didn't seem to cool down the room. It got better, but it was never really perfect. 

In terms of entertainment, MGM was excellent. Wet Republic and Hakkasan on one property? Yes, please! Although we never made it to Wet Republic, I wish we did since Calvin Harris was there during the visit. Our group left the property a little too much considering all that was going on at "home." I wandered through the MGM Grand pool area at one point and wish I carved out a little time to just hang out there. I also visited an array of the other bars\/lounges on the property. They all kind of looked the same but served the purpose. 

As for food, I only ate at Fiamma and Hecho en Vegas. While neither were my favorite, I appreciate the convenience and variety of options for casual to fine dining. I struggled a bit in the late night and quick bite category. McDonald's and a pizzeria toting itself as New York style don't quite cut it for late night in my personal opinion. I also struggled to find a healthier breakfast option and ended up at Starbucks. Although I enjoyed it, I didn't travel across the country to eat at a chain with 20 locations near my home. 

I'm being a little nitpicky, but overall I really enjoyed my stay at the MGM Grand. It was a nice hotel with a lot to offer. You wouldn't need to twist my arm to get me to stay there again.

I stayed in a queen executive suite from 12\/1\/2017-12\/4\/2017 for a girls weekend getaway. The room had no hot water the whole duration of my stay. I called the front desk twice and service technicians came in to fix the problem however it was never fixed. The water was ice cold no matter what time of day we turned on the shower. My friends were taking sponge baths in the sink and we were also using a friends shower whose room was on another floor. Inconvenient to say the least. The resort fees totaling $119 were removed from my final bill for the trouble but I feel like they could've done more. I had paid extra to upgrade the room and I expect to have hot water when I turn on the shower. Also no coffee makers in the room either. I will stay somewhere else on my next trip to Vegas.

Check-in staff were super friendly.  Got the tower spa suite affordable.  Good service...large room and early check out.  Combination of the party and low key people.  

While on our way to check out a couple of afternoon drunken hipsters decided to bring last night back into the elevator.  One of the girls took off her pants and dry humped a random dude on his way to a business meeting.  Not sure if dry cleaning will take out the stds on his suit.  Then an elderly couple came onto the elevator and got a free bottomless show.  

Hotel is huge...be prepared to get lost.

Vegas and the visitors are so entertaining

So my he-who-shall-remain nameless friend was in charge of the hotel reservations and thought he had secured them at the MGM...only he hadn't. For posterity's sake, his gaffe goes on the official ledger here. Luckily, there wasn't a major convention in town and the fine young lady at reception was nice enough to help us out and get us properly situated.

The MGM looks a lot different since I'd been here last, and I still remember the now-defunct MGM Grand Adventures Theme Park that we hit up as kids. Rest in peace, yo.

Bullets? Bullets.

- The location at the south side of the strip makes it convenient for airport arrival\/departure, but puts the MGM a 20-30 min walk to the central area.
- The casino floor is huge, and just walking from the lobby to the book is a hike. Dealers were nice, plenty of tables.
- The book is sizable but is placed in a narrow corridor making standing room or backseat viewing quite difficult to virtually impossible. Enclosed space also makes it smokier than other books.
- Close proximity to casual mall-style dining, as well as fine-dining, including the dual Robuchon restaurants. L'Atelier did not disappoint but that goes in another review.
- Saw both families and adults migrating to the pool area and "lazy river." Didn't go, but it's supposed to be nice and has generally favorable reviews on Yelp.
- No trendy nightclub, but the terribly named Hakkasan is set to open in 2013.
- Overall service was solid to above-average with the exception of a curiously strange lost & found guy that was almost thoroughly unhelpful.
- Renovations look nice, no complaints about the room.
- Trying to throw in in-room movie charges was sneaky but doesn't fly with our Asian bookkeeping, son.
- $25 resort fee. Whatever. Hoped you liked that WatchESPN streaming.

Absolutely loved our executive king suite. Booked a great deal for our flight & hotel through Travelocity which included 2 free buffet credits. The gentleman who checked us in at the front desk did not mention how to use our credit until I mentioned it. The buffet was yummy. The lazy river was soo cool! The concierge was very helpful when I called to ask about night swim at Wet Republic. The pool party was my first & a great experience. My favorite penny slots were the Lord of the Rings & the Walking Dead ones. Overall awesome time here. Would love to stay again.
Don't offer government discount to military. Only hotel I have experienced this from so far.

Reserved a Spa suite for here nights.  Room was outstanding until we went to use the Spa and there was water dripping into it from the bathroom above.  Of course there were no other suites to move us to so we had to wait a day.  They refunded me back two days of resort fee which appears generous but not the type of apology I would expect from such a nice hotel.  I guess I could have acted an @$$ but chose to voice my displeasure on the internet.  At a minimum, you think they would have  comped my 3 hour extended check-out but no, actually cost more than the comp.

I'll give you the best tip off the bat, don't stay in a west wing room.

Sure it's newer, has a more modern design, but what they forget to mention is that it's about a mile away from the elevators.  Also for a 'modern room', you can't hide a 20" CRT style tv inside a box and trick people into believing it's a flat screen tv.  it's like putting lipstick on a pig.

With that aside, the MGM isn't all bad.  good restaurants, solid strip location and when they have some specials, it's a pretty solid deal.  we had an offer for 129 for sat night and it came with a $100 dining credit at Aria.  Overall it's a solid choice and a slight notch above bally's and monte carlo but not quite as nice as the mirage...but it beats the embarrassment of telling your friends you stayed at the imperial palace or the jockey club

Have stayed at the MGM many times and always been impressed.
However on this last trip we felt let down. The hotel facilities are still impressive but the room we got given wasn't. We were placed at the end of a corridor beneath one of the terrace suites where there was a party nightly which we could clearly hear from our room. Now we know we are in vegas and are happy for people to party but we felt the hotel could have done something to lessen the noise. We were offered the first three nights of our five night stay for free but as yet have still not been credited. On top of this the maids never came to clean our room for the first couple of days despite asking housekeeping to have it done, in turn we had no toilet roll and dirty towels.
To top it off the room felt tatty and dirty (marks on bed linen, filthy windows and blown bulbs in the bathroom).
When we received our PDF bill we had cabana charges added to our bill, yet we never charge to our room and didn't rent a cabana!
Again we emailed a few times but have yet to have a reply.
Based on this poor experience I think it's time we moved on from the MGM to another resort hotel.

Check in is at 3pm and it is currently 5:21.  Housekeeping just arrived.  How do you get assigned a room and it looks like the last guest just left.  There's marijuana residue on the table and we are just waiting for a room that should have been ready 2 1\/2 hours ago.

I've stayed here a few times with my job..... This time has been nothing to rave about... Our room is absolutely terrible.... Our first time using kayak to book, never again.... We have been issued some old rundown dirty room...  Half of the things in here are broken... Our room is extremely loud,  toilet runs for about 5 minutes after you flush. . .  Evwrytime someone walks by our room, our door handle shakes as if someone's trying to come in.. We didn't stay here to run around the strip, we come to vegas to stay at our hotel and relax, and that's not how thus trip is :(    we could have stayed at plenty of cheaper places,  has better quality and a full kitchen in some.... My advice if you stay here, make sure you have one of the newer rooms, not this old run down one... Our last experience here was completely amazing, I wish I could say the same this time...
Been here a few times. Never stayed but gambled. Very fun and great places to eat and drink.

I stayed at the hotel for a week long technical conference hosted at the hotel.  The room was a one king bed deluxe room.  The room itself was fairly ordinary, though spacious.  There is neither a microwave nor refrigerator (other that the one stocked with expensive drinks) available in the room.  The channel selection available on the TV was rather limited and features no premium channels.  Though, we did not spend a great deal of time in our room watching TV, so that was not a deal breaker.  

The view from our 15th floor room was good will a window that ran the full width of the room.  The window featured a drop down blackout curtain that did an excellent job of blocking out outside light.  The biggest weakness of the room was the front door.  It featured no latchable lock on the inside and it also blocked no sound from the hallway.  We were often awoken in the middle of the night by people returning to their rooms after late shows or parties.  The doors really need to be replaced with one that insulate better.

As for the hotel itself, the property is huge.  This was both a plus and minus.  On the plus side, the property featured an extensive gaming floor, lots of restaurants, shops and an extensive pool  complex.  However, the price for this is a lot of walking to get around.  The walk to the convention area is particularly remote from the rooms.  If you are there for a convention, you should count on at least a 10 minute walk from the central elevators to the convention area.

The casino area is central to the hotel, which means you have to walk through it to go just about anywhere in the hotel or even to enter and leave the hotel.  The smoke in the casino area is oppressively bad and we spent very little time gaming before giving up.  Even just walking through the casino area to get to different parts is an unpleasant experience.  The MGM isn't the worst on the strip, but it's certainly not good.

Overall, as a conference hosting hotel, it has a lot to offer with a large convention space and conference rooms (the conference I attended was on the order of 3500 people).  It also has a decent location surrounded by other MGM properties with lots of entertainment options within close walking distance.

However, if I were staying on my own for a pure recreational trip, I would probably book one of the other properties on the strip first.

We stayed 3 nights- room was clean, TV HD w lots of channels. Shower fixtures great! 28$\/ d resort fee included cardio room, USA today and wifi - Only thing w wifi, YOU HAVE TO HANG AROUND LOBBY OR HALLWAY TO GET A SIGNAL

The MGM is still one of my favorite hotels to stay when visiting Las Vegas. Service is friendly, rooms are clean, and they have the best pool in Vegas. The buffet is a must for breakfast. Gotta love it.

My girlfriend and I went to Vegas for the day. we went to the MGM because one of our friends highly suggested this particular hotel.  We arrived in Vegast at about 2pm.  The hotel was really confusing and we werent' quite sure where to go to check in.  Someone finally ushered us over to the check-in.   Our credit card didn't go through and the agent in her rush to process us she said we should just leave it open. Not knowing that doing so would mean that we could not use the internet.  Our room was really far away from the elevator and it was apparent that the hotel had undergone renovations and the side of the hotel that we were on had obviously not been apart of the upgrade.  The shower did not drain properly and overflowed when we took a shower.  The room was not at all functional but the bed was super comfortable. The room let all the noise in.  Very loud.  I think next time we'll try a different hotel and see how that goes.

This was the worst Vegas experience I have ever had.  I have been twice before this year alone staying at MGM related hotels (Mandalay Bay and Caesar's) and I simply cannot believe the service this time.  First of all, I bought a package deal with hotel and ticket to the closed circuit viewing party for the Mayweather vs. McGregor fight.  I go to pick up my tickets and they have done a bait and switch on me and put me in a different viewing location at the Monte Carlo.  The purpose of me staying at MGM and getting the package was so that I wouldn't have to leave the hotel.  I waited 20 minutes for someone to finally give me the tickets that I received which were absolutely horrible.  My seats were all the way to the left side; you could not see the picture head on from any projector (there were three).  This section should not have even been sold as viable. In a concert, this section would have been closed. I am disappointed that they would treat their guests like this who bought in advance.  Don't even get me started on our room.  Wallpaper peeling from the walls, we got a room in the section that obviously wasn't renovated, no hot water for the shower (luckily it was 109 degrees so I didn't necessarily want a steamy shower), the AC even at 65 degrees never got cold enough.  It was just a disaster.  I have other choices in Vegas and from now on, I'll be using them.  And no, I didn't have time to complain because I was making the best of my trip and didn't want to spend time talking to MGM staff, switching rooms, asking for better tickets, etc.  We spent over $1300 in two days with rooms, meals, etc. at MGM.  I'll take my money elsewhere next time.

Don't what happened to this place. I've stayed in the past but tonight the check-in line ranged from a solid 1.5 hours to over 2 hours. In fact, I'm writing this at 2:30am waiting this is never ending line. Management really has to do something to correct this for current and future patrons. Totally ridiculous.

Update!!
Finally get to my room and see this critter crawling around the bed linens. Is this a bed bug!!? Moving rooms. Saga continues.

Update #2 in response to Lori's comment below. I emailed you at that email address days ago while I was still at the hotel and encountering an endless barrage of issues. You didn't offer to do anything about it, just sent apologies.

Stayed here for a bachelor party weekend. Stayed at many hotels in Vegas but the MGM is easily top 5 in my book. It helps that I won in their casino! It was winter time so didn't get to check out the pool. The casino floor is great. But the main reason for this review are for the rooms. Easy checkin and checkout. The room itself was modern, bigger then other rooms I've stayed at in Vegas. Beds were super comfortable. Bathroom was great, water pressure was great, and had a living room area. Our room faced the strip which was awesome as well. I'd recommend the MGM all day! Don't hesitate to stay here if you haven't already.

Decent on-strip hotel.. 

The rooms and beds are comfortable. They have done some renovated but this hotel in general maintains the dated feel. 

It's far enough away from the majority of clubs and attractions that I would caution staying here during the summer if you are planning on walking at all. In case you didn't know, Vegas is in the middle of the desert and gets HOT. 

The one thing MGM has going for them as relief for the summer heat is Wet Republic, their pool\/daytime club. I think the drinks and admission during peak season is probably absurd for me. Bummer. Reasonably cute ladies tend to get drinks and extra perks here for free.

Vegas at night in the winter ladies, I wouldn't want to be expected to walk from here in a mini-dress and heels. "Brr.. Ouch... Brrr.. Ouch"  Doesn't sound like a fun plan to me.
Mlife, first it was resort fee, now even self parking they charge a fee to park your own car. Hello your not the only casino in Las Vegas

This hotel is just okay. They are doing construction in the middle of the casino and they must have hit a sewer line because it literally stinks in the casino. I stayed for a business convention and it was convenient to local transit, all the food I ate was good though sometimes not even warm. If you list that every room has a hair dryer it should be in the room and I shouldn't have to call for it. Everyone who works here seems fake, I got called by housekeeping 2 hours after the hair dryer request to confirm it was delivered. Overkill and the time delay reads as stupid and phony.  I wouldn't use my own money to stay here, but since the company paid it was okay.

MGM is definitely a cool place to stay in Vegas. First and foremost I need to point out something I thoroughly enjoyed about the casino here: it actually smelled good! It wasn't that smoky and it didn't have that nasty cleaning solution smell that the others did. The size of this place did not bother me at all, to be honest I did so much walking in and out of random casinos that I couldn't even tell MGM was any bigger. A huge plus for me was the food court with Del Taco and Weinerschnitzel next door. Greeeeat drunk food. The casino does not disappoint, and there are quite a few restaurant choices inside (the buffet, Shibuya, and Seablue are recommended). Studio 54 is also a fun place to go clubbing, although I would steer clear of Tabu. Overall, the fun factor of the MGM Grand was pretty solid. 

On to the room: The room was a good size and I got a pretty good deal, but one thing I was disappointed with is that they put me on the 4th floor. No view at all. I asked to be moved up and with a strip view, but was told I would have to try to switch rooms the next day after 11AM. I made my reservation 3 months prior, but I guess when you stay here you should tack on another 3 months to get a good view. The room was only a couple rooms away from the elevators which later proved to be beneficial for the drunken nights\/mornings we had, so I ended up keeping it even though the view lacked. We didn't spend much time in the room anyway. The room was quiet and the curtains were thick enough to block all outside light so when I did get a few hours of sleep they were uninterrupted. 

I would give the hotel 3\/5 and the casino, restaurant and clubs 4\/5. So an even 4\/5. Recommended!

I've been in town attending the AACE International conference at MGM!! This hotel is super and I always enjoy hanging out there. Great food options, Wet Republic, and great places for drinks.

The conference space was organized with meeting standards in all rooms. Breakfast was enjoyed by everyone each day. Checking in during registration was easy and the convention signage was most helpful walking through the hotel.

Kudos to a great hospitality team and I'll be back in September for fight weekend!!!

I go to Vegas quite often, been to almost every hotels on the strip. I recently stayed at MGM for the first time because I wanted to go to their lazy-river pool. Hotel staff was very nice when I was checking in, check in was a breeze didn't wait long. I got $50 dining credit for their promo and they also upgraded my room at no charge!!!! I also tried their Buffet and regardless of what other people reviewed I really like their food for the value, prime rib was great, they had many different choices to choose from. I even did the room service to get my breakfast in bed, and the service personal was very nice! and the food was great. Will definitely go back to MGM soon!

Horrible service !! We were recommended to stay here  , and the first day a guy entered our room to refill our "wet bar". We did not use anything in the fridge that would need to be refilled,  and when he knocked he entered immediately as us 3 females were sleeping. We told him to leave and notified the front desk. Now , we come back after our afternoon walks and the cleaners took off our shower head and are refusing to put it back on or even come look at it. We called the front desk over and over and each time , they said someone was on the way and no one would show up . Now we have wasted 2 hours sitting in our room waiting for service to fix this. Unbelievable service and we will not be returning.

The MGM Grand is a beautiful hotel.  The rooms are nice, the casino is huge (SO easy to get lost in here), room service is fine, shows are excellent, staff is friendly.  My only complaint about this hotel is the "lazy river" pool--- it's filled with drunk idiots, pissing themselves and spilling their drinks in the water--- the smell of chlorine almost burns your throat--- I cringe to think of what else is in that water.  Never again will I go in their pool.  The MGM appeals to the younger 20-30 something crowd, and while I fall into that age-group, I'm not one to get plastered and act obnoxious while I'm in Vegas.  All in all, the MGM is a nice hotel, and when they run specials on hotel nights, I'll return-- however, I wouldn't pay more than $150\/night here.

An overpriced dark and gloomy hotel... The hotel charges a mandatory resort fee, which one has to question why? If it is mandatory, then it is a part of the room rate. When resort fees are added like this, it makes me wonder if the only reason is to clearly trick others, espicially international tourists, into paying who otherwise do not understand the fee. The whole M Life marketing campaign is also annoying, It makes me realize how many properties MGM owns, and that they are all one big evil corporate giant... Support the smaller properties in Las Vegas (like the Cosmo) who have friendly staff, a more upbeat feel to them, and dont look all old looking. Also the construction noise is insanely loud, like to the point where at times ear plugs are required.....

Before I start, +1 for the beauty \/ value of the suite and professionalism of the staff.

But I'm actually pretty shocked at our experience at the hotel.  The hotel casino & lobby area was pretty and glitzed up for Christmas \/ Boxing.  But our experience was marred by a failure of the customer service apparatus at every level even for a Gold+ member from beginning to end.

We came here as a family with 4 rooms during the slow time before Christmas.  So when we booked via my Gold status on the MLife site, I even called in to make sure they were nearby or connected.  When we arrived, the line for the Gold+ level members only had 1 person while the regular line was really long.  The request was lost (go figures) so our kind receptionist tried her best to find rooms closer together.  But after 30 minutes (and by that time the regular line already cleared out :-( ), she had to downgrade one of my rooms to make it work.  She even mentioned that she had to deal with many very irate people pissed that Hakkasan was closed but nobody let them know when they booked.  I'm not a clubber but who's running the MGM ship? That grueling check-in gave a bad omen on the stay already...

So our rooms smelled like light smoke but we were so tired from check-in, we didn't want to go through that ordeal again.  Let me list what went sideways instead of writing it out.
1) Our bathroom light was broken.  We called but it never got fixed
2) Our Shower temperature handle was broken.  It either got super hot or cold.  Never got fixed
3) On our second night, my wife wanted to have a bubble bath.  Black water came out of the tub spout.  I had a black-humor laugh at my wife's expense. 
4) Asked for housekeeping to spray the room to clean out the smoke smell.  Since they didn't do #1 or #2, just a guess they didn't do this as well.  They told me to call sooner if we smell smoke to catch smokers in the act in the hallway.  It felt like my old days playing Bad-Cop RA.  I don't want to be a snitch to get a smoke-free room!

Also, Avoid the 4th floor.  You're at the roof level and its a little awkward greeting workmen through your window in the morning in your nighties.  Needless to say, we had the shades down the whole time after that.

Needless to say, I'm giving low ratings not for the broken things in the room since I understand Vegas.  I'm giving it for the customer service promising service but never delivering.  If a MLife Tier member had to deal with this, I wonder how the regular peasantry feel...

One of my fav hotels in Vegas and I've stayed here several times for work purposes. First of all, the service here is second to none - from the front desk peeps to management to audio\/visual guys to wait staff. I had a chance to talk to some of them and learned that many had worked here forever because they're treated so well. Not something you hear too much of nowadays.

As for the hotel rooms, I can't say enough about the beds. They are like big fluffy clouds and one of the few places where I can sleep like the baby I am. Apparently, they've renovated all their rooms so I'll have to go back soon to check them out.

The first time I coordinated a corporate event here, they offered two free tix to KÀ by Cirque du Soleil!! Sweet deal! And it turned out to be one of the best ones I've ever seen so if you get a chance to go, GO!!

MGM has by far the friendliest staff on the strip, everyone was not only helpful but pleasant, and most often, had a sense of humor.  The rooms were clean, spacious, and comfortable.  The highlight of the room was the quality bedding, the only disappointment was an old and non-elegant shower head which sprayed too little water too hard.  So really, I have nothing to complain about.

The location is central on the strip and there are plenty of restaurants to choose from in the hotel.  For late night entertainment you have Tabu (an "ultra lounge") which looked promising.  Then there is the classic Studio 54 which offers good dancing to a wide variety of music (as long as you don't mind a circle of older lechy looking gentlemen ringing around the dance floor).

The spa and gym facilities are also impeccably classy and worth your time and money.

My two kids (ages 8 and 15) and I chose the MGM Grand during the week (Mon-Thurs), to check out their lazy river. Usually we stay at The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. We drove all around the huge complex until we stumbled across an employee who directed us to the front of the hotel. We pulled in and had our luggage loaded up and checked in to the bell station. I felt the bell man pressured me into tipping him because he kept saying "I won't see you again". He wasn't the person who takes your luggage to your room, that's another person. Ok, so now we have to check in, the line took about 45 minutes (at 5pm, check in at 3), but was at least moving and good music videos on huge screens kept us entertained. On to the room, pretty nice and easy to find. Clean and cool with a decent strip view. Could never figure out the mini fridge, but the blackout shade was awesome. The room smelled smoky from time to time which was gross and although the rooms were straightened up and decent each day, housekeeping must not have a vacuum because anything that fell on the floor or was there when we got there, stayed there all week. The pool, sadly, was a disappointment. The check in at the entrance was just a flash of the room card and then we made a beeline to the lazy river. We rented tubes that were HUGE and $10 each for the day, only credit or room charge, no cash. We ended up getting one tube taken from us when we went into another pool, but because of the size we were actually relieved. The lazy river was not all that was promised. It reeked of chlorine, our eyes burned all night. Drunk adults lined the entire mile blocking the fun of a pool that carries you through. Me and my kids were pushed hard at different times by adults who were walking through the river like they were rushing to get somewhere. The entire pool was lined with empty beer cans and bottles that fell into the pool! There were also lots of folks walking through the lazy river holding their cans and bottles just above the water. We enjoyed the regular pools better but those were lined with beer cans and bottles too. I don't care that folks are drinking, it's Vegas, but they should have at least one person on staff to scoop that mess up all day. A lightening storm cut our pool time short and we never returned to the pools again. We tried to eat at the Rainforest Cafe but the wait was 2.5 hours. So, we drove south of the strip to a variety of other casual dining spots all week. The Avenue Cafe in the MGM was ok. $60 for an omelette, kid's waffle and a BLT. Clean. Nothing but eggs after noon, no other breakfast items available. Best meal was Bucca de Beppo at the Excalibur (yucky hotel and people, but great food and server named David). Must buy\/try are cupcakes from the Corner Cakes in the MGM Grand Tower. All in all, not bad, but we'll be sticking with Mandalay Bay for our family-friendly Vegas jaunts.

Two beds, four walls, shower, toilet and a door. Can't complain too much. This is a big hotel and carrying luggage from the car to the room can be a journey. Bright side is that it's a workout in itself.  Thin walls and elevators can be a pain when it's crowded.  Plus side is they have decent dining options when balling on a budget.  The best part of the is hotel would have to be the Fat Tuesday they have once you enter from the parking structure.

I was not impressed with MGM at all. I paid for an upgraded room and I was put on the 9th floor, meanwhile my friends were in a smaller room but the 28th floor. They had way better views. We requested a higher room and the next day they moved us to the 16th floor but then as we were moving they said actually someone gave your new room away...ugh really? Then luckily they had a room on the 17th floor. When we first walked in to our room on checkin we had to search in the dark for a light switch...guess what there aren't any in the main room. All manual switches on the lamps. You also can't use the fridge in the room for your personal items like juice mixers and food or else they charge you $50. If you take anything out of the fridge they automatically charge you due to sensors on the fridge. If you're used to staying at the Aria, you will be majorly disappointed. I'm afraid this hotel is becoming a relic and needs to be updated to stay with the modern trends.

Didn't stay here,  but  a fairly member did and we spent quite a bit of time there. Great,  great pools for kids.  Their suite was also beautiful. The food court is high price,  but similar to similar hotels.  There were problems arranging a refrigerator for the room after several confirmations that things were sorted out,  but the hotel was generous in allowing them to use the minibar and kind about not charging restocking as they normally would given that the baby formula needed to go somewhere.

Just got back from a 4 night stay at the MGM Grand. Although a very clean and nice hotel I would make sure when booking to ask for the new renovated rooms. Our room was very basic, but no fan in the bathroom and only one mirror in the whole room, that was in the bathroom. Making it hard for a group of girls to get ready.  But my biggest problem wasnt with the room, it was that the MGM Lions are no longer at the hotel!! When we asked someone about them they said the new CEO of the hotel didnt think they needed to spend any more money on them and now they are at some zoo. But they still show the lion habit on their website. I would not stay at MGM again only because of the location. Its at the end of the strip and not in the center of all the hotels. We walked to The Mirage and found that, that hotel would have been perfect location to access everything better. Side note, Love, The Beatles show was the most amazing show ever, I highly recommend! We had the cheapest tickets and still say everything perfectly.
Nice casino. I did not stay at the hotel. They have every game that any other casino would have but far better beverage service for those gambling.  Things are a bit pricier here though.

I have stayed at MGM 3 times now. This past trip we took the kids. The Lazy River is always a favorite for the whole family! My young children couldn't get enough of the Rainforest Cafe. The restaurants are good, love the atmosphere and the rooms are clean and comfortable. We'll stay there again...

The only bad thing that happened to me was that my toilet got clogged. luckily it was the last night so it didn't really bother us...that could really happen to anyone and any hotel..

The beds were comfy, nice bathroom, the pool is really cool with that lazy river. great Bars and club...fantastc restaurants...the second largest hotel in the world really does have something for everyone...

This place is not the Bellagio but for the price it's worth it..

overpriced, ruined, old hotel.

we got a rate of 109$ for a night, then when we tried to extend, the price rocketed into $149, i'm glad that i moved out and got a suite at hard rock hotel.

oh did i mention about the broken escalator? the stinky elevator? and the overcrowded parking lot?

will never come back

no toothbrush no slipper almost nothing in this 5 star hotel and even persuade us to pay extra to upgrade room in the register place. Excuse me, if it is not good like u said small dark, how could u list in Expedia and charge us 113? It is just like $60 level no more extra value.

Stayed there last weekend, ton of fun. All servers were extremely friendly. Little mishap with the room was totally taken care of with 5 free buffets. Pool is great, super warm. Will definitely be staying again. I've stayed at Luxor and Excalibur and these rooms are worth the little extra in price.

The first important thing about a hotel is the bed. I love the bed here. 

The second important thing about a hotel is safety.. Not so sure about this one since our door was open by a worker randomly when we were taking a nap inside. 

The third important thing about a hotel is service. Our room was not cleaned during the two nights we stayed. We were a little disappointed.

Well.. four stars for the nice bed, reasonable price and nice river pool.

If you're considering going to Vegas, I urge you to loosen up the purse strings and stay elsewhere.

My wife and I usually stay at The Cosmopolitan, but we decided to stay somewhere cheaper this trip because the Cosmo was pushing $1000 for two nights.

Here are a few reasons why I'll never go back to the MGM:

Paper-thin walls: My wife and I had the pleasure of listening to our neighbors puking.

Starbucks: My wife had a free "birthday drink" loaded to her Starbucks card. After waiting in line for quite a long time, she scanned her card and it took money off of her gift card and didn't honor the free drink because they are not a "corporate" location (not sure how we were supposed to know this). We had to wait in the long line AGAIN, and then wait for someone to be called up that could issue a refund. Ridiculous.

Tiny rooms: Our room was clean, but was very small (tower room). We did have somewhat of a "strip view", but there's not much to look at south of the MGM, which is where our room faced. The room was also clean which was a plus.

Fees: Parking fees, resort fees, $8 6-pack of Oreos, etc. This is pretty common in Vegas, but it still bothers me. We stayed two nights and owed close to $100 on top of what we already paid for the room.

The people: Nice mixture of classy and trashy.

Walking: This place is HUGE, so walking from the parking garage to the room can be quite a feat. If you're going to charge me for parking, at least make it convenient! You could probably park at the Tropicana at no cost and have a shorter walk.

This place is going down hill.  It's weird how a hotel will charge for parking to make more money but they won't provide a good entertainment experience to bring customers back which would earn them even more money.  Mgm is driving good customers away by nickel and dining them to death.

This hotel is fancy etc, but not really that great.. I gave it two stars because we stayed at the west wing, and other things. At check in it seemed like my husband and I were a nuisance to the gentleman who checked us in. The surprising $200 security deposit was ridiculous, but hopefully they give us our money back tomorrow when we check out, and payed a $28 a day resort fee. The resort fee we knew about, and security deposit we didn't know was going to be so high. The hotel room was nice, modern. I didn't enjoy the bathroom too much because it's see through hazy green glass walls with little privacy, which isn't a big deal to couples. The wifi and cell reception is TERRIBLE. Couldn't log in wifi with any device. I made phone calls and had to stay in one little corner of the room  because if I wal ked any where else my call would drop. The hotel itself just too big. Yea pretty much all hotels have a walk to the rooms, but this was just ridiculous. The shops and some restaurants were just okay. I recommend NOT to stay here if there is a major event like a concert if you're not seeing it yourself because t the place is too crowded and it's difficult to get to you room.
 We have stayed at a few hotels here on the strip before, and this place just wasn't our cup of tea. We just had better service and experiences else where. Maybe it might of been different if we had gotten a better room or just stayed some where else. Too bad they don't have the lions anymore either.
This is the first hotel I saw in Vegas. Very nice lobby, however not much to do here. The staff is friendly, though, which goes a long way.

My stay here went very well. Located less than 10 min away from Mccarran airport! We got here on a Friday and waited in line to check in & the line moved fairly quick. We asked for a free upgrade and they had one available. We stayed in the west wing! King size bed, nice sized tv, and my favorite was the bathroom. Everything seemed pretty up to date. This hotel has a whole bunch of restaurants in it and even a food court. Oh and Starbucks! Can't go wrong with that. Located in the hotel is also a night club. And casinos. It's kind of a all-in-one hotel. 1 star taken because of the cigarette smell(like any other hotel in Vegas) and for dirty sheets and pillow cases when entering the room.

The hotel can only work for those traveling for the first time to Las Vegas and probably are attending an event at the Conference Center. Over the last few years I have stayed at multiple other hotels in the strip. As per the cost the Wynn offers almost at a same price a much better room. The "grand buffet" is a joke. When I went to a much nicer place (Fiamma Trattoria) they would not allow charges to the room, the section was cancelled with a pen. The elevators on Grand tower are slow. I was only interested on playing slots but ended up walking to the NY NY as the cumulative amounts were insignificant at the MGM. I hate being asked for my ID to get a toothpaste at the store. There are not enough outlets to charge all your devices at the desk. The only good things so far is the TV system, very responsive. Internet, Bed and air conditioning are ok to good. Not planning to return, the cost\/benefit is not what I expected. Customer service can be significantly improved.
If I could but do you zero that's more than enough customer service  Room service even the manager I can't wait to change the hotel by tomorrow

Don't book a suite here, unless you don't mind living in the streets of Vegas. 

Our group of 8 booked and paid for our suite months in advance for EDC weekend. After waiting days to check in, we were told that they didn't have a suite for us since they overbooked. We were PISSED. It's one of the busiest weeks in Vegas and now you expect us to successfully find another place to stay? They didn't even try to help us.

After wasting the whole day sorting this out, we eventually ended up staying in separate rooms at a hotel elsewhere. We tried making the best out of the situation but not having our suite was definitely disappointing. 

I'm going to Vegas again next week and we booked the same suite at MGM (not my decision) so I'm praying we don't get eff'ed over again.
This hotel was okay, but the shape of the building is what makes it terrible. I kept getting lost.

Love gambling here. I stayed at this hotel before and it was definitely the hotel to stay at if you like to party and go clubbing. There is also a Starbucks right in the casino area which is perfect for me. They also have a lot of good restaurants on site but if you're not into that they have a food court that stays open all night. All in all its a fun hotel to stay at.

I had a much better experience during my latest stay at the MGM than in my previous review. I actually considered giving it 4 stars, but the pool issues forced me to only up it to 3 stars..more on that later.

We booked through Vegas.com and had some issues with them (mainly that we booked 2 double queens, but they wrote it down as a double queen and a king and told us we basically had to wait until we got to the hotel to ask them to fix it). Fast forward--we arrived at the hotel right around 3pm on Friday and the line to check in was LONG, but it moved REALLY FAST this time because they had "line helpers" directing traffic, etc. For some reason, probably because we're so beautiful (lol jk) we were taken into the fancy diamond check in room from the regular line. Whisked away from all the riff-raff ;-) we were offered waters and apples and told stories of the celeb. check ins of the day (it was Billboard Music Award weekend). We explained our room reservation issues to the guy and he immediately said he could switch the rooms to queens, but then we told him that we really wanted adjoining rooms and he explained that the only adjoining rooms they have are a double queen room connected to a king room. We decided that adjoining for our party of 6 was more important than double queens, so we went with that (but we were charged an extra $15 a day for the king). 

Once at the rooms we discovered they were large, clean (unlike in my previous review when I found hairs everywhere), and in good shape. It was clear their rooms has been recently upgraded as gone were the chipped furniture, stained carpet, and cracked tile--KUDOS!

The A\/C worked well in the room and the bed itself was fine, but OMG THE PILLOWS ARE STILL HORRIBLE!! We all woke up with neck aches! Boooo

While staying there we ate at 2 of their restaurants- Avenue Cafe and Hecho En Vegas. Hecho in Vegas continues to be one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas and Avenue continues to be an easy option to eat breakfast at while staying at the MGM--food ok, service a little worse than ok. 

On to the reason for 3 stars instead of 4 stars--the pool! Okay, so our issues: at noon on Saturday there was not ONE CHAIR AVAILABLE for our party of 6 to even put our stuff on. They charge $15 for a TINY LOCKER, and..the worst offender of all...$24 for a .99 cent inner tube for the lazy river!!!! SERIOUSLY?! TWENTY-FOUR DOLLARS ARE YOU SH*TING ME?!?!???!??! After paying hundreds of dollars to STAY at the hotel?! Honestly, out of control!

I can forgive the no chairs thing (I guess). If you want to get a chair on a Saturday apparently you have to line up at like 8:30am to enter the pool area at 9am. I cannot, however, forgive the locker and inner tube fees, they are simply astronomical. 

It's unfortunate- the rooms would have made me want to continue staying here, but their crazy pool prices would certainly have me considering staying at a different hotel in the future if part of my plan was a pool day.

Beware the honor bar SCAM!!!  As previous post says beware getting the money sucked out of you because you might not even notice. The resort is very nice which masks what they have in store for you at check-out. Did you know if you move something to the side in the honor bar to maybe fit in a melted chocolate bar you will be charged for every item moved?  We pleaded with the manager to waive the charges since we hadn't consumed anything in the bar. Can you believe they outright refused?  That candy bar cost us $45!

I would have given this hotel a higher rating but it was SO smokey. I'm sorry I thought it was 2013- why are people still allowed to smoke wherever they want in this place? Some of it is to be expected throughout any casino, but this was overwhelming. I had trouble eating at some of the restaurants because they are wide open and people can smoke right next to your table. My friend got stuck on a smoking floor, because there weren't any other rooms available, and she said it was like someone was chain smoking in her room. Disgusting. I can't wait for Vegas to get with the times and ban smoking indoors like the rest of the world.

I stayed here during a recent visit to Las Vegas, and as a first time guest here, I found it to be quite nice. I'm far from a veteran, but I've stayed at other properties on the Strip, and I definitely liked this one. 

The room was spacious and clean, with nice fixtures and materials. The bed was very comfortable, and my expansive window overlooked the southern end of the Strip and the airport. Blackout shades did their job very well.  

One of the best parts of my visit, though, was enjoying the lazy river and cabana areas. We rented a cabana for the day, and spent a lot of time there. Sure, the drinks and food were expensive, but hey, this is Vegas on the Strip. The drinks WERE, however, strong and definitely "enhanced our fun". We made many trips through the lazy river, and despite sizable crowds, it flowed well and the people were friendly. 

If you're looking for a good pool experience, this is really a good choice based on our experience.

I really expected more... It was a sad state of affairs from the get go.  At check in we were told we had two rooms reserved.  We only booked one.  She was not helpful or kind in any way.  She told us we  had to take it up with the people we booked with and that was all she could do.   Wait... i just go here you throw this issue at me and i may have spent all my money on two hotel rooms... I haven't even had a drink yet!  
I requested a manager and she was kind enough to help us out and cancel the second reservation in a matter of 30 seconds.  The remainder of the time there we were just baffled at how unhappy the staff was and how they treated patrons.  We came across maybe two people there who enjoyed what they were doing and were worth chatting too and they truly earned their tips in my opinon.  I have a series of issues from this stay and i did take it up with MGM.  They offered to refund me my "hotel fees" 

I will not be giving these folks my business when  I visit Vegas.  I suggest you dont either.  Save your $$ and go elsewhere

What happened to MGM? 
It's so old and so disgusting now. 
Room 429 on 18th floor had crack on bathroom sink.

Their fridge has sensor so even if you don't drink anything, if you touch or move items in the fridge slightly, they charge you. 

Their shampoo ruined my hair and their lotion made me smell like men.

One of the best places to stay in Vegas for a decent price. It isn't the Belaggio or Aria but it is a great hotel. I stay because I love the sportsbook and the card room. I would consider both of them to be in the top 3 for Las Vegas. The bars are great and you are never too far from more fun when you are at the MGM Grand.

The summer scene is great too. Everyone knows about the lazy river, and if you don't you do now. For relatively cheap you can get a bucket of domestics and float for hours. All while soaking up the sights.

Don't forget the lions habitat, a must.

Beautiful place, Tuscan villa style. Understated entrance. Excellent service.

Breakfast on the patio was lovely. It's a garden atrium, very unlike Vegas. I ordered the braised short rib with two poached eggs. It was so tender it literally melted in your mouth.

It's very quiet, private, exclusive.
Clean rooms and friendly staff. I've heard good stories and bad just while I was here but I can't complain...yet.

Pretty nice hotel  Huge is a good word.  
It's not too bad for a business hotel, if you want to stay on the Strip in LV.  While there are miles of hallways, everything comes to a central point.  Self park is relatively close to the elevators.  Please note:  relative in Las Vegas is still a hike.

Foods on par with other themed hotels.   Needs a little upkeep.

We checked in a VIP services and they give THE BEST customer service. To the point where you want to slap them. :) No complaints about this place at all except for the fact that I couldnt win here. Service was awesome.

It is my first review here, definitely not recommend. Super slow front desk service, rude attitude, 25 extra charge for arriving and check in before 3pm. Heavily smoke smell inside the room!!! The room sucked as well. Dirty, small, smelly and dark. No windows. Noting inside the room even the coffee maker! Everything has price tag. I am very disappointed by this hotel. It ruined my trip!!! If I have choice to give negative points, I will give negative infinity.

I had a very comfortable stay in the MGM Grand tower, 25th floor this week. It is far from many activities happening in the middle of the strip though you can take a shuttle train - however good thing about staying at MGM is that you don't need to go outside MGM - it is self contained. Which is good for a repeat visitor to LV or anyone  who wants to avoid walking the strip or sightseeing  - and just wants to chill within the MGM parameters. It has it's own shows - I loved KA which was spectacularr. It has it's own nightclubs and famous chef good restaurants. 
BEST are the window vents which allow fresh outside air into the room. 
Bathroom was updated modern. Quality body lotion and shampoo\/conditioner. Don't like the shower water trickle. Makes it difficult to wash long hair.
On last day there was ceiling water leak from floor above. I was disturbed early morning while asleep -  first by maintenance and then again by  hotel security - for them to asses the damage from water flood in room above.

This place is HUGE!! I was here last week when the Monorail dropped us off and we were going to the Luxor. We hiked through the MGM, the rodeo was in town and the entire place was packed with people. The only gripe that I have is that the signage for the monorail isn't all that clear from one end of the Casino to the other...

We only got a taste of the MGM Grand but it seems to hold it's standards pretty high despite all the traffic that it attracts with KA and the Arena Fights\/Concerts and all the 5 Star restaurants. Also, the prices for the rooms seem to be consistently mid range despite it being so popular. They must attract a lot of high rollers. 

The plethora of Michelin rated eateries is very impressive. Even the non-Michelin rated restaurants are pretty impressive. I have been to Pearl, Emeril's, L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon, and Wolfgang Puck's. I have just scratched the surface and will try more in the future for sure. 

The rooms were pretty nice when I stayed here a few years ago. Moderately sized and clean. 

The only thing that really bugs about this casino is the extremely long hikes from the front of the hotel to the back where all the restaurants are. Even from the valet station, it's pretty far. Everything is so far apart. I guess that's how they get you to play. You get tired from walking, sit down at a machine, and say, what the heck and play a $100 while you rest. Good strategy. 

All in all, this hotel really tries to cater to it's regulars. Why else would you scrap a brand new lion entrance just because it's bad luck in some cultures. That was a big renovation but I'm sure the dividends were much higher.

Expected better.

Basic King room is super modern and clean (thus the 3 stars), but tiny. Toilet and shower are separate glass doors that both step right into the main room entrance. No privacy and no sound insulation! Worked for me and my husband, but I'm glad the days I spent with my girlfriends were with a different hotel. Also, the hotel is enormous, so you have to walk through what feels like miles of narrow and dark corridor to reach your room.

The main issue, however, is the service. The taxi line is 20-30 minutes on a crowded sidewalk, and not just during peak hours - always! Our best technique was walking across the street to Hooters and catching a cab there, with no wait! The bell desk line is also ridiculous at checkout, and when we came to pick up our bags later that afternoon it took 30 minutes to get them back and the staff kept forgetting who we were or that we had already given them our bag ticket. Maybe if you looked up when we talk it would be easier?

Bottom line: Next time, we will go for a nicer room at a medium hotel instead of being treated like second class citizens for having a basic room at what's supposed to be a fancy hotel.

Has the worst customer service in the bars and restaurants...except in the buffet and poolside.   Very expensive dinning and again poor service...glass of wine $14!! And that was the house!!  Too too many people everywhere and massive place.   Not my style.

Wow what a great place to stay.  Granted if you're in Vegas, then you'll probably be out and about most of the time.  But after a hard day's fun, you've got a nice clean and comfy room to come back to.  I spent 4 days here and during that time had a blast at the Black Jack tables - didn't lose the shirt off my back, whew!
The buffet here is quite a deal... LOTS of selection and they even have champagne brunch options.
