If you're racking up comp points, however, spend them at Bellagio instead - they've a better buffet.  While you're here, don't forget to catch a show or two.  My friends and I got to see Cirque du Soleil's Ka and it was a mindblowing good time.

We stayed at the Signature suites behind the MGM but this newly remodeled casino is beautiful and it does not look like it was built in the early 90's.  Several great restaurants, stores, food court, HUGE casino, great pools, decent sports book, cool bars, and a great location on the strip.  I wish I could remember more but Vegas is always a blur.

I've stayed here several times over the years, but I was disappointed with this last stay this past week. I was expecting to get a room of similar quality I've always had before, since I booked the same type of room all the time. I was excited before I got here because of past experience and how nice everyone and everything was. The room I got this last time was much smaller and although there was a complete renovation of all the rooms done, this room felt cramped and fragile. The glass doors were not lined up exactly, so if you closed the door to the toilet, it would rub the contact area with the hinge, which was also glass. I understand modern design, but it just seemed really cramped. In addition, you would think with the room renovations done, they would have thought to upgrade the cardio room to an actual fitness center. The ridiculous $28 resort fee is not justified by providing wifi and access to this cardio room with only a few machines working and almost as many not working. Before the renovation, you at least got a daily newspaper and printing services for certain items.
Got a suite for my wife and kids on the way to Arizona.  Suite was awesome and my kids loved how big and spacious it was.  The casino was awesome and the kids loved the lazy river.

We checked in at the airport MGM desk. The staff was nice and there was no wait - I offered the "twenty trick" and received several good upgrades - better room, closer to casino location, fridge, and the room was available three hours early. The key machine at the airport site was down so we had a short wait again at the hotel to get our keys, but they do have an ample number of check-in people always available (who were also helpful with questions throughout our stay as well).

We found the hotel to be quiet and very clean. TV was small & outdated, but we didn't watch much television anyway. Housekeeping staff was friendly and accommodating, as was the desk personnel when we checked out.

Downside to the MGM is it's size....gigantic. You get plenty of exercise walking to shops, restaurants, walkways to other casinos, and the monorail. But it's ALL there!
I do not like having to pay $20 a day for wifi we didn't use even once, but that's typical of all the resorts. It's nice to be able to charge to the room account in a wide variety of casinos, shops, and restaurants affiliated with MGM and we got an amazing package deal through Allegiant Airlines that included airfare, shuttle, room, shows, and meals.
LOVED Wolfgang Puck's food and received a thank you from the manager for visiting the eatery on Thanksgiving Day.

I arrive at the MGM Grand on a Saturday night to hit one of their clubs- Club 56- and hit the slots machines. The club was alright, albeit too crowded with posers with Affliction shirts and hootie mamas with bell-shaped dresses and forever 21 dresses. The drinks were moderately priced and too strong for me. I ordered an Incredible Hulk and the drink was really strong. I'm guessing they added weed to the drinks to kept you buying.

The hotel itself was okay, with nice airy, clean rooms. There were pictures of long dead actors hanging on the walls and the bathrooms have ample towels. The drawback was that the elevators would take a long time on peak days. It would take several hours sometimes just to get an elevator without some dude with a boner standing behind you. The pool was nice, except the 3 feet depth and water that tasted like pee and bad body order. On several occasions, I swallowed some water while attempting a breast stroke. You have to watch out for little kids running around the place and fat people that have a size too small bathing suits. 

The restaurants inside the hotel is top notch, with restaurants catering to every price. Top tier restaurants to a McDonalds if you're on a budget. There's even a Dyer's ice cream parlor that comes in handy on really hot days. In all, I give this hotel four stars for the smelly pool and wannabe posers.

MGM's hotel rooms are getting a bit rundown...perhaps new carpeting or a polishing of the bathroom marble tiles is needed? 

Other than the not-so-tip-top-shape of the rooms, our stay here was better than satisfactory. We came here to stay for 3 nights for my sister's birthday, and we all had a good time. The rooms were decent, the beds were comfortable, and the rates we paid were fair.

The front desk check-in staff was really nice and accommodating, and allowed us to upgrade to suites for a minimal fee once the rooms became available.

We spent some time lazing around the Lazy River; which had waterfalls and a pretty decent current. Rent an inner tube, buy one of those huge daquiri drinks, and just lay back, allowing the current to carry you along the river's path. Make sure to watch out for the random places where water shoots out at you though...and the curtain of water at some point that you just can't avoid, no matter what you do.

Many of the dealers here are nice too; there was only one grouch at a roulette table, but then again, it was 4 in the morning, so oh well. Learned how to play craps finally, and the dealers were all very patient and helpful dealing with us newbies at the table. 

The only complaint I have is that the casino doesn't have any 25 cent Wheel of Fortune machines! Why?!?!

I'd recommend this hotel if you're on a budget, looking for a pretty nice place to stay (although it's nowhere in the league of the Venetian, for instance), and don't mind a lot of walking, since it's located at the far end of the strip.

My wife booked us rooms at the MGM Grand because they where advertising the latest, most up to date rooms. I would rather have stayed someplace that had a better atmosphere. 

This was my first time in Vegas. We went to Vegas for a combined celebration of my wife's birthday and a belated Honeymoon. When we arrived, the girl checking us in said she could give us an upgrade in the room, but the room we had reserved had all the latest technology. Flat screen TV, Blu Ray, ETC.. the room she would move us into didn't have any of that. I didn't care, we took the upgrade. I didn't come to Vegas to watch TV, and to be honest I never turned it on. The room was nice enough; I didn't plan on spending a lot of time in the room, just change clothes and sleep. I will say the huge king sized bed we had was very comfortable! Plus it had free WIFI. 

The shower was weird. I'm not a tall man, but I could not stand under the shower head. My wife is 5'4 and even she had issues with the height of the shower head location. It could have stood to be about a foot higher. Other than that, the bathroom was nice enough in the room. 

So why the low rating? The rest of the resort. 

This place is huge. After we checked in, we went to our room, unpacked, changed and went to hit the strip! We wanted to get onto Las Vegas Blvd... there where no signs or directions on how to get there. I walked around the casino, hotel, resort, going in circles when I finally found the concierge desk, I was annoyed, but I tried to make a joke of it by making fun of myself, I actually asked the concierge, "How do I get out of this hotel?!" They gave me a map and directions for me to get onto Las Vegas Blvd. After that I really didn't have too many problems, I was able to find my way in and out. This was another thing I didn't like After walking down the strip, especially at the end of the night, you are relieved to get to the hotel, only to have to walk what seems like a mile through crowds to get to the elevator bank. 

I didn't care for the atmosphere of the casino itself. It seems so stuffy and pretentious. I don't know, maybe I've seen too many movies, but it's not at all how I pictured a casino would look in Vegas. The staff was friendly when you could find one. A lot of times they would come around and ask if we wanted drinks only for us to never see them again. Or we would be playing for long periods of time before someone would ask if wanted a drink. 

And what is with all of the kids?! There were a ton of kids there. Who the heck brings kids to Vegas? I'm sorry, it only takes about a minute of walking up and down the strip to realize Vegas isn't exactly "family friendly". I'm not holding that against the hotel, it just has been bothering me. 

We had pre-paid for our rooms when we booked them, and then where surprised with an $18 (we booked and paid before they raised it, so we got the price at the time we booked) a night resort fee... and then they charged tax on top of it. Sure the $80 dollars is not going to break us, but still... that is like 3 drinks on the strip! 

The lion habitat was pretty neat. I did get some good pictures up close of that. I appreciated the helpfulness of the hotel staff, but honestly the next time we go to Vegas I want to stay someplace more my style.

The worst hotel check-in experience I have ever incurred. When we booked the room we asked for a celebrity suite with 2 beds and no smoking. We finally got to our room which was a suite with 1 bed that reeked like cigarette smoke. So we called guest services and asked to move into the room we originally booked. They told us they didn't have any two bed suites available. So they sent us down the hall to wait for security to let us into out 2nd room. We waited in the hall with all our bags for 10 minutes.  Upon arrival security let us in to our new room which was 2 beds, no smoking but not a suite. Very small. So we called guest services again and asked to be moved into a 2 bed non smoking suite like originally agreed upon. We waited in the hallway at our new room for 20 minutes. I called downstairs to see what the holdup was and the said they sent a bell hop to pick us up at our old room. Great communication guys. When we finally were let in to our 3rd room which was a 2 bed suite it smelled like someone smoked a carton of cigarette in there 15 minutes before we arrived. On to our 4th room. Glenda from guest services finally got us in the right room after 4 attempts. Her customer service skills were good and she was doing the best she could. The whole ordeal took us about two hours to check in. The  ball was dropped many times. In addition the rooms are very outdated with old cathode ray tube televisions.  You might remember them from before flat screens. Horrible. The beds weren't very comfortable either. Compared to other places in Las Vegas it's old and aged. I will never stay here again.

I hate Las Vegas! I only go there for conferences. MGM was the cheapest option that was not creepy with strange characters roaming around. When you arrive, note that this is the THIRD largest hotel in the WORLD...so expect to walk around A LOT. 
Receptionists are like used car dealers (no offense to car dealers reading this). They are pushy to "upgrade" you. You have to negotiate and haggle. The "Staywell" option is worth it only if smoking smell bothers you (it bothers me). Their buffet is good and worth a try.

First day of arrival got charged with unexpected fees that they did not mention in the reservation. Then throughout our stay we have been locked out of our room twice because our keys kept breaking. Will NOT Be coming back here. Pick another hotel

Not in impressed with the customer service at all at the Mgm. Me and my husband checked in yesterday and was caught off guard that they now charge to self and valet park at ALL MGM properties. When we got to the counter Rena checked us in. Process went smooth however we discussed the parking cost which irritated me a bit. Wouldn't have stayed here had I known this policy was recently implemented. Also we were not offered a bell boy for our luggage. Therefore we walked all through the casino looking for the west wing. When we found the west wing another couple was also loss. At this moment I knew I'd never stay at MGM  again. Our room was decent. As described online however the water drained very slow in the sink causing the sink to fill up for sometime before it slowly runs out. This morning called for towels n to have room cleaned and I got the towels 1 hour and 30 mins later and my room still hasn't been clean. Minor but slightly annoyed. We paid over 600.00 for our stay n a bulb is our as well as the tv doesn't wrk. This is insane to me. I'm trying to be a gd sport about it but it's not going to end well if I have to go to the front desk to voice my concerns. This is ridiculous. I could have stayed in one of those boutique hotels off the strip for this kind of service.

Worst experience ever....I had reservation for 2 rooms, with 2 queen beds in each room, when I arrived, they said all that was available is a small room with only 1 king bed.  I booked the rooms on the internet months in advanced, they charged my credit card immediately, and when I spoke to the manager in charge, all he said was that "When you book a room, it only guarantees the rate, not the type of room".  Well that is insane, then why bother putting the type of room request on the internet at all.  Anyway, after complaining, they said they would switch my rooms tomorrow....I could hear the other desks clerks saying the same thing to other guests with the same problem.  I mentioned this to the desk clerk, many rooms with 2 queen beds were going to be available, since I could hear other around us with the same problem.  The desk assured me that there would not be a problem if I returned to the desk before 6:00 PM the next day.  Of course I believed her and returned the next day at 4:30 PM and was again told there were no rooms available.  Talk about poor customer service!!!!!!!!  I will never go to anything hotel manager by this group, which also includes the Mirage, Bellagio, and others.

This hotel is okay. A little too big for my taste. But we got a really good deal which included free shuttle passes to and from the airport and a $25 dining credit good towards any of the MGM Grand-owned restaurants. Like nearly all of the casino resorts this past weekend, the lobby had a red and gold ornamental display to commemorate Lunar New Year. 

The casino floor is enormous and we stayed in a room in the relatively new West Wing. While it was nice to stay in a room that was more W in style than themed casino room, it was a VERY long walk from the main elevators to our room. I swear it was like a 1\/4 of a mile long. The hallway literally changes color scheme and decor style as you walk into the West Wing.

There are some really nice restaurants and bars in MGM now (see my reviews for Shibuya and Craftsteak) but again, this casino is so big it always takes forever to get through the hotel and crowds to get outside. 

Going back to the room, it was smaller but nice with modern decor, a flat screen TV, even a small TV imbedded in the mirror of the bathroom. I loved the huge shower. The bathroom could have used a fan. The walls were quite thin and I could hear people running around above us. 

There is a lion habitat that has the cheesy fake lion roar sound effects but there is no denying the lions are beautiful. I felt sorry for them, all cooped up with a zillion tourists taking flash photography and making dumb noises trying to get their attention.

I am currently staying at the mgm grand in the "grand tower" my veiw is great of the airport! In a tower suite. The first night my TV in my room was possessed. Turn on an off by itself, turn volume up and down all on its own and flash non stop. Eventually had to unplug it and wait until the morning to have a tech come look at it. The room has a really cool lamp that does not work. The living room portion of the suite has 1 lamp that works. 
My wife and I had lunch at the buffet...... absolutely horrible. Food selection was mediocre and something that I ate from there gave me diarrhea.  Nothing like paying 60$ and then getting sick from it.  Mgm needs to learn how to treat it's guests or there will not be any. Rented a car and then was informed that there will be a 10$ parking garage fee each day.... after I paid 33$ a day for a "resort fee". Wow are you really hurting that bad to rip your customers off. Well sorry mgm you lost a customer with me, I WILL NOT be back
Ill never book again is price, long line to get a room , wr got locked out and had to wait and hour to get our key re programed . Never gonna stay here again.

The casino here is HUGE and pretty nice with the red tabletops... it's impressive. But the rooms seem to be a little on the expensive side and for my money I'd rather stay on the north end of the strip. They generally do have a great show or two here though and the underrated Hard Rock is right next door.
I've never stayed in the hotel. However this is one of the nicer casinos on the strip. They have plenty of great slots machines, and great choices for food and drinks.

Recently stayed at the MGM and had a great experience. Stayed in a standard room on the 11th floor, with two queen beds. The room was recently remodeled and was very clean. Had a view of Tropicana and Excalibur. The pool was busy but very nice. The lazy river was awesome and they have a shallow kiddie pool. 
The cardio room didn't have a ton to offer, elliptical, treadmills and bikes. But was clean and offered cold water and clean towels.
Overall great place to stay.

I stayed here during the Thanksgiving season. One thing that annoyed me is that they don't have a bar specifically for you to hang your clothes on when you shower. In addition, the label on the mini-fridge was confusing. The label said that if the contents are altered or something is placed in it, there will be a $50 restocking fee charged. I'm a little confused on how charging someone if they put something in the fridge works, since you could put something in the fridge and take it out before you leave.

Other than that, everything else seemed good. The room was clean, and the window had shades controlled by some buttons on the wall. There was a TV with a lot of channels with some MGM-related information, and I liked the AC\/heater control. It was neat that there was a little mirror on the side of the bathroom whose position is adjustable; I found it very useful when I was putting contacts in my eyes. I also liked that they had power outlets on desks. In addition, a safe is in one of the drawers, which I put my valuables in whenever I left the room. Towels, a hair dryer, an iron, soap, and travel-sized lotion, shampoo, body wash, and conditioner were provided.

Self-parking was good in that there was a moderate amount of parking spaces available. There are a lot of restaurants near the parking structure, including a Haagen Dazs shop. The more expensive restaurants are in the hotel itself. The fountain by the elevators is beautiful. At night, there's a security guard by the elevators who may ask to see your room key, which makes me feel more secure.

My employer was hosting an event at the MGM Garden Center but for some reason my suite got mixed up. I was only staying for two nights so I didn't throw a fit about them over booking my room however the room they gave me was terrible. The carpet was filthy and it was right next to an air conditioning unit. I called the front desk and asked if they could move me or if they could at least give me a better room since they were the ones who over booked my suite. I was told they couldn't do anything. At this point I was upset because not only did I lose my suite but I was in a noisy dirty room. Again, I tried not to let it bug me because I was only staying for two nights, however it was extremely disappointing. The room service was great though and so was the food. I am not sure I'd stay here again after the terrible service I received and over booking my suite. You bet your behind when I got my AMEX Corporate bill the next month, I was charged for my Suite and it took almost a month for them to fix it. The worst thing is most places offer you free nights or something for their mistakes and MGM basically didn't do anything for me. I travel to Vegas often for business and as I plan my next trip I can't say I'd stay here and I am most likely going to be booking myself and other colleagues elsewhere due to MGM's lack of responsibility and customer service after they made a mistake.

Nice hotel at a great location, West Wing room was modern though slightly odd in functionality, especially the bathroom.  The quieter West Wing room we stayed at was modern yet comfortable for what you need.  Not sure what I feel about the two adjacent shower and toilet stalls separated by frosted glass wall but it was modern elegant and served their purposes.  I also wished the bathroom counters weren't so terribly small.

The hotel casino itself had all the amenities you can expect from a big LV hotel.  Plenty of restaurants of all price ranges, nice pool, and plenty of bars to enjoy your nights.  We went to see Ka while there, and being hotel guests we got a substantial discount on our show tickets.  

Regardless of the oddity of some room functions, because of the location, hotel-casino amenities, and entertainment options I'd still consider this as one my options for future stays in Sin City.
room service is the worst..!!!!!! so gross, no effort

#Mgmgrand is the worst on the Vegas Strip.  With over 6800 rooms mine had feces smeared on the carpet and sheets.

Food is raunchy and the buffet is the worst on the strip.   Barf!  Not to mention the foodborne measles spread at MGM.

Special thanks to customer support who offered a free stay but unfortunately they reneged with this review.  See Mgm grand sucks on FB and please like it.

Report food poisoning online to 
http:\/\/southernnevadahealthdistrict.org\/foodborne

Update: measle outbreak at MGM.  Be careful!

No coffee maker or mini bar in room & an extra $25\/day if I wanted one.  The place stunk (everywhere you went) of strong cheap musk cologne (nauseating).  Nothing to do really other than drink or gamble.  And an extra $134.00 exit\/resort charge on my checkout.  There will be no return for me to this hotel.

All things considered, this is one of my absolute favorite places to stay in Las Vegas.

First,    everything you could want in a destination location is found in the MGM. 
The hotel boasts great places to eat, a supurb pool, large poker room, huge casino ( maybe even a bit to huge ) and excellent entertainment. The Ka experience is totally amazing as are the night club experiences beginning with Studio 54.

Second,    the location of the hotel and casino on the corner of Tropicana gives tyou access to all the hotels at this end of the strip. The variety of activities around this corner intersection with the NYNY is just amazing.

Finally ...... The rooms are very nice and there is a variety of styles that should please everyone.
I enjoy the standard tower room, but got upgraded through a super front desk clerk to a west wing room on one weekend visit. 
West wing rooms are smaller than the tower room, but the decor is very modern and the cozyness of the room with all the ambiance makes for  an outstanding weekend experience.
I stayed in the Hollywood suites with the family and found them to be nice, but nothing special other than the size and the fact that you have your own seperate entrance to the hotel area. The suites are located opposite the grand tower elevators.

I think the MGM grand is exemplified by the grandeaur of the lobby area. It truely is amazing in size and scope.
I have always found the desk people to be super nice and willing to meet all your needs.

In all aspects of casino action, quality dining experiences, late evening entertainment, quality spa and swimming pool and spectacular shows you can not do better in one location in Las Vegas.

In all ways the MGM is ............ grand.

I will NEVER stay here again! Housekeeper walked in room unannounced at mid night! Claimed she thought the room was vacant. A guest on the floor had pics of BED BUGS! Hotel informed and said that bed bugs are at all hotels! Not a big deal to them!

The tower spa suite was beyond my expectations. Huge room with separate area for couch and bar etc. very modern with two twelve feet by five feet windows. Estimated. Great bathroom with large jetted tub. Shower was a little small but that's it. Great value for a great room. Will definitely stay in this suite again.

F this place. 
One of the top two worst Vegas hotel experiences.

I'm here right now on a vacay. 
Last year I came for the same event, stayed at the Palms for the same price and the room was a sweet, suite and around THREE times as big!!! 

I was so upset, so I called for a room upgrade.  
Upgrade fee .. okay. I leave my room on the 8th floor and to my new room which I have to go down to 1st and up another elevator to the 16th floor.

I enter....

TV on some random channel...
Closet open with lights on...
Seats moved around...
One of the bathroom lights on...

There is an empty pizza box... 
couple empty beers...
iron and board set up...
messy sheets... 
spot lamp lighting pointing at the bed.... 

and a f ing open "LOVE BOX"....
MULTIPLE USED CONDOMS and their open wrappers littering the room

... uh... 

I call pissed and request another room and to waive the fee... nope. 

You kidding me?! Apparently there are no similar rooms available on the floor or any near floors which use the same elevator so we have to go back down and up again and return to the 8th floor. 

I enter the new room upset and unsatisfied by the choice I made for which resort to stay in.
Oh and now the remote doesn't work in the new suite. Now I'm watching a continuous commercial looping and telling me how MGM is supposed to make my stay great.

We rest for 30 minutes and head over to the Ling Ling Lounge in Hakkasan which was reserved for our own private party.
After everyone waited for 40 minutes PAST our reserved time they THEN mention the "dress code" issue which was never previously mentioned, or expected due to the lounge being reserved and private party.
We return back to our rooms to change and return to the event. 

Thanks MGM for helping my experience\/vacay with you guys.
Contact me if you have a reason for me to remove this.

Wow, I used to come here a lot when my parents gone to Vegas, and how much has it changed. The place looks new and lively. And yes, the baby lions are still there. 

This is the place to gamble, be sure to get the club club. It does not include the total rewards program. Get comps on food, but do NOT go to the buffet, I was not impress. For buffet's, go to Rio's.

Hotel is basic. The first room they put us in the bath tub and the sink wouldn't drain so they moved us to a different room. Now we can't get into our room! Every room they move us to the keys don't work and ur stick outside your room for like 30 min trying to get the key to work. Then if we call to have someone open our door we are waiting another 30 min because they take so long to get up here -_- terrible hotel!

I have no complain so far with this hotel. It is clean, spacious and decent enough. The only bad part staying on a hotel along with a big conventions is that you have to  fall in line to the elevator, starbucks, etc. It is really crowded and gives me anxiety. I usually love being around a lot of people but not like this of bumping elbow to elbow when you walk everywhere. Arrggh not fun at all.

Me and my wife decided to go to Vegas and stay at the MGM for our honeymoon. Upon checking in the front desk clerk found out we were staying there for our honeymoon and sent us a complimentary bottle of Champagne. The only issue we had was on Friday when we had to call twice for fresh towels before someone actually came to provide them to us. The checkout desk waived the resort fees for us as a result but being one of the premier hotels on the strip I expected better. The MGM I will say is conveniently located on the strip as there is a monorail stop which will take you to the opposite end of the strip. If you wish to go to Mandalay Bay all you need to do is walk across the street to Excalibur and hop on the tram.

Very mediocre hotel by Vegas standards.  The room was nicely decorated, but few things worked.  Television was not working due to apparent bandwidth problems.  Wired internet useless.  Wireless internet on the verge of being useless.  Loud and often bad music everywhere you walk in public areas.  Cheesy (although probably average by Vegas standards).  Better places to stay, that's for sure.  Don't book a conference here.  Checkin notes for the hotel:  if you're going to build a humongous monstrosity like this, you need to ensure you have front desk capacity to handle the extra flow.  Had to wait in line a good 15 minutes to check in.

I've stayed at MGM many years ago when they still had the Wizard of Oz display and I wish they never got rid of it, it was so incredible. My kids would have loved it.

I've had breakfast here and have had some of the best eggs benedict on the strip. 

I've also enjoyed a concert here and it was great, but on this day I was here to buy tickets for the Jennifer Lopez and Enrique Iglesias concert on August, 18. 

Honestly, when I came in off the strip entrance I didn't even recognize it due to all of the construction.  But the best thing was finding the Rain Forest Cafe Restaurant which you'll see as you walk in.  I can't wait to bring the kids here.

I made my way to the concierge only to find out that the concert was not at the MGM!!  

JLO is performing at Mandalay Bay!  

HOWEVER, 5-stars for the MGM concierge who called the Mandalay Bay and found me my tickets to the JLO Concert!  

Yippee, I've got my tickets! Score!
No idea how we ended up here! The hotel is amazing the whole place is so luxurious that you can't help but be amazed! The night started at a bar last nigh and now I'm here haha what a night!!

Worst hotel experience of my life! 

For starters: when I called to book the hotel I asked about joining rooms because I was bringing 2 children with me to visit family who were in town visiting Vegas. The lady on the phone said she could not reserve two rooms next to each other but that it shouldn't be an issue when we arrived to request it. 

When we did arrive the lady that was helping us asked if we had "blocked" rooms next to each other- I had explained that I called and requested it, but the lady on the phone said she couldn't do it. The lady helping check us in said that was not true, she could have helped us. 

So we didn't get a room next to family which was really important for the children for when they were sleeping to be right next door in the next room. So that sucked! Secondly, our room was filled with smoke from cigarettes and weed! It was so heavy that I called around 4\/5am and told the front desk. They said they could bring an air purifier and help with the smoke. I thought that was at least something since my kids are breathing it in. THEN I received a call from the person delivering the air purifier and he said they would need to come back and pick it up after 30min.... which would mean we would need to be up again to give it back and so they wouldn't wake the kids after not sleeping alllll night.

OTHER LITTLE THINGS:
1. The remote didn't work
2. I took cans of beer out of the fridge to put Breast milk and they charged us and my husband had to spend our post dinner time explaining what happened because we didn't know that you can't even take anything out because it's censored...

I will NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN. Horrible!

This review is for reservation agent Connie. She and casino host Andy were very helpful in arranging our rooms for our stay. Extremely professional, helpful, a joy to engage with on the phone. Thank you!

The suites are just plain whatever.  I got tricked by the front desk into upgrading my room to a suite for $50 more.  Not worth it.  The decor is plain and the only difference is that the shower is separated from the bath tub.  Still it was my 3rd time staying here cause I love the casino and their beds.

Dealers at the tables are cool...even when I spilled my drink. oops. : p   And the girls handing out drinks keep em coming.  I'm a vodka girl and they do use cheap vodka but i dont mind since its free.  The casino is HUGE and I could stay a whole day in there and not get bored.

One thing they are missing is a good club.  For now, I will have to hop across the street to LAX or take a cab somewhere else.

I didn't stay in a room here, but I did see Cirque du Soleil's "Ka" here and hung out for a bit on the first floor. The show was awesome and the theater is very nice. As for the first floor and the atmosphere at MGM, its EXTREMELY busy. The size of the hotel is absolutely massive. I thought this was place was Grand Central Station times 10. If you want to be in the midst of it all, this is the place. However if you're looking for something quieter and less crowded, stay far far far away.

I love the MGM Grand. A very fun place and a nice way to stay in Vegas. It's right on the strip, and it's got a ton to do. The rooms are nice and a good value for what you pay for. They have shops and tons of nice restaurants. The monorail runs right near the hotel. My favorite part of the hotel is the pool area is huge and awesome. I love the lazy river. They have an arcade as well. One of the best places to stay in vegas for a good value.

reservation, noun
1. The act of reserving; a keeping back or withholding.
     a. An arrangement by which accommodations are secured in advance, as in a hotel or on an airplane.
     b. The accommodations so secured.
     c. The record or promise of such an arrangement.

I don't know about you, but for me the entire point of a reservation is to ensure that you get what you want when you expect to get it.  To further secure such a reservation, PAYING IN ADVANCE should by all known laws of commerce guarantee that you receive the service or item in question.  Apparently at the MGM, that only applies if you are a celebrity and\/or "make it rain" on everyone with a gold name tag.  

I reserved and pre-paid for my suite two whole months before my stay.  But alas, upon check-in they were somehow out of suites.  Could it have been the highrollers in town for the boxing title bout that weekend at the MGM?  The hotel's only solution was to give me a regular "Deluxe" room and some free buffet vouchers.  I didn't want to make a scene and start my mini-vacation off with a bad vibe so the wife and I reluctantly decided to at least check out the Deluxe room offered.  The room sucked.  Plain and simple.  I had a lovely view of rooftop air conditioning units and wonderful green alien-esque MGM trademark spotlights aimed right at my window.  The room was less than half the size of the suite I paid for, and there was a broken lamp and water damage stains on the ceiling (at least I hope it was water).  Further investigation also showed that the food vouchers they gave us didn't make up for the price difference in the downgraded room. 

I called the manager to complain.  She was less than apologetic and actually acted like she was doing me the favor by comping the buffet.  After 3 rounds of increasingly angry calls, my wife was finally able to get them to magically make the suite we paid for appear on the second night of our stay and upgraded the buffet credits to full resort credits which we were able to use at the Wolfgang Puck restaurant.

Customer service is key, especially when you have such strong competition, so needless to say I will never stay at the MGM again.  I didn't roll up in a green and gold Lambo, but I expect to be treated with respect and fairness.

Recently stayed on the "Stay Well" floor of the MGM Grand, which is basically a floor of rooms that have some extras built in that separate them from "Stay Average" floors. I must say the biggest plus of the Stay Well experience is the separate registration area which is located between the massive general registration area and the bell desk. There must have been 200 people in line for general registration when I arrived, so this was worth every penny to check-in behind a closed door away from the masses. Upon entering the Stay Well Registration area, I was greeted warmly and offered a bottle of tasty blackberry infused bottled water. It was a nice start. Little touches can add a lot to the experience. As for the room, pretty much a standard room with some bonus items such as: an air purifier, a scent machine which made the room smell like green tea (fresh and clean), an outrageously comfortable bed, vitamin C infused shower water (reminded of non-vitamin C infused shower water), a night time clock designed to put you gently to sleep (zero patience to figure out how to work this device), wellness lighting in the bathroom which appeared to be nothing more than settings of really bright and not as bright,  and some other stuff that has already been forgotten. I enjoyed the Stay Well experience, but primarily for the ease of check-in.

As for the rest, I always enjoy the MGM. It smells fantastic throughout, a combination of jasmine and rose, I've read. The pools are comfortable and spacious. The fitness center and spa are well-appointed, and there is a great variety of restaurants throughout. Lots of gaming options, too, as one would suspect at a property of this size. And don't forget about proximity to airport - quick rides from and to the airport.

I reserved my room about a month and a half in advance just so that I wouldn't have any issues.  I reserved a non-smoking, suite with two queen beds and when we checked in, it turned out that they were booked and could only give us a smoking room with a king bed!!! WTH... I make reservations to avoid stuff like this and we get slapped in the face??  We had to go for it because it was Memorial Day Weekend and the likelihood that we would find something was very slim.  Oh, and to make matters worse we didn't even get one of the renovated rooms, we got an ugly old one with a leaking faucet!  We got no apologies and no goodies in lieu of their mistake and to top it off they over charged my friend's credit card.  We will not be staying here again and I hope they get their act together.  The only reason they get two stars is because at least their pool parties were worth it.

Before this trip, I would've given MGM 5 stars. This was our favorite place to stay in Vegas, but sadly we will not be coming back. We checked in, went up to the room they assigned us, and someone was already in it. Ok... So we go back down, explain to the manager that they gave us a room that was already occupied, and he assigns us a new one. Everything seems to be back on track, until we return from dinner the following night, get up to our room, stick our key in the door, and it doesn't open. Awesome. Again, we have to go all the way back downstairs to speak to another manager. He tells us that "someone" had switched us to another room in the system. Obviously without our knowledge. So the manager gives us $100 food and beverage credit for the inconvenience. Nice gesture, but it doesn't really make up for the heart attack I almost had thinking they had given our room away and someone made off with all our belongings. This relaxing holiday weekend ended up being a huge stress. Never again.

Through the years I've stayed at many a Vegas hotel.  But somehow I've seemed to have returned more than once, to the MGM.  They have really great deals and the hotel is very clean and the rooms are actually pretty nice.  Besides that, their walls are plastered with pics of Frank Sinatra and the likes.  Need I say more?

The room was clean, but The bathroom wasn't so clean.. We found a suite at a really low price.. The workers are really professional.. You are in The centre of Las Vegas, it's cool And from The window there s a really good view..
The room was clean and looked great. All the food we ate was awesome. I would stay there again.

Wonderful but such a fat walk to everywhere.  The suite was amazing,   The service was 5., even the maids were nice.   A few small problem in our room like blinds,  etc but they were repaired immediately.  We will stay there again.  I'm trying to plan my next trip now.

I'm taking my 1-Star Back! You would think an establishment would offer free parking for locals. I feel horrible for the employees that work here because their Insurance is useless. Research this casino and see who they're funding.
Never Again MGM!
now THIS is the happiest place on earth! didnt gamble much... went there for a party! really really amazing! blew my breath away

I've stayed here multiple times in the 80's, 90"s early 2000's and now again in 2015 although the hotel's appearance remains somewhat the same, mother  time is catching up with this once majestic hotel that has defined the Vegas skyline for decades. This experience was less than comfortable and the amenities aren't close to what they once were in my opinion.

I stayed here two nights in the west tower during a business trip so the entertainment, casino and restaurants was not the attraction it was about comfort, location and proximity to the airport. Apparently this was my first time parking a rental car in their garage and it may be my last, the walk from the garage to the west tower rooms had got to be approaching a mile once you consider the route. I certainly understand the business model and by design they make sure you pass by every shop, restaurant in the hotel and finally you must wind through the casino with your luggage in hand to get to the most ridiculous elevator location one can imagine it's located at the furtherest point from the main lobby (from the car to the room was no less than a twenty minute walk carrying luggage).

West Tower Room 3-503 very simple room - semi private bathroom, no counter space so plan on leaving all all your toiletries in your luggage, the lavatory sink was a miniature with very slow drainage, a small glass desk, surprisingly comfortable bed and two chairs.

My issues - NO HOT WATER -  it doesn't matter how early you wake up and turn the shower on the water will barely get lukewarm the same issue for the lavatory so expect a cold shave ugh! I don't want to hear did I contact the front desk the walk wouldn't be worth the trouble and there is nothing the maintenance department can do by coming up to the room this is a infrastructure issue that they know about it and further makes my point about this aging giant. Changing rooms you say - well we had multiple rooms and all had similar issues.

The lighting is good for sleeping not for reading, working or using the mirror above the lavatory.

The electrical outlets be warned your apple charger for your iPhone or IPad will fall out the socket. 

Check in process - Although there are an ample number of stations for the hotel representatives to check in customers only 25% of them were being used we arrived late evening it still required about a 20 minute waiting in a slow moving line even though we had advance reservations, of course it's the up selling and marketing that's a priority here no regard for the customer needs apparently. 

It pains me to write these kind of reviews especially for a place that once was so on top of their game. I will really have to consider other options in the future.

Okay so I know we tried to mix the family vacation with the kids in Las Vegas. And to be honest it was for the most part amazing with heaps of activities for the holidays and the kids to enjoy. What I found ridiculous was the lack of ability to deal with families traveling with children. I have five rooms this stay and checking out tomorrow after a 4 night stay. Everyday since we arrived in some way or form we were addressed rudely by staff because we had kids. Even when just in strollers while trying to buy 10 tickets to KA at the M-Life Players club. I'm not upset about the rules at all but the delivery of their message and attitude of majority of the staff we came across during our stay. I have stayed at the Aria, Vdara, Bellagio, BlueGreen and Pallazo and they have all been amazing with us and our kids.  And we will return to these places instead of returning here.  We ran into three other families traveling with children and I was not surprised at all that they were having the same reaction to staying at the MGM. As a Gold MLife member I will not be bringing my family here again nor will I be returning on my own.  Oh and I'm not even going to go into details on how we couldn't shower for 12 hours due to a backed up shower tub. Ok now back to our vacation.

Overall, I would recommend the MGM for convenience of location, more than anything else.  The price and size of the rooms are definitely not worth it, but you really can't beat the location, and the room was clean and every employee we dealt with during our stay was super sweet.  We paid for two queen beds in a room for two nights: Friday-Sunday morning.  The room was TINY- we could barely have people over in our room (there were 8 in our party, spread out over Vegas), which surprised me as I would think two queen beds would include some actual living space.  Or a coffee maker.  Or a fridge.  I would trade our TV for either item in a heartbeat.  Apparently, in Vegas, a coffee maker is worth it's weight in gold, or whatever MGM charges you to rent one for your room!

That being said, the MGM is right on the strip, close to the airport, and contains what I think is the best club and the best buffet in Vegas.  There's something to be said for being able to return to your room in a drunken stupor 10min after leaving the club.  I was also surprised by how quiet the hotel was, for  being in Vegas during the weekend.  We only heard one noise complaint, something about someone barrel-racing through the hallways... I'm just said I missed that one.  I have mixed feelings about recommending the MGM to anyone else looking for a room in Vegas, but if you have money to spend, it is clean and convenient!

I stayed at MGM for the first time in 2002 and became addicted. I have yet to have a bad experience when staying here, and I believe I have five visits under my belt.  The service is outstanding, the food options are incredible and the gaming area is unsurpassed.  On your next trip to Vegas, I would hightly recommend staying at MGM.

They're currently updating the front of the casino and, as a result,  they've removed the lion habit!

Bummer......

Forgot to do my Yelp review so a little late.
I stayed here in the summer. Its great. I love it. 
One warning, Its huge and will take a little time to learn your way around. 
The room was nice and clean and reasonably priced.
The casino is huge and beautiful. A lot of good places to eat and drink. The pools are great especially the lazy river.
There is a monorail stop right behind so that is very convenient since its at the end of the strip. You can get a 3 day unlimited pass for, I think, $28. So worth it to save on some of the walking.
I will stay here again but i want to stay at many others too.

We stayed here the night after staying at the Palms and loved it again. The only things we didn't like were the pools here compared to the Palms. They were over crowded and not as nice as the Palms. This was on a week day as well. The hotel room was great and the casino was awesome as well. This place is massive!

My fiancé and I go to Vegas about once a month. We drive in from LA. It's our little romantic getaway from the city. We started staying at MGM a few years back and now we usually stay either there or at the hotel's affiliates. We love this and we have become pearl members and hope to become gold card members soon. We take advantage of every amenity the place has to offer. I work out of the gym, we frequent the spa and get spa services, we see shows, and we gamble at the casino. We contribute to keeping this place alive. We have stayed at the MGM signature, also Mandalay Bay, and others of MGM's affiliates. The thing that I will say is that it's not the cleanest hotel, because it is so much older than the others. However, that kind of contributes to how MGM is been one of the longest lasting casinos :-) I would recommend a stay there because it's affordable and it has everything you need. You're not bathing in the lap of luxury but you need to know that ahead of time. If you'd like to comment on this review, I can recommend a few other, nicer MGM affiliate hotels.

We had a wonderful stay.  The room was contemporary, clean, and spacious.  Upon checking in,  I asked if they could situate me in a quiet room because I'm a light sleeper.    The representative that helped me was friendly and attentive.  He said would do his best.  I don't think I was awakened even once by other guests in the two nights that we were there.  In addition, there is so much to do within the hotel that you practically don't have to leave the hotel to have a good time.  I would definitely stay at the MGM again.

Rating for:

Cleanliness and Service.

Room service was very quick during my stay and the food was much larger portions than I anticipated! The food was good!!
You have a good mix of fast food or nice restaurants to choose from.
The rooms are modern and the beds are comfortable!!

This hotel offers more upscale rooms for an affordable price. Avg. $125-$300 per night

Long, overdue review. Been here many times, keep coming back. Excellent location, to airport and everything. It is a huge resort, always busy, but very convenient. Old school, just the way I like it. And the casino hits. The rooms in the West Wing are small, reimincent of NYC, but who hangs in the room? Prefer a room off the main casino, but love a good deal and updated rooms. Oh, the pools are fabulous. You could get lost here for weeks. Always look forward to Vegas and The MGM.

My family and I stayed at the MGM Grand a few years ago and LOVED our stay there. We checked in with no hesitation at all and the people were very friendly. Our room was SPOTLESS and very clean. It is HUGE too!!!  I would definitely recommend the MGM to anyone staying in Vegas. We even found it humorous to see the green lights from outside shining into our room. 

One of the great things about this place is the food court that is downstairs. You can simply go and grab a cup of coffee, breakfast or a hot dog for a reasonable price. I would definitely stay there again!!!

After swearing I would never come back here, I received an email about their promotional offer 2 free buffets per day. When a trip to Vegas became a reality, I remembered about this email and went back to look at it because I remembered the expire date was mid august and there were no block out dates for the month that I had planned for. But when I opened the email, the photos were all broken, but they still had the words there that linked to the offer.

Turns out, they took all the photos down, changed the offer to just 70$ credit total and made it expire sooner. So I called MGM and after 30 minutes on the phone they said no such offer existed. I thought maybe I was wrong and made a mistake, BUT I went searching for another code and found proof that I was correct about the deal, because retailmenot had posted it as well. SCAM SCAM SCAM MGM shame on you.

Attached is the email I received with the broken photos, you can see where the words still say two free buffets per day. Also attached is the post I found on retailmenot proving the dates. Also if you use the code on retailmenot for the 2 free buffets per day, it reverts you to the 70$ credit offer that has expired.

Check in was great. MGM has a decent overall atmosphere and it wasn't overly crowded during March Madness. The problem was the room. We found blood on the wall, mold in the bathroom, the sink was badly damaged, and a strong smell of sulfur when using the faucet. The manager compensated us with $50 off of our room charge and two free buffet tickets. I'll let you decide if that's fair or not.

Worst hotel experience ever!!   Paid for a luxury skyloft suite at the MGM 6 months in advance for my bachelor party weekend in Vegas.   Arrived early at 9am and was told my room wouldn't be ready till 3pm.  Which was fine because we were gonna gamble anyway.   We received a call at 3 saying our room was ready.   We go to the VIP check in area for suites.   This is when the problem occurred, they told me my room was given away and I was moved to a regular one bedroom.  They apologized and said they over booked that suite and that their was nothing I can do about it.   They wanted to give me $100 comp to food and beverage like that was going to solve everything.   I was extremely upset and my entire tripped was ruined because I was looking forward to staying in a skyloft suit.   Mgm for sure lost a good customer here with this trip

Everything about this hotel and casino is great except for the reservation and check in process. 
Ok, since my last review, i have stayed at this hotel 9 times. I end up in Vegas a lot for both work and fun. I want to make something clear to people booking this hotel. When you make a reservation, specifically for a suite, you are not guarranteed the room type you booked. And if you booked a suite on a busy weekend, forget about getting that room unless you are some fancy high roller! Labor day weekend i was supposed to have an executive suite room with 2 queen beds and a connecting grand king room. Plenty of room for 5 people! Instead, i ended up with a regular room with 2 queen beds. Yes, that is right, 1 room only! The hotel also doesn't use "rollaway" beds anymore.  Upon checkin when i found out about all this, it was too late to book at another hotel. Also, the front desk staff checking me in was rude about it. The front desk woman,( who's name i referenced in a letter to the executive office this week) told me that it wasn't her problem that i had 5 people to fit into 2 queen size beds. 

I like everything about this hotel except for that policy. I would love to have a catered event over the holidays in one of their suites, but i'm afraid that if i plan something, then go to check in, i won't get the room i requested.(Why wouldn't i be hesitant? The last 5 stays i haven't received the room type that i requested.) I have expressed my concerns many times, sent emails to executive offices, talked to Mlife representatives, etc. No one ever calls me back.


Summary: You aren't guarranteed your specific room that you booked. It doesn't matter when you booked it. The early check in fee doesn't guarrantee that you will get your specific room either! The hotel overbooks all of the rooms and suites. It is first come, first serve, checkin for the rooms. Unless of course you are a high roller, then you get whatever you want. ( I'm just a gold mlife member that is supposed to get complimentary room upgrades-what a joke-never happens!)

My entire weekend was ruined because i was given a room that didn't accommodate our needs.
Not a good place to watch a football game.  Not nearly enough room at sports bar.  Rude staff.  Finally went to another hotel just to watch the game.
MGM Grand Mansion has amazing food and service!  The waiter remembered what I had ordered the year before and whether or not I had liked it :D

I've stayed here twice. The first time I stayed in the West Wing and the second time I stayed in the Grand. If youre booked in the Grand wing, request a change of suites.

The quality of the West Wing (5 star) far exceeds the Grand (3 star), which is understandable as the West Wing has been recently remodeled, but there was a big gap in the cleanliness of the rooms. My room at the West Wing was immaculate, but there was a lack of attention to detail during my stay in the Grand suites. There was long and short hairs sticking  to the ceiling of the bathroom, there was a band aid sticking to the bed headboard, and there was a large red stain that hadn't quite washed out of the sheets. Now I've traveled quite a bit so I know its unrealistic to expect perfection every time, but it was a little gross and I expected more for what we paid.

Also keep in mind that you'll pay an additional $25-per-day resort fee for "complimentary" wi-fi and for the pool (even if the pool isn't open.)

Service is so nice that I cannot say anything. Worth the money every penny. But of course this is a 2star hotel. I know what should i get on the money i have. Cant expect 5star service if its 2 star right? just be aware to those middle east guard they like to intimidate. Hotel=worth every penny.

I was forced to come here for a conference. When I booked my room I made it pretty clear I needed a non-smoking room because I am allergic to cigarette smoke. While the room itself is technically non-smoking the ONLY way to get to it is to walk through the giant, smoke filled casino. When I tried to explain to the front desk why I specifically requested a non-smoking room their only solution was to offer to "upgrade" me to a room that would cost $100\/extra. That's like charging someone in a wheelchair extra money for a room that has access to an elevator instead of stairs. Beyond the complete lack of empathy from the front desk the room also loses stars for having an overly loud AC, no mini fridge and no coffee machine.

The room quality here is medium to poor. My first room had water stains on the blinds and paint chips in the ceiling of the bathroom. I went to bed at about 1am and awoke at 2:30am. I could hear the sick kids in the room adjoining mine - there was little to no sound proofing because there was a door linking the rooms. I felt bad for the family but quite simply could not go back to sleep. It was like the kid was in the room with me. I could hear full conversations and make out every word. Worse, I had another adjoining door, and that person was busy smoking, which was filtering into the room. I packed up my stuff and got a new room, which was just fine. Nothing great about the MGM Grand in terms of room quality. Other posters are right - if you want a more luxurious Vegas experience, head to Bellagio or Wynn. This is a high-end Super 8 with slot machines in the basement. I'm stunned that anyone gave the MGM Grand five stars - makes me wonder what they are comparing it to.

The rooms are aren't any better than the other substandard room in Vegas (i.e., Luxor, Stratosphere, Excalibur).  I have stayed here three times (twice against my wishes ... work trips) and it seems to get worse every time I visit.  On one occasion the non-smoking room reeked as if a gang of chain-smoking gypsies had lived in that room a month.

I absolutely HATE that they make you walk through their mall from the parking to the hotel \/ casino (I don't go to timeshare presentations, why should they force me to "timeshare" and walk past those lame magnet stores, the bluescreen photo studio, and other various substandard and uninteresting retail outlets).  I know it's marketing, but the mall is just sad.  I hate that Aladdin makes me do the same thing, but at least the stores there are fresh and worthy of perusing.  I felt like I was in one of those old Flintstones cartoons where the same building \/ tree goes by in the background a dozen times while Fred chases Barney ... "Didn't I just see a magnet store?"  But I digress ...

The eateries are all fine ... nothing stupendous (but I never ate at any of the "upper scale" ones as I'd rather just go over to Bellagio or Mandalay Bay to spend my money).  I do remember one bar having bottles of Chimay which was nice.  They also do have a Davidoff cigar store which was a pleasant surprise.  The casino seemed acceptable ... but sprawling.  I stopped gambling when I go to Vegas, but it seemed fairly well layed out, but not as cozy or friendly as others.   The MGM Grand is also the end of the line for the Las Vegas monorail which is an added benefit if you happen to stay here (but plan on walking through that annoying mall to get to the station).

Generally, the atmosphere is lackluster.  Also, everytime I've been there over the span of a few years, it's the only casino that has had portions under construction in the casino area.  I've stayed at over a dozen of on and off-the strip hotels and this is almost at the bottom (the Motel 6 is lower, by the way) in terms of overall experience.  For the price and a better "average" type experience in Vegas, I'd rather visit the Monte Carlo.

This feedback doesn't even deserve a 1 star, but I have no choice. I never write review, but after contacting MGM 3-4 days and every time they transfer me back and forth through different department with no straight answer, I've decide to write my first review. I called my casino host ANTHONY LAY, he arranged a limo to pick me up from the airport. Well guess what? No one showed up at the airport. Then during the stay I've lost a certain amount of money from casino gaming. I contacted ANTHONY LAY and see if he can comp some of the food and bev but he NEVER respond. Being a regular to different casinos I've never seen such a rude and irresponsible host in any other hotel in Vegas. Very poor service, if u want to go Vegas and have a good time and be treated respectfully, don't bother to spend your money there. I will never return MGM ever. Why would I spend thousands of dollar and be treated like that when I can go to any other casinos and be treated respectfully. I came back from the trip trying to contact MGM and file a complaint on my casino host, found the email address on the website aftertravel@mgmresortsvacations.com, guess what? They respond and said they are not in hand for casino host complaints, told me to call MGM so I did, they kept transferring me to different department, told me there is no email address for me to file a complaint. Are u kidding me?! A hotel has no department that can take care a complaint?! So ppl can't complaint?! Wtf?! They just kept tossing me from this department to that department, and at the end, the operator gave me an email address and said try email to this address, at no surprise I haven't heard any respond for over 2 weeks. I've just wasted an hour a day for 3 day on this bull sh*t.

I can't believe how dirty the room is... I stayed at the spa suite which was pretty pricey so I expected the quality of the stay to be good. The room is big and looks very nice. However, the next morning when I woke up, I have a several bug bites all over my body, same goes for my bf. And we are sure we didn't have those the night before. Not only that, the sink plumbing was backed up, and black water flakes and hair kept coming out (I've attached the pic). We told them about the situation when we were checking out, they told us to go to the security to file a report. After filing the report and them taking pics of our bug bites, they told us they will have the room inspected and call us. The whole process was very unpleasant, they treated us like we are just trying to blame them for something that's our fault... And of course, we never heard from the hotel afterwards...

I'm sorry but the MGM just doesn't have that wow factor.  Their theme is actually hard to decipher, other than the obvious huge lions.  I mean, Hard Rock, Caesars and Bellagio....there's no question.  There's an ambiance that oozes rocknroll, Roman antiquity and Italian Renaissance.  At MGM...they have a cheerleader, and it's cheerleader is a massive golden lion.  I was upgraded to their West Wing, and had a fabulous shower, but the rest of the room was nothing to write home about.  It was a sorry sight from the window, just windows of the other rooms in the resort.  Certainly a downgrade from the fabulous view I had at Treasure Island a couple years ago of the whole damn South side of the Strip.  But I digress.  It really seems like everything is a exceedingly long walk in comparison to the other hotels, and trust me, I know the resorts are huge in Vegas, but MGM takes the cake.  And even though they fill it with stores to distract you and have you ooooh and ahhing at its sheer beauty, nothing really caught my attention.  The gaming room and their bars...again, nothing to really set it apart from the rest.  The most enjoyable part of this hotel was the spa....I would not return.

Stayed there for 3 nites and putting aside the chaotic parking and check in we got to stay in the Staywell queen room an that by far made up for everything else! Going there again in June an this will be my goto hotel! Also the Buffet was ok too.

Could not be more disappointed with our stay at Mgm, the toiletries they give are a joke the soap is one of those crappy little circle bar soaps. I wish they would just say bring your own soap ours sucks. If you are looking for people screaming at each other down the hallway and throwing glasses at each other this is the hotel for you. I get it is Vegas, but no other hotel has been like this. The cleaning staff is horrible, there has been the same piece of bread on the floor by the elevator for 2 days now. Our first stay out here was Excalibur and the room was nicer there along with the toiletries. I give it 2 stars because the staff is nice but that is it. This is our first and last stay here.

Whenever I get to a hotel I check if the the bedding is clean and tables are wiped.  Sadly it took 3 rooms for me to find a room that was somewhat clean. So much hassle. The customer service was good and put me in cleaner room.

Hey guys look, a waterslide!"

This, followed by Casey B running over to the Lion enclosure.  Upon his return:

"Guys, we can't go in there.  There are LIONS in there.  And it's their waterslide.  Not ours."

So basically what I'm trying to say is that the MGM is still pretty liberal with their policy on over serving.  God bless America.

I hated the exterior green of the hotel so I expected to be underwhelmed, but my wife booked it for us because it was a good deal. 

I was extremely pleased with this hotel. It was well designed to entertain you while you wait in the long lines to check in, and there are lots of elevators that only serve about 7 or so floors each so you can get to your room quickly. Once on your floor the wagon wheel design means that you don't have to walk a hundred miles and this design makes it very easy for you get where you need to down at the casino level.

There was a good food court and easy access to the monorail which makes it easy to avoid renting a car or catching a cab to get around town - this is a huge value which can't be understated.

We ate at Shibuya which was fantastic! Sure it was very expensive, but the quality matched the price (for Vegas) and the environment was WOW. Price was about $450 for 5 people, so bring a fat wallet.

We saw Ka and really enjoyed it -  no complaints other than it was more than we paid for O which I thought was a better show. There also was a segment that was all video instead of people due to the accidental death of a member last year, so that was rather disappointing. Honestly I think they would have been better off just skipping that part rather than showing a video as I wouldn't have known I missed it and wouldn't have felt short changed. I understand why it wasn't real people and agree with their decision, but I'd say just fill the time doing something else less risky with real people and that would have been just as good. I think we paid about $350 for two people plus fees, but we had front and center seats on row P (which is is as close as I'd want to be for this show - don't get much closer)

The rooms were very modern, super clean (way better than Bellagio and as good as Four Seasons). Loved the room and the well thought out bathroom. There's also very convenient access to charge your gadgets so I'd call this the best hotel room I've enjoyed in Vegas.

We stayed on the 25th floor which had the downside of being behind the David Copperfield sign which meant there was this screen pattern which made it hard to enjoy the strip view that we paid extra for. Definitely ask to NOT be on these floors when you check in and all will be well. 

The food court was good and the Casino was excellent. Cigar smokers will enjoy the Davidoff store as well.

Overall I'd highly recommend this hotel and I'd call it my favorite place I've stayed in Vegas.

I think I paid $110\/night plus a crapload of fees.

love this Hotel its reputation is well worth it, Everything you need  is here a long as you have money we stayed her 3 nights had a blast they even gave us show tickes for free I could not have had a better time. The staff is freindly but is always really busy but you could imagin working a such a big hotel.

We had pretty good customer service and a good deal. We were arriving on a Sunday night so we figured we'd have a good room. We were in the west wing room 3-507. The hallways were extremely dingy. The rooms smelled stale. In the time we were there, I noticed the dirty plates and glasses outside the guest rooms were not removed once. Our neighbor had plates sitting outside for over two days. The rooms themselves were outdated and worn. Poorly laid out (walk to the very end of the hallway to get to the elevator to take you up the floor to double back to the end of the hallway.) I thought the hotel was really bizarre. And it wasn't "Vegas cheap" like 40 bucks a night. We still paid 100 a night. We definitely could have done better with almost any hotel on the strip. I guess people stay there for the pool - but we didn't spend any time at it anyway. Wouldn't stay again. But the buffet was good! And the lobby\/casino are nice.

I go to Vegas often and I have stayed in a variety of hotels. I have stayed here twice and the rooms are just OK. The higher price is more for the location and convenience of staying on the strip. Next time I will stay off strip and save some money... a nice place but just not worth the extra money when you can stay someplace else for  better price.

I enjoy everytime I stay here. Although its huge...you get used to it. 

The rooms are normal. nothing special. Very comfortable beds and pillows. other then that....nothing special. I only stay here if I get a good deal. If not Ill just stay across the way  at the New york New york.

we were put on a smoking floor. and I honestly didnt have a problem, with this. They have a good ventalation system. so the smell of cigerettes is very minimal in the hallway and barely no smell in the room. 

The pool is awesome since it also has a nice lazy river and plenty of shade. Even though the walk to the pool is a ways from you room.

Modern & pretty decor. I like :)

I like our room. The bathroom was super clean & the bath stuff smelled sweet. The beds was really comfy with simple white sheets. Had a nice view of the strip. 

My two complaints:

MLife, y'all suck for screwing up the reservation. When we specifically book for MGM, & y'all booked us to Luxor. Wasted like a hour of our time getting the stuff straighten out.

People keep on stealing the "Do Not Disturb" sign from the room doors. Wtf??

3.5 stars.

Our room in MGM was nice & spacious in west tower. I gave it 2 stars because the carpets had Doritos chips by the bed, choc pieces & clothes tag left by previous guests. I didn't complain about it, thinking the carpet would be clean next day. I was wrong. It peak my curiosity if the housekeeper actually vacuum. They don't, those pieces remain on carpet for 3 days. I would think the housekeeper would do thorough cleaning for the price we pay for the room.

WORST STAY IN VEGAS! 

I would call myself and experienced Vegas Visitor since I come here about once every month, and I gotta say this is one of the worst Hotels here together with the Harrahs Hotel. 

I paid $170 for one night, for a basic room. The room does't look comparable to other Vegas rooms, it looks just like any Best Western Hotel. The TV is older than I am, and I can't even just take a shower cause it is clogged. I mean really??? 

I called the technicians and after waiting 20 minutes, I called the front desk explaining them the problem and that I am in a hurry since I have a dinner appointment. The lady just says hold on a moment and transfers me back to the technician department. That's really great service. 

If you want an advice, DO NOT STAY HERE if you can afford better. I rather pay $30 more for an amazing (basic) room at Vdara or even Flamingo instead of this crappy place here.

Worst hotel that I have stayed on the strip. The next time I go to Vegas I will be graciously going back to stay at the Luxor or the Stratosphere. MGM has one of the most over priced and outdated rooms. The first room I was in was filled with dust and had pubic hairs in the bathroom. Also the light in the room was not working. I swear we gave more additional tips to people that were trying be helpful and still got no results. They ended up changing our room for another hideous looking room that I guess was cleaner but for the prices they charge I was inspecting a more updated room. Their front desk manager was useless and not really caring about accommodating us. I filed a formal complaint with the MGM and they never contacted me. I wish to God I could get my money back!! You expect so much more when you stay at hotel that you have an image that this is top of the line hotel but  its not. However I would say I fully enjoyed the concert that I saw there and they do have some of the best eateries but besides that I will never lay my head on of their pillows again. I might at well stay at a Motel 6 and keep the rest of my money in the bank!!

Great option for lodging in Las Vegas - I booked a room for four nights in January 2011 and averaged $65\/night - can't beat that!  The rate also included 2-for-1 coupons at the breakfast buffet.  I wasn't expecting much but it definitely didn't disappoint!  
The MGM has a monorail stop if that's what you're in to but it's way cheaper and more convenient to take a cab. 
Considering how many rooms they have, check-in\/check-out was efficient and quick.  My only complaint is that this place is almost overwhelmingly enormous - it takes forever to get anywhere.

When hotels, or any business for that matter, does a great thing it should be reported.  God knows we Yelpers like to report when we are not treated well!  

My wife and some of her old collage friends spent a long weekend at the MGM to celebrate a birthday.  Because they were sharing rooms closet space was a bit limited so she kept most of her luggage on a chair.  

She had bought some cosmetics at a local store and had them in a plastic bag on the floor near her belongings and unfortunately  near a trash can that was overflowing.  The cleaning lady must thought it was part of the garbage and threw it out.  

It was a $75 purchase so she decided to report it to housekeeping, just in case it was recovered.  It was not, but housekeeping told management of the issue.  

The MGM soon contacted my wife and asked her  to repurchase the items, bring in the receipt and they would cover it!  They also gave her a $5 drink ticket for her troubles!  

Well done MGM.  Certainly not expected, but greatly appreciated.

My niece and I recently stayed at the MGM Grand located on the Strip in Las Vegas, NV. I decided to book a room in this West Wing of the hotel during this visit. The West Wing rooms are located closer to the front entrance near the Rainforest Cafe. This afforded us to have closer access to the Strip and so not to have to walk all the way through the Casino. The rooms were smaller, but were not recently renovated as the rooms at the Grand Tower. I selected this hotel only because of the Backlot Lazy River and the other pools in which we had an excellent time!

The elevators leading to the West Wing rooms where very dirty, beaten up and looked like elevators which had graffiti and were from the 'ghetto'. The elevators were working, but so bad that you could not tell which floor you were at. The West Wing lounge, carpet & entrance area looked 'cheap & filthy'! The front desk personnel did not inform us until we inquired that we can reach our room via the elevators close to the Front Desk and near the Grand Tower so we didn't have to walk to & from the Casino to reach our rooms in the West Wing. The resort fee we were charged included a $15 Bar Credit which we could not use in the Pool area and most of the inside Bars did not have a blender for 'frozen' type of drinks. Also, we could not bring our own floatation to use in the Backlot Lazy River and had to purchase use the Tubes which cost $16 each. 

Will I stay there again? Probably not, but I loved the Backlot Lazy River pool and the hypnotic-electronic dance beat type of music, and the close proximity of the hotel to the airport.

I booked my first trip to Vegas with a friend and booked 2 out of 4 nights in Vegas with MGM. The room was booked under a package deal including tickets for Kà. My total confirmation that was sent was $164 for Tuesday and $55 for Wednesday not including taxes and resort fees. I attempted to check-in on Tuesday and they did not honor my rate and confirmation that they sent me. They said they would solve the issue and give me a call with a solution. They allowed us to put our stuff in the room until they could figure things out. That was 12pm. We walked the strip and returned around 7:30pm because Kà was starting at 9. Apparently the front desk didn't take notes regarding the situation and we ended up explaining everything all over again. I showed them proof of my confirmation and they still didn't honor it until the very last minute when I decided we were not going to stay. They would not let me keep the Kà tickets for the hassle they put me through, but we picked them up earlier and ended up going for free because they couldn't take them back after they were already distributed. They handled the situation very poorly and I left extremely disgusted and disappointed. The service level here sucked. How do you decide not to match a rate that you as a business confirmed with a client. There are much better hotels in Vegas and MGM is not one that I will consider ever again.

Save your self the pain and find a different hotel. This is the first and last time I ever stay at this hotel. I  normally stay at the Cosmopolitan. However, my daughter wanted to stay here so I gave in. This is a tourist trap with no service!!! The lines at Disneyland are shorter than the check in lines at this MGM. I waited almost 2 hours to check in. WTF are you kidding me. The valet was also completely rude and disorganized!!

MGM was really a pleasant surprise since I was sneaking into a room I knew to be vacant; it turned out to be a beautiful suite, and the former guests had left me part of their welcome gift from the hotel staff: a bag of "mashuga-nuts" and plenty of Perrier water. The Mashuga-nuts I could take a pass on, but I always appreciate a hotel that provides complimentary Perrier to its special guests. Favourite feature, of course, was the bathroom, with luxurious white marble and detachable Kohler shower-head, with little gold MGM lion on it. Everyone knows what detachable Kohler shower heads are good for.
