Of course, we did have to pay a $35 resort fee, so not really free, but essentially, we paid $35 to hang out at the pool all day and just head up to our lovely room when we were done instead of going back to our regular digs next door at the Marriott Grand Chateau.  We also had our family who were in town come spend the day with us.

The pool:  All the things I wanted to know.  If you are staying at the hotel, you get to use the pool area, including the lazy river.  You can bring people in with you... I mean, I guess if you tried to bring 20 people, they may not allow it, but we brought four along with us and it was fine.  You can get as many towels as you need.  There are lots of chairs, but honestly, not much shade.  There are multiple pools and I think they all have cabanas and daybeds for rent, but we spent our day at the lazy river.  The SELL branded round inner tube style floats as well as a few other styles, all round for $25.  No renting, just buying.  However, you can bring your own with you as long as its round.  My fam brought regular small rafts with them, not knowing about the round rule at the time and so we tied them into a circle and made them round!  It worked!  But, be prepared, just bring your own...  that ticket is CRAZY for a piece of plastic!  They have bars where you can buy beverages, you can order food at the grill and they have servers that walk around and will get your food and beverage for you.   We had two orders of chicken tenders and fries and they were huge, so the two of us only ended up eating about one. the bar also has a water station, so you can get cups of water.  Overall, we enjoyed the day at the pool.  A little more shade would be nice, though.

The room:  The room was actually very nice.  It was your standard hotel room, king bed, non-smoking with a view of the airport and the Tropicana Hotel and south Strip.  Check in was a breeze because we currently have Gold status in MLife from a credit card offer... looks like that offer has changed, though, so I won't go into details on that.  If you have Gold status or hire, you don't have to wait in the long line to check in... and the line IS long because this place is massive and popular.  Our bed was comfy and the shower was okay, but not cleaned properly as there was hair in the shower.  Ew.  I enjoyed the bath products they provided, they were nice.  I don't often use the provided products, but I thought I'd try them and, the shampoo and conditioner were nice.

I actually gambled just a little and had some moderate success which was fun, the husband not so much success, OR fun.

There are so many food choices here which is awesome.  We ate at the Casual Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill which was yummy and no reservation was needed.  There are also several shows that take place and a nightclub (at least one), so you can actually stay at the MGM for a couple days easily without leaving!  Its very self contained.

Overall, it was a really nice experience and I would totally stay here again, I mean if I didn't have to pay for it.  I already have a home at my time share in Vegas, so staying at the other properties is fun, but I'm too cheap to actually pay for them!  But, of the places I have stayed on the Las Vegas strip over the years: Venetian, Palazzo, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan, & MGM, I'd say they all have really great options to them and any would be fabulous for a second stay.

In celebration of our 10th anniversary we planned to renew our wedding vows at the MGM Grand along with our two children on 3\/25\/15. We were married there 10 years prior in 2005. We purchased a wedding vow renewal package through the Forever Grand Chapel. After the ceremony the Forever Grand Photographer took us to various locations in the hotel to take pictures as part of our purchased package. When we began to take pictures in front of a fountain located in the west wing, Officer Whitson, abruptly and aggressively told us that we could not take pictures in front of the fountain. When he first approached us he referred to us several times as "you people" and automatically assumed we were there illegally. He was immediately abrasive towards us. We explained to him that we were just married in the Forever Grand Chapel and he still said we did not belong there. I asked for his manager, who he immediately radioed after my request.He then asked for ID from the Photographer and the photographer told him that he forgot his ID at the Chapel (because he was standing in for someone else) but could show him the pictures we just took in the Chapel to verify that he was hired by them. My husband showed him our room key to prove that we were staying in the hotel but he ignored him completely. His anger was not appropriate for the situation at hand.He was rude and disrespectful to us for no reason at all. I was in my wedding dress with my husband and our two children (6 and 8 years old) all dressed in wedding attire. The four of us along with the Forever Grand Chapel photographer were not threatening, loud, or disruptive towards other guests and in no way deserved to be treated in such a deplorable manner by this security guard. Officer Whitson at one point brazenly jumped in front of the camera after the Photographer explained to him that we are on a time schedule from the Chapel and had to continue as part of our package while he verified his affiliation with the Chapel. After his manager arrived and assessed the situation, he asked Whitson to leave because he was escalating the situation and was behaving erratically. 
We went to two other locations to take pictures and it was difficult because my children were traumatized by this security guards behavior. We had to field questions about the "mean police man" for the entire afternoon.  I was crushed that the event ended so poorly.  After we went back to our room, I took off my wedding dress, changed and returned to the same water fountain to find the main security office.  I spoke with another security officer and explained the situation to him and he was so shocked at how we were treated. He immediately escorted me to the main security office where I spoke to the manager on duty. She stated she had been briefed on the situation and was expecting me. She told me that the Chapel should have gotten clearance from the PR department and to me made several excuses for why the incident happened. I explained to her, that I have no idea how the MGM operates behind doors and regardless, if their PR department was notified or not that we were taking pictures, we should not have been treated so badly by one of her officers. Very unsatisfied with my interaction with her, I was instructed to fill out a complaint and I left. We were celebrating our love in the same facility where we were married ten years prior and it was completely ruined by employees of MGM Grand Security. If you are getting married, DO NOT DO IT AT THE MGM GRAND!!! Go elsewhere!!!
Pretty much one of my favorite places to stay on the strip. Keep it up.

It has been awhile, but I'm glad to see they have made improvements and updated their decor. 3 stars

the fourth star is for housekeeping for finding my "top" (dress) + my lingery and holding it for me until I picked it up the following week....

good looking out =)

Everyone was very helpful and accommodating. The bell desk held our luggage all day after check out, due to our late flight. We were upgraded to a Grand Tower room, instead of the West Wing, upon arrival because our original room was not ready. Our casino had everything & was always bustling with people. The theatre was a nice size. There were plenty of restaurants to choose from, each with a different facade. Food court could have been a little more extensive for quick bites. The Grand Buffet is great for breakfast! We ate there twice & liked it both times. There were some renovations going on while there, but nothing that affected our stay. Rooms were a nice size and kept pretty clean. The bathroom in the rooms are nothing fancy. The hallways could have been kept a little cleaner. Great views of the Strip from all parts of the hotel.

Their suites are so big and pretty! I stayed in the one bedroom suite and it's seriously big enough to fit 5+ people. The living room had a pull out bed. It had a dining room table. And the bathroom had a bathtub shower and a shower with double sinks! 

The only down side is the suite is the last room in the hallways so be prepared to make some hallways runs when you're drunk :) haha so much fun. 

Check out was at 11, but since I was super hungover the maid started cleaning a different room. Thank goodness for her!

So on December 27th, we checked in about 7 hours after the 3'o clock check in time due to massive traffic coming and then a pre-paid "O" show that we had to attend, and even after we called ahead to let the MGM Grand registration desk know that we are running late, and they assured us that they will hold our two rooms, we were a little anxious.

When we finally arrived to check in, one of the receptionist, Claris (Claris, we didn't get your last name) went out of her way to take care of us, and even gave us several complimentaries  that we totally didn't expect and made sure we were fully accomodated.  More than that though, we were impressed with her complete professionalism and her comforting and welcoming words to four very tired, very disheveled people who could surely use them!  The night ( ? - don't know the proper title) manager also came by and made everything go smooooooooth.  They were awsome!

This is just another reason (among many other reasons, great facilities, location, service, etc.) that when we do Vegas, we always, always, come to MGM!
Sorry but the sushi here did not hold a candle to Seattle sushi- specifically Sam's Sushi in Seattle. The Unagi at the MGM was cold and tough on my Dragon roll.

I stayed at the MGM Grand from September 27 - October 2 with my husband. My husband was in town for a conference which was being held at the MGM Conference Center, so that is why we stayed here. We stayed in a standard room with two queen beds (we had friends who came up for a night) that was more than adequately sized. The bathroom is pretty average for a hotel - I must prefer the bathrooms at Aria and Palazzo.

The hotel is still a maze to get around and you will walk...a lot! The trek from the room elevators to the conference center is long; the walk from the elevators to the pool is long; and the walk to the sports book (especially if you are going from the pool) is long. But it's a good chance to work off all the food and booze! 

The MGM pool complex remains one of my favorite pool areas in Vegas, even if cocktail service is sporadic and slow. At the end of September at 10:30 am it was not hard for me to snag a chair mere steps from the pool. We did not dine at any of the MGM restaurants, but we did have drinks more than once at Whiskey Down (I had several very friendly waitresses there), watched Sunday football at Centrifuge (buckets of beer for $25 and much more comfy than the sports book), and watched several sporting events at the sports book (again I had several nice waitresses there). Taxi lines were non-existent so you walked out the door and into a cab. Plus getting to and from the airport is super easy and around $10-13 depending on traffic. 

As a tip, if you are heading out to walk the Strip or just want to buy cheap beer without paying $8+ for it or gambling, walk to the sports book, make a right, and go out the doors in that area. There is a convenience store when you walk out where you can get $3.50 24 oz cans of beer to take with you while walking. Also it's a good shortcut to get directly onto the Strip.

Clean rooms with overpriced stay without the value and service attached. Excessive resort fees\/other fees rack up cost of stay unnecessarily.

Seriously understaffed, check-in line took just as long as a phone call from the room to the front desk for extra pillows. 

Location is fairly convenient on the strip, however is not served by the connecting tram. Pool is heated, but open only for 6hrs\/day and has no showers\/changing rooms in vicinity - and the poolside bar is closed! Hello, this is VEGAS!? 5\/10, wouldn't stay here again.

I'll get my complaints out of the way. I hate resort fees. It's so deceiving, you think you're getting a good deal then you're hit with a $25 or sometimes even more resort fee. Why can't they just do a straight forward price? That's why I like booking with Harrahs properties.

The other bad thing? Our room keys stopped working after a housekeeper walked in at 10pm. Okay, first of all, if I wasn't so tired from walking around and not having slept the night before, I would have flipped out and called management on her. She had no business in our room and didn't even do a courtesy knock, just slipped her key in and let herself in our room. WTF?!

This is also the first hotel I've stayed at where they don't have a double lock on the door that will let you prevent such housekeepers from disturbing your privacy even though you already have the do not disturb sign hanging on the door knob.

Now that that's out of the way, here's what I liked:

- Newly renovated rooms! Comfy bed, oh my! Flat screen and rather beautiful decor. Love the shades, we left it open so when I woke up at the crack of dawn, I enjoyed the view.

- Grand Pool: wow, wow, and another wow. Considering that this is the first time I've ever been to a Vegas pool, I was rather impressed. Multiple pools and a lazy river? Yes, please!!! We took a lap at the lazy river and it was really fun. We didn't even have floaters, just walked and sometimes swam and floated. All their pools are 3 1\/2 feet deep from what I saw.

- Take the customer survey. Not only do they give you a 20% off on your next stay, you might even get a reply addressing your concerns from their management. 

Right now, they are undergoing renovations and are pushing reservations by offering 15% off and free buffets with two night minimum stays.

Sorry MGM, can't say I'm a fan of your resort fees!

https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=UGk8NSp4Y9o&index=19&list=PLA8fY63qNlEtdE6Y3ZgDYj_Nz57VfuWFE (youtube video of my room)

https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=VUP-wV4iWFM&index=35&list=PLA8fY63qNlEtdE6Y3ZgDYj_Nz57VfuWFE (youtube video - plane watching from my room)

https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=IcOrNvfSgkk&list=PLA8fY63qNlEtdE6Y3ZgDYj_Nz57VfuWFE&index=38 (youtube video - My buffet lunch)

https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=Qi967maas-4&index=5&list=PLA8fY63qNlEtdE6Y3ZgDYj_Nz57VfuWFE (youtube video - Lion exhibit from a previous visit (now closed) )

Las Vegas;MGM Grand Hotel 
Went to Vegas for a conference and stayed at the MGM grand. The room was modern, clean and well designed. The best part of this hotel room is the view of the airport! I get to see airplane coming in and landing at McCarran every 3 minutes. I think this is the best show in Vegas. Despite being so close to the airport, the room is surprisingly quiet. Not a sound or vibration was heard. This room was advertise for 79.99 on hot wire. Remember they charge resort fees per room. 

It was good for the money. If you rate the room only, I would have given MGM grand 5+ stars, given the view of the airport and the technology in room and the decor with the ample sunlight. but then I just remembered I had to put up with a lot of crap on my stay there. You got a feeling that they just don't care about an average costumer like us. So we'll put this hotel on the "could use improvement" category. 

I started the review giving this hotel 5 stars, but kept taking stars off as I write the "Con" section...

Con: check in line took an hour and fifteen minutes. (not kidding) I was already *not in the mood* after a long day of budget air travel, by the time I got to the front desk I was totally pissed off. They have like 25 check in counters but only 3 of them were staffed. Clearly they don't care about the long line of dying people. There were mangers around but they just stood around and done nothing to help the situation. Check luggage on my way out was impossible given the mid day line and a mid day schedule, I waited 20 minutes and said "fu*k this*. Front desk was well mannered but not helpful. Like they took a class on how to decline all your request without being offensive. Unless you are a whale you are nobody here. Early morning window cleaning (from the outside) could had been intrusive for the people who likes to stay in their hotel room nude. A cable guy showed up in the middle of the day and spent 45 minutes working on my TV set. The guy was polite, but what if I was trying to get lucky?

Stayed a weekend in the cary grant bungalow suite which had 2 queens, 2 tv's, a living room and is roughly 700sq ft.  Some of the rooms are themed by actors from hollywood's golden era which give it alot more character than the average hotel on the strip.  The beds are extremely comfortable and might even be the best i've slept on in vegas.  The gym\/spa facility downstairs is $20 a day per person to use but can't compare to the one at Mandalay Bay for the same price.  It's located next to the pool level which I give 4.5 stars for its cleanliness, cabanas, and layout.  Very tasteful.  Only complaint about the pool is that they close it down if there's even the slightest chance of a thunder\/lightning storm.  I always end up eating at the Rainforest Cafe since its the only place open at 3:00am.  The menu there is sandwiches, burgers, etc. and the food is so-so.   When I need coffee there's starbucks, when I want a quick bite there's 'wichcraft, and if you want upscale japanese there's shibuya downstairs.

btw - if you're in need of a limo, mgm is where treasure island, new york new york, bellagio, and mirage dispatch their drivers from.  ask for a driver by the name of cedric cuz he's funny as hell and knows what's going on in vegas : )

I stood in the massive check in line waiting my turn. A staffer informed me that if I signed up for the MLife rewards card, that would enable me to check in at the faster check in line. She also told me the parking fee would be covered. So I stood in the MLife rewards line for 40 minutes, only to discover that the entry Sapphire level entitled me to none of those things. I went back to the main check in line and waited for 1 1\/2 hours to check in. I expressed my displeasure to the clerk, and she said she would "take care of me."

She assigned me a room in the West Wing, and when I entered, I discovered the hard way that it was OCCUPIED. Imagine if that had been your room!

I went back to the front desk, expressed my displeasure, and they "upgraded" me to a regular room in the Grand Tower. They also informed me that although I experienced an inconvenience, they could not comp my parking fee.

I lost over 2 hours of my life (and of the conference I'm attending). I will never set foot in this place again, and I would warn you of doing the same - unless you like complete strangers having access to your room.

My husband and I just stayed here for 4 days\/3 nights. We like the location because it has a Monorail station, plus it is easy to get to from the airport.  This was our first time staying at MGM Grand, though we have dined here several times before.

Check in was easy, and it was easy to find our room - the atria is clearly labeled with what floors each elevator goes to, and once you arrive on your floor each hallway is clearly labeled with what room numbers are on each hall. 

We upgraded to a remodeled room and it was great. King bed, beautiful bathroom with waterfall shower pressure, hair dryer and makeup mirror. The bed was comfortable, the blackout shades made it perfectly dark, and the shower was hot and relaxing.

I only gave it 4\/5 for two reasons: 1. Our room had a door to the adjoining room. There was a group of men in the next room who spoke VERY loudly each night and we could hear every word (in a different language, but nevertheless it was loud and annoying) 2. One day our towels weren't replaced during room servicing. We were able to get them the following morning from the housekeeping cart, and it was only a minor inconvenience. 

Staff was pleasant, the hotel smelled fresh, and the signs made it easy for us to find whatever we needed. We will definitely consider staying here again, though we do like to try new places (this is our 6 hotel we've stayed at in Vegas thus far).
What is the mgm anymore without its lions now they have put translucent cover over the entire lion habitat.  How retarded! !

Very nice rooms but has the coldest hallways in all of hotel hallways.  I literally ran from my room to the elevator.  So cold!  I had a cold by the time I got back to LA, lol!  But I like this hotel.  Nicely priced and in the smack dab center of the Strip.  Can't wait to frequent it again.

We booked 5 nights here (24th to 29th) for our Christmas, for the fist time, we expected more then this!
1star for the rude staff at check-in, didn't even tell us the direction to the room or any other resource, not even wifi!! Told us to check ourself when we get into the room!! Sucks!
The room is WORSE! Spending 100+ for a small room with broken bath tools. Somebody took the sign on the door, housekeeping came in when we were sleeping!! You can clearly hear the wind and the next door!!!!!! That's the WORST!!!!! Never got a room like this, you can even hear the phone conversition from the next door, can't sleep well. 
Called the front desk one time for the door sign, problem resolved quickly. 
Ka is a great show.
Buffet is just ok.
I can say that MGM ruined our Chrismas, won't come back or reconmmend any friends.

$85 for 12\/28\/08 night, we had 2 rooms. First thing I noticed in MGM Grand was that there's no one organizing the crowds for check-in\/out, everyone just had to find a lucky line to get in, like the supermarket style. Our check-in process was smooth except that we found out our rooms were hundreds of numbers apart, so we went back in line to ask for a closer distance, and the CSR replaced another room right next to each other - so why didn't he just do that the first place? Obviously that room wasn't taken. Than we bumped into a huge disappointment after we entered our rooms - bulky TV, no fridge, no blow dryer. Later I found out that my sink (not sure about the other room's) couldn't drain properly, I had pause washing my face so the water wouldn't over float... Pillows weren't comfortable either. The next morning we were waiting for elevators for over 15min (not kidding) with other 20+ ppl on the 10th floor and noticed that only 2 out of 6 elevators would open, but both were full every time they opened. Finally a janitor offered us staff elevators so we could leave but the security guard just had to ruin it. He let us in, but had to tell us how the janitors weren't supposed to offer us staff elevators because we weren't staff. We complained to the CSR when we checked out and they only wanted the security's name, but our concern was the 4 broken elevators that wouldn't open, and wanted them to deliver the msg to every staff, including securities, that guests are being trapped so pls open the staff elevators. I stayed in Tuscany twice and their rooms were big, fully equipped and new. Palms had the same price but I wrongly chose MGM Grand - bad bad choice.

Great service! We had an issue at check in that was quickly resolved by a manager who gave us his card and called us up later to assure that everything was taken care of. The next day the sent us a bottle of champagne with some desserts. It was a very nice surprise.

The room: nice clean and comfy. Temperature was alway perfect. Never touched the thermostat. Electronic black out and sheer shades were awesome!

The casino: is  huge so be prepared for a lot of walking. Especially to the pool. I had to walk from the pool to the strip and it took me about 20min.

The pool: has got to be the best thing about MGM. Specifically the Lazy River! Wow! What a unique experience. We just floated around the whole time stoping at different spots, meeting all sorts of people and doing a whole lot of laughing! It's such a different atmosphere than the club pools full of super drunk, high maintenance douche bags and plastic barbie dolls.

I'm so glad we had an opportunity to stay here. Now I'm hooked on MGM. Can't wait  to come back!!

My friends and I stayed at the MGM this past weekend. Our experience was good overall. We stayed in a Marquee suite. The suite is spacious; it has two bedrooms, two bathrooms and a large living room area with a pool table. One of the benefits of staying in a suite is you don't stand in the general check-in line, which is usually really long because there are thousands of room at this property. The check-in line for guests staying in suites is much shorter. The only reason why I'm not giving them five stars is because the suite did NOT come with a refrigerator or microwave. I've stayed at cheap hotels before and their rooms come with microwaves and refrigerators. So for a hotel like MGM to not provide that is unacceptable. We had to call the front desk and request a refrigerator. At first they wanted to charge us, but we got them to waive the fee. We also had to pay for parking. Other than that, everything else was fine. I would go back.

Poor design of hotel.  Rooms are small and you have to walk almost a mile it seems before getting to your room.  Crap!  We were here for Thanksgiving holiday and the service line for checking in was massive and it took at least 40 minutes before we were able to check in.  Customer service needs to move at rapid speed.  Our rep took some time to check us in at first telling us we were on the 3rd floor, then changed it again saying we were now on the 5th.  Annoying!  We also told her that we had two separate reservations and she indicated that she had taken care of everything for us.  However, she failed to tell us that our cards would be deactivated so late night we get back to our room only to find out we have to walk that long mile again back to the lobby to get our room keys activated again.  Annoyed!  

The rooms are some kinda funky.  Small sink and water deeps out of the shower, if you are not careful.  The only thing I liked about this place is that at least they paid me out a few hundred on the slots.  Would I stay again?  The answer is nope!

I have stayed here a couple times and every time is just as good as the last. The hotel rooms are nice, but I find myself spending little time in them as there is so much to do at the resort. 

This is by far my favorite casino in Vegas. I love the layout, the crowd, the variety, the dealers and even if you find yourself short on luck at the tables, you can always just go stare at some lions.

I have only eaten at one restaurant in the resort - Seablue. I wasn't too hungry upon entering it, but I recall coming out fully satisfied. It is a little pricey - especially the seafood appetizer that charges per person at the table. 

I would avoid the CBS Television City attraction as it's really just a ploy for CBS is show you a bunch of commercials and ask you what you do and don't like about them. Your time could be much better spent.

The pool is the best on the strip, in my opinion. Great crowd, fun crowd, tons of pools - each with its own flavor.

Some friends and I end up taking guy trips out to Vegas about once a year and have made a tradition of sorts to meet up in the bar at the middle of the casino "Centrifuge" to take shots and kick off what is always sure to be an epic weekend.

MGM Grand has become an icon for my trips to Vegas and never disappoints.

I love gambling here, I love Wet Republic (the hip pool party zone) and I love to eat here, but I haven't paid to have a room here in over 10 years.  Their prices are a bit too much.

Everyone should definitely come here for the variety in restaurants, their gaming tables and their awesome, extremely large pool area.  If you're planning on attending Wet Republic get there early because the line to get in gets long quick.  Make sure you hit up Joe Meyer (bartender) and tell him to surprise you!!! He makes the best drinks!

Also, MGM Grand has the best venues for boxing matches and concerts.

We stayed here for a business convention.  We arrived around 11 am on a thursday and our room was not ready until 5pm.
We had our bags stored downstairs until our room was ready.  The zippers looked like they were moved but nothing appeared to be missing.  So i would be cautious if you let them hold your bags.

When we finally got to our room the bathroom sink had a stench.  We called them up and it was fixed in a reasonable amount of time.  Overall the room and view was very nice.  I loved the backlit bathroom mirror and the automatic blackout shades.  Had amazing sleep during my stay there.

I didn't stay here but I was in here a couple of times to buy KA tickets and then later that night to see the show. I thought it was super cool that they have the lion den in the hotel. There was a guy in there playing with them, what an idiot I think. But...isn't it inhumane to keep lions caged up like that, simply for the sake of entertainment? 

Anyways, the conceirge was really nice. and the bar in the KA theatre had really great drink deals. I thought it was cool that the tram connects to the back of MGM as well. 

As for the rooms, restaurants or casino's...I can't really vouch for them.

Great stay from 7\/14 7\/17 room was  a Grand King very clean !!!! Housekeeping did a excellent job!!! Blackout shades were not working so matience came up right away to fix them prompt service all the way around ! Check in was fine took maybe 30 minutes that's all don't know why people are saying MGM check in takes so long???? Did not take us long at all!!! Perhaps it's when they check in we did not check in until about 7 pm on a Monday ! Spa was great and the Christophe Salon was awesome got a great haircut there and they went out of there way to accommodate me!!!!

Alright, so it should be known that on my stay at the MGM Grand I had one of those "moments" that don't apply to everyone. You know, the one star reviews you read because someone had some specifically odd situation that led to problems and an eventual ranting on their Yelp business page, but it's probably something that wouldn't necessarily apply to you "moments." Want to know more? Read on. Otherwise, just know the MGM Grand is a pretty decent Vegas hotel.

Still with me? Okay, maybe the MGM Grand is relatively prestigious. They sure emanate that feeling throughout the casino, bars, hotel rooms, and restaurants. It's not pretentious, but rather contemporarily classy. This was partly why MGM was chosen as a place of residency for a quick Vegas trip I took with my family. 

Throughout the stay, we encountered mostly-friendly employees and no big dilemmas (except the one). Well, we did have to ask a few times to get extra towels, but the place is huge so I'll cut them a little slack on that. It's big enough to be a stop on the Vegas monorail which worked out wonderfully for me in leisurely getting down to the Stratosphere. Oh and the pool? Woah. Massively-sized with multiple spots to chill (including a formidable lazy river). Don't forget the clubs (Wet Republic by day and Hakkasan by night) which might just add to the fact that you'll never want to sleep in Vegas (in a good way, I think).

All that is fine and dandy, and would've resulted in a four star review, had it not been for the following mishap. We booked our stay through a travel site and chose to take a red eye flight home, but instead of checking out in the morning on that final day, we wanted to pay for that last night (even though we'd be out of the room by 10PM) just so we would have a place to go to rest up and relax until it was time to depart to the airport. 

When we checked in, everything was under my name and we reexplained the situation to the friendly employee at the front desk. She noted it and didn't say we needed to do anything else...only problem was that last day, around the late afternoon, my family was locked out of our room. None of the keys worked and they called me unsure what to do. I was several hotels away from MGM so I called up only to hit a roadblock of a person on the phone that stated there was nothing she could do to help me over the phone and I needed to be there in person to update the info so they could be let in. At this point I was calmly furious and explained how nothing was said to us about any of this possibly happening and someone should've informed us at the front desk or to at least have someone else's name on the room so there wasn't a problem. Somehow, after going through this all a few times, the woman was miraculously allowed to let my family in as long as I answered a few security questions. Wow. Really? 

I finally headed back and went to the front desk to explain how this was a ridiculous way to end a vacation and the woman who helped me was incredibly empathetic and understanding. She was able to get her manager to knock off some money for that final night and lower the room rate (I mean, we weren't actually staying over so that made some sense). But the damage had still been done and it left a bit of a bad taste in my mouth for MGM.

Overall, like I said, this isn't an instance or situation that usually (or maybe ever) happens to people, but it happened and from that, MGM Grand loses a star. I may be back in Vegas in a year or so for a bachelor's party, and despite a mostly positive stay, MGM Grand might not be my first choice. Then again, if we book things normally, perhaps we'll get lucky (Vegas joke) and things will go smoothly.

Check in took 5 minutes, DO NOT PAY FOR A SUITE! Waste of money! We had dripping pipes that woke us up whenever someone above us used the water! Wasnt bad enough to move rooms, but was annoying. The hotel is dated and needed to be remodeled when i stayed there 4 years ago! But the casino and pool are 6 out of 5 stars! Favorite casino on the strip, and the pool can keep you from losing your money so easily as it is a blast! I also appreciated no pushy sales people unlike other casinos. Would give it a 5 if the rooms didnt suck.

It's pretty gross. At start the digital check in pads did not work. Room was dirty, lots of hair, drips on ceiling while showering, bathroom sink did not drain at all, noisy, carpet was stained, room smelled badly of smoke, not sure how it's actually non smoking. It was pretty bad. I was here for a conference so maybe I just need to be drinking to not notice how yucky it was. Also woke up with bug bites on my arms and foot each morning.  To be nice, the staff is friendly and mean well, it's not their fault.

We are greatly satisfied with our stay here. The hotel is simply stunning. It smells clean, the details are lovely, and if you book at the right times you can get an amazing rate. We paid $100 a night during the middle of the week! They held our luggage until check in time, and the process in doing so was easy and professional. We were checked in promptly, and the worker helping us said our rate was simply amazing. Though, my only complaint was that the room we booked online looked modern and upgraded. He informed us that the room they'd be giving us would not be. I'm assuming because of the low rate we paid. Therefore, he asked if we wanted to upgrade for $30 a night for their "Stay Well Suite." We opted to do so and it was the best choice ever. We then pushed a little for something complimentary. Why not try the luck? After informing him that it was my birthday, he gave us free tickets to the MGM Buffet. He told me Happy Birthday and suggested some places for us to go on the Strip. The entire check-in experience was wonderful and we were treated like valued customers. I couldn't have asked for more.

On the way to our room, we were constantly surprised by just how gorgeous this hotel is. The casino leaves something to be desired, but it's a lot cleaner and less smoky than many of the ones we visited. It's on par with the Bellagio and Cesar's Palace, minus the beautiful sky scene. The Stay Well Suites have their own tower in the hotel, and a fountain in the middle that divides the sections. The fountain is breathtaking, as well as the elevator hallway. It's really something you just have to see for yourself. When we arrived to our room, we realized we had a semi-strip view. We didn't know we'd get a great view, so you can imagine the excitement there. The upgrade was completely worth it. The shower is infused with a Vitamin-C diffuser so that it streams through the water while you shower. There's a sound cube that plays sounds for you in case you have trouble sleeping. The bathroom had different lighting options for the mirror, which was a great touch. All the sheets and pillows are hypoallergenic, and extremely comfortable. The room felt clean and crisp, and smelled fantastic when we arrived.

We ate at the MGM buffet, and it was a decent little spot to catch a quick bite. A bit pricey for those who pay to eat, though. The service was good, and afterwards, we headed to concierge to find out about our Cirque Du Soleil show in the hotel. We had questions about when the show started, and the staff working were amazing when it came to answering our questions and offering suggestions on where to eat and places to go. They treated us like extremely valued guests, and I was genuinely surprised at how kind all of the staff are. We saw Ka in the MGM Theater, and I highly suggest this show. We weren't staying on a peak night, so the theater was about half full and we moved a little closer to be nearer to the action. It was absolutely wonderful. I was worried from reviews that it wouldn't be as thrilling as higher-ticket shows such as "O", but it left both my girlfriend and I feeling really satisfied with our choice.

The hotel is the largest on the strip, so sometimes getting from place to place can be quite a hike. We took the LV monorail system quite a lot, and it was a bit of a walk to get there from our Wing of the hotel. The pool area is also a fair bit away, so keep that in mind while booking. It is definitely worth the walk, however. The pool at the MGM was actually the reason we chose this hotel over several others. The lazy river is amazing and includes a waterfall area that we thought was just beautiful. Within the lazy river, there are areas that are quite fun, such as a wall of water that beats down on you like heavy rain. Details like this make this pool area top notch compared to a lot of other hotels on the strip. There are other pools you can visit, though some of them were closed during certain hours. They opened them up eventually, and you could escape to these low populated areas when the others got a little too busy. There are lifeguards on duty and located sporadically around the pool area, so if you have kids, they're likely to be safe and well looked after. Even during week days, the pool was booming with action. I assume during weekends and peak periods it would be extremely busy and crowded. However, it's simply too great of an amenity to miss out on. 

Checking out was also a breeze. We received the same wonderful service as we did arriving. The hotel once again held our baggage while we walked around the Strip for a few more hours. There was fruit infused water located in the lobby, as it was a high heat day. It was delicious and the kind of gesture we got used to staying here. The workers simply know how to treat their customers. It may have just been our experience, but I hope you all receive the kind of stay we did.

*3.5 Stars

I haven't stayed here since I was a kid so I was semi-excited to come back. The hotel itself doesn't have very many eye-catching restaurants or decorations. I'd say the only thing to look forward to is Hakkasan. They have plenty of casinos and a fair amount of restaurants in their food court. There's also a Fat Tuesday near the parking garage! 

I visited with my friends and we booked two hotel rooms, but they ended up upgrading us to one of their biggest suites because there was a convention going on. They apparently overbooked and had to move us to one giant room. The room was pretty nice. The view was decent and was extremely spacious. 

Service was great. They were very quick to respond to our requests and always helpful whenever we had any questions.

First off, this hotel is massive! We stayed in the West Wing and since I hadn't read the reviews, wasn't concerned about what I would find. It was a small, cozy but updated room...with small window to see part of the strip.

Being in Vegas, I didn't think we would get nickel & dimed, but this was softly the case. No fridge (unless you want to pay $50\/night), no coffee (after spending nights in Vegas??), and the monopoly of paying for parking even when we're staying multiple nights in the hotel. The cable went out occasionally and the WiFi didn't work one of the mornings.
 
We didn't have hot water some days which was infuriating, after traveling during the day and coming back to go out at night. Very disappointing, I was happy to get home to a hot shower.

We had a winter special with the room, so we had buffets comped for every day we stayed. I'll be honest with you -- if it wasn't free, it's not worth it, especially at $25-$35 per meal. Thankfully, it was a slow crescendo in terms of quality from the dinner, brunch to Christmas dinner (granted -- only once a year), but over-all, it wasn't better than dining hall food at any college. I'd much rather spend $30 per meal for small portions of higher quality. Props for the bottomless Mimosas at brunch though!

Also, the all-you-can-drink for $18 is a steal! Tony working the bar is so nice and amazing. Apparently, he usually works summers at Wet Republic only.

In the end, I'll probably stay here again because it's centrally located, affordable, and has many things to do in the Casino -- but with better room and more exploration of its unique restaurants.

I LOVE MGM GRAND! I've always stayed here when going to Vegas seeing as it has so much to offer. They have a wonderful casino, pool, lion habitat, and entertainment! I don't know if they still have KA there but when I went it was brilliant! Also it's a pretty cool place for kids with the lion habitat and the Rain Forest Cafe near it! Their little arcade can be improved though & also their walls are just a tad bit thin. Other than that no complaints!

Not one of the finest hotels and establishments in Vegas but definitely the most bang for your buck. The hotel is nice and well maintained the restaurants are above par and the new wet lounge is awesome. 

Have not been disappointed and is above value resort. 

Since MGM is a value resort and casino the crowd has and occupants are younger. College kids often reside there and the rowdiness can be annoying for those trying to get some sleep. I may have stayed at MGM at least 10 times in the past 3 years and there is only so much noise and smell of weed in a non smoking floor that I can take. 

My advice is if you're looking a place to relax, you might as well pay more for Venetian, Wynn, Bellagio, etc

Stayed at the MGM Grand this June for the Beyonce concert!

First of all, it is so convenient that they allow you to check in at the terminal in the airport. If you mistakenly wait until you arrive at the hotel to check in, you will understand why. I even left a tip. PLEASE do yourself a favor and check in at the airport.
I had to wait a bit to check in to my room because my room was not available until about 3:30pm. I wasn't very happy about it, but they did me a huge favor and brought a mini fridge to my room for free as a nice gesture (the room did not come with one).
The resort is huge, and although I could have passed the time walking through the mall, I didn't want to carry my luggage around with me because it was heavy. In the meantime, by friend and I went to eat in the Rainforest Cafe. Came back, checked in to our room, and all was well. I would like to assume most rooms have really good views, and they are pretty spacious. Another poster said that she could smell\/hear the people near here, I did not have that experience. I actually didn't hear anything from those near me and they must not have carried about my best friend and I having late night laughing sessions after getting in from the club at 4am.
The lazy river was really amazing! There is a good mix of people- older people who are spending money frivolously and younger people who are ready to party. Bieber was performing at the arena the day I arrived, so of course there were a few teenagers but apparently that is not the norm. 

The small of the lobby is not of hydrangeas and vanilla or anything, but it's not terrible. 
 It was my first time in Vegas and the MGM definitely left a great impression.

To clarify, we stayed at the MGM Sky loft, not the regular MGM Grand, but I liked the MGM grand quite a bit. Not a big fan of gambling here, I just couldn't catch a break on the craps tables. I did however clean up on the poker tables (not really gambling for me), so I can't complain. If you decide to stay at the MGM, you really should consider the Sky Loft. Crazy excellent service and rooms. Check out my other reviews for more info.

I never stayed at the regular rooms at the MGM.  

I always end up staying at the West Wing.

The only reason I like the West Wing is because I haven't seen any kids wandering around the halls or screaming bloody murder in the morning. I mean come on, hung over + screaming kids = HELL. 

Not only is the West Wing not in the same area as the other rooms but they have a bar right before the elevators. The bar is great for the last, last call for the evening. (For those of us who are drunk but still want that 1 last drink before we stumble back into our room)

My experience at the bar has been fair. There were times when the bartender was cool as hell., other times I thought the bartender should look for a new occupation because they sucked so bad.

This was our first time staying at the MGM-in the past we stayed at the Mirage which was amazing...I was very disappointed the moment we walked into our room in the West Wing. It was very small and the bathroom didn't have a door. The sink was and TINY counter was in the entrance and the toilet and shower were open to the entrance as well with a clouded door.. which meant if you had to go the the bathroom in the middle of the night your partner would have to be woken by the light. When we went to have a shower the next morning it took 15 minutes of running the water to get it lukewarm enough to get in. I should have called the front desk to let them know but thought it might have been a fluke..nope it was every shower no matter what time I had one. The sink didn't drain very well so it looked dirty most of the time. I wish we would have stayed somewhere else or tried the Grand Tower.
The pools were very nice and the staff were all very helpful.

I stayed at MGM on my very first trip to Vegas, which was also my 21st birthday so of course I had a blast!

MGM is so ridiculously big! We checked in and had no idea where our room was and we didn't know which tower to go to. Aimlessly walking around the Casino, we had to stop and ask three workers how to get to our room and which tower to take. We finally find the tower (the signs confused us more which was why we asked the staff there) and proceeded to take the elevator to our room. Tell me why our room was on the freaking 13th floor?  Like there was the number 13 on the elevator! I thought the number 13 is superstitious, hence buildings skip the 13th floor, using it as storage or whatnot right?! Anyway, we settle into our room and I remember it being just ok. It wasn't breath taking, but then again it wasn't gross like Imperial Palace! It was comfortable so I was happy! So the rooms check out in my book!

The casino is nice! Lots of slot machines, tables, great bars, café\/restaurants and of course the cool Lion! I've only seen the Lion once but I would love to see him\/her again.  

I like that I can sit at the bar, stick in a $20, play $.50 and order a few drinks without getting hassled by  the bartender that I have to play max credit and to hold off on ordering another drink because I JUST ordered one. The bartender at MGM was cool and served us drinks and chatted with us. That's what I like!

Downside is that it's at the end of the strip! 

So would I stay here again? I probably would but it wouldn't be my first choice of hotel to stay at . It wouldn't be my second and third either. But I would stay here if I have to and if there's a deal somewhere out there!

Attended UFC 141 event here at the MGM Grand. 
So this review will be primarily the experience in the event center. 

It looks smaller than what you see on TV when Manny Pacquiao is getting ready for his fight.  :)

We had lower level seats which was pretty awesome already.  In general, I think just being at this event was pretty rad.  Their lighting system was spectacular when the fights were announced.  Food was available is you were hungry.  Air circulation was great...especially being in a crowded arena. 

The only wish:  wish we got to see the lions that lived in there.  :(  I had a stupid allergy attack and left in a hurry.  Boo for allergies.

I like the proximity to the rest of the strip
I like the proximity to the strip clubs
I like the "fish" that frequent the low limit poker games
I like the fact that the rooms are decently priced and occasionally comped
I like the fact that I won a small jackpot here back on my first trip to Vegas
...And I like the fact that Studio 54 is one of the best club experiences I've ever had and I've had a lot of them!
Hotel is very clean and they have lots of famous restaurants.

I have to give it up for the MGM Grand as it is probably my favorite Vegas hotel and casino at this point.

The reason it is my favorite hotel is simply because of the Terrace Suites.  If you are going to get a suite in Vegas, I don't think you can find a better suite for the price.

The Terrace Suites are two-story, 1,300sq ft suites that are nice -- nothing special -- until you step out onto the 700 sq ft terrace over-looking the strip, with a private jacuzzi.  Now THAT'S Vegas.  The suites are basically on those large steps you see going down the exterior of the MGM.  For me, it doesn't get better than that starting at $900\/night.

My business partner and I threw our "we just sold our little internet company" party here -- and it was excellent.  The worst part about the suite was that you didn't want to leave because hanging out on the terrace was just too cool.  But, you should leave, because the casino at the MGM is also fun.

Friendly dealers, lots of blackjack tables with reasonable minimums, and a younger, unpretentious crowd.  That really sums up the casino.  So many casinos in Vegas make me feel defensive and intimidated -- dealers telling me what to do (despite my knowing how to play), and lots of people who are sure they are really important.  I just don't get that vibe at MGM and it makes me a happy gambler.

Lastly, the pool.  It's nothing too special, but honestly, floating around the tube-river is a pretty good hangover remedy.  On a side-note, I witnessed a balloon-off at the pool (two people -- one with ballons -- who knew how to make balloon animals, competing to make an animal the fastest).  Totally impromptu and coincidental.  That can't happen often.  Too bad I didn't have that same kinda luck at the tables.

There's no door separating the bathroom from the bedroom area.  There's a frosted glass door for the toilet and another frosted glass door for the shower, but the sink and make up area is completely open.  This means that when you turn on the light to use the bathroom or the shower, the entire hotel room is lit.  It's poorly designed.  There's a t.v. embedded in the mirror in the bathroom, but it doesn't work.  Not only that, it obstructs the view of the mirror.  Not very well thought out.

There was a long line for registration.  It was $28 for resort fees and over $240 per night.  The walls are thin.  Our room was close to the elevators and I can clearly hear the "floor X, going down" from the room.

Booked thru Priceline and the hotel itself is very nice.Priceline had reserved our room on the west and I had read bad reviews about the west.When I got to the hotel, I told the desk clerk I wanted a upgrade because I had heard bad reviews for the west and I was here celebrating my birthday.For free they upgraded me to a tower which is clean and beautiful.Large bathroom with plenty of towels and washcloths with nice counter space and the room had a nice flatscreen, nice furniture,and beautiful decor.Our view was beautiful! The only reason I'm not giving 5 is because when I got here I was told they needed a $400 deposit because I was staying here 4 nights.Not only that they charge $40 additional a night for the pool, gym, and spa even if u don't use it!We thought since we had already paid thru Priceline that when we got here all we needed to do was check in.Boy was I wrong!Theres not a coffee maker nor microwave in the rooms and open that refrigerator if u want to and you will be charged!They have sensors on them.Other than that the hotel itself is beauuuuttttiful!!!

I like this place. it's so big and you can easily get lost, but once you find your way, you'll be just fine. I'm a fan of the poker room as it is large and you hardly have to wait to get into a game. i come here for the poker and not necesarilly for anything else. dig it.
MGM is a great casino and hotel.  Location is also a plus.

Reviewing the casino not the hotel. Another casino where most of my nights start off before it becomes a blacked out mess. Great place kind of weird they got this circular thing going on but I see bottles so I gravitate to it. Another of their bars sells PBR tall boys. It's all good to me on the strip. If you plan to be a creeper stake out the club line in a Saturday or Friday night to see the eye candy.

I traveled to Vegas for business and stayed at the MGM Grand.  I had never been to Vegas and this was my first experience seeing a casino.  

It has its ups and downs but it was a very nice visit and after seeing the bill (I had to sign for it) it was a great value as well.  I arrived too early to actually check into my room but the folks on the shuttle from the airport made sure I was taken care of, bags were secured and I was free to roam the hotel\/casino for a few hours before I could check into my room.  I was amazed at everything, from the restaurants, to the shopping to the sheer size of the place.  It was like a small self contained mall. 

The room was a little small but I really didn't care.  I wasn't there on vacation and I wasn't there to gamble.

All in all, good customer service, nice room and many choices of things to do without ever having to leave the place.

Short version is that I booked a King bed. I was told at the counter that MGM was going to "upgrade" my room at no cost. Interesting but of course I agreed and thanked the woman behind the desk. When I go to my room it was a room with double full beds. I called and told the front desk but the woman I spoke with said it was an upgrade and that it was a nicer room. I explained that I am 6' 3" and that the upgrade was actually a downgrade for me since I am longer than the bed. I asked if she could please switch me to a King bed. She said I would have to go up to the 7th floor and wait for security to open the room for me and then call the bellman who would bring me the keys since she was unable to successfully transfer the keys to the new room. I asked if she could just send me the bellman with the keys to the room I was in so I did not have to carry all my stuff to the room and wait for security but she actually told me no! I said "wait, I am trying to understand why you cannot just send him here". After some lame excuse, I went to the 7th floor, gained access to my room and was very amused to find a room with two full beds...Again, same issue I relocated to correct. It would have been hilarious except I was late for a dinner meeting and very much irritated. I kept the room because I had to get to my business dinner meeting but had a very rough night with my feet hanging way off the end of the bed. The room was not very clean either with long hair in my bed and used toilet paper on the floor in the bathroom. I wonder if someone had transferred out of the room prior to it being cleaned. The room also smelled stale.

P.S.
My colleague traveling with me also ordered a King bed and received a "free upgrade" as well. When he walked into his room there was someone actually occupying the room with suitcases and trash everywhere. He was transferred to another room but did not receive the King bed either. MGM must have over booked the rooms but mishandled the situation. The worst part was the lack of empathy by the MGM staff. I will never stay at the MGM again.

Woke up the day we were leaving by a broken fire sprinkler that went off in our room. It saturated all our clothing & other belongings. We were forced out in the hallway as we could not see anything & the water pressure was too much to bare. 

     One of the managers came up and placed us in another room as we waited for all our belonging to be dry cleaned. Unfortunately that wasn't going to be for another 8 hours & my fiance and I needed to get home. We decided to wait. In the mean time we were able to buy ourselves new clothes, underwear & shoes. We also had lunch & the MGM was nice enough to cover the cost with no issues as long as we presented them with receipts. 

    The end of the day came & our belonging were nowhere near ready. Risk management offered to send it via Fed-Ex so that we could start our journey home. We left and stayed in contact with them. Once our stuff arrived we sent a list back to Risk management of all our belongings that got damaged & was unrepairable. They didn't hesitate to offer to pay for the things as long as we sent receipts & pictures.

   To our surprise when we finally received the check (1-2 weeks) we received a letter inviting us back free of charge. 

   I can't go into all the details of our ordeal. There were times when frustration set in. Looking back though, I believe MGM & the risk management did what they could to keep us happy.


GRADE  B

Even though the Imperial Palace pays me, I tend to be drawn to MGM.  I dunno.. I like kitties.  They've never comped me *exception buffet, big effin deal.  I stayed here once, and it was a standard stay.. nothing special.  They're connected to the monorail if that helps.  The thing is, the food court- really?  Are you staying at a mall or a hotel?  Oh, and they keep getting my money.  Grrrrrrrrr.

Anyways, great pool, decent rooms, average service, and they'll kill you at the tables.

I stayed here last year for my wedding for 5 days and completely forgot to review! I really enjoyed the MGM Grand Hotel. If you've never swam in a heated pool, you will absolutely fall in love. They have so many pools! And a lazy river! I wanted to check out the Wet Republic but I never could seem to make it at the right times. Hakkasan was crazy amazing. Very crowded but still awesome. They need to make their bars longer because the long lines at the tiny counter was a little ridiculous. Otherwise, I had an amazing time there. It was my first time gambling and I actually won a lot! I think it was wedding luck hehe. The cocktail waitresses were kind of rude, but at least we were getting free cocktails for gambling. All the dealers at the tables were very nice also.

One thing to note for anyone planning to stay here- DO NOT by bottles of alcohol at the hotel. Go a little ways down the sidewalk to the Grand Canyon Experience store and get it there. You'll save a ton of money that way!

This was a great place, however i was billed extra nights i didn't stay and its taken 3 days of on the phone talking to customer service and the bank just to resolve a problem that should have never occurred. 

I think i'll stay somewhere else next time, plus i won't have to wait one hour to check in and out.

I recently stayed at the MGM Grand and was surprised at how dated and worn the rooms were.

There were scuffs on the walls and blisters on the furniture. (See photo)

There were holes in the bath room wall from where an old mirror use to be. ( See photo)

The walls were pretty thin as we were able to hear the noisy folks next door.

Earlier in the week, I was staying at the Encore. And I was planning to stay the whole week there.  But I had received a marketing offer from MGM Grand to stay at a special rate in one of their suites.  The marketing photos on their web site looked nice enough.  So I decided to stay 2 days out of the week there.    

The decor and ambiance at the Encore was so much better and well worth the extra price.  Compared to the Encore, the MGM Grand was a big step down.

I can't add a name to my room of one of my guests from the room itself.  Well...currently the line at the front desk is 30-45 minutes...so you're telling me I have to wait in line 30-45 minutes just to add the name of one my guests to the room? Yes, in fact that is the case.  Note to self...never book at the MGM Grand.  Supervisor was no more helpful or friendly than the staff member at the front desk.

I had a thought...do I need to go downstairs to order room service? To request a late checkout? To request a rollaway bed? Any of these things? Because that could certainly pose a security threat as well...ludicrous logic.

The supervisor I spoke to was named Yvette for the record, in case management happens to view this.  I don't want any action taken against her, as I'm sure that was protocol she is required to follow.  But really? I need to waste 45 more minutes of my night (I waited that long to check in in the first place) to add a single name to the room?  Please justify that.

Love this place. Went here a few years back and it was fantastic. Loved the hotel, room, and entertainment b offered by the hotel. There is just so much to do in the hotel. From the enormous drinks available for purchase to the endless game tables. There is pretty much something for everybody to do. It is scorching hot if you go here in the summer. I preferred to stay inside the hotel where there is air conditioning. Oh, the buffet here is off the hook. They have mountains of bacon available for the breakfast buffet. What more could you ask for. Definitely coming back soon and will make sure I book my reservation for the MGM. TOP NOTCH, CLASSY, AND DISTINGUISHED.

My boyfriend took me to Vegas for a getaway weekend. We stayed two nights at MGM. It was nice they "upgraded" us to the new part of the hotel.  The new room was very modern, but it had a very small window.  I guess it was nice since it is new, but it's smaller than there standard room. I might have preferred the regular room but they said we could move on the 2nd night, but we decided to stay in the west wing. 

During our first day we hung out and drank by the pool all day. They have a new pool that's similar to what Tao Beach is, but we just chose to hang out at one of their many pools, which has bars and music too.  I love hanging out at the pool and being lazy with a drink.  My idea of a great vacation! For dinner we wanted to eat at Shibuya but they were closed, so we ate the Grand Wok and Sushi Bar. We also got 2 free drink tickets for the bar, which was another plus.  After dinner we went back to our room and I found flower petals all over the room and champagne. I thought we entered the wrong room, but then and there my boyfriend proposed! The concierge did a great job at setting up the room while we were at dinner. This was definitely a weekend to remember!

I know this hotel probably doesn't deserve a 5 - star review from me.  I've been here a thousand times and there's so many annoyances such as awful parking, bad food courts, etc.

However, we recently stayed here for a staycation and we had the best "vegas hotel" experience out of every place we have been on the strip, and that includes all of the 5-star resorts such as Venetian\/Palazzo, Wynn, Mandalay\/TheHotel, etc.  

I had booked a suite at this property because they have some of the most affordable suites on the strip, at about $100 a night on a weekday.  However, when we got there and found out we were celebrating a special occasion, they bumped us up to a Terrace Suite for free, which goes for probably $1500 - $3000 a night depending on the day.  This was literally the best room we have stayed in, anywhere in this town.   It was spectacular, and I have new respect for the MGM Grand.  So much that I'm not sure I will ever stay anywhere else but here.

Here's some photos of the room itself:

http:\/\/www.mgmgrand.com\/hotel\/terrace-suites.aspx

Yes, it is a 2-story suite with an 800 square foot balcony and a big-ass JACUZZI.  They also hooked us up with the room with the best view, and it was breathtaking.

Words cannot describe how awesome this room is.  We had a fabulous time.

My husband and i loved the MGM. It was a nice hotel, well kept, the rooms were nice, comfortable bed, and we got an awesome view! the staff were so nice and we got free club passes and open bar for ladies. So far, cant complain.

I love the MGM Grand!  I've stayed here twice now and plan on going back in 2016.  The rates are hard to beat and the pool is the best on the strip.  While in Vegas, we walked in and out of a bunch of the other hotels and none of them had the fun and exciting atmosphere quite like the MGM.  The hotel is huge and you will walk; A LOT.  There's so much to do for everyone at this hotel; you will never be bored.  (If so, it's Vegas, there's plenty more to do).  The rooms have recently been updated and the beds are super comfortable.  The staff at the front desk was incredibly helpful and kind at check-in and the gentleman who checked us in, Jacob, really hooked us up with a great view of the pool and the strip.  I've never had a problem with the cleanliness at the hotel.  The only problem (and this is not just the MGM) is the fact that smoking is still allowed in all casinos.  I was actually shocked they still allowed smoking at the MGM pool and we were a little annoyed at it as we had to move our seats a few times while at the pool to get away from the disgusting smokers.  
Overall, I still love the MGM and can't wait to get back to it!

THIS ONE STAR REVIEW IS ONLY FOR THE CONCIERGE DESK.
Megan is horrible. She looks like she hates her job. She is rude.We were picking up tickets for Zumanity and she was bothered that she had to help us. Then, I asked her which restaurant she would recommend and her response was "There's a show tonight (Motley Crue), you'll never get reservations." The look on her face was that of disgust. 


THE REST OF THE RESORT GETS 5 STARS!
We stayed at MGM over the Christmas weekend.  The room was awesome (we stayed a  Wellness room on the 14th floor and enjoyed the amenities.)  Jesse at the MLife counter was a joy!  We even offered to buy him a drink when he got off, but it was Christmas and we are thinking he preferred to go home to his family. I wish I could remember the names of the wonderful dealers, the great servers, and the sweet girl that checked us in.  Even the guy at the Fat Tuesday was great!

This is the worst hotel experience that I have had in Las Vegas.  The rooms were to be discounted 30% because we were coming in with a group, only to find out that we were charged the regular rate.  Please, this was no regular hotel room, it was a glorified motel room and when I inquired about the state of the room, I was informed that the rooms had simply been remodeled from the old Marina Motel\/Hotel from many years ago and linked to the rest of the hotel.  If you are not clusterphobic, you will become one.  You walk in to the bathroom first and then get to your room.  The A\/C unit is your nightstand.  The drawers for your clothes are old but painted, looks like something out of the fifties.  There is no room on the sink counter for you to put your brush let alone your make-up bag or anything else.  There are no hooks to hang anything.  After taking a shower, you need to walk into the bathroom stahl to grab a fresh towel, since there is no where to put it.  Why is the shelving for the fresh towels over the toilet seats, I couldn't begin to explain....  The chairs in the roms will give you vericose veins.  They are very uncomfortable. 
Here is the great part, there is nothing that divides the bathroom from the bedroom really but a unsealed glass door.  So, watch out!  Should you have a bowel movement, expect to relish in the aroma for your entire stay since there is no aspirator or anything else to help vent the room.  The room is dark, the window is a 3'x3' opening.  It is a coffin.  Now for the bed.  Since it is impossible to sleep next to the air conditioning unit, everyone must sleep on the other side and therefore, the mattress is lumpy.  I went to management to express my disappointment and they really don't care....It is all about their bottom line and not about the guest experience and this guest will NEVER go back to the MGM or any of its affiliates.  Spare yourself the agony and go somewhere else.  Keep your dignity.
WiFi is free up to a limit.  You can pay $50\/day for more data.  Really??????

The gaming staff here is mixed. I went to play at the MGM Grand two different times during my stay in Vegas and got two different experiences each time. Note: I did not stay at the MGM, so this does not include any rating for the hotel - just the casino and the food.

On my first visit, it seemed that all the tables were, at a bare minimum $15 for blackjack and craps. I asked one of the pit bosses if there was anything cheaper and he said if I went to the back pit, far from the front doors, I could find a $5 table. I didn't see one back there, so I asked that pit boss, and she permitted to me to play for $5\/hand at a table that was just starting up. It was a little odd though because she made other people who joined later play $15\/hand but kept letting me play for $5 because I was "grandfathered in" - I can't complain but I felt bad for the other players that weren't necessarily getting a fair deal.

The second visit was a poorer one. I went to go redeem a ticket at the sports book and there were 3 windows open. All of the guys working the windows were taking their good old time chatting up the young ladies that were placing bets. I waited, the only person in line, for over 5 minutes before finally one woman finished and left the window. I walk up to the window and the supervisor comes over and says "sir, they'll get you at the other two windows" and changes this employee's sign to "closed." Good customer relations would mean letting me cash in my ticket real quick instead of directing me to another window that was still busy with the same people as before.

For this reason, I probably won't be gaming at MGM on future Vegas trips. Their loss.

The food was "meh." At the two cafes there, the coffee at each of them was horrible. Go to Starbucks instead.

If I could give this dump a quarter of a star, I would.  We stayed in the West Wing, which for almost $300 a night you'd figure would not look like a motel room, but it did.  Only plus was the bed was comfortable.  Other than that, it was a small, brown room with a tiny window, a crappy bathroom outfitted for a handicapped person (WHY), with no coffeemaker, no fridge.

I will NEVER stay here again and will tell everyone I know to avoid this over-priced creepy-ass place.

#MGMFail

We had the most wonderful stay at the MGM Grand beginning with the sweet girl who checked us in and gave us a complimentary room upgrade so I wouldn't have to huff my preggers butt as far through the massive complex to get to our room and back.  

Everywhere we went we were treated to smiling faces and courteous help from various staff--at the pool, the concierge, M-Life desk, Ka box office, and many others! We got a free fridge when I mentioned I accidentally moved one of the priced items in the mini bar to make room for leftovers. And it was nice to get birthday wishes from almost everyone who checked my ID; they genuinely seemed to care!  I'm not used to this exceptional customer service at most Vegas hotels I have stayed at. 

I picked the MGM Grand first and foremost because of their  MASSIVE and DIVERSIFIED POOL area.  I'm content to lounge like a lioness in the sun all day, taking a dip once in awhile to cool off, while my husband likes to PLAY! Here he can go join the pool-wide volleyball game while I relax poolside or go to one of several other pools on the property if I want to get away from the noise (except when Wet Republic is on; there's no escaping those boots and pants! and boots and pants!).  Then we can meet up at the lazy river (and he can push me around in a tube, of course).   

The MGM also has COMFORTABLE and REASONABLY PRICED rooms and the rates are comparable to other strip hotels of the same star rating that don't offer nearly the space, styling, or amenities that the MGM has.  

We also like the relative close PROXIMITY to the CENTER of the STRIP because we love to visit other hotels and enjoy all the touristy stuff Vegas offers (still gotta see the Bellagio fountains and the Mirage volcano each trip).  I've also really come to favorite the Grand Spa after trying other spas at various hotels. 

My hubby and I are a big arts and entertainment fans and we always see at least one show when we're in Vegas.  This trip we wanted to see Ka which is at the MGM so that was a bonus to staying there. 

I didn't give the full five star rating because of two moderate inconveniences: the media center and Internet devices had multiple bright lights that lit up our otherwise  darkened room. We had to use clothing, towels, and furniture to make a little fort to shield us from the light so we could get to sleep! And yes, we thought of unplugging everything but the outlet was unreachable. 
Also, sometime around 3 am on the last night of our stay, I was awakened by the sound of some kind machine outside--it was like a leaf blower on roids! I think they were performing maintenance to the roof of the shopping and restaurant wing below our tower.  It was obnoxious and and I needed to pop in my earbuds and watch some Netflix to drown it out and fall back asleep.
I went to buy show tickets at MGM today. Evelyn at ticketing counter was super nice and I received a fast service. Very happy. Thank you for your great service!

Made room reservations months in advance only to find out when checking in that rooms are first come first serve. We had originally booked a non-smoking premier king with a view of the strip and arrived at the hotel at 5pm. Apparently checking in begins at 3pm and if you do not arrive in time (and wait in the extremely long line that begins way before 3pm) you are not guaranteed a room. 

This would have been very helpful to know when we had reserved the room initially, we could have planned out trip to arrive before check in but since this fact was never mentioned they gave our room to someone else. We ended up getting a staywell king room with a view of another building. What was the point of making a reservation anyway? We have stayed on the Las Vegas strip before (at Wynn, a very satisfying experience you get what you pay for) and we had never heard of this practice anywhere else. 

We were very tired that night since we had an early day hiking in the Grand Canyon then driving from there to Vegas and catching a late night show. We tried to go to sleep around 1AM when the occupant of the room adjacent to us came back around 2AM. She began slamming her door, screaming on her phone outside in the hallway, and throwing things in her room. She also called several of her friends to come to her room to listen to her scream about a girl she hated. Her friends were also loud, laughing and screaming with her. We called hotel security about 5 times that night, they came up 3\/5 times we called. The racket lasted until 4:30AM. The only thing security did was knock on their door and ask them nicely to be quiet. Weakest security team I've ever seen, super passive aggressive. Of course as soon as they left the racket started again. 

When we complained and requested a room change, they said they could not do anything for us. They offered two free breakfast buffets at their hotel, fuck that. We talked to customer service again the following morning, requesting a room change and they said they could move us to the room we originally requested but that we would have to call back between 2-4pm. So we called at 2pm, they said they didn't have any rooms available to move us so we pressed harder until they said they had a room but it needed to be cleaned. They gave us the run around for an additional 2 hours before we finally got the room changed back to what we had originally reserved. 

All the pools are also packed were you can't even attempt to swim unless you come between 9:00-10:15AM. 10AM is when the lazy river opens so that's when the crowd arrives. The lazy river is the only redeeming quality this hotel has got going for it. 

Overall horrible experience, terrible customer service, would not recommend coming here unless you don't care what room you get and  you weren't planning on sleeping or relaxing in your hotel room anyway. We will not be coming back to stay at this hotel, get what your money's worth and actually stay at a nice hotel that cares about its customers.

*we stayed on a Thursday and Friday night

Do not stay here save your money! Beds are so uncomfortably hard and stiff and you only get two pillows. We had two rooms and both parties complained about the same thing. We all tossed and turned all night woke up with our backs killing us. We wanted to check out and go to a different hotel but the front desk said nonrefundable. Ask if they had a room with real beds not the ones we had she advise no they're all the same. She was sorry and said she had to go because she was busy and had to attempted to other customers. Yeah I am sure she did probably a lot of complaints she had to attend to. It's real sad how the place has become I use to come here years ago and never had any issues this place is turning into a motel. This will be my last stay here. Good by MGM hello Aria across the way.

We upgraded to the Stay Well rooms and I highly recommend the extra cost. It will give you spa access every day to use the fitness, steam, sauna and jacuzzi. My favorite thing about staying at the MGM is the pool. They have a lazy river and it's fun to float about and read a book and people watch. 
 I am not a big fan of the decor of the rooms at the MGM. The stay well rooms have air purifiers, scent cubes, black out curtains and Vitamin C infused showers and upgraded beds. The beds are super comfortable. I don't like black out curtains because I like to see sunlight to help wake up in the morning. The green glow from the MGM lights at night in my room made it hard to sleep. My eyes were blood shot every day and night and I think it's due to all the cigarette smoke in the casino. I was going to bed early, getting lots of rest, exercise and used the cucumbers on my eyes every day in the spa and still had red eyes.
