The casino is pretty smokey and not a place I want to hang out. MGM is my least favorite place to stay over the other hotels I've stayed at. I prefer the newer tower at Caesars Palace, the Bellagio and the Palazzo and Venetian because the rooms are huge and beautiful. I don't like cigarette smoke and prefer the newer casinos with better air filtration systems. I feel like the MGM is still pretty dated in comparison to the other casinos I've stayed at.

Perhaps the worst hotel on the strip because there is no major theme throughout the hotel. Under NO circumstances should a guest stay at this hotel. To start off: the check in service was horrible with no attention to friendliness and customer service.  The check in person did not listen to our needs of getting a room in the desired location. They assigned us on the West Tower in room 5- 555 which is about one mile from the parking garage. Rude service at check out as well. The hotel room was small with cheap amenities. No microwave no fridge. The room had a funky smell of cigarettes and marijuana even though we requested a non smoking room. The escalators and some of the elevator did not work most of the days. We stayed for 5 days and the service was horrible. The grand buffet was like eating from a garbage can. The same food everyday with no attention to freshness. The lines to the buffet was about 30-40 minutes and costing $32.00 per person. They charge a mandatory $25.00 per night for no useful amenities. The gym was small and did not even have a shower. The spa was horrible. If the check in person states that they can waive the $25.00 do not listen. The hotel price was also not reasonable. The only good thing I can write is the David Copperfield show. I will most likely not go back at this terrible hotel.

CASINO: I brought two first timers to Vegas and of course I wanted them to see the MGM. While gambling the servers were very rude. My mom asked for a water and the server wouldn't give it to her because that wasn't her section. I don't know but in San Diego waters and coffees are all over the place ! The servers (from your section) come around every 30 minutes and take about another 20 mins to get to you, so you'll get 1 drink per hour. So if you're planning to get drunk while loosing your money, go to a bar instead. 

BUFFET: I liked the Cajun selection since I'm a big seafood fan but I highly disliked the fact that they didn't tell us they were going to close the buffet 30 minutes after we had entered. I think it is fair to let your customers, who are about to pay $50.00 per person, know that they have 30 mins left to eat.

I wasn't too thrilled about the standard rooms in this hotel.  It was fairly small to really walk back and forth from the entrance of the room to the bed and imagine a room with 4 people! Pretty tight I'd say...

From what I see, it looks like the rooms may have been remodeled? It's been 3 years from the last time I stayed there and all I can say is that I didn't really enjoy it.

Regardless of what they do well, MGM Grand deserves 0 stars. They allow smoking in the Casino. The smoke permeates the entire facility.  I do not smoke and am staying in a nonsmoking room and I can't get the smell of smoke out of my throat. I feel like I have been chain smoking for 3 days. So grateful to leave in a few hours. 

One other thing to be aware of, my deadbolt magically turned itself off at 12:15 am. I am traveling alone and will not be sleeping until I can leave this dreadful place.

I visited the weekend of June 19, 2010 and I will never, ever go back.  First our bathroom toilet was clogged (thankfully it was not a gross situation) then we found a small piece of broken glass on the bathroom floor, but the deal breaker was our stop to the pool.  I have never been so disgusted, hundreds of towels strewn about the area and even more deplorable and unsanitary was the fact the hundreds of alcohol containers littered the area and even floated in the various pools!  I am not joking, this was disgusting.  I can only think that with the bad economy that they have downsized cleaning staff but this was far too unacceptable.

** Walk Through Review **

We spent some time walking around through MGM Grand looking for the lions that we heard about from friends. After awhile of not finding anything, we asked a security person and were told that we had missed the lions by a few years. I guess that is a good thing for the lions, but not as great a thing for MGM Grand. There didn't seem to be much else to draw us in and keep us engaged. We left shortly after...There actually seemed to be a couple of areas we walked through that were empty and kind of wasted space.

stayed here for 2 nights in a standard room. no flat screen tv, the shower head was low (im 6'4 so i had to slouch down pretty far) the water came out like a fire hydrant, and something was wrong with our bathroom because it smelled like sewage... from the moment we walked in there to the moment we left... only good thing about this place was that i was comped 2 nights and its located pretty much in the middle of the strip... If i get comped again then maybe i might come back, back until then i'm going there only for Tabu nightclub and Fat tuesdays. thats it. you would have a much better experience if you stayed at the MGM Grand Signature.

HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE! Stayed at MGM for 3 nights. I originally booked my room through a third party travel site ( don't do it!!!) and they put us in the WEST WING--- which has NO VIEW and is super compact. Also, MGM charges a $30.00\/day resort fee for slow wifi service and the pool. It adds up quickly!!! We ended up 'upgrading' for $40.00 so we could have a good view. Our upgrade included bath hooks that were falling off the walls, a shower that wouldn't drain, and writing all over the wall from kiddos. I called the front desk-- who never noted the phone call about the walls ( I just didn't want to be charged for it)! When I checked out today... No-one really cared or could confirm that I had called ... And I didn't wanna be stuck with a bill for damages. Just felt like it was a rip off. I don't mind paying for something nice ... But I want what I pay for. However, the housekeeping staff was super friendly and did a nice job!

I'm not sure what is wrong with MGM's staff\/inventory system, but the problem needs to be fixed.

Check-in was normal - but upon arriving at my room, housekeeping was still in it - and told me that they had only just started to clean it.  Subsequently, the front desk told me that the room had been marked in its inventory system as not being ready, but the agent who checked me in ignored that information and issued keys any way.

Obviously, that should not be possible.  And this is now the second time that an MGM property has pulled this stunt - last time, the Mirage did much the same thing to me, except in that case the room was actually still occupied by another guest!

We also discovered on day 3 that my spouse's key had not been re-encoded for the new room - which suggests that we may have still had access to the originally-assigned room - even though it presumably was later assigned to another guest.

This sloppiness is absolutely unacceptable.  It isn't just "bad show" but endangers visitors, since it suggests that keys can be issued willy-niilly.  And the fact that it's happened to me twice in a row suggests that it happens a lot.

The hotel facilities are fine, but I strongly urge anyone who values their safety not to stay at a property owned\/managed by MGM.  Unless you want to take a risk on the next intruder being someone less nice than me.

I have stayed at a number of the hotels in Vegas over the years. The MGM's rooms are really nice, the beds are great, clean. The Staff is wonderful from the front desk, to the dealers to people at the McDonalds in the food court. I have seen some really great concerts at the Garden Arena, wonderful venue to see a show. The comedy club downstairs was nice too, great comics & good drinks, service was a little slow in the club.

I really want to give MGM 3.5 stars, but my issues were mostly due to bad timing and they deserve better than a 3.

My girlfriend and I stayed at the MGM from a Friday to a Tuesday.  I had stayed at the MGM once or twice before, and been to Vegas many times, but this was her first trip and her birthday weekend.

We had read in reviews that if you ask for upgrades, you can usually get them.  And seeing as how this was my girlfriend's first trip and her birthday, we thought we'd have no issues.  However, to play it safe, I attempted to use myvegas credits from Facebook on a room upgrade, only to discover they had none available (so much for 6 weeks of constantly playing fake video slots).  Nevertheless, I figured we'd be able to get something. 

Unfortunately, upon arrival, we were told they had no upgrades available.  The best they could do was a strip view and a $30 beverage credit.  Firstly, our strip view room was right at the elevator, which was nice because it saved us long walks to our room, but if you know the MGM Grand Tower, that also meant that our strip view was partially obstructed by a giant green wall.  As for the $30 beverage credit - outside of beer, you can't get a drink at the MGM for less than $15.  If you want one of those large frozen drinks or the yards, which is what we got, it was more like 1.5 drinks.  So MGM did a pretty poor job of making us feel pampered or making my girlfriend's first trip and birthday something special.

That said, the reason why this was somewhat our fault was because we chose a weekend that was the grand opening of the West Republic season (their Ultra Pool party) and the grand opening of their new nightclub\/lounge\/restaurant, Hakassan.  So, they were booked, and the lack of upgrades was mostly due to that.  That said, I think they could have come up with something besides 1.5 drinks.  Maybe passes to wet republic so we wouldn't have to spend $50 to get in, or passes to Hakassan so we wouldn't have to spend $75 - and Vegas, when you're starting to charge $75 just to get into your nightclubs, you've officially stopped caring about everyone but the wealthy.

Okay, complaints aside, the MGM itself is a great place to stay.  Rooms were moderately priced and very comfortable.  The walls are paper thin, so that is a drawback.  But they are spacious and well kept.  The casino floor is huge, with plenty of games.  I was a bit surprised that on a Monday night, with lots of open tables, we couldn't find a $5 min craps table, but that wasn't the end of the world.  The pool (the main pool, not wet republic) is spacious, relaxing, and a good time.  We had problems with service at the pool - the server seemed to only come around every 15 minutes, which doesn't sound like a lot, but we asked for a drink menu and didn't get it for 15 minutes, and then when we ordered, it was another 15.  Its one thing to only circle your station every 15 minutes, but you should really bring your customers what they asked for a bit faster.

We didn't eat inside the MGM except for one morning at the breakfast buffet, which is mediocre and actually made my girlfriend sick.  There are better buffets.  That said, we didn't eat at the MGM only because we did a lot of research and found other restaurants we wanted to check out, so that isn't a knock on the MGM restaurants.  They could be awesome, we just wanted to check some of the best ones reviewed here and on tripadvisor.

So all of this said, why am I giving it 4 stars?  It looks like I have a lot of complaints.  The thing is though, when I think about my stay, we had a fantastic time.  We liked the room, we liked the casino, we liked the resort, and I would repeat the trip in a second.  So while I want to give a complete picture, in the end, the things that went wrong were really minor in the gran scheme of things.  The staff at the MGM is really friendly.  Checking in and out was easy.  It was just a tremendous amount of fun, and the issues at MGM didn't detract all that much from the experience.  Like I said above, I would like to give it 3.5, but I can't, and my experience was better than a 3.  Without these issues, it would have gotten a 5.

The stay well suite was nice and I didn't have to wait in the ridiculous check in line because with the stay we'll experience there Is a separate check-in room saved me probably 2 hrs worth the room upgrade and the David Copperfield show in the hotel is amazing when I return to Vegas this will def be at the top of my list

Ok, so this became my new favorite hotel for many reasons! My first time staying here and in the past I had stayed at other hotels on the strip but my girlfriend and I decided to stay here and we were both impressed, pleased and happy with our stay. 
   We were here for 4 nights for the weekend and the things they have to offer just with that alone it beats other hotels. They have a whiskey bar , Hakkassan and wet republic so if you're looking to party it's a great hotel. 
  One of the days I stayed gambling in the lobby from 2am - 8am no issues or problems with anyone. This hotel has an older mature crowd I think. 
   We stayed in a King size bed room with a view and surprisingly the room was pretty big! The room over looked New York New York in front and off to the side the strip! So it was a pretty cool room and view. Room service was great we had a problem with our iron I called and asked for a different one within minutes they brought us a brand new one. When we were out they came and fixed the beds and threw out the trash no issues\/problems

mgm is a great place to play and gamble BUT dont stay here. 

i would think mgm has nice rooms  but i was so disappointed.

the room was small, there wasnt a great selection of tv channels, shower head sucked, the bathroom was small. 

but gambling and partying at MGM is a great place. 

i wouldnt stayed at MGM again.

MGM is a classic vegasl hotel that you always see and hear about.  unfortuantely i didn't LOVE our experience.  i thought the rooms were aiite and the walls were INCREDIBLY thin.  You could hear everything that was going on in the hallway, including 2 love birds in the next room.  eeek.

the hotel floor itself is fine, there were lots of restaurants, clubs, and bars to visit.  I liked the location of MGM but probably wouldn't return to stay at this hotel.

i do want to note though, that every staff\/service person we met was incredibly friendly.  we had a great experience there, but just didn't find it as comfortable or as sound proof as venetian or encore.

The rooms here need attention.  Otherwise, get your comfy shoes for a walk through the small city they call the MGM Grand.  Oh, and sit in Rouge and watch all the guidos and guidettes walk through the Casino in their bathing suits.  Good people-watching.

MGM Grand is a cool place. It's hip without being tacky. 

We stayed in the West Wing, which is "hipper" and cheaper than the standard rooms. It's smaller and better suited for couples and\/or young adults. There is a bar area on the floor (unused at the time) and in the lobby! A TV in the bathroom is both really cool and disgusting at the same time. I'll pass on the remote, thanks...

There's lots to see for both kids and adults. The pool is huge and really nice with a lazy river, lots of bridges, tents for groups, and watertoys. Sadly, it was raining the day we were there so I didn't actually get to go in. MGM wouldn't be MGM without the lions. You can walk under their glass floor and see more of their glory than you ever wanted to. 

We ate at The Grand Wok and Sushi Bar, an Asian restaurant (duh), and 'Wichcraft, the sandwich place on the corner. Though I was really surprised by the authenticity and great taste, we probably wouldn't have eaten at Grand Wok had we not been provided meal vouchers ("not without coups, baby..." ahhaha, Dane Cook is hilarious*...). The cool folks at 'Wichcraft gave us a free cookie as a consolation for selling-out on a sandwich. Prices at both of these places aren't life-threatening. Also, Emeril has a restaurant here... and he is freaking awesome. They fly their fresh fish in via plane everyday, and you will pay the price. Rainforest Cafe is great for kids.

Check-in pissed me off. They have no formal line, so people kept cutting in front of me. If ever I felt compelled to kick an old granny in the groin, it was then. Express check-out was as easy as filling out a card (actually, it was exactly "filling out a card"). I would gladly stay here again.

*Not even a year ago... such an idiot. (06\/27\/07)

The MGM sure is Grand. Grand in the sense that I had to walk more than halfway across the hotel to get to my room, but it was a really nice room. I upgraded from a room in their Grand Tower to one in their West Wing. It's the best and most modern room I've stayed at in Vegas to date. It's also a bit of a walk to get to their pool; you have to go through their restaurant\/food court area just to get there. One of several bars in the hotel was right on the bottom floor just steps away from the elevator to the room. The bartender that helped us was nice and made us some really cold (how they should be) shots of Grey Goose. The valet parking attendants here work really fast. For a hotel that's pretty crowded, our car was up in only 2-3 minutes. If you ever book this hotel and absolutely hate waiting in line to check in, they actually have a counter next to the baggage claim at the airport. Very convenient. Another good Vegas hotel to add to my list.

Eh - my heart is with Paris.  No idea why.  The room service here definately was CRAP.  I should've spent the $60 on room service at the blackjack table.  I seriously wanted to complain to someone about how CRAPPY the room service was, but decided against it.  

Room was pretty comfortable.  Pillows were way too high, gave me neck cramps lol.

The pool was overcrowded, since they closed 2 of them.  Maybe to save on maintenance costs lol.  O well, I know I won't be back.

Over priced Red Roof Inn w a casino! 
Stood in line forever to check in. Outdated old dirtty carpeting in halls n room. Our reservation specifically stated on it we were to have a King Size Bed in West Wing, instead we were given two tiny "what they say is queen" but are really full size. We just got engaged and came here for this? The view of the roof of the bldg next door n a concrete wall is glorious..Not. Refrigerator was locked so we had to call down to get that taken care of. Will never stay here again or recommend it to anyone. Stayed at several other places in Vegas and never had any issues like this. .oh and the smell is hideous in the rooms and hallway. Came back to room after being out all day and no towels n no cleaning service was done. Stay somewhere else!

Let me also add...no coffee makers in roomso you will be standing in long lines every morning to pay $6 for one cup of coffee. And..if you use the mini bar refrigerator in your room for cokes etc you purchase elsewhere..you will be charged, as a matter of fact..you are charged every time you remove anything from it even if you dont use it. If you wanna keep anything cool, you gotta rent a mini fridge from lobby. . Also...when you check out..your receipt will say Room Service for a to. Of things they cant even explain to you..even when you didnt get room service. Supposedly it was charges for my bottle of diet coke i took in n out of their fridge. They will not explain any of this to you upfront so beware. In general, stay somewhere else.

The MGM is a great place to stay if your going to a fight. The atmosphere is spot on rowdy crowds enjoying the boxing UFC life. The MGM is a well oiled machine when it comes to big events. If I was going to Vegas on a vacation I would pick a more upgraded hotel for sure ..

Update from my last post.  We checked out of MGM yesterday and moved to Excalibur for the remainder of our stay.  My boyfriend checked his bank account today and noticed MGM had charged him $350!!!  When he spoke with them they told him it was because there was evidence of smoking in the room.   Let me just say we don't even smoke so we were shocked that they just charge these large amounts for random reasons.  When we asked for proof of evidence they said they can't provide it.  Since they were no help over the phone we stopped our day and drove back to MGM to speak with the Manager in person.   

First the front desk employee didn't even know how the Manager was and told us there is no one by that name.  After asking another employee we were able to get the manager to come out and speak with us.  The Manager obviously didn't want to reverse the charge as he kept saying to take it up wit the bank and dispute the charge which should take a couple weeks.   I'm sorry did you realize you took $350 for no reason,  no I'm not waiting a couple weeks, we are not rich.   After repeatedly stating our point to the Manager and him reviewing the charges and "evidence", he ends up telling us that there is no evidence of smoking except the word of housekeeping saying it smelt like smoke.  So now you are saying you charge hotel guests for smelling like smoke.  I'm sorry but every casino you go in smells like smoke.  

We had to explain to the Manager that the rooms next to us were partying and we could smell smoke the night before, we just thought that it was our clothes or the ventilation.  He then says he thought it was odd that we were getting charged for the particular floor we were on.  He also stated that the other rooms around us had also got charged.   So first you thought the charge was odd and because the rooms around us got charged it was okay to charge random rooms next to it.   This is ridiculous.  

After telling us that you weren't able to do the refund and the bank had to do it, you come back after discussing with other Managers (hiding in the back rooms) that you are going to refund us because you feel bad.  I'm glad we were able to get that unnecessary refund but it's still going to take a couple days to reflect on the back account.   We still have a few more days in Vegas and now the money we thought we had to do shows and shop is gone for no reason.  I'm sure if we had left for home and weren't able to speak face to face we wouldn't have gotten our money back. 

Dear MGM thanks for the generic response you provide to all customers that rate you with one star.  We have encountered so many unnecesary issues on each occasion that it has disrupted our vacation on numerous occasions.

Stayed in an Executive King "Suite" (just a room with a desk and a sitting area). When we checked in two of the drinking glasses in our room looked as if they had not been cleaned. Our carpet was sticky. The view out of our windows was of a roof covered in rock. On one day of our stay housekeeping did not service our room. The noise from the next room, and hallway, disturbed our sleep.  At night the room was very dimly lit.

My cell phone was stolen at the slot machines and was told there was nothing they could do about it. When I asked about the cameras he said and I quote " That's not something we look for" So I guess you better hang on to your valuables. 
The room in the west wing was very dated but clean, but there's no refrigerator or coffee machine so I had a long walk every mourning to Starbucks to get in a very long line. 
Very long check in lines.
On a positive note the Circus de soleil Ka show was fantastic. A must see no matter where your staying.

Horrible! Stained sheets and blanket on our bed and Told them the room wasn't getting cold and asked for someone to look at it, we left came back hours later and whoever came in, had it at 80 and was so hot in our room! Beds uncomfortable, pillows uncomfortable! Did not replace shower soap or conditioner!
The casino had a lot of smoke and  bc of going to bed so late and couldn't shower, my bed smelled like smoke! They don't provide clean sheets they just remake your bed with used sheets and  left the dirty sheet on top of the luggage!
I know it is Vegas but be prepared to see half naked girls, and not pretty girls, dressed slutty and a lot of ghetto looking men and woman half dressed. A lot of homeless people begging for stuff and promoting music or promotions strip clubs, very annoying
Do not come here!
Cavey, and mediocre. Gambling, shops and dining, all feel very 1990s. Time for an upgrade MGM!

My friends and I moved to MGM from Aria because they wanted a busier environment with a younger crowd.  MGM definitely is the spot for spring breakers.  

I was very disappointed with the room they gave us.  Coming from Aria, it was dark and looked like crap.  The TV was old and the closet it was in, the doors don't open all the way.  One side had to be closed to walk by every time.  Good thing, we only stayed in our room to sleep.  

The highlight of MGM is the pool area.  I believe there was 5-6 pools and it was packed.  All the lazy chairs were taken, so I suggest going early if you want to sunbathe.  The Wet Republic was a separate pool area.  It's your day time club set around two pools.  The music is always bumping and beautiful bodies everywhere.  The waitresses are all hot.  I don't think I saw an unfit body in here so work out before you come here.  

MGM is an average hotel.  It's perfect for the average joe.  It's nothing close to the Bellagio or Caesar's.

I have stayed here multiple times when I was younger and a couple times when I turned 21. Needless to say the needed to upgrade and i would usually stay else where. But after the new remodeling I am impressed. When you walk in you are no longer greeted by the smell of cigarette smoke more a great vanilla smell. Which is a great sign. The new rooms are great. Beds are comfy new blinds to blackout the light after long nights. The shower and water pressure is just right. I recommend staying in the newly remodeled rooms it is worth it. Great job MGM getting back in the game. Also get to the buffet early for the early bird special, and just about every line of food has a stock of bacon so bacon lovers are more then welcome.

For some reason, I have always liked the MGM.    Maybe it's because it's close to the Airport or maybe because it's close to the Pinball Hall of Fame.  It's a large, very large hotel typical of what you'd see on the strip.   The hotel itself is really nice.   The rooms are big enough and the bathrooms are pretty large for what you need.   There are plenty of places to eat and gamble.  If you are a wandering soul, the MGM is a good place to start your hike up the strip.   
Will I be back?  You bet I will!

Our stay at MGM was ok.

4 of us all pulled together and decided to splash out and stay in one of the large sky view suites, (had 2 large bedrooms, 4 HD televisions and a billiard table. An awesome room and well worth the money) I don't think we would have enjoyed our stay as much if we didn't have this haven to retreat back to.

The main issue we encountered was when we checked in. 
The man at the counter did not run through any of the expenses with us. And never had us sign any papers, which we found kind of weird as every other normal hotel does.
He told us the cost of the room and charged my friends card, but when we checked the transaction history on the card account it had actually been charged an additional $300, so we're thinking he's overcharged us without realizing. 
Also, due to the limit on the credit card, this unexpected additional cost caused an overdrawn fee on my friends account.

When we explained this to management, they did not care at all about how their staff had not communicated with us properly and how this had affected my friends funds.

Their response,

"That $300 is a bond fee for the room, it will be returned at the end if your stay and is always included in the room you booked, it was on the paper you signed"
We didn't sign ANY papers and even when booking over the phone no one told us of this. 

After again, trying to explain that if we had known this we would have then split the costs over two cards we got a blank stare and an additional "well what do you want us to do about it" 
In the end they offered a petty $75 voucher. We didn't want a voucher, we just wanted an apology. And not once did they apologize for the lack of service and communication.

I would have left MGM with a 5 star rating if the manager assigned to us  had actually listened to our concerns, acknowledged them and apologized. 

Some (not all) staff at MGM need to get a lesson in customer service

I've always imagined the mgm as an image of class and standard. However, after this first and last stay, I will never associate mgm with this image again. Check in is probably the only thing that's saved my review from being one star. Upon entering my room there was used  beer bottles on counters and bottle caps on the bed. I was concerned maybe they gave us someone's room, but no. It's just how the room was left. No pens for writing. Luckily our room was comped two buffet tickets. The floors are dirty, the halls looks like it's straight out of the shinning. I'd rather use my money elsewhere.

Great value. Beautiful rooms, comfy beds and great price for 5 star service. Pretty good location on the strip. This hotel has it all and is actually the world's largest hotel. Slots pay well. There are great restaurants and clubs\/bars\/pools. I wish the Casino had a better ventilation system as the smoke sticks to you in 5 minutes. All in all very pleased with my stay here and will be returning.

The MGM has always been known for being one of the top hotels in Las Vegas which is honestly an over exaggerated compliment for the current state of the hotel. The lobby is great with easy access to the pool, however the hotel service is the worst of its kind. The showers are very weak and hard to control. On top of that, they do not keep track of their door scanners! My family and I were stuck in our room our entire stay because our door scanner ran out of battery. For a "5 Star Vegas Hotel" you'd think they would keep better track of thing like this for their customers? This was the worst experience I've had in Vegas and we come from a 4 hour drive every month to enjoy our free time, yet this is rock bottom service. I'm very appalled by MGM "Grand" Hotel.

We got a bungalow queen suite. I was really excited because we got a suite. I have stayed at Paris, Venetian, and Ballys' in a regular room. I thought since we had the suite it would be bigger. 

When i arrived at teh hotel........ WTF!!! The room looks like a regular room in paris. I should of got a room at Paris for cheaper. hahahah. Only one bathroom. It said separate bath and shower so i'm thinking there should be two separate bathroom. Nope!!! I was not happy. Their was no separate entertainment room. The beds were in one big opening. So small we didn't have much room. We had 6 girls in one room. WHATEVER!!! Misleading website. 

I had better experience than this.

Too bad i didn't have a picture of the room. hahaha. i'll show you guys what i mean..........

The name is misleading. It should say.......
MGM  Sort of Adequate.

Check In a total mess.
I arrived around 1:00 ish on a Sunday....( Never Ever arrive on a Sunday, )
The line was similar to the Indiana Jones ride at Disneyland on a Summer Weekend.......the line snaked back and forth in the lobby for around 1 hour. ( WHY IS THIS SO CUMBERSOME..
I BOOKED A ROOM , HERE IS MY CREDIT CARD, MOVE IT ALONG ! )

Somebody had a smart idea to hand out water and cocktails to the folks in line waiting to register. Good thinking.

Ok, I am finally registered. Head to room, walk in......the room is kind of warm. ( Maybe I have to be in the room for the air conditioning to kick in. NO. About an hour into this, I call downstairs, they said a repair person would be up, but we can not give you a time.

Two hours later, I call back, where is the repair Dude or Dudette. The voice on the phone says, " That request has just been assigned to a person and they will be up shortly. They were up shortly. Open up the AC and huzzah, the air filter is very dirty, which makes the AC sucks poorly. It did suck poorly. New filter and 30 minutes later all good.

Head to the bathroom. No hand towels\/ No wash clothes ?
Forget it, go gamble.

The next day, I politely ask the maid for those towels. She said " there aren't hand towels or wash clothes........I should call down to the front desk and request them. Since by her demeanor  and comments , this was more normal of an occurrence.

What is the deal ?

The prices are not cheap.
A Room Service  Breakfast for 1 with a milk was $44, w\/o tip.

Just plain annoying !!!

Bad experience couldn't have been worse. 

Firstly the huge line at checkin, with no help around to explain where the line actually starts. Management didn't do anything to help out. After a long wait, when we finally got to the counter, we ask for any possible good rooms or a change, which I can understand due to season won't be available readily. Then when I swipe the card for incidentals and deposits, the machine crashes, and charges me anyway. The rep asks me to swipe again and again, this after an hour long wait and a tiring 3 hour flight. Thanks for not keeping your machine updated. 
Finally when we get the key, we start towards our room which felt like forever. Rooms are small, and I guess this is because of the fact that I booked through hotels.com. The iron in the room doesn't work, when called to replace, was told will be done immediately, but I m still waiting for one. 
Next day early morning, I get knocked on the door asking when am I leaving today, and my reservation is for 3 more days, don't know how they have no idea about that?
On top of all the inconvenience, the hotel has added an extra charge of $235? Really I m in Vegas trying to balance my credit cards looking for extra charges? Thankfully they did manage to take the charge off, after me running down and standing in their checkin line, wasting my valuable vacation time. Never going here again.

The MGM Grand is one of those classic Vegas hotels that is here to stay. When you walk into the hotel lobby, the entire area is massive. The front desk workers were very helpful and courteous, providing us with information and answering all of our questions.

The room was in a great location. We had a view of New York New York directly in front of us, and the mountains were very visible in the background, which made for a nice view when we woke up in the morning. 

The hotel's pool is amazing. It's like a flowing stream that goes around an island. The temperature of the water was not too cold. Walking to the pool was a little cumbersome. We had to walk through the casino to get to the pool area, which seemed a mile away. 

Another cool thing about this hotel is the lion area. It's cool walking in an area where the lions are literally above your head in a glass encasing. 

Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Some people may think it's too far from the strip, but it is actually on the strip. I consider it to be at the beginning of the strip as you're coming in from the airport.

My husband and I stayed here for our 20th anniversary. Our experience in Vegas was AWESOME..mostly due in part to the hotels concierge ..ms Brenda Goldberg..thank you for making our trip even more memorable

The MGM Grand has always been one of our favorite casinos so we decided to stay here to check out the hotel.

Our visit started with a very, very helpful desk agent who went out of her way to make sure we were happy with our check-in experience.    There was an issue with our dining credit and she corrected it quickly with no argument.      We had a "Hollywood" suite on a remodelled floor.    Really nice room, so-so view as we looked out at the monorail station but we've had far worse in Vegas (and elsewhere) so no big deal.

The room was at the end of the hall so it was a bit of a walk but if you've ever stayed at a Disney hotel, you won't think this is very far at all.   

Housekeeping was great - none of the issues that others have complained about in prior reviews.

We like to switch up our hotels when we visit Vegas but MGM is definitely on the "we'll stay again" list!

One of my favorite hotels on the strip, and it's a CLASSIC.

Huge lobby where you can take a picture with their iconic golden lion, but the real magic is in the casino! Who comes to Vegas and doesn't hit up the casino at least once. I love playing here. The dealers are all really nice and friendly.

The rooms are nice and clean, and the hotel service is superior to most hotels out there.

MGM might actually pass for my FAVORITE hotel!

3.5 STARS

What makes MGM Grand so GRAND?!?!
Is it because the building and all it's splendor is emerald green?
Is it because the gold gigantic lion out front can be spotted a mile away?
Is it because there is some connection to the Wizard of Oz?
Is it because they hold boxing matches here? 
Is it because they are the head company that pretty much owns a couple other casinos down the Las Vegas Strip?!

I remember staying at the MGM when I was younger and had some fam bam trips to Vegas. The rooms were decent and filled with your typical amenities of a hotel room. I think the rooms are much better in quality compared to Luxor & Excalibur. When I stayed at the MGM, the Skylofts & The Signature (luxury boutique hotel rooms) were not built yet. But nonetheless, a decent stay at the regular rooms. 

RESTAURANTS
[SUPER SWANKY]
* Joel Robuchon (French - 3 Michelin Stars)
* L' atelier de Joel Robuchon (4 Michelin Stars)
* Tom Colicchio's craft steak (For all you carniwhores & Top Chef fans!)  

[SWANKY]
* Diego Mexican Cuisine
* Emeril's New Orleans Fish House
* Fiamma Trattoria & Bar
* Nob Hill Tavern (Michael Mina)
* Pearl (Chinese)
* Sea Blue (Michael Mina; currently renovating and will open 2013)
* Shibuya (Japanese)
* Wolfgang Puck
* MGM Grand Buffet
* 'Wichcraft (Tom Colicchio's Sammie shop; not as swanky as the others)

PARTY ROCKERS & PRE-PARTY HOT SPOTS
* Hakkasan Nightclub(debut 2013)
* Tabu Nightclub
* Wet Republic Ultra Pool
* Centrifuge (crafty cocktails)
* Rouge Bar
* Zuri Bar
* West Wing Bar

ENTERTAINMENT
* Brad Garrett's Comedy Club
* Hollywood Theater
* David Copperfield
* Ka Cirque Du Soleil
* Boxing matches at MGM Grand
* Concerts at MGM Grand Garden Arena
* Conference Center and Ballrooms (on the other side of the casino)

Given this laundry list of items, you can imagine how large this casino would be! It took me a good 30 minutes to get to the conference center as it is located on the opposite side of the casino! The food catered at the conference center was quite upscale and top notch! Consider it 100x better than what the Holiday Inn would serve you in a banquet! I wouldn't mind coming back to the MGM for a conference nor staying at the hotel. It's pretty decent if you're looking for something in the middle of the strip.

Good: Good prices for being on the Las Vegas strip granted it's at the beginning of the strip. Able to do express checkout without need to go to the counter. Next to the Monorail.

Bad: Had room with 2 Queen beds, the room was average, the hotel had casino smoke smell more present that other hotels on the strip. To check in takes awhile.

Summary: If your looking to have a ok room with good prices but want to be on the Las Vegas strip the MGM will work.

I had a pleasant stay here until I used their bag check service upon checkout. When I opened up my backpack after receiving it back, I found that my MacBook Pro had a massive dent in it - not easy to do! After I saw that damage I was worried about my other items, so I pulled out my camera to check it. Everything looked fine from the outside, but when I went to turn it on the live view screen didn't work and the view through the viewfinder was distorted. My heart sank. The interior glass components of the lens and camera were completely shattered. $3,000 in damages that I only noticed once I was at the airport headed home.

Everything else about my stay was wonderful, so I would have definitely booked my future visits here if it were not for the bag check experience. Lesson learned not to check in valuables. I guess I was wrong to expect that they wouldn't hurl my backpack with the force of the Hulk. Horrible, depressing ending to my vacation.

My husband and I stayed at the MGM last month on a Thursday through Sunday. We like to hop around and stay at different hotels in LV so I don't know that we'll be back necessarily, but it was a really nice casino and hotel. We went to the pool every day, not Wet Republic - we saw the kind of people walking in there and knew it wasn't for us ("ladies" in thong bikinis with high heels, no thanks). The drinks were great and priced appropriately, good music at a good volume, clean - no complaints. We gambled everyday as well and really liked the casino - it's enormous with different minimums at different tables, so good for all budgets. Buy bottled waters at the little pastry store next to the elevators - it's like 2 for $5 and much less expensive than in the rooms or even the shops downstairs on the casino level, although I ended up needing to buy a pair of sunglasses at a shop across from the front desk and they were cute and at a decent price. Our room was on the 24th or 25th floor and at the end of the hallway, which was no big deal except I think we had a larger suite next to us on the end and they had large groups in their room until 2-3AM and were very loud. We'll just make sure we're not near a suite next time. The room was great - very clean, nicely decorated, great bathroom. Lots of dining options - we ate at a bar\/grill near the pool one day, breakfast in the food court once and a pizza place downstairs. They just opened a Top Golf there as well. We live in Dallas and have several in the area -it's so fun! This one has pools and huge screens along the back net, definitely an upgrade from other locations. The best part about this hotel though was the lady who checked us in for our stay at the front desk. I wish I could remember her name - older woman, perhaps 55-65, and had worked there for 17 years (I think that's what she said). She took quite a while explaining everything to us, giving us all sorts of information, and even found us in the lobby 10-15 minutes after we checked in to give us our M Life cards. She gave us a small refrigerator for our room at no charge, too. She started our experience at MGM on a great note and really set the tone for the weekend.

Awful... Plain awful! We made reservations 2 weeks ahead for the grand queen deluxe room ($99 at the time). On the day of check in, we knew we were going to be late so we called in to let the hotel know at around 10:30. After giving our name, we let her know we were going to be late (2\/3am) and made sure it will be ok. After asking a third time she rudely told us it will be fine and hung up. We werent happy but we let it slide. 
After arriving at the hotel at about 3am, we were told our room was taken. We explained that we had called in and that someone here told us that coming in at that time didnt matter. So the hotel offered us a stay well room which is less value than the room we paid for! They even claimed at first that it was a $175 value compared to the $99 we paid! Well duh... Its more expensive the day of vs. booking and paying 2 weeks ahead! After asking she then told us that the current value of our queen was $200 and tried to rip us off! 
After asking for reinbursement of some sort she offered us two tickets to the lunch buffet.... As long as we ate it before we checked out 11am that day! The buffet starts at 10:30! How do they expect us to eat at 10:30 then go back to our room and check out by 11? She showed no sign of remorse or respect for that matter and kept saying it was our fault for coming in late. After reminding her that we did call she went back and then finally offered us a better room. She had previously told us that all the rooms were filled and checked out and all of a sudden this room is available after we complain??? All we wanted was an apology and maybe some extra hours for checkout (at that point it was 4:30am). There was no apology and she kept telling us it was our fault that someone in yhat hotel made a mistake.
FinLly we get to our room and the room was so dirty! There was dirt\/dust in the bath tub, the outlets werent working and the door would shut properly!!! I mean what an awful hotel room! The stay well suite was no different than a normal room (only thing we actually liked was the buy one get one free donut coupon at the bakery shop). Some of the lights werent even working when we turned them on! 
Terrible customer service and horrible hotel room.
SAVE YOUR MONEY AND GO TO A NICER HOTEL!

Went to get my rewards card and Kathy was awesome. She got me my card and convinced my bf to get his own. Then also gave us all info on it. Also got our tickets for our shows Michael Jackson  'one' and blue man group. There was a terrible line and 2 workers only. When that happens more should help and get line done. I luv the hotel and also had fun playing slots.

I've stayed at the MGM a number of times in the past, and I'm not exactly sure why, but there's something about this place that makes me want to stay...I guess I like the whole big Vegas resort...pools\/casino\/restaurants, and the easy access of the monorail.  I've given my reviews in categories...hope this helps!

Location

Location isn't so bad here considering though it's a bit a stretch away from the strip.  If you're flying into Vegas, it's awesome...whether you're renting a car or taking a cab, it's only 5 minutes away so you do save that time and money from sitting in traffic from the strip.  The monorail station allows free-flowing movement along the strip without the use of the car.

Check-In

Checking into the hotel can be a drag if you arrive at the peak hour.  I didn't have to face this issue due to being a regular--checked in through the VIP line.  

Rooms

The rooms are fairly standard.  My friends and I stayed in the standard rooms...nothing fancy but had what it needed...2 beds, bathroom, a TV, and a fridge (pre-requested).  If you're coming here to vacation with friends, you don't need a fancy room...just a place to pass out and sleep a few hours.  The hallways weren't too noisy...sure, would've loved to stay somewhere more fancy but hell, 3 days isn't much...just suck it up...

Amenities

The gaming area is large...and you can easily get lost.  The good side is that you don't need to leave the area so fast b\/c you can spend a lot of time in there and have fun without leaving the hotel.  

Pool

The pool's pretty nice here...it's large and surprisingly, it wasn't crowded when we were out...

Overall

I would stay at the MGM again.  It's a nice hotel, nothing fancy but it does have a lot to offer for the money you pay.  If it's for a few days and you could care less about sleeping and using all the fancy crap in the room, MGM is where you should book your place of stay.  Like I said, it's far from the center of the strip, but I would suggest to go to the strip for the day (play\/eat\/shop) and at night, come back and rest.

Came home from a weekend stay at MGM and had been biten by something all over my ankles and legs.  the only time I was not wearing shoes, socks and pants was when I was sleeping in the bed.  I suspected bed bugs and called the hotel to express my concern.  Instead, I was passed around to four different people with 3 minutes of hold tme in between.  Finally, the 4th person took my name and number and said some one would call me back.  Well, you know how that goes...No one ever called back.  I called the Nevada Health Department to investigate.  The sad reality is that the hotel only cares about the bottom line profit.  I don't know if there is a problem or not, but the hotel doesn't care.

MGM is ok I guess and navigating throughout the casino could have been thought out a lot better. In my opinion placing the floor map of the casino could have been in a better location such as when you first come in after parking your car, you have to find the map buried within the casino. Also they have a horrible potpourri smell in the lobby area and beyond. I'd advise if you have breathing issues or not really a custom to a very heavy fragrant to plant type materials I would try and avoid this area as much as you can, especially kids with breathing health issues.

I was actually pretty pleased with MGM.  The room was clean and comfy.  Their hot water is amazing!!  Check in was quick and painless.  I was disappointed with one aspect though.  When I booked, there was suppose to be a free upgrade to either a stay well suite or the king suite.  When I asked about it I was told that neither suite was available.  I understand that the upgrade isn't guaranteed, but I have a hard time believing that neither suite was available.  The husband wasn't super crazy about the location (he prefers central strip) the location didn't bother me though.  I did find that the doors\/walls are on the thin side.  I was woken up a couple of times by loud drunk people.  But it is Vegas and that is to be expected.  All in all I would stay here again.

Pretty chill hotel to stay at. It is huge and takes forever to get to the pool though. Good casino. Tabu club is alright but only go if you get in for free. Would stay again. Elevators are slowwww prepare to wait! But make friends.

Third time staying here!  Still haven't won that M5 they have laying around!  I did however win $170 dollars on those slot machines lol.]

Anyways, got a deal at http:\/\/www.myCheapVegas.com for $55\/night rooms with free all day buffet as well.  I don't think they have that deal anymore but there's some other good deals there, but it made my stay awesome!  I think i gained about 10lbs though.  

Highly recommend, 5 star all the way.  I'll be staying there again next time!

Stayed the first week of October ( great weather warm during the day and cool at night), rooms looked to be remodeled from my previous stay in July. MGM has a number pf great places to eat based on your budget. Rooms were clean, roomy and MGM is in a good location on the stip. MGM is on the south end of strip but great location for a short walk to New York and other casinos.  The only issue was it is big and takes a little sign mapping to get around at first but that is with most casinos.

almost 3 months later, and ive not heard from thir security dept about the missing money, nor their concierge about items i left in the room, altho concierge nevr availble during my stay, nor by phone or e-mail afterwards. hope their staff enjoyed the 200 bucks they stole, also noticed, that MGM nevr even replied     to my review as they normally do, not even an apology for this dreadful stay, ive stayed iin better motel 6 room motels that were nicer and friendlier

The MGM Grand continues to change. When it first opened, I remember the big ol' open mouth lion head- so gold and so gaudy. It was really an eye sore. Rumor has it that they changed the lion head to the lion statue that is there today because of superstition\/feng shui. A portion of the casino had this yellow brick road themed area where you could pretend to be apart of The Wizard of Oz. There was also a mini theme park that was suppose to rival Circus Circus, but obviously failed since it's no longer there. 
Now?
Concerts, fight nights, fancy restaurants. When I stayed here last, they were getting ready to introduce the renovated rooms. A couple sections of the hotel were already completed, but the boo and I ended up in the older wing. Regardless of that, I feel like their beds are comfy enough and you're in a high traffic part of the strip where you can take those sky bridges from place to place. 
Their Super Bowl parties are a lot of fun too! It's just a matter of securing one of those invites ;)

Very sad to see what this place has become.  MGM used to be synonymous with service and attention to detail.  Not so much anymore.  You're treated like a number from the very moment you check-in.  It's as if they could care less if you every come back; as long as they get your money.  
Call the front desk and be prepared to wait for 20 minutes or more on hold.  

Coffee maker in your room? Forget it.  It's a "fire hazard" according to the staff and therefore, not allowed anymore.  The in-room iron and hair dryer still remain, and it will cost you over $20 for a pot of coffee from room service.  

Want a refrigerator in your room? $25.00 per night.  

We asked for a room with a nice view and the person who checked us in smiled and said "no problem".  What we got was a room with a spectacular view of the hotel's HVAC system and loading dock, and we had the distinct pleasure of being woken up each morning at the crack of dawn by delivery trucks and their backup\/reverse alarms ringing.  

The door handles in our supposed suite were broken and non-functional, and the areas behind the bedroom night stands were disgusting and had obviously never been cleaned before.  

The air conditioning would blow ice cold for an hour then switch to heat by itself and we would wake up sweating in our bed and barely able to breathe from the stifling heat.  

The automatic window shades did not work and we could not raise or lower them.

The management staff could literally care less and their attitude was basically "take it or leave it, plenty of people who want your room so leave."  Unbelievable.  

We saved-up for over a year for what was supposed to be a magical time at the MGM.  How can you in your right mind treat your customers like this?
Very welcoming casino. I love the cocktail service, I dont have to wait very long even if theres crowd, and its well staffed. I will definitely return here again!

The staff is friendly but the room itself was really gross. There were stains on the comforter, sheets and pillow cases. Some stains were black and some were orange, almost like someone was eating Cheetos in bed. Nothin' wrong with eating Cheetos, but it would be nice if bedding was swapped out when a new guest arrives. The bedding was wrinkled too, which made it obvious that all they did was make the bed when the last guest left, instead of putting new bedding in its place. Another indicator was that there were random hairs (that were not mine) all over the sheets. Gross.

There were several of us in town for work and every single person said their bedding was dirty, and had other cleanliness issues. Dust and grime everywhere in the room itself. One of my co-workers found a long pubic hair in his tub the day we arrived. Another co-worker went to take a shower and noticed the drain was clogged, and suddenly (WARNING: THIS IS GROSS), a big glob of semen came out of the drain and then the water suddenly flowed again. I realize the staff can't control the urges of its guests, but GOOD LORD CLEAN YOUR HOTEL ROOMS, MAN!

And even though I never spilled any water, I was walking across the room one morning with socks on and suddenly my feet got wet. The carpet was soaked. Again, I didn't spill any water before. 

Obviously, I won't be staying here again.
I suppose it is like any other hotel on The Strip. We didn't stay or buy drinks here, but we made a point to stop by just to play on the giant Pacman screen. It was hilarious fun.

tHEY Had to Close the Lions mouth entrance upfront cause previously the Asians did not want to play here cause walking into a Lion with an open mouth meant they were going to lose money ( the lion was going to eat your money). So MGM spent millions change the entrance and replace the open lion mouth with a regular bronze lion statue. 

  The rooms are nicely decorated and fairly modern looking. I am minusing a star for not having a plasma.A 42 inch plasma is a requisite in my estimation. The views of the strip were outstanding.The beds are the most comfortable from all the hotel casinos I have stayed at - Venetian, Luxor, Treasure Island, Hilton and Aladdin.  I must have slept for over 7 hours and I usually do not sleep for more than 5 hrs in Vegas. The bed definitely had something to do with that. 

  MGM is one of the nicer casinos to play at and they have some of the better restaurants - Fiamma, Shibuya, NobHill, Wolfgang Puck and L'Atelier Joel Robuchon. I ate at Wolfgang Pucks bar and grill since I was not in the mood for French(L'Atelier), Italian ( Fiamma) or Japanese. But I hear they are all very good restaurants.  The Davidoff cigar shop is another plus.
with my guy, watching the finals! it's cool, friendly atmosphere, very inviting! friendly staff. very attentive to our needs. clean & fun! spacious...very affordable! luv luv luv! !!!

Nice hotel, easy check In ! They offer mobile check in. The only downfall is the parking lot! Weird and scary feeling. It's a far walk to the lobby. Very comfortable room. Would stay here again but probably valet and not self park.. it's $25 a day .. we got dropped off.. our friend helped us.. and didn't stay. Still had to pay the parking fee.

I am only giving this property two stars right now because overall our room is clean and comfortable. We are currently checked in as guests and since our check in it's been a experience to say the least. 

Let's start with check in.. we upgraded our reservation to to the SleepWell floor or experience. We were told they didn't have a room ready, but would text us in a shortly, once it was ready. We were happy with our experience and loved the fact that they could text us. We took all our luggage to breakfast at the Avenue Cafe. Our thoughts were that it was going to be a short time. The front agent spoke to them and let them know we were waiting for a room. We were given a number to call with our key packet to verify or check the status. After brunch we called and it was not ready. An hour later still not ready. Two hours later, still not ready. Almost three and a half plus hours... I lost track, multiple phone calls , the original room assigned is still not ready!!! Only then we ask if there is another room do they offer to move us to one that had been ready the entire time!!!! 

We get into our room and it's great! Relaxing and comfortable. That is until 2:45am!!! When doors start being knocked and slammed waking me up. Then from there banging starts and continues all morning off and on with slamming of the doors until around 8:30 am. So being on absolutely no sleep on the "SleepWell" floor is not working well for me currently!!! Then after being out all day we come into our freshly maintenances room and are immediately hit with the overwhelming smell of marijuana!!!! Not just a bit, which I get it's Vegas. No this was coming through our bathroom vents and our entire room was covered in it!!  Currently I am furious!!  I looked for a place to contact customer service online and nothing! 

We are here for 4 more days for a conference and it better not get worse!

It was my first time in Vegas and I had such a great stay at the MGM! This hotel is huge - you could almost spend an entire day just exploring it alone. 

The pool area was definitely my favourite part of the hotel! So beautiful! They have a huge winding lazy river that was great to relax on :) 

I stayed on the west wing and the rooms are very modern with comfortable beds. 

The hotel is also in a great location - very close to many restaurants and attractions! 

My only complaint is that people could smoke indoors (but I guess that's like every hotel in Vegas?) and the extra hotel fees were kind of ridiculous when you still had to pay for tube rentals, etc.

We usually stay at their signature rooms which are nice. But this one is something else.

For the price you pay and the few issues i come across, we will never stay here again. Here we are checking in at midnight we would think, no line for checking in. Boy were we wrong!! Not only was it long, it took over an hour to check in!! With the crazy line, no one bothered to open a few more check-in employees?! Then get to the front and after all this they tell me, I'm sorry, we no longer have a king size bed but only 2 queens. So why would you rent out rooms that you don't have? This is over 1am now and we were just tired and sleepy to argue so we just took it. I even tried to check in with the app which doesn't even work. Such a long process with tons of questions just to get no email back when my room was ready. Useless app. 

Next, she then says we now charge $10 for parking. In my mind, so what does the resort fee cover? The internet that barely works? The pool that is not opened? The fitness club that we wont be using as we are only staying practically by now less than 9hours? Does this make any sense to anyone? Anyway, so she asked if i would like to have to charged together now with the room or pay the $10 separate when we exit the lot. We charged it together which was good for 24hrs and guess what? As we exit, the ticket for parking was invalid and we had to pay again as we exit the lot. By this time, i am just so done with this. So now, i have to call the Hotel and request for a refund for one of the $10 charged twice now. If all this isn't enough, it took 4 employee reps passing me around. From "oh good question" then pass me to another which somehow ended me to a mandalay bay hotel rep then back which end up to wrong dpt to i am so done and yelled and this person to better not pass me around again and fix the problem. Which finally did about 25 minutes later! Guess I'm never parking here either!

Getting into the room, the rooms AC\/fridge or whatever the noise is that goes on through the night was annoying.  Ceiling above us was cracked with water\/pipe stains on it. This is what the price you pay gives you?

So from long phone call wait for room rsvp, to horrific long checkin wait time, to horrible issues that come along the way to a horrible mediocre room for the price you have to pay + resort fee + parking fee etc etc. Enough said.

 Not a bad place to hang out but to stay, no thank you.

MGM: If your going to charge for resort (which most are not used but forced to pay) + parking (even for staying guests) + more costly rooms then some other surrounding hotels, then people would expect better upgrades in some of the rooms, more employees to pick up phones without long wait times, more employees at the check in desk and train employees better so I wouldn't be passed around to someone else because they don't have the answer.

Went here because we were touring all of the hotels.

The lions were gone (which is probably good from an animals rights perspective) and this place, while once great, doesn't really offer anything exciting or original anymore.

Oh well.

We have stayed here before and enjoyed so decided to return.  Some good, some bad.  Room was nice enough - we were in the Grand Tower, but few minor problems like the carpet on the other side of the wall from the shower became damp we suspected a leak so called and they came promptly and dried it not sure if they fixed the leak but not wet again.  Had to call because the remote didn't work and the guy had to do something to the back of the TV.  Video checkout didn't work, housekeeping came very late several days.  Staff for the most part friendly and accommodating particularly the Mlife desk.  Brad Garrett comedy club had a great time.  David Copperfield show not that good.  Emerils and Pearl restaurants were very good.  Had fun gambling except for the smoke.  I really wish they would have a no smoking part of the casino. Kind of amazed at the amount of families we saw walking thru the casino.  Husband really enjoyed the pool as well.

It's Vegas baby!  Everything is grand including the MGM, even a bit overwhelming when you enter the place it's so big and the casino is immediately evident but the check-in desk is off to the side.  The pools were nice but the water should have been heated, also they close the pool at 5pm wtf?  I thought Vegas never shut down.  The room was big and clean though so I can't complain.

As far as Vegas hotels on the Strip go, this hotel is just OK. My biggest complain is that it's just too big. If you are unfortunate enough to get a room at the end-of-the-hall, your walk is going to be super long. We felt like we were in a Twilight Zone episode where the hall kept going on forever. So when getting your room, make sure that it is by an elevator. The hotel did away with the "Wizard of Oz" theme which was sad. They also closed down their amusement park, too. I guess it was not making enough money for them. On a good note, while you are there, check out the show "Ka". I think it is the best Cirque de Soleil show in Las Vegas.

We stayed for 4 nights; the room cleaning service was first rate and the room itself was very nice (we had one of their newly remodeled rooms). Service in the casino was just OK.
We extended our stay by 2-nights, however when we called reservations, the price was extremely high for the weekend. We then went on line and found the same room we were staying in for the price we had been paying. We called reservations and they then booked us that the appropriate rate we were paying. Hint, do go on line for your room rate rather then calling, the difference was astounding!
If you're a true foodie, the offerings in their restaurants are amazing with at least 10++  places to choose from. If you want a steak you could pay from $60-$245. Wow, depending on the place you choose to eat.

Stayed at MGM grand for two nights during a business trip this week, and I'm glad I know never to stay at this hotel again.  There was nothing but mishaps and poor service all around.

I checked in around 6pm and was told they had given away the Bungalow Suite I reserved (although I wonder if this is true now that I read some of the other reviews here?) and instead of offering an upgrade they decided to downgrade me instead to a standard room (and it wasn't just me, at least 2 other people had the same problem; front desk said they oversold for Valentines day...why is it so hard to only sell the amount of suites they actually have?).  To make matters worse they didn't even offer me anything to make up the difference (the suite I paid for was $20 more than a standard room), so I had to ask if I would be refunded the difference and the front desk said "well you already have the $65 dining credit" ....which was part of their current promo that everyone gets, whether they purchase a suite or not.  They did eventually offer to waive my resort fees and they gave me a mini fridge for free as well (which was old and came on this ugly cart, it was such an eye sore), but the fact that they didn't offer it up front shows how little they value their customers.

The room was newly renovated and I did like the decor and colors in the room; they at least attempted to make it look a bit more "swanky" than your average hotel decor. But when I go there was no remote for the TV, so they brought one up and that didn't work, so they brought up another one and that one didn't work either...and it turned out that the TV just didn't work at all, even though it was a brand new flat screen (the rooms were only renovated 3 weeks ago).  They said 3 other TVs had done the same that day offered to send up an engineer, but it was almost 9:00 and my show was ending anyways, so I didn't want someone in my room that late.

The second day of my stay I was set to move to the suite I paid for, they told me it would be ready between 11 and 3, which of course turned into a "wait until 3".  So I wait until 3, go to the front desk to get my key, they already KNOW that I've left my things in the room and will be moving them over, so what do they do?  They lock the room.  So I call security (twice) and it takes them 20ish minutes to come up and unlock the room for me so I can get my stuff out.

And there was no apology from security, or anyone else that I spoke with except the guy at the front desk when  I checked out.  In general, most of the staff I spoke with on the phone (security, operator, in room dining, etc) had bad attitudes and just sounded bored.

The suite was nice enough, it didn't have a kitchenette unfortunately, and the decor was blah (it didn't even have a flat screen tv), but at least it was spacious and came with a robe and slippers.  

Things I did like -- the easy access to the monorail and the food court.  Their rates are great too; but it's not worth the hassle.

When we arrived, we checked in for 4 nights total; we were assured that the system showed that and we were given our room.  When we arrived in the room, we found that the door to the bathroom was broken - no matter how it was shut, it sounded like someone was slamming to door!! We also were near some sort of dumpster area, and we were constantly woken up by the noises of them at all hours of the night.  
On our third day there, after being at a work conference all day and a work dinner all evening, we headed back to our room around 12:30 am to find our room keys were not working (again - this had happened 2x before and we had to have them re-keyed).  When we went to the front desk, we were informed our room was changed and that the manager had checked us out of our room.  Our belongings were still in this room, and we were very tired and frustrated.  We were told the room was no longer available because there would be "drilling" on that floor happening at 6:00 am that morning.  After much back and forth with the manager, we were given an "access key" that would work only one time to get our belongings so we could move to the opposite tower.  At this point, it was 1:30 am and we were exhausted.  We decided to sleep in the room that night and risk the morning sounds of the drilling; we decided we would get up the next morning and change rooms at that time.  There was no drilling.  When we changed rooms, we called the Bell Hop who was extremely helpful.  She gathered our things and escorted us to our new room.  When she used our keys to open the door, there was someone in the room!! We had been assigned an occupied room - thank goodness we did not barge in at 1:30 in the morning, it would have been very rude to the man in the room.  The Bell Hop then called down to the front desk and had to get us another room at this point which was now on another floor.  About 30-45 minutes later we finally were checked into our new room.  What is frustrating, is how we had to be uprooted from our room, which took a total of about 3 hours (finding out this information, gathering our belongings, going to the next room, getting assigned a third room, and finally getting into the room and getting unpacked again).  It was a terrible stay, and the customer service was terrible from everyone except the Bell Hop - she was amazing! I would caution anyone who is here for multiple nights, or anyone who is looking for a nice place to stay on the strip.  I have been to Vegas multiple times and stayed at many different hotels; this was my first and last time staying at MGM.

This place is huuuuuge.  It's the second largest hotel in the world, actually.  That's not particularly a selling point for me, so this wouldn't be among my first choice of hotels when staying in Vegas.  So we didn't!  But we did see 2 shows here -- Ka by Cirque du Soleil and David Copperfield -- so we roamed the grounds quite a bit.  As a requirement.  Because it's so freakin' huge.  

Everything looked so-so, a little old, and was dimly lit.  I wasn't really impressed, and it took way too long to get anywhere!

The check-in process is super slow. On Saturday at 4:30 PM the peak check-in time, only 6 of the 30 counters are open. People are frustrated and screaming. We have been waiting for 2 hours for the check in.

2 lines full of guests still waiting to be checked-in.

Stayed here for a get-away weekend.

The check-in experience was very good.
We checked in at the airport which was very nice.
No lines!

Booked a Bungalow King suite for $110\/night.
Nice over sized room but with a view of the 4th floor roof top.

Slots were very plentiful, clean and relatively good drinks were served.

We had drinks at Rouge, dinner at Emeril's, massages at the Spa and saw KA in the Cirque Theater..
All experiences we very good.

Everything was well done.  The entire facility was busy but there were never long lines.
4 Stars!

If you're used to Wynn or Encore, go there instead. MGM Grand is a very big, cool place. The rooms are decorated very nicely (modern). No matter where we went in the hotel, the food\/bev people were great. Front desk crew was both efficient and extremely helpful. The pools are fun - lazy river is great. Bar service at the pools is excellent. My beefs with this place are its security staff and how the hotel runs Wet Republic. First, the spectacle that is Wet Republic is worth the trip. Eye candy central with lots of craziness. $17.50 for a mid-grade 6 oz call-cocktail and near $100 buckets of Bud Light left me feeling REALLY violated. The security staff and entry routine at Wet Republic is absolutely rediculous. I think MGM grand rounded up every mall cop reject with a petty power trip they could find. Two gates + a VERY aggressive frisk and bag check routine left me pretty sour on the place from the start. I've had much better treatment from TSA officers, much more often. Optimism prevailed and a decent time was had. I'm an urban professional in my mid-40's (i.e. not a suspicious looking person). Yet, this tone within the security department was felt in most places throughout the property. The security people at the MGM just need some additional interpersonal training. I left with a tainted feeling like I wasn't quite treated like a paying guest. Maybe I'm just spoiled by places that treat me like that instead.

Ein sehr schönes Hotel in sehr guter Lage der Strip und viele Einkaufsmöglichkeiten können schnell und problemlos erreicht werden . Das MGM hat eine tolle Poolanlage und es ist sehr gepflegt den ganzen Tag läuft super Musik und es ist eine super Stimmung am Pool , Liegen sind reichlich vorhanden und Handtücher bekommt man kostenlos für an den Pool . Gegen eine Gebühr kann man sich schwimmreifen für den "Lazy River " leihen und auch Bälle zum Spielen . Ein tolles Hotel nur weiter zu empfehlen .

For our first Vegas trip with my boyfriend, we stayed at the MGM grand. We got a deal for 55 dollars a night and 2 free show tickets to any show we wanted. Which was pretty awesome. Since usually each room can range from 100+ a night.

The hotel is HUGE so get ready to put on some comfy shoes! This hotel is NOT heels friendly because the rooms are actually located near the main entrance of the hotel.

Some good thing about the hotel is that it has some attractions such as the lion exhibit, and the new wet republic pool (21+ only). It also has the monorail, which is very convenient because you can travel to the other side of the strip for 12 bucks for a full 24-hour pass.

Another thing, you might see some familiar famous face here and there because my boyfriend and I saw a UFC fighter while waiting for an elevator heading to our room.

This was for a long time the world's largest hotel.  It certainly must still have the world's longest walk from the elevator to your room.  Speaking of rooms, they're pretty generic here.  The restaurants are unremarkable besides their expense.  It takes forever to walk through this place to get to the monorail.

On the plus side, this is the only casino with real live lions.  Sure, other casinos may have aquariums (Mandalay Bay), tigers (Mirage), dolphins (Mirage), or flamingos (duh), but for lions this is your only choice.

We booked a west wing room for three nights. We arrived at 11:30am way before check in time. We stood in like like 20 mins to check in. Line looked long but actually moved fairly quickly and they have us water bottles while we waited. We checked in no problem. Got to our room very basic nothing amazing but for the price it was good. Room was clean and didn't smell like smoke. Headed to the pool love that whole area has 4 pools I think and a lazy river tons of chairs. Only thing was there wasn't enough tubes in the lazy river seemed like people were hanging on to them and not using them. Drinks at the pool amazing not watered down. Overall a great trip and stay at the MGM. Reading some reviews before I booked scared me but I'm glad I came to judge for myself...some people just like to write negative reviews.

I just returned from a birthday weekend in Las Vegas staying at the MGM Grand in a West Wing King room. This review is for the room only.

Our room was on the 14th floor, the Stay Well floor. You exit the elevator and go down the hallway, beautiful patterned carpet, textured walls, art on the walls, attractive light fixtures...then you reach the West Wing, or as my boyfriend called it "crossing the train tracks". The carpet changes patterns, as well as cleanliness. It was very dirty. Stained & old. Plain walls, overhead lighting only, and grey. Welcome to the West Wing Clinic. Once you enter the room, the bathroom is immediately on your right. The floor of the shower is cement. Painted cement. i was shocked. The tv cabinet\/dresser had large chunks taken out of it, I assume from previous guests. The headboard was so faded i thought it was a pattern, it wasnt. The shade had multiple holes in it and was stained. The mattress was terrible and there was a large gap between the back of the mattress and the top of the headboard where you could see all the wiring and what not from behind the bed. We couldn't even sit\/lean in bed and watch TV because you would fall back into the gap. I guess it was a good weekend for my posture? This room was very disappointing. Actually the word is, depressing. My boyfriend compared it to a "rent by the hour" room.

Notice I did not remark on the size. I was very aware that it was a smaller room when i booked it. I do not equate size with quality. I have stayed in numerous small hotel rooms over the world in big cities that are quality through & through. This was not one of them. What a shame.

Don't stay there... my daughter was injured in one of their rooms... a glass shattered in her hand -- no fault of hers... she was literally holding the glass, and the cheap glassware they supply, shattered.  They immediately sent up security, did an accident report, insisted that she travel to the emergency room in an ambulance (none of it covered by the hotel).  This cost me out of pocket co-pays and expenses.  They would not talk to me due to HIPPA laws (even though she is my daughter and is covered on my insurance).  When I brought the issue to the BBB, all I asked for was for them to cover the $100 I spent at the hospital and a possible weekend stay for my daughter... they refused.  HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!  If you stay here, I hope you are comped and I pray that nobody gets injured on their watch, because they will not do anything about it!!!  They could care less about their guests... sad... used to be a fun hotel and in the past I would have highly recommended it.

This casino is great, but it seems like all casinos on the strip seems to be great. Not much to write about here as we came here to just check around. Didn't gamble much didn't check out the rooms or pool (because we didn't room there). But all in all it was great couple of things I like about this casino is that they had there own Lion watch area where there are a few lions walking around in a glass area.
