We actually got there at a good time as we ran into the UFC poker tournament and get to see a few UFC fighters.

This review is only based on the casino aspect...
Came to play roulette and im not a big gambler but i do enjoy just sitting not worrying about time and getting free drinks. I waited for a cocktail waitress for 30 min to come to me after trying to flag one down. Wasnt busy. Room was a little empty. Still stayed an hour and saw the cocktail girl once. Sorry but ill go to cosmo or planet hollywood or aria where i was there for an hour and saw the young gal come around 4-5 times.

This hotel has taken a serious dive. Too many little kids in the casino...and I mean little. A little four year old was lost around my slot machine crying at 2:30 am. Finally his idiot mother found him and guess what, she started yelling at HIM. I could not believe it. Where is casino security?!! 

The other turn off are the number of women parading around the casino in their bathing suits drunk around all these "little kids". I witnessed one of these drunks literally messing with one of the "little kids" behind her and her parent's back. One of her huge nasty butt cheeks was hanging out. She was barefoot, staggering and spilling her drink everywhere. Two...yes two MGM security guys walked by her, one of them actually turned around to check out her butt. 

I am not a prude, and I understand that is a long hall to the pools from anyone's hotel room. But I think that the other guests in the hotel are allowed a certain amount of respect. It seems like the MGM is attracting a much lower class of people. Geez!

Overall great casino it's hugggge!! Nice clean room and great view as well, but for future trips we wouldnt stay here again the fact being we arrived at 1030 waited in the huge line to check in and our room wasn't ready til 330!!! We couldn't pay early check in, they said they sold out. So we spent 4 hours in the casino waiting around til our room was ready and waited another 30 minutes for our luggage to be brought up to our room. Soooo half the day was gone,and all we just wanted was to be drunkk in the pool!!!
I'm in room 442 4th floor west wing if this hotel. the shower stall is full of algae, black molds around the corners of the tiles. And this us suppose to be a 5 star hotel. check out the picture.....

The only reason to give a star is for the pool. The lazy river was great, but that's where the enjoyment of staying here stopped. Hubby and I stayed 2 nights and we reserved a room with a king bed. Upon checking in were were told we were getting a "free upgrade" which turned out was in the grand tower with 2 queen beds and when I said that I didn't want it since I wanted the king bed I was told they were at max capacity and there were no other options. So we got stuck in a room with beds we didn't want and to boot we were right next to the airport side so we had to listen to airplanes and helicopters all day and night...uhhh, this is supposed to be vacation at the freaking mgm not a shaft place to stay. The bed was way too small for hubby and I and we shouldn't have to sleep seperate because the hotel decided to jank us. We were super unhappy about our hotel stay here including the buffet.

Got the hakkasan experience package.. Its pretty good - overnight rate with free express entrance to hakkasan and a $50 credit. The only downside of it was that it smelled like smoke almost everywhere (its hard to avoid that when you're in vegas i guess). Ive always had a hard time sleeping coz i would cough so much at night. I had to pass thru the casino everytime we had to go in and out of our hotel room.

At the MGM again and enjoying there AC and pool as the temperature reached way over 110 degrees outside. Used a pod out at the adult only pool and enjoyed getting drinks in the pool. The lazy river was fun also just to many kids very crowded for a Monday. We will be back hopefully soon. Only complaint is the parking fees. They need to find a way to get money for parking then charging for valet service and garage parking.

Although I'm a "local" every now and then we like a little staycation and try a different hotel each time. This is one we won't return to or recommend. We stayed in the west wing, the hallways are grey and bland looks scary and cheap! Put some colors or artwork on the walls...two different carpets at one point....ugly! Room was super small, I felt like we were at a small town motel not the MGM Grand in Las Vegas. We had plans so we freshened up and left for the evening, we arrived back (late) fell asleep and the next morning while getting ready my fiance sitting in a chair notices there was a dirty pair of boxers under the bed! I spoke to housekeeping since she was in the hallway, I went to speak to the front desk and of course they brought a manager. Who questioned how we didn't notice them when we arrived...as I explained to her aside from being in a hurry, we didn't expect to have to thoroughly inspect the room after all MGM is (what I thought) supposed to be a nice hotel. I Was dissapointed with the customer service from the Mgr (the registration clerk Crystal and Brennan were super friendly =) ...whatever...so we had plans again & left for the evening.
The morning of checkout (which is at 11 am) so i was a little pissed when at 9 am we hear a quick knock and our door flies open followed by "housekeeping" we were still in bed so I respond "we're not ready!" Ugh that was the worst hotel experience I've ever had!!

MGM has one of the most impressive lobbies I've seen. It's also pretty conducive to shouting, just ask Kamster.

Checking in was a little bumpy, had to wait in a long line just to be told we couldn't check in yet and we had to call a special number at a special time in order to get our room number. Their concierge was pretty helpful when we asked about the best\/most popular nightspots and didn't automatically recommend MGM's clubs.

The room itself was really nice (though, no fridge) with big super comfy beds and bedding and a glorious view of Hooters. I'm still confused as to why there was a picture of Patrick Stewart on the wall.

we stayed at the signature.. so.. here goes nothing.

we went up to the concierge to find showings for zoomanity tickets.

woo.. did we go to the right lady. she was soo sweet. she helped us out and managed to give us a great deal on the tix. yay!

A Grand Hotel with a large Golden Lion at the  door to greet you.  This is a heritage place on the strip with reasonable rate and maintained as part of a now larger casino group.  If you register in the MLife rewards program, you can get room rate and other discounts \/ rewards.  Nice location handy to the shows and other stuff on the strip.

My family decided to do our summer vacation in Vegas this year, so we searched online for a good deal. Since my sister is a Platinum member with US Airways, she directed us to www.usairwaysvacations.com, and what an amazing deal we got. 2 nights and round trip airfare from San Diego for $132 per person! Book it! 

I read a few reviews about the MGM and just decided to try it since it is the biggest resort in Vegas. I don't mind the walking and all that since I'm not that old. 

The checkin process was pretty annoying since there were only 5 agents open. They had at least 10 stalls available. Anyways, it was pretty painless once we were helped. We asked for an upgrade, but since we requested smoking rooms, there were only 2 floor that they could put us on. No problem.

We got a room on the 24th floor if I remember correctly. And yes, there was Indo smoke filling the hallways. Damn it smelled good!

The rooms are typical for Vegas. Very clean, spacious, and tastefully decorated. I'm not one to take pictures of every nook and cranny and scratch so I was very satisfied.

I have nothing to complain about with the MGM at all. Everything from valet, to room service was up to par. 

I tried out the Studio 54 and the poker room but I guess I'll do separate reviews on those.

Check you out MGM! The green monstrosity on the strip that seems like it's been there for ages has spruced up their little West Wing and I for one, am a fan.  I'm not extremely picky when it comes to hotels since I don't spend more than a shower and (sometimes) a good night's sleep in them.  Shoot, I can sleep on a hardwood floor, or sitting straight up in a driving car and still wake up refreshed.  But with pillow top mattresses?  Modern décor? 3 pools? And for 75 bucks per night (plus tax)?  Yes, yes and more yes!
 
For a quick getaway on a budget, MGM will do you right.  Access to other hotels is relatively close (Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Excalibur, NY NY, Monte Carlo, and City Center) and except for the outrageous prices for alcohol, the pool situation is great.  It's even more exciting watching your drunk husband and even drunker brother float along the lazy river wreaking havoc on innocent bystanders who get in their way. (Apologies to the little girl who got her inner tube jacked.  I told them not to.)

Currently staying here. 1 day late to check in and they cancel my reservation even though they assured me that my booking would be valid when I called the prior day to inform them I would be 1 day late. Spoke to the check in manager who was a complete doosh bag and didn't want to help at all. Basically he said I had to repay the accommodation costs at today's rates which were substantially higher and that the previous reservation payment was declined. I know for a fact that it wasn't declined as it came out of my bank account months ago. So I had to make a lengthy international call to my travel agent who also spoke to MGM yesterday and informed them of the late arrival and they actually seemed to care unlike the MGM supervisor. By the time I explained the situation the MGM staff miraculously found that my payment and reservation was now reinstated.... wow what a load of rubbish coming out of the managers mouth... I can't believe he blatantly lied to my face and then he was nowhere to be seen once my booking was reinstated....

So far I'm not impressed. The check in girl made 1 phone call and had it reinstated... she could have done that from the beginning and my rating would probably be positive...

Welcome to the roller coaster that will be this review.  

Parking: $12\/day to park?! I am already paying a lot to stay at the hotel not to mention ill be charged a lot in resort fees on top of everything, and now i have to also pay to park? That was extremely frustrating.

Arrival: we checked in using he mobile check in app and were able to walk right up and get our room keys! It was a great start to our stay at the MGM. We took our time to get to our room because we were taking in all of the beautiful sights and sounds. 

Our first room: first impression, "what is that smell?" The room certainly had a smell but we pressed on and explored the room. At first glance it's a very cool looking room, a bit small but cool. When I started to pay closer attention I noticed a horribly chipped sink, broken outlets, a non functioning window shade, and a broken door lock.... we tried to stay optimistic and not let those little things ruin our trip, but what is that smell?!  We decided to explore the hotel and have some fun and upon our return the smell had completely consumed the room. It smelled like a dead animal in the ventilation. (No I am not kidding). We called the front desk and they sent a man up who seriously sprayed our floor with some mystery solution and left. It did a great job of temporarily masking what we are now almost certain was a dead mouse somewhere... I finally decided to speak to someone at the front desk and they were AMAZING! i wish i would have gotten his name. He was very apologetic and switched our room immediately. He even upgraded us for the inconvenience for free! We couldn't wait to get out that smelly room. 

Room # 2: Are we in the same Hotel?! WOW! We literally felt that way. From the elevators, the carpet, the staff, and the room were literally night and day. It seriously felt like we had switched to a different, more luxurious hotel. Our new room was BEAUTIFUL! Working locks, twice the space, an amazing view of the mountains! We were so thrilled about our new room. It gave us the ability to not worry about our room and enjoy everything else! I cant express how grateful i am for them being so helpful! 

The Casino: If you've been to one vegas casino you've been to them all. We walked through almost every single casino on the strip and i cannot picture a single discernible difference from one to the next. They are all smoky, loud and have lots of slots and tables. MGM Grand was no different. 

The Food: We thoroughly enjoyed every single dining experience we had at the MGM Grand! Sit down, fast food, late night, buffet, breakfast, etc! They had it all!! We did not have a single meal that wasn't absolutely delicious. The prices of course are high, but they were mostly competitive compared to other Casinos and very convenient for us as MGM Grand Guests. There is literally something for everyone. I was very impressed by their food selections.

Top Golf: We had never been to a Top gold previously but were with a group that had. We had an absolute blast! The two hours went by very fast and our entire party seemed to really enjoy themselves. The food and Drink prices were outrageous so please be mindful of that. 

Final Thoughts: What had started off as a very disappointing stay, ended up being a very fulfilling experience.This hotel had everything imaginable. We could have just as easily stayed anywhere else and experienced the MGM Grand as visitors but we were glad we stayed there to see how it was. When we ultimately Return to LV we will most likely not be staying at the MGM grand as there are so many other places to try. Plus there are several Hotels and Condos that don't charge for parking and also exclude Resort Fees which can save you 100s of $$. 

My Personal Recommendation: A group of my friends Stayed at a Condominium basically on the strip. They had twice the room space, lots of amenities, and free valet parking. They were still able to experience everything We did but without all of the costly fees. You don't have to stay at a casino to enjoy them.

If I could give this hotel no stars I would. My experience here was horrible. I stayed at this hotel for about a week. My first day I waited on a line to check in for about 2HOURS. On one of the last days of my visit I was attacked by another guest outside of my room. When I called the police and security to press charges on the girl who assaulted me they thought the right thing to do was to kick the both of us out of the hotel. I have never been so miss treated by a hotel I spent thousands of dollars in. When I asked the security why was I being kicked out and why they did not go over the cameras there answer to me was that they didn't care it's not there problem. As me and the other guest who I was sharing a room with gathered our stuff ft he security guards were saying very awful things to us such as get the f*** out, Go F*** your mother. When I asked why they were speaking to us like that when we did not do anything there reply was because that's why they love there job because they get to say and do things like this. DO NOT STAY HERE IT IS HORRIBLE!

As one of the most popular hotels on The Strip, you would think this hotel would be mind blowing!  But it was a disaster! 

I was already wary when I found out that bed bugs were found last week.  Thankfully, or at least not to our eyes, there were none in our bed.

We stayed in the West Wing - King Bed.  
-It was so far from the casino!
-The room was incredibly dark, barely any lights, & the window was tiny!  
-The shower had a shower head & a hose.  After we showered, there was water everywhere!  No matter how much we tried to contain the water, we had to use almost all of the towels to wipe the floor dry.  
-The pillows were flat!  I had to constantly keep on flipping the pillow or fold it to add bulk.  Also, there were only 2 pillows for the both of us (I like to use a pillow for my head & one in between my legs but I could not do that).
-The housekeepers threw away things that they should not have...

One of the hotels with a parking fee.

We had a very bad experience here staying last week. Rooms are small and untidy. The first room that was given to us had water leaking from the roof right above the bath tub... disgusting. Surprised they were renting such rooms... Front desk was not at all helpful. Me and my friend booked at the same time but were given different towers. When asked to give us close by, they charged extra. Even after paying extra $ they gave the room with leaky roof... When asked to change it they gave a room far from my friend's. So we ended up paying extra $ but still couldn't get rooms close by. Overall it's not the old MGM hotel anymore, at the best it's a 2 star motel. Don't go by the look in the lobby. Rooms, corridors and casino floor all sucks.

Entering the resort is a lot more difficult than it should be. Accessing the front of the hotel, where the main valet is located, was a mission. We finally learned that you need to enter from Tropicana, by staying right before getting to Las Vegas Blvd.

The hotel rooms have been newly renovated, but I still wasn't a big fan. The mattresses could have been better, but overall the room is fine. I think I have just been spoiled by hotels like Venetian, which are much better, but much more expensive. The rates at MGM are reasonable and you get what you pay for, maybe even more than what you pay for here.

The hotel and casino are very large, so it takes some navigating to figure it all out, but once you do, it's not bad. 

The food court has a McDonalds which was cool, but the Big Mac did not taste the same as the McDonalds that I have had in LA.

Other than that, just beware of the resort fees.

I had a suite on a high floor and the room was clean and and well-ventilated and beautifully decorated and furnished. 

This hotel is way too big and busy for comfort, though. 
 
The overall hotel experience, the lobby, coming and going, the casino, the shops, the taxi lines, the miles of walking, even to the pool, is so low-end.

And the "free wifi" isn't working too well.
Thin walls in a Vegas hotel room is no bueno!  Our room in the Garden Tower was nice though.  Housekeeping didn't leave a trash can in our room!
Good hotel but just too big for me. It took like 20 minutes to walk to the room from the strip. Just too big for me. It's like a cattle call just getting breakfast.

Loud loud loud loud loud this place is loud can't sleep it like sleeping next to a club! Ohh yes it is next to a club!! Horrible loud place I stayed in the 10th floor can't imaging poor souls in the second floor holy crap!

great hotel, clean, large rooms with awesome views.

delicious buffet downstairs.

friendly concierge.

one flaw - very thin walls - we could hear the people next door partying at all hours.

I stayed in this hotel with a bunch of friends for my first time in Vegas. I have to say, I fell in love with the place. 
We came to stay during Memorial Day weekend so it was hella crowded. Check-in lines were long, and we waited a good 20 minutes before being able to check in. 
The hotel room that we got was a regular room with 2 king-sized beds. The room was well-kept and very clean. I also liked the modern feel of the interior. 
Housekeeping did a very good job of cleaning the rooms everyday. 
After day and night of partying, I was so happy to find solace in our room. The bed was very comfy!
They pool area is quite nice as well. Unfortunately our experience in the pool area was tainted by a bunch of drunk youngins that were getting very annoying and angry. 
Overall, I would go back and stay here again though. The Grand has a special place in my heart because it was a huge part of my first time experience in Vegas.

Great hotel! Stayed there with my husband and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful considering how HUGE it is there. It's like it's own little mini village and of course coming down and seeing tigers laying around made me feel right at home!

I will go back there again for sure this year for the holidays.  Big Rooms too.

MGM has a convenient check-in at the McCarran airport. When we arrived, it took them about 15-20 minutes to give us our room keys because they had accidentally given them to somebody else with the same last name as me. They were kind enough to give us a $50 food voucher and a free shuttle ride to the hotel to make up for their mistake. It was no room upgrade, but I was still happy =)

The hotel itself was awesome! It's not super fancy like the Venitian or Bellagio, but this is the kind of place that you would wanna stay at with a group of upper middle-class friends. The standard rooms are....standard, just as you would expect. 

This hotel has everything that you would need. A total variety of restaurants, a HUGE casino, some great shows( Ka, David Copperfield) and Studio 54 is a decent nightclub. And if you dont want to walk up and down the strip, they have a monorail that will take you all the way to Sahara.

The only thing stopping me from giving the MGM 5 stars is the long walk to the rooms, which can be a pain after a nights worth of club hopping.

The room was nothing like the pictures, checked out on Dec 18th, 2013, didn't get my $200 safety deposit returned until today, Jan 8th, 2014. I had to call MGM several times to get the error that they were having with the deposit fixed. They kept telling me that they had returned the money and to go check with the bank, but in the end, the issue was with MGM. If I had not noticed this error, MGM would have taken 200 from me without me knowing. Can't trust this hotel resort anymore, stay away. Go to Bellagio or The Venetian.

**There is a resort fee.. 20 a night. Includes a daily paper, access to the gym and internet**

My brother wanted to go to Vegas this weekend for his birthday, so I made it happen.  Called Casino Marketing to book a room. Got a great rate.. So that was the easy part. 


Parking:

Parking is not too bad, but just know that you have to go to the street level (from where ever you park) and then take the escalator up to the main level (where check -in and all of the other action is)

Check-In: (arrival 11:30pm, lines and wait were not that long)

I have stayed here about  a hundred times (I come to Vegas often) and by far, this was the worse check-in service. The guy barely said hello and welcomed us to the resort. He took my ID, CC and Players Card, left it on the desk and walked away for 10 minutes and went to the back room. No "I'll be right back, one moment please or anything."

When he get's back, the clerk looks at my players card (see's that I'm a gold member) and then gives better service. Apologizes for the delay.. Says there was a "system error" and then proceeds with the rest of my check-in. There was no interaction nor eye contact. (I still have to call my\/a Casino Host about this)

The only thing I felt good about was the room that he assigned to us. Double beds, high floor and a prime view of the strip. 


Room:

MGM's tower deluxe rooms are simple but yet comfortable at the same time. Comfortable beds, great pressure on the showerhead, approx 450 square feet, comes with a 27 inch tv (which they are in the process of upgrading from what I hear), business desk and a lounge chair. One cool feature about their rooms is that there is a ledge that you can sit and stare off into the strip while enjoying a drink of your choice. 


Pools:

Amazing!! And tons of them! A lazy river, few Olympic sized pools and Wet Republic for the Adults.


Casino:

The Casino is huge. Any game you want they pretty much have. For us Baccarat players, they took Baccarat off of the floor about a year or so ago and made all Baccarat play get played from the Salon.  :) 

Tons of Blackjack tables with all different minimums and millions of slot machines. 

The sportsbook was pretty cool too. Just one of the smaller sportsbooks that I have been to.


Bars\/Lounge Areas:


Writing in a separate review..  (Look for Centrifuge)

Overall, I enjoyed my experience (minus the check-in service). Three stars this time. But should have plenty of updates were MGM Grand Hotel gets 5 stars from me. 

I am easy to please when it comes to hotel service.. Trust me!

My husband reserved a suite. The suite was beautiful and roomy. No view which kind of sucked but we still enjoyed the room. The room had black out curtains which helps. We slept in until 10am because our room was so dark. The jacuzzi tub was great. We went in it both nights. Plenty of bathroom space for two. The flat screen turns so you can watch it from the couch or from the bed. I would definitely stay again.

Horrible hotel. The standard room is tiny and has no refrigerator to keep drinks or food. You literally have to walk a mile to get to your hotel room. There's no drink spots for miles in the hotel. The 13 floor hallway is half done with some good nice looking carpet and walls and the last half is ghetto walls and floors. Will not stay here again.

The MGM is one of the older and more affordable hotels on The Strip.  It has the standard features of a casino hotel, lots of slots, games, and restaurants.

The rooms were fine, not terrible, not special.  Things were kept clean and nothing was glaringly wrong.

The location for the price is key.  DO NOT eat at the buffet.  Take a walk along The Strip to the multiple, much better options.

This new parking policy suckks... Now you need to be a pearl member or above to have free parking access or else you need to pay $$ well i am a pearl member this member cards are always giving me issues and causing huge back up to exit out of the structure.. Not very happy!!!
HORRIBLE!!!!  Check in process is so slow!!!  I've been waiting for an hour already and not even 1\/3 of the way thru the line. The staff has no sense of urgency whatsoever.

My friends and I decided it would be a good idea to drive to vegas from orange county at 1am 2 weeks before christmas. When we rolled up to the strip we started calling hotels to get a room. The mgm sounded great because it was right on the strip and only $65\/night in the middle of the week. So we valeted the car got our stuff and strolled up to the checkin desk. We asked for the BEST room they had available because we were only staying one night and we wanted to go big! The woman at the desk said if we wanted a room we would have to pay for last night and tonight because it was 3am. we were so exhausted we agreed. she also informed us that we would be charged a $40 resort fee. So we were like okay fine!
 
When we got to our room it was a normal room with 2 queen beds on the 5th floor... HAHA that was the best? nooo! so we went back to the desk. We were already a little frustrated. Then on top of that there was absolutely no one in line and we stood there for 10 mins to get the front desk attendants attention was annoying! We finally got into a more desirable room on the 28th floor over looking the strip. 

After a few hours of sleep we woke up ready to go! As everyone knows its way more fun to pregame to music so we called the front desk for ipod speakers.  They told us it would be $110 to RENT a iHome for 24hours! What a joke! Ive stayed plenty of places on the strip and its always complementary especially if you pay a resort fee!! Mmmmokay so we passed on the iHome. Soon after we realized there was no mini fridge in the room. So we called the front again asking why our room didnt have one.Apparently our room hadn't been remodeled yet. OF FREAKING COURSE NOT! we only asked for the best room right?  So we asked them to bring a mini fridge to our room.
 
ME:          "alllllllright.. thats a going to be an additional $30 to rent a mini fridge. So your telling me the fridge is less then the iHome"
MGM:      "...yes."
ME:          "mmmh ok!? and your telling me all the other rooms that are up to date get a fridge complementary and we need to pay for one"
MGM:       "...yes."

 ALRIGHT thanks alot mgm...for nothing! Needless to say not a good experience next time me and my friends go to vegas (which we californians do) we will NOT be staying there!

*This review is primarily for MGM Grand Spa*

We had a wonderful stay at the MGM for my bosses bachelorette party and since we were on a little vacation a few girls treated ourselves to a day of pampering at the Grand Spa. The spa is like a place of its own located in the lower level of the hotel. Note that the massage prices are high, but they are definitely worth it. After checking in, you're shown the dressing room and given bath robes to change into. Then off to the relaxation room where you await your masseuse and hour and a half of pure bliss. Their spa facilities include spacious steam rooms, saunas, whirlpools and of course the relaxation lounge. My massage was wonderful and my messause made sure to focus on my lower back which has always been a problematic area for me. After all of our massages, the rest of the girls and I met back up and  relaxed in the whirlpools for a bit and had some snacks that were available to us. In the locker room, I noticed they had some pretty cool amenities for their patrons such as perfumes, hairsprays, and disposable toothbrushes made with ready to use toothpaste. We were at the spa for a good 3 full hours and it was such a relaxing experience. I wished we could have stayed the entire day!

Some twenty years ago (guessing here) the MGM Grand went through a massive remodeling that resulted in the green beast that you see now.  The thing is truly a huge hotel.  The problem is that it probably needs another one, because it's really looking pretty run-down now.

Carpets are frayed, (glass) doors are cracked or dirty, and overall it's just looking bad.  Even downtown at a number of hotels that are probably twice the age things just look better.  It's a shame.

Came here for a bachelor party, got the end hall suite, overall a positive experience :)

PROS:
-Good Room Service - we had someone plunging our crap filled, plugged toilet at 4am. Epic!!!
-Crazy Horse - the burlesque show was AMAZAZING!
-Tip the waitresses well at first in the casino and they'll never let your cup go dry
-Very close to the airport ($11 taxi)
-Across the street from Hooters
-Walking distance to a number of other good hotels\/casinos

CONS: 
-Far from the strip
-Bad luck at their casinos
-The late night guy at the elevators checking for your room key gets annoying

Older hotel. Service was pretty bad and staff made me feel like they were expecting tips for everything they did. If you complain about your room they pretty much just tell you too bad. My friend could see drug deals going down outside her window on the street. Stay somewhere else if you can.

I was a little disappointed in the room that we received upon check in. When you come to places like this you expect top notch service, and it was just a rinky dink room for me. I stayed here January 2 to the 4th this year so it was a little busy but we were accommodated very smoothly at customer service and in room service. My disappointment comes with the room itself, (king standard) room 4-525. The cable did not work in our room, we could not get a hold of front desk for hours so just said forget it. Our room in particular faced a wall, so if you are particular about where you want to be placed then be sure to ask for something that has a view of the strip. In addition, this room was just a bed and TV, no refrigerator or any other amenities that you would expect. Then we get charged a resort fee which seemed like a rip off because nothing was accessible the pool and all outdoor areas were closed for the year. Maybe it was my lack of reading the terms or just not willing to pay an arm and leg for better rooms but I have been at lower hotels with way more amenities than that. Any how, the term you get what you pay for is very accurate in this case. Ask a lot of questions prior to booking for a more preferred experience.

We stayed there early March 2015.  The rooms were extremely nice.  I was very impressed with the cleanliness and modern feel to the room.  

Every staff member we encountered was helpful and courteous.  The casino area was very clean and well maintained.  The wait staff seemed to be very attentive.

The Sports Book was my favorite location.  The staff there was great and it was a very relaxing atmosphere to watch (and gamble on) sports.

To be completely honest, I came to Las Vegas to party, gamble, and drink. So, I figured MGM would be a decent choice. I have always heard mixed reviews, but most people agree that it's at least a "party hotel". Knowing this, I booked a room for me and a few friends, so we could enjoy a fun weekend. 

The reservation got off to a rocky start. We had booked via "Hotels.com", but I guess this was a mistake. We had called a week before to confirm our reservations (2 rooms next to each other), and they person on the phone confirmed our request. However; when we got there they seemed to have no idea what we were talking about. We got to the hotel a little early, and asked if we could have early check-in. Confused, our clerk agreed. He told us to come back in about an hour to check-in officially. So, we checked out bags and returned an hour later. Between the time we asked for early check-in, and when we came back to the front desk they "lost" our reservation. They checked us into complete different rooms, on different floors. And didn't activate our cards. We had to stand in line a second time (hour long wait), just to have them activate the cards correctly. Thank goodness they took our "early check in fee" off, since it was almost "check in" time by the time we officially got to our rooms. Having such a difficult time to check in really didn't help our "party vibe". 

Once we got to the suites, we found them to be pretty blah. Nothing special, nothing fancy, just a boring room. Being that we came to party, and have fun, it wasn't really a big deal. But, don't expect you'll get the elaborate lifestyle at this place! Just a boring, average, hotel..no real "Vegas" feel. 

The reason I am giving the MGM 2 stars, rather then one, is based on the pool only. There were enough pools to make it not super packed, and the lazy river is pretty cool. Again, don't expect to "lounge" by the pool, this is a party hotel! Lots of drunks, and loud partying, but for what we were going for, I had a great time! The pool is a bit of a walk from the hotel rooms, and you have to walk through the casino and a few restaurants to get there, so that can be a bit awkward. 

The casino is meh. Same slots and games as every other hotel on the strip, with the same costs, but fewer waitresses. I sat by a slot machine for 45 mins, and the waitress only came by one time. My husband played craps for over an hour, and never saw a waitress. You would think the waitress would at least serve the table games, if nothing else? Based on the casino alone, this place is only a 1 star. The games aren't cheap enough to have no waitstaff. Might as well go across the street to play. 

Overall, I didn't have a terrible time, but I will not stay here again. There is nothing that makes it stand out above other hotels. Rooms are average, casino is average, service is poor. The pools are great, but it doesn't make up for every other aspect. With so many other great hotels on the strip, this one isn't cheap enough to justify paying the same (if not more expensive) price as other places.

This was my first time staying at the MGM. The room was such a disappointment. We stayed in the West Wing, which must be the economy rooms. The room itself is very small and the hallways feel like a dormitory. Our room had a small window, no bottles of water, no coffee maker, a very small sink area, and the shower took forever to get hot. Each day we were awakened by construction workers  at 5am. On the upside, the lazy river is a blast but get there early, because it closes at 6 and the pool at 8pm. Also the cost of a tube is $25.00 but you can bring your own. The highlight was  EMERIL'S great drinks and food. All in all, I guess you get what you pay for.

Beautiful Hotel and Casino with tons of things to keep you entertained!  Beware that they are under construction at the moment so there is lots of dust and loud noises, but nonetheless still very fun place to hang out.

I will NEVER stay at this hotel again! You make 11 charges on my credit card for well over $1200 for shit I didn't use and tell me you arent going to charge my card but you still did!! Now I have to call you guys for the THIRD TIME to get this sorted out! Figure it out!!

Will never stay here again. Overpriced (even for Vegas) - barebones room with no mini bar, no drinking water in the room, no coffee maker, and just two pillows (all these things usually come with a high end hotel). Our room had one tiny window, low ceilings, and was very dusty (dust was flying around in the bathroom and I couldn't even get my contacts on without getting dust in my lens). Our light was malfunctioning and wouldn't go off. The heating or air conditioning system is super loud, and not in a cute white noise way. The electronics are outdated. If you try and order water, you'll have to buy it and pay a delivery fee (so $10 water!!). Even though we were staying for just one night, house keeping came by at 8am (I don't know for what) waking us up. I called to give my feedback to guest services and they said that they were busy and so the price and service is to be expected. I really can't believe this is considered a 4 star hotel.

There are probably some decent things about this hotel, but I didn't notice them because I was so furious at the amount that I paid and the value and service that we received. I understand that it was a busy time for the hotel, but then hire some more staff or at least provide complimentary water for surge pricing. We had just stayed at the Cromwell the night before which was similar price, but infinitely better service and rooms, so the contrast was particularly appalling.

I've stayed at a few other hotels in Vegas during busy times and this is not normal value, service, and quality for the price.

Just go somewhere else.

For one of the older, more iconic hotels in Las Vegas, I was not impressed with their rooms or casino. The rooms were a bit dated, however I only stayed in a basic suite. 

The restaurants, however, are nothing short of amazing. With Robuchon's first ever US based restaurant residing next to the Ka Theater, there is a plethora of dining options. I tend to lean towards the gourmet dining scene while I am at MGM, because anything else would be a waste of time. 

There are also a few great bars located throughout MGM...so if you have time to kill and want a great drink at Vegas prices, make sure to hit up Centrifuge next to the Poker Room.

Beautiful remodel.
Smells delicious... bvulgari

Hakkasan opened and it is gorgeous. We nibbled different cantonese dishes. I really enjoyed the spicy wagyu beef, and the black pepper ribeye. Every veggie side dish is yummy

We saw deadmau5 and it is a great platform for DJs. I really enjoyed the entertainment portion, it really is a beautiful experience and it was nice that dinner rolled into the evening without lines, etc

There is a gift shop before the elevators that sells homemade large cupcakes for $4.00, but after 10:00pm they are $2.00. I usually love red velvet but the oreo is amazing

Do you like urine and facial hair scattered around your bathroom? .................... Neither do I. That my friends, is the difference between a 4 star and a 3 star review.

I booked a "New Grand King" room through Hotels.com. The room at first glance was beautiful. It was a recently re-modeled room, complete with a bright (and huge) vanity-style bathroom mirror (any gal's dream), a huge bed, and a big window with a city view. I loved it.... until of course I noticed (what I assumed was) urine stains all over the toilet, and (what I'm sure was) facial hair sprinkled all over the sink. Yay. If that's not sure to turn a smile into a frown then I don't know what is.

Other than that, we enjoyed our stay. I wasn't particulary fond of the bed pillows, but my boyfriend thought our bed was very comfortable. We didn't have any other problems with the room, and the service at the MGM Grand was excellent.

A word of advice: don't go to the MGM Grand buffet unless you like being disappointed. It was terrible. On the bright side, there is a small fourt court inside the Casino (with a 24 hr Mcdonald's for all of you late-night drunkies), in addition to Starbucks and a few other cafes and restaurants.

**WHEN CHECKING OUT: Don't wait in the insanely long line in the lobby. Use your room phone to call Guest Services and check-out that way (that's what we did, and it was a breeze). You can also check-out using your television.**

Overall, I'm not sure if I would stay here again.

A bit confusing to navigate the first night that we were here, but everything was absolutely amazing after we got a chance to put our things into the hotel room. By far, one of the best hotel rooms that I have ever stayed at. I believe we stayed in a tower spa suite (I'm a little unsure since we were offered a free upgrade from our original). Living room was separate from the bedroom and bathroom. I was so impressed by the amount of space, the view, and the cleanliness of our entire stay. Most of all, the bathroom was absolutely amazing. Marble floors and counters, a Jacuzzi tub, everything was great. My boyfriend and I had such a great time exploring and getting to know the area during our stay at the MGM.

As for the MGM itself, it's a convenient location from New York, New York. I also loved how active the hotel was during all times of the day. Wolfgang Puck's restaurant stays open 24\/7 (such a lifesaver at 4am) and it was literally down the elevator from our hotel room. There's also the Cirque de Soleil and Hakkasan.

The MGM Grand made our first visit to Vegas absolutely wonderful. We will definitely book a hotel room with them again in the future.

Room was not well maintained, TV didn't work and I made the mistake of asking the front desk for help...two hours later the repair guy is still in my room messing with the TV! Couldn't pay me to repeat this experience!

loved this hotel! the rooms were really nice and they had a lot to do in the hotel itself. The staff was great the pools were really nice but I wish you didn't have to pay extra to use them :-\/. Excellent food choices like wolf gang puck (amazing) but expensive. I highly recommend this place, it can be expensive to get a reservation so you have to do it at the right time to get a good deal!

I know this is a funny thing to say about a hotel in Vegas, but if you plan on sleeping AT ALL, do not stay here.

The trip to the MGM began with a dip in the lazy river. If you don't feel like having beer cans thrown at you by large groups of frat boys, do not swim here. If you are a large group of frat boys and want to find a pool where you can bring your beer in, never get out to pee, and party with your dude friends, while throwing beer cans at passing ladies (me), this is your spot!

You can also party LOUDLY the entire night through, trash your room, and run screaming through the halls. They love that at MGM! This is your place, for sure.

After we complained to the front desk twice at 4AM and again at 4:30AM that our neighbors were literally screaming and banging on the walls, they said (AND I QUOTE), "if you complain again, we're not going to do anything about it."

The next morning, we told the manager what the person on the phone had said to us. The MANAGER said, "well, ma'am, we cater to a certain type of demographic, and we do a fine business that way."

They comped us two beers for our trouble.

I have gone to Las Vegas so many times since I was 23 and every time I go out there I book through my MLife. I have stayed from all kinds of different hotels from the Stratosphere hotel (the first one I ever stayed at my first time in Vegas it was so much fun), to Luxor, Excalibur, Cosmopolitan, Planet Hollywood, Balley's, etc but literally nothing beats staying at the MGM!!

I have been coming here for years and I like to rotate between MGM and other MGM Hotels along the strip. I literally always have the best time coming to MGM.

**STORY TIME!!!**

I once came out to Las Vegas with my sister her husband and my friend (we used to be in the same cosmo school) she has two children and works and goes to school and I have two jobs and go to school; BACK TO THE STORY: we were in love with room service and our beds lmfao. I will try to find that picture of our room service because we were so sleepy we barely ate but I remember it was good except for my steak that I ordered I specifically asked for Medium Well and you can tell that shit looked fresh off the cow it was that bloody and red in the DARK!!! I don't tend to complain about my food especially if I am hella sleepy so guess what I didn't and I didn't eat it, I ate the other things we got and went to bed lol. && YES that steak was like $40 lmfao smh the shit you do in vegas I tell ya! 

MOVING ALONG!!

When I tell you my sister and brother in law kept blowing up our phones to come and gamble and have fun, we were so tired from the long day that morning and noon with a fat Tuesday (if you haven't had one don't lmfao they will put you to bed) that we went to bed at like 6pm NO LIE and didn't wake up till the next day like "Dam that was some good a** sleep!" LOL 

MY POINT IS....

Even if it' s just to relax and sleep MGM is the place I am telling y'all LOL!!! 
Everyone made fun of us "Who comes to Las Vegas to sleep" apparently I do because I barely rest when I am home so leave me alone lol. 

UPCOMING TRIP TO MGM IN JULY 2017

We are going on an upcoming trip to Vegas for my Brother in Laws birthday JULY 2017 #waitonit celebration and we are all staying at MGM AS ALWAYSSSSS. I will update my review with pictures in a month included from my boyfriend and I's Spa Suite and my sister and her husbands room as well. I also booked us 3 Pods for 5 people at the Pool so I'll update the rest in July when we go. We all gamble and dine there have room service etc so this should be a great update once we get back. 

STAY TUNED I'M SURE I'LL HAVE MORE STORIES TO SHARE LOL!!!

Overall, I love staying at the MGM when I come to Vegas. The hotel has everything you'd need without you having to ever leave. From the restaurants to shows and shops, the hotel truly has everything. The rooms are really nice as well. My biggest complaint about the rooms, though, is that they are so DIM. I literally turned every light on and it was still dark! With that being said, I would still return again the next time I'm in town.

I enjoyed my stay here with family.  The hotel room was very nice and the beds were very comfortable. The restaurants were over-priced (the quality of food and price were not a match). For someone that is a non-smoker, the hotel did a semi-decent job at controlling the level of cigarette smoke I could actually smell.

I wasn't too impressed with the array of gambling machines\/tables available. For a large hotel, I would have expected a little more, and I really don't gamble, at all. Not too impressed with the restaurants either. I think had I not been in Las Vegas for almost 5 days, I would have given it more stars, but by day 3, I was over its grandeur.

I stayed here for four days on a business trip. Although it's a beautiful hotel, clean, and conveniently located, there were problems.
 
I used the valet parking for part of my stay, but MGM charged me for valet parking for ALL nights of my stay. This is their POLICY. MGM's customer service representative told me that once you use the valet parking once, they ASSUME you use it for the other nights. Without actually verifying. That's not what the valet parking told me, and I specifically told them when I was stopping using valet parking.

I'm speechless.

On top of that, they really messed up on two things that are critically important.

1. I couldn't connect to the wifi in my room. I had to call their tech support four times. When I urgently needed to work (I was on a business trip), I couldn't get online for hours. Several times they had to manually add my computer to their network. When I still couldn't access the internet, I was told they were sending someone to my room to troubleshoot in person. 45 minutes later, I get a call to my room saying they are not allowed to service my computer in person and I have to call back the same tech support line I've been talking to. Fortunately I got online but only hours after I was supposed to. Although I may have been the exceptional personal who had persistent issues - it created major headaches for me.

2. I never had a sound night's sleep because I found their pillows very uncomfortable, both their feather pillows and foam pillows. Although I tried everything, including sleeping on towels instead of pillows, nothing helped.

Wouldn't come back here.

Stayed at the mgm August 2012 for my 21st birthday it was my first time visiting Vegas. We arrived at night and there was a line to check in but it went by pretty quickly. They gave us a room in the grand wing and we got a high floor.. We didnt get a good view the only thing we could see was the roof of a bulding but we didnt really mind since we weren't going to spend much time in the room. The room was pretty big, very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel is HUGE and the hallways are REALLY long! so make sure you wear comfortable shoes.. there are plenty of restaurants to choose from and if you dont want to spend much on food there are inexpensive restaurants at the food court.. we also spent a day at the pool and it took us a while to find a spot so if your going during the summer make sure you go early because it gets really packed! everyone at the hotel is very nice and friendly.. i read other reviews about people complaining about the smell of smoke in the casino but i didnt really notice it.. another complain i read was about the west wing that the hallway is really dark.. i didnt stay or get a chance to pass by so im not sure about that.. overall i enjoyed staying at the mgm and will definitely recomend it to others..i will be leaving tomorrow 04\/10\/2015 to vegas and will be staying at the mgm again.. hopefully i have the same experience i had last time i visited.. i will be updating my review once i get back :)

What a surprise!  I booked my room via Priceline.  I was given a closet of room.  I was told if you book through PL you will be provided the most "economical" room.  The window is covered by the bed, really poor experience..  Has anyone else had this experience?  I am a long time PL user and have wonderful experiences in the past.  As for the MGM, I expected much more from a 4-star hotel.  Never again for the MGM.....

Barely worth 3 stars. I've been in two star hotels that have more comfortable accommodation and options than this one. Be careful with the shops too. Chances are you can find what ever they're selling online for half the price. I did.

Hotel: 
I was underwhelmed by the hotel aspect of MGM Grand. I feel that the price was excessive, especially considering the "resort fee" which is just a way for them to advertise a lower price than you'll actually pay. Broken shower controls meant I was taking lukewarm showers my entire trip and the video checkout didn't work. Relatively minor inconveniences seem a lot worse when you consider how much you pay for them. Especially since I've stayed at other hotels in Vegas that are cheaper and nicer. 

Casino: 
The best thing about the MGM Grand Casino is they have a quarter-operated mechanical horse racing game that's one of the last few in existence. Even the "old vegas" casinos have largely phased out anything mechanical in favor of computer chips that require a lot less maintenance (and sadly it seems like many are also trying to replace real live dealers with computers as well, but that's a different story). Playing this mechanical horsie game is a lot of fun, and a treat since you know you may be one of the last people to ever play it. 

Craps is my game, but I found the craps dealers to be somewhat brusque and not nearly as much fun as the dealers I've encountered downtown at The Four Queens or Fitzgeralds. My friend was repeatedly admonished for the way he put his chips down, I incurred the wrath of a dealer for taking an extra second before shooting to make sure everyone had their bets in. Overall the atmosphere was much less fun than what I'm used to. Tipping the dealers did not seem to improve their mood. 

Other: 
We didn't really eat, drink, or do anything else at the MGM. 

Overall: 
I have more fun staying and playing downtown than I do on the strip. While MGM is probably a great place for lots of folks, it really isn't my type of place. And yeah, the lukewarm shower thing still bugs me.

My stay couldn't have gone any better. Great clean room threw out our stay and the best bellman Vic who made our leave that much easier. I had a hand full of bags and Vic was efficient, quick, professional. I can't wait for my next stay.

This is one of my most favorite places in all of Vegas. It's not too much of a party hotel like the Hard Rock or Planet Hotel, but it's not a stuffy old dump like the Sahara or Monte Carlo. 

I've stayed here over the years, and the one thing that keeps me coming back is the constant renovations and the consistent prices. I've never overpaid here, even when I visit during busy weekends (relative to other hotels-- gouging is inevitable during fights, conventions, etc.)

The rooms are nicely maintained, but if you want a real treat, pay a little more and get a room in the West Wing. Classier, swankier, and WAY cooler. Impress your friends, or a stranger. Oh wait.

ANYWAY, the MGM Grand Garden Arena is by far my favorite venue in Las Vegas. It's easy to access, and easy to exit. 

Parking at this hotel isn't SO bad. Valet or self. 

Plenty of show options. A plethora of dining options. I'm not a huge fan of the nightlife here, but you can always catch a cab, and head out to Tao, XS or Moon. No big deal. 

Bottom line, this is the place you want to visit in Vegas. Spend your money here. You'll be happy.

The MGM hold a special place in my heart for the many memories I've had here.  A perfect mix of classic and chic, it is the ideal spot for twenty-somethings to stay on the Strip.  There are plenty nice dining establishments (Nobhill, Seablue, Shibuya) along with the traditional Grand Buffet, swanky lounges (Rouge, Tabu, Centrifuge), the  meandering Lazy River (lots of attractive lushes), and beautiful rooms featuring black & white photos of legendary movie stars and marble bathrooms.  We had an amazing view of the Strip from the 25th floor, a chaise lounge, a California King monstrosity to come home to, and the housekeeping staff checks in a few times a day.  The tables are usually pretty good to me... I've had ample beginners-luck there.  Moderately priced and in a great location, the MGM Grand (named for the first 3 lions Metro, Goldwyn, & Mayer) has yet to disappoint.
This hotel is alright, nothing special. Kinda of an old feel. However the Hakkasan club is here! & very convenient walk to the room!

We had an awesome visit at the MGM!! We got the best deal thru the actual hotel with AAA discount! I made reservations in the west wing for a reasonable price! The reviews on Yelp were really bad for the west wing so I was worried! We arrived and did self parking but first checked in our luggage. We prechecked in from an email sent to us before leaving home. So when u arrive MOBILE CHECK IN is the way to go! Walked right up to the kiosks and scanned my reservation from my email and out popped our key cards. The room was perfect! The elevator comes right out to the strip practically! Right across from nyny, and right into one of the casinos Starbucks and bars! Anyways pool was amazing and Tap restaurant was so delicious! We ended up getting comped for over half of our stay for earning points with our M card! Great trip!

I'm staying at the MGM in the west wing now as I write this review I will update when my stay is over but for the most part there right about the low ratings 

Reviews about west wing hall ways with a old moldy smell %TRUE

Reviews about west wing rooms having low light lighting %TRUE
I order room service they told me it would be a 45min wait it was over a hour for room service come on

I loved my stay at the MGM Grand!!! My husband and I were there from June 14-19 which was Friday-Wednesday. It was definitely enough time to see Vegas, and some of our group left on Monday or Tuesday due to their schedules and they had a great time in those few days! I had never been to Las Vegas before so I have no other Vegas experiences to compare it to, but it was amazing! I cannot wait to go back. My husband and I went to Vegas for his birthday celebration and I had been planning our trip for months. We heard great things about the MGM and decided it would be a great place for our entire group to stay (we had about 15 family members and friends flying in from all over the country). My parents stayed even longer than we did and they rented a car for the week, which was great. We took it to go off the strip for dinner a couple times and to visit Fremont Street (not the best place, I went during the day but heard it's more fun at night). There is also a Haufbrau (spelling?) House, a German beer\/food place off the strip that my husband enjoyed going to! Here are the pros and cons of the MGM:

Pros:
*Lots of restaurants - we went to Rainforest Cafe, The Pub, McDonalds, the place next to McDonalds that had Krispy Kreme donuts (yum), the pizza place in the basement, the crepe place (delicious), and Diego.
*Great location - south end of the strip but not all the way down the strip, still close to NYNY, Walgreens, etc.
*Close to the airport
*Check in at the airport is available to skip the lines at hotel
*Huge hotel, tons to do!
*Good breakfast buffet, I went one time
*Convenience store by elevators, has everything you need!
*Elevators are fast (we used the ones behind a set of glass doors, go past the elevators in your wing on the ground level, they are even quicker and no lines!)
*Pools are amazing!! 5 pools total, lazy river, and outdoor pool club
*Clean rooms
*Blackout shade in your room! Woo hoo!
*Nice amenities in the room and bathroom
*Huge casino
*Cirque de Soilel show (Ka) that we has tickets to was right in the hotel, which was great!
*Monorail is accessible from inside the hotel, which was awesome

Cons:
*I was not treated nicely at Wet Republic (staff was incredibly rude to me)
*There is practically no shade at the pools, get there super early if you want shade!
*Lazy river was full of drunks, it was a little off-putting and felt like a cheap spring break in college
*You have to walk A LOT! Huge hotel.
*Long line to check out of hotel (we opted for the express check out)
*Valet parking took over 35 minutes to get our car on the day we were leaving for the airport. We had called ahead, too, but it still took that long! That was unusual compared to the rest of the week, but it happened on the worst possible day when we needed the car!
*Wi fi is horrible at the hotel
*TV in two of our friends' rooms stopped working numerous times
*The rooms smell pretty bad, not sure why
*Sometimes the room had not been cleaned by the afternoon hours, but it is a big hotel so that is understandable

Two tips: Do not move anything in the mini fridge, they come to check daily to see if you opened something. Luckily they did not charge us even though we were curious about all of the items!

If you are traveling with four people and staying in one room, only book the room under two names instead of four. You can ask for four room keys and then you solve the problem of getting everyone into the pool (everyone needs a key), while also saving money on the daily hotel charges for each person. I am not saying that we did this.... Just a tip.

3.75 stars!

Came here to their lounge area with a group of friends. The place has nice comfortable seating, and the drinksssss came pretty fast! I THINK (haha!) we stayed there for a good 2+ hours. As far as I can remember, it was a great place (but maybe the alcohol had something to do with it). Price is typical Vegas level.

The exterior and the casino floor are both beautiful... however, I am reviewing our stay at the hotel. We selected the Bungalo Queen Suite, which is one tier below the balcony suite. It was expensive, so I expected a beautiful room. We went during slow season, so I thought that the staff would have seen and accomodated my request for a view of the strip- nope. The room and bathroom were simply outdated. The bed was comfortable, but that's about it. It wasn't ugly, but you just don't get what you pay for. Oh well, we spent most of our time outside of the room anyway. I could have just stayed at Tropicana and saved a lot of money though...

Check out Shibuya restaurant while you're at the MGM, it was delicious and the service was excellent. Start with the Lobster miso soup.. but avoid buying their bottled water at all costs!! $8!!! x_x $8!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

One more note: every time I wanted to go to the pool, it was closed. They close it pretty dang early.. plus it's not the easiest place to navigate to.

Wow this place is humongous.  It's iconic.  You really can't miss the large green hotel and the large MGM Lion.  The location is on the corner with 3 other large and iconic casinos as well: Tropicana, Excalibur and NY NY.  And I don't like it.  It's sterile.  Big is not always better.  You have to walk miles just to get around here, and that's just inside.  A nice shopping complex is here, but doesn't compare to the Caesars Forum and the Venetian Grand Canal Shoppes.  Your hotel room, all towers are a million miles from the casino.  It's a shorter walk to California than it is to your room.  The large lobby is impersonal and crowded always moving slowly.  The car valet is among the slowest in Vegas.  The casino rewards programs, linked to many great Vegas casinos doesn't seem to reward you.  It's just like their slot machines; they think your money.  The only nice walking distance casino is NY NY, so even if it seems there is a lot to do, there really isn't.  Stay mid strip where there is more action and more choices of gambling and activities.

This is as good a place in Las Vegas.  Pretty top notch, very good restaurants and of course, nice casino.  This place rocks pretty much all night, lounges are open and you have Studio 54 nightclub inside to take you over the top.  Ok, yes, the important thing is that I win money here, that always helps a review.  If I lose, probably get a stinker review.  But, the shows are popular, right now, Cirque de Solei (KA) is playing there and its packed!!  Not bad considering they must have spent millions designing the set.  Tickets are well over 100.00 a person so that explains that.  Crazy Horse show is going on too, naked woman but a nice chorus act... reminds me of Moulin Rouge.  Guys will like this, yes!!!  Anyway, hotel is very clean and its a great environment.  Poker rooms are very nice.  And a good sports book so hard to beat this place....
The best hotel in Vegas other than he Trump hotel. Pleas stay here if your looking for a great casino.

I stayed here in Oct. 2016 and had a good experience. Customer service was great and hotel was clean. I recently stayed here for a bachelor party over super bowl weekend. i reserved 3 rooms and called in for a late checkout on 2 rooms. i just checked my bank statement and got charged for a late checkout on 1 of the rooms when the front desk said "don't worrry about it" when i called them that weekend. 

I just called customer service today and asked for a refund but the rep said she can't do that. i asked for a credit towards anything since i would like to stay there again in the future and she said "i can't do anything".  I believe the late charge is $20-25. Your're telling me you can't even credit\/comp $20??

First time staying at this location and I really enjoyed the whole stay. All the employees were polite and welcoming. I loved the casino, mall area, restaurants and all the entertainment it had to offer. I honestly didn't feel the need to go to any other hotel casino. I will definitely be back

I don't even know where to being.... Ive been to vegas many times now and this was my first staying at the MGM. I had high expectations of this hotel and honestly I was completely and utterly disappointed. first off our room was about the size of my kitchen at home...the wifi they provide you is a joke...256 kb and 1.mb for 15 dollars really...you guys make millions and cant even provide good wifi? second the customer service of the hotel is the worst ive ever experienced...no one seems to have the answer to anything and they act annoyed when you need something. hotel guests have absolutely NO PERKS to staying here either (wet republic, Hakassan) People should might as well stay at a better hotel and just come to these places. other hotels actually give you perks like Hotel guest lines etc. in the end I will NEVER EVER stay at the MGM again nor will I recommend anyone to stay here.

Looking back, I think our experience at the MGM Grand could have been better. 

We arrived in Vegas super early (don't ask) and waited until after 4p for an open room. We booked the Prima package, which has since changed pretty drastically, but at the time the package included a free room upgrade. Sadly, there were no rooms to upgrade us to, so we received a $50 credit. We stayed in the West Wing and the room was very small (smaller than Luxor and the Hilton). Fortunately, there weren't any noise issues other than random drunks in the hall, but be prepared to feel slightly claustrophobic at first. The bathroom was also small and there was very little primping space. Very modern feel to the room, but not great. 

We checked out KA and Crazy Horse Paris, receiving a discount on KA since we were staying at the MGM. Both were great shows (Crazy Horse was a little slow in some parts, but at least there were boobies to stare at.) One great thing about the MGM is that there is a discount ticket booth almost directly outside, which is how we saw Crazy Horse for half price. 

The Prima package was a great deal at the time because we received 2-for-1 drinks at four of the bars, saving us a great deal of cash to spend on the slots :) They also offered several deals for the restaurants (2-for-1 entrees) but we actually never ate at any aside from the buffet, which was NOT part of the deal and which I would NOT recommend. The seafood was NOT fresh. 

The Prima deal is no longer the awesomeness that it was, so I really see no reason to go back to the MGM to stay when you can get a larger, nicer room for the same or better price elsewhere on the strip.

I do love the Lion Exhibit, though.

This is the worst hotel I have ever been to. Check in to the hotel wasn't easy. We had to wait in the line for about 2 hours and a half and after all that we got to our room that was dirty from the previous guests, so disgusting! VERY RUDE STAFF AND GUEST SERVICE! My husband was playing blackjack tables he asked for a bottle water it took forever. And when the server got there he wasn't playing at the moment so she was like I can't serve u! You're not playing! And he had already lost $400. Above all that these people are crooks they will steal your money. I was over charged And I had to call 2 3 and 4 times and waste my time just to get my money back! In other words we had a terrible experience at this hotel and will never ever go back here! the first and last time :(

Ahhh.. our first time in Vegas..

Dec 07' ---This hotel has a big big casino! We had great service from the bell hops and our room was ready for us after checking in at the front. The lady at the concierge we were checkin in with was a little bitchy and was like irritated when she was explaining the policies and stuff.

We stayed in the Grand Tower and had a view of the strip and some hotels away from the strip. The room was comfy and clean. 

Since we went in December  I didn't get to see any of the lions at the Lion Habitat or experience the pool. I loved the casino and they had a nice bar I think it;s calles Tabu lounge was playing loud Hip Hop haha. Love that.  We went before Wet Republic was established also .. but overall we had a great time. I just wish this hotel was towards the middle of the strip!

I like picking up souvenirs and they had a lot of good ones to choose from. They also have a convenience store right by the elevators with everything u sould possibly need. 

We left the day of the boxing fight though - boo. I would stay here again.
Luv it.

The MGM Grand has gone through a nice renovation in their rooms, including the addition of Hakkasan restaurant and nightclub. I always wanted to stay here and I was not let down. It's so elegant... from the lobby to the building at night... a dark color with green highlights.

Check in: It was around 2pm on a Friday and I waited about 25 min. to check in. There was a long line but it moved quickly. There is flavored water available, a lion statue as a centerpiece, a cool big screen promoting their weekend events and playing Tiesto music videos... to dance to while waiting in line, haha! To check out, you can do it through your phone, from booths set up in the lobby, or on your TV. So easy, even a lion can do it! :p

Room: I booked a Grand King Room but got hooked up with a great view of the strip in the Grand Tower wing! The room was nice and clean. Their front desk was excellent in answering their phone, I only had to wait between 30 sec. - 1 min. every time.  

Hakkasan nightclub (Sunday): I came to see Tiesto on a Sunday\/Industry Night. It's an awesome club, it fits MGM look and feel very well. I was able to enter the club around 11pm by having a presale ticket you buy offline. Tiesto went on at 1am and the dance floor was packed! There were many tables surrounding the dance floor. I believe they should limit a number of people in the dance floor, it was crazy, but it was awesome when Tiesto went on... 3 hour set!

Traveling from MGM to other hotels?
MGM has a Deuce bus stop right outside their front doors, and a tram in the back of the hotel. The Deuce bus travels along Las Vegas Blvd. all the way to Downtown Las Vegas. The Tram goes to Las Vegas Hilton, I believe. The Deuce is $8 for 24 hours (great!). Tram is $5 a single ride and $12 for the day. The upside about the tram is that there is no traffic as it's elevated in it's own lane. If you take the Deuce, you may have to deal with the Blvd's traffic.

Stayed here for four nights for my brother's bachelor party.  I got a great deal on our room through the MGM's Guestbook Member promotion - around $100 a night for four nights over a long weekend.  All in all, it was a very good experience.  The hotel is huge, but the service is still attentive enough to hide the fact that there are thousands of rooms in this place.  The casino is pretty modern, has a lot of great restaurants, and reasonable minimum bets at the tables.  Location is a bit far south on the strip, but it's still a reasonably short walk from New York New York, Planet Hollywood, and Paris.

Das MGM Grand ist mit seinen 6.853 Zimmern eines der größten Hotels am Las Vegas Boulevard und in der Welt. Als ich 1994 in Las Vegas war, hatte das Hotel erst im Dezember 1993 eröffnet und war damals das Highlight am Strip.

Das Markenzeichen und Stilelement ist natürlich der brüllende Löwe und bis ins Jahre 1997 betrat man das Hotel und Casino durch einen Löwenkopf. Im asiatischen Raum sieht man den Löwen eher als Unglücksbringer, so dass man den Eingangsbereich nochmals extra umgestaltet hat.

Das luxuriöse Hotel lässt keine Wünsche offen. So gibt es beispielsweise eine riesige tropische Poollandschaft mit vier Pools, dem künstlichen Fluss Backlot River, Brücken, Fontänen und Wasserfälle. Darüber hinaus gibt es die Einkaufspromenade Studio Walk mit 10.700 m² und die Star Lane mit kleineren Shops.

Bekannt ist das Hotel aufgrund der gigantisch großen MGM Grand Garden Arena mit über 17.000 Sitzplätzen. Hier finden auch immer wieder größere Veranstaltungen und Boxkämpfe statt. Für den Hollywoodstreifen Ocean's Eleven diente das Hotel zeitweise als Filmkulisse.

Das Casino ist mit seinen 16.000 m² gigantisch groß und verfügt über 165 Spieltische, wie Blackjack, Poker, Roulette, Craps, Let It Ride, Baccarat, Keno, Sportsbook, Slots, Videopoker, Videokeno. Für die reicheren Besucher gibt es einenPlayers Club, den sogenannten "M life Players Club".

Ein wirklich riesiges Hotel, das mit seiner guten Lage punktet und Zimmer wurden 2011\/2012 aufwendig renoviert. Von der Optik ist es nicht ganz mein Geschmack.

Stayed at the MGM Grand Wednesday, July 8th through Saturday, July 11th in room 11133. We met up some girlfriends and requested adjoining rooms, so we also ended up with room 11135. This was great as we could roam back and forth.

I can't remember if I've ever stayed at MGM as an adult, but we only really picked this hotel since the girls booked a room here first and we wanted to stay in the same hotel. Rooms are standard Queen rooms. The beds were comfy and the bathrooms clean.

I like the pool area as they have a number of pools. It was never super difficult to find 5 chairs together. Both pool days, we ended up at the Producer's pool. We typically got to the pool around 9-10am.

Altogether, for 3 nights with resort fees and tax, we ended up paying a little under $600. Not bad for three nights which included a Friday night.

I've stayed at worst properties than MGM (remember Imperial Palace?) and better properties (I won't name the hotel, but it's the roommate's choice). MGM is kind of in the middle. I guess that means it's A-OK.

I always seem to gravitate to MGM for food and gambling.

Foodwise, is outstanding.
Wolfgang Puck, 2 Tom Colicchio, a Michael Mina, Emeril, and more.

There is decently priced gambling here, especially at off hours.
Nothing below $5 really.
Craps is usually $10.

I've stayed here a few times...
West Wing, which we really liked! I think it is being renovated right now though...
Recently stayed in a renovated King, which was really nice.
My only complaint about the bathroom, is there needs to be a second light switch for the bathroom. When you try to quietly go pee at 4am, and not wake up your friend, its hard when a blast of light comes out of the bathroom.

I've had packages delivered to their business center, which is right beside the lobby desks, which worked flawlessly. Make sure to put your name, and reservation number, and they can deliver it to the room.

Hooker watching is hilariously fun here...

The monorail is also an easy way to get around, especially if you want to get around the crowds. It is air conditioned too. Definitely key.

Wifi is worked into your resort fee. It is spotty, but works when you need to quickly look at something.

I stayed here this past weekend for three nights with my friend and had a great experience. I can't comment on regular room pricing as I booked a package deal through Expedia that made my stay extremely reasonable.  This was especially true considering the quality of accommodations as well as the amazing location and activities. Like any other hotel on the Strip, MGM Grand does have resort fees to the tune of about $35 a day. These aren't exactly fun to pay, but to me and my friend it was worth it to stay in the middle of the action rather than off-Strip.

Check-in and check-out took all of 10 minutes total, and every employee we interacted with was very pleasant. We even got a complimentary upgrade to a slightly bigger room with two queen beds. I'm not exactly sure why - maybe the desk clerk was just in a good mood?! The room was decently sized and very clean. It seemed new and modern, almost like it had been renovated recently. The bathroom was larger than most. Wifi was free and pretty fast.

You could realistically not leave the MGM and still have enough to do during a few days in Vegas! There's so much going on. You have Hakkasan (the nightclub and the restaurant), shows including Jabbawockeez, Ka, & David Copperfield, Brad Garrett's Comedy Club, the Wet Republic pool\/dayclub, five other regular pools, a spa, and a gym. There might even be more that I forgot to list. 

There are also many other shops and restaurants just off the lobby outside of the casino. My friend and I liked the food court because it had fairly reasonably priced food, at least for Vegas. You can get lunch or dinner for around $10 per person, and while that's not the cheapest food in the world, it's some of the cheapest you're going to find anywhere near the Strip. (Hint: try to find a tray with a paper placemat thingy on it before you order. They have buy one meal, get one 50% off coupons printed on them!) And let's not forget Fat Tuesday, the infamous daquiri bar with those plastic cups the size of a toddler that you see everyone walking around with. (Another hint: get some Jello shots or slushies and have them before you go to the pool parties on the weekend so that you don't have to pay $30 for one drink! You'll thank me later.)

I deducted one star because the walls are wafer thin. You can hear exactly what's going on in the rooms above and beside you. When someone is out in the hall talking, it sounds as if they are standing right next to your bed, which is obviously very inconvenient and frustrating when you're trying to get a good night's sleep. Further evidence that these walls are the equivalent of issue paper? There were a few times where my friend and I heard someone using their room key to enter a nearby room, and we could hear what was going on so well that it sounded like they were trying to come into our room, which was a bit scary.

To sum it up, I would stay here again because the location is so great and my overall experience with the room and amenities was satisfying. I just plan to bring earplugs next time so that I don't get woken up every time someone has a conversation anywhere near my room.

I have stayed at cheap hotels in Vegas (Luxor, Ballys and Excalibur) these are FAR better than our experience at MGM. A bunch of my girlfriends and I went this last weekend and it was the worst experience ever in Vegas. Not only did they put us on the 1st floor( yep folks the 1st floor where the casino is..right next to the slots) but they also refused to move us after we found a giant black hairball the size of my fist on the floor. It only got worse when there was dry urine found all over the bathroom. After multiple complaints and pictures they still refused to move us or accommodate us in any way. They said this was a non smoking floor but the room was filled with ashtrays and was filled with smoke. 

Save your $ because this was not worth it! I would stay anywhere else the customer service, the rooms, and the overall cleanliness of the hotel was terrible.
