First of all this is one of the largest hotels in the world. So if you like to keep to yourself this hotel may not mirror up with you unless you visit their exclusive mansions or lofts. 
Check in was extrememly fast Which is very important to me. 
Being such a large hotel they have multiple room types. I suggest asking for one of their newly remodeled rooms. 
The hotel has every type of restaurant you would want. Literally fast food to 5 star and everything in between. 
I like sports so i was happy to see a quality sports book. 
I also like to get a work out in. I found the spa and work out facility to have all i wanted. 
I could write on but, long story short MGM Grand had everything i need, friendly service, and a good value.

Free upgrade to the Grand Tower apparently makes a big difference. Our room was really nice, and almost everything we needed is right there in one big place -- including some of the best restaurants on the strip. We had a great time, and no complaints.
But beware of cob fees lurking around every corner. That doesn't just go for MGM though. I hear that pretty much every name in town is playing the same game -- squeeze that poor customer for every penny.
And if you happen to be from the Bay Area, be especially warned -- that "resort fee" that every place tacks onto your bill every day is paying for the Raiders so the locals don't have to..!
Stayed at the original in 1978, great place to stay and had great up grades! Class showroom too!

This is the first place I have ever been kicked out of and still given a 5 star review!

I love the MGM! They have my favorite game in Vegas! It's a mechanical horse racing game that takes and pays out in real quarters. I think it's the last one of it's kind in the city!

MGM has a real Lion habitat in the middle of the casino, one of the best clubs on the strip and 4 Starbucks so you can say "let's not go to that one, let's go to the good one."

Most importantly when my girl passed out in the girls bathroom and I went in to get her, the security guards could not have been more pleasant. We were escorted to the door with friendly banter and made aware that we were welcome back when not so intoxicated. 

I couldn't love this casino anymore!

My girls and I just came back from Vegas and we stayed at the MGM from Wed-Saturday. LOVED IT!! The service was great. I've stayed in three other hotels on the Strip and was often on hold for a long time before I could get through to guest services. MGM guest services respond immediately and are very accomodating. 

Our room was comfortable and the beds were awesome. The pool also ruled! We had a lot of fun floating down the lazy river and lunching at the Cabana Grill. I wish their food court with McDonalds, Nathans, and some great pizza place was open 24 hours. 

I would definitely stay here again!

Awesome facility, lots of great restaurants and shows. 

The bad: 30+ min to check in, are you kidding me? Not acceptable.

Big hotel. We stayed on the 28th floor at the Grand Towers facing NYNY. Location is a bit more south than we hoped, but the weather was nice for walking. 

We checked in on a Thursday around 12pm and it took about 10 minutes. The room wasn't ready so we checked our luggage and off we went. We got a text around 3pm that our room was ready.

Double queen room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was big and clean as well, but you might want to ask for more amenities like soap\/shampoo. Free wi-fi was fast and steady too.

There are tons of restaurants including the food court so there's enough options for everyone. This is a great place to stay, but next time we might look at a hotel right in the middle of the strip!

BEWARE! CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD STATEMENT!! We booked 3 rooms at the Grand Tower and used express checked out on 11\/24. We only received one invoice out of three rooms. Guess what, 2 days later, credit card statement shows more than $100 extra. The front desk admitted that they put a censor in the mini bar area! As soon as you lift it up, regardless you use it or not, you will get charge. WTF!?!? Check the f***ing room, we only lift it up to look at it, didn't damage nor open the packaging.

I will never stay at this hotel again just because you created trouble for guests to speak with representative about these stupid charges.

This place is so over rated.  It started off pretty crappy for the fact that I was charged $15\/per day resort fee, which I was not aware of.  I know it's not much, but if you are staying there for almost a week, it's pretty costly.  
They didn't have a King size bed either...  Then they promised us a room with a great view- which was not very impressive.  
Order anything through room servie- expect to wait--- let's say FOREVER.
But I guess that's what I get for staying at MGM instead of somewhere like Bellagios...  The crowd at the hotel is a very odd mix as well... But I guess you get what you pay for...

I wouldn't go back here and I would not recommend this place...

This is the first time that we have stayed at MGM Grand hotel.  We stayed there for 3 nights, and we enjoyed it here.  The room was very spacious, modern, tastefully decorated, and well-lit.  The elevators ran very smoothly and efficiently even with a huge convention happening the same three days that we were there.  According to the gentleman who checked us in, he got us a room in one of the newer towers so we were fortunate.  Our view was of New York New York, Tropicana, and Excalibur.  We only used our car once during our stay here because the MGM is walking distance to everywhere cool on the Strip.

My only complaint is that we did not win a single penny in their casino!  Oh well, I'd stay here again anyways.

I just got back from 4 nights at MGM and it was HORRIBLE! I've been to Vegas 30+ times over the years, and I have stayed at just about every hotels on the strip and this was the far WORST experience. After our 1st night, my sister and I woke up with bug bites all over our body. So they switched us to a different room. So after dinner and little bit of gambling, as tired as we were, we had to pack up and go and unpack at our new room. We woke up with more bug bites at our NEW room. Our sheets and blankets were dirty and the towels smelled funky. Plus, when we checked into our new room, the lights didn't turn on so we had called the maintenance guy. Our room had two queen size beds and one of them had a dent in the middle, sort of like a V-shape. My sister woke up with a terrible back ache. So we went back to front desk 2nd night in a row. The supervisor on duty was Ms. Buchner and she was a total bi*ch and said we maybe having allergic reaction. WTH? She didn't want to see our pictures of dirty sheets or our bites. She was unsympathetic, cold and unwilling to really do much. She refused to comp the room so I had to insist that she needed to go someone above her which she reluctantly ended up doing, and we moved AGAIN. But we both woke up with more bites! At this point, we just gave up. We weren't going to move again. Our last night, my sister ended up sleeping on the floor. The bed was too uncomfortable. We were leaving the next day anyway. But in the middle of all the chaos of moving to different rooms, my sister had left her bathing suit in one of the rooms and couldn't get it until the next day after 3pm because they were spraying the room. So one of our days at the pool was ruined. When we were checking out, as I had expected, the bill wasn't right. They didn't comp our room for the night they were supposed to. Kaylene, one who was so rude and bi*tchy to us did not note anything in the system so I had to explain everything all over again. 
This was the worse experience I've ever encountered at any hotels!! We've had a better experience at less expensive hotels like Treasure Island. Wow.... I've never thought I can be treated so badly by a customer service representative and the rooms can be that filthy! I recommend everyone to stay away from MGM!
Love the MGM! We stay there every time! The service is great and everyone is extremely helpful and friendly! Will definitely stay here again!

Wet republic (the daytime pool club) is nice, especially if you can get a Cabana. When my friends and I went a few years back, we were lucky to be put in a cabana for free with grey goose & snacks (although there were other people using this cabana too, and idk if we just took their drinks and food lol). I really liked the mini pool that is by the cabana area and its super nice to have a large flat screen tv & bed to lie in when you get tired of the sun. 

The room at MGM is alright. They've been renovated the past few years, & the beds are comfy but the MGM itself is pretty old... and not the most poppin' hotel. It's also far from the larger hotels & casinos so you're gonna have to taxi to those places unless you get heat stroke from walking in the Summer. I would recommend getting a hotel in a more central part of the strip.

Also, there are no good clubs nearby or inside MGM. Stay somewhere more central!

I had an expensive tiny room that was perfectly placed in the tower near Starbucks\/sports book.  No coffee in room, so this room near the elevator allowed me to arrive at either at Starbucks or on the strip in less than a minute.   

Walking inside the vast MGM is a pleasure.  They have multiple excellent restaurants.

Jonathan and the front desk very calmly and pleasantly ensured me that my concerns would quickly be addressed.  Soon the front desk manager, Trevor Rogina came out and showed me the error I thought MGM had made was in fact mine. I was impressed how professional and nice these guys were and still made some adjustments to show good faith when in fact they did not have to do anything. Am I going back to MGM again? Absolutely, I already booked with Trevor to take my wife to Andrea Bocelli's concert. MGM staff rocks!!!!

This was a nice hotel maybe ten years ago. Last time I was there guaranteed I will not be back. I have never encountered such surly and unprofessional staff as at the hotel and for what they charge you'd be better off (and better treated) at any local no-tell motel. We paid in advance for tickets to one of their shows and then when we showed up they refused us admission because one of the men in our party was wearing (very upscale, not denim and not short) shorts! This is July in Vegas. It was over 100 degrees! Then they refused to refund our ticket money. I smell a scam, as I have seen this comment in other reviews as well. There is no dress code posted on the web site or anywhere else, and as it happens, the gentleman in our party refused entrance...TO A FREAKING FREAK SHOW...is a professional model who is often paid to attend high-end parties in NY to add high end atmosphere. In short, I will never again set foot in the MGM Grand or any of its affiliated properties. Fortunately I had paid for the tickets by credit card, so when refused a refund I just contacted my bank and stopped the charge (and suggested they take a look at how many other people MGM tries to rip off in this manner). The Excalibur is classier, cleaner and friendlier. That is NOT a compliment.

the reason why I give 1 star is because the KA theater popcorn counter. I got a large coke and a small popcorn, when I sign the receipt the cashier threatens me that if I don't give him the tip he will leak my credit card information and the original word he said is: file this part to avoid credit card fraud trouble." Since when the tip is mandatory, and you have to pay tips to someone who is it not even serve you. I mean do you pay the cashier in a movie theater? I don't think so. I think the main problem is I have a Asian face and also a tourist, i won't believe he will say such words to a white people, shame on you!!! RACIST

I would love to give this place 4 stars, but I just couldn't...My husband had booked us a night here for a concert that we were going to attend, later that night.  While making reservations, he opted to pay an additional $20 for early check in (9 am).  We arrived at the hotel around 8:30 am and they told us to get back in line at 9 am.  Therefore, we decided to walk around the hotel to kill some time.   Thirty minutes seems so long when you're waiting for something...9 am finally arrives.  My husband got back in line and was told that there are no rooms ready yet and the early check in is just an option and there's no guarantee that we can get it.  Bummer!  My husband was told that the hotel would call us when a room was ready so we ended up giving the bell boy our luggage so we can walk around the strip.  After we ate lunch, I was getting really tired so we decided to walk back to the hotel to see if there was a room available.  It was 2:30 pm.  A room was finally ready.  Our room was great.  It was big and clean.  I was so happy...until 3:30 pm.  Someone knocked on our door (an employee wanted to refill our mini bar) and interrupted my nap.  Oh well, we left the room for dinner.  When we checked out the next day, the hotel had charged us $20 for early check in.  I was pretty upset that they charged us for early check in (30 minutes before regular check in) but the room was nice so it didn't dampen my feeling about this hotel.  However, next time, I would like to stay somewhere closer to the middle of the strip.

Wish I could give no star if there was.... so basically I reserved a room but they have sent me an email saying my room has been canceled because I did not confirm the reservation. So I booked somewhere else then 2 days later they have charged me full price.... not happy at all. They cancelled my booking and charged me for everything. I will never book in mgm grand again in my life

What can I say! Came back to Vegas Jan 11 to get away from the cold up north and I wasn't disappointed! Had a wonderful time as always... Ate at my favourite restaurant TAP not once but twice!  Took in a meet and greet with Carrot Top and saw his show for the 4th time... Thanks to such a wonderful stay and looking for my already booked trip in May!! Maybe you could surprise me with something special this trip :)

The rooms are nice here...probably in need of a renovation but the price is definately worth it! Its in a good location with great restaurants and shops. I guess m life partnered up with hyatt, so now you can get hyatt rewards...

I travel to alot of hotels to do on location tans, this is my least favorite hotel.  Its always crazy, can hardly valet.  The people are young and usually drunk... if you have to park in the garage and walk in because valet wont take you .. its a mile hike into the damn hotel.  UGH !!
The rooms are not bad but its big and crowded .. not fabulous by any means

MGM is a decent place to stay if you can get a good rate... Check-in\/out is a waiting game, as with any other hotel on the Strip. My room was actually much nicer than I expected, and I especially loved the blackout shades. They really work!... Internet was fairly fast, the minibar selection is good, and I was fortunate to be on a quiet floor.

Their higher-end restaurants were also better than expected, except for Fiamma- blecch

Negatives included boring, often rude blackjack dealers, poor cocktail service in the blackjack area, very little shade available at the pools unless you purchase a cabana (and, you know, it's HOT in the Vegas sun... there was also very limited waitstaff working the pools), the room air conditioner couldn't keep my room cool, and huge crowds everywhere

Overall, if you like staying on the Strip, this isn't a bad place. There are better hotels, and there are certainly worse places

Just a brief note to describe five wonderful days and nights at the MGM Grand. Room was huge and clean. Food was great. Brad Garrett's comedy club was hilarious. Everything you need in one spot in Las Vegas. Doc.

During my stay in Vegas I stayed 4 nights at the MGM! My experience there was wonderful. From the moment I stepped into that hotel, the hint of vanilla hits my nose and well I was in heaven. They've done a great job of cleaning out the air of any smoke smell.   Front desk was friendly, helpful and quick to check us in. They do need some improvements on their room service....it was alright. I understand for the convenience, room service can be pricey but the food quality wasn't worth it! You're better off going down stairs to get something to munch on.   I must say they do have some great black out curtains, after a night of roaming the casinos and clubs you can sleep -in and not have the sun wake you. There were quite a few pools, good to relax, and Wet Republic where I had a blast. Overall, my stay was great and I will return!

I think the MGM Grand doesn't get enough love from reviewers. The place is classic. Actually, if there was a half button, i'd give them 4 1\/2 stars. They're a bit outdated in my opinion. From the furniture to the appliances. I haven't seen such an old TV in 5 years. Come on MGM, replace them. O and the fridge is way too tiny to fit ANYTHING.

Now for the good stuff. It wasn't even Memorial Day or Labor Day but Vegas was super packed. One bed was going for $250 and up per night if you're looking for a place on the strip. With rates like that, its great if you know someone, and know someone we did. Ended up getting the Marquee Suite which are those rooms at the very end of the hallway with double doors. YEP!! 3 girls in a 1500 sq ft suite. What a waste dont you think? The view was fabulous, and so was the place. Wall to wall windows, with a lovely living room dining room and bar separating the two master bedrooms. But move away from the big stuff, and its the little things that make the biggest difference. Marble tops, robes, sandals, 2 beautiful bathrooms with a spa tub. We used those bathrooms to death. Im sure housekeeping freaked out seeing the mess a couple of girls are capable of. 

Catch a showing of KA, look at some LIONS, stop by the pool with their LAZY RIVER or go to WET REPUBLIC, shop, eat, gamble. They may be outdated but the fact that they do boast some of the best shows as well as parties should be something. I'm inclined to say I am a bit biased, been coming here since I was just a wee tike with the fam and got nothing but good memories back then too.

Another little hiccup, the day we were checking out turned out to be a bit of a b*tch since a thousand other guests were leaving as well. Called for a bellhop who never showed. Whatever, their loss on tips anyway.

I have come close to writing reviews on several occasions but never put pen to paper as they say... But I can't stay silent on this one.... It's to late for me but my only peace will be knowing I have saved some other poor soul... I am actually in my MGM room now. It's 830am and I can't sleep because the loading dock and garbage bin that reside outside my window have other plans. I am staying here for 4 nights for a birthday and anniversary with my girl. I booked the room two months ago and thought it would be nice to work some overtime and upgrade the room to a "tower spa suite" (pay close attention to the word "tower" there). We checked in yesterday and we're excited for our special weekend. Until we got to the room. I take issue with calling something a tower suite when I'm literally on the second floor... I have a view of a dumpster and a dead tree. I can't see the strip but I know it's there because I can here a jack hammer and traffic... I'm pretty sure the taxi line is behind the room. To be blunt .... This room shouldn't even be a room. And if they insist it is . They should not be so misleading... Save yourself the pain and tears in your wife's eyes... Stay at a motel 6 and get a good nights sleep. Unbelievable MGM. And yes I did talk to the staff and try to change rooms.

My boyfriend and I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend.  I would say that our experience there was OK, but not quite what we were expecting.  

1)  When we checked in, they recommended that we "upgrade" to a room in the West Wing.  After walking what felt like at least a 1\/4 mile to get to our room (through a very dark, narrow hallway), we got to our tiny room.  There was only one small window over the bed, and the room in general was very dark.  We then walked the 1\/4 mile back to the front desk and requested a room change and we were put in a Grand Tower room (which is what we had reserved in the first place).  I will say that we were very happy with our Grand Tower room.  It was somewhat basic, but very clean and I loved the Jasmine scented bath products.

2) I felt like we were on Spring Break, except that we would have enjoyed that ten years ago.  Picture people running through the halls at 2a.m. screaming,  wasted people hanging out in the lazy river drinking (and I am assuming not getting out to pee.  ew!), it got old very quickly.  The worst part was that I felt like it was no place for the few families that we saw who were trying to actually use the lazy river for it's intended purpose.  Little kids really shouldn't have to fight their way through a crowd of wasted dudes to enjoy the pool!

3) I did really love the restaurants.  We had an amazing dinner at  Nobhill Tavern, and great sandwiches at  'wichcraft

4) I liked the location, we were able to get to the tram that takes you from the Excalibur to Mandalay Bay pretty quickly, and we took the Deuce to the Bellagio which was also very quick and easy.

5) The staff was very helpful and polite.  Everyone we met was very courteous and friendly.   Especially a nice man on the housekeeping staff who explained that the red dot next to our room number meant that our window was designed for helicopter pickups in the event of a fire!  He told us not to jump heh heh.

MGM Grand Las Vegas

I used expedia.com to book a package deal for our vacation to Las Vegas. I wanted to stay at one of the better hotels, so I selected the MGM Grand Las Vegas which had a high star rating. The package deal I chose included five days, four nights, and airfare roundtrip for two people. At the time of booking, I didn't have any familiarity with Spirit Airlines, who was the airline for this trip. See my review on this horrible carrier on Yelp. The package price was a great deal, so I initially thought until Spirit Airlines hit us up for additional undisclosed fees close to the trip date.

I should have done a little more investigation about the wing, room, and amenities at the MGM Grand before booking the trip. I'm not so sure I would have canceled the trip, but at least I would have been more prepared for what to expect from the largest single hotel in the United States, with 5,124 rooms.

I was somewhat concerned when we arrived at the hotel by taxicab from the airport, and the porter didn't greet our cab and offer to take our luggage inside for us. We checked in, got our room keys, and took the special elevators for the West Wing to the 13th floor. After stepping out of the elevator, we walked into a circular area with hallways leading in about six different directions with signs indicating a range of room numbers. I didn't see a sign with our room number on it. Our room number was higher than any number shown, so we went to the hallway with the highest number thinking that maybe they extended the rooms and didn't update the sign. These hallways were long, incredibly long; about a block long. While walking down the hall, about halfway, the carpeting, wallpaper, wall lamps, and decor changed. It was similar to stepping from a modern, art deco hotel into an old dingy, non-renovated hotel. We got to the end of the hall where the numbers stop just short of our room number. I asked a housekeeper about the room number, showing her my key card holder with the room number on it. She spoke little English, but enough to tell me that the room number didn't exist. She told me that I would have to go back to the desk to inquire about it. I told her that I was not walking all the way back down that hall and all the way back through the casino to the desk for a problem they created. She tried to contact the front desk on a guest's telephone and was unable to get through to the desk. Finally, I used my cell phone to call the hotel directly and spoke to an agent. I explained the dilemma. She looked up my account and told me that I was in another room. The original agent scrawled the number on my key card holder so that one of the numbers looked like another number. I was beyond frustrated. We walked back down the hallway to our room.

When I opened the door, I saw a tiny room; 350 sq. ft. It held a king-sized bed, which was very comfortable, firm, the way I like it. There was a small desk, lamps on either side of the bed, a floor lamp, a TV, and a bathroom area where there was a tiny vanity with a pedestal sink, narrow shelf, a toilet and shower stall separated by frosted glass and frosted glass doors that didn't close all the way and banged shut when you let go of the doors.

It's not that it mattered too much since the only thing we were going to do is sleep in the room; somewhere to crash. Our time was going to be spent on the Strip and doing activities. However, I expected a little more for a 4.5 star rated hotel.

I visited all the casinos in Vegas, but when I lived in California and made trips to Vegas regularly, I stayed at a timeshare so I really cannot rate other hotel rooms. I'm giving MGM Grand a 3-star rating based on the ineffective porter service, poor writing skills from the desk agent, the incomplete renovation of our wing, and the poor taste in design of the bathroom area.

Booked the west wing King. The room is so small it's clear that it is an add on to the older hotel. The room is so far from the elevator it's almost unbelievable. Our entire hall smelled like marijuana. We were set to receive a $50 resort credit and was told via phone it was for room service as well. However when we arrived we were told only certain locations would accept our resort credit and room service was not it. Such a disappointment.

I'm staying here for a work conference so I didn't even have to deal with the resort fees or parking fee, but that would be obnoxious if my work didn't pay for it. I submitted a dress to have it dry cleaned and they lost it! I was supposed to wear it on the tradeshow floor for the consumer electronic show but now I'll have to find another outfit. On top of all of this, they charge you for every single little thing that they possibly can. $50 just to use the mini fridge in the room? That's absolutely absurd. MGM will never have my vote. 5 star prices and 2 star service, at best.

I guess MGM leaves something more to be desired when it comes to casinos on strip. Located at almost one end of the strip I won't count this casino hotel as one of the most upscale ones of the strip. The hotel is big and one can easily get lost roaming around here.It is the third largest hotel in the world and largest hotel resort complex in the United States. They have two lions inside the casino close the theater where David Copperfield has it's magic show. Though now the lions have been removed because of ongoing renovation of the casino.

As compared to the newer casinos on the strip this place does look little out of fashion and worn out. They have little bit of everything here right shopping to some nice restaurants.It also houses numerous shops and night clubs, restaurants, and the largest casino in Clark County. We tried the buffet here which was very nice. 

In my opinion I would just come here to see shows and gamble but would stay at a different  casino on the strip.

I got a great deal on a room here for Labor Day. The rooms were nice, although the walls were paper thin. Our neighbors were partying their a$$es off in their room and I had to call security. Sorry- go to the club, come on now.

The hotel and casino are gigantic- my mom kept getting lost. While that was amusing, it got annoying trying to explain to her that the "Shakin' Bacon" slot machine was near the lobby, and not near one of the two Starbucks.

There are a bunch of nice restaurants in the MGM Grand and the pool is pretty nice. Overall, I'd stay here again if it was cheap and if they turn the AC down a notch. Let's just say that everyone's headlights are on in the MGM Grand.
Really like this casino, it is a little more open and they had more tables going during the week.

First time staying here. Hotel was nice. Rooms were nice and clean and the beds were comfy, though my pillow was terrible. I think the amenities here are pretty good as well. The lazy river at the pool is awesome and there are lots of cheap and fancy places to eat.
Gambling is too rich for my blood though. No tables below $15 at any time on the weekend.

Clean room, and as far as casinos go, nice. I like the fact that their signature scent (all the big casinos have them) didn't gag me.
Big complaint: Our room was in the West Wing.  It was built way back when and renovated. They didn't bother to add a new elevator shaft when they connected the new MGM to the West Wing. So you walk for about 15 mintues to get to your room, and then 15 minutes back.  
The ceilings are really low- it's like walking into a fading perspective drawing.  There are mirrors at the end of the hallway- so it looks like you'll be going on forever.  After hiking the length of the West Wing to the elevator, we had to hike back again on our floor to get to our room.
The interior of the room is quite modern- glass and mirrors abound.  Heavy glass doors on both the bathroom stall and the adjacent shower.  (No tub). 
My favorite feature was the lighted and magnified make up mirror. 2nd favorite feature was the shower.
The room has a TV with a DVD player.  
Bed was comfy- but I got the feeling that it was really old. It had what seemed to be a down matress pad on top of the matress.  Were it not for that, the bed would likely have been really uncomfortable.

I stayed here a couple times before. This hotel is okay. I just didn't like the fact how it is at the very end of the strip and takes a long walk to get to the middle of the Las Vegas strip. The only thing I love about MGM Grand is the lazy river! SO FUN! Otherwise, I really have nothing good or bad to say about this place. 

So in my opinion, stay at another hotel and find a way to sneak into the hotel's pool during the day.

My wife and I stay here in January for the first time, we had a good time there. From the very beginning front desk was helpful and nice. We did not wait to check in. The room was very clean and had a nice washroom, very spacious. The casino was very fancy this is the only smoking area of the hotel. The hotel in general is luxuries and they have good prices for the history they have. I'll give the hotel a 9 out of 10.

I've always been a fan of MGM Grand.  This has always been the place i've stayed at whenever my family would come to Las Vegas.  BUT finally i've been able to actually gamble and enjoy drinks.  I like being able to sit at a slot machine, win money AND get drinks.  The drinks were definitely worth it, they weren't watered down, and they actually tasted like it had alcohol in it.

I'm commentng soley on the poker room. Outstanding!  Chairs are some of the most comfortable in Vegas.  Sure, Wynn's chairs\/tables are nice, but who can enjoy them when cramped so tightly with a million other players. MGM's room is spacious and classic.  Tables are all automatic to move games along.  Service is quick and frequent.  MGM also offers a poker room rate for frequent players or those comitting to playing a certain number of hours\/day.  Chips are nice and heavy- easy to shuffle\/do tricks with.  Dealers are nicely chatty but efficient.

The hotel has been renovated and the rooms are nice and comfortable, the only issue I had was the shower, there was absolutely no water pressure whatsoever. It felt almost impossible to wash my hair! I had to wait forever for the water to rinse out all of the shampoo! Oh parking can also be a pain if there is a special event going on (valet parking becomes full, and self parking is a nightmare).

Stayed here over the weekend. It was a Yelp discounted rate and I think they might have made a mistake because our room for a night was $10 and the second night $100 something.

Anyways, the hotel itself was ok. The lobby had no sitting area so you kind of just stood there while your friends checked in. 

Our rooms had broken sheers so it didn't go up. It was a remodeled room but it still smelled really bad inside like old smoke. I hated the shower because 1) it was short and 2) no water power. I like my showers to have water coming out strong. That is the only way I can feel clean to wash off the smoke of vegas.

Would I stay here again? Probably not considering all the other options but for the price we got, yes.

Internet wasn't too good here either. Although it was "comp" it was pretty spotty. Going to the pool from the room also was like a journey. Too bad no elevators close for guests.

For all the ones who had a bad experience that's to bad:(. I read reviews before we went and got nervous but was quickly relaxed as we checked in!  After a week here and going to every single casino on the strip I was always happy to get back to our casino. MGM. Our room was WONDERFUL exactly what we wanted. Strip view. Amazing staff from the housekeeping, front desk, room service etc. Will only stay here when we go back!!! Thank you MGM and for anyone stressing about it. DO NOT. You will be wasting your time and energy. Best place to stay in Vegas!!!

I stayed here with a group of friends for my 30th birthday this year and was very pleased with our decision to go with this hotel. 
We got a really good deal so we couldn't turn it down! As my first time in Vegas, it was a great hotel to stay in to be able to appreciate the experience. From what I saw in nearby hotels, the casino is one of the better ones too. 

I know I don't have much frame of reference to the other hotels in Vegas, but the pools were amazing (hello, lazy river!). The hotel is close to many others to walk nearby and right on the strip, while only being 10 minutes from the airport. 

I highly recommend doing the IV infusion if you partied too hard the night before like I did on my 30th birthday! Overall just an awesome experience. 

The only con we experienced was the fact that our rooms were not together when we were expecting they would be. We had 3 rooms, and ours was in the west wing while the other two were in the Grand Tower, so it made for a little bit of a haul. Our room was much smaller than the other two couples got and as the owner of a king sized bed, I know the bed was a little smaller than a standard King. 

There are a ton of great restaurant options and food court and the breakfast buffet is pretty solid for only $19. Overall, I was very pleased and would recommend the MGM.

Recently I stayed in a "Stay well" room.I really liked that room to say the least but i will outline my experience below:

Check in- Private check in in the Stay well lounge helped me save time by skipping that huge line. There was complimentary water in there as well. I think that was great,

Room: The room was wonderful, Stay well has a lot more amenities such as the scent cube for aroma therapy, the air purifier, the Vitamin C infused shower, the wellness lighting......It was very comfortable. So comfortable in fact that i booked another room tomorrow just to relax. i LOVE the fact it includes complimentary access to the Grand Spa, not many hotels do that anymore so i really thank MGM Grand for doing it.

Buffet: Its gotten MUCH better over the years, the food was very good.

Grand Spa: it was so relaxing, the facilities were well maintained and it really was a joy to relax there.

I cant wait to be back tomorrow for my Stay well trip Round #2!

I have been to Vegas at least 15 times and stayed at many different hotels and this by far was one the worst experiences iv ever had. Half the time I travel with my emotional support dog, she comes with me because I have sever panic attacks, anxiety, and high blood pressure. I checked into the hotel with no problem explaining my situation to the front desk, which the wait to check in was well over an hour it was completely ridiculous. During the duration of my stay I was stop multiple times by security asking me why I need my dog, they were very rude and pushy. One security guy even corned me and demanded I give him a full explanation of my medical issues just so he can decide if I have a valid enough excuse to be allowed to be in the hotel. It was insane, I have never been treated so badly. It's actually illegal to ask someone what there special needs for a emotional support or service dog is. I felt so violated, the whole stay I felt very uncomfortable I couldn't relax. I was harassed so many times I lost count. I do understand they have to do there job in making sure I am legit with my dog but come on, they obviously don't have there shit together. What they should have done when I checked in is to send a memo to the security people telling them that there is a service dog in the building or maybe give me a special tag to attach to my dogs vest so they don't have to approach me every 20 feet. There was a few staff members who were very nice to me but generally it was a horrible experience and when I notified the front desk when I checked out that I wasn't happy with my stay, they said," I don't know what to say...sorry....". Really?! That's all you have to say after I just spent almost $2000 in your hotel. I straight up told them I wouldn't be coming back and they had no compassion or sympathy which was shocking considering I was very upset about everything and almost in tears. Don't stay here if you travel with an emotional support or service dog.

I was very disappointed in the MGM. It is old, extremely run down and not maintained. I would recommend looking  into alternatives if possible. Our room was missing a switch wall plate as well as some trim on the tile floor. The shower head was clogged and broken, and it leaked into the bathroom. Speaking of the bathroom, there is zero privacy so I hope you are traveling with people that you are very close too, if not it will lead to awkward situations. Best part were the pools, but they buckle and dime you for everything, by that is how all of Vegas is now a days.

The Palms casino horrible experience cancelled our reservations "due past reservation issues" . I was nervous first time staying here but everything went smooth staff handles out bottle waters at check in desk. The lines went quickly I can't remember in front green shirt Asian girl so sweet and nice "How are you today" "I am  so glad your staying with us". I probably pick better room West wing but it was last minute an d we needed a place to sleep for work.  It cool 2016 USA pageant  hosted T Mobile arena at time we booked our room.
The NFR transforms this place into a cowgirls dream. Country bands Cowboys ad great music

I've stayed here 6 times, most recently for the May-Paq fight week May 2.  My love for MGM has decreased a bit each year, and I now tend to stay at Bellagio, still within the MGM family.  

They really need to bring back the lion habitat.  It gave the hotel a theme and something cool with photos opportunities.  Now the hotel feels like the Cosmo or Aria hotels, with no true personality.  It was such a cool thing to see real lions twice a day inside a casino.  

In its place of lion habitat, Hakkassan club was a brutal stair walk of confusion.  

The rooms at hotel are very nice, much improved.  Probably the best value for this high quality on the strip.  Great comfy beds too, and the electronic shades are excellent.   

One last note, they need to ban those people riding those fast scooters throughout the hotel.  They were a menace and dangerous all weekend.  Unless someone is handicapped or elderly, they should not be allowed.  Saw so many people nearly run over by those crazy people.

Overall, the place I remember from back when I was a kid... I came here not to long ago, its been sometime. Nice to see you again MGM!

However, I can drink this time around. I must say the pool, its pretty amazing. Honestly, I say experience a pool party once, But really, its not needed. Theres just as much fun outside the "party." We make our own party, no entrance fee needed. 

The lazy pool was nice. We got prime seats next to the lazy river, and was able to sit in the water and relax. The drinks are semi expensive, probably about $12-15. Average, I know. The waitress was nice. She didnt seem the happiest person. Dont blame her in that heat!

Now about the rooms, they are comfy and the staff is nice. However, no mirros besides the one in the bathroom?! Really? I dont think I have heard of such a thing. Only downfall. 

Overall, family friendly hotel, but still keeps that young feel to have fun and party.

Cool place.  Even though I didn't stay here in Vegas I went here a lot.  Emeril's New Orleans Fish House, Cirque de Soleil Ka, Joel Robuchon, and Craftsteak are all here.  For the record though, inside is the MOST expensive Starbucks ever.  My venti White Chocolate Mocha was $6.50.

One Star : I leave a winner every time , but it's not enough for a 5 star review today. 

One Star for Wining !!! $333 not a lot I know, actually that sucks. 

One Star for Font desk , attendant was super nice and helpful 

Negative Two Stars 
Our room was located on the 1st floor to the left hand side where the gift shop is at. Basically the 1st Room . It had a awful window view to some back part of the building , two doors located outside next to windows where employee walk in and out of .... Can you Say Annoying  

Paid $66 on hotels tonight , but they don't say you have to pay a $36 resort Fee
Total Stay $ 102.00  

MGM Hear me Out , I know the resort fee is an add on charge, kindly remove it for those that didn't use the pool area. Thank you

At least the room was decent and clean, though the WiFi was slow.

Everything is a huge walk. Our rooms were about 100 yards down the hallway, and ours wasn't the longest hallway. Walks were similarly long everywhere in the building. Think twice if you or somebody in your party has mobility issues.

The dining was a disappointment. Only the Studio Cafe was decent. Everywhere else had slow service, and the food was second-rate and overpriced.

The highlight of our trip was supposed to be seeing the Cirque de Soleil show, Ka. Instead, a bunch of obnoxious drunks ruined the night for everybody around them, including us. I don't think that this was a rare thing, either.  The casino was filled with people like them.

Don't get the Petite King room. The size of the room is really petite and even more crowded with furniture. Even for 2, we felt really cramped. The shower is not clean, the toilet and shower is separated by a misty glass wall that doesn't completely reach the ceiling (no true privacy and you can see the shadow of the person using the can), the air conditioner is the portable type (how ghetto), and there is no ample space to put your toiletries down next to the sink. It seems like these rooms were designed to cram in as many people per sq feet. For $200\/night this room is not recommended. I think a fairer price point is $80\/night. But it's Vegas, who am I kidding! I think the room is a 3 star room but due to the price minus 1 star. Tip: Look for deals!!!

My gf and I booked for 3 nights here at the MGM Grand last weekend and I must say it was a pleasant experience. The bed was very comfortable and pillow's were very soft. We both slept very well. The view of the room was alright didn't have much of a view except of the New York hotel. Room service are on top of there game they come in everyday to clean up our room. They did a great job! 

Although, the casino area is like a chimney LOL might need a stronger vent to suck all that smoke out. Other then that, we both had a great time in Vegas. I would recommend this hotel.

This is my second time staying at the MGM Grand and it's because I love this hotel. The rooms are great and extremely spacious. I used the laundry service and they brought my clothes back the same day. Room service is pretty great and doesn't take too long to bring the food up. The casino is huge and its employees are really friendly. I love the variety of restaurants to eat at here too. The only bad experience was when we waited in line to check in at the hotel and after waiting for about 20 minutes, we were told that the system was down so we couldn't check in. That was a huge inconvenience and I think the hotel should've comped some room service or a bottle of champagne for making us wait all day to check in - oh well. Anyways, I spent the day at their spa today and it was a great experience. I had a 50 minute massage and enjoyed the spa for a few hours; the spa employees were very nice and accommodating as well. Overall, it's been a great stay here!

Okay, so my initial thought when I walked through the front doors were, "What's that awful smell!?" I seemed to have forgotten that smoking is permitted in the building here, and the stench is overwhelming. This place is highly overrated, so do not waste your time here.

I need to say: the West Wing King is by far the worst bang for your buck. Literally it was a king bed cramped into a tiny room with a flat screen tv. The bathroom, I am not kidding, looked like a boys locker room shower: no bathtub, stained shower floor, NO counter space, cracking tiles that were put back together with what looked like super glue ; burnt out light bulbs, and thermostat controls did not work. I am, by no means, a high maintenance individual; but this West Wing King room was far less than what we had expected. It had one tiny window behind the headboard of the bed. I felt like I was in a bomb shelter. Wish I would've taken pictures. 
In MGM's defense, we did voice our concerns to the front desk and they did offer us an immediate upgrade. It was a newly renovated double queen bed, with a tub and nice view for an extra $15 a night. With a working thermostat! Also, it was on the 16th floor of the Grand tower compared to the 2nd floor of the ghetto West wing tower. So all in all, MGM did redeem their questionable accommodation and provided us with an enjoyable room for a fun weekend. 
I've read quite a few poor reviews regarding the west wing rooms not meeting expectations...maybe time to do some more renovations on that tower?

We arrived at the hotel, and the wait was not bad to check in. We got up to the room and it was disgusting. The glasses had lipstick stains, and the bathroom wall was disgusting. We immediately went downstairs and the receptionist told us that they didn't have any rooms. So we asked her to at least send someone up to clean the room, and she went and talked to a manager. TADA! A new room magically opened up. This room wasn't much cleaner, but at least the glasses were cleaned and we have a remote control. We got comped a Buffett, but really it doesn't make up for the disgusting rooms and the mediocre service. We will stay elsewhere next time. Disgusted.

A big hotel. I understand. Lots of people checking in. 
Christmas night. Ok, you might be lighter staffed 
Looking like 2 + hours to check in??? At 11pm at night?????
Not worth my time. Lots of other places around to stay at. 

Would have been long gone if it was a refundable reservation.

I used to really like the MGM grand ( back in my college days before I had experienced some of the nicer casinos on the strip). We recently spent the weekend in Vegas and decided to return to MGM because it was the cheapest room available for what we had remembered to be a decent hotel. Not luxury by any means, but fun and easy. It was still fairly expensive ( $160\/night), but we figured that it would be as good as we remembered and thus worth the value. 

THE GOOD:
Restaurant selection. The restaurants at the MGM grand are awesome and you can find all kinds of food at various price points. 

The pool- The pool scene at MGM is great. Complete with 2 huge pools and a lazy river there is something for everyone. 

The Casino- My husband loves the MGM poker room and he seems to do much better here than any other poker rooms. We left the trip up hundreds of dollars- score!

The lions- okay i love animals and this is seriously a highlight for me.


THE BAD!: 
Smokey. Compared to some of the newer casinos with better ventilation and higher ceilings, this is the type of place where smoke hits you in the face as soon as you walk in. You leave with your clothes, hair, etc. all smelling like cigarettes.

CROWDED. Seriously- this hotel is ginormous. And the wait for the elevator shows it. Be prepared to wait a few mins for the elevators and sometimes have to pass them up because of over crowding. Or, in my case be smooshed up against some strangers for the long trip up\/down.

No shopping! Besides a giftstore, a  sunglasses shop, and a douche-lord shop ( ie selling a lot of affliction, ed hardy, and true religion), there was no other retail shops. I like to spend some money in Vegas, and I had to venture over to Planet Hollywood for this.

THE UGLY!!!: 
LACK OF AMENITIES: we had tons of leftovers from our delish ( and expensive) dinner at NobHill. We knew there was no refrigerator in the hotel room, but assumed we could store with the hotel since this is how it works at the nicer casinos we've stayed at ( palazzo, Encore, Bellagio).... We called down to arrange this and not only we were told we couldn't store with them but we were also informed there was a $35 rental fee for a refrigerator. What if i had medication that needed to be refrigerated? Its really not cool to not offer a free way of refrigeration to your guests. we also noticed there was no coffee maker either. 

The rooms- Big box TV's, gross shower heads ( with awful temperature control), and old furniture. 

The Noise- You know how in vegas people get really drunk and shout all the way back to their rooms at 5am? Well normally I feel like this sound is somewhat muffled by large sturdy doors or something. In MGM it felt like these fools were IN our room! Thank god for blackout shades otherwise it would've been a sleepless night for me. 


Moral of the story:
I wouldn't stay at MGM again unless I got a room rate that was under $100 a night.

Thanks for the wonderful suite :]  I felt like a princess!

...and then I felt a little famous when I saw that Kendra & Hank stayed in the same suite!

Overall a good hotel. Our room was clean and stocked. House keeping came every day unless we choose not to be disturbed. The front desk was accommodating. I liked there was a lot of staff available. Their buffet is good. Reasonable price and lots of food especially for dinner.

Not the fanciest hotel we have stayed at (we try a different hotel ever year on our anniversary) but the customer service was top notch. When we checked in and they noted that it was our anniversary they granted us a credit for a cake at the cake shop. When the waiter at Pub 154 got word that it was our anniversary weekend, two free glasses of champaign arrived at our table. Finally, when we were lost looking for the concierge, he found us and walked us over. We were able to print show tickets for another mlife hotel at the concierge. Whole at the show a chilled bottle of champaign was delivered to our room with a happy anniversary note from the concierge team. The service team, food options, entertainment, and pool were fun and not too stuffy. We had a great weekend. Thank you!

Unless you are a high roller stay somewhere else! The first thing I noticed was the rug on the way to and in my room; the airport rugs are cleaner.  The next thing was that someone tried to rip away the Bose radio.  They ripped it off the table it was bolted to.  I had to take cold showers two of the three days.  I have to mention that ALL staff was excellent though.  They advertise a TV in the bathroom mirror but it did not work(not a big issue but they advertised it).  When I asked about it security told me to contact the engineers.  I won't be staying there again.

While not the most upscale hotel I've stayed in, MGM still managed to nail all the important things I look for. 

First, they have lions. Only joking, but they do make for some amusing late night companions while stumbling back into the hotel. 

As for the key components, the rooms were clean (and housekeeping did a great job every day), spacious and comfortable. Bathrooms were huge - enough for the three girls in my room to all do makeup\/hair\/girl talk at once. We did wish there was another full length mirror outside of the bathroom. Also, the shower head was super low. It boggles the mind when I see this in hotels, and when you're a tall drink of water like myself, you notice it more often than not. I'll never stop complaining about it. 

What the shower lacked, the bed made up for big time. I must have said it at least ten times throughout my three night stay: I loved the bed. It was like sleeping on a cushy cloud, only with down pillows and blankets everywhere. I don't think I've ever slept in a more comfortable bed. And I slept like a dream every single night, despite my nagging cold. 

One of the best parts about MGM Grand is the pool area. There are three huge pools to choose from (including a lazy river), towel service and other necessary amenities. A bar and quick order walk-up restaurant are conveniently located and there was rarely a long line. The cocktail menu even features four "skinny cocktails" under 100 calories each. I became addicted to the Drunken Palmer as I happily tanned myself on a chaise. 

I didn't know what to expect going into our stay at MGM, especially with all the newer, posher hotels on the strip. But it turned out to be an affordable, comfy headquarters for our bachelorette party of seven. And the location was perfect. I'd absolutely stay there again.

First off condolences to everyone affected by the shooting at the Mandalay Bay.  I personally know people who were there.  Now, we had reservations to check into the MGM Monday morning, the night after the shooting at the Mandalay Bay.  We were going to renew our wedding vows on our 30th anniversary.   For obvious reasons and the fact we could not get to the MGM, we cancelled the trip.  Tried calling the MGM, but always a long hold time.  Finally get a MGM employee (Taniel)  who immediately is short and says since I was a "NO SHOW" all my deposits were forfeited.   No show, lady we couldn't get the hotel, I guess we could have stepped over the dead bodies.  Her tone was so bad I told her it sounded like I was bothering her and would just lose the deposits and end the call.  She says no let her try to help.  Then went right back into who did I speak with? When did I call?  After 30 minutes I just tell her never mind I am done with MGM and any other affiliated resort.  ALL I WAS TRYING TO WAS PLACE THE DEPOSITS ON FILE SO WHEN WE RETURN TO VEGAS WE COULD STAY AT THE MGM.  Apparently the $350 deposits are more important to MGM than doing the right thing.    Taniel calls back after I end the call and then tells me,' Reservations no longer has access to the deposits and that I had to talk to someone at the front desk.  She did not know that during the 30 minutes she treated me like I was trying to pull a fast one?

This was my first time staying at the MGM after wanting to stay there for so long. My sister told me it was average, so I wasn't expecting too much. But I have to say I left happy and impressed. 

Parking: Parking was easy, the structure is easy to get to and it's location is fairly close to the lobby. It is $12 per day, but if you add it to your room charges, then you can use your room key for in and out privileges at all of the MGM owned properties, which I thought was great!! 

Check in: I was a little scared because it was a Friday afternoon, but the check in was so quick! There were approximately 20 people in line, but there were also 20 front desk clerks checking people in! We only waited about 5 mins to get checked in! Great! The girl that helped us was so sweet! I had originally booked a West Wing King room, but I asked if there were any complementary upgrades available and she said yes! She got us into a Grand Queen room with a view of the strip, with no additional charge! Thanks girl! 

Room: It wasn't very much of a difference from the West Wing, but it was something! The bathroom was bigger then what the other room had, so I was happy. We inspected the beds as we arrived, since i heard about a recent beg bug incident. Everything looked clean and great! They had extra pillows in the closet and plenty of towels. They do have a mini fridge, but the girl at the front desk warned us that everything inside has a sensor, so if we move anything, we'll be charged for a restocking fee and the item. Refrigerators were available though for an additional $25.  

I liked how it was fairly close to a lot of things on the strip and how easy it was to get from one place to another, and all the restaurants the hotel had. We also checked out Tiesto at the Hakkasan and had a lot of fun! The pool was great! I had never been to any pools in Vegas and I really wanted to try these out. I say these because there were literally like 4 pools, plus a lazy river and a jacuzzi! So impressive! I wish we didn't have to buy the inner tubes for the lazy river though, they were at least $20, wish I would have brought my own.

Can't wait to stay at the MGM again! Maybe next time I'll try out the Stay Well rooms!

Definitely never staying here again. I booked a Stay Well suite a couple months in advance. We checked in after 3 and were given our room keys, but once we got in we realized it wasn't cleaned. There were sheets on the floor, food everywhere, CONDOM wrappers, just absolutely disgusting. I called the front desk and they told us they had nothing else available, even after asking twice, the girl said there were no room available we would have to wait for staff to clean our room. REALLY? The only other option was a 2 bedroom on the same floor. We were tired after the long drive and said fine.

Going into the 2 bedroom we realized it was worse than the first. The closet was almost non existent, the lights flickered, the window shades were crooked. We were basically downgraded as their solution to not having our room ready.

We went down to the front desk lugging our stuff with us and complained that we needed a new room. Magically one appeared, after I was told over the phone there were none available. They gave us a $50 credit for food. Whoop dee doo.

We finally got into our room and felt like we would actually get to relax until we heard our neighbors. SCREAMING at the top of their lungs. I realize the hotel can't control guests but I couldn't help by wonder if we would be staying next to neighbors from hell if our first room had been ready when it was supposed to be. 

All in all a terrible experience. I'm not even looking for a comp or apology. I vote with my money. I will never stay at mgm ever again. I will tell my friends and co-workers so they wont be cheated by this place.

This was my first time staying at the MGM Grand. We drove and I could not believe that a hotel in Las Vegas now charges for parking. 


My check in experience was great. It was prompt and the associate was very courteous.

The room we received was a bit dated and the shower was moldy. For the amount we paid I would expect to receive a room in this condition.

The casino section of the hotel was very nice.

I do not believe I will be staying at the MGM Grand again. With the dirty room, having to pay for parking, and all the added hotel tax fees it for not seem worth it to me.

I would Suggest staying off the strip where you actually get what you pay for.

Due to a combination of value and overall experience,  I had a recent 4-star stay here. Really like this hotel and would gladly return. 

The Good:
-The Resort is truly massive. You could stay here for a couple days and never leave once. I'm sure this is by design but really, everything you could possibly need (at least temporarily) is here. 
-My room in the Grand Tower (11th floor) was very nice and the bed was super comfy. This is the first tolerable hotel bed I've stayed in since I bought a top of the line Tempur-Pedic a few years back.
-Beautiful pools and an excellent business center (that I spent several days in).
-Very good restaurants, several with a respectable craft beer selection.
-Quality of staff was very high, particularly the housekeeping staff and those attending to the gaming floor. 
-The price is definitely right 

The Bad:
-I spent well over 30 minutes in line waiting to check in on a Sunday evening. A coworker who showed up in the afternoon waited over an hour! That is completely unacceptable.
-When I got to my room, it was a room with two Queens instead of a single King (as I had requested as I was traveling alone). But given the fact I had just waited so ridiculously long in line and was already late for a business conference, I did not have time to complain about the oversight. 
-The pools are only open until 6pm. Being that I was there for a business conference, this sadly left me ZERO time to enjoy said pools.
-The place is so incredibly massive that it can take you well over 20 minutes to get from point A to point B. And this comes from me, a fast walker.

Anyway, as stated, I will definitely be back. Hope to visit while there is an event taking place at the Arena (which I've heard is lovely).

Our room was extremely noisy.  It not only faced the airport but was also directly above the lobby drop off.  This is probably also one of the noisiest hotels in terms of hallway noise that I have ever stayed in.  If you're a light sleepers, make sure you get a room that faces away from the airport and lobby.  

Overall the hotel is really clean, the staff is friendly and there are many choices for entertainment and dining.

We booked the celebrity suite through their website and checked in at the hotel. The lady that checked us in for some reason found it appropriate to walk away, go in the back room and take her sweet time while I watched people get check in other lines. Once we got checked in our room was umm okay. I was absolutely surprised by the room. It was so outdated and looked nothing like the picture. I pulled up the picture on my laptop and sure enough the same items in the room, but boy they did a good job and making the room like different. The room looks like a 70's throwback and I cannot imagine a "celebrity" would every choose to stay there. Believe it or not, that was the least of the rooms problems. When I tried to put my bags in the closet, the closet door was broken. When I tried to take a shower, the shower door wouldn't close. I tried not to worry about it because I was on my honeymoon, but on the second day the water stopped working. Seriously, stopped working. Yes I was on my honeymoon and the toilet wouldn't flush. At this point I had had it so I called down to the front desk. The lady said that the whole floors water was off and it should be up and running in an hour or so. I said umm that's not okay, can I speak to the manager. I was able to speak to the manager who was beyond understanding. She quickly changed our room after finding out that we were on our honeymoon. We had the most amazing trip ever because of the manager. It was well worth the disastrous beginning. Oh and the room that she moved us to... was a terrace suite.

My bf and I stayed here back in July of this year for the first time. I really liked this hotel and casino. We stayed in the west tower in one of the basic rooms. It was a pretty tiny room, but the room was clean and nice despite it's small size, so I was fine with it. The bathroom was really compact and was there to greet you as soon as you walked in the room. My only real complaint would be that there was no real counter space whatsoever just primarily a sink and storage underneath, so not a whole lot of space for us ladies to lay out our makeup and stuff lol, but that didn't bother me too much. Also the remote for the TV wasn't working consistently, but we weren't planning to just sit inside and watch TV all day anyways, so it wasn't too much of a bother.  

Free wi-fi, but it didn't work very well to be honest. And I think it was only free for one device. 

The lobby was huge and really nice actually. Check in was pretty quick. We arrived early, maybe around 12, so our room wasn't ready yet, but the friendly lady at the desk let us check into another room early and waived the early check in fee, which we much appreciated! Our room also came with a free buffet, so that was a nice bonus. 

The casino and hotel itself was huge! it felt like forever until we made it to the pool from our room lol. So if you stay in the west tower be prepared for a journey if you plan to go to the pool. But the long walk was worth it. The pool area itself was pretty big. I think there was maybe 4 pools and a lazy river. The lazy river was nice, but if you don't like being around kids then be prepared or stay away lol. The other pools were pretty quiet and peaceful though. 

Overall I really enjoyed the MGM grand! I'd likely stay here again.

Pretty average hotel from all the other hotels in Vegas it seems. I can't complain too much because we won 2 nights here but I can give you the gist of the room we got and the hotel itself.

It's at the bottom of the strip so you have to walk to most places which can be a pain, but there is a bus stop close by. Other than that the closest other restaurants and casino was New York. But nothing is really terribly far if you are OK with walking.

Our room was 424 in the grand tower. The room was nice enough but it had a horrible view of giant green lights that light up the hotel at night. Well, the blinds suck, they need to be black out blinds. All night it felt like we were sleeping in a fish tank. The water pressure was also awful, I can't imagine what it's like on higher floors. But overall, ok. No coffee maker, and even Holiday Inn's have a coffee maker. The lines at starbucks were obscene. 

The place is a maze and the map they gives you kinda sucks. And the elevators get crazy full. We had to wait at least 20 minutes to get an elevator that we could squeeze into. Now, this was during the I Heart Radio festival and obviously had a lot to do with it. 

Service was overall good, I didn't have much interaction but with the front desk agent.

With your resort fee you get wifi which is nice. If you want to use a tube in the lazy river it's $12 which is ridiculous. The lazy river is nice but it is packed with people drinking and the water is very, very warm...you do the math. 

Overall a kind of average hotel. I think I'd rather pay a tad more to stay in a bit nicer and more updated hotel.

I am writing in reference to my recent stay on 7\/18 - 7\/20. I am not one who usually complains or even writes about it, but after thinking and discussing with others, I thought it would be the right thing to let you know that I was not very happy when I left the MGM on 7\/20. 
 
Everything went well when a friend and I arrived on 7\/18. We were welcomed and was told that I would be given a room credit of $50 for it being my birthday. She said I would be able to use it on food or drinks in the MGM and just charge it to the room and it would be deducted. I was very grateful and thanked the lady at the front desk. 
 
As soon as we got to the room I noticed 2 things that I should have reported to the front desk and housekeeping, but decided to leave it be because we got in late and with it being my birthday just decided to head down to the casino. 
 
1) The comforter on the bed by the window had some type of red stain on it that crusted. I did not sleep under it and just threw it on the floor and slept under the bed sheets. 
 
2) There were 2 glasses in the bathroom that were definitely not clean. One had fingerprints all over them and the other had some resin around the rim of the cup like someone ate and drank from it and the food stuck. 
 
Again, I didn't say anything only because I didn't want to hassle anyone at the MGM and just focused on enjoying my birthday.
 
Besides those two things, the room was fine and my next complaint has to do with the checkout process.   
 
I was told that I would receive a $50 credit for food and beverage if charged to my room if purchased in the MGM. When I went to checkout there was a $32 charge for pizza purchased at the MGM food court. The lady I spoke to on the phone said that it has to be an "MGM owned" restaurant and that it does not count. I explained what the front desk lady said and also told her that the receipt and what the charge shows is "MGM Bonannos" and how would I know to differentiate when MGM shows on the receipt. She was willing to work with me and said that she couldn't do anything about the charge and instead refund the resort fees. I was told my balance and thought it was fine but then realized that she only reversed one resort fee instead of both and still was responsible for a fraction of the price of the food I thought would be free.
 
I am not complaining for the sake of complaining, but I thought you should know because a lot of people would find the first 2 things very disturbing and refuse to stay there and the other is a matter of principle. I was told one thing and it was not honored and given another option which didn't help me at all. 
 
I am a very loyal gambler at the MGM and I do have an Mlife account. This was my first official stay at the MGM and was definitely not pleased. I will say that I usually stay at the Signature but got a better deal here which was the reason I booked it. I come to Vegas about 8-10 times a year for business and leisure and always looking to stay at mlife resorts. After this experience I'm not sure I can stay at the MGM but will still use my MLife card when I am in Vegas. Thank you for taking the time to read this.

It's really very simple to "fix" this 0 star review: Clean your hotel!
This is absolutely the most disgusting hotel room I have stayed in in over 5 years...and I lived overseas for 4 years.
The carpets are beyond stained. Everything in the room felt dirty and gross. 
EVERY towel\/washcloth had some sort of stain. Do you have no standard for this?
But the worst of it is the hallways. Of course, one look and the stains are disgustingly apparent. For 4 days, not ONCE was the hallway vacuumed. For 2 days, we passed the same fist-sized hairball that lay on the floor. For 2 days, we passed a line of 8 dirty glasses along the wall. For 2 days, we passed a discarded room service tray. The same small plastic child's toy was there the full 4 days.  
We even passed one day what appeared to be the 'manager' of the service staff (she was carrying a clip board and looking in on the maids cleaning the rooms and making notes on her board) and the hallway STILL remained disgustingly dirty with said items never removed.
I used to live in Vegas and the MGM was always an upscale hotel. It has gone so far downhill, I will never stay here again. And the sad part is, it's all a matter of having some cleaning standards--that doesn't even cost you more (except if you decide to discard the stained towels and buy new ones and have the carpets cleaned once in a blue moon).

FEES (An after-thought):
The resort fee (and now parking fee) and the tax on top of the resort fee is... well I guess charged at every hotel now. But if you are charging it, make the guest feel like they are getting something for it. I mean, is getting 2 towels at the pool really a problem (I couldn't even get the 2nd towel for my friend it was such a big deal--and the towel I got was streaked with yellow stains). And is charging extra for a float tube (that you ran out of anyways) really keeping you in business? Plus, no coffee pot or fridge in the rooms? I guess a big THANK YOU THANK YOU for not charging even more for Internet access (which everyone has their own now anyways) and of course, the complimentary notary service that's included in the Resort fee; I'm sure millions get their monies worth out of this (Is listing this as an included service a joke?)

Really, the only complaint I have about the hotel is that there isn't a coffee maker in the room.  I know this may seem silly but I like my morning cup of coffee before I shower, just as I'm waking up.  It's a bit of a pain to have to get washed up & dressed to go downstairs to buy a cup of coffee.  Also, it would have been nice if breakfast was included

What a disappointing experience. We came so excited to stay at the famous MGM Grand in Las Vegas. Oh boy! The girl at the front desk was rude and completely unwilling to help me with my questions. The room keys were not properly activated, so I had to go back to reprogram them. We learned right then and there that having payed already for the room, we also have an extra charge of about $100 for the "resort fees" (wifi, fitness room, phone!?) I mean unbelievable!
When we finally made it to the room, we were surprised at its size, I mean for the price we payed we were expecting something bigger, fancier and with more appliances, the rooms don't have a coffee maker, mini fridge, mini nothing! Only two pillows for two people in a king size bed. Mind you, my wife is pregnant, so she is very uncomfortable. 
Very very disappointing indeed. Won't come back and\/or recommend it any time soon.

Dies ist mein zweiter Besuch im MGM Grand und ich liebe dieses Hotel immer noch. Kein Hotel in Las Vegas bietet so eine schöne Pool-Landschaft. Außerdem wird hier alles geboten, was man will: gutes teures Essen oder eher billigeres, Gambling, Shows, etc. Schade ist aber, dass im Gegensatz zum letzten Besuch der Arcade-Bereich deutlich verkleinert wurde zugunsten der CSI Attraktion.
Leider war auch ein Pool die gesamte Zeit geschlossen, was nicht begründet wurde. Dafür war der Rest der Pool-Landschaft wie immer super. Und trotz Sommersaison waren genügend Liegen frei für uns. Ab 17 Uhr werden aber fast alle Poolbereiche geschlossen, was sehr ärgerlich ist.
Das Zimmer (Bungalow Suite) war riesig und hatte drei Fernseher: einen alten vor dem Bett, dann einen riesigen Flachbild-Schirm-Fernseher für den Wohnbereich und dann noch ein TV-Gerät, dass im Spiegel im Bad integriert war.
Das Bett war sehr bequem, genauso waren genug Schränke vorhanden. Das Bad hatte eine riesige Massage-Dusche mit zusätzlicher Regendusche, dazu zwei Waschbecken.
Leider gibt es keine Kühlschränke oder Wasserkocher auf dem Zimmer.
Außerdem hatten wir extreme Probleme mit dem Housekeeping. Zwei mal wurde unser Zimmer gar nicht gemacht. Produkte wie Duschgel, etc. wurden häufiger vergessen. Einmal kam Housekeeping nachts um 1, nachdem wir uns beschwert hatten. Allerdings dauerte es lange, bis das Housekeeping auch an unserem Zimmer ankam. Anstatt 20 Minuten dauerte die Reinigung dann auch 45 Minuten. Als wir fragten, weshalb das so lange dauerte, wurden wir bezichtigt, dass unser Zimmer scheinbar extrem dreckig sein müsste, wenn das Personal so lang braucht.
Uns wurde außerdem ein Turndown-Service für die nächsten Tage versprochen, der aber nie kam.
Da wir in einer Woche viel gespielt haben im Casino, hat uns der Player's Club außerdem zugesichert, zwei Nächte gratis zu bekommen. Beim Check-Out war davon dann keine Rede mehr und die Mitarbeiter konnten uns nicht weiterhelfen.
Bei einem weiteren Problem bezüglich von Öffnungszeiten einer Mall, nahmen wir den Concierge Service zur Hilfe. Auch da konnte uns zunächst nicht weitergeholfen werden, was mich überrascht hat. Normalerweise sollten Concierge gut informiert sein über ihre Stadt. Die Wartezeit beim Concierge war teilweise auch sehr lang (über 20 Min.)
Auch die Wartezeit beim Valet-Parking dauerte manchmal länger als 20 Minuten. Immerhin ist das Valet Parking gratis, genauso wie der Internet-Zugang.
Männer sollten spät abends nicht mehr allein im Casino unterwegs sein, da sie andauern von scheinbaren Hostessen angesprochen\/angeflirtet werden. Das kann sehr nervig werden, wenn die Freundin oben im Zimmer ist und man nur was zu trinken holen wollte. Komisch, dass sowas offensichtlich immer noch tolleriert wird vom MGM.

Alles in allem würde ich immer wieder kommen in dieses Hotel. Allerdings schafft es das MGM Grand nicht, meinen Aufenthalt zu einem völlig perfekten Erlebnis zu machen. Vielleicht kommt das noch. Und vielleicht macht auch endlich wieder der gesamte Poolbereich irgendwann auf.

We got very nice room with a nice view but we got very disappointed when we requested a simple taxi from hotel and they set us up with luxury car that charged us so much for simple 2 mile ride. Just letting you know so you guys are aware of that. Food in their buffet made me and my husband really sick.

Stayed here one weeknight in February 2014. The room\/bed\/bathroom was nice. The bathroom was pretty big and the shower was great. Finding a good parking spot was easy (maybe because it was a weekday). Check-in \/ check-out process was simple. Had a good view of the strip from my room. Lots of things to do and a variety of food options within the hotel, but it's so big that it's easy to get lost (for me anyway). Would definitely stay here again.

Like other Yelpers had mentioned, stay away from the West wing. I wished we read the reviews before booking. There are no fridge, microwave or coffee maker in the room. Check-in is horrendous! Will not be back here again. Also, be prepared to pay for parking, ridiculous!

Final update. MGM ignored my credit card  company too and I kept my credit. Incredibly  poor ! I will NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone!

Two months and still no word from MGM regarding the over charging. Sad that a place gets so big they do not care about customers or customer service as long as they are making money!

I have stayed at the MGM Las Vegas several times over the past 10 years both for business and pleasure. I always enjoyed the great service, food outlets, and nightlife.  My sister and I recently stayed three nights in The Grand Tower. The two-queen room was great. The beds and linen were nice and comfortable and bless the man who installed the blackout curtains. Upon arrival, I did notice that the toiletries were not new. This included a lotion that was half used. Needless to say, I am glad I brought my own. Housekeeping did a great job over the next few days even organizing our makeup on towels.  What disappointed me this stay was the feeling that I had to beg for service. When I got it, it was wonderful, getting it was the problem. The first night we had to practically stand on our heads to get noticed by service staff in the Lobby Lounge. I saw a waitress at the other end of the bar and we waited about 10 minutes before just going up to the bar and ordering our drinks. The bartender was nice and drinks were great but moved on after not being able to find a waitress again. We found our way to the Centrifuge Bar. Again my sister and I stood there twiddling out thumbs for 10 minutes waiting for a bartender to acknowledge us. Again the bartender was nice and the drinks were ok but we did not want to wait for the service staff to get around to us again. We gambled on slots for a good 45 minutes after and not once did I see a waitress. For me gambling a drinking go hand in hand without one the other is not as fun.
