They've caused me a great headache when I came back. 

They've messed up the billing (credited my account with too much). 

As soon as I've noticed, I've sent them an email with all the details. After a while they came back to me, saying that they had a look at my account and everything seems to be OK. 

After a while, they came back to me (not unexpectedly) saying that there was some problem with billing. I've told them that I knew and I already contacted them. Never received any response to that. 

I've also asked them if they can charge different credit card with the amount (because my old one has been cancelled meanwhile) - never received any response to that as well. 

And surprise, a couple of days there was a charge on my old credit card. Long story short - customer experience was truly terrible, they've made a mistake, yet at the end it was I that had to spend a lot of time trying to get it fixed.

The west wing is very disappointing ! The hallway carpet was very dirty not to mention extremely long. The room was ok but I have stayed in Motel 6's that were nicer. The bathroom though , wow horrible ! The shower door didn't seal so the water just ran onto the floor and was very slippery. Wont be back !!!!

Good Location, nice rooms. Check in was a disaster, considering I spoke English. Our person checking us in was not, and did not like that I did not understand her. Had to get another person to translate what I was requesting. NO comps for difficulties. Manager seemed to not want to deal with the situation. Overpriced on a regular day. We got a deal to try out the place since we had heard so much good. Won't go back, so many others that are great. La Quinta has better service at checkin.

What a garbage operation. Rude customer service every step of the way, overpriced rooms and they are not even that nice. They also charged us much more than what the front desk girl promised for an upgrade fee, and it took nearly two months to get only a partial refund for their mistake. 

Never staying here again. Much better Vegas options, such as The Wynn, Encore, and Cosmopolitan.

The casino itself is huge and a little difficult to navigate. Came here for Morimoto and the staff members were very nice and friendly to show us the direction. The shops are great. Responsibly priced. KA also performs here!
i feel like this hotel and casino is more appealing to the guys than gals. i think i only like the green glow of the place on the outside hahaha!

It was a decent hotel... nothing special. Very limited selection of craps tables it seemed. 

The rooms were spacious, although they stuck me in a smoking room (I'm allergic to smoke) which sucked, until they finally switched me after the first night. Gym costs money to use (lame) and the buffet wasn't very good at all. 

The location was good & the price wasn't too bad, but I'd rather pay a little more and stay elsewhere. 

I did however enjoy: The lions & seeing Cirque du Soleil (Ka is my fave!)

Unfortunately - not a fan of the bar\/club... so had to venture out for my nighttime fun.

There are some great places to eat at in this place - Craft Steak and Shibuya, so we of course came here on a recent visit. The hotel is older so don't expect the ventilation to be the best. I'm still bummed that they ditched the lion habitat back in 2011. The casino floor is massive and I feel like the signage is poor. It's difficult to find the monorail and restaurants. This location is a bit too far down on the strip for my liking to stay but I'll be back to eat.

MGM had contacted my wife and I due to our negative Yelp reviews immediately following our return home from our wedding. They made a generous offer, which we graciously accepted and then returned to the MGM Grand three weeks later for an extended weekend get-away. 

MGM Resorts cared about what happened and our terrible experience and not only fixed it, but was able to keep us as loyal patrons. Thanks, MGM
I've stayed here twice in the last three years and it has never let me down! Really nice rooms, clean, great atmosphere. Great pool party at Wet Republic!!

My friends and I stayed there Aug 19-21. We stayed in the west wing rooms. The room was very small... I had never stayed in a hotel with such a small room. The lighting sucked so bad. I hate how they have they're restroom set up. No type of privacy. The view was terrible.. This was the smallest room with a king bed. 

The food we got from room service was nasty. We order pizza and fries and oh man the pizza was worse than eating 7 eleven pizza. I thought that the food from the MGM room service would be delicious.. But no! I should of just walked down to one of the restaurants they have there. This hotel was not worth a $400 hotel!!!

did not like this place.  Decor was dark and manly.  Like a man's den or a bachelor pad.  The buffet was okay.  The restaurants on Studio Row look delicious but very pricey.  The lounges and nightlife was hot and happening which saved the MGM a one star rating.

Where do I start? We chose the MGM because it was conveniently located for our convention. We stayed here before several years ago and didn't consider it to be too bad, and since we wouldn't be in our room much, we didn't need anything fancy.

We are staying in the West Wing, which I definitely don't recommend. The vanity in our bathroom is incredibly tiny - there is almost no room to put out one's things. The cords from styling tools knock everything onto the floor because the counter is so ridiculously narrow. We are constantly having to pick our things up and it's just plain silly.

Our first morning here, after a long and restless night on an uncomfortable mattress, I dragged myself into the shower to revive myself before a day of classes. The water was barely lukewarm and left me shivering the entire time. My husband decided to forgo the shower all together, which wasn't ideal. We reported it to the front desk and they seemed concerned and said someone would come fix it. By the time we came back from our convention, the hot water was restored.

Today, as I was trying to get ready for dinner, I went to wash my hands. No water. I tried the shower. No water. I called the front desk AGAIN and was told that there had been an emergency shut off of the hot water and that it should be restored soon. Lovely.

I would have given two stars, but my husband said that he feels like this is usually a decent place and we're just having a bad run AND that we should avoid the West Wing if we ever stay here again. I will say that the room is clean and we were allowed to check in early (for a fee) which I appreciated. So, three stars. We come to Vegas frequently, and this is not a spot I will be wanting to return.

Although the pools were the best and the buffets were the best deal considering you could pay $20 for one item at one of their restaurants or $20 for buffet...it's a no brainer, the buffet was the way to go. HOWEVER...the room we had was horrible. I felt like I was in a dungeon, dark, small window with no light....kinda like being on a cruise ship! No ventilation in the bathroom\/shower area, one chair to sit on besides the bed. We were in a section of the hotel that must have been the OLDEST and was undergoing a facelift, but we did not have the luxury of those, as soon as u got to our section, it was dark and gloomy, even the lighting in the hallways was half of what it was in the updated sections. We had to listen to a safety alarm go off for 2 hours and we had a GIANT hairball on the floor in our room when we return AFTER housekeeping was there.  Front desk was no help....their response "thanks for letting us know" they didnt even know about the alarm!

Typically we are Wynn faithfuls, but we stayed at the MGM Grand with friends this past week and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were incredibly modern and updated. My only complaint is the sink and tub drainage was slow.

We'll definitely come and stay at the MGM Grand again!

MGM Grand review 6.6.13

Intro: Check-in went pretty smooth and no issues. Hotel layout is very strange though and there is a very long walk from one thing to the other. it could have been designed better. 

Room detail (negative): The room itself looked very nice and had a nice feel to it. However, the rooms lack a mini fridge and microwave to reheat stuff and also there is no coffee pot in the room as well. WARNING: DO NOT USE THE 'MINI FRIDGE' AS A FRIDGE! IF YOU TAKE THE STUFF OUT TO PUT YOUR OWN IN THEY WILL CHARGE YOU FOR USING IT. They did give us a notice that we 
can ask housekeeping for one for 35 bucks, however they did not tell you a notice before we got into the fridge! Also the plug for the laptop on the lamp is broken and the plug slides in and the laptop does not indicate being on AC power.The bathroom faucet was very loud and my sis's ears were ringing.  


Room detail (positive):The wifi did connect right away and there is no login needed. They also recently upgraded the network as well. The shades aree neat you can have a sheer to let a lil light in or blackout to let you sleep in longer. Fixture quality is decent. TV and entertainment center is really nice and you can plug in game consoles or a laptop with HDMI. Shower looks nice and has curving shower curtain rod. Toilet is in a nook for a lil privacy. I slept really good in the room and the beds are decent. Pollows were good too. 


Overall I am going to give the MGM Grand a 2.2 star rating. The rooms are nice and the location is perfect and the wifi was great, however the negatives listed above take the rating down from 4.5 stars to 2.2 stars. 

Other stuff:

The pool was very nice and relaxing, it had a lot of different types of pools and they even played my kind of music (dance\/trance\/electro) and the vibe was nice. The casino floor was nice as well. Most of all the show KA was AMAZING!

Recommended: Mabye to no.
This is our go-to hotel when in Vegas. The rooms are an excellent size, the beds are comfortable, the buffet is delicious, and KA is fantastic.

BF & I stayed here the weekend before 4th of July. We got the suite. Place was awesome!!! Housekeeping brings in bucket full of ice all the time. If I get a chance to stay at this place again, I surely will!!!

I stay at the MGM 90% of the time I'm in Vegas and I have never been disappointed. I usually go with the folks twice a year and we all share a room (4 of us) with two queen beds. The room isnt that big, but its comfortable for 4 people. I love all of the little lounges that they have throughout the casino, and the casino itself is fun and quite large. They have an arcade for younger folks and plenty of restaurants to choose from, although we tend not to go to them for fear of how expensive they are. The pools are nice as well. Overall a great place. Studio 54 is here also, if youre into that. Prices are usually cheap also if you are an avid gambler.

Just got back from a weekend in Vegas with a signifcant other.  I was leery about the West Wing room, but upon check-in, that's what they wanted to give us.  I decided to be open minded and see what it was like.  I was really happy we went with it.  I'm not a huge fan of modern decor for myself...however, in a hotel, I LOVE it, since it's so hard to hide any dirt.  If there is one thing I can say for it, it was clean, and the bed was comfortable, the most important qualities of any hotel room.  And it was affordable.  You're not staying at the Wynn, but you're not paying to either.  The MGM Grand pools are also great, and it's got excellent restaurants.  Really a great, affordable experience.

One note: Because of the layout of the West Wing room, it's great for a.) business travelers (meaning you're alone) or b.) with a significant other.  There is not much privacy.

They get you to upgrade your room for a charge thinking the room would be nicer...WRONG! 

TV-isn't working. As soon as we check in the tv said No signal. We want out of there asap after checking in to start our vacation but had to wait for maintenance 

DUST-Everywhere!!! We can write our names in the dust! 

BEDS-2 pillows really?!??? That are so flat we could have used towels! Dirty sheets! We're they even changed?

FLOORS-3 Bobby pins and earring locks found, NOT MINE! 

SNACKBAR-missing items, I better not be charged

AC-we woke up so sweaty at night. No AC in the elevators either

WATER-the water pressure in the hotel is a joke. Might as well shower in the fountain in the lobby. Water also takes forever to get hot 

WALLS-you can hear everything! We stayed on a Monday and Tuesday night, why book someone right next door where we can hear them opening their windows with chains (yes this "so called renovated hotel" uses chains still to open the shades) 

REFRIGERATOR-locked at all times. Of course a charge just to use

Then we do the late check out, go to the pool and when we return we're locked out of the room because apparently they didn't get the late check out?!!? This by far is the worse hotel and customer service is horrible!!!! Stay somewhere else!! Oh and read previous reviews, they have five star BED BUGS!

I love you, MGM. Your bars, your casinos... all except your attitude about electronic cigarettes. Really? You can smoke openly but you're weird about vaping in bars? It shouldn't have taken 20 minutes to explain that it wasn't a crack pipe.

Rooms are fantastic and everyone was really helpful otherwise. The front desk staff upgraded us just for the hell of it. Room service was totally understanding about my 3am drunken need for buffalo wings and the cocktails are perfect!

The decor is nicely done but the rooms are fairly standard, as far as hotel rooms go. I only stayed here briefly, but I was placed in the most AWFUL room on the property. 4th floor, Room 132. Run if you are assigned here. It must have been above a boiler room and the view was of the loading dock. Therefore, there was loud noise 24 hours per day. I complained at checkout and they did nothing. The customer service overall was disappointing.

The reason I'm giving the hotel 3 stars is for the pool. The lazy river is super fun, with a great mix of people hanging out and excellent music.

The West Wing bar was a hidden gem.  We were really over the crowds and smokey atmosphere of Vegas. We wondered down a long hallway  secluded hall way toward the West Wing Bar. 
   First off  it was really sleek and sexy. They had these leather "bed" style chaises the faced a flat screen playing ambient pictures. It was so nice to kick back and just relax by ourselves for a while. 
The bar was small but, the whole place was fairly empty.  It was like we had a private little sanctuary. However, the sanctuary came at a hefty price. $27 for a Hangar 1 and soda and a Grey goose martini!
  Wow, it was Vegas and we were splurging!

The casino is large, not too Smokey, and restaurant are nice though very pricey. The hotel room itself was horrible. Best way to describe is they polished a turd. Room was not close to the pool. The walls were paper thin (could hear full conversation of people talking in room next to me in normal time level, every time a door opened or closed could hear it, had to listen to people in room next to me puke all night, is next to an airport so heard planes and a helicopter consistently). I called to checkout downstairs and the person I spoke with was rude and I instead had to go downstairs and wait 30 minutes in line to checkout. They also appeared to be understaffed because check-in on a Sunday night also took over 40 minutes in line. There was constantly a long line to check-in during my stay. Room was so bad I cancelled one of the nights I was going to stay. Rooms on Freemont St. Are nicer for 1\/4 the price

I come to Vegas a lot and I've stayed at many different resorts. MGM has been by far one of my favorites. The location isn't the best, personally, but it is a very nice hotel. 

Checking in went fairly fast. We had made a reservation for 4 people. The receptionist was very nice. Not once did she mention what kind of room we were in. I figured we would get 2 beds since the reservation was for 4 people. We walk up to the room and one of the keys didn't work. I've had this happen to me at the Flamingo and it was a nightmare. The other key worked and we walked in the room to find that they gave us a King bed. How the hell are 4 girls supposed to fit in one bed? I called downstairs and they said they could do nothing about it. At this point I was furious as they wouldn't even give us a roll away bed because they don't have any. 

Later that night we were crammed and irritated. I went down and spoke to a very nice gentleman who was a night manager. He was understanding that I demanded another room. He moved us to a 2 queen bed room. Seriously if it wasn't for that manager I would be writing a 1 star review. 

The room was pretty nice and really clean. It was also really spacious and had plenty of room for 4 girls to get ready. The resort is beautiful. I'd recommend this place overall just make sure you know what type of room you're getting  before you drag your stuff up to the room.

background: I've stayed at over 10 different strip hotels. We try and stay at new ones every time, and this is low on my list. 

PROs: large with lots of variety of quality restaurants, bars, and gambling options. There are a few liquor stores around that you can go grab some bottles for in-room pregaming. There's also a small food court which is nice if you want to grab something cheap and quick. 

CONs: DO NOT STAY in west wing. It's about a 20-25 minute walk to the pool, feels like you're in a prison cell, has absolutely no view (concrete wall), the windows are tiny, we didn't get our room cleaned once (and we were out of the room the entire day), and the bed was rock hard. there is also basically no bathroom privacy - so don't stay with friends if you need any sort of discretion while changing or getting ready. the bathroom is practically in the living room with no door to shut. 

the check-in line is absolutely absurd (expect 30-60 minute wait to check in), and we are M life members and asked for a new room once we got to ours, and they wanted to charge us an extra $15 a night. Really?! you can't waive that for guests that are unsatisfied and gamble at your casino all week? It's not like we asked for an upgrade - we just wanted an actual window that we could see out of, as opposed to a literal concrete wall. 

the pools are luxor quality. sure, there are a lot of them, but they are stuffed with kids and aren't impressive. the adult-only pool costs $35 to get into per person, and no, that's not a dayclub. just a regular pool. the lazy river is gross - its a 70%\/30% ratio of kids to adults, there is liquor in the water, and gross people's feet dangling off tubes all over the place. absolutely don't go in without an inner tube, which is tempting since they cost $20 a day to rent. additionally, the cocktail list at the pool is flimsy and unimpressive. and they spend 60-90 seconds digging through your bag on the way in. Made me feel like going through airport security, and i STILL saw a group of young people with a plastic handle of phillips vodka by the pool. 

For this price point, please please stay at the Mirage. Better location on the strip, MUCH better rooms, a more quiet and luxurious pool, great pool cocktails, and far less children. The MGM is way too big and the quality very clearly suffers because of it.

All I can say is how disappointed I was with the service. First of all, when we checked in we were not greeted by the clerk behind the desk. Ed, simply asked for a last name, i.d. and credit card which I handed over. The next 10 min passed without a word from him and next thing I knew my husband and I were handed a key card. I know these folks see a lot of people come in but that doesn't allow you to be rude. We had a reservation for an Executive Suite and were not even asked if a regular room would be ok. When we brought it Ed's attention he seemed surprise. Not sure how he could be because the reservation said Executive Suite. Then he disappears for 20 min without saying a word. When he finally came back he said there were no rooms available but that he would waive the resort fees and give use a $100 credit. We hesitantly agreed because I didn't go to Vegas for my birthday weekend to fight about a room. So we headed to our room and then to the pool. We had a great time with the exception of the waitress on the second day of our stay at the pool. She rudely ignored us while talking to another group of "older" people for over 20 min about where they were from. I get you cant please everyone but if I need to order something I don't want to be rudely ignored and then see you "hustling" and trying to get a bigger tip from someone else. When she finally did take our order, she brought our bucket of beer and left it for us on someone else's lounge chair without saying anything. My husband and I go to Vegas at least a few times a year, we will NEVER stay here again. We stay at Aria all the time and regretted our whole weekend at MGM. 

Now to start on the room. Our floor was so noisy. Both nights we were here we had drunk random people banging on our doors and yelling in the hallways at all hours of the night. We caught two girls smoking in the hallway of our non smoking floor, who just threw their cigarette butts in the carpeted hallway. When an MGM member came by he simply walked passed the lit cigarette butt and continued taking on his phone. 

As mentioned before, we learned our lesson and will never stay here again. 

Oh by the way, the $100 resort fee that Ed said he would give us was actually only $75 because we already had a $25 resort credit on our room. So he just told us what we wanted to hear I presume so he could be done with us at check in. This place is a joke. For a respected and appreciated stay go to Aria, you won't regret that choice!

As a fan of MGM this latest stay 3-4-16 to 3-7-16 I was charged for smoking when I don't even smoke... I don't vape. This is some BS! This has completely changed my opinion of MGM Grand. I have had mold in my room, I have had foul odors but this experience takes the cake. 

I will NEVER stay at this over priced POS Hotel again. Every time I have came their amenities are not able to be used or are in repairs. The pool was closed the jacuzzi was broken the elevator didn't work the escalator style walk way was broken.. This entire hotel is falling apart.


I am going to make sure every single member my group drops a negative on this hotel. I have called around and another non smoker was charged and he wasn't even in his room!!! This is a scam being ran by MGM

First, we got CHEAP AS HECK room rates (and yes, they add a $23 a day "hotel charge" which takes away somewhat from the great deal).  We got a free upgrade to a Suite.  

ALL and EVERY employee we had any contact with-- from Bell Men, Parking Attendants, Security, Waitpersons, Concierge, Dealers, etc. etc. etc.-- were wonderful.  Polite, friendly, professional.  SUPER wonderful staff.  Very nice and did great.  We liked that.  It was true everywhere in the hotel casino.  The staff were excellent.  And our maid(s)-- did a fabulous job cleaning our suite every day.  Can't say enough good stuff.  Take some of that $$$ away from the stupid "suits" and give the "working staff" all raises.. they make the place great.

Place is TOO DARN BIG.   Just too big.  We rented me a "scooter" and that helped some with my mobility problems.  But it is still just too big.

POOL:  They have a wonderful Floating River.  Takes a good 10-15 minutes to go around the whole thing. Nice staff, nice plantings, etc.  BUT:  This time, July 4th to 9th, there were TOO MANY KIDS-- screaming, running, bumping, obnoxious, loud, horrible KIDS.   They clogged the floating river and the pools.  Ruined that part for us.  Just too much.

"Ka", Cirque du Soleil show:   WOW!   OMG!   A+++++.  Awesome show.  Best of the 7 Cirque shows I have seen.  Just outstanding.  So worth it.  Wish I could go again.  LOVE LOVE LOVE it.  

Restaurants:   Ate at Wolfgang Puck one night.  Wow, the prices were pretty reasonable and food was EXCELLENT, as was waiter.  Next night we went to "Diego" Oaxacan Mexican food... very very good.  Loved the chicken in mole sauce.   Great meal.   Never made it to the buffet.  For breakfast we loved the cafe restaurant.   Hopefully next time we will get to try Joel Robuchon (heard many great things); Emeril's, and other places.

It was clean, nice, pretty, and excelent staff.  Just wish it was a little smaller.   Wonderful place to stay for a great rate.

MGM Grand Las Vegas.... Expectations are pretty high for this extremely popular hotel on the Las Vegas Strip. Unfortunately, my stay here last September did not meet my expectations. I am a little late to write this review, but better late than never, right?

There was no problem with the hotel itself. Hotel is GORGEOUS, every part in my opinion. Casino is HUGE and full of diverse games. The hotel look itself gets 5\/5. 

Getting from the room to the lobby was always a struggle. First off, it takes FOREVER for an elevator to open up and take you to your room. It makes no sense that only 2 of them seemed to be functioning. Since I went in the summer, which is a busy time, it just seems like a poor choice to only have 2 elevators operating. In addition to the elevator issues, our room took 3 minutes to walk to from the elevator. The hallway was SO long. Very inconvenient. If you stay here, request a room close to the elevator. 

This hotel is located pretty far from the center of the strip. The location gets 3\/5 stars.

The quality of the room was pretty good, other than some old stains on the carpet. Overall, the style was very appealing, and the room with 2 queen beds was fairly spacious, with a large bathroom. Room gets 4\/5 stars.

Customer service was where it fell the shortest... Basically, the lady in the gym was incredibly rude, and because my brother and his boyfriend were wearing normal closed-toe shoes (instead of workout shoes), they kicked him out and were very rude about it. I went down there to complain to her, as my brother felt very unwelcomed. She rolled her eyes and had SERIOUS attitude. I then went to the manager at the front desk to complain, and although she was apologetic, she did not offer any compensation... Even offering the smallest thing would have been appreciated. For the money we paid to stay there, I pushed a little compensation, and she comped my resort fee. That was greatly appreciated. However, she was pretty reluctant to do any compensation. Finally, when I asked someone at security for a bandaid, he was so rude and refused to get one for me. He claimed to be a rep for Enterprise Car Rental. I get that he wasn't a direct employee at the hotel, but he is still a representation of the hotel, and should at least be kind.

Overall, my stay here was not horrible. It fell slightly below my expectations. A large hotel, like the MGM Grand, needs to work on listening to their customers and keeping them happy.

love the MGM grand, thanks for comping me for everything!! Free all day buffet, even though their buffet is crap! My room had a walk in shower i dont know why but there was a TV in the wall where the sink was. My girlfriend really enjoyed the spa\/massage treatment... she said it was top notch. They even let me check out 1pm, which was very nice of them. The rooms are huge, depending on which one you get. Try the celebrity suite or anything better, not sure how the regular rooms are but i believe they are just as good since no one ever stays in the rooms.

Hotel room A\/C will only keep the room at 77°, t-stat says 69° room temp. Called front desk after being passed around and they sent someone up to not fix. If you like a cold room, this hotel is not it.     
 Called front desk about no ice and just gave up after 5 minutes on hold. 
  Buffet is complete trash. Hotel rooms are pretty nice

A STRANGER ENTERED OUR ROOM WHILE WE WERE SLEEPING!!!!!!!!

MGM Grand was not our first stop in Vegas. On 6\/28\/17 my partner and I stayed two nights at Luxor (another MGM property) and had a decent time. We enjoyed our time at Luxor for the price and had no complaints for our stay there. For the nights of 6\/30-7\/2 we stayed at The Venetian and had the most marvelous stay\/treatment and will 110% return to The Venetian for our annual trips to Vegas.

For the nights of 7\/3 & 7\/4 we regrettably stayed at MGM Grand. When we arrived, we were a bit taken aback by the $20\/day valet fee, especially after our stay at The Venetian which had free valet, but since we were already there it was convenient - just makes us not want to waste $40 on valet every again. We got into the hotel and, after a 30 minute wait in line, checked into our room which was thankfully clean and ready to go for our arrival at 1pm. We had 4 large pillows on our bed which is exactly what we need. Later in the day, we took a shower and realized our drain was clogged and we were standing in a pool of dirty water so we called the front desk and were told that someone would come fix it for us. After my shower, I began drying my hair with the hair dryer when it suddenly stopped working. Thankfully I had brought my own anyways so I simply switched to using my own hair dryer. We had no other complaints for the day.

Our main concern was our SAFETY when between the time of 10pm-3am someone entered our room while we were sleeping!! We went to bed around 10pm so I know it was after that, and I woke up later around 3am and actually checked my phone at that time. We do not know who the person was as it was pitch black, but we assume they worked at the hotel because they came in pretty noisy like they expected we were gone and I assume they got scared when they saw us so they left. I don't think they realized they woke us up because they "snuck" out trying to stay quiet and did not close the door completely. It took us a moment to realize what happened before we got out of bed, got dressed and went over to the door to turn the deadbolt. Since we turned the deadbolt, we decided to take care of the problem in the morning and finish getting our sleep since we needed to be up early and we were too exhausted and frustrated to try to deal with the problem right then. We woke up and took a shower which was STILL clogged, so either no one came to fix it the day before or they did not double check that they did their job correctly so we had to again shower while standing in a tub full of nasty water. We went down to speak with someone about the stranger that came into our room and they told us they would move us to a new room. They apologized and offered to move us to a nicer room with a nicer view. However, when we moved, the room was EXACTLY the same as our old room, except it was 8 floors lower, not as nice of a view and smelled strongly of cigarettes (we specifically paid more for strip view\/non-smoking), there were dirty dishes outside of our door, the bar snacks were not filled back up which made me worry that they would charge us for them since they were missing, and we only had 2 pillows (easy fix as we just called and they brought us two more). Thankfully we did not have anyone walk into our room the 2nd night, but we were EXTREMELY upset with our stay at MGM Grand and did not feel like anything was done about it. The blame was put on another guest when they said "Oh, it's Vegas and a lot of people are drunk so I'm sure the door just malfunctioned and another guest entered your room and then realized it was the wrong room." Ridiculous answer to an inexcusable high safety issue that should have been addressed better - someone entering someone else's room is a HUGE deal that should NEVER happen.

I usually go to MGM Grand quite often when I find myself in Vegas.  Not for the overpriced food and definitely not to get to see the lions that rarely ever come out from their little habitat there.  It's to take money from the tourists on the poker tables.

MGM opened their new poker room about a few years back (I was there) and it's probably one of the nicer rooms IMHO.  For starters, the room is right in the smack dab middle of the hotel and is quite spacious and roomy.  The tables are spread out enough so that you don't feel like sardines like you do over at the Bellagio poker room.  On popular club nights, you can check out the hot ladies all dolled up walking to Studio 54 which is the hotel's club.  But most importantly for some reason, a lot of fish tend to throw their money away at the MGM and I've been there many a time to catch them.  

As far as restaurants go, there are quite a few places to go within the MGM. Wolfgang pucks, Wichcraft, Diego's for fine dine Mexican and the list goes on and on.  There's even a food court if you feel like a quick slice of pizza of Mickie D's and of course there's the buffet, but theirs is nothing to write home about.

The hotel casino hotel over all is decent but I consider it 2nd tier to all the nicer ones like the Venetian, Bellagio and the Wynn for example.  Still that doesn't mean I don't stay here once in awhile when they send me free rooms in the mail.

Van The Man's Must Do : Watch Cirque De Solei "KA

Expected so much more.. MGM might have been the big boy on the Strip at some point in time, but now it is very much outdated with poor floor\/layout design.

I stayed here a few years ago and it wasn't bad. However, my most recent trip in October 2014 was a huge, huge disappointment. 

I stayed in a Petite King room in the West Wing. There is no better way to describe the room than "petite" and borderline claustrophobic. The room is tiny, poorly lit, and has one window that does not open........  There isn't even a separate door to the bathroom\/shower! As soon as you walk in, the bathroom is to the left right next to a shower and sink. The walls are also kinda thin- I could hear my neighbors' bathrooms flush. 

There is also no mini fridge or coffee maker.. I thought these simple "luxuries" were standard nowadays. 

One of the MOST annoying things about the room was its location. The hallways are ridiculously long (and I'm not even trying to sound lazy; they are just LONG. It takes at least 3-4 minutes walking at a decent pace to get down from one end to the elevator). They are also a bit eerie. 

One "good" thing about the West Wing is the cardio room on the 4th floor. It's free and while it's tiny and sauna-like, it is better than nothing considering MGM charges guests $10 to access the actual hotel gym.

What a disappointment, MGM. Not staying here again. (The Signature Towers, on the other hand, are a complete different story. SO modern and upscale).

I just got back from the MGM and overall had a satisfactory experience.  Not great, not horrible.  Pretty average.

I had my 6 year old with me so granted I was not looking to do any gambling or nightlife this trip.  What I was looking for was a fun pool for he and I to play in and a good location to get to the things we wanted to do.  

The pool is large and honestly, we never had any trouble finding deck chairs whether we went down in the morning or the late afternoon.  I did find that the Lazy River runs out of inner tubes to rent pretty quickly so that was disappointing.  As was the fact that the largest pool and the Lazy River don't open until 10 AM and the Lazy River closes at 6 instead of 8 like the other pools.  

Also, there isn't much in the way of exhibits or entertainment for kids under 12 (minimum age for their CSI Experience) so we ended up going over to the Mandalay Bay, Excalibur, NYNY and the Luxor to play in the arcades and see their exhibits (Titanic, Shark Reef, etc.)

The room was clean and spacious and there is definitely a big variety of kid-friendly dining options at the MGM.  I should mention that the MGM advertises free WiFi and I could get my phone and iPad to find the MGM WiFi signal but I couldn't get online using their WiFi ever.  And the TV will randomly lose signal in the middle of a show....A LOT.  But if you just click the channel up one and back down the signal was back.  Not earth-shattering or vacation ruining by any means.  Just super annoying and worth mentioning I think.

I couldn't be more upset about the changes made to The Grand if I tried. The new "Smellovision"  hits you like a wall of Axe body commercials and never stops. I hid in our bathroom in the Grand Tower room, where even the ac was tainted and trying to kill me. Toxic chemicals give me migraines. We had to change hotels.

Had a late check in and instead of the room that I booked, we were put in an "upgraded" room which was a downgrade in my opinion. As if this weren't enough reason to be irritated, the carpets and walls were thrashed and had looked like they had never been cleaned. Complained but no one cared. Will never stay at MGM again. Plenty of other great hotels in Vegas.

Not to impressed with this hotel. Over an hour to check in. No offer of assistance with a bell hop to our room with all our luggage. 
The casinos are large and the pool is very nice with the lazy river but the rooms don't have coffee pots or refrigerators to put your stuff in. The soap is horrible, smells like crap and they barely give you bathing amenities like some of the other hotels. I have stayed at other places and would not stay here again. I had a better experience at The Mirage.

MGM is GRAND and they are stepping up their game:
*contracting with celebrity DJs
*opening up Hakkasan
*opening up The District, a nice restaurant row, entertainment and retail
*Mlife tier points system, recognizes practically every dollar spent, except for retail
*Thank you for the sheer and blackout screens in the rooms
*updated wing, west wing, love the purple color scheme and the Grand room
*private elevator access
*restaurant collection is one of the best on the Strip
*plenty of pools and chairs for all, I hate struggling to wake up early just to grab a pool chair
*yay for the channal guide, most hotels make you flip through all the stations
*toiletries are pleasantly scented
*plenty of mirrors in the room

Needs to step up:
*cab lines are terrible here, 9 times out of 10, I am hailing a towncar
*buffet, terrible
*casino is SO dated, needs to be completed remodeled
*new poker room please
*need healthy eats, or at least a smoothie place, no smoothies with room service
*pool cocktail gals need access to freshly brewed tea, not just fountain
*need more consistent temperature in the halls and walkways, AC blasts cold air

This hotel \/ casino has almost everything you will need for your Las Vegas trip all under one roof.  However, if you want to catch some of the big name shows (Ka, O, etc.) or check out some other hotel's spas (like TheHotel's BathHouse), you will have to leave the premises for a short walk or cab ride.

Very central location on the Strip.  Nice slots and blackjack.

This is a huge casino complex, so wear comfortable shoes!

I've stayed at the Bellagio, Paris, New York New York before but after staying at the MGM, I've stuck with them. Coming back to Vegas after many years, I still loved it. I hated the floor they put us on which was the fourth and offers no view at all. 
but they changed our room the next day and life was good. The food is pretty good from what i ate of their inroom dining and the fact that they customize orders for you won me over cause generally i find service standards across America to be pretty lousy compared to hotels in Asia and Middle East and even Africa. 
Their check in and checkout lines are awful. To have to start your trip waiting one hour to just get a key card is awful. for as long as they have been in business and with the number rooms they have, i feel its almost unforgivable they they are ok making guests wait that long. And not that they are short on real estate to accommodate more counters and allocate more people to the task. I checked in at 9pm on a sunday and there were 30 people ahead of me and it took over an hour to check in. I checked out on tuesday night at 2 am and there were over 20 people ahead of me and it took over 45 mins to just pay the damn bill. This should be easy to fix guys given the resources you'll have at your disposal. Please don't make your guests start their holiday like this. If its 45 mins to check out at 2am i can only imagine how bad its is at 11am. 
Other than that, i will still only go back here. I do find it faster to go park myself even though its across the street and a 15 min walk compared to using their valet which i have in the past. 
Wifi was free and great to have. Just a little slow at times.

With all the new Vegas hotels popping up yearly, it's definitely making older hotels like MGM look....out dated. 

I'm just gonna shoot off some cons because it really is just a hotel (beds, bathroom, running water, a TV):

- Walls are really really really thin. Our room got yelled at by some lady 2 rooms down telling us to be quiet (side-note: doesn't she know what city she's in?)

- Pool is quite a walk. AND you have to pay for the floaty tubes in the lazy river? Even though we're guests? Just get rid of the lazy river then!! More than half of the people were walking around it anyway! That makes them NOT lazy!

- Parking garage is WAYTOOtiny. I saw a truck back into 2 different cars trying to get out of their own parking spot. 2!! Went down another aisle, and another truck was ding'ing up other cars!! 

I guess that's all I had, thought there were more. I mean, it's ok. I'd stay there again if need be!

First, I'd give the entire place a 2.5 if I could. I was there for UFC 182. Booked a west wing room on hotels.com for $110. Resort fee of $32 is ridiculous. Free wifi is worthless and the upgraded wifi is $49.95! Fuck that. No fridge or microwave in room. Got room service, burger, fries and beer for $30. Typical vegas pricing, average meal. The room itself was small, large shower, and everything worked, wall mounted flat screen. The best thing about the room was that it was short walk to the fight. I really like the grand garden arena. Good sight lines and I like how they stop people from entering between rounds, really prevents people from obscuring your view. Overall, unless the price was stupid low, I wouldn't book here. Mandalay Bay usually has similar room rates and they have much better rooms and better room service.

I haven't been to the MGM since 2003 and after my recent trip to Vegas I can guarantee you it won't be another 9 years before I am back! I was so impressed with this hotel from check in to check out. I arrived at 10:30am on Saturday and was surprised to see our room was available for us even at that hour. We were told we would have a recently remodeled room too. Upon entering the room we inspected it for cleanliness and it was spotless.

We then headed down to the Grand Pool for the afternoon and had a great time. We were again impressed with the fact that we were allowed to bring in our own beer to the pool provided we use their cups. No problem. There were many pools and all were clean and offered a different vibe. Just so you know, don't expect the "lazy river" to be a lazy river you've probably experienced elsewhere. There are hardly any inner tubes in the river and it is entirely 20 somethings partying it up. I was hoping for a relaxing trip down the lazy river, but it was still very fun. 

Thank you MGM Grand for a great experience and for treating us Yelpers so well! I will return for sure.

Booked a room in the grand tower for three people, they gave us one queen bed, no option for upgrade even when I offered to pay more. The room smells like vomit. There's a "scent cube" to mask the vomit smell. There's a few huge clumps of black hair on the shower wall. Hair dryer is broken.  Front desk is not helpful and seems to not care that we're crammed into a room that's too small.  Will never stay here again. Worst Vegas experience of my life.

The stay was great. I love the remodeling and the hotel in general. Ive been here every year and between this and other hotels like elara, the service has dropped tremendously. 

One thing that was in bad taste was that all the drinks and snacks in the fridge have sensors. So if you move some of the drinks around for your own things they will try to charge you. My stay this year, it felt like they were trying to nickel and dime every small thing which was very distasteful in my opinion

Well this hotel has been around a very long time!  I think the last time I stayed here was probably NYE of 2005 or 2006 I think.  And it hasn't really changed much in regards to comfort or style.  The room we got was very nice - a standard King bed room (no view) on the 16th floor!  Comfortable bed and pillows with a cute little chaise and desk. 

My Turn ons:
1) they have a registration desk IN the baggage claim area of the airport. Check in while waiting for your luggage (how frickin cool is that!)! No waiting in line, get your room keys, grab your bags then hop into a cab and jet up to your room! Easy.
2) near the airport.. cab ride is only about $10-12.
3) monorail!!! No more hiking an entire mile just to go to Caesar's Palace or catching a cab for $10 to get all the way across the strip to Wynn or Venetian! For $12, you get unlimited rides for an entire 24 hours! Hop on the monorail to get to the Bally's area, the convention center, LVH, the Stratosphere or the Venetian. However, its hours are limited (http:\/\/www.lvmonorail.com\/)

My Turn offs:
1) even with the convenience of monorail, it's still kinda far from most of the current popular party spots located farther down on the strip (Encore, Venetian or Aria to name a few).
2) there's not a whole lot of variety in restaurants to choose from.

I stayed 5 days and nights for 1k, including a $75 food discount for the top restaurants. Friday-Wednesday, two weeks ago. Clean hotel. Arrived at noon on a friday..went out that night, craps and...shhh! 

Went to sleep at 3am...woke at 8am to loud banging noise to my window 14 flights above ground. Hmmm...please noise go away. Ok, I'll look...pull back drapes keeping me in vampire darkness...ugh cables....cables against my window...oh, suddenly a guy lowers himself and is cleaning the windows. Nice...but I know the policy that on weekends they can't clean until after 11am. So...I get comped later in the day upon my visit to a manager. Yawn....but I did nap at the pool later in the day.

Saw Madonna Saturday night, got into a night club in the hotel after midnight. 

Over all, a good hotel with easy access to the strip and my exploits.

Visited our friend who was staying here and were blown away by the view and the smell and just about everything.  

Again, take my review with a grain of salt because I didn't actually get to stay here, but from what I saw on my visit, the Yelpers were mostly singing the praises of the service and friendly staff.  

Major bonus: the air doesn't smell like vice and sorrow.  The rest of the Strip hotels and casinos take note: You too can make your establishment smell less like shit by perhaps using air fresheners and occasionally vacuuming.

Definitely want to stay at this hotel one day.  Beautiful, inside and out.

This hotel has a great location, excellent access to the strip.  You also get free admission to Wet Republic if you stay here during the summer months, which is a nice benefit.  The rooms here are standard for Vegas, nothing too exciting but who cares, really, you don't come to Vegas to sit in a hotel room.  I haven't stayed in the remodeled wing yet, so I'm sure my rating will improve once I have a chance.  If I can remember right, we were given a few complimentary drink coupons at the front desk when we checked in, which are always a very courteous gesture from a hotel.

It's hard to find parking and far from everything. Staff were friendly and quick to get their check in line moving.. There is no view from our room and is really small. No fridge, no microwave, and no ice maker near by on the 1st west wing...at first I was going to give a low rating but  went to see if they could do some thing for us...

At first she didn't have anything but with the help of her supervisor she found us a room with a view and provided us with a complementary fridge. Talk about keeping their customers happy...

I had an amazing week staying in Las Vegas this year for my birthday. We stayed in the MGM Grand, which is located at the bottom of The Strip and is a prime location for exploration. The lobby was quite grand and beautifully decorated with marble flooring and the MGM lion sat firmly in the centre. The checkin process was relatively quick with the hotel accommodating our request for a room on a high floor, which ended up being on the 14th floor in the West Wing. The checkout process was even quicker as we did not bill anything to the room, so we were able to checkout at one of the express machines and it took mere seconds to type in the details and then lick "checkout", and then we were done! Unfortunately, the sleek and modern décor ended at the lobby as the casino area of the hotel was carpeted and rather dark and dated, and desperate for a modernisation, especially when compared to other hotels like Aria, Flamingo or even The Signature at MGM. However, the tiled flooring did reappear around the shops and food court area but still looked rather dated up until you arrive at the steps to the pool and Wet Republic. You would also find here the entrance to access the three Tower Blocks of The Signature.

The hotel had great facilities, and massive pool area with a lazy river and multiple intimate pools sporadically planted around. My only critique was that they had no parasols, which in 40 degree heat is essential protection against sunburn. I believe this to be a huge health and safety issue, and the best cover could only be found behind a palm tree or along the side of a building. Providing guests with shade should be a priority for any hotel guests who want to lounge by a pool. What I found great about spending time by the pool was the waiter service, having a cold drink brought to you was perfect! Guests could pay by cash, card or charge to room, so plenty of options. With multiple pools to choose from, guests could take a dip in a small one or go for a swim in a larger one. The pools also played music all day, which gets you into that party spirit.

A tip for all guests looking for a little more relaxation, or with young families, then you should check out the pools at The Signature. As MGM guests, you can use the whole facilities, which includes access to the three towers of The Signature and their pools. These pools are small an intimate, full of loungers with parasols and the pool is completely in the shade until around lunchtime.

As for our room, it was relatively small, and despite being on the 14th floor, the view outside was an obscure one of The Strip though a small window, which couldn't be opened. I was disappointed with the dark décor and lighting in the room as it kept the room looking quite unwelcoming, despite the full length mirrors in each corner! The bathroom area wasn't designed very well as the shower and toilet were separated into two cubicles and one more annoyance was that the bath towels were stored on a shelf\/rail above the toilet, so you had to leave the shower and then go into the toilet cubicle for a towel, which was very impractical, unless you hang the towel outside the shower door; but who thinks about doing this every time they shower? And again the lighting in the bathroom area was relatively poor. I think this was because the room didn't have ceiling lights!

Other issues I had with the room compared to what I am used to are: The safe is completely impractical as it is tall and narrow; it is as if the hotel has installed a floor safe in the wall within the wardrobe. Secondly, the hotel does not have tea & coffee making facilities or fridges in the rooms, which initially, I didn't think would be an issue as an experience traveller, I took a travel kettle and cooler bag, which I kept filling up zip-locked bags with ice to keep our water bottles cold. However, after a couple of days, this became a huge annoyance. Would it be that much trouble to have these facilities when even three star hotels have these.

Wifi was a bit tricky to access in the room initially, and after 48 hours, we had to login again and had constant issues, either not connecting at all or slow speeds and not loading. Pain! Another disappointing factor was that our room was not cleaned on the first day.

Overall, the hotel was ok and quick to address our concerns and questions. It had great facilities. The pool area was fantastic (despite the concern about shade!), but the ability to use the facilities at The Signature was perfect! Coming back to Vegas, I would opt to stay at The Signature, and I would recommend this to others as the rooms here are bigger (from what I have read!) and you have a microwave, tea & coffee making facilities and a fridge in the rooms, which is great for bigger parties. You also have a more modern hotel and relaxing pools, and you still get to use all the facilities throughout the MGM complex.

We reserved a King suite with a strip view and received a confirmation number.  When we arrived at 4 in the afternoon we were told they GAVE AWAY OUR ROOM.  They told us there were no more rooms like that and we would have to take a regular King room and was told it would have a strip view.  They said they would refund the difference and give us a $50 food credit.  We said we wanted the room we reserved and they said it was impossible.  After speaking with a manager we still had no choice.  We went upstairs to find the view was of a roof top and a few airplanes.  We complained again only to be put in a room that was on a higher floor but still a rooftop and still a standard king room.  NEVER has this happened with any type of reservation we have ever made elsewhere.  If for some reason what we have reserved is not available we have been given an upgrade NOT a downgrade and the upgrade would be at no extra charge since it would have been the company's fault not the consumer.  This was our first trip to Vegas and wanted it to be luxurious.  What a joke!  No more rooms than what we ended up with?  Isn't this the hotel with over 5,000 rooms?  No way will we ever stay at this hotel again and we will be sure to let everyone we know about their terrible guest relations!

MGM Grand is a great place to stay! I never had a bad experience here. The rooms are nice and the people that work at the MGM Grand are really nice. They have the best pool in Las Vegas ( well I think its the best). They also have a lions exhibit in the middle of the Casino so if you have kids make sure you stop by there! But I warn you there are always pushy people at the exhibit they have to act like they never saw a lion before!

Thank goodness for winter deals in Vegas. My friend and I stayed here for one night back in December in a standard room for $69, a room that usually goes for more than a $100 a night. The room itself was wonderful, comfy beds and a lovely view of the New York, New York casino. And as someone who's used to sticking with the Excalibur Hotel across the street for the dirt cheap rates, I was relieved to stay in a hotel where I could actually enjoy the dining options. There's a Rainforest Café, and lots of classy looking restaurants I can't afford, like the ones from Tom Colicchio of Top Chef fame. There's a pretty cool bar here too called Centrifuge that's a good place to get a drink and people-watch. I'd definitely want to stay here again if I can find a cheap rate again.

PSA For All Thieves: GO ON AHEAD AND DO YOUR WALLET OR PURSE SNATCHING HERE. THE SECURITY DOESN'T INVESTIGATE AT ALL. 

After waiting in that enormous line to check in, I just wanted to relax and play some slots. Literally, the first machine we sat down at, some guy comes sweeping by and grabs my purse. He was gone in an instant. I notified the slot machine attendant who lazily walked over to the security desk. They couldn't have been less concerned. The security guard questioned the witness who saw the man take my purse, but not once did he ask her name or contact information. They never even asked me what my wallet looked like!

Now the runaround began for us. We went to go talk to the casino investigator who wouldn't even check the cameras. We were told what they caught was "random." Yeah right. The investigator told us that we needed to file a police report for them to do anything. 

Next we were sent to the hotel manager, Alice C.  I have never encountered such an incompetent manager. All she offered to do for us was call the police. After 45 minutes of waiting on hold, Alice asked if we wanted to go "enjoy ourselves in the casino" instead of calling the police. I was livid at this point because she was so insensitive to make a comment like that and kept referring to "the lost item."  No! It was freaking stolen. Finally, I got ahold of the police and got a police report number. They said that it was the MGM's JOB TO INVESTIGATE. When I told Alice that she said, "Oh, do you want to file a report with us?" I about lost my mind when she said that!

So the investigator comes up to the front desk where we are and brings some useless paperwork for us to fill out. He starts filling out a report too but has YET TO ASK ME WHAT MY PURSE LOOKED LIKE (he never did, btw). My husband asked, "why weren't you filling out that report an hour ago when we talked to you?!" He mumbled some answer like, "I was going to after you guys left." Yeah right. They couldn't be less concerned. 

We never heard from anyone regarding my purse again. 

Later, a bartender said that stuff gets stolen all the time there. Good to know. 

So like I said before, thieves have at it at the MGM. They could care less!

I love the MGM and my rating is actually for 3.5 stars.  The only reason I can't go full 4 star is the West Wing...I still have some minor tremors from its creepiness.  I absolutely hated the small, single windowed rooms (I'm talking one tiny, prison-like window).  I hated the corridors with low ceilings and overall, just was displeased with the entire West Wing portion of the hotel.  That being said, I loved the pools, the amazing restaurants options, the lounges and the sports book.  Oddly enough the standout for me at the MGM is their video blackjack machines!  They have the few on the strip that let you split aces and double-down (all the fun things).  Believe it or not, the only two other hotels I've been to that have those options are Mandalay Bay and Treasure Island (let me know if I'm wrong?).  The bartenders were helpful and fun and handed out those Fiji waters like they were candy.  I'm staying there again next month and will be sure to request the main tower of the hotel.  See you soon, video blackjack machines--I'm coming for you!!
Finding an open table in their cramped food court is as delightful as anal bleaching, theoretically speaking.

ABSOLUTE MESS! Good luck trying to find the front of the casino, construction everywhere, line of a-hole taxis that wraps around the casino, no entrance! "MUST TURN LEFT" there's no way to actually pull up to the front of this nightmare. Circled this labyrinth of nonsense twice just trying to pick a friend up who was unfortunate enough to be stuck there. I will never go here again. No signs, everyone should just have that magic intuition to know you need to disregard the tiny no left sign, cut off the taxi cab and go down some unlabeled street.. Thanks for wasting half an hour of my life in traffic for no good reason! Why trust a casino that can't afford an illuminated sign?

I get that it was the 4th of July weekend so the hour in line was expected.  However, knowing that it would be busy, you would think they would staff the other venues in the hotel appropriately, especially the pool.  Waited in a ridiculous line to get float tubes, then they pulled the bait and switch.  "Oh, we ran out of small tubes for $12 so we only have the large ones for $20" even though that's nowhere on the sign.  Then they have one person inflating the tubes with a huge line.  No real plan on opening the gates to the lazy river, so it didn't matter if you waited patiently at a middle gate, when they open the side gates people just sprinted to the seats near you that you had your eye on.

Room was average, saw plates sitting in the hallway for a few days and saw a roach in my room.  Missing one remote in the two rooms we rented, didn't bother to call since we tried the concierge for something and they never answered.  Bottom line, I'd stay somewhere else next time, the only thing the place had going for it was Ka the show.

When visiting Vegas we have primarily stayed at Mandalay Bay, first time to MGM Grand.  Taxi right to the front door as it should, front entrance and lobby well kept and looks good. Check in process was smooth and the desk clerk was professional and helpful. Short distance to the elevator, nice when you have a lot of luggage. We were there for a week on floor 28, room 134. On the negative side, room was obviously old, stained carpet, view not clear due to advertising banner over the window, heater did not work, wall paper damage, dried splattered something on the art over the desk. On the positive side, layout was good, internet connection was satisfactory, and the cleaning service did a great job. Every single staff member we met in the hotel were enthusiastic, helpful, and friendly whether it be room staff, bartender, wait staff, casino cocktail waitress's, or whatever. Also, when we found out the pillows were feather they replaced them immediately as my wife is highly allergic to anything & everything fowl. Hotel had a great layout, plenty of great restaurants both high end and for budget minded. We tried 7 or 8 of them but not the buffet as my wife and I are just not into the buffet type dining. Had our best meals at Michael Mina Pub 1842 and TAP Sports Bar, but even though it did not make best meal for us Crush & Fish House has outstanding service. 
There was lots of shopping options and shows. I have been to Vegas about 25+ times, but our first time to see David Copperfield and it was the highlight of our entire week in Vegas. Great sports area for betting even won some money. Sweet!  For the first time joined the M-Life program. In short loved the casino, restaurants, shopping, hotel in general, just didn't think much of the room.

Staying at the MGM this time around on my trip wasn't so much about getting a quality room, but more about the perks and bonuses that came with booking your room. You pretty much have a city built inside the hotel, and you will have everything at your disposal. The night before we stayed at the Signatures, and we knew the move wouldn't be that big of deal. Its about a 10-15 min walk from the towers of Signatures to MGM. 

The room itself definitely lived up to the name. Beds were very comfortable, showers were large enough and had good source of hot water and there was even a desk and a couch for you spend time away from the beds. I hate hotels where the only thing you get is just a bed, it reminds me of motel 6. The only gripe I have is that the room's TV is still the old school tube. Most hotels now days atleast come with a flat screen. I m sure the West Wing has it hooked up like that.  Other then that, the room was great! 

As far as amenities and perks, I will start off by saying I saved about $150 off the cover at Wet Republic. I got a special which gave us free access, and we were able to use it towards LDW 09 Monday.  Next we saved an additional $40 off the all day buffet. We got a 2 for 1 deal, so I only had to pay for one person.  We could've saved more if we went to Tabu, but we got hook ups at XS.. so we weren't going to mess around.   All in all, we got almost $200 worth of perks, and I paid about $58 after tax for my room. I think it was a great deal. 

Im definitely going to come back to the MGM if they run deals like this again. Would I pay $199 a night here? Nope. $52 a night with all the perks.. hell yes.

There are so many things that go into a casino hotel. For me, it was a place to crash in Vegas. The price was cheap and the room was clean.

I love that parking is free at the hotels along the strip. The MGM grand parking is plentiful and pretty easy to navigate. Unless you park in the garage, you might not know there are a few shops and food places on the lower level. Nothing worth making a special trek down there, but if you want ice cream or breakfast or a souvenir, you can find options there.

We happened upon the lion habitat by accident. There were a couple of lions and a lot of people taking pictures. If you've ever been to a zoo, there's not much else to see here.

The casino floor is clean and vast. We wanted to play roulette but the only human attended table was a $25 min table. We stood watching a bit and decided to put in a single bet just for fun. As we were taking our money out, the dealer immediately told us that there were cheaper tables on the other side of the casino. She gave us a bit of an attitude so we left to go find the other tables. Sure, there were other roulette tables, but none were open. We wandered back and then returned to the "too expensive" table to place our single bet. We played a bit of blackjack but had to leave since we were just trying to kill an hour before we checked out.

I was a little disappointed with the signage for all restaurants\/areas. We had to wander through the casino to get to the West Wing exit so we could catch a tour shuttle. Some signs said West Wing and some did not. Totally confusing.

We also wanted to try a dessert from one of the restaurants but we didn't want to sit down for it. They do not let you take out or get items delivered to your room. Bummer.

The hotel is nice and cost-effective. But there's nothing to make me recommend it over any other hotel I've stayed at on the Strip.

MGM Grand Hotel is a sure shot on The Strip. 

Truth be told, I am not a huge proponent of Las Vegas. A weekend every 2-3 years is plenty for me. That said, MGM Grand is always the first place I look to when booking a room in Sin City and has been for years. The amenities are on par with just about any other Resort\/Casino on the Strip and MGM is one of the few Hoteliers that offers everything in one location from Michelin rated restaurants to nightclubs to shows and even has Nathan's Hot Dogs in its bowels. You really do not have to leave the MGM in order to have the full Vegas experience and I suppose that is what keeps me coming back. 

I stayed most recently over a weekend to attend a bachelor party and yes - it did get well out of control - but I had a fantastic time. This was the first time I was able to stay in the Skylofts and I think it has ruined me when it comes to staying in the regular suites. Skyline views, walk in closets\/bathrooms, a pool table, they even have a dedicated Butler for each Skyloft to assist you in any way imaginable (it helps to tip them $300.00 off the bat - you will want for nothing). The service is truly impeccable and we were partying like Guns & Roses circa 1987. This is the only way to do Vegas, but it certainly doesn't come cheap. 

Age has taken a toll on the facade of the MGM Grand, during daylight hours the exterior reminds one that this Resort was opened in 1993, it badly needs a fresh coat of paint and the windows are in need of washing. Once the night comes, however, the MGM Grand looks like it was opened last week. 

Outside of that, there is very little to not like about the MGM Grand and it will remain a stand by for my Vegas debauchery along with Wynn and Encore. I definitely recommend staying here if your travels take you to Vegas.

We have a two bedroom suite.   Check in was fast but the hotel needs a make over.  We were expecting the newer side but this was okay.  Far walk from everything.  I don't think I would recommend this to anyone.  If it were really clean and upgraded then I would overlook the walking distance.  Valet was quick.  Bathroom floors are freezing!!!!

Just stayed here and it was great. The beds were very comfy and we loved the Lazy River. I don't think this would be a good place for kids though. I think The Flamingo is great for kids and they have a fun pool too with slides. MGM is the Party scene! We went out for my sisters B-day and it was great, we booked through Vegas.com and they gave us a $75 food and beverage voucher with our room which went pretty fast but was still cool that they gave that. No complaints and good proximity to other clubs\/ hotels on the strip. I am glad they took the lions out...it didn't seem they were happy. The club they put in their place we didn't go to but it looked really cook, maybe next time.

Stayed in the newly renovated Grand King rooms, and they were very nice.  Lots of room, modern and clean, and best of all we were fortunate to have been situated in a quiet location.  The entryway light didn't work, however.

Check-in was long and arduous.  Had to wait in a long snaking line for almost an hour.  There were only 4-5 check-in stations open and over 100 people lined up!

Valet parking also took forever (dropping off and picking up).  I guess it's a large hotel, but they were clearly understaffed.

Overall, I would definitely stay here again.  Just hope they hire more workers.

The resort fee is a joke of course - the internet was very slow - my 3G Sprint phone was faster (and if you know how slow Sprint 3G is, you know that's slow...)

My stay was during the winter so it does not include the pool party portion.
The casino is vast but not circular in design so you always need to go back to the start. 
the dealers are good folks and fun to play with.
The rooms are old fashioned, this is the case with most classic hotels, the good rooms are in the new far away towers and the classical rooms are in the near the casino towers.
The bad news is the relocated poker room, its just a few tables in the pathway, no longer and actually room like the good old days a few years back...

Our first visit to this hotel. Very nice. Spacious double queen room with a view of the strip and the airport. Loved it! Also, the employees here are very welcoming and polite. Anywhere we roamed, we were greeted and served by professionals. Only one issue with our hotel room. The faucet handle in the tub kept coming off. We left it off so the maid could see it, but she never called maintenance for it. So we dealt with it during our 4 night stay. Also, their bathroom sink and tub kept backing up. Apparently they have very bad clogged drains. Just running the water for a bit would give anyone a clue this was an issue. Again, the maid did nothing to fix it.  Oh well.
Hotel is too big. Very crowded. Very long walk between rooms and conference center. Long lines.
Great hotel. Better service.  Out hostess went out of her her way to upgrade us for our friends birthday. The weekend was fantastic.

Writing this as I am laying in a very comfortable king wishing that 11am wouldn't come. I was very hesitant about staying here since there are so many awful reviews, but I personally had an amazing stay here at the MGM. I arrived Thursday, July 27th and only waited about 15 minutes max to check in. I was worried since it was 1pm and a bit earlier then checkin time, but I was accommodated thanks to Angelita. She was so pleasant, informative and provided great customer service! Otherwise we stayed in the Grand Tower which the grand king did not disappoint (didn't have much of a view on the 25th floor) but nonetheless the room was very clean and comfortable! The pools are nice and accommodate everyone from children, young adults to seniors. I also loved their buffet which was delicious and very satisfying! The location is also prime on the strip! Overall, this whole stay was a win and I can only hope the terrible reviews don't deter you from staying here at least once!

Quite the weekend in the Celebrity Spa Suite...It could be nicer, but it did us VERY well!

I'll see you there, darlings!

The MGM Grand is a great place to get a fun overall Vegas experience, but don't expect all the "bells and whistles."
This is my second visit to MGM.  The property is located in an excellent location with access to most of the casinos on the South end of the strip. 
The Spa is amazing and the Pool area is big and well laid out.  I was a little disappointed at the West Wing accommodations as I had expected something a little more lush based on the advertisement and price.  
The cafe by the pool was awful and overpriced.
On the plus side, Wolfgang Pucks restaurant and Circe Du Soleil's Ka, both located in GMG, are definitely worth the upscale price.
If you are looking for great access to the strip and a well rounded introduction to Vegas, the MGM is a good choice.

i was incredibly happy with the price i paid for the rooms here ($72\/night).  being that it was the holiday season and all, i was nervous about having to spend over $100+ a night for a hotel right on the strip, but luckily i found an online deal.  yay for our wallet and also double yay for impressing the out of country relatives with the grand lobby.  it wasn't bellagio or anything, but apparently big hotels like the ones in las vegas don't exist in new zealand- so it doesn't take much to impress them.

check in was a breeze, and the lady was even nice enough to make sure that the rooms i ordered were right next to each other.  this particular hotel is a little far from certain sights [like the bellagio fountains] and you kind of have to traverse shadier areas in order to get to the miracle mile shops... but with a few younger kids in tow, all they really wanted to see was the m'm and coca cola store [which is right next to the hotel]... so that's good!

will probably stay here again if i get another good deal.  everything was clean and tidy- i had no problems at all during our stay!

Make SURE they don't put you in the South Tower unless you want a trash can for a view. You also feel like you are underground. Not my idea of Vegas! This is a maintenance tower w a strange & shady entrance. You can even take the elevator to the basement where service stuff was. It was my first impression of MGM and it wasn't good. However, their customer service gets an A+. They were very accommodating and moved us to the Grand Tower where the entrance is beautiful and we have a decent view now. Still not the best view and not the greatest hotel. The bath tub is super shallow. I think I prefer the Mandalay Bay.

We had an enjoyable stay at the MGM Grand Hotel.  The rooms are very nice, modern, and comfortable.  We didn't have any issues while we were there at all, and the staff was very friendly.

The only negative was that (I agree with another reviewer on this) it is a VERY big hotel.  It took us about 15 minutes to get to our room each time we entered the building.  

The pool area is phenomenal.  There are several pools to choose from, with the lazy river being the highlight.  If you want a tube though, you will have to pay $16.  If you are staying for more than a couple days, I recommend just buying the smaller tubes that they have for purchase.  They are a couple bucks cheaper, and you can keep them and use them every time you go to the pool.

I was a little bit disappointed that the lions weren't there anymore!  Last time I was in Vegas, that was such a fun highlight for me!  They do have a lot of other entertainment on site though.  If I had more time (and if tickets were a bit cheaper), I would have loved to see David Copperfield's show!  

Overall, the pros far outweighed the cons for our stay and I would recommend this hotel.

I stayed at MGM Grand for the first time on Nov 2-4. The hotel was okay, rooms are decent. I stayed in both the basic Queen room and the Executive Queen Suite. Basic Queen was nice and clean. The Executive Queen Suite was nice as well. It had both a bath and a shower, and a couch. I found that it was nice to have a TV both in front of the couches and in front of the beds. I enjoyed the black out curtains in both rooms, unique and fun. I now know what type of screens I would like for my home. 

The portion of my stay that was horrendous was the service at the front desk. I was visiting vegas for a Bachelorette party. I described the situation of how I need to check in now, but would like for them to give the room keys to the other main person under the room (she was the maid of honor and was surprising us\/kicked us out of the room until the surprise was ready). I asked the front desk man if he understood what I was asking and if everything was fine. He agreed all was fine (but honestly I felt like he was staring at me listening to some story and thinking I was an idiot or something). 30 minutes later, I receive a phone call from the maid of honor and her mother that we were not checked in. I had to walk quickly\/ run back to MGM from Cosmopolitan to deal with the incompetent front desk. As I almost arrived to MGM, I received a text from the maid of honor's mother telling me that she spoke to a supervisor and that we were checked in now. I still was told to retrieve some keys, so I continued to the front desk. When I arrived there, I was told we weren't checked in and asked them to check us in. I don't know how many times my party has to say CHEK US IN for MGM's front desk to understand. They are incompetent and need retraining. Their customer service skills need to improve (although some were fine) and they need to work on listening to the client. The second person I spoke to that actually checked me in said he would let his manager know of the situation, but my party never received any apology for their incompetence. 

The best service at MGM was the concierge. They really went above and beyond to help the maid of honor with the surprises for the bride to be. It included room service with tasty treats and champagne to celebrate, chocolate covered strawberries and a surprise gift, which included more alcohol and martini glasses we could keep. 

The other great part of MGM are the managers. They have that position for a reason. I spoke to the MGM front desk manager over the phone. I expressed their need to improve their customer service skills at the front desk and explained everything I had went through with MGM. DId i mention, I was my first visit and I was horrified? He was extremely kind and interested in figuring out what happened. He thanked me many times and appreciated my input in helping improve their front desk service. I just wanted to let them know how terrible my front desk experience was, the apologies are nice, and if the manager gets to the bottom of which guy sucked at life.

So to stay at MGM or not to stay? you COULD... If their front desk improves. Concierge was awesome so if you do have a special event, you know you can count on them. I say use a coin and toss. 

on another note, do all hotels not have microwaves? or do you have to request one? Is that even an option?
Great hotel- it is HUGE. But being on one end of the strip it's quite a treck to get anywhere by walking. This place has everything. Very beautiful . Pool is great!

Still a top hotel choice for me to stay at anytime I'm in Vegas. Everything I could want is under one roof.
