We can't say enough good about it , it also means alot to us , we will always stay at the MGM , give it a chance it's great !

This hotel is starting to get on the old side, but the prices are coming down because of it.  It is still my go-to Vegas casino because it has such a great poker room, a solid location, and a great fast deli to get corned beef.  The comfort of the room is probably upper-mid quality of Vegas, as the only important aspects to me are a really comfortable bed and nice bathroom, because you shouldn't be in the room anyway!
Solid hotel.  The SkyLoft suites were pretty darn impressive.

Good location. Has both expensive and low cost food. Something for everyone. Bed is comfortable. They just need new tvs!! Tube tv is so 90's. Hotel is always clean and rarely do I smell smoke in the casino. Resort fees are  a joke especially since the tubes are outrageous to rent for the lazy river. They should be included complimentary.

Hello,

I have complaint about  recent stay at MGM. I resevred a room for King size but we only got two queen beds at the time of check in and the tub was plugged and leaking. Therefore, we are really unhappy and not satisfied with this stay. Also, we were at the slot machines for hours and at the end the point were not.recorded. Please get back to me ad soon ad you can to reimburse us as we are truly unhappy about this stay.

The rooms were nice and clean, the service was good, and the beds are comfortable.  The Casino is pretty easy to navigate around and there's plenty of places to eat as well. The decor is a little gaudy but it's Vegas.. The room service menu seems a bit limited but at least they have late dining. The breakfast was decent.

Wow is all I can say. We have visited MGM the last few years and it seems like it's gone downhill. We started out with a room that had a broken handle for the shower.  The following night the faucet leaked. Maintenance couldn't fix it so we left it broken until we checked out. MGM didn't even take care of  the room but ended up giving us a credit for food to go back to. Really ? You would think they would like us to leave happy. Is this the way to keep us happy and coming back?

I gave the MGM one because they are giving David Copperfiend a stage(although a very poor one)  to rob people of their money. Showing a youtube video of yourself for $15 minutes after you just rolled out of bed is not a show. Its highway robbery for people who paid for the tickets. 

Has anyone at MGM seen the copperfiend show, you people should be ashamed of yourself. Drop this clown please. 

Also, this place need more ventilation to clear the smoke.

I was at the MGM Grand for 6 nights ( 6\/17 - 6\/23) for EDC. I have to say the stay was amazing and the room service was one of the best i'ver ever seen. Saw Hardwell at the Wet Republic. my only complaint was that the alcohol at the pool party was a bit over priced but what can you expect being on the strip in the middle of the summer!

Hello,
 I hate to give this review to MGM, however Mlife is representing you. am a current Mlife member and I wanted to reach out after feeling very disappointed with the service I have received. My biggest concern is that I am unable to utilize the calendar on your website along with all my current offers to see which weekends I get the best discounts! I was always able to do it before. Now after selecting the hotel along with the offer I want to use, I either get a message that says "Sorry, there is a system error, please call" or I get a message that says "unfortunately the selected offer is not available for the selected dates." I have read the terms and conditions for each of my offers for each of the hotels, I am choosing dates within the availability of the offer time frame. It is easy for an Mlife employee to tell me to call and they can assist, however the problem is that I am very busy and booking online is most convenient to me. Also booking online usually allows me to play with the dates to see which weekends are better priced. I generally decide what weekend I'm coming based off rates, of course I want the best deals and perks that's why I use Mlife. It's One of the reasons I went with Mlife over the other Vegas competitors. 

The other issue I have experienced was actually finding a moment to call and book my one year wedding anniversary stay only to have it cancelled a couple hours later. I had to move a business meeting around last minute so that I could find time to call yet again to see what the issue was with my reservation. I was told my MGM August 5-7th reservation was cancelled because I have another reservation at another Mlife hotel (Aria) that is with 48 hours of each other. I let the agent know that the information was completely incorrect. I will be there on July 29-31st and then August 5-7th, however the two stays are much more than 48 hours apart. The agent confirmed this then proceeded to tell me she had no idea why it was cancelled. That's horrible!! Luckily I was able to find time to call again and luckily I saw the email notification or else my wedding trip to Vegas might not have happened or worst, I would arrived only to find out my reservation was cancelled for no reason. The money was being processed for a refund so the agent asked me to pay a new deposit. I refused as I don't agree with having my card charged twice and have my money tied up because of a mistake you all made. She re-instated my reservation and told me I could pay for the entire reservation upon checkin, which was only the right thing to do. 

The issue with the website is my biggest complaint! I am very busy and not being able to use a tool that you all advertise and claim to make available to your members is ridiculous. It has now been at least 2 months and this issue has not been resolved. The agents also could not help, as they say "that's another department. " I did let the agents know that I booked both of my upcoming stays with,  however nothing has been resolved. I am truly thinking of switching to the Total Rewards program that Caesars Palace offers. I have been on their site and it works with no issues. The Mlife website not working temporarily is ok, things happen, but it has been months with no fix. I haven't been able to book as often as I would like due to this inconvenience and have missed out on some great Mlife perks and offers. There is no use having a reward program that I can't use. Internet works best for me to book! This is totally unacceptable and I am one very unhappy member. If I hadn't got married at MGM last August, I would have chosen a different hotel at full rate. I actually love the hotel or else I wouldn't have gotten married there, however the Mlife service or lack there of is pushing me to the edge. Seriously considering switching to the competition so that I can actually enjoy and use the perks and discounts I've earned.

Yes that's right I stayed at Vegas' version of the Green Monster.  That's right the MGM Grand.  I stayed for a night and just like anywhere in Vegas, you don't really spend much time in the room.  Unless you were able to score more than at the casino.  If you know what I am saying.  So I am not going to spend more time talking about the room.  Because in all honesty it was very nice for me to pass out in.

The casino and retail areas are pretty cool.  They have everything from Cirque du Soleil to your traditional mall food court.  Something for everyone that's for sure.  

However the happening spot to be during this 100+ degree weather is the pool area.  If you happen to be single and looking for some action then this is the place to be.  The pool area is HUGE.  Anytime they give you a map to help navigate you know the area is massive.  Whether your fancy is swimming, hot tubbing (which is crazy during the summer), or lazy river-ing it up then you are at the right place.  Or if you are like me and like to uh "people watch" then check it out!

Also if you plan on checking the strip out... I'd recommend cabbing it somewhere and walking.  Kind of a hike!

Oh by the way for your salon needs make sure you say hi to Darcy at Cristophes salon.

To me, Vegas often smears into a giant mutton-dressed-up-as-lamb Slurpee.  If you're not one of the high rollers, I feel that the service is generally crap, I inhale tons of smoke, and overpay for bagels.  How nice to have arrived at the MGM Grand West Wing and been pleasantly surprised.  Note:  the West Wing rooms are different from the other rooms in the main part of the hotel.  The rooms are nice and modern; somewhat in the direction of the rooms at the various W Hotels, if you've ever stayed there (but put a star next to that b\/c you aren't paying $300+\/night to rest your lil' tired head at the MGM Grand).  The showers and door to the bathroom were frosted glass and there's a TV in the bathroom.  The radio is a nice Bose radio that could devour most other alarm clock radios in other hotels in which I've stayed.  DVD player in room.  Overall, a cool room (we didn't mind being a 15+ minute walk from the parking garage).

There is a great lounge bar called the West Wing Bar on the first floor in this area of the hotel.  The drinks are kind of expensive ($10\/cocktail) but well-built.  The music is cool and they have great couches to slouch around in.  The only thing that could suck for you is that it's a thoroughfare for people to get from point A to point B so there is a lot of foot traffic.  However, we couldn't figure out what points A and point B were.  The key here is whether you enjoy drinking and people watching and making up little conversations about the people who walk by.  Assuming that you aren't confined in a mental hospital, this might be the place for you.  For example, we like weird little things so we thought it was awesome when a guy came by and set two bananas down on a table along with a glass of rose filled with ice.  Why'd he do that?  And then the waitress kept coming by and calling us "kids" and kept trying to help us manage our light sources (lamps), which made us howl when she walked away and try to figure out if she was wearing pants.

When our remote control turned up missing (not a result of over consuming at the West Wing Bar) they brought a new one up in 5 minutes!

The pool complex is great; they have an adults only pool and, although I have no problem with kids, this pool seemed to be deserted...so we hung out there a lot.  They also have a lazy river you can float down which looked like fun but I didn't try.

The casino is like every other casino to me...bling-bling, yeah, yeah, who-hoooooo, Wheel...of...FORTUNE!  Doesn't that WOF slot machine freak you out too?

I'm normally not a big "Vegas fan" but had a fantastic time at the MGM Grand and will definitely make it back there at some point.

Update:  I tried the lazy river.  It rocks!

Best hotel for the price! They have everything here and it's reasonably priced. There are nicer hotels but you will pay double for a room you only sleep in.  MGM has great sized rooms that are clean and the prices are reasonable.  Good location on the strip too.

****A TIP****

If you are staying at the MGM and are going to be spending more than $500 there or in any of their properties (NYNY, Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Aria, etc), make sure you sign up for their Prima VIP program at check-in! They offered it to us, and we got  upgraded to a bungalow suite and a bunch of other perks, including discounted drinks, VIP entry to their clubs, and free gym and spa access! 

****My Review****

MGM is a great place to stay. Here's what I liked about it:

**Hello, there are REAL LIONS in the lobby. 
**There's a Fat Tuesdays in the lower level. A little grain alcohol to start guarantees a good night. 
**There's a stand called 32 degrees in the studio walk that sells $4 jager shots. Also a good way to ramp up your night. 
**MGM has many excellent restaurants, including the only Michelin 3 star in Vegas (there's only 9 in the entire country period), Joel Robuchon. If you have some cash to burn, definitely eat here - it's amazing. NobHill was also good and the happy hour at Seablue is worthwhile. 
**Tom Collichio's Wichcraft: The sandwiches are soooo delicious. They use REAL meat. We grabbed lunch here many times and brought it to the pool. Be sure to get the egg, bacon, gorgonzola and frisée  breakfast sandwich! Go here, not the food court.
**There are 4 bars; some of them offer discounted drinks with the Prima deal.
**The bed is comfy (and bedbug free - yep, we did a full inspection). 
**The bathroom in the bungalow suite is huge. 
**The lazy river is a lot of fun. There are also 5 pools here, including an adult only pool (Directors). We never made it to Wet Republic but I heard it's a fun scene.

Things I didn't like so much:

**Our non-smoking room smelled like stale smoke. 
**The towels also smelled like stale smoke. Even the new ones delivered every day.
**For a suite, I was expecting a flat screen TV. When I opened the entertainment center and saw a crappy 25-inch Sharp from 1990, I was surprised. But, we weren't in Vegas to watch TV so it didn't really matter than much.

MGM is my gambling place of choice just because I usually win money here wether it be slots or tables. I was losing money everywhere last week, but MGM came through and handed me some dough. Thanks buddy o' PAL.

Latest Headlines: The MGM News


Conference attendee hacks off foot to avoid daily 2-mile trek to conference area

Concierge has "best laugh of the day" following a 4am guest call requesting a "quiet floor"

Couple takes bazooka to hotel speakers after deafening, back-to-back 90s songs stir memories of teen angst

Tourist holds up restaurant at gun-point, steals refrigerator to store leftovers in hotel room

Woman adopts 52 cubs after visiting the MGM Lion Habitat

Couple stages soak-in, refusing to leave hot tub until world peace is achieved

Austin man: I saw an authentic mullet, 4 tramp stamps & 5 oxygen tanks at MGM

Study: you must be at least half as intoxicated as the most belligerent fool at the casino, or you will stab him

Woman talked to death by conference waitstaff: "they'll talk to anyone who'll listen, until they're, like, dead"

Mother escorts toddlers through casino at 1am, inspired to rename them Bambi and Destiny

Couple divorces after husband pays $15 daily fee to use hotel gym

Sighted: Cleanest-looking Jesus outside of the MGM entrance

From 9\/13\/15
Came here to hang with fam that was in town. The MGM Grand is actually really nice inside, you have an assortment of restaurants, bars, and it seems pretty easy to get around without getting lost in the casino.

The check in line snaked around the entire lobby. Luckily, it moved quicker than expected, but we still waited in line for about an hour. The front desk tried to up-sell us twice. 

The rooms were really far from the check in. And the elevator situation was confusing. The floors were really long and we couldn't tell which way to go to find the elevators. Signage could be improved. 

The room we got was small. The bathroom area was a really awkward, European style. The door separating the toilet from the room was glass that didn't close and didn't provide any sound protection so I hope you're comfortable with your roommate. The shower door opened away from the counter and didn't really have a place for a towel so I literally stepped out of the shower dripping wet and walked to get a towel above the toilet. The shower had two shower heads. One wouldn't give me hot water. The other whined when I turned up the hot water. 

No free parking for hotel guests?

What's up with the resort fee? Couldn't they include that in the price if the hotel room? It seems misleading.

This was my first time ever staying at the MGM.  All because our birthday girl wanted to stay here.  It is pricey, but appears to be like the main hub for a lot of Vegas activities.  The parking lot is big and kind of confusing, however I was able to find a spot.  Checking in kind of sucked, because we got there early and for an extra $20 we could check into our room earlier.  Boo!  What a rip.

Didn't try out any of their restaurants, so I can speak for those.  I did try the worst club ever, Hakkasan.  Don't even go there!  You should check out the endless river, if you don't feel like forking over $50 for Wet Republic pool party.  That was where I had the most fun, was in the free pool area.

Elevators can be annoying when its super busy.   I did enjoy our hotel room, it was very comfortable and clean.  Slept like a baby in their plush bed.  Their bathrooms were enormous.  If you get a remodeled room, you can play around with the mechanical shades.  Overall, I don't think I'll ever stay back here again, because of price, but I made the most out of MGM.

The place was very clean and had a jungle feel to it as the theme! I loved the lion show and the stores are pretty decent. I like the theme for this hotel and how the huge lion statue is outside. I really want to stay at the MGM sometime.

I gotta admit....I underestimated the MGM Grand. Our 2 bdrm\/2 bath suite was perfect to house 9 girls visiting Sin City for a bachelorette party. It was very clean and updated. We had a bar with mirrors to surround, a round over-sized communal table and sofas, etc. The beds were super comfy and luxurious. We could've slept for days! 

To top it all off, my loving boyfriend arranged a thoughtful surprise with the MGM concierge. Upon returning to the room, there stood a beautiful single red rose in a simple vase. After reading the sweet message out loud....in unison, all the girls said "Awwwwww!!!!". It was a small but very sweeeeet gesture that I will never forget.

A quickie review, but nevertheless this needs to be written... to warn and to educate: 

The crowd is a younger one (20-25), whom apparently have not been told about standard casino etiquette (see: shirtless dudes at the blackjack table)

You decide if this is your scene.  Me, -I know better.  
EXIT, stage left - no, right... oh just get me the hell outta here!

Booked the MGM Grand, thinking that it would be better then the average hotel on the strip. Things started to go down hill fast once we checked in. The room we was giving wasn't what we paid for, the room didn't even have a room number on the door. After going back to the front desk, we were giving another room that had burnt carpet holes throughout the room. The room hasn't been dusted since it opened, Due to the amount of dust piled up on the fridge. The buffet was terrible there was a very limited amount of food to be had, for what was paid for. The slot machines wasn't paying out. This was a totally wasted trip as for as getting to relax. I would recommend that you get a hotel anywhere but this one. I had a friend that stayed at the motel 6 and his room was more cleaner than mine at the MGM Grand. I would totally avoid staying there in the future.

This is a letter sent directly to MGM's CEO James Murren on 7\/28\/2016 after an accident in the hotel lobby. 

On Jul 28, 2016, at 11:37 PM

Mr. James Murren (CEO), 

I'm writing this email to you directly as a very frustrated and disappointed patron of your hotel MGM Grand Hotel.  

Just a few hours ago (on 7\/28\/2016), I brought my wife and two young children to watch the Jabbawockeez show (7pm show) at the Las Vegas MGM Grand Hotel. 

After the show, my family and I made our way to the hotel lobby area to exit the hotel and Uber back to our hotel (Elara).  I was walking ahead with my son, while my wife and daughter trailed behind. 

I turned around and my wife was on the floor after she slipped on a puddle of liquid on the tile lobby floor (in front of the front desk guest reception area). 

As soon as I saw my wife, I ran to her because I know she has a bad knee. In fact, just a few days ago, her left knee cap had slipped in and out and she was forced to wear a knee brace. She said when she slipped this evening on the wet MGM lobby floor, she felt her knee slip in and out yet again because of the fall.  If she didn't have the brace on, we can't imagine how serious tonight's injury could have been. 

Moments prior to my my wife falling, another couple walked through the same area and this female guest slipped and fell.  They were instructed to go to security and as they pointed to the area where the incident occurred, they saw that my wife was now on the floor too. 

The man and woman came over to us on the lobby floor and quickly told us they just experienced a fall on the same location.  It was only after this SECOND slip on MGM property that a grounds keeper came and attempted to wipe up the very big puddle of liquid on the floor.  This MGM employee then suggested to all of us (including the other couple) that we go to the side of reception and file a report with security. 

I'm writing to you to explain in detail how utterly mismanaged this whole process was and how incredibly incompetent your front desk staff was. They responded without any urgency and offered us absolutely no assistance during this entire ordeal. 

After my family moved my wife to a lobby sitting area. I, along with the other couple, walked over to security. We were met by a security employee named "Person 1". This was about 8:35pm. She said she was calling someone to come and take our "report". After waiting 15-20 minutes, nobody came and that is when I pressed her to find someone. I asked for a manager and she got on a call again and told me that a (Supervisor) or (Asst. security mgr) would come down to meet us.  Nobody came. 

At this point, I gave up on Person 1, who was also busy managing lost-and-found issues.  I walked to the reception area and asked sternly for a hotel manager or supervisor because it was very clear nobody at the front desk was even aware that 2 hotel guests has just fallen right in front of their reception desk. 

It was only after my request, that your assistant manager - came over to me.  I explained to Asst Mgr what had happened and he expressed his concerns for the situation but did not offer any real immediate assistance. Instead, he got on the phone and talked for several more minutes while I stood and continued to wait for some mysterious person to take our "report". 

I expressed my dissatisfaction, as any normal person would in our situation, and made clear to Asst Mgr that I would like a hotel manager or supervisor to come and handle this issue promptly.  We were nearing 30+ minutes since my wife's fall and my wife, 2 kids and and I were all getting tired and anxious.  He said if we left the hotel grounds -- there would be nothing he could do for us.  Not the kind of support you'd expect to hear from an assistant manager. 

At this point, a security person ("security person") finally came to the hotel lobby.  Nobody else arrived (as Person 1 initially indicated). Instead security person, a regular security officer (as he explained) came to us. He said he just literally arrived to the hotel and knew nothing of the situation.  He spoke with us and the other couple briefly. We explained and showed him where the fall occurred.  It was clear "security person" was sent to just process the situation. 

I explained yet again to another one of your jr employees how unhappy we were with the hotel's lack of urgency and support. "Security Person" obliged and recognized how frustrating that it was for all of us, but was clear he was in no power to help. He asked my wife if she could walk over to the security office to write up the report.  Really? She just fell on the floor. And her knee cap popped in and out. She was in discomfort  and he wants her to walk over to the office?! After waiting nearly 40 minutes for some help, we get this?!? 

[continued on next review - due to length]

Staying in the MGM from 9\/22\/2016 to 9\/26\/2016, in the Grand Tower with a Strip View.  This place is not what it used to be. Waited in check in line for 2 hours just to get the room. Requested room with no connecting door and was told at check in there was none; room has connecting door.  Was told I would have a great view of the strip (and paid more for the view). Well the windows are so dirty U cannot see the strip.  There were only two towels in the room, so had to immediately call and request more towels. Valet parking now $18\/day + tip.  Room is freezing and thermostat only blows out cold air.  Got the MGM players card (MLife), and they don't even provide a lanyard so you don't accidentally leave it in the machines.  Really???MGM has definitely lost a step.  Will not be staying here ever again.

Hello,

My husband and I recently stayed at the MGM Grand, we had a wonderful time while we were here. The only thing that was disappointing was the shock when we checked in that we would be temporarily charged $200 just in case we trashed our hotel room. We understand why you have to do this, if we would have known this was going to to happen we would have been more prepared. Because of this hidden cost we had $200 less to spend on our vacation. I asked why we were not told about this fee the man replied "because you booked through a third party." This is very inconvenient and upsetting. Because of this we would think twice before booking here again.

We stayed here for 5 days\/5 nights in the West Wing. Let me just say  that in walking past regular rooms (while housekeeping had them open, etc) that the West Wing was SO much nicer than the regular rooms. The furnishings were very modern and sleek, and the bed was SO comfortable. I didn't want to go home to my own bed...but unfortunately, the mattress was to big to carry on the plane.

My only qualm is that the toilet\/shower is just separated by a glass door.  Not the greatest for when you have to take care of...business. We quickly developed a system of turning the water on to cover up any issues that may arise. This might not be the best room to stay in if you're staying with someone that you're not married to, etc. As i said, there's no "dressing area", as the bathroom is open. 

We even had a partial view of the strip from our window, which can't be beat.

Otherwise, i was really really thrilled with this room. I was sad to leave it. I would really recommend staying in the West Wing, if you had a choice.

Had the absolute WORST experience of my life staying here. My husband and I were treated extremely terrible. Make note at check in, you get charged "resort fees" AND they will charge your card $100 dollars a night as a "hold" on your funds. Normally I've always paid resort fees at check-out. Anyways, my husband and I after having a bad flight experience and an even worse rental car experience, showed up absolutely exhausted after traveling all day and just wanted to eat and check into our room. Our bank ended up putting a hold on our funds because of all the out of state charges that showed up on our cards. We arrived at the hotel and were told we could not check in unless our resort fees were paid and it was put on a card with an ADDITIONAL $300 dollars for the "hold." It was 9pm. Our hotel room stay was pre paid through Vegas.com which was $700 dollars for a three night stay. They had their money already for the room that we had paid in full months prior, but told us if we didn't pay the resort fees, we could not stay that night. Are you kidding me? We paid for the room already but we couldn't stay there if the $119 dollar resort fees weren't paid. We were scrambling because our bank wouldn't release the hold on our cards until the next morning. After begging.........literally begging.....and pleading......the "manager" agreed to let us check in with $50 dollars down in agreement the remainder would get paid the next morning. You guys, ALL OUR MONEY WAS TIED UP FROM THE BANK PLACING A HOLD ON IT. Me and my husband had to scrounge and come up with $50 bucks to finally check into our room. We hadn't eaten in over 8 hours and again, had zero access to funds until the morning. I figured we would call room service and charge food to the room and pay it upon checkout. NOPE!!! MGM wouldn't allow us to order room service because we didn't pay the full "resort fees." So we went to bed starving. The next morning we paid the remaining balance of $69 dollars and they placed their lovely hold on our additional $300 dollars. Money we wanted to have for our trip for spending. Again, our hotel room had already been paid for for 3 nights. And this was how we were treated. DO NOT STAY HERE. This place is a joke and clearly do not care about their guests at all. Also, plan on spending a RIDICULOUS amount of money if you want to have an alcoholic beverage at their pool. Notice I said "a alcoholic beverage." Not multiple. I ordered one large pina colada, the husband ordered one as well and a bottle of water........$70 dollars later. Spend your money at a different hotel. This place is a joke.

So..being mine and my friend Mark's first time in Las Vegas, we did not know what to expect from the MGM Grand. 

There have been some terrible reviews on Yelp, some great ones as well. But a lot seem to be based on the time that people had, not the place they reviewed. 

So, I had a pretty good time in Las Vegas. Therefore the MGM was pretty good. Hah! 

The good things about the place - 

*The check-in was not a problem for me. Many people have found it an issue when they have reviewed it on Yelp. I found the staff to be swift in action and super-helpful. We did not even have to wait for too long to see the friendly check-in assistant. 

*The pools were all great, but can get pretty busy in there! 

The good things about the room we had (Main Hotel) were that the bathroom was finished to a high standard and spacious. I loved the view over The Strip. The window sill was nice and low, and had decent headroom. The windows could have done with a clean though. 

I had a great time at the Grand. The hotel is a really good all-round performer, and if the price is right, I will be back there.

This is place is OK. Check in was fast,I checked in at 1 and the room was ready, also did a $15 upgrade to  grand queen from the west wing king. Thank goodness !! I do have some gripes and that was the a\/c in my room, it wasn't functioning properly so it always felt musty and humid. Also, no fridge or microwave! I think it's so annoying that hotels charge $25 per day to use a mini fridge, you would think with crazy resort fees it would be 
included. checkout was fast as well but I think next time I will stay elsewhere and more towards the middle of the strip.

Cons:
-room carpet had stain
-not much to do in hotel
-bathroom mirror had chips 
-No mini fridge
-sound proofing is bad
-linens had stains (not fresh stains)
-towels had stains (not fresh stains)
-not worth a $100\/night

Pros:
-Wolfgang Puck restaurant
-Ka room was good size
-customer service was good
-had access to monorail
-on strip

Ricky the Manager is awesome! He was very kind and professional and made sure we were taken care of after an issue! I definitely recommend you talk to him because he's swift and had great customer service! Definitely made our experience better so thank you Ricky!

I purchased tickets for Chainsmokers (DJ) they told me I wasn't welcome in because I was wearing shorts rather then jeans! Why can't I wear shorts at a club?!

When we were able to get my friends phone got stolen from her purse. The security guards were not helpful.

Great hotel, especially for the Beachbody Coach Summit in 2012 and soon again in 2013.

The rooms are great now that they are renovated and I found all of the staff to be helpful and nice.

Every hotel is going to be huge in Vegas and this hotel was no exception, but once I found my way around, it was easy.

I like that it was so south off the strip and close to the freeway and airport.

I paid less for the newly renovated rooms than the signature suites and I really didn't feel that the Signature Suites were really all that much better except that they have a refrigerator that you can use.

If they can filter their air so that the smoke isn't noticeable at all, they'd be a 5

We had an awesome rate because MGM was a Yelp Spring Break partner.  From the moment we pulled up to the moment we pulled away, we were treated like VIPs the entire time.  First off, updated rooms.  LOVE!  Flat screen TV, lovely decor, comfortable beds, and most importantly QUIET.  For whatever reason, the MGM rooms were quieter than those I've stayed in at the Bellagio.  

Secondly, we were treated to complimentary Veuve Clicquot champagne and sweets.  Yes, please!  Thirdly, every time we contacted the concierge, bell or front desks, we were treated with respect and the utmost hospitality.  Any questions or problems we had were addressed immediately.  We were even able to procure some photos for the Yelp Goose Chase Scavenger Hunt just by asking.  We had a few days to relax and even venture to the pool which was excellent.  I was sad that I didn't get to go to Wet Republic though.  I did hear from someone that the admission is waived for hotel guests but I don't know if that's true or not since it's normally $25.  Thanks so much to the staff at the MGM Grand for treating us so well.  I'll be sure to stay there again next time I'm looking for a hotel on the Las Vegas Strip.

One of my favorites hotels. I've fallen in love with M Life resorts\/casinos because they have the blackjack switch game. Sports galore. Love the lobby area.  Self park is easy accessible. Only thing I noticed is valet service can get full and takes a wee bit more patience when waiting to get your car upon leaving.

One of my favorite places to stay in Vegas! I find the service to be MUCH MUCH better than Venetian... after staying at both places 3x, I would stay at MGM over Venetian anyday. Love the location, love the restaurants (particularly Pearl), and enjoy the poker room. I do advise staying in West Wing.. beds are much much softer, although the rooms are tiny. I rate bed comfort pretty high on my hotel wish list, and the west wing beds definitely deliver.

Very decent to hotel to stay at if your in Vegas on a budget. The rooms are very clean and with a players card more then likely you will qualify for a comp room or a very good discount..The customer service is always quick in check in and great to accommodate any last minute request.. I dont you to valet because it takes at least 20 to 25 minutes for valet to bring your car. As for what there is to do in the hotel there is plenty from of course the casino which I LoVe to gamble at, the tables are low, compared to the Wynn or Palazzo. There is great variety of restaurants to choose from, from McDonalds to Emerald.

The room was nice and clean, beds were comfy, and staff was nice.  My only issue was all the housekeeping staff that walks around the halls all freakin' day long.  It was annoying, on a couple of occasions when we went to our room there was housekeeping staff in there one of the occasions was just after we checked in.  Wouldn't the room be clean already?  I don't like people in my space so it just bugged, but I guess convenient if towels or soap was needed.

MGM has always been one of our main "go-to hotels on the strip."

Located on the south end of the strip, it's a great starting point. We've stayed here countless times, w\/or w\/o kids! The MGM  has been our favorite because of their pool area! Great either with or without kids! 

Our first visit was grand! That was over ten years ago! They put us in a suite, with plenty of room for the four of us! 

Fast forward to present. So we've noticed that when you book a room now, just two of us, no kids, they put you in a smaller room, on the far, inconvenient side of this grand hotel! We upgraded on this last trip because of the bad prior experience. The last stay we had with MGM was at that far side of the resort and the room we had was rinky dink! Oh, and to try to upgrade your room after you check in was a nightmare plus!! 

We knew better this time and upgraded for a fee, voluntarily, upon check in. Hell no! We weren't about to spend four plus hours switching rooms! That's how long it took on a prior visit. So beware! 

We love the MGM but after considering the room that's offered through travel sites and paying upgrades, you may want to check around!

This place gets 5 stars not because it is the nicest place on the Vegas strip or even the fanciest but I found nothing to complain or not like about it. I have been to Vegas several times and I think I have found my go to hotel to stay in. You can get a much cheaper rate across the street at Excalibur but will wind up paying the differences in taxis to get what you want elsewhere as MGM has everything you could need. I stayed 5 nights in a standard room in the west\/grand tower. The room was nothing fancy but clean, modern, and served its purpose in Vegas (to shower and sleep). The resort yes is BIG, yes it can take you 10 minutes to walk to the pool, yes you can get lost here, but again.. it has everything. There are several pools to choose from (wet republic being its own separate entity) and a lazy river. I never had a problem finding a chair at the pools and the waitress service was fast. They also have several bars and a to go counter for food. When entering the pool area there is a casual outdoor café which I wound up eating at many times. The entire menu is available all day, so sushi for breakfast it was! Slightly pricey but what can you expect?? Food was good enough for me to go back to several times. I was excited about the lazy river but there are so many people not using floats in it and just hanging out that it was fun to just walk around and not need one. The hotel has many high end restaurants to choose from none of which I wound up eating at but would love to. Plenty of casual places and a food court to choose from as well. The casino is large and has plenty of options to gamble with. As for nightlife every bar seemed to be bustling when we passed and has the obvious choice of Hakasaan. Huge and popular nightclub right there. I saw Calvin Harris and Tiesto while there, find a promoter and girls get in for free\/guys reduced usually. The staff that I dealt with while there was nothing but helpful and pleasant. If you're looking for a resort that has everything you could need for a decent price stay at the MGM!

Terrible experience all around for us.  The pool area looks cool in pictures but they have zero control over the number of "guests" allowed in the area.  We tried on two separate days to find just 1 open chair, nothing.  The pool area was packed full of idiots spilling drinks and running into each other

The hotel should have more respect for paying guests and limit those who are allowed in the pool area.  We noticed tons of people getting in who weren't staying at the hotel.  Apparently you can get a pool pass or resort ticket or something?  They also apparently let entire groups in all one card.

I can tell you i'll never stay at the MGM or use their facilities again.

Great hotel right on the strip. Stayed in the west wing and rooms were amazing, very modern and comfortable. If your planning a trip see if you can find a deal online, was able to find a pretty good price on expedia. There were a decent amount of food and night life options like studio 54, and it is one of the monorail stops which is super convenient. 

Overall, def a nice place to stay, not sure what the other rooms are like but would highly recommend the rooms in the west wing.

Not as advertised.  I am still confused as to what is the difference between a Grand Tower King and a West Wing King when they are on the exact same floor and the price difference is up to $20-$30\/night.

There is no separation between bathroom utilities as is suggested in the about the room information on hotel booking sites.

The one resort facility I used was the pool.  Nice pools but they need to improve their operation hours.  On their website and pool grounds they post that the pool area is open from 7:30 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  Yet, at 7:30 a.m. only two pools of the five pool areas are open.  Leaving the grand pool, adult pool and lazy river closed to guests until 10:00 a.m.  

Now with a resort fee of $25 and especially during summers with 90+ temps at 7:30 a.m. it would be reasonable to expect that all the pools be open and closed at a later time, possibly 9:00 p.m. when it is still light out.

Instead of checking in at the MGM Grand, we checked in at their location in terminal one baggage claim at the airport.  Only two persons behind the desk, but only one person in line in front of us.  A great feature when you consider how huge the lines can  be to check in at the hotel.  

Got their special price on-line and ended up in their west tower at the end of an extraordinarily long hallway.  This newer wing features small rooms with a single king sized bed and a bathroom that opens into the bedroom.  Virtually no view except that of another building, it seemed almost an interior room.  But who spends that much time in their rooms in Vegas?

Huge casino floor, unlike the New York New York casino across the Strip.  Three big pools and a lazy river where you can rent an inner tube for $16.  Cabanas are $400, which includes food and drink.  Lots of fine dining and a food court in their shopping area where McDonald's is the primary option.  No real mid-priced dining options like the New York, New York casino.  

Hotel entrance is on Tropicana Ave.  Front door on Las Vegas Blvd. opens into a large area that almost seems abandoned or under construction.  However, at night the open spaces are used for the lines of Gen Y members heading into the big clubbing scene.  Casino still a very smoky place.  

Free valet parking and the valets were friendly and worked hard for your gratuity.  

The only real problem we encountered was the cardio exercise room was about 90 degrees.  Can't believe that was intentional.

Très très chouette hôtel pour séjourner à Végas. Idéal car on y trouve tout !!
Que vous soyez piscine, jeux ou que vous vouliez un large choix niveau nourriture ou même vous faire une fête de fou à l'Hakkasan, le MGM offre toutes ces possibilités.
need sooo much updating.  bad smells and dirty rooms.

Ummmm....not the best hotel I've stayed at in Vegas. "Wizard of Oz" theme rooms. Small rooms I might add. The pictures of Dorothy, The Tinman and The Lion are kinda creepy. Casino is like a maze...hard to get around. Oh yeah...if you happen to be sitting at the slots at like 4am, which is normal for Vegas, there's this guy who keeps coming 'round asking if you want a MGM Player's Card. Why? I only go to Vegas like once a year and spend less then $500 on gambling. Cool thing about this place is the Lion's den.

Review for casino only:

The MGM Grand is huge with enough variety of machines and table games to please almost anyone.  There are several bars throughout and many restaurants.  

Despite the huge size, there are no nooks or areas where you can be basically alone unless you go at an off time.  At night, the casino is often quite crowded despite its huge size.  

Still, I find the place A-OK.

Food: 3\/5
Service: 3\/5
Cleanliness: 4\/5
Decor & Style: 3\/5

This place, like most of Vegas' older hotels and casinos, are getting older which means dirtier and smellier. It's nice to be near the airport however this place isn't "happening" as it once use to be. Loved KA from Cirque and Hakkasan Restaurant (Dim Sum) is very good, but thats about my only favorite things about MGM.

Stayed 3 nights and had a blast! Hotel is huge and has everything you could ever want. MGM Garden Arena is a great place to see a concert and enjoyed Journey, Foreigner and Night Ranger. West wing hallways are a little dark, but the rooms were great and clean. Look forward to coming back soon!

i have my pros and cons about mgm...pros since we were getting married we were upgraded to a better suite and given a room service credit. but the cons were the room credit was only $50 and that place is very expensive (for a bowl of fruit it can cost you $17!), we were charged a $30 resort fee everyday and lets just say overall the place is just too much financially. be prepared to have lots of money when you travel there. i was just ready to leave even after our second day of staying there and we had just got married off the strip at a chapel. sorry...mgm is way too much for me.

I stayed here at West Wing  MGM Grand hotel on  Friday December 16,2016. Room was dusty, not very well clean. Under the chair(that I moved to get more space) I found old food and some mess.  In the bathroom old dirty racks. On the top of it In the parking lot ( which u have to pay now)they crashed my car. Nobody help me with that, even they have everywhere security cameras. Rooms getting old( even they are saying they are remodel). Not gonna stay there again!!!

This was the first time I've stayed at MGM since I was a child so I figured why not.  I've visited Vegas probably 20 times the last few years but decided to change it up this trip.  Upon entering the lobby we were greeted with a huge line that took us about a hour to finally get a room key.  This was a little annoying but not surprising considering its the famous MGM at 2 PM check in time.  We were quite satisfied with our room initially... It was at midnight when we returned from a late night show and when we went to bed, we flipped over one of the pillows and noticed a disgusting stain on the bedsheet right at the head of the bed (see picture).  I immediately called housekeeping and was told they would send someone right away. Half hour goes by and still no one.  I call again.  This time a different lady answers the phone and assures me she will inform management and send someone.  The wife and I fall asleepon the other "clean" side of the bed and get a loud knock on the door at 145 AM (1 hour and 45 mins after the first call).  The housekeeping guy hands me over a fresh, folded bed sheet and proceeds to walk out.  I stop him and imply if I am to place this over the stain.  He responds by apologizing for coming so late and blames the previous shift for not showing up and confirms that the new bed sheet is to be placed over the stain.  I was like WTF??!?!?!  WHAT KIND OF SERVICE IS THIS??  I didn't make a fuss of it because we were so tired and was going to deal with it the next day instead.  Needless to say I was appalled with MGM's level of service for something so simple.  What a disappointment.  I guess I'll be heading over to their competitors next time I visit Vegas as I've never had this problem before when similar events occurred.

Stayed here over the weekend and not completely happy. Although the suite we stayed in was good, it basically took FOREVER to get anywhere in this casino.  From our room to the pool was like 18.4 miles... Service was decent, price was alright but not cheap.  My ghetto friends were happy that at least they had a Mcdonald's that actually served dollar menu items though.  Normally the food chains that come into the LV hotels jack up their prices such as the Mcdonald's at the LUXOR but not here at MGM.  Won $500 playing 3 card poker though!! If you want to stay at a convenient hotel in Vegas, this is not the one but if you wanna walk 4 miles to see lions sleep and enjoy a $46 bucket of six pack beers at the pool, this is not a bad place to book.

The bed is amazing along with the big pillows. We stayed in the grand tower and had a decent view, reasonably priced. We especially enjoyed the blackout screen on the windows. Two buttons and it's black as night, even during the day.

Hotel room itself was great.  Restaurants are ok at best.  1st day at the pool sucked because of all the drunks they let in.   2nd day was better since we went out first thing in the morning.  Most if which probably are not staying in the hotel.  So if you are a vacationing family, stay away from this hotel.

Awesome the buffet is a little pricey but good and the rain Forest Café is awesome very good the beds are supersoft and clean no bedbugs and the concierge was very helpful and we got checked in right away even though we had A late flight

we went a group of people and we were able to stay on the same floor. Even the members of our group that came the next day. had to Sacrifice our king bed for the group but it was worth it...Really nice hotel. Front desk was helpful. easy to get around. Wet republic kicked us out b\/c we weren't sexy enough, i guess...Our group had to go back and change into proper pool club attire, whatever that means. The regular pool for us coomon folk was really nice...TV's and other electronics were outdated. Floors were dusty in the corners. Had some great shows and entertainment venues. Good Hotel for Vegas. It is @ the South end of the strip so you may have to walk a ways to get into the heart of the strip. Tigers were cool as well when they were up. close to Excailber, New York New York, Hooters and the Tropianca...

This is a backdated review for MDW13 - here goes:

I booked this reservation through Expedia so I got an email that the reservation was guaranteed until midnight of the first day of the reservation.  Seeing as my flight was going to come in at 11:50 I decided to give MGM Grand a call since I didn't want my room to be given away.

It was a 15 minute or so wait on hold to reach the correct person, but she was very polite and wrote a note on my reservation so the room wouldn't be reissued.

Our flight came in around 2AM local time (Spirit Airlines, that's a 1 star review for another time).  The check in people were nice and we got our room keys quickly without a hitch.

Once we got into our room, it was a little weird.
-The soaps were already opened. Not sure if they are just really trying to make things easy on me or didn't change them out. I found a hair in the soap...
-There was still trash in the trash can.

Ehhh.

No matter, we brought our own soap anyway and trash is trash. We were tired.

The rest of the stay was uneventful.  The buffet was okay since it was included in our stay, but if you're looking for a Vegas Buffet worth talking about with friends, head up the strip to some of the newer casinos.  The MGM Grand buffet reminded me of dorm food. Since I just got out of college it's not a big deal, but if your palate is more refined then you might be better off paying more and going elsewhere.

The casino is cool. Again, there's better on the north end of the strip, but nothing is terribly bad or exceptionally good.

My one regret about being at MGM was not going to Hakkasan. It had just opened and we were busy with other venues so we didn't check it out.  But after reading other reviews it seems like I missed out on a golden opportunity.  I'll be sure to check it out next time.

Some final notes -

-MGM is in a good location since you can hit a bunch of casinos thanks to the rail that is connected to Excalibur down the road. One can easily hit up Mandalay Bay, Excalibur, Luxor, and NYNY.
-The pools are great and check out Wet Republic if you get a chance.
-Weekday rates are pretty reasonable.
-There is a $25\/day resort fee that gets added on. It includes WiFi so bring a computer or tablet since you're already paying for access.
-There is a foodcourt between the hotel and pools if you are trying to save some cash.

great fun, i stayed at aria before this and hated it since it was too similar to dubai where i come from... mgm gave me the perfect slice of american ambiance that one wants when visiting vegas.. good fun, great pool, great club, and an amazing casino scene... landing on memorial day weekend also helped..

I have stayed at almost all the hotels on the strip and this is one of my favorites! The rooms are fantastic! Very clean and modern. Nice bathrooms. The casino is huge with lots of slots and games to choose from. Only drawback is that its location is toward the end of the strip.

I stayed here the weekend after my 21st birthday. It was the first time I was in Vegas and actually had some fun. So yeah, the crowd fit my age group quite well.

We stayed on the 16th floor, the view kinda sucked since you only saw the end of the strip, plus the valet area down below. The beds were comfy, but there was no fridge to keep our road trip junk food in. Room came with a desk and some chairs, and there's a ledge by the window you can sit on. The room was always clean, fresh towels, beds made, etc. when we came back to our hotels from wherever. The maids were nice and always greeted us when they heard our sandals *clop clop* as we walked to the pool or wherever.

The Lion Habitat was kinda interesting, though we didn't go in. The lions seemed really calm, and the dude on the speakerphone was saying how there's four layers of glass or some crap so they can't hear anyone outside and they're incredibly relaxed. They had the lion trainers walk into the habitat too with the lions, and the lions just lounged there as they normally do. But I swear, I think I saw a trainer crap himself a little.

I remember only eating at the McDonald's and Seablue, a seafood restaurant. Seablue is one of my favorite restaurants, EVER. I'm not even a big seafood fan, though I do eat it when the opportunity presents itself and have eaten it at fancy restaurants before. Check out my review on Seablue!

I freaking loved the Lazy River, partly because I'm a lazy ass. Show your hotel pass and you get in for free and get free towels, plus you can even bring guests who aren't staying at the MGM. Tube rentals were kinda pricey, but the first day we went to the pools, the computer was broken so they just gave us the tubes for free. We met a couple of friends while having a drink at Seredipity 3 @ Caesar's Palace and they ended up going to the lazy river on another day and the rental place was closed so we just scavenged for tubes and got them for free, again!

One of the times I got carded was at a table of course but the dealer wasn't all that courteous. I wasn't sure if he spoke much English, but whatever. He sorta just blurted out "ID?!" out loud the way fobs do when they speak - that is, without a volume switch. He did smile but I was just a bit taken aback. The ladies at the cashier booths were really courteous though.

I had a very pleasant experience here, and so did everyone else who went. The hotel does look sorta dated compared to places like the Wynn and Palazzo, but it was far from ugly or run down. Next time I'll definitely be checking out Rouge or Tabu though, they've got some hot looking servers!
One of my favorite vegas hotels. Great rooms, fun gambling and tasty restaurants!

One of the smokiest casinos in Vegas in my opinion.  The room we had was good enough clean and comfortable.  Upon check in I asked if there was a fridge in my room because I had to store insulin and I was told no.  They did however give me a fridge for free to use.  Be sure to charge everything to your room and sign up for the m life card so you can possibly get some comps or discounts during your stay.  Check out was easily handled on our tv so it was fast and efficient.

Ok so its been a week since we were in Las Vegas. 
It's been awhile since i did a Freestyle.
Its been ages since I seen my Yelp buddies, so this is for all yall.
Guys trip in Las Vegas, Mayweather\/Marquez weekend. Let's just say I saw more action from those guys on the strip handing out those sexy girl cards! Fight wasn't all that, but being in Vegas with my friends made the trip a great one!

to the tune of HOTEL ROOM SERVICE by Pitbull (enjoy!!)
http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=Me17_uzP4Pk


I'm chillin' with my guy friends drinking in the hotel room

MGM Grand is a nice clean hotel. Its not the PALAZZO but its coo. I wouldn't mind staying there again. Honestly, its really not the hotel you stay at, its who you are with and what you make of the trip. We should have a YELP VEGAS TRIP. 5 stars to that!

SO many funny moments in Vegas, too many to mention. Here's a few that I thought was funny:

FRIEND 1: hey girl, there's an All-you-can-eat MEAT buffet at the MGM GRAND.
GIRL(a little on the fatty side):ooOO foreals!? We are so there!
FRIEND 2: you are so mean, you like to push buttons don't you!?
FRIEND 1: I was being such a jerk and she didn't even realize it!

*TEXT MESSAGE OF THE NIGHT*

"Plese healp me!! I'm by the b room"

That was sent from a buddy who had waaayy too much to drink. Tell me why he sent it to all the homies, even ones who weren't even in Vegas!!

Vegas + buddies + alkies = A DAMN GOOD TIME!!

I've stayed here a few times now and it just gets worse every time.  There was mold growing ALL OVER our shower and into toilet area.  The floor of the shower even looked dirty.  I coughed every night and morning.  The lighting in the room is horrible.  I'm sure my clothes never matched the entire trip.   Pillows are lifeless.  I woke up stiff and practically unable to walk for about an hour.  This room should come with a daily massage.   I won't stay here again even if it's free.  It's not worth my health.

I have been playing Craps and Black Jack in Vegas for decades. I have been a rated player at a handful of well known Casinos.  I have stayed at the MGM at least 50 times.  Due to the latest trip I don't think I will ever step foot in MGM again.  After 10 hours of play on their tables in 24 hours, I can't say who was the least friendly or nastier.  The Black Jack dealers, the teams working their Craps tables or the cocktail waitresses.  The entire casino staff acted as if they could care less if you were there and slowed every game down due to their lack of interest in being there themselves.
It seems obvious that the MGM has decided that their interests are in night club and pool clientele and no longer interested in the casino and gaming clients.  We are not the priority.  It is sad because the MGM was an icon on the strip.  Now it is just another corporate mess.

Big Mistake.  Apparently none of the workers at this hotel feel that they have a job to do.  When first room was not exceptable contacted front desk she gave me a new room at 159.00 total for room cost.  Lateron found out this was a upgrade charge.  I specificially asked her 4 times if this was the total room charge.  She said yes.  Bonk not so!!! In my attempt to correct this I have been on the phone 22 times to correct this and being on hold the majority of these conversations of up to 15 minutes.
My phone was also stolen by the individual across the hall.  it was outside my door.  However Sgt Robertson who I spoke to told me this was not lost and found.  And no one told him about it!!! Go back to playing solitare moron!  Checking in and Checking out  has extremely long lines and very unorganized.  To get to the pool is a major walk.  Rather stay at the travel lodge with the pool outside the door.  MGM is so yesterday!

Our room was fairly awesome.  I was a big fan of the blackout shade you can drop to make your room impervious to sunlight.

The big drawback is the smell.  As soon as you walk in, you are hit with a wave that smells like old lady perfume trying to cover smoke.  It's highly unpleasant.

The casino is spacious and smoky.  Should I deduct stars because I lost badly both nights I played here?  Nah.

One must-do activity at the MGM is the Television City pilot-rating thing.  You watch a TV pilot and rate it while it plays.  Afterward, you get some coupons for discounted food.  But it's awesome to share your opinion on new TV shows.

The buffet is decent, but avoid the disgusting Avenue Cafe.  

This is an awesome place to hang your hat during your time in Vegas.
Excellent staff, however walls between rooms are not sound proof. I cant sleep as people in next room were just talking. Asked to change room, however got no success. Will never stay here.

We usually stay at the MGM in Vegas, but we are going to start looking for another place the next visit. $12\/night parking on TOP of the $35 per day resort fee? 

What really pushed up over the top was finding a man's dirty underwear and a petrified soiled hand towel on the top rack underneath the bathroom sink. It took almost 2 hours for housekeeping to pick it up! Eating away at our day!

Two stars for this visit.

I am making this review purely because this place has made my travel in Vegas a living hell. Do not stay here. If you feel like passing through this place avoid it like the plague. From the entrance it took me a good 30 mins to get to the monorail. The craziest part is I knew exactly where I was going and moving as fast as I possibly could. There are so many twist and turns. The place is humongous. When you think you are close to where you want to be you realize quickly that you aren't. Its a maze. They have signs to point you to where you want to go but then signs for that destination will disappear and you get lost super easily.  Take for instance the monorail. I will follow the signs for it and they would disappear and I knew well that I was no where near it. I had to ask people to get to where I needed to go. If any of you have ever played Zelda Ocarina of Time, this place would be the Water Temple X10. 

AVOID AVOID AVOID 

You have been warned

MGM Grand gets 4 stars...but it's only because with being a player's card member (hubby and i have a "combined" player's club account) that we get awesome offers. Basically, they send us offers for 3 free nights in a deluxe room with free lunch and dinner for EVERY DAY we are there. It's at select restaurants but one of them is the Grand Wok. As long as the bill says two guests, we can pretty much order anything we darn well please and it's all free. Basically, all you can eat sushi, seafood and other asian dishes! Like I said, the reason for 4 stars.

IF we ever paid to stay there, this place would prob get between 2-3 starts.

PROS:
decent gambling, tons of slots (last time we went, i sat down with $20 bucks at a machine and won $500 in about 10 minutes!)
cocktail waitresses are pretty good about coming back (if you tip them) but it's a pain to wait until they actually show up the first time
BEDS! amazing...so comfortable
water pressure in shower (i'm one of those that likes the shooting water at full speed, minimizes my normally 30-40 minute shower time)
POOL seems to be the consensus...actually haven't been yet but will def. check it out next time. I'm excited!
Airport check-in ROCKS

CONS:
place is HUGE, there is way too much walking involved and maneuvering  around sloppy drunken people
Bell Desk = rude, incompetent A$$ (we checked our bags because our room wasn't ready, they said they could not take our bags upstairs for us when we were ready to check in. Then these stupid frat boys walk up and I see the bellhop rolling their luggage up for them.....riiiight...)
late checkout--having to get up at the crack of dawn to ask for it. although, everytime we've requested it, we've always gotten it.
Player's Club -- watch your comps, don't expect them, you have to make up your room price etc... before they even think about giving you comps!
TOO many kids....honestly, i don't think small children should be chillin' in a very smoky casino for health reasons...but that's just my humble opinion

It's the largest stand-alone hotel\/resort property on the Vegas strip and on the price scale, is generally considered a mid-range resort. I've stayed here a few times in the past, mostly when this resort was still new and had all the OZ theming.

This is a review of my last stay at this hotel, which was years back. I vowed to never return and still haven't.

It took WAY too long to check in, and it was close to 11 PM at night. When we finally got to our room, it took us no longer than 10 minutes to discover the room INFESTED with a colony of ants. HOW THE FUCK does a hotel room 20+ floors above ground get infested with ants? They were EVERYWHERE. Running in a single-file line up and down the curtain drapes, they were IN the bed sheets, and all along an entire wall base. I have never seen anything like this before.

We called the front desk to have them move us immediately and they said it would take half an hour before they could relocate us to another room. So our whole group just waits in the hallway for a hotel rep to meet up with us. Finally, nearly an hour later, we were escorted to another room on a different floor. We go inside and mull over how ridiculous that this is happening to us.

Then it just gets better with room #2. There are blood stains on our bed comforters and cum stains in our sheets AND it's not like we had to go looking for them. They were some fatty stains that were screaming to be discovered; left behind by a previous guest that decided she would carelessly discharge her "that-time-of-the-month" vaginal wine into the bedspread. Thanks lady!

We phone the front desk again in outrage. They really could not give a shit. Twenty minutes later, housekeeping arrives with a different set of bed linens.

We leave our rooms and head out to the strip in disgust. How hundreds of ants and body fluid stained bedding can go unnoticed by hotel staff is completely ridiculous. This would be something I would not be surprised to see at Circus Circus, but the MGM Grand? I can stomach a boring, tasteless, and sterile hotel room ANY day, but I draw the line at bedding stains and insect infestations.

Every visit prior to my last visit here was a 2 Yelp Star Rating experience at best. Bt that was when the MGM Adventures Theme Park was still around though (where The Signature towers now stand).

Reserved the cabana for the lazy river pool, never received a call but was told when we got here the lazy river pool was closed due to work being done on it. We were relocated to the producers pool. Cabana not swept out, no safe as we were told there would be. Finally compt us a locker. Great music. Had the best waitress ever - KanaA mini JLo.. Since you receive a credit of $350 for food and beverage for renting a cabana, the food is fantastic. Great drinks. Best. Day. Ever. Worth the $450 - do it!!!

Personally I do really like the MGM Grand, it's a really nice hotel in a super convenient part of the strip, and anytime I've stayed here the rooms have always been great, both clean and spacious.  As a big aviation fanatic, my favorite rooms are the ones that overlook the airport.  Weird as that might sound I actually find it relaxing to watch that the odd times I'm in my room and it's a nice respite from views of the strip, or worse, the dreaded "no view of anything much" which is common with many of the strip hotels and which cause you to just keep the curtains shut all the time.

Eating options are also great here, I especially like the Japanese restaurant (Shibuya I think it's called) and there's a Chinese place too.  Both are good quality and about $50-60 for a meal.  There's also an okay food court, good for an emergency.

This has a good casino too, but if you're playing tables there are cheaper options for most games, (e.g. head over to Excalibur or New York New York) which are just a few minutes walk.  In fact the location of this hotel is great because you can get to many of the other major hotels on the strip real quickly which opens up a whole new world of options for anything.

For conventions, this hotel really is the greatest - they have some phenomenal huge conference facilities, and the exercise getting from your room to them will help you offset the calories you consume on these trips!

However, because of the fact I've only really stayed at the MGM for business, I just cannot do it for pleasure - I have a stressful job and I have to disconnect, thus I might stop by for a quick visit during a leisure visit to Vegas (as I did just recently) but that's it - but don't let that put you off.  I think that's more just my need to separate work and leisure kicking in, it's a decent hotel no matter how you look at it.

My fiancee (now husband ;)) and I got married at the MGM Grand on May 4, 2014.... Which was a Sunday and just so happened to be the day after the Mayweather fight.  FINE.  

We got to the hotel Sunday morning at 11am and requested an early checkin as we booked one of the 16 penthouses for our ceremony and reception.  The gentleman was very nice and stated that he could probably get us in around 1PM.  Great!  He called housekeeping to ensure there was an open room that could be cleaned as a rush.  He indicated he had our numbers and would call by 2 pm.  NEVER HAPPENED.  Since 3 pm is the POSTED check in, I thought for sure we would get the call be 3.  NOT.    We went back to the hotel at 3:30 to inquire about our room and the desk said the room was still not ready.  We FINALLY got the call at 4:12PM that our room was ready--- then came the 45 minutes for our luggage to arrive from the bell desk.  Ceremony was set to begin at 6:30... Needless to say we had to postpone the ceremony by 30 minutes. FINE.

The room was gorgeous for our intimate ceremony and reception--- I highly recommend it for a non-traditional wedding or 2nd wedding.  The skyline is EPIC AT SUNSET!!

That being said, I was disappointed when the doorbell rang at 8:30AM the next morning.  SERIOUS?  Check out is 10 AM.... Who the hell rings a doorbell that early in the am in Vegas. And they were back again at 9:30.  SHIT. WAIT TILL THE CHECK OUT TIME BEFORE RINGING DOORBELLS!

The ONLY reason I am giving this 3 stars is because the space was perfect for our occasion and when we called for housekeeping, they also brought up additional paper towels, toilet paper and trash bags.  Other than that, the check in service was NOT acceptable... Over an hour late and an add'l hour for luggage. Then the early disturbance in the AM.

Shame shame MGM. I know you made your $$ the night before with all the boxing fans but a little appreciation for the little guys would have been nice.

My first trip to Vegas! And my hotel was... meh.

Nothing special about this hotel. Beautiful lobby, but there's not much that really differentiates MGM from the other Vegas hotels (except the lions... which were not out on display the entire time we were staying there). 

Rooms are average. Pillows a little on the hard side. Bathrooms are massive, but the shower heads are only high enough for a child to fit underneath. I'm 5'5" and had to squat underneath (try doing that tipsy - it's no easy feat!).

Selection of restaurants was decent. 

There was a plethora of pools, which was the best thing about MGM... no one pool was ever super crowded, so that made for a very nice day-drinking experience.

(Oh, except for Wet Republic, which had a 3-hour wait to get in, but I suspect that was because it was the pool's opening weekend and Kim Kardashian was there)

I'd maybe return to MGM, but I'd be curious to see if the other hotels had more to offer.

Been coming to vegas since I can remember. We come at least 3X a year and prefer to stay downtown where momma and I can tour around, sipping on a tall drink and enjoy the sights. Free entertainment, people watching. The best thing about downtown is there hospitality. They have the old school Vegas feel and majority make you feel welcomed. You feel like even though you lost, you got something in return.

Not so much on the strip. It's been years since I stayed on the strip but momma wanted to take the kids to a fun property that had a pool for the kids. We decided upon MGM. From my memory, they advertised kid friendly and they had a lazy river. So, lets do this...

Upon arrival, drove up to valet like I always do. I believe in taking care of all services from the valet to the dealers. On any given weekend, I would easily tip $200 total... Drove up and saw they charge a $20 bill for valet. What??? So, if I usually tip a valet server $10 to park it and $10 for return, it's $40 to valet? When the heck did this start??  I talked to the attendant and said that the mandatory charge must really put a dent in their tips. He grunted and said, "You have no idea, and we don't even work for the hotel."  Felt bad for the guy but we self-parked.   Again.. What???

Whatever, Are things that hard that MGM has to start bilking its guest for everything?

Walked in and saw 100 people easily waiting for registration. But surprisingly, there were 25 registrants standing by. 20 min wait, no big deal. Kudos for that.

Gave my credit card and saw my bill go up and up and up. The room was $150. Bu wait, there's more... $35 resort fee.. but wait there's more, tax on resort fee $11.00, then the $12.00 parking charge. so, whatever deal you got on your reservations, stand by, increase it everyday by $50.00.  I rented 2 rooms for 2 days. = $200 extra.

I know I am in Vegas and I expect to pay for the weekend, but I expect to also get something for my $.

Went to the 1st room and all was good. Momma and I went to the 2nd room and it reeked of MJ and mildew smell.  Looked around and quickly noticed the beds were made with DIRTY sheets.. The stain was free of charge. About the only free thing we got this weekend. We asked about another room but was denied, "all booked up."  They offered a air cleaning machine and new sheets. After 4 phone calls and 2 hrs of waiting, Dealing with the rudest housekeeping rep named Jaunita, the machine finally showed up. It help.. a lot... made the room bearable.  The sheets were changed and we were ready for a nice couple of days. 

1st night we walked around and caught a movie. Woke up and started looking for breakfast for the kids. They had nothing. Absolutely no choices for kids and food for breakfast. they had 1 cafe with an hr wait.. we had no choice, we waited. Average cost of a typical breakfast plate was nearly $19.00. times that by 5 and you have a $120 breakfast. 

Grabbed bags and hung out at pool all day. Awesome pool and surroundings, lazy river, etc... while in a pool we asked for drinks for the kids and us.  Waitress said no prob and returned. Another waitress came by and we asked for a 2nd round.  She needed to see our room key and ID before taking order to place on room charge. I told her it was in my wallet on a chair at the other end of the pool. She said, "Oh" and walked away. She returned and I showed her my ID but she didn't bring any drinks. She said she won't take the order unless we have ID. I told her, never mind, we are good.  

She returned with the drinks..huh?? OK, I told her I cancelled the order, she said, "Oh, well they are already charged to your room." I said, "Uncharge them." I look at my room charges right now and they are still on there. She obviously didn't remove them and didn't care. 

Listen, people come to Vegas to party, spend money and have a good time. MGM takes away from their server's tips by demanding the nickel and dime tactic of charging for everything. I usually will go through $3000 to $4000 gambling at one property per trip. Because of the principle of the matter, I spent less than $100 on the property and took my gambling to other properties.

Wont be coming back,,, Sorry servers, your employer is too greedy for me

バスタブが小さかった。
どのホテルもそうだが...
内鍵が無いのが怖い。寝てる時ルームサービスやらドリンクの補充やら、勝手に入ってくる。
本当やめてほしい。
また、夜中に酔っ払いの若者が部屋を間違えて入ってきそうになったが...
朝起きたら3人で廊下のソファーで寝てた。
そもそもホテル客なのか...

The MGM Grand is a DUMP!
Here are just a few things that went wrong:
I had reserved, and was paying for, a Tower Suite a couple of months in advance. I got an email confirmation and no where in that email does it say 'based on availability.' When I checked in on June 25th, I was informed that they were sold out and I would have to take a regular room and there was nothing they could do.
When we were walking into our room one night, there was actually a dirty Q-Tip in the hallway in front of our door (we assume it was dropped there from the housekeeping staff).
We got into the elevator and there was cigarette butts and dried beer on the floor. 
We spent over $1200 on a cabana on Saturday. When we got there, it was filthy. There were leaves all over the carpet, it was dusty, there were stains (from God knows what) on the sofa and the bar hadn't been cleaned. We were informed that they don't actually clean the cabanas every day. I asked for the cabana manager and this young woman came and apologized but did NOTHING! Our server (who was very sweet) came in and wiped down all of the dusty surfaces, but no one else ever came in. 
The Director's pool was horrible. All of us (the 3 women) had our bathing suits destroyed by the water. The color was changed and now have to be thrown away. One of my friends actually called the front desk and without even seeing the bathing suit, they gave her a credit. I was too mad to call as I didn't want to take my anger out on someone that didn't have anything to do with it. 
When we got back to the room, after the room had been cleaned, the housekeeper left a pile of dirty towels in our bathroom.
This is just a few of the issues that we had in our very short 4 day stay. I cannot believe what a dump the MGM Grand has become. I'm astonished and, believe me, will never stay there again. It's truly shameful.

Upgraded to a suite...two king bed rooms and a common area with large table, tv, couch, wet bar area, and fold-out.  Huge suite.  Nice, comfy beds.  Over-abundance of towels, shampoo\/soap, etc.  I know this is Vegas, and there is an endless amount of activities, but I would still like the t.v.(s) to work.  These old tube t.v.s with broken remotes have to go.

My g\/f and I just spent 2 nights at the MGM. Like all the other reviews, its full of smoke (with a hint of vanilla or coconut, it was hard to tell) and the check in line is very long, even when you have early check in.

I just want everyone to know.....stay away from room 03-320 Tower One Bedroom Suite. We were right under the gym and from 5am-11pm, the whole room shakes when someone gets on the treadmill. Forget about sleeping during these hours. Also, you can hear the trash being moved around outside the bedroom window. 

The room did have a nice view of Tropicana Blvd. The blackout blinds are awesome, I wish all of the hotels had them. The living room area was nice, big couch to relax on. The bathroom layout was nice, too. It would of been nice if the toilet had its own door. The water pressure in the shower is very low, which made the shower time take a little longer. The charging station was nice, it is right by the tv, easy access. You can ask for an extra fridge at no charge, if you have medicine to store. The housekeeping(Helena), bellhop(Tex) and valet service was awesome.

It was our first time staying there and we probably will not stay there again. We like the Cosmo or Mandalay much better.

I stayed here with a few girl friends a few weeks ago and we had a great time. I have stayed at the MGM Signature Suites before and I like staying at MGM better for location and being close to everything. Our room was the last one on the hall.. it was a trek! The room had no windows! Other that than that the small room was charming. I wouldn't recomend it for a group of girls because there is a lack of mirrors which I never understand especally in Vegas! This is perfect if your traveling solo on business or splurge for the Sky Lofts = ) Also the wifi doesn't work and there is barley any cell service... something thats important to all of us!

Great Casino Buffet Restaurant & FREAKIN LIONS

SITREP

Every time I pop into the MGM Grand Hotel, it's a fun casual experience.

THE SETUP

I love their dining buffets because they are quick & efficient.  Lunch runs $19.99.  Dinner runs $29.99.  (I never do both on the same day since I eat like it's my only meal of the day!)

LIONS!
