They tried to charge us for "early check in" at 2 pm, but did end up refunding us after the second attempt, temporarily lost one of our bags and after finding it they couldn't send it up right away and made my husband run down and get it, paid for a suite and got a wheelchair accessible room with a shower that sprays water out into the entire bathroom and is smaller than a bathroom in a standard room. Asked for extra towels because of this issue and they brought one towel. Wouldn't bring champagne glasses without buying champagne from room service even though my husband called days before to order a birthday cake... these are small things and could not even be a big deal but the attitude and lack of accommodation or urgency started to just feel insulting.

We stayed in room 24-233 for 4 days 3 nights.   The room was clean and the service was nice. There were a few rust spots in the shower area. Nothing really special about the MGM Hotel. To me it's just an average hotel.

AWFUL!!! I'm standing in line AGAIN because my card doesn't work! I spent 45 minutes this am waiting to check in when I was told u could get an early check in to find out I couldn't. Now my card won't work to let me into the room and I guarantee it will be another 45 minutes!!! NEVER staying here again!!! EVER!

What terrible service.  We stayed in the 775 SF 1bed suite and when we checked in early morning, we requested a strip view close to an elevator with a pack n play for a baby.  We ended up getting an airport view at the end of the longest hotel hallway I've ever seen and no pack n play.  The hallway must have been several hundred feet long.  I called to see if we could switch rooms and was hold for 20 mins just to find out there was nothing they could do.  I guess all the 1bed tower suites are at the end of hallways so I won't fault them for that.  The entire stay we had a mysterious sewer smell coming out of the bathroom which the engineer said was coming from other rooms above us.  Our 3rd day included no running water and the lights would periodically not work.  We also had an automatic shade that didn't work and needed to be repaired.  All these incidents happened individually and each time I called was 10-20 minutes I'll never get back.  For all the trouble and wasted time, they were only able to comp 2 nights resort fees and a late check out.  Pretty pathetic.  Warning to those who are interested in the 1bed tower suite, they are all at the end of extremely long hallways and the living room area is very dark.  There are only 2 side lamps for the room.  I've never posted a negative hotel review but this experience and the lack of want by the hotel to make this right just annoyed me.

The hotel is nice but the staff is terrible!
The rooms are much better since the remodeled, sky lofts & mansions are out of control amazing!
The most unfortunate part of the experience was the bell desk and wait staff at the restaurants.
They just seem so incredibly unhappy.
Cheer-Up you have a job!

Wow this place sucks.   Overpriced, small dingy rooms (I got stuck in the west wing despite paying the same as companions in the regular rooms).   Towels had holes and they forgot to lock my room after cleaning so when I came back it was unlocked.  I mean come on.   My favorite was when two of our party checked in and found out their rooms had no water due to construction.  When they complained and mentioned they should have been told they were told oh we don't know when it is going to happen.  I had heard about that .. random construction firms going into hotels and doing it on their schedule not the hotels.   Give me a break.  A truly bad hotel.

This review comes down to a customer service issue. Two of the rudest people I've ever encountered were behind the desks at the MGM. Calling down to the front desk, I spoke to Raven.. And wow, I was blown away by how abrupt and rude she was, clearly no one ever taught her any manners growing up. I'm in disbelief that she's in a position where she interacts with customers at all. The second person was also at the front desk. I feel bad judging the hotel by these two individuals but they really soiled the trip for me. The only saving grace was Katie from the front desk, faith restored. The housekeeping ladies were also really nice people. Even though Katie was a complete sweetheart, I will not be staying there again. It's not worth the hassle of dealing with those unpleasant people and the rooms are mediocre at best.
Valet's no longer free.  $13 for under 4 hours, $18 for more than that.  And you can't call down to have it brought out early.  Grand tower room is tiny. The tv behind the mirror doesn't work.

Meh..

Downhill spiral with the nickle and diming. First the check in line is 30 minutes with only half the stations filled. But if you look at the mlife line there are three attendant's doing nothing and the line is empty.

So you get to the front of the line and they say hello and tell you there are no rooms available and the wait is four hours, but to enjoy yourself in the casino.. So I ask "there are no rooms available?" Not at this time but would you like to upgrade? Sure. 12 bucks.. OK week see you back at three. Wait what was the upgrade for? Oh a nice room. But there aren't any available but if you want a room that is done it's $20.. 

Mlife grants no benefits either unless you blue a lot of cash in the casino.

In done with the strip and their tourist based hostage plans. From now on its an off strip property.

We stayed at MGM for 3 nights last week. It was overall a really good experience with a few bumps along the way. Let's break it down:

Rooms: (3 stars) the rooms overall were small but modern and did the job just fine. We didn't have a good view but we were in the west tower and only on the 5th floor. I didn't like the bathrooms because there is only a door to the toilet so privacy is minimal. Also there was barely any counter space in the bathroom making getting ready a challenge. I thought the bed was comfy but others thought it was hard. All in all the room was fine. 

Issues: I called a week ahead to get all three rooms close to each other or even on the same floor, they said it wouldn't be a problem so I was a little frustrated when they couldn't accommodate this when we checked in. Also, the actual door mechanism on my parents door (what you slide your card into) broke on the first night. They had to wait outside their room at midnight for 1.5 hours for someone to come fix it. They finally came, and the next day we were comped $300 for food and drinks at MGM restaurants so they handled our problem really well and we were totally content and over the door issue. 

Casino: (4 stars) out of all of the casinos this is the one we all won the most money at! We also really liked how big it was, huge sports book, lots of tables, and slots galore. We really enjoyed the virtual craps, blackjack, and roulette: all the fun without the pressure of playing at a table. 

Staff: The staff here were awesome! Stephanie (from NY!) and Michelle were great on the roulette table and some of the best casino workers I've come across!!!

Food: There are a ton of food options in the MGM so if you're staying here don't overlook your options! They have a food court for fast, cheap, or late night eats stocked with the basics like McDonalds, Nathan's, and Pizza. They also have finer dining options like Craftsteak and Emeril's. 

MGM location: Bottom line is that the MGM is HUGE. To get from our room to the casino took at least 5 minutes. Everywhere you go in the casino it's far away so plan for comfy shoes. Also, a lot of people told us we stayed on the wrong end of the strip and I have to disagree. Yes this is farther away from the mirage and Venetian but the walk is doable (and entertaining) and the tram is easy. 

I would probably check out another hotel next time I am in Vegas but I enjoyed our stay at the MGM grand.

For the most part this is a great hotel, but there are aspects I was not a fan of.
As with anything in Las Vegas, you are nickeled and dimed A LOT. An additional $25 per night if you want a mini fridge seems a tad ridiculous to me, as well as a $50 fee if you move the mini bar items around to make room for your own beverages or snacks? CRAZY. Also, $3 for a vending machine soda? Not happening. There was also a sign near the pool offering 2 complimentary inter tubes for the river pool, but in fact they are $16 an hour even to hotel guests. Requested a room with a view of the Strip, received a room with a view of the airport, the roof below, and a LOT of green hotel.
There was also not a discount to hotel guests for any shows happening inside the hotel. Yes it was free to get into the pool and the nightclub, but with the food and drink prices jacked up to what they were you are better off scoring free drink wristlets at a different hotel and paying a cover to get in. 
Construction made getting around the hotel a pain at times. 
A little far from the big events and happenings on the Strip. Towards the quieter end of the Strip. Super comfortable bed and great bathroom lighting, plus complimentary hair dryer. 
Overall, a nice hotel, but I expected more for what I was paying.

This place is great to stay at if you like to party. The hotel is for a younger crowd and if you have no problem with that this is the place for you. I however like to relax and not be at hotels that are overcrowded. The room itself was just ok and the pool areas is huge with lots of shade and bars. The only reason why I come back to stay here is based on the pool. It has one of the best pool areas in Vegas. If it was not for this I would not stay here. My hubby would give it 5 stars here but I give it a solid 3. It could use some work, like please hire more drink servers for the casino floor. I sat on several machines and never had a server come to me. Not one. Also, the lines were long at check in. Maybe the hotel could set up an online check in ? Not sure but it took forever to check in and it was 1030am

I've been to Vegas a few times, my girlfriend & I decided to take a last minute trip on Halloween to see what it was like, and I can honestly say the MGM staff and stay was the best experience we've had there. They were very welcoming, and polite. Our plane was scheduled to land hours before check in' & the lady at the front desk took care of us beyond our expectations. Definitely recommend this hotel & will stay here again!

Before arriving, I read a lot of negative reviews about the MGM grand and made me extremely nervous. Luckily, there were not any issues and we both enjoyed our stay :) 

Checking in? We arrived at 930am our room was ready but check in wasn't until 3pm so we paid an extra $20 and got our room key right away..so worth it! 

Grand King room? Our view was incredible! The windows were 'about' ceiling to floor length. The room was very clean and trust me, I checked everything after some of the reviews I read! All the amenities were up to date although I was disappointed there wasn't an ihome in every room. 

Pool? It's massive. There are a lot of locations to choose from which means a lot of chairs but 1pm on a nice day they will still all be taken! Alcoholic drinks are way overpriced with not enough alcohol, wouldn't recommend buying them. 

Location? Yes, it is at the far end of the strip but there is a monorail close by that is extremely convenient :)
Really old and sketchy people. Would have been cool to see the lions if they weren't sleeping!

I booked through vegas.com and when I arrived at the hotel my room was given away to another guest. They upgraded me to another suite and I went to the room and the television did not work, the heater did not work, nor did I have  hot running water. Went back to the front desk and told them the problem and they put me in another suite across the hallway and the same problems where in there.. I spoke to the manager again and he took off my resort fee and paid for my breakfast... I will never stay at this hotel again

My home away from home, I love the MGM! 

I travel to Las Vegas about once a month for work, and have stayed at just about every cheap to not-so-cheap hotel on the strip. When I fly out there for fun, the MGM has always been my go-to hotel. 

The player's club card prices for this hotel just can't be beat. Where else can you stay at a 4 star hotel on the strip for about $50 - $60\/night? The hotel is huge, and other then going out to see specific shows or go to a specific club, we literally never have to leave the hotel during our trips. 

The pool is a lot of fun. I like "wet republic" as it is more of a place for young adults to hang out and relax with a cocktail. The regular pool areas are also fun if your with family, although the noise little kids can be a little annoying (it's fun to steal their inner-tubes and ride down the rivers though.) 

The restaurants are some of the best I have gone to. They have a cheapy food court with a few dining options, but we never eat there (why waste a Vegas trip by eating crap fast food you could get back home anyways.) CraftSteak has to be my most favorite steak house, and we always eat there at least one night every time we go to Las Vegas. They have other good options too, like Wolfgang Puck's place, Emeril's, WichCraft, and Shybua. The prices might seem a little high at first at these higher end restaurants, but once you eat the food and taste how good everything is, you will find that the prices are well worth it. 

If you are into the clubbing scene (I am) the location of this hotel is great. They have Wet Republic for the day, and have two decent clubs in the hotel that always play good music. Tabu and Studio 54 might not draw the largest crowds, but they always play good music all night long, and they always have a good mixed crowd. Best of all, you can drink and dance yourself silly and not worry about catching a cab home since you are already in the hotel you are staying at. All the other big named clubs on the strip are all a short cab ride away. 

The hotel rooms themselves are nice. Soft, comfy beds, spacious rooms and larger bathrooms, everything is very clean and well maintained. Room service is great at accommodating needing guests. 

I love this hotel. It has everything I need and want in a Las Vegas trip. I have stayed here dozens of times, and will continue to go to the MGM on my Vegas trips.

We absolute love MGM Grand. When we are in Vegas, it is our choice. We cannot find an issue and every aspect of the experience exceeds our expectations. This last stay was challenging. Due to severe weather, we needed to arrive 1 day early. The easily accommodated our needs, kept us in the same room we originally booked. Because of the same weather issues, we extended our stay by 1 day. Staff were exceptionally accommodating and we kept the same room we were booked into. These changes took minutes and there were no hassles. They really make you feel like valued guests. Our room was absolute luxury! It was the perfect vacation.

I just returned from Las Vegas and stayed at the MGM Grand. In particular, a West Wing Master room. Whatever you do, don't stay in this wing.  The hallway is incredibly long, dark and claustrophobic. The room was tiny, and very dated. The bathroom shower stall had all kinds of sloppy caulking and gunk holding it together. I got locked out of my room twice because of faulty programming and a faulty door lock.
Room service was good. Pretty pricey for breakfast but not too bad considering it's the vegas strip.

This is my first time staying at the MGM. I got there around noon and was informed that check in wasn't until 3 or 4 and I would have to pay an extra $20 to check in early. I figured I might as well do it since I didn't want to lug my bags around for 3 hours. I got into the room and the carpet was stained, the sheets\/pillows had black stains on them, the walls had..something...on them, the mirrors around the bed were scuffed, there were dings in the nightstands, and the room was very dark. That was just the main room. The bathroom was another story. I found out I could easily lift the mirror off the wall and see the plumbing behind it, the sink just looked old and worn down, and the shower door did not close which meant that water leaked all over the floor whenever you wanted to take a shower. The hairdryer in the room smelled like smoke every time you used it! The absolute worst part was the huge, nasty, ball of black hair on the floor when I first checked in. NASTY!! The view was of the back of the building..not great at all. I didn't mind that, since I wasn't in the room at all times. The good part about the room was the bed was super comfortable and the pillows were amazing. 

I will probably not be back at the MGM any time soon. The resort fees are ridiculous - especially since the internet is so slow!

The MGM is a cool place to hang out but not my favorite place to stay. The rooms are fine but as others have mentioned the TV is a little outdated. All in all it's a good value but with a little searching you can find good values elsewhere.

The sports book is one of my favorites.

Don't waste your money.  Get your mani\/pedi done before you leave home.
Both the manicure and pedicure chipped within 2 days and did not look professional.  The manicurist left smears of polish on the skin under my nails.  Sub par quality for more than twice the price I pay back home where the pedi lasts about 2 weeks and the mani about 1 1\/2 weeks.
Also, I was lied to and taken advantage of.  I got my appointment time mixed up and showed up about 20 minutes late at which point, I was told they could not accommodate my original appointment because they did not want to keep the client after me waiting.  So, they offered to give me an abbreviated\/express mani\/pedi which I thought was fair considering I'm the one who made the mistake.  However, I was charged the higher, original price for the full service treatment that I did not receive.  When I told them how unfair it was that I get charged for the full service I was told it's because I was late and the client after me was kept waiting.  They also said that it's unfair to the manicurist who was expecting to get paid for a full service mani\/pedi and will now have to settle for the express price.  If that is the service she performed, why should she get paid extra?  
There is only one client entrance for that part of the spa so I waited for 15 minutes after my appointment and saw no one come or go which tells me they lied about the subsequent client.  

P.S.  While I was in the waiting area after my service was completed (I was the one and only client waiting) I was "encouraged" to leave numerous times by the front desk girls.  Hmm...I wonder...did they not want me to witness the ghost client?

I stay at the MGM every time I go to Vegas, I am a member.  Everytime I stay there is some kind of issue,  but I let it go because it's minor it's a huge hotel things happen.  This time I WILL NEVER RETURN!!!!!! I checked into my room it looked dirty first things first took off my shoes looked out my window relaxed a minute walked to the bathroom and stepped in glass ...... first off I went to the bathroom,  took the shard of glass out my foot cleaned up the glass the trash can in the bathroom was full had the broken glasses in it with a bottle of wine in it. The bathroom had nothing in it like no soap,  soap holder, kleenex box...etc. I called to have someone come clean it up. They asked if I wanted to place a report,  my family said drop it not a big deal so I did not. NEXT...... we go play in the MGM casino not the same day I ask a worker for a bottle Water for my grandpa so he can take his medication Which I even Explained, As I had been Waiting about 35-40 minutes for our server "pam" who was great but he needed Water ASAP. ....so this other woman told me NO, I NEED TO WAIT FOR MY SERVER VERY RUDE!  I mean it's not like I'm asking for a drink I'm asking nicely for water for my grandpa.  I did request a manager,  all the manager stated was each server has their own jurisdiction and they are very busy. I Said to the floor manager I'm in management myself and customer service is crucial, and if people like me don't report who knows how many people that server us doing that too. Very unprofessional!
NEXT. .... back to the room situation we ended up finding more glass as my cousin got glass in her foot pretty bad we got frustrated Checked out and went to new York new york. Horrible experience.  The room was not cleaned properly prior In between clients which consists of not only making beds but mopping and vacuuming!

We stayed over Thanksgiving and it was not really impressed the thing that pissed me off the most was the lack of coffee in the rooms not at Motel 6 can give you coffee in the room why can't the MGM Grand needless to say I never spent one red cent in the gambling machines simply because I did not have coffee in my room

Came here with my friend during the week. We got a great rate on an executive suite and the room was very nice. It was nice and spacious with a large bathroom. Check in was pretty quick and the guy that checked us in was very friendly. The staff throughout our entire stay was extremely nice and very helpful. We also went down to the buffet in the morning to enjoy the unlimited champagne brunch. The pool was very nice and check out was quick as well. I was a little nervous about some of the reviews but my experience was great and would definitely stay here again!

There is no more lion as of 3.5 years ago but the lobby is still nice with the gold statue of a tiger and is on the way to the monorail.  There's no reason to stay here as it is a bit dreary and has no exhibits other than the Rainforest Cafe aquariums.

Don't leave your mountain bikes locked to your car in the parking garage.  Mine got jacked last night.  And don't expect anyone to respond or care for that matter.  Not the hotel.  Not the Metro police.

What an absolutely beautiful hotel.  The minute you walk in you will see the giant lion greeting you from in his cage. Past that, you will see the long counter full of friendly staff to help you in any way they can. The stay well lounge is nearby to get you checked in too. Finally in the distance is the magnificently large casino that may or may no be nice to you...but have fun and remember your limits.  Below this gigantic building are restaurants and parking. Pay attention to where you are....you can easily get lost or turned around.

Wow, this hotel is MASSIVE.  You keep walking and walking, and you still aren't through the lobby.  The best part about this hotel is the restaurants.  Everything from Micheal Mina to Joel Roubochon.  I love coming here to see the lions, who are always asleep when I get to the exhibit.  This time we ate at the buffet, which is an old favorite of mine.  I liked all of the food choices, yet again, had an upset stomach later.  Damn buffets.

Grand, it is. Also overwhelming, but I don't think that superlative would sound as appealing in its name. 

The MGM Grand, is, according to the check-in-lady who assisted me, the "second largest hotel in the world." Not sure how true that is, but the place is incredibly ginormous. Like many hotels in Las Vegas, it is like a giant shopping mall with nice rooms for sleeping when you're all done spending all your moolah. 

In my 6 days in Sin City, I spent most of my time within the confines of this hotel - I was attending the annual NCTE conference which was held in conference area. I think I walked from my hotel room (in the Grand Tower, close to the entrance) to the conference wing 3 dozen or so times in those 6 days.....and those are LONG walks. 

The conference rooms are nice - good range of small and intimate to huge huge huge (actually, the biggest conferences were held in the ballrooms). An outside promenade led to the vendor\/convention area. I thought the set up was quite well done, and generally things were easy to find. 

My hotel room was really nice. I loved the blackout curtain option. Bed was super comfortable and I loved the bathroom. Internet was spotty at times but overall fine coverage. One thing you have to know - don't expect a mini-fridge (I did, and got quite a surprise!). The fridge in the room has a sign on the bottles that is hard to miss - basically, if you move anything around to store your own stuff, an electronic sensor automatically charges you a $50 re-stocking fee. FIFTY DOLLARS. And if you want your OWN fridge, you can request one - for a mere $35. Good grief. Needless to say, there was no complimentary coffee or tea maker in the room either. My hallway was completely full of guests, yet I never heard noise from other rooms, so kudos on the soundproof-ness. But man, I was the second to last room in my hallway and it was suuuuch a long walk to the elevator, and then of course to the conference area.

Like others have noted, there are just endless options for eating here. From the super cheap (McDonalds) to the lunch and snack crowd (Project Pi, Blizz) to the nice dinner (Craftsteak, Pearl) to the ridiculous dinner (Joel Robuchon), there is something for every palate and budget. Tip: the Starbucks in the food court always has a long line - there is another one by one of the theatres - it usually doesn't have nearly as long of a line. 

MGM Grand is a nice hotel, and while it didn't knock my socks off, I was glad to be able to experience this town for the first time from this hub.

staff is very friendly, helpful, and cheery. everyone says hi in passing.

we stayed in the grand tower which was fairly large for vegas (standard size) and clean. we heard the new remodeled west wing ones were much smaller and the windows are extremely small, like the size of the headboard. quick check in and out. no coffee maker in the room :( which i desperately needed to wake up in time to check out. and the shampoo\/conditioner squeeze bottles are a pain! i spent 5 min in the shower just trying to squeeze the contents out of one bottle.

compared to the other hotel casinos on the strip, it was lacking the WOW factor of vegas. yes, they have a lion habitat and a golden lion in the front and in the lobby but there was nothing else. i did appreciate the golden sun\/stars on the ceiling but it lacked the detail and pazzaz i expected.

One of my favorite places to wander around. This hotel has the most awesome display of the most beautiful lions...  You can walk under them, and see their huge paws right above your head. As they lay there, you can almost reach up and touch them, through the Plexiglas- 
There is a fun cool restaurant here called Rain-forest Cafe and there of course is the casino.  the rooms are not really all that great, but there IS a 'Studio 54' like club that was quite fun. They play 70's and 80's music...and you can get your John Travolta dance moves on...

I'm changing my review from 1 star to 3 because of Alice. She saw my Yelp review and gave me a call to discuss my experience. She was really sweet and professional about the situation, even offering us KA tickets! The show was awesome and even though we couldn't see Atmosphere at the Brooklyn Bowl (our original plans that got delayed because of switching rooms), my boyfriend and I really appreciated it. 5 stars for Alice, 3 stars for the hotel room and 1 star for the inconvenience. Thank you again Alice!

Stayed here June 20th-23rd in one of their West Wing Rooms. Arrived on a Sunday and the lobby was insaaannee! Waited like 20 or so minutes behind ONE person checking in. After waiting we had to take this epic walk to the West Wing. Finally got to the room.. and I thought it was nice but a lil funky. Not really my style and kinda small. The bed was super comfy. The bathrooms were odd and really had no privacy.There were room service carts all over the elevator area and actually stayed there the whole day. I guess they were a little too busy to clean up? 
The air conditioning was OK. It was like 100 deg outside and I dont think the air conditioning could really keep up with the weather outside. The chairs in the room were very uncomfortable and when you took a shower there would be a puddle of water outside the shower every time. 
A good thing about the West Wing is that there is an exit straight to the strip right thru the West Wing Bar. Also its easily accesible to the New York New York walkway and the casino. 
This hotel is epic. It is so big and I got lost so many times. 
The rooms are kind of noisy and you constantly hear people down the hallways and room doors opening and closing. 
The staff was really nice and very helpful with everything. 
As for the casino it was pretty big and always seemed to be packed. Drink service absolutely SUCKS at the MGM grand. 
The monorail is connected to this hotel so that was cool. 

Overall we had a good stay and would probably stay again just because this location is pretty close to everything. Although next time I won't be staying in a West Wing Room. I just didn't like it.

This place is so freakin huge, I liked watching the lions.
My sis in law got married in the little chapel here, then we
partied in their honeymoon suite. That was cool!!
I really like their pool area and lazy river,  they rented a
cabana and we drank all day, fun times!

I was at the MGM Grand for a few days at a conference. I stayed in stayed spa suite with a very delightful view of the strip on the 26th floor. It seems fairly recently renovated in the Grand Tower, and while it is tastefully done you can tell it was on the inexpensive side. It doesn't both me much though, to have a clean room with spotless drawers is what is important to me. At first I thought I heard a lot of road noise, but I think it was just a surprisingly loud evening-- and as a bonus the room comes with a little clock with some ambient noise options!  All in all, not a bad decision on this end of the strip.

If you're looking to stay at a hotel with a lot of action, a Cirque du Soleil show, good restaurants, and amazing pools, this is definitely the hotel for you!  The MGM definitely has a lot of action going on, there's always something to do at this hotel.  

CHECK-IN
Lines were constantly long and never-ending when we stayed there.  When we were checking in, we waited a good 20 minutes in line.  They have a long counter with multiple employees to check guest in but there are just so many guests that it takes them a while to get through the line.  Heidi checked us in and she was awesome, she even got us a nice room with a partial view of The Strip.    She did a good job of explaining the amenities and how to get the free Wi-Fi.     

ELEVATORS
Make sure you know exactly what tower you're staying in because they have a different set of elevators for each tower.  You have to head in the same direction for the elevators but then the paths fork off into different areas to get to your respective side of the hotel.  

ROOM 
The room we stayed in had a decent view of the strip and of the New York Hotel and Casino.  The room was pretty large and clean.  The safe was hidden in the cabinet below our flat screen TV and we also had a mini bar.  The mini bar was strictly for their drinks and there would be a fee if we stored any personal food or drinks in the fridge.  They know because there are sensors in the fridge and every time you remove an item, it keeps track and they charge you for everything that you take out.  The bathroom was pretty spacious and it came with a hairdryer.  

VALET
MGM's valet has a pretty efficient process going on.  There are tons and tons of guests who constantly come and go so they have to be quick and efficient to keep the traffic outside of the hotel in order.  They have a long driveway with multiple lanes and the very far right lane is for the taxi cabs lined up ready to pick up guests at any given time.  The lanes in the middle are where you pull up to drop your car off and the lanes to the left are where they bring your vehicle back to you.  When you're ready for them to bring your car out, you cross all of the lanes and proceed to a window where you give them your ticket and a few minutes later, they drive your car up for you.  Sometimes the wait is long because there are so many people trying to leave the hotel so they have benches for you to wait on.  

On nights that you should really not be driving AKA you're planning to drink a lot, the cabs come in handy!  You just walk out of the hotel and they have a podium to the right of the doors for you to wait for a cab.  Most times, there was no wait at all but on nights where everyone is leaving the club or leaving from the Cirque du Soleil show, you'll be waiting a while.  

GENERAL
The MGM Grand is HUGE and there are tons to do!  When you first walk in, you're in the lobby.  The check in\/out counters are to your right along with the concierge.  To your left is the gift shop and if you go straight, you're on the casino floor then you start hitting the restaurants and bars.  There are convenient signs hanging from the ceiling to point you in the right direction.  

They have a food court area, some upscale stores, restaurants, theaters, sports book, a gym, spa, pools, a club, you name it, and they've got it!  Their pools are my favorite in Las Vegas.  Yes, pools as in multiple pools (check out my review for the Grand Pool Complex).  Their restaurant\/buffet isn't bad either.  It's huge and can serve many people-I also have a separate review for the Grand Buffet.  I also have a review for Hakkasan, the night club on the first floor of the hotel.

The customer service for the hotel alone (not the vendors in the hotel) was pretty awesome.  I can't recall a bad experience from any of the employees.  They were on point from check-in, to valet, room service and check-out.    

This is also going to sound strange but the MGM, in my opinion is the hotel with the best scent!  Every time we walked back into the hotel, we noticed the same light, vanilla scent and I asked some of the employees what it was and they said each hotel has their own scent that comes through the A\/C vents.  It smells pretty awesome, not too overpowering but really nice and comforting.  

CHECK-OUT
The check out process was pretty quick and easy.  You can check out multiple ways and since I wasn't willing to wait in those long lines when we were leaving, I called the operator and they checked me out over the phone and e-mailed my receipt. 

I highly recommend staying at the MGM if you're looking for a lot to do and if you want to be around tons of people who want to have fun.  I am already planning my next visit to Las Vegas and the MGM Grand is at the top of my list on where to stay when I return.

1st time staying at the MGM - wouldn't have picked it, but MyVegas gave me a comp, and we upgraded to the Spa Suite...so glad we did... The room was big, comfy bed, awesome hot tub.  My only draw back was the shower ran out of hot water in just a couple of minutes, which was odd because the hot tub stayed as hot as you would want it... 
This casino is huge, lots to play, close to the monorail - which I love, and has lots of eateries.  
Favorite part of the trip, looking out our window from the 10th floor into a back alley... saw a suv limo pull up and a cop on a bike block the alley... and guess who gets ushered in pretty quickly - Taylor Swift... nice :)

This is my favorite Vegas hotel.  Just stayed here again this weekend.  The lady at check in was very friendly and helpful.  We got a double queen room in the Grand Tower.  The rooms are nicely decorated and are not cramped at all.  Extremely clean bathroom and sleeping area ... I was surprised actually how clean the bathroom was.  Noise level was minimal, which was shocking considering it was a Friday and Saturday night in Vegas.   We visited the Spa too on Saturday, and that was incredibly indulgent.  $25 spa day pass VERY WORTH the price.  Spa staff ladies all were so nice too.  MGM Grand has a handy check out via email process... avoid the checkout line!

I stayed at the MGM grand for a recent conference, and after hearing a coworker state how much she absolutely hated the MGM Grand, I expected the worst. 

The hotel was booked for the weekend, and I arrived late the night before the conference, so only smoking rooms were available. The smoking room was disgusting and since you can't open windows in Vegas, there was nothing I could do but suffer through the night. I felt awful the next morning. 

However, I went and checked the next morning, and they had a non-smoking room available, so I was able to switch that day. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I didn't spend much time in the room, so that's really all I needed. The internet access was reliable and though we did lose water for about 5 hours one day due to the ongoing renovation, we were notified in a timely manner, so it wasn't an issue. 

The casino floor was great. As a newbie, I didn't feel too intimidated walking around, and the waitresses were quick to take care of us.

There were tons of dining options (reviewed separately), access to the Monorail and plenty to do.

The conference space was a bit of a pain. It's not really set up for that many attendees (one escalator up and one down for 7000 people with no regular stair options is a bit ridiculous), but the sound and presentation devices were fine. 

I would stay at the MGM Grand again if I were guaranteed a non-smoking room again, though I may wait until the renovation is complete.

I recently stayed at the MGM for 3 nights. The news reported that visitors to Las Vegas is at an all time low. I figured I take advantage of this fact because I don't like large crowds. My girlfriend researched promo codes online and found us a rate for the hotel of around $69.00 a night. That also came with a meal credit and two cocktails at a bar. The rate was really good for what we got. I give this 3 stars because this rate is the exception and not the norm. If I was able to always get this price, I would have given the hotel 4 or even 5 stars for the value but I'm rating this on the average rate of $120+ dollars a night. The room was very average. A very long distance to the room from the elevator and it took forever to go up or down 27 stories. We wanted a refrigerator and asked for one. They said they would charge extra for the convenience. I also asked for a complimentary inter tube for the lazy river pool. I couldn't see spending $16.00 X2 for a freaking tube I'd use for 20 mins. They refused to budge on the price of the fridge or the  tube. I also asked for free room internet connection. Another NO. Now... when visitors to Las Vegas are at an all time low, why not give up a few things that won't cost the hotel anything just to make the customer happy. I know I being picky but when I go to Vegas, I often ask for comps and I usually get them. This hotel was tight fisted with everything. 

Dinner at Wolfgang Pucks was great. The service was nice and the meal credit worked at the location. The martinis in the West Wing Bar was excellent as well. We had a credit for two free drinks at the bar because of the room promotion. When we went to the bar, they were  having a two for one promotion. So, we ordered two drinks (free because of the room promotion) and then asked for two more because of the bar promotion, that was another NO even though we just wanted water. 

Table service in the casino was awful. I sat at the blackjack table for a long time before we could get any drinks. Tight fisted Casino\/Hotel. We walked across to the Hooters Hotel\/Casino and got drinks easily and had fun with friendly dealers. I lost my money having fun at Hooters and not at the tight fisted MGM. PS... don't knock Hooters unless you've been there. 

I'm not suggesting you avoid the MGM Grand, I'm just suggesting you get a great deal before deciding to stay there because they ain't going to give you anything above average.

I enjoyed staying here. The rooms are nice and modern. There are plenty of great restaurants and bars in the hotel. They even have their own club here too. The downside is this place is so huge it can take a while to get from your room to anywhere you want to be. It's on the south end of the strip so the location isn't the best but the amenities and room quality here make up for it.
It has a Fat Tuesday for drinks and I think the last electric horse derby betting game in Vegas (one still in tahoe).

I want to say that I read a lot of reviews on Yelp about MGM before going on my trip to Las Vegas for Thanksgiving getaway. Most of bad reviews are about West wing which hotel offers discounted prices for. I did not book a room in that area but I did pass though it on my way to Grand Canyon tour and from what I've seen and reviews I read I can tell you this: if you don't care what room you stay in as long as you have a place to stay, you don't have kids traveling with you, don't mind smoke (both cigarettes and recreational drugs) in your room, not claustrophobic (rooms are small with dark windows) then West wing will not bother you. 
Since we came late on Thanksgiving night there was almost no line for us at check in. We booked a room at Grand tower and our service desk employee gave us great room on 22nd floor with nice view (we did not tip). This area in non smoking with great clean hallways. Pretty quiet as well.
Room was very clean and big. Our room service did great job cleaning our room. 
Surprisingly we got to enjoy our pool as well since weather was unusually warm for this time of the year and pool stayed open. 
Every employee at hotel was very helpful! 
They offer great choice of food (from breakfast to late night including buffet), entertainment (highly recommend KA by Cirque du Soleil), nightlife (had tons of fun at Hakkasan night club) and amenities (one of the biggest pools).
Be aware that your room rate does not include 40$ per day resort fee that includes pool access, free WiFi and gym. 
Great five days! Will definitely come back!

On my way to the poker room :) This is the best casino eva people. Come play with me here. I bet you have a ball!
That's what I do when I'm here! Party over here & party over at tha pool. This casino is ok I give it five stars total. I'm here often! I like to pretend I'm famous when I'm here.
 I even went to my eye doctor and got cool poker shades to gamble here. 
This place is a pure party. I mean it's everything VEGAS is famous for but when I'm here I am in the building for hours its like a 2nd home. Yelp! And lucky me...what happeneds in Vegas stays in Vegas. This is one casino where u really can win. No funny monkey business this place rocks! Look the food is great. The employees are kind and fun. Its nothing like being around people who love they job. They make it fun. They don't try and rip you off. Its packed with security so you feel safe. Its even spots to charge ya phone or at least I found secret spots to charge my phone. (Giggles) I have been like 10 days in a row thus far I am beyond addicted. The employees tell me I should gamble responsibly. I tell them well bring this gamble responsibly to the table I will sure gamble with him or her. (kmsl)

Decent casino, once you actually get in. Single turn lane to get onto property from the Strip and a gigantic and confusing parking garage situation turns this into a time-consuming process.

Good selection of dining, snack, and drink options, including a Starbucks on the floor, a pie dessert place, Fat Tuesdays for frozen drinks, and a wok\/sushi place that looks rather upscale.

Floor of slots is kept clean and has a lot of variety, but I played and was in the area for over three hours and was never approached by employees or offered a drink. Found that very odd.

 This is definitely a place for young partiers to stay, the floor was constantly congested with girls whose breasts were falling out of their tops and women who were flat-out falling as they made their way back to their rooms. 

 Stayed in rooms twice now, I've really liked them. The deals on Hotwire are always well-priced (and you can package together with flight from SFO super cheap), and the on site gym is sufficient for your cardio workout.

I like it here. Are there nicer and newer places on the strip, YES. But this place has everything and does it well. Great restaurants, good access to other hotels, and a very good casino. This is my go to place and I have never met anyone that hates it.....

I've stayed here on many occasions for both business and pleasure.  The place is big!  It's a good thing and a bad thing really.  I often feel overwhelmed when walking through the casino area because of the massive real estate that you have to cover to get from one place to the next.  The bar\/lounge near the front is a great place to chill though.  The rooms are decent.  The newer rooms in the West wing are very fashionable but if you are in one of the outer rooms it will feel like you are walking down a neverending hallway.  The tables here are a bit on the higher priced side as well.  If you are looking to throw some cash but not go super crazy while having lots of gambling options then this is a good place to go.

Get your walkin' shoes on - this place is HUGE!  I stayed in the Grand Tower for five days for a conference.  By the fifth day, I just started to figure out where everything was.  Staff is very friendly, knowledgeable and willing to help in any way.  There are a tremendous number of restaurants - upscale, casual, and everything in between - and shopping available inside.  Do be aware that the main lobby does not front on the Strip so it is a long walk through the casino to get to the Strip.

Rooms were comfortable and well stocked.  I particularly liked the electric blackout curtains to help me after a few long nights.

The MGM Grand is not the best hotel I have ever stayed at, but it is very good at what it does.  If I come back to Vegas, I would certainly stay here again, but I will be willing to check rates at other properties on the Strip and check to see if I can get a better deal somewhere else.  

Special tip - go to the Starbucks at the west lobby in the morning.  The lines are much shorter than the lines at the other two Starbucks (yes - there are three Starbucks.  I told ya this place is huge)

We stayed here 3 separate times during my last vacation. Why 3 times ? That was courtesy of Mlife platinum thank you ! 
We were also given resort credit for food and drinks, so who can say no ? 

Twice we stayed in identical spa suites ( only difference was the floor we were on) 

The suite was spacious. The living room and bedroom was more of an open concept studio style rather then separate bedroom. It was divided by a desk and TV. 

I liked the accent colors used and the art work. Purple ( one of my favorite colors ) it made for some great backdrops for photos. 

The living room had a large sectional and was decorated with a big huge lamp that looked like an old school movie set light.  It also had a mini bar with the usual drinks and snacks. 

The bed was a comfy King size. I think the bed was used less for sleep then it was for other fun activities ( I'm a newlywed what can I say !! ) 

There was large windows that stretched across the room facing the airport. 

The bathroom was the best. It was huge and brightly lit.  It had a long vanity with double sinks, a decent sized shower. 

The toiletries did leave a bit to be desired. 
They weren't exactly high end and didn't have conditioner or shower gel. 
Luckily I had my own, but I like to save ones from hotels, for donating to shelters when I'm home. 

The Jacuzzi was the best part, however It was high up on a platform which made it hard to get in and out of. I wish they had a small ladder as it would of come in really handy. Be careful! 

It also wasn't very big or deep. We had 3 people in it and it was a really tight squeeze ! Even for 2 people was still kinda small. However it still was fun : ) 

I liked the elevators that lead to the Grand Tower. They have a nice big waterfall in the middle. 

In the casino we loved the "Deal or No Deal" game ( located in front of the VIP lounge ) play it if you get a chance ! It lasts much longer then most slot machine games when you hit the bonus and tends to pay out more often then not. 

The "Walking Dead" game was also good due to my husband winning large on it. I myself get bored rather quick on slots, and would rather spend money on shopping (often with funds from his slot winnings - but that's another story ! ) 


The VIP lounge is behind a set of gold doors. Located in the casino to the left of the main front check in. It's behind the first few slot machines. You will see the large doors and the VIP plaque. 

 If your privileged enough to be granted access ( you must show your VIP key upon entry ) snooty attendants will serve you a glass of champagne upon request. They also have a few light snacks available, and the usual non alcoholic beverages. 

You may also use this area to lounge around and read magazines, as well you can check-in here. 

The casino has a large number of places to eat, and the staff were all great. (special thanks to Justin from StayWell he was amazing !! ) 

We went when it was quiet ( late Nov ) we went when it was slamming packed ( during the Rodeo ) and again when it was quiet ( mid Dec ) and I much preferred the times when it was not busy. 

It's not as cushy as say the Aria or The Venetian \/ Palazzo but it's way better then the Luxor ! 

I'm not sure if I would stay here normally, However if it was comped again....

I've never been a big fan of the MGM. I stayed there once a long time ago, and the rooms were decent, but the casino itself really doesn't offer anything that great for me. It's huge, which is almost a detractor as you seem to have to walk forever to get to what you want. I recently came here to go to Wet Republic, and from my car to the pool was like a 20-30 minute walk, no joke. There's a lot of restaurants here, but I can't say I've been to one in years. MGM's time in the sun has come and gone. It's just not top notch anymore, sorry guys.

Awesome place, as big as it can be. A complete city. It was that big that we had to walk for so long to get tithe pool. Clean Hotel, wide rooms. However, the temperature of the A\/C in the halls was too cold. Great selection of restaurant. The casino area was well ventilated, even though people smoked, we could hardly smell it.

3 nights for $59 a night with King size on second floor of West Wing was a nice experience. We were close to elevator and strip with a quick hop to a cab. We drove so some days it was a hike to the parking. 
Plus:
nice down bedding
large clean walk in shower with really great pressure and heat
2 tvs
many mirrors for the lady

Minus:
hike to our car
smoky casino
not enough in hotel shopping

We were going on a budget and it worked for our budget, would stay again

I stayed at MGM June 21st through the 24th for business trip. When we pulled up in the car, not one person came to help with the bags. Next, when I got to my room on the 10th floor, I noticed a large 'gross' red stain on the carpet, bedding, and bed skirt. I called the desk and was told I would just have to wait for housekeeping to clean it due to the hotel was 'booked up'. I didn't like that answer but figured I had no choice. Waited for 45 min or so and not one person came to clean up the nasty mess. I found a maid in the hall, asked her to come to my room to see if she could help me with a problem. I showed her the stains & she told me she knew of the stains but thought someone else had cleaned it up. I asked her why could the hotel rent the room knowing it was not ready and was gross. She did not answer, left and I did not see her again. I waited a little longer whereas my employer called the desk. I was then moved from the 10th floor to the 20th floor which is a smoking floor. I don't smoke nor do I tolerate it well. But...i figured if there were not gross bloody looking stains on the bedding... i was better off. The new room was stale smelling, smokey and had cig burns all over it. I am very very disappointed with the appearance and service of the MGM. Four years ago, it was a premier hotel.... now it's more of a dive.

There used to be a time when MGM was this great an wonderful place. It was huge. Gambling was fun. Now it's just chugging along and I'm not quite sure it knows where to go. 

Honestly, the best thing this place has going is the Garden Arena, which still sounds excellent and the all inclusiveness that might appeal to families wanting a day or two away.

For me, it just wasn't it. They noted construction going on, but I didn't know how annoying and bad it got until they actually started doing it. Banging, cold water... It was too much. I called and asked for just a late check out so I can sleep a little and they couldn't do it. I should mention that it was on a Monday and the place was FAR from busy. 

I didn't mind the resort fees. I valeted and used the internet, so it seemed worth it. Though including the cardio room and not the gym seemed rather odd. 

Now here comes the kicker, after 4 days, I just wanted some nice employee to help me with my bags, instead I got some lousy guy who was pissy that he had to load my bags. He literally threw them into my car. Thank goodness nothing broke, but did he have to be an ass about it? It's his job. He put the cooler I had in the front seat. NOT on the floor. Did he magically think it was going to be seat belted? It's a cooler! Not a person! I even tipped him BEFORE this. I should have done it after and throw pennies at his pressed ass. (Yes, I said that.)

Back in the day, MGM was one of my favorite places to go. You would think when the economy is in the shitter, they'd work on some customer service skills.

Yeah, no.

The Grand is a fixture of the Las Vegas scene.  Not as recognizable as some of its cohorts, perhaps, it's still quintessential Las Vegas Strip.  This goes both ways.  

My friends checked in ahead of me because my flight was fairly late.  I managed to get from the plane to a Lyft to the Grand in relatively short order.  It can be overwhelming for a first time Vegas goer, though.  SO MANY LIGHTS AND SOUNDS.  The main lobby is appropriately impressive and it just goes on from there.  The actual layout is very sprawling but I found I was able to get around with a minimum of backtracks.  I'm not sure I was always going the quickest way, but it never seemed hard to find places in the hotel.

The room itself was pretty small, as expected.  It was clean however, and remained that way for our trip, despite our best efforts to the contrary.  Maid staff were never seen by us, since we were always out the door before they came around, but we never had cause to complain about the service.  They provide a hotel safe, which I highly recommend you use, as part of the room.  Don't make your password 1-2-3-4-5.  

There are plenty of restaurants, nightclubs, etc. to enjoy here.  I really can't recommend or even remember any of the food I had here that clearly, but I do remember the price not being commensurate with the value, to say the least.  If you're staying here, try to eat elsewhere.  I stuck to Starbucks for my morning yogurt and that served me pretty well.  The weekday mornings have a pretty strong contingent of convention goers, so there will be a line in many of the food court areas.  

For our last night, my roommates and I decided to upgrade to a suite.  This is where the ratings dive, but then recover.  We had reserved this upgrade on Wednesday.  When Saturday came, there was a 'hiccup' with the reservation.  My one roommate went down around noon the day of and was told they had no suites for the night, despite us reserving and paying in advance.  Fair enough, we headed out for the day and returned around 6.  At that point, I went down with the same roommate and went to talk to the concierge.  Realizing that the Grand is a huge business and we are a very small part, I was just gearing up to do my best 'incensed customer' routine to provoke some management response, but this proved unnecessary.  They did some shuffling and gave us a suite and some money off for the inconvenience, which I appreciated.  The suite itself was well worth it and the difference between it and an ordinary room is leaps and bounds.  Even the soaps are better.  I highly recommend splurging for at least one night.

Overall, this is a great place to have as a base of operations.  There are some basic victuals to keep you from dying, and it's a stone's throw from many of the popular strip locations.  However, try not to eat too much here, there is much more around the area that gives a better value.  Also, don't give up if you get denied a request at first, switching personnel or shifts may yield you better results.

I am not a big gambler but if I were this place would have been a paradise. It is huge! Someone told me that it would take us 20 minutes to get to our car from our hotel room; they were not exaggerating. The hotel itself was very clean and there was more than enough staff to accommodate the amount of guests. Our room, I believe, was in the newer section; the room itself was a very modern design and very clean. I have one complaint, the hour we had to wait just to check in. The check in desk was huge and the line was moving, there are just that many people in this place. The monorail does come to this hotel, which is convenient, just keep in mind you will have to walk a bit to get to it. The hotel itself needs a monorail. A little too big for my taste but I would probably stay again if the price were right. If you have no issues getting a little exercise just to get to the front door, or getting lost in a maze of unlimited slot machines you will probably love this place.

Room Tip: the newer rooms are a very modern design unlike the basic hotel room.

I don't gamble, but my buds taught me how to here, and I must say the folks working around porker table were really nice and helpful (spending my money) Im sure they were like "look this dumb earth who never played before", yet, they were so patient waiting for my move and occasionally made joke to make the table feel at ease. That's kind of service that I like. 

Like I said, I don't gamble but If I ever feel like trying again, I will choose MGM.

We came here on a recent fight night  and the place was packed.  The glitz and glam was over the top and it was quite fascinating to see all the people dressed to the nines to go and see a couple of guys beat the crap out of each other.

Unfortunately that was the only memorable thing about MGM.  This place is a staple of the strip and at one point and used to be the place to go.  Now with the many upscale casinos that have popped up along the strip, MGM has become somewhat archaic.

To MGM's credit, they tried to remain relevant by changing their business model in the early to mid 90's by becoming "family friendly" and building an amusement park.  Unfortunately for them that model didn't work because Vegas isn't a kids town.  That is evident by all those street vendors handing out the escort pamphlets as you walk up and down the streets.

From the outside, MGM is still gorgeous.  There is something royal about that greenly lit building without the tackiness of many Vegas establishments.  The inside however could use a face lift as many of us could with age.  It seems as though they are continuously working on the entrance at the corner of Trop \/ LV Blvd and I would suggest they take some of that budget and move it inwards.

Table prices are high as you'd expect but you can go across the street to one of the lessor known casinos and find more reasonable tables.  

I still like MGM.  It is like an old shoe that is comfortable.  But even with old shoes, you eventually have to upgrade.

Son gave me a gift card for MGM and when I went to use it I was told it was NOT valid.  I called an 800 number and was told that they take money off gift cards monthly.  AVOID MGM they are ripping people off for a few bucks.  Charging for parking, added fees for shows, and now won't honor gift cards. Stay away, stay away.

OMG I am really totally speechless! When you hear the word Vegas - the MGM Grand is what comes to mind as a hotel. Vegas, The strip - MGM Grand. At least in my world it did. I've been here before - I guess a decade ago because things sure have changed. I was so surprised at the rooms! I stayed on the 17th floor in the newely so called  remodeled grand king suite. Nothing Grand about this king suite! No plush soft towels, no his and hers bath robes, no microwave, and yes they have a frig oh my bad - they're so called mini bar. Quick story: So on top of the frig they tell you to call house keeping so that you can get the frig open and put your stuff in- you would think! Hell NO - housekeeping is not coming up to open the frig for you to put your stuff in - but they'll loan you a small frig for $24.00 a night for your stuff. FUCK YOU... really??? You're the MGM GRRANNNDDDD! You can't give your paying customers a freakin frig for their drinks, food, etc. Oh I'm sorry I'm suppose to go and use the ice machine to keep my shit cold. FUCK YOU! Other hotels - have a mini bar but allow you to use the same frig. Just know when you eat or drink something - you'll have to pay. Needless to say I was very disappointed. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday. The room was small. The pictures on the website kind of fool you which is why I go here on yelp to see THE REAL PHOTOS. The room sucked so much I didn't even really bother to take photos. It was a plane jane room Nothing fancy unless you like your room to glow like in ghost hunters. The walls are thin as hell. You can hear people outside the hallway and in their rooms. And the TV Channels suck. They list a show is on - when you turn to that channel something totally different is on. If you plan on being in your room some of the time - bring a portable cd player. Why pay $9.99 for old movie they feature??? The internet sucks - its a hit or miss. Just all together this place sucked. I really expected more. One good thing about this place I will say is - the bed is good and in order to pass up the long ass lines - sign up for that M-Life thing - it'll get you past alot of the long lines and crowds - especially during check in. That's it. I think if you want to stay at the MGM stay at the Signature hotel with the jacuzzi rooms. Will I be back to the MGM Grand again - NOPE - we're definitely going across the street to New York - New York. The crowd was livelier and there was soooo much stuff to do. I cannot wait until my next Las Vegas trip. The rainforest resturant - what a joke - what they charge you for the food you can get better elsewhere. $14 drinks - are you kidding. Fuck you again MGM. Yes you greased me really good with the vasaline this time - but never again... never again!!! Oh and the parking sucks too!

i wouldn't mind staying at mgm grand again next time.  i took away 1 star because it didn't have a mini fridge in the room.  the toilet was flooded after i used it the first time but they were extremely prompt in coming to fix it with plunger and towels.  we only tried the grand buffet for breakfast and it was ok. overall, solid cleanliness in the room\/beds and in the hallways and to the exits.  however, we didn't leave until monday and it seems like no one works sunday nights. the room service pick ups were there from sunday afternoon all the way till monday morning when it was time to check out. tsk tsk.  the hallway was filled up with room service pick ups.

Rooms have been updated since the last time I stayed here 3 years ago. The bathroom now has a very nice, brightly lit mirror, something I know we ladies can really appreciate.  I wouldn't mind staying here again especially since Hakkasan is just downstairs.

Really enjoyed my stay here this past weekend when we came to celebrate my sister's 21st birthday. I arrived at the hotel later so I did not go through the check-in process--my sister did though, she said everything went smoothly and it wasn't very long. However, I can see how some people have experienced long waits. When we were leaving I saw the extremely long lines in the lobby. 

Anyway, our floor and room were very clean and we didn't experience any mishaps. Housekeeping was quick with our requests and were pleasant. We loved that there was a Fat Tuesday located in the hotel which was frequented by us many times during our stay. Based on this experience, I would stay here again.

I used to love the MGM, Stayed there four times in the last five years.  
Our last trip there was in May and I think our next time in Vegas, we will stay at Caesar's.

Number one reason I won't go back - they got rid of the Lion Habitat.  They still have lion statues though, just not the same as the real cats.

We  also had some problems getting housekeeping to make up our rooms.  Two days they missed us completely and the third time, after several calls, the Housekeeping manager came to clean our room while wearing a suit and tie!  He was super nice and a hard worker but it was 9:00 PM!  We complained at checkout and was told they would reverse the resort fees for three days, but we had to email them from home because they didn't follow through on reversing them.

I still love the pool area but it was hard to find chairs if you got there around 10:00 or 11:00 and I got tired of the drunks that stand in the lazy river while I have to swim around them.  Most are very nice people though, always willing to share a beer with the people floating by!

Still like the comfy beds, pool restaurant and the Grand Wok restaurant (best orange chicken I've ever had).

Bring back the lions!  Or go see them at the Lion Habitat Ranch 12 miles from the strip.  Check the Ranch's website or Facebook page for their hours before you go.

I stayed here because it was free, minus the resort fees. When my husband and I checked in the lady at the counter gave us a free "upgrade" The room didn't look anything like the picture she showed us. It was done out of kindness because it was our anniversary, but I will never stay here again. The carpet is absolutely disgusting. In fact ...this place doesn't look any nicer than Excalibur, but they charge a hell of a lot more.

We had a huge week long conference here for the OpenText Enterprise World.  The rooms were nice however I would request that they put a microwave, an operating refrigerator...they have a mini bar only fridge that can't fit anything other than the liquor that they have stocked...and having to be up really early for meetings it would have helped to have an in room coffee maker...I'm just saying! :O) The staff is super friendly, attentive and helpful!

Choose another hotel in a better area of the strip. Been in Vegas three times, and this hotel is by far the worst!

First of all, the hotel is too huge. You have to walk for ten minutes in bathing clothes just to get to the pool area. The casino is by far the worst you can be in on the strip. They don't even try to remove the cigarette smell in the casino. And they brag about being a "smoke free" hotel. The rooms are big, but we got a room that smelled of smoke. Called the front desk twice and they did nothing about it. They worst place that smelled smoke was the closet. Couldn't hang clothes in, or stow away our suitcases there. The ventilation in the room had the same smell that other hotels use to hide the cigarette smell from their casinos. A bad and nauseating smell, that you don't want in your room. It's almost as they knew that someone had tried to smoke in our room before us, or at least knew that their ventilation system is really bad. If you want a good night sleep, choose something else. In my floor, 24th, we got woken up in the middle of the night all three nights we stayed there. From people shouting, and knocking on doors. And if that wasn't enough, all Grand Canyon tours by helicopter starts and ends just nearby the hotel making they helicopters pass just over the hotel late in the evening and early in the morning. Tried to complain upon check-out, and they didn't even say they were sorry. And if even that wasn't enough, we saw when we came home that the bill had a resort fee higher than promised when we ordered the hotel. And that just completed our bad experience with the hotel.

If you are traveling to Vegas to party, this is an ok place to stay. If you travel to Vegas to party and get a good night sleep, stay somewhere else. If you travel with family and small children, or girl\/boyfriend, you absolutely have to stay somewhere else! Don't say I didn't warn you!

My husband I recently stayed here with our 2 year old daughter, and I'm 7 months pregnant. I would say our stay was great! We stayed Wednesday to Friday. Originally I had booked the west wing room but after reading bad reviews paid $20 extra a night after I received and email with the exclusive offer and stayed in the grand room which is 100 sq feet bigger and had an amazing view of the strip! My family loved it and my daughter enjoyed seeing the bright lights and airplanes and helicopters leaving from the airport. 

I would recommend staying here to anyone who wants a nice relaxing stay. We enjoyed the pools with waterfalls and the lazy river. It was relaxing for my whole family!

I've always been a fan of the MGM rooms because they are fairly priced and pretty decent. It had been a few years since I've stayed here and recently decided on this hotel as it had never really failed me before. I gave them too much credit. 

My weekend started out great, in town celebrating a friend's bachelorette party. As she was staying in the room with me, we were offered a complimentary bottle of champagne at check in which I thought was a nice touch. The champagne arrived later that night just as they said it would. When we checked out, they charged it to my room bill. Really, MGM? I didn't ask for the champagne, it was offered to me. I was able to get the charge reversed when checking out but I thought this was a dumb mistake to make. 

Next, while the room was pretty decent, the AC never went below 75 degrees. We were there in a hot Vegas summer when outside it's well over 100 degrees. I did call downstairs to have someone come look at it and was told that they would get someone to check it out for us, but no one ever came. Disappointing. 

Sunday morning when we woke up to check out, we discovered that they had shut off the water to our floor and yup, that meant no shower, no sink water, no working toilet. Called again downstairs to ask about the water and was only told "we are working on the floor below you and the water will be off for a while" This is really not acceptable in a hotel. Thankfully at this point we were checking out and had other friends staying in a different hotel so we took our stuff over to their place to borrow their working bathroom. 

Overall I was really disappointed in my stay. Probably won't ever book a room here again because no one seemed to care that the water was not working on our floor. What is the point of paying for a room when you have no working bathroom?

Far from impressed. Room was dusty and had visible hairs in the bathroom from a previous guest. Carpet is buckled in the middle of the room. A "strip view" room is somewhat useless because you can't see much out of the dirty windows. Maybe it is one of those billboard things but I don't think so. Service is either rude or uncomfortably friendly. Fees here are insane. They charge $32+ per day for a resort fee which gets you spotty at best internet and God knows what else that is useful. I went to the pool and it costs $16\/day to rent a tube and I got a package sent to the hotel and they charged me a $10 handling fee. The casino is so smokey I did not want to gamble. The potential for an amazing stay is here but the execution is lacking. Think I'll stay elsewhere next time.

For the price, this hotel is pretty good. I was there for a work trip a few months ago, and we stayed in the West Wing.  The room is ultra modern, with a very convenient sloping floor for when you forget to turn off the faucet. Yeah, the MGM has been in this rodeo for a while.

The only complaint is that the casino floor is dingy and smoky, with none of the special smell pumping out of the Aria.

We stayed at the MGM Grand in room 513 from Nov 28 - Dec 2.  The room had problems with tiles raised from the floor and grout missing from the tiles.  Water leaked out of the show.  The water from the shower was very cold.  We talked to the front desk and the facilities person told us that the water came from a block away and we needed to leave the water running for at least 10 min.  Now how is this helping conserve water?  The carpet was torn up in the transition between the tile and the carpet.  There was black mold in the shower.  It was not cleaned well.  The craftsmanship in the room was of poor quality.  For the price it was not the quality I was expecting.

I've never stayed at this hotel, but have visited it frequently. My initial inclination was to say that I don't much care for MGM Grand. Why? I don't know.

A commonly heard complaint is that it's uncomfortably large. Maybe that's true for those staying at MGM, but I don't find it bothersome. Another criticism is its lack of a killer show - but that's hardly a reason to write off the place.
 
The biggest problem is its location. MGM Grand is south Strip, and I'm a center\/north Strip kind of person. In addition, there's not very much else surrounding MGM that I find interesting. There's not much incentive to just wander into the place.

Then why do I visit it frequently?

** GREAT RESTAURANTS **
MGM Grand is second only to Wynn in its collection of fine dining venues. Joel Robuchon is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas, and L'Atelier is a much cheaper but still excellent alternative. Seablue is pretty good, and Emeril's is surprisingly good as well.

** LIVELY CRAPS TABLES **
I've only played here a few times, but whenever I did my fellow players were having a good, loud time.

** SIGMA DERBY!!!!! **
With the closing of The New Frontier, MGM Grand is now the only casino which has Sigma Derby. It's cheap, it's fun, and it goes especially well with alcohol. Play it before it disappears, folks.


Wow, I guess I like MGM Grand more than I thought.

I had a great experience with this hotel. We got early check in right away and our room was very nice. I ordered room service, the woman said it would be about an hour but my food actually came in about 30 minutes. We had balloons delivered for a special occasion and it was affordable and nice. Our neighbors on either side were quite noisy but that's Vegas for you. I will stay at the MGM again.

Perhaps one of my favorite hotels to stay in Vegas. It is definitely on the higher end, so definitely book in advance or search for deals. Staff are extremely friendly, checking in and checking out option were smooth and fast. 

Rooms are beautiful, extremely clean. I love the little jacuzzi in the bigger suites for soaking your feet after a night of crazy dancing. I would definitely come back, if I 1) Richer 2) Special Promotion (wink wink)

MGM Grand has a lot to offer in the way of eateries (both casual and sit-down), UFC fights in their renowned arena, David Copperfield's theater, pools and 2 of the hottest clubs on the strip, Wet Republic (dayclub) and Hakkasan (nightclub). They offer self parking as well as valet, and the self parking garage isn't too far of a walk. Employees were friendly and helpful. Many hotels on the strip cover up the scent of cigarette smoke these days, but MGM does not. You can really smell cigarettes permeating everything and it was bothering my allergies.

As far as the rooms, they were acceptable while not luxurious. We stayed in a 2 queen bed room in the Grand Tower. The bathroom is on the smaller side with a shower, no bathtub, only one sink and a non-enclosed toilet. They offer wifi which is included in the resort fee, but it was too slow to use with my apps. Overall I just felt that the rooms could use a little upgrade, but they were clean and comfortable.

This hotel is in a perfect location for fun!

The rooms are spacious and clean.   No old casino or stale smoke smell.  Located in the beginning of the Strip, MGM offers great dining and nightlife.

Our room was located near the front of the hotel.  The beds are comfortable and our hallway was quiet. 

Hotel prices are good here and location is premium.  How can you say no and not stay here.
One of the best hotels on the strip by far....great rooms, great service, had the best pool on the vegas strip....it has a river pool get a tube nd relax.

I always have a place in my heart for this place... it was one of the first casinos I stayed at when I first visited Vegas. I love the pool complex because of the lazy river. All my friends know my obsession with it. It is still not a bad place, but some parts of the hotel are showing their age. On one of my recent visits, I was given a "celebrity suite", sounds nice... jacuzzi in the bathroom etc... wow let me tell you something, this place was awesome and amazing if the year was 1992. Thats the last time I think anything modern was placed in this room. And they gave me a room way up on the 4th floor, so my view outside was of the parking lot and right under the window was a giant green spotlight... nice!
Aside from this, I was somewhat content with this place. I feel like they need a major renovation soon but for now, it's still A- OK!

Booked a Tower Suite for my fiancé and I for a weekend away.  We did it the smart way and stayed Sunday-Wednesday.  These are the "off" days and it saved us a bunch of money in hotel costs.  

We got early check-in which I always love.  Gives us time to settle in before heading out.  Our room was AWESOME.  King size bed with separate sitting area.  Last time I was in Vegas we stayed at Aria and there was an issue with outlets for charging out devices.  MGM had plenty of them!  This made me happy!  

Our bathroom was my fav with a soaking\/jetted tub for two.  Created a lot of relaxation time.  

The mini bar had some great items and actually were reasonably priced.  I know that $6 for a beer seems a lot but that's just about the cost if your order downstairs.  We bought bottled water off the strip and would keep it cold in ice\/water in the sink.  

Parking was good.  We did valet a few times but it did take awhile to get our car during busy times.  The parking garage was pretty easy to get to as well.  

We ate at some local restaurants and also took in the show, Ka.  My favorite was the spa.  I scheduled their special of the season a honey\/milk massage.  It was amazing!  I like the spa area with Jacuzzi and sauna.  I wish I could have taken more advantage of it but we had a full schedule.  

The only downside was that we could hear a lot of noise from outside at night.  This wasn't a huge issue as we would just turn up the TV or put music on to sleep at night.  

I would recommend this hotel, especially the deals you can get during the off-schedule.

it's sort of old, especially on the casino side, but we've stayed here at a suite before. the rooms spacious, the couches and chairs were comfortable, floors in the main room were marble, and the view was lovely.
