Most of the promotions they email out and we sign up for have a "resort credit" included with the rate.  In 2014, we stayed at MGM three times and each time,  we had a different billing issue.  Only one of those times did we receive the full amount of our resort credit,  due to misinformation given to us at check-in. And believe me, we asked about the right way to use it. The first time,  we even asked for bill correction before we left and they emailed us an updated invoice.  Then someone reversed our credit out and  charged our card. I had to call back a couple days later when I saw it on my credit card and sort it all out.   If they will just get their billing together, MGM has it going on. 

Fix it before June 2015 , ok

Stayed here for my 21st birthday vegas trip. Honestly it was better than I expected. I read some of the reviews here that said it was old and dirty but I did not get that at all!

The only negative thing from keeping this a five star review was upon check in, they gave me two double beds instead of what I had booked. They said it was based on availability, I understood but still did not think it was right. The next morning I called down to the front desk they got me another room with the king size bed and a city view.  

I had a BLAST here, Poker here was the best. Thats where I spent all my time. I stayed for a week and could not have been more pleased with the staff. 

The parking really is a pain thou, Almost a 10 min walk to our car. So I just valet it from there on. The hotel is HUGE! 

I cant wait for my next trip out here!

I've stayed in far better hotels in Vegas & wasn't impressed with the MGM. Was here for a week for work and staying in the West Wing. As soon as I walked into my room (14-511) I was greeted by the restroom.... no really...you walk in and see the wash basin. Super weird. After unpacking I discovered the drawer right under the TV was broken. Called up housekeeping...but they told me to call up maintenance...seems like this is a pretty regular occurrence as no one sounded surprised. Since I was barely in the room and out for work the entire day, I would have ignored all this if the bathroom had proper hot water. Not only was the water pressure terrible, the water was barely lukewarm. Again...calls to housekeeping didn't do much. 

Compare this to the Aria or the Cosmopolitan which have stellar customer service.... MGM in general seems to have a pretty lackluster attitude towards their guests. 

The place itself is a meandering maze...it takes at least 7-10 minutes to get to the elevators from your room. 

Pros:
3 Starbucks cafes - one is hidden behind the "Show tickets" booth opposite Centrifuge and always nearly empty
The Food Court - labeled as "The District"  - so you can get a bite without breaking the bank. 

Overall, MGM needs a  major customer service re-haul. Wouldn't opt to stay here  with so many better choices.
Old and needs to be revamped. I am not crazy about this casino. Stayed here on a business trip. Its ok, but just kinda old.

Ohhh the MGM. Large and green, it stands out as a destination on the Las Vegas Strip. I recently stayed here for 3 nights and had a great experience from the time I walked in the door. All of the employees were very friendly and helpful. I was seriously impressed with how professional everyone was. That's one of the main reasons I gave them 5 stars. I felt like everything I needed was taken care of. My room was newly remodeled in lovely modern decor. I did wish they had a balcony, but I know that's not very common in Las Vegas. It also would have been nice to have a separate mini fridge (besides the minibar) for food I wanted to eat later. I suppose I should have asked about that. The bed was amazing! I got the best sleep I possibly could, while in Vegas. If only I had a bed like that at home!! But for some reason the casino and hallways were always freezing. I'm from Phoenix, I can't handle that! 

I also loved the pool. It was huge with a lazy river, volleyball and waterfall pools all packed full of people having a good time. I went two days in a row and never wanted to leave! 

They also were so nice to hold my bags when I checked out and had some time to kill before heading to the airport. (Super close to the airport which is a plus!)

Overall I really had a good time staying at the MGM Grand. It was really close to lots of other hotels I wanted to walk to and even though there was usually a line for cabs, the wait went by very quickly (they were also legit and trustworthy cabs). I would definitely stay there again if I was going back to Vegas!!

MGM has been my goto spot when heading to Vegas and with good reason. It has everything you can want and need without having to leave. Tons of food options ( low and high-end dining) , a ridiculous pool complex complete with a dope lazy river and who can forget one of the most popping nightclubs in LV aka Hakkasan. 

If you rented a car, do yourself a favor and valet it. The self park is towards the back and really is a waste of time walking back and forth especially when you're here on vacation. 

I booked an executive queen suite ( the old bungalo rooms ) which has plenty of room and a short walk from the front lobby. 

The floor usual gets popping during night. Most dealers have a happy disposition and make table games enticing to join. The remaining look like death took over and wonder what they've done with their lives. 

The only thing better then staying at MGM would be staying at the Skylofts at MGM. 

I'll be back...
room is not bad, nice service. Japanese restaurant and Steak house are pretty good there. Recommended for family and friends group.

It's huge, massive, confusing. I used to love this place for the lineup at Hakkasan. And while I'll still go back for the DJs, I've lost interest in the rest of Hakkasan as a nightclub (rude staff). The route to even get to the club is confusing and long and windy.
27th floor strip view was nice. The casino was charitable to my foundaton as long as I had sold my soul to it. Will visit again.

Stayed here while attending the ACM's. Overall it's a nice hotel ,it's on the more southern end of the Las Vegas strip sitting across from New York New York. The one thing I do not like is how the overall hotel is laid out concerning the casino floor and generally finding your way around. Now, I realize they do this on purpose but yet this hotel seems more confusing than most in its general layout. All of the rooms were fairly up-to-date and no major issues did order room service they quoted an hour in delivered within that hour. The pool looked like the place to be although from your room it's a hike. To give you a sense of how big the property is, I believe I counted four Starbucks within the property itself. They were having quite a bit of construction and some of the restaurants that you would normally eat at were closed. We did eat in a couple their specialty restaurants and those will be covered in a separate Yelp. Overall would I stay here again? If it's up to me and I'm booking the room, the answer would be no. I much prefer Caesar's Palace or Mandalay Bay.

I was surprised to see the rooms at MGM. I stayed in a room with 2 queen beds. I really thought the interior design of the room was going to be outdated with photos of old celebrities. But they have completely remodeled it. It's more contemporary. They even changed their carpet. The mirror in the bathroom is spectacular. One thing that they can improve on is the water pressure for the shower. It's really low.

Probably one of my worst experiences, We got to the hotel checked in in about 10 min. we walk up to our 'Suit' that we had reserved with a king size bed, instead we get to queen size beds no Jacuzzi in the suite, worst of all I open the door and their were pillows on the floor blankets every were cups with alcohol the bathroom had towels everything with wet floors, by the way I arrived at 8 p.m. giving them 5 hours to make sure our room was clean by the time we got their. I called front desk and told the girl what was happening , I had a compromise at 9:00 and it was 8 I still had to get ready I told the girl and she responded with " cant you just get ready like that , and well take care of the cleaning when you leave " like are you kidding me I don't know who was in their before I was! that's just disgusting ! I hung up and called again and somebody else answered , they sent the house keeping   people in and cleaned. if that wasn't already bad enough we checked out the next morning Sunday , at about 10 a.m about an hour afte0r, we got our invoice ! We were being charged about $64 dollars, for who knows what I then saw it said 1 beverage, 2 service foods, 1 service retail. I called and explained to the guy , what had happened and he gave me this super rude attitude telling me it wasn't their fault , like okay well it wasn't mine. He kept arguing with me that he couldn't take the charges away because the things weren't in the room, I then told him again that when we got to or room nothing was in their, and they finally decided to take the charges off. Never Staying Here Again.

Check-In:  What a wonderful hour that was.  We stood there in line while each person checking in took at least 20-25 minutes each.  I felt bad for the front desk staff, because I know that guests can have their individual issues, but that wasn't the case here.  Whenever a guest had a question the front desk person would seem to call a supervisor over, and the supervisors looked pissed off and uninterested in engaging the guests.  People would ask questions of the staff and were just shuffled off to another line.  When we finally checked in, we were told that our room would not be ready in at least an hour.  The reason for the 2 stars and not 1, is that the front desk worker gave my wife and I each a $15 voucher for free drinks at one of the bars in the hotel.  We checked our bags in and were told to call back in an hour.   When we called back they told us that our room still wasn't ready and to call back in 30 minutes and when we did they told us that it still wasn't ready and they gave us a different room.  We were told to go up to the room and a security person would let us in.  We were finally let in and told to call the bellhop to get our room keys and bags brought up.  Finally the bellhop came with the keys...no bags...another wait. 

The Room:  The new room we were given was right across from the ice machine.  Paper-thin doors and walls.  Decent view and comfortable bed, which contributes to 2 stars rather than 1.  Why they had a glass door on the door to the toilet I will never know...not sexy.  The room looked like it was furnished by IKEA.

The Casino:  Shiny, but that is about it.  Decent machines.  They have lions in an enclosure, and I kinda just feel bad for them being so close to all of the obnoxious tourists taking constant photos of them.   Okay restaurants, buffet was cheaper than most but nothing special.  The staff speaks English...some of them do.  Don't get me wrong, it's just that when you need directions....English helps alot.

Overall:  We have stayed at several different hotels on the strip and this was the worst experience of those.  Next time we will go to any other hotel on the strip.
Amazing! There for a business Trip with Arbonne International! Treated like royalty! Love it.

It's a shame that we had a lovely stay here and I have to give only two stars. I paid in advance with a Groupon Getaway which seemed like a great deal at the time. With tax, etc. I paid around $72 for what was a very nice room. Upon checking in I was told that I would be additionally charged a $25 resort fee (no problem) and that a $100 deposit would be put on my card and returned on checkout. Instead, two days after I checked out I got hit with a $150 charge. I called their "Billing Inquiries" number about six times. Every time, I painstakingly entered all of my information into an automated system and was then immediately disconnected every single time. A call to their customer service line was not helpful.
Besides, they don't even have the lions anymore.

Got a comp (one night) from playing myvegas slots and then paid for the second night. If you're military you get free parking on all MGM resort\/ casinos do that's awesome! Place is huge so self park is a distance from the hotel. So be prepared for a lot of waking, but I get it. It's Vegas, everything is big. Double bed in the west wing kinda oldish and dark but it was good for me and my family. Friendly house keepers and very helpful (asked to borrow vacuum to vacuum come clothes to compress them together. We really enjoyed the lazy river at the pool, very relaxing (even for a one year old) I think we went around like 5x. Wouldn't mind coming back if we're back in Vegas

I haven't stayed in the rooms, but have spent enough time in other parts of the hotel to have an opinion. It's massive size makes it difficult  -- or at least time consuming -- to navigate. Everything is so spread out due to it's large footprint. The self parking garage is large and a long walk to the hotel. If you're dining there you'll want to give yourself a good 10-15 minutes to walk from the garage to the district. The district is a long hallway with many of their restaurants like Shibuya, Fiamma, Craftsteak, Pub 1842, Emeril's and their food court. Farther down the hallway is the entrance to the MGM Grand Garden arena, the monorail stop, entrance to their pools, and the walkway to the Signature hotels.

The pool area is great whether you're there to party or just hangout with family. I think the addition of Wet Republic has helped keep partygoers in one section while leaving a more laid back crowd to the other pools. They've got about 4 or 5 separate pools, hot tubs, and a mile long lazy river with a small shallow splash pool for the really small kids. The lazy river section opens at 10, expect many people to wait by the gates to get the best seats. There are plenty of great seats available so you don't have to be first. Inner tubes are available for rental for $16 each. Food and drink service is available so you don't have to leave your lounge chair until you have to pee or hit the water.

It may not be the newest or swankiest hotel and casino in town, but has plenty to offer everyone, whether or not you're there with family or to party.

This is the WORST EXEPERIENCE of my travels. I am the CMO of a Global Company. They locked me out of my room, argued with me that it wasn't my room, security took over one hour to let me in. Karen and Hope both need to be fired, rudest losers on the planet. The manager James wanted to "correct" me. They SUCK......The only descent guy was the security. This is a flea bag hotel with an uneducated staff that really should be working at a fast food joint !
We were there for a conference, pretty much spend the entire time inside their conference center, cannot really tell much, but the walk from parking garage to conference center....it's way too far.

This is the worst hotel I've stayed at in Las Vegas in over ten years of visited here, and this includes the one time I had to stay at the Tropicana.  Our room was tiny and the one chair and bed were both very uncomfortable.  Our shower, which appeared to be the one nice thing, leaked terribly and soaked the entire floor in the open bathroom area.  We addressed this three times, all three times they said they would take care of it as well as give extra towels because all of ours were soaked from trying to dry up the floor, and not once was anything done.  The only time someone seemed to actually care was at the check-out so it was a bit late.  I liked gambling at the tables here and like Craftsteak and Joel Roubuchon and have enjoyed several fights here, but I will never step foot in this dump again.

The husband and I stayed here for my birthday weekend getaway. We stayed here because of an expedia package we signed up for and this hotel had one of the cheaper rates. This hotel is wide; it felt like a 5 minute walk to go to our west wing room. The room we got was just ok. Kinda bummed that there wasn't much that they had in the room, but I guess that was ok. One gripe was that we didn't like our bathroom; the shower always leaked out to the toilet area, which made puddles on the floor. We had to call housekeeping to get our floors cleaned and replenish our towels cuz we used up the rest of the towels to clean up the mess. Also, they didn't have the best wifi. It would cut on and off, which frustrated us because we were needing it for traveling purposes. 

Over all, our stay was good. If you don't mind being a little far from the busyness on the strip, try this place out. Since a lot of the stuff happens closer to middle part of the strip, we'll check out a different hotel next time we're in Vegas.

Not a bad place to stay...  Prices are reasonable... even on line.  If you can plan on the good buy nights, that's probably your best bet.  Has plenty of room to be able to move around without climbing over stuff... They also have nice celebrity portraits in each of the rooms.  If you like the Lion Habitat, and eating at Rainforest Cafe, then you're good to go.  This hotel also has some pretty good eateries if you're a foodie.

Awful experience and no response from the property or the corporate office after 3 weeks.


I hate  to bother you, but I have sent the below letter to the resort and unfortunately, I never heard back.

I was wondering if you could forward this to someone within your company that would be concerned about the below experience.


Dear Guest Services:

I enjoy coming to Las Vegas for concerts, fun, gambling, etc.

Obviously, there are lots of choices to stay, dine and gamble.

On Friday night, we planned on attending the Green Day concert for which we purchased tickets months ago.

Due to the proximity of restaurants and gambling to the concert venue, we chose gamble and dine at your hotel.

We chose the Tap House for our dinner.

The dinner was great, but I must say, the service was mediocre at best.

Luckily, we built a lot time to dine before the show, as our server disappeared and we waited 20 minutes to get our check. You know, we could have bought a few more drinks also.

But that is not the reason for the letter.

Since we did have extra time, we decided to play some slots. I will admit we are not big spenders, but we like to play anyway. 

We were playing outside what seemed to be a waitress\/bar service area, as there were waitresses going in and out.

While playing, we were waiting for a waitress to come take our drink order.  However, it was impossible for them to see us as they were not actively and purposely not looking around. Hence it was impossible to see us.

We waited 20 minutes and I finally asked 3 different waitresses to take our order.  We received rude treatment and comments from," hold on", "you already have a server in your area", and "I don't believe your server is not waiting on you".

Now, there is a difference between poor service and being called a liar.

I really do not appreciate being called a liar, but did not have a chance to talk to someone in charge since we waited so long, and ended up being late for the show. And to be honest, we felt management really wouldn't have cared

I realize that paying penny slots is not where you make your money, and because of this I treat waitresses accordingly. I normally tip big out of the gate, so they know that although I am not a high roller, I still appreciate good service.

We would not mind giving the MGM and M life chain of hotels another chance. In fact, we headed down to Mandalay Bay after the show and we treated nicely.

But as this point, we feel like we really are not wanted and are in a quandary of where we should plan are next trip.

Please let us know if you have any questions.
stayed here because i got it for a good rate.  the room was clean and comfortable.  casino wasn't too bad.  found the pool area to be very relaxing.  stay away from buffet.

With how much we paid we were expecting an awesome visit with great customer service. However when we went, they were under construction. At 9AM construction begins with continuous banging and yes you can hear it in your room depending on where it is. Called the front desk and all the lady could tell us was "Yea that's the construction." and all we could think was "...helpful... NOT!" For how much we paid we expected better then that. Finally had to go complain at the front desk and we got moved to a different floor. The ice machine breaks and we call the desk one more time..." Well there's another machine on the floor below you." Again, not helpful! No fridge unless you pay extra cash and no coffee machines. To me it seemed like they already had as many customers as they ever wanted cause I certainly won't be going back and didn't get the feeling that they wanted us back.

I never thought I would be doing a review on a hotel, but here we go.  I went to Las Vegas for the UFC fight in May 2008.  The fight was great, the hotel stay was great and service was ok.  If I wrote a review on the MGM Grand within three days after I came back from my trip, I would've given them 4 or 5 stars . . . until they overcharged my credit card account.  Then all hell broke loose!

I noticed that my credit card was charged double the amount that I was supposed to pay.  The problem was that I took the option up to pay for everything upfront rather than letting them charge me on check out.  Apparently, the check out counter guy charged me again for some reason even though I told him that I paid for the hotel rooms already.  

Now the problems arose.  I had to speak with about 15 different people in their customer service to get the money credited back to my account.  It took almost 3-4 weeks for them to figure out what happened!  I think a bunch of monkeys could've figured out what happened in less time.  

My last word of advice to you is that if you stay at the MGM Grand, just pray that there are no issues that come up with the billing.  If that is the case, be prepared to call in many times and repeat yourself over and over again until you get your money back.  Check your account once you get back periodically to make sure you are not being overcharged.

Blackjack only pays 6:5 now on tables with a minimum bet of less than $50.
This means everyone loses at the MGM Grand.
Because they get a younger crowd, they are taking advantage of the fact that these younger folks are not as familiar with the game.
In effect they are treating their own customers with contempt.
Shame on them.
Is business so poor there that they need to squeeze every last dollar from their least affluent customers?
Shame on them.

Nope. Would never stay here again if\/ when we come back to Vegas. Reasons?

1- We were there for our honeymoon. My husband tells me after we've already been there for awhile that he actually requested for staff to have champagne and chocolate waiting for us in our room upon arrival- there was nothing!

2. IT WAS OUR HONEYMOON! and all we got was a basic room.

3. Even the cheapest of hotels provide basic things like a coffee maker\/robe\/ usable mini fridge for the room- not the MGM grand. Don't expect any of this if you stay here.

4. The ice machines on our level were consistently out, so we had to travel to other floor levels for ice. And needing ice in the first place is all because the mini fridge provided for the room is stocked full of their expensive snacks with sensors that charge you if anything even gets moved out of place. So, the little ice bucket provided is what we had to use to keep our drinks cold.

5. sheets that weren't fully cleaned. Our bedroom sheets definitely had some stains that we did not create!

For future reference, I've been told that when you check into a hotel and state that you need a mini fridge specifically for medications, they have to provide one to you, no questions asked; so this can solve one of the problems, but not much else!

I stayed at the MGM Grand during my first ever trip to Vegas, for a bachelorette party.  The MGM Grand is a wonderful hotel experience.  It is located right in the heart of the action and it has pretty much anything you could ever need right there on site.  The main reason that I did not stay here on my other Vegas trips is due to the price (I'm cheap), but you definitely get the full Vegas experience at the MGM Grand!

The MGM Grand was once the Wizard of Oz of all Vegas but it has declined over the years.  This is a very large property that stands out with all the Emerald Green and Neon.  This hotel is still where all the great boxing\/mma\/ sports event take place.  People have over exaggerated the decline of this Grand Hotel.  

The rooms were redesigned over 5 years ago but when you upgrade from your average room to the "king" or better, you will appreciate the room and layout.  

This is one of the few higher end Hotel that are Kid Friendly with a Rainforest Cafe, Emeral's, and the Stage Deli which I really like.  They have tried to change their image from a family destination to a young hip crowd but there are still areas where kids are welcomed.  The adult entertainment is much improved here with Club 54 and high end restaurants so there's a bit for everyone.

The MGM is a nice hotel worthy of 4 stars in every sense.  When staying here it is hard to leave the hotel because everything you need is contained within the Emerald City.  Entertainment is always top notch and the sporting events attract stars from everywhere.  This hotel is always very busy and the casino is fine.  The enormous size can be overwhelming as you can easily get lost especially in the casino.

Had high hopes. Too bad. Had a jr. Suite with two kids for spring break. Got in late and opened the hide-a-bed to find chunks of food and broken sunglasses in the seats and under the bed, but best of all, a dirty sock on the top of the sheets of the pull out. Called front desk early and they sent a cleaning crew who changed the sheets, but left everything else. Called again. Nothing. Called the next day (DAY 3), nothing. Went to front desk on day 4 and asked and yes notes were in system. They eventually waived the resort fees. And that took an arm twist. It took 4 days and finally stumbling onto the maid in our room to get a vacuum. They still missed half the food under the bed. On day 4 someone broke a glass in the hallway. Three times, to three separate people (front desk, maid, engineer) including the front desk, we wanted the glass cleaned up. Nope. As we checked out, it's still there.  Smart move. 
Pool was cool, food was good. Won't stay at these properties again. Gone down hill.  Did I mention the mildew on the shower?  The m&m under the desk the entire stay?  Two days of overflowing garbage In the elevator lobby?  Yea. Nasty.

I stopped by the Beauty Shop inside the MGM Grand during my stay. At first I didn't have anything in mind to purchase, more or less just browsing. I was greeted by a lovely lady(whom I forgot the name, whoops) that introduced the Forever Flawless line to me. Facial care with diamonds in it?? Sounded too good to be true. She then sampled a couple creams onto my face.. the results were amazing! At this point, I wanted to try everything! Although they probably would've let me, i didn't want to be that annoying person. She was very patient and kind with me while I explained to her my problem areas and concerns. I ended up purchasing their basic products along with the "Black line". My skin has never looked so good! (being that i am 48) I have recommended a couple of my friends to stop in that will be at the MGM this weekend. I will definitely be revisiting on my next stay at the MGM. What an extravagant experience!

I LOVED this hotel. A was a bit darker than most of the hotels on the strip as far as decor but still eye candy and lots to do. I had no idea how much walking I would have to do just to get around. Bring walking shoes for Vegas, the hotels seem endless!! Our room was great and very roomy. The beds are ultra comfy and my hubby and I wanted to take the bed home with us. I slept the best I have in months due to the bed. The lions were a nice touch to go see on a daily basis too. I was there for a week but just started figuring out my way around. Next time I'll know. There is so much to do just in the hotel you wouldn't have to leave for a few days. We're not gamblers so we didn't spend time in the casino, it was smokey anyways. We were there for a work conference for my hubby. The staff was very accommodating and friendly as well as helpful. Treat yourself to Cirque du Soleil's KA that's right in the hotel, it was worth every penny!! We did get discount tickets through the hotel, they had a summer deal going on so we got them for $55\/ea. I think we picked the best show. It was nice just getting back on the elevator and going back up to our room when it was done. We're not huge buffet fans so we didn't try that but we did go to Starbucks daily (there are 5 of them in there!) Studio Cafe has great food as well, had 2 meals there. I would stay here again but may try other hotels in the future. 

Get yourself a bus pass for only $7\/24hrs right outside the hotel near the M & M store. The bus only takes exact bills and prints our your ticket. Ride up and down the strip as many times as you want. You will also find a discount ticket place right near the M & M store as well so don't pay full price for any Vegas shows.

We loved Las Vegas! Rent a car for the day and make the drive to the Hoover Dam (45 min) or Red Rocks about the same. It's so worth it. Don't pay for a bus tour, it's super easy to get around especially with a GPS. If we had more time we would have driven to the Grand Canyon. Bye for now Las Vegas and MGM, we hope to come back!!

The MGM is a great choice when visiting Vegas.

Room was great, I was on the 11th floor of the Grand Tower, room was spacious with all new furniture and other amenities. I'll admit the view wasn't much to look at but I had a grand time playing with the automatic blinds.  The king sized bed was huge and ridiculously comfortable, it felt like I suck right in.  Bathroom is also very modern and unlike most hotels, the shower heads are high letting water fall down on you instead of hitting you in the neck like some places.

Casino is good, they allow smoking but most places do in Vegas so you just have to roll with the punches. I will say my one complaint with the casino floor is it would be nice if they had more than 4 or 5 crap tables. As somebody who likes to throw the bones, I would like a few more options.

I love the sports book, I spent an entire NFL Sunday kicking back and enjoying all the games displayed over the many monitors.

Food options are plentiful and for the most part of good quality.

Staff is good, took forever to get checked in because of an issue with the website I booked through but staff was patient through the process and gave me a decent food credit for the hassle.

Great hotel, right at the tail end of the strip but easily in walking distance to all the main attractions, will definitely make the MGM part of my next Vegas trip.

I love the MGM Grand Hotel!

Here are the reasons why:

1.  The standard rooms are large enough for me and my friends to pre-party in.  
     a.  The bathroom had just one basin instead of two--my preference as this arrangement provides more counter space.  
     b.  The blinds completely block out any sunlight which allows me to sleep-in undisturbed.  
     c.  While most other large casinos on the strip have long hallways and you may get stuck with a room at the far end of a long hallway.  MGM's layout has about 6 hallways that radiate outwards from the elevators.  With more hallways, the hallways are shorter and the walks are shorter.

2.  The casino is busy with gamblers earlier in the morning than others on the strip.  While at Caesar's, Cosmo, etc, the crap tables are usually dead at 11am.  It is common to find a couple crap tables full with players during the mid-mornings.

3.  Even at night, the crap table minimum bets are low.  Most of the MGM crap tables had a minimum bet of $10; by contrast, other strip casinos would have only one $10 (it is common to have $15 minimum on the strip and no $10 tables) crap table going...

4.  They have a decent pool party--Wet Republic.  WR is overrated but is still a good pool party.

5.  There are lots of dining options at MGM.  While they are tons of better options in Vegas.  Within the hotel itself, the food selection is quite diverse--there are 15 - 18 different eateries to choose from.

6.  The casino is near the airport.  You can see the runway from the hotel room.  By taxi, the airport is less than 10 minutes away.  I usually get a rental, and there is a gas station at the corner of MGM so I can fill up my tank there and head to the rent-a-car center...

7.  The MGM arena is a great venue for concerts!  Large arena with possibly the best acoustic system on the Strip and a very large display screen behind the stage.

While not a perfect hotel, it has enough positive points to make me want to return and stay here....

What's grand about the MGM?

This experience occurred in March 2009:

The hotel booked my party into an occupied room. We opened up the bungalow suite to find luggage, underwear and other sundries strewn about.

I was then booked into a smoking room, although my original reservation had specified "Non smoking." According to the concierge on the room phone, I had "approved" the smoking room at the front desk. A bald face lie.

I was booked into a third room with no view: staring out at the roof HVAC. Nice. Furnishings and appointments were very modest for a hotel of this reputation and expense. Neither TV remote worked in this room. It took one hour for someone to arrive with a functioning remote.

I called concierge to get information on the health club. I was told it was $10. I went down the first level and tried to find it: no signs for health club, so we went to the pool. Two staff people, including a supervisor, had "no idea" where the health club was and didn't attempt to find anyone who did. We walked upstairs to the spa, and found it there. The nasty spa attendant snapped that the fee was $15. I told her that the concierge had said $10; she just shrugged her shoulders.

I complained to the management and was comped into the health club. I went to the MGM Grand Buffet  that evening. It was a standard buffet, and  about half of it was turned off. They have serving staff dole out portions to you like you were Oliver Twist. Cheap.

That night we heard absolutely everything in the rooms on either side of us, including coughs, chatter, yelling, door slamming and more. 

We were out of the room for the entire second day. Returning to prepare for the evening, we found the room unserviced. Called and complained to housekeeping.

The margaritas we ordered in the casino were awful. 

With the many choices the Vegas strip offers, I couldn't imagine staying at this overpriced, overrated facility a second time. If you like the casino, I suggest just staying anywhere else nearby and just walking to it. There's a Motel 6 just two blocks away where I'm sure you'll at least get clean linens.

First time staying at MGM even though bee to the MGM for parking and fat Tuesday's. But this is a first where they charge parking that's my only CON......other than that. My stay was very pleasant. First time I checked in. One was training and the other one was a trainer. She kept apologizing to me that it's taking awhile and I told her don't worry about it I understand. I was on the fourth floor which I didn't mind and it was convenient for me to get to the lobby as well since I didn't stay in the room for a long time. Anyways overall, it was a nice stay. Friendly staff and nice queen suite room.

Awesome place to stay if you want to spend your evening listening to the in-room raves of losers in the adjoining room next door. Don't expect security to do a thing about it. I called four times in forty minutes and security never once showed. I got "upgraded" at the airport to a "Grand Queen Premier View", which apparently means "sharing a door with 20 people throwing a loud rave in the next room over." Screaming, shouting, thumping hip-hop beats--literally all I heard. I have stayed in hotels from here to Pattaya Beach, Thailand and I have NEVER had this issue. The only reason I did not stay at the New York New York as I normally do was because they are under construction and I was afraid I would have to deal with excessive noise. HA! I will never stay at the MGM Grand again. Lobby looks lovely, rooms look fantastic...customer service and soundproofing, however, are a ZERO.

Update: Security finally showed up. They made at least six prostitutes leave the room. This thankfully put an end to the matter, but it is worth noting that the pencil-junk throwing the 'party' was warned at least three times about the noise and that at that point they didn't even bother to throw him out. I don't even need to bother adding that there was an odd smell coming from his room that I could detect through our shared door. It's disheartening that the MGM Grand gives these people a slap on the wrist instead of evicting them from the premises, and the rest of us have to deal with it.

I stayed at the MGM my first time in Vegas many years ago and it has been a regular stop every time I head back.  It has good gaming, decent restaurants, and the lions.  I finally broke down and took a photo with a cub, which was worth every penny to discover their fur isn't as soft and cuddly as it looks!  The spa is another draw, it has everything you could want with reasonable prices.

Worst check-in experience ever! The lady was obviously being trained but neither one could clearly explain to me the charges they were about to incur on my CC. So I tried to ask scenarios and they still acted as ignorant as possible. The fact that I could barely hear her because it seemed as if she were whispering didn't help at all. So as I'm getting more frustrated I'm trying to ask the same question I different ways. The, I guess, trainer, says; "we're going to get a manager cause you're clearly upset. Clearly she just can't answer a simple question! Then the manager comes up and says I said a word that they'll be putting in notes on my file. Wtf? What did I say? So then they make up a word and I laughed. Anyway. You get my point. Fuck this place and all their unnecessary rudeness & extra fees. They didn't even get me in the proper room so now it's going to be even more of a fucked up adventure. Don't worry! I'll never stay here again!

I really like this place, granted it is now out dated since it was built back in 1993, but still very nice place.  The room had a nice flat screen LCD TV......but it was in what I refer to as a TV coffin.  Armoires are tacky in my opinion and especially when you jam a very nice flat screen in it.  It would have been better served mounted on the wall.  
The bathroom was smaller than I had anticipated but that was no issue really.  The sink had a crack in it, but did not effect the use of it.  I kept in mind this resort was built in 1993 and even after remodeling things are bound to have some flaws.  I personally feel that the room was worth what I paid.

First of all, the MGM Grand property is HUGE!!! There is definitely something for everyone here at this resort. I would have rated it a 5, but ran into some issues with the hotel initially, which they were more than accommodating to fix. 
I checked in for EDC week, so I knew they would be busy, but check in was very efficient, and the staff was welcoming and friendly. I had upgraded to a suite, which was well worth it for the size, and the view. The bed was comfy, and the suite was very spacious. Unfortunately, this is where the problems arose. First, the initial room was not cleaned yet when I got up there (though they told me it was), but they moved me to another room and issued me a food credit, which, of course, I happily accepted. Problem two, later on that night, when I was getting ready to go out, EEEK!!! No hot water... For three hours. That was even more disappointing, running in and out of the shower stall to not freeze to death (exaggerating). They were very slow to fix this, and not really apologetic for this issue. But it was only the first day? And second day. But I digress. The resort is kept very clean, housekeeping is friendly and efficient, and the location is right in the middle, kind of, of the strip, great hotel, although due to my experience, not my favorite.
The food options are pleanty, but not the best. The buffet is rather kind of ho-hum for breakfast, and very bland for lunch\/dinner. The Avenue Cafe was way overpriced, but the service made up for it. Luckily too, there are two Starbucks in here, one close to the pool, and one close to the lobby. If you consider yourself a foodie, or just like good food, you may want to consider other resorts, because there's just not many good offerings here.
The pool though, and Wet Republic, are very nice, expansive with the Lazy River, and very very relaxing, I would go again, if all other resorts doubled their prices for some reason, but maybe I'd stay at the Signature instead.

I went to Vegas for Thanksgiving with my family and booked a room with MGM and it was in the Grand Tower. They recently renovated their rooms so everything looks really nice and new. The housekeeping staff does a great job because the room and bathroom is immaculate. 

The bed is really comfortable except the bed frame has really sharp and protruding corners so I kept walking into it. I got several bruises from that. 

The hotel staffs at the front desk are friendly and efficient. There was a long line for check in but they had a lot of people working so the line moved up quickly.

Just checked in (staying here for next 9 days) and found a USED CONDOM by the bed plus left over from the cleaning crew. When I called the front desk, the manager sounded annoyed and didn't even try to right their wrong properly. Great job!!

For sure I wouldn't stay in this hotel again. The service is terrible. We paid $300 a night for a "spa suite" where it states we would have two bathrooms, we indeed did not get two bathrooms, just one. They didn't change the sheets on the pull out sofa bed, when we opened it was all dirty and messy with headphones and wrappers inside. We called someone up to help us with it and he said he needed to call someone else up to help him, we waited over an hour and no one ever came. If you go out to eat and have leftovers don't even bother brining them back to the room because there is no microwave & they were extremely rude on the phone when we requested one (we heated our food up with the hairdryer haha not wasting good food!) There also wasn't even a mini fridge to put any drinks or food in! The water in the lazy river was so warm it was like a bathtub & made you feel disgusting not refreshed.
The hotel room was very nicely upgraded.  Beds comfortable.  Did not like the route to the hotel room itself.  It's very confusing.

What a nice place.  Free parking was nice.  Every employee in the building had a smile.  Even when busy, they had a great attitude.  This place has it together when it comes to making folks feel welcome.  
Would have given 5 stars if we had drink service.

This place looks like it has been renovated since the last time I have been here.  We got a deal for 2 nights free if we stay for 2 nights.  So 4 nights say for $210 is worth it in my book at the MGM Grand (resort fees and taxes not included yet).  Our hotel room was clean at all times and was quiet which is a plus.  Our view sucked but I honestly dont really care.  Towels and everything else was changed on a daily basis and bathroom clean.  Honestly, I had no harp about anything since we were rarely in our room other than to power nap (yes, i said nap we didnt really sleep too busy gambling and drinking).

The casino was nice, not the prettiest place but I am not one to complain its good tables and you can win money, thats good enough for me.  The foot traffic is insane in this place and I am assuming its because of Hakkasan.  No harm no foul I love people watching while i gamble.  Will come back to this casino depending on the rates they offer.

Thanks for the room upgrade! We were originally placed in the old west tower but after our group showed up, we were moved to the Grand Tower side which was supposedly newer, upgraded and nicer. Yes, it was newer and nicer on the Grand side. 

Pros: Nice employees, nice rooms (loved their double automatic window shades; no sun light comes into the room in the mornings), tons of fast food and sit down restaurants, nice pools (salt water pool too), a friendly crowd\/patrons at MGM, easy access from Las Vegas Blvd and to and from the I-15. Easy check out. Free fast wifi in your room. 

Cons: SLOW, VERY SLOW, valet parking. Even though I called down from my room, it still took 15 minutes after I checked in downstairs. 

Like any decent Vegas resort hotel, MGM is nice. Decent rates, they have special events there as well. MGM is a big property.

This hotel has it all.  Fun, class, customer service and great food!! I can't even begin to tell you how awesome the bartenders are. Never a bad time at this place, but I have to say don't go to their buffet. I don't know why but it's not the greatest.  So many good restaurants in the hotel though.  At all prices.  Go wherever you want, eat at whatever price you want all in the same hotel.  Go play video poker at the bar and get a free drink unlike other pretentious places. Best overall hotel on the strip.  

Again, This hotel has it ALL!!

Rawr...rawr...Rawr! 

About 14 of my friends stayed here for about 4 days over the summer and we had a great time. The rooms weren't over the top luxurious, but they were clean, spacious, our beds were made everyday, new towels on request, and we didn't have to pay an arm and a leg for it. The architecture of the place isn't has grand as the Bellagio, Wynn, etc, but it has a charm and style all it's own. 

The customer service here is fantastic. We had no problems getting what we needed in the room, and getting it quick! They even mail out some documents that I needed to get out pronto for me. How cool is that!?

Everyone mentions the Lion Habitat, which is great, if you've never seen a Lion before, but wasn't very magical or amazing for me...But maybe you'll get lucky and see one of the lion caretakers get attacked!!! http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=oTmVo1JLV_g Now that would be amazing!! Haha

The pool area is great; The lazy river is nice to just sit in and grab some drinks, enjoy the sun, and the company. The bad part about the pool is that is super far away from the hotel rooms. Basically, takes about 15 minutes to walk down there. So if you get too drunk at the pool you might need help getting back to your room.

This place is not cheap, but it worths every penny.  I love the pool area, it's huge, with several swimming pools and my favorite is the lazy river, it goes around and around with several small water falls.  If you are going with a group who love hanging out by the water or love swimming, this is the place for you.... It's fantastic... This is the first place that I would pick to stay in Vegas... The casino is huge... watch out  and pay attention on where you go cause it's easy to get lost in here, did I mention that everywhere in the casino look the same? :)

Casino: barely 3 stars
Restaurants\/Shows Available: 4+ stars
West Wing: 2 stars
West Wing bathroom stalls: 0 stars (see below)

MGM Grand is a decent casino, with lots of great restaurants, but there are definitely more Ed Hardy wearing types on this end of the Strip.

Don't let them talk you into a room in the West Wing, even if it has a king bed.  While quiet and great for sleeping, it's hard to know what time it is and we felt like we were on the Battlestar Galactica.  The hallways reminded us of the corridors they used to show on the X-Files...dark government hallways, dimly lit, with little spotlights all over the carpet.  It wasn't until we were about to check out that we noticed that the laundry bag\/notes\/envelopes\/pen all had a secret government theme.  Top Secret, Confidential, Confessions, Lies, etc...were printed on them all.  We had a little laugh at that - coming all the way from DC just to stay in a secretive government themed hotel.

I didn't mind it in the end - we got used to it - plus, the standup shower was huge and pretty great (despite the adjuster on the pole for the secondary hand-held showerhead was missing a washer\/gasket and held together with part of a bar of soap).  But with some ingenuity and a hand towel, we were able to position it so it was like having 2 showerheads.

The one thing that we never got used to, though, was the bathroom stall.  It was adjacent to the shower, made out of smoked glass, had no fan, and any little sound in there was majorfly amplified.  You could even hear little movements in there despite a loud TV.  And it was creepy to go to the sink\/mirrors while someone was in the bathroom because you could kinda see them sitting on the pot.  So for a secretive government theme, the bathroom was a serious privacy FAIL.

I'll come back to MGM Grand for the restaurants, and maybe even for a little blackjack, but I won't be staying there again.

This was our 2nd trip to Vegas and the last time we stayed at the Monte Carlo and Mandalay Bay. Since we were going the weekend of the iHeartRadio festival, the hotel prices on the Strip were very high. I found the best deal on the mlife.com at the MGMGrand. I got a Petit King room for 104 a night! When we got there, I skipped the long check in line cause I was an mLife member, and the concierge upgraded our room to the Grand Tower, to the 26th Floor with a Strip View and upgraded it to a Grand King Suite when I told her it was my birthday!

The MGMGrand is where all the action is. It's located pretty much in the center of the Strip and many events that people come to Vegas for happen here. The hotel is beautiful, the pools are nice and the cocktail waitresses are plentiful and generous in the Casino.

There are a few Happy Hours in the restaurants were you can get moderately priced food and do some interesting people watching. The Fish House this time was not that great.

In addition, we did hit the mlife casinos in Monte Carlo, Bellagio and Aria as well and we had a splendid time getting buzzed while we played!

Can't wait till next year!

Worst service at any hotel bar none. Rude, do nothing and incompetent staff. The good news is they treat guests in suites just as poorly as a standard room so don't waste your money on upgrades. 

If you remove their crap from the mini bar they immediately charge you for all the items. They refused to remove alcoholic items from the room and there was a non working lock on the bar.

They will charge you a $50 restocking fee if you put any personal items in the mini bar. 

No safe in the room either.

You have been warned. There are lots of great hotels in Vegas. Avoid this one. You're welcome!

PS I don't normally leave reviews, especially bad ones so consider this a public service and my good deed for the day.
One start because your lines are awful. Redesign the check in. I stay somewhere else that's faster.

No complaints. Stayed here over 4th of July weekend and the price was still reasonable.The location was good and the room was perfectly fine, nothing great. It would've been awesome to stay at the Wynn or Bellagio of course but when you are in Vegas it doesn't really matter that much since hopefully you are only in your room when you are getting ready or napping! I would stay here again.

As we were walking towards the exit area of the MGM hotel (lobby area?), I slipped and fell practically doing the splits. A puddle of liquid was left on the floor. I'm currently recovering from a dislocated knee injury and thank goodness I had a brace on, otherwise my knee cap would've fully moved to the side again. During the fall, I did feel my knee cap move, but the brace basically prevented it from going too far. However, my fall at MGM may have prolonged my recovery process. Before my fall, another lady slipped and fell. When she went to go fill out a report, she saw me fall and was shocked that it happened to me also. My husband tried to file a report with someone at the front desk and they told him a supervisor would come and meet us. We waited to file a report and no one came for about 45 minutes. They then sent a security guy instead, not a supervisor. The security guard wanted me to go over to some other area to fill out the report, but by this time, I was tired, annoyed and concerned for my 2 tired, young kids who were waiting all that time to leave. One of the employees also had said that if we leave, it's like it never happened. Wth? Then show some effort and concern that I fell! Honestly, it felt like they were purposely just taking their time and were hoping for us to just leave so they wouldn't have to deal with us. This hotel should've at least pretended to care and apologize for the slippery mess that caused me to fall and possibly re-injure myself! Customer service is awful! I did leave my contact information with the security person, so let's see if they bother to contact me.

I've never stayed at the hotel but have frequently used the parking garage and have met visitors here a few times. If you don't get a spot relatively close to elevators be prepared for a hike.
It's also gonna take a while to get oriented within the hotel\/casino, but there is a lot of signage to help you! Restaurants\/bars are spread out and there is something for everyone, and MGM always has a number of celebrity\/Michelin starred chefs du jour. I didn't see the buffet this visit but I guess there is one? 
I vaguely recall being at Wet Republic years ago when it first opened, enticed by free beverages, but have not returned. I had a better time crashing the pool and lazy river! 
Most recently, a family member was staying here and we met up for an evening exploring the hotel (her first visit here). 
Rouge bar used to have a great open bar (years ago) called Lace Mondays that I enjoyed! That is long gone but the poker bar is a nice spot to have a speciality cocktail.
We had dinner and drinks at crush, which is another great spot with an upscale feel and very good food. A drink at the newer Whiskey Down bar turned into a semi drunken tourist experience with some of the patrons. The bar staff was amused and also sociable so no complaints! The cocktail menu here is nice too. The downside of the MGM is of course that during the busy times here it's kind of a mess with all the crowds.

Wow. I have NEVER been to a hotel quite like this one. I attended the Beachbody Coach Summit in 2014 (for work!) and stayed here since the summit was on their property. When I checked in, I felt like I was at an amusement park as the line was over an hour long!

The rooms are pretty big but the entire hotel smells like Vegas. They are people EVERYWHERE.

The pluses: GREAT pool (I should say pools) and lazy river and meal options everywhere!

This is by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed at and the manager named Andres Trejos was extremely unprofessional and inhospitable. I'm in the hospitality industry and I would not tolerate behavior like his with any of my staff. It took me 2 hours from the time I arrived until I got into my room. The first room smelled of smoke and the entire west wing is old and not maintained. I told Andres of my sensitivity to smoke and he offered to have room service spray the room to get rid of the smell.WHAT? He looked at me like I was being irrational for wanting a clean room. He also accused me of not letting him speak when I wouldn't accept his spray the room option. He said " if you would let me talk maybe I can do something" So dude. Fast forward to the next day, my rooms tube drains extremely slow, the shower knob fell off. I went to Starbucks and came back to my room keys not working due to the receptionist saying " it shows you're already checked out" this was at 9:30am. I had to wait for security to let me in, go to the lobby and wait in line for a key. All the while I missed my breakfast reservations across the street.   The worst part is that no one ever apologized for my poor experience. I'm so disappointed and will never be coming back. We always stay at Trump but the wife wanted to try the iconic MGM. More like the dump MGM.

In preparation for a Vegas list I am putting together for future reference, I am back tracking on this review from a few years ago when I saw U2 and spent a few days in Vegas. Never stayed at the hotel, however, love browsing and spending time here 'cause it's a gorgeous hotel just to browse and walk around in detail in general.

I stay here for conferences and have stayed in a few of the wings.  The West Wing rooms are more recently remodeled and much nicer\/cleaner than standard rooms in the other wings.  I've mostly had standard king and 2 queen rooms which still come with a sofa and work area.  Bathrooms are large with well lit vanity area and a deep bathtub.  The only thing I don't like about these rooms is that there is no deadbolt or security latch of any type on the door.  There is no way to prevent someone with a room key from entering while you are in the room.  Seems like a security risk to me.  

Service at the front desk has always been very friendly and quick when I've stayed here.  Even when there were a lot of people in front of me at check in, I've never waited more than a few minutes.  Similarly, any time I've made a request of staff \/ housekeeping, it's been taken care of quickly. 

The hotel \/ casino \/ resort itself is massive and a bit too spread out for my taste.  Fortunately there are a lot of restaurants near the room elevators, so you do not have to cross a smoky casino in order to get to dinner.   Unfortunately it's a bit of a hike away from other casinos -- the shortest way to get back on to the strip is to cut through the casino.

oh god, terrible hotel, what this hotel would be if it were not for its gambeling attractions, and some shows, i think that is all that is keeping this thing up, not much to say other then many good events are usually at the mgm i dont know why i guess they have the best scenary?!


TFR

Worst hotel experience on my 5th stay in Las Vegas.  Conference booked my room for the week so I had to accept.  Their new mobile check in had me waiting in the lobby for nearly 2 hours to process.  The room was very clean.  The shower spray is ultra low flow and just terrible.   The Toto toilet was a nice touch though.  During my second night while taking a nap on the bed in my room with headphones on listening to music some from house keeping unlock the door and came in.  Scared the hell out me!  Manager said they were new and went to the wrong room.  I checked out the next morning having my privacy violated.

If you want to be at the site of the show\/fight, then it's not the worst place to stay.  If that doesn't matter, then there are better rooms than what you can get here without paying much more.  Be sure to tell the front desk not to have housekeeping disturb you or they'll give you an early morning wake-up bang on the door and yell "HOUSEKEEPING!" just after you've managed to fall asleep from a long night of fun.    They even tried to barge into the room in the middle of the day, though I was thankfully decent.  The "Do not disturb" sign might as well have been invisible.

Hands down they have the best beds and down comforters.  I swear, just sleeping on their bed cured what could have been a hangover for me.  However, my biggest pet peeve about this place is their parking.  If you park in the garage, you have to hop on several escalators to get to the first floor, walk through a set of shops, go up another escalator and walk all the way across their huge lobby just to get to the hotel room elevators.  Annoying!  Despite their parking issues, it's a good hotel.

The last 2 times that I've overnighted in Vegas, I've stayed at the MGM. My most recent visit was for 3 nights over the 4th of July weekend; 03July-06July.  

This hotel is always "poppin", and 4th of July weekend was insane.  If you're as big a fan as I am of people watching, then you're in luck. 

I didn't have to bother with the check-in process, someone else in my group handled that, so I cannot speak on that aspect.  We'd driven in from the Phoenix area, arrived around 5pm, I dropped them off at the front door to check in, and by the time I'd parked they were calling me from our room, so that was pretty fast IMO. 


Hotel...

lobby: 
Huge, bright lobby with large TVs over the check-in desks.  The TVs are usually playing music videos (to my delight, as I prance-dance through the lobby).  The large boxing ring, which houses a large gold lion statute, is a popular attraction for photo ops.  If you want a photo of the Lion in Ring sans a million strangers in your backdrop, I suggest getting down to the lobby before 8am...while everyone else is still hungover and asleep. 

Note: It was freezing in the hotel hallways!


Workout facility:
on the 4th floor, if I recall correctly.  You'll need your room key to enter.  Nice, clean, simple little workout room.  Lots of treadmills (I didn't count them; maybe a dozen?), stair-stepper, and other equipment. It was well stocked with lots of clean towels, and it had 2 filtered water coolers.  


Rooms:
Follow the yellow brick road (overhead signs) to the guest rooms.  From the lobby, take a quick right, walk through a short hall (cupcakery to the left, convenience store to the right), until you reach the rotunda with the large fountain in the middle.  From here there are different pathways, above which you'll see where they lead.  Proceed accordingly.  (FYI If you are told to go to a room, for example, 401, do not assume it's on the 4th floor. Verify which floor, b\/c there is a (for example) 401 on all the floors.)

We had a room on the 10th floor with 2 queen beds. The room was spacious, but not as large as the room we had here last year. Same comfy beds though!
I'm not sure why the bathroom being at the door is such a focal point for some.  With as many people as I've seen stumbling through the lobby, barely making it to the elevator, I'd think the bathroom being at your instant disposal would be a good thing.

The bathrooms are large and clean.  I like that there is a wall separating the commode from the sink area.

The maid service was great.  She kept us stocked on extra towels.
Tip: Tip the maids a little every day ($2 per day if it's just you or +1; $1 per person if there's a group of you), especially if you're staying multiple days.  You'll be rewarded!  

The city lights can be bright at night, but they have blackout curtains in the rooms, so just close the curtains and nighty-night.  There is nothing that you can do about the noise in the halls though.  Dude; it's Vegas.

I don't watch TV when I'm in Vegas, so I don't know what the TV service is like. 
However, there was an outlet center on TV stand, which included 2 USB ports; great for charging our iPhones. 

I wish they would switch from glass drinking glasses to individually wrapped, disposable plastic cups.  Those glasses are unsanitary. 

If you call guest services to request they bring you anything, call WAY before you need it. It took them almost 2 hours to bring us extra blankets one night. 


Casino:
I do not drink or gamble.  However, it was very smokey while walking through.  I wish they'd incorporate a no-smoking policy. But I know they're afraid to lose money.


Food courtyard:
McDonald's and the pizza place (forgot the name) were open at 2:30am one night, and it was packed!

Other options during the day were Asian (think Panda Express, but the name was different), Mexican (burritos, tacos, etc), Southern USA (fried chicken, mac n cheese, etc).  Aside from steamed veggies at the Asian option, nothing else was vegan-friendly.

Pool:
You'll need your MGM room key to enter, otherwise YOU SHALL NOT  PASS.
Clean towels available, so no need to bring your own.
Arrive early for a lounge chair (and some peace and quiet). Small humans (children) take over by midday. 
Pool closes at 8pm, so no late night dips for you.
There are different areas, and they're all huge.  You have to pay extra to chill in the lazy pool. :(
I think there were at least 2 restaurants inside the pool area. I didn't visit them, so I have no comment.
You can NOT bring your own water bottle into the pool area, so when (not if; when) you get thirsty, be prepared to spend $6 on a baby bottle of water. 


Entertainment:
I went to see Cirque du Soleil's KA performance, which was outstanding!  Fun, truly entertaining, eye-catching performance.  Absolutely loved it!  The auditorium is lovely as well, and it wasn't too cold inside. There's a concession stand, but I didn't visit it.


We got to view\/rate a TV pilot, which was cool.

This review is split between the check-in procedure, room, housekeeping, general atmosphere of public grounds, and concierge.

Check-in - 3 stars. Not enough people working at the desk, lines too long, but when you got an agent, efficient enough.

Room - 5 stars - marble bathrooms, cute pictures of movie stars and the mgm lion in the room, very comfy bed and we happened to have a view of the New York New York hotel!

Concierge- 2 stars - one of the greater weaknesses. Some agents were very informative about Las Vegas, but mostly they just wanted to hook you up with super expensive shows, grand canyon tours, and restaurant reservations. That is, if you merely wanted to ask, say, how to get somewhere, they would print out some written directions but carried no brochures on them. The lines were about 45 minutes long too - since often the concierge agents were in charge of making aforementioned reservations.

Housekeeping staff - 5 stars - hardworking - we didn't have bodywash when we first got in and 10 minutes afterwards got some extra body supplies.

General atmosphere - 4 stars - It is a casino, after all, but it's quite a posh interior and a very large complex of (expensive) restaurant options, card tables, and slot machines. Don't forget to check out the indoors lion in the clear cage. The MGM is located very near the airport but farther away from the main part of the Strip.

NOT PLEASED mgm is not all that cracked up what people think. I booked a celebrity spa suite 2 months in advance for 5 days for my wife and I 10 yr anniversary. My plane got cancelled at one of our connection flights from sanfransico to vegas on the day of our arrival.Check in is at 3pm. I called Mgm to informed them that my flight was cancelled and were due in on the next flight but would not be arriving to after 8 pm. Was told ok not a problem my room will be ready. That day i have two cancelled flights and had to sit in an airport for 8 hr. Total travel time 18 hrs, finally arriving at mgm just wanting to get to my room and sleep. NOT GOING TO HAPPEN. was inform that i didnt have a room and the rep inform me sometimes they overbook when purchased through 3rd party(ie orbit or kayak etc). I informed her that 2 months ago I called MGM directly booked the suite and PAID IN FULL. she didnt have a response for me. our luggage got lost and was inform  that it be delivered to the hotel, great so no room and no luggage. mgm said that they will call me when my luggage arrived for me to pick up or send up. got no call although my luggage arrived at 1 30 am. I called at 6 30 am and they said oh yeah its here we can send it up REALLY.

back to the room. they got us a upgrade for the night in one of the premier suite , which was told they wont charge me the 28 $ resort fee, ( your right you wont because i already paid the resort fee for the other room which i paid in full already) fine very nice but very dark room i was told that to come down at 10 to be switch to my orginally room. guess no sleeping in for us. that morning i called at 9:00 am . I didnt feel like lugging all my bags out and downstairs just to have to wait , I ask was my room available yet. Lady on the phone told me I was checking out that day and she dont see any other reservations for me. After being on hold for 15 minutes she came back and told me my room is stiill not available , but they had a celebrity suite available if i want that one ( BLANK STARE) im wondering whats the different she says nothing so i agree to take the room. She said i have to come now, i told her i already been inconvience more than once , i need time to get dress and get myself together afterall why should i rush now, her response , " i guess i will hold the room" my response i guess you will.

in the celebrity suite i felt as if i was downgrounded to some rink dink hotel , the furniture was old and chip i did have a nice view better then the parking lot view in the  premier, had to ask for robes to be sent up and felt like i was treated as a crimnal she stated people steal them umm ok nothing to do with me my wife and I took a nice hot bath and long behold when we go to drain my fingers get tangled in a clump of blonde and sandy brown hair, ( were AAmericans with jet black hair , dont believe that was ours, disgusted). 

Overall our first time here could have spent that money somewhere else for better customer service and care. Take your money and go somewhere else.

I stayed there April 3-6, 2016. I knew about 200.00 deposit reading a review. But I didn't know about the 34.00 resort fee. Being I booked with trivago it was an extra 100.00 total resort fee 134.00. If I booked through hotel just 34.00. I got to my non smoking room immediately I smelled smoke with another smell fragrance trying to cover up smell the room had dirty walls carpet. I called front desk, they sent me walking walking to another room that was smoke free dirty walls carpet smelly towels behind the headboard. I called again said I want a clean nice room .They said ok but if will cost you extra 15.00 per night I already paid 400.00 for 4 nights more walking got the nice room. Overall the hotel restaurants are overpriced shops too. Food court is where to eat if your on budget, stay away from fiamma Italian restaurant they are overpriced, charged my credit card twice!! Still waiting for refund server was Dallas very rude to me! Swimming pool they have 3 they are knee deep only because they told me they don't want the drunks to drown because you can drink in pool. Shop at Walgreen's on Vegas strip for food soda have them send up a Mini fridge

I had not been to the MGM since they had the amusement park. 
I have to say I never want to go there again. What a circus. I went to a concert at the MGM Grand Areana, but you have to go thru the entire place to get there. 
I know casinos are loud and crowded, but this seemed way over the top crowded and noisy. Kids all over the place. When did this become ok? People walking thru the casino in their swimwear with no coverups and no shoes. All I kept thinking was if these fools step on glass and get hurt they will be the first to sue. Is this the new casino attire? 
A huge manaic on a scooter going very fast almost knocking folks over. Then I see this manaic at the concert sans scooter, funny he was walking fine then. 
Where are the people in charge of this asylum? Perhaps hiding? 
I do not care what show or restaurant is there, this was the last time for me. 
I had just come from dinner at Mandaly Bay and it was the exact opposite of this, people had clothes and shoes on imagine that.
Check in here is horrendous... spent less time in economy TSA at LGA... 1.5 hours... they have mobile check in but I never received my confirm and had to wait anyway

I attended a conference at the MGM Grand and stayed there as well. I was impressed with the size and comfort of my room; housekeeping left my room spotless;  there was never any significant wait for an elevator (a problem at some mega-hotels); the ventilation was superb, I was never bothered by smoke; the support the hotel provided the conference was top notch.  There were issues with the conference itself but that had nothing to do with the hotel.  The Grand Buffet had very good food.   Check-in did involve waiting in line but that is Vegas for you.  I have three minor complaints.  One, service in the Lobby bar was slow even though it was not crowded. Two, the West Wing bar was never open even during posted hours.  Pity as it seemed like it would be a nice quiet place to have a drink.  Three, the David Copperfield show was frustrating as sight lines from my top-price seat were not that good.  I'll review that separately as well.  Oh, and the prices.  I paid almost twice as much for my Starbucks latte as I pay at home but again, that's Vegas!  Oh, and the damn "resort fee" which everyone is charging now.  It's a scam but what are you going to do?
Fast check -in ..stayed 3 nights..Had a great time ..nice restaurants..nice rooms...will be staying there again next time.

PLEASE READ!!! Management!!!! 

My friend flew in tonight from across country tonight and Nicholas greeted us at the front desk. He had been so accommodating and friendly upgrading our room to make our stay that much more special since it was my friends first time in Vegas! We had a problem finding our room and Officer Love the security guard noticed us struggling and really went ABOVE AND BEYOND to help us. Both her and Nicholas provided service like I have never experienced ever before, I truly felt so cared about and special. Officer Love really went out of her way, she was with us every step of the way while we were double booked on accident. I am truly so impressed. Nicholas also fixed the problem right away and was so understanding and kind. I really am blown away with the customer service provided at MGM on our FIRST NIGHT here! We will always remember them and these memories. Thank you Nicholas, Officer Love and Judy, too!

THIS WAS THE WORST NIGHT IN VEGAS EVER! My boyfriend and I were driving cross-country from New York City. We thought, this will be a perfect one night of fun before we land in our final destination: Los Angeles. We booked a last minute deal on the Hotels app, we found what we thought was a good deal, it was around $90.00. We parked our two door Honda Accord in the FREE PARKING LOT, and thought this is amazing. FREE PARKING! We thought we were off to a good start. We left our car close to the entrance\/high traffic area because all of our belongings were packed to the brim in the trunk and the back seat. (Months later I found out the engagement ring I didn't know about was sitting in a box, under a guitar, in that very same back seat, in that MGM parking lot...) When we entered MGM it was like grand central station. We finally made it to the check-in desk. The lady kept trying to sell us an "upgrade" with a hot tub for $27.00 extra. We thought we were being cheated out of our good deal, so we refused. We followed our very labyrinth like directions to a hall way, pass the high roller room. We should have taken the upgrade. The whole lot of "good deal" rooms were in an area that was under construction. It REEKED of five day old Chinese food. *Don't ask how I know what that smells like.* We rushed into our room to crack open the window, only what do we find in our window, the view of the New York City skyline! No window. No ventilation. Just a florescent light image of New York f-ing City. But there was a telephone in the shiter! The next day we bought over priced bagels and coffee and watched a sad domesticated lion lay on a glass floor. We also had our hearts broken, we found out that parking is free everywhere in Vegas, and we weren't special. I will say, I am giving one extra star for having a secure parking lot - our car didn't get broken into. Yay!

The MGM is decent...I used to stay at Mandalay (my favorite hotel) every time I went to Vegas and wanted to see what MGM was all about...well, it's different...i reserved a non smoking room, and guess what, they put me in a smoking room the first night...called housekeeping and they brought a 1950's air purifier, has a switch that says "smoking to non smoking..." was funny until it kept cutting in and out...looked at where the air filter was and you could see blue sparks!...so i got my room change the next day to a clean smelling room...it was alright, no vents in the bathroom...steamy showers were the norm...view was good though, nothing else that spectacular...pool is alright, but if you guys want a good pool, you have to check out Mandalay Bay's!...no i don't work for them, just a satisfied customer.

Gotta love vegas.. especially when you live in the rainy northwest and those desert swimming pools are just a cheap two hour flight away.  Once you've decided to brave the place some call the devil's backbone, your lodging options are virtually unlimited..  from the stratosphere and imperial palace at $40 a night weekdays to $300 a night and up rooms at the bellagio and wynn.  The MGM is squarely in the middle money-wise.   If you sign up for their player's club card and throw a couple hundred bucks in the slots you will start getting some pretty generous offers in your email box.. this goes for most of the hotels.  Especially in this shaky economy, those rooms are just sitting there and they'd rather have you there for super cheap than staying at home in des moines watching tv and eating pizza.  Walking up to the desk and checking into a comped room is a pretty sweet feeling and chicks dig it.  

Overall i've had great times and excellent service at the MGM.  Check in has always been pretty quick and fairly smooth especially compared to their sister property the mirage.  I'd say if high floor strip view rooms aren't available, stay in the west wing.. the rooms are smaller and further away but are really nice.  When i've had an issue they are there for you (i accidentally messed up my room safe code and they were there pretty quick).  Room service is super spendy cuz they want you to "get it on tha floor" like DMX so yep ordering up a six pack of coors light is like thirty bucks!  There are little stores by the elevators where you can buy beer, cigarettes, bottles of liquor and other "basic necessities" (insert stupid internet smiley thing here).  

There's a food court with pizza, mcdonalds and a nathan's famous on the way to the pool that can save you a lot of dough on chow.  The casino is huge and great with excellent staff and the sports book is awesome.  There's always good fun music by the pools and throughout the hotel.  Somehow the tunes seem to always fit what i am up to.. I'll lose my friends and then hear "without you" by motley crue or find myself playing slots at 4am on april fools day to bob seger's still the same..  "you always lost every time u placed a bet".  Ahh the irony!. 

The biggest disadvantage to the mgm is the distance from your room to the pool - it's a serious hike. Then again the best thing about the mgm IS the pool complex.. seven pools, jacuzzis, a "lazy river" floaty deal and different vibes at each pool.  The 'producers pool'  has some lanes blocked off for lap swimming which is great for curing your inevitable hangover.  If you want a mellower or more lively scene.. just move to another pool!
