I'm a pearl member M life player and you want to charge me for the opportunity to play on your property F.....U greedy  A holes

We have stayed at the MGM a couple times with no issues in the past.  At least ten eight years later... forget it!

We got to room and it appeared it hadn't been cleaned.  Rice on the back of the couch, tables had crud on them and didn't appear to have been wiped down,  One of the tv's had no remote and we were charged for bar restocking because we took a few cans of beer out and replaced with our own water (did not use theirs at all).  I guess if we wanted to pay 35.00 we could have had them bring us up a tiny fridge!  To top it off, the lights did not work and they brought someone up with extension cords!!  And what is with the ugly centerpiece in lobby with all the money they make??? Seriously?

For sure will NOT stay at this hotel again!  To bad

Okay, 
Studio 54, I'm sorry...
I take back everything I ever said about this place.

Sure everything was a little hazy, and everyone was in costumes, but I got to experience being Alex DeLarge (post re-re-programming I think) and dance with Little Bo Peep, Little Miss Muffet, Elvis (don't ask) and a slightly slutty and very tall nurse.

Don't waste your money on tables or VIP here, all the fun in on the floor.  Save it for the table at Light or Pure for sure.

My Amex bill the next week evidenced the reasonably priced drinks and since I was drunk when I woke up, I would say their service is consistent and their drinks are strong enough.

Huge hotel!  They messed up our reservation but then upgraded us to a Spa suite.  Nice.  No fuss.  Their service was excellent and when they messed up they didn't argue and immediately compensated for it.  As far as prices go it varies from place to place and you won't get the same deals cause it varies with a lot of factors.  There are deals abound online you just gotta plan and dig, especially when it comes to Vegas.  

It was  a pretty enjoyable experience.  The service was good, the rooms are clean, They have one of the tightest pools.  Parking was nice cause there was always someone leaving.  We actually got good parking every time we needed it.  That will vary with the tourist season though.  

I'd come back if they had a similar deal or better.

The reason I stay at the MGM Grand is that I'm familiar with it. 
Things I like
Housekeeping is friendly and efficient
Great view of the strip from most rooms 
The Studio Café for breakfast- Best Lox ever! 
Many really good restaurants 
Maintenance crew responds well.
Photos of yesteryears stars hanging on the walls-Wow did they know how to dress. 

Things I don't like
Horrible water pressure- unfixable
Nasty looking couches in our room
Broken shower handle, so no hot water- until I called for maintenance
Broken hair dryer
Broken lock on our door- until I called for maintenance
No Internet until I called for maintenance 
Requested a King bed, got two queen beds 
Room service doesn't pick up in a timely manner. Wine glasses in hall for 3 days. 
Poor hotel maintenance- Ice cream drips on the beautiful brass elevator doors, never cleaned in the 5 days we were there 
Robot staff at front desk.  
Real Lions on display in a glass enclosure -I get the connection, just don't approve
The rainforest area with all its dusty plastic plants.  
I don't expect cheesiness at a hotel of this caliber 
I also expect to be pampered in a Hotel like the MGM. 
Things seem to be going downhill at the Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer. 

But all in all, I had my family with me and that makes everything perfect 
We had a blast playing together. Happy 21ST Birthday Grandaughter 

Now please excuse me I need another nap.  

This one is for you Lydia
http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=oUMwu_gXK7Q

I haven't stayed here since I was a teeny tiny tot!  Things were okay--I'd probably stay elsewhere next time, though.

They have SO many restaurants and lame tourist options (hello, cheesy green-screen videos and useless trinkets!) and not enough other fun stuff to look at or do on the premises.  The lion exhibit is only cute for a few minutes, CSI would be better at a theme park, and Tabu lounge was LAME. The people I went with who saw KA weren't raving about it like the other Cirque du Soleil productions, but I think everyone had fun at Studio 54 haha.

I do like the fact that there were so many food options, but you really have to stay for a week to enjoy them all!

Also, hellooooo, mirrors inside the rooms!  It was a bit difficult getting ready to go out when one person is in the bathroom and all of the mirrors are in there.

Even though the rooms are just average (CRT televisions, tiny shower), I slept well every night.  Maybe it was the bed, or maybe it was cause I was so tired from everything I was doing all day.

I have been staying at MGM ever since they opened on Memorial Day in 1994 for the Dela-Hoya fight. 
Never experienced any issues and can't remember anything bad that sticks out through all my stays 
We stayed my GF and I Michelle this last Sunday and overall we had a great stay 
The room was upgraded for only $20 dollars to a MGM Grand room I believe. Hint; with AAA you can get a decent discount. Plus the rate for Sunday was only $70 dollars. Parking on the property is now a chargeable expense, cost us $10 dollars a day
The bed was a bit soft, I prefer it that way. The room was quiet, and dark with the shades drawn if you like quiet and dark like I do 
The property has a nice gym and spa that we tried out. The pool is amazing, restaurants are unequal, and plenty of choices high end and fast food. 
Entertainment is phenomenal, Haakassan nightclub was amazing 
The lounges with live DJs are pretty cool and fun to people watch or dance 
Overall I would easily grant the MGM property 5 stars every time, since 1994 yo!

Let me start by saying that I would have given the casino alone a 3 . . . but unfortunately the casino gets rated with a hotel that I won't stay in again.

CASINO...
Very elegant, in keeping with the theme.  And HUGE.  It's pretty much _too_ big; it's easy to get lost inside regardless of the plentiful signage and any cockiness you may have about a sense of direction.  There's an excellent selection of restaurants throughout, but nearly all on the extremely expensive side.  Also, despite the size of the place, it's somewhat cramped and airless by all the machines, tables, and people crammed inside (and searching for a door...).

HOTEL...
Slowest.  Check in.  Ever.  The desk had a full complement of staff, but each employee across the board was taking 10-15 minutes per customer.  I wondered if this might just be overkill on customer service, or maybe even slow computers (I was ready to give benefit of the doubt), until my turn at the front of my line when I discovered that no, it was just slow staff.

Each floor of the hotel is beautiful and airy, especially the central area near the elevators from which the spokes of the hallways radiate.  The rooms are . . . okay.  They're rooms.  Simple, but nicely decorated.  The pictures on the walls are nicely framed black & white photos of stars of stage and screen.  (Some are a bit dark and creepy, but most are nice.)  But the feel is _old_.  The fixtures are not ageing well, from chipped, scarred, and stained chairs, to chipped, scarred, and stained bathroom fixtures.  (I was a little concerned about the toilet.)  The beds are beautiful and supremely comfortable, but otherwise I definitely felt let down by the quality -- I just expected much more.  Plus, for a non-smoking floor, there was a constant definite smell of cigarette smoke in my room.

Overall does the job as a hotel, but the old-school Tinseltown elegance has definitely faded.  With all the other options around, I won't stay here again.

We arrived here on Valentines Day for a 4 day stay.  We stayed at the MGM Grand because the Eagles were playing live there and figured it would be more convenient to stay at the same place the Eagles were playing at.  We arrived from the airport which was a quick 10 minute ride from the airport via a taxi and only around $15 with tip and taxi service fees.  The line at check-in was very long.  It took about 20 minutes to check in.  The gal that helped us was really nice.  They gave us a room in the West Wing.  As we walked down the loooooooong hallways to our room we began to notice old suspended ceilings, smelly hall ways and ugly old décor.  We got to the room and was not excited to see what we had just flown 6 hours from Boston to stay in.  The room was tiny.  It had almost no bathroom.  The bath sink was in the room and not in the bathroom.  The toilet was located in the room but not in a separate bathroom.  It was like a closet door in the room.  We quickly decided we could not stay in this room.  We call down to the operator and was connected to some one who said they could not help us because the hotel was full.  I asked to speak to the manager and was given someone whom said the same thing and that the next day they could see if they had something better.  Feeling disappointed we went back down to the front desk and asked for the gal that checked us in.  She had mentioned at check in that if we were not happy to come back and see her.  She was sooo nice and was able to immediately change our room to the main towers.  We had reserved a king size bed but was willing to take the room with the double queen beds instead of the original room.  This new room was great.  It was on the 18th floor room 101.  It even had a nice view.  It would have been ice if the room had a refrigerator that the guest could use.  They had fully stocked refrigerator that you could not use because they had beer, booze, water etc in them and if you removed a item you would be charged.  The room did have a built in safe which was nice.  This room was very nice and the hall ways leading to the room was nice.  The food court was awesome.  The Eagles concert was unbelievable!!!  I was VERY surprised to find out that there was no non smoking area's in the casino!  I have never seen so many smokers in my life!!  The entire hotel smelled solely of cigarette smoke.  We are spoiled up here in New England that we have 2 casino's with non smoking area.  How can the MGM not designate a small non smoking area to their non smoking crowd?  The casino is HUGE and you can not tell me that a area could not be roped off for non smokers.  The smokers were not even considerate to non smokers.  Over all Vegas was a fun "people watching" place.  You'll see all kinds of interesting people and activities.  We saw the Jersey Boys at the Paris and loved that.  We took a ride to Freemont St in old Vegas.  It was honky tonk and for the $32 taxi ride each way was probably not worth the visit.  Walking around from hotel to hotel and people watching was fun!  They could of had more pools open with better beverage service.  The only pool open served only beer and wine.  Hope you enjoy your trip!

I did not stay at the MGM but was here to see KA, eat at Joel Robuchon and some gambling. I feel like MGM is a bit too south on the strip and the front entrance is off to the side. Air circulation is OK but definitely not great. I liked that they had starbucks inside because beings a seattlite, I was having cravings after a few days!

KA was easy to find and the staff here were generally courteous, so the one time I asked for orange juice, I was given basically all ice in a little skinny glass. 

Won't be going out of my way to come play here, and KA wasn't that impressive. Robuchon also drive you to and from the property through the Mansion. Therefore I doubt I would be coming back to the MGM anytime soon.

We stayed at their west wing tower for 3 nights, it was the smallest room I've ever stayed in Las Vegas! If I knew it was to be tiny or they disclosed the room size, then I wouldn't have booked it and was wiling to pay for better room. Also the hotel couldn't even provide a bath soap and shampoo for the west wing room. Seriously??
 Also when we were checking in, they didn't bother to tell us they are placing us in a room right outside of the elevator. We end up getting a lot of noise disturbance throughout every night of our 3 nights stay.

This is our favorite hotel in Vegas.  This hotel is constantly busy which i like.  More people means more action on the tables and machine, which I feel pays out more.  Since we've been coming here for a while, we are always well taken care of getting a 1bdrm suite in the Grand Tower, which the closest tower to the lobby.  It is also right next to our favorite machines the Majestic Lions.  Our room is well appointed with a separate living room are with dining table, full size couch, super large bathroom with separate tub, shower and dual sinks.  Hotel is completely remodeled and have the auto opening and closing shades.

Valets are also very quick.  For handling the amount of volume they have.  I have never waited more than 10mins for my car.  Self parking is a pain and FAR AWAY, so i alway valet.  They have all the newest slots, which my wife really likes.  All the table games are at a reasonable limit, not constantly at $15-$25 min. 

They have many great restaurant such as Joel Rubuchon, L'Altelier, Hakkasan, and Craft Steak to name few.  They also always have top name entertainment, UFC and Djs
Great experience at the MGM. Service and comfort was awesome. Added bonus: got one of the BEST massages ever from Valerie at the spa.

I stayed at the Skyline Marquee Suite, beautiful two bedroom suite with a breathtaking view of the city. Although I was a VIP member, the staff were rude and impatient. I noticed that in general, the staff were not very courteous to the other guests as well. 

If MGM wants to compete with the many other hotels in Vegas, they need to train their staff to have more class.. Especially to their invited guests and VIP members.

They're lucky to get any stars, but I MUST at least try to be objective in my criticism.
Ok...I will give them their rating based on magnitude and options. This place is gigantic, and packed full of good food, shopping and entertainment. Fairly easy to get around. View was great, room was comfortable...even if our mini bar was broken.
Now. Let me explain why we will NEVER return to the MGM (not so) Grand. 
First off, upon entering our room, our joy derived from our view and spacious room was instantly sucked from our souls and rendered moot by the open condom wrapper and open tube of lotion by the bed. Then we found someone's clothing...
Then, they improperly coded our room keys which created multiple problems. One, we were locked out of our room. And two, our "free" parking almost cost $20, until an argument with the parking attendant solved that issue after ten minutes!
I can overlook certain things...and had nearly forgiven them, until the final straw. 
The most disturbing part of our visit was when I was resting in our room after dialysis. As I was about to drift off into a wonderful pile of pillowed sleep, I heard a noise at our door. DESPITE the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door, in walked a guy (from housekeeping I assume)..."oh, you're not checking out?"  NO JACK ASS IM HERE FOR A FEW MORE DAYS!
Why did that happen? Maybe a clerical error, but I don't buy that...
Needless to say, I was very irritated. I could have overlooked even a few more minor irritations, but the blatant disregard for our privacy was beyond unacceptable. 
Not even winning a huge jackpot would get me here again.
They'll have to be happy with their rating from this yelper, because its certainly more than they deserved.

As crazy as it sounds, I had never been to Vegas until last August. The MGM Grand is where I stayed during that trip to celebrate a friend's 30th birthday. The folks at the check-in were pretty cool, and the guy who checked us in (I honestly can't remember his name, but he had a strong Italian accent) seemed like a sincerely jolly fellow. Our stay did start off a little oddly, because the only room they had available for my friend and I was a handicapped-accessible room on the first floor. Our jovial Italian check-in guy informed us that we had a good chance of upgrading our room the next day, and he was right...we stayed in that handicapped-accessible room our first night there, and upgraded to a better room the next morning. And in case you were wondering, the most notable details about that handicapped accessible room were that it had a sliding door for the bathroom, a higher toilet and a low shower head in said bathroom, and a table that was a little lower than a usual hotel room table. 

Other things I liked about the MGM Grand:

- the lions exhibit was pretty cool.
- the mini-mall on the lower level of the hotel...I wish that I had more time to explore that area while I was staying there. 
- the wheelchair service they provided for my homie (the one who was celebrating his birthday), when he got too drunk at a club and couldn't make it back to our room under his own power. I would have helped him up, but dude outweighs me by about 40 lbs. Plus I was pretty faded at the time too, and it would have been tough to help him up all the way to our 4th floor room. Props to the security guys who helped us out with that...I thought they were gonna be a-holes, but both of them were cool about it and said they were used to handling situations like that at the hotel. 
- the view from our room was AWESOME.

There wasn't much that i disliked about the MGM Grand, but like one of the other reviewers said, the walls (not to mention the doors) are pretty thin. On our last night there, I could hear kids yelling and running up and down the halls near our room. When it's 4 in the morning, and you're trying to sleep off a hangover on the night before you check out, that's one of the last things you want to hear. 

I would definitely stay here again. 4 stars, yo.

The hotel is an okay location on the strip. It's near New York New York but about a 50 minute walk to the wynn hotel. When I checked in the guy helping wasn't really nice but also wasn't mean just kind of meh. I knew I had to pay a resort fee but it didn't say any where about a $300 security deposit. I did get it back but it was just a standard room and he didn't really explain much not sure why I couldn't just leave my card on file. I overheard the lady next to him helping guests and she mentioned to them that they would be able to check out late with no fee they'd just have to call the front desk and ask. So I was waiting for the gentlemen helping me to mention the same but he didn't. He just took my card swiped it and told me what room I would be staying in. I then asked him about late check out and he said there would be a fee. Ok. I was checking out Sunday morning but my flight was Sunday night so I asked if there was anywhere they could hold my bags and he said he didn't know. Also there are no mircrowaves or mini fridges in any of the rooms!! there is a mini fridge you can use but it's $50 a day and you can only buy the beverages that are in it, you can't put your own things in it.. don't think I will be back here.

Paid 300 dollars a night for a staywell queen room with a "pool view" got to the room and view was of a large expanse of  rooftop with no pool in sight.  Was told there was a pool at the end of the roof top as an explanation on how that could possibly constitute a pool view. ! We were moved to a staywell strip view again more rooftop expanse and a strip view if you stood against the wall to see it. We did have a peekaboo view of the airport and we were right next to the helicopter path that runs along Tropicana Blvd so from morning till late at night we heard constant LOUD helicopters CONTINUALLY droning past our windows. The blackout shade let in lots of light around the edges, the air conditioner didn't cool the room well, The alarm clock that wakes you with natural light lit up the room at 3:30 am the first night and the only way it would shut off was to unplug it. The bathroom had a gouged hole in the wall. The restaurants Shibuya and Fiamma were both Amazing and the housekeeping staff were very prompt and pleasant. 
I wouldn't recommend staying here for the money we paid per night. Would have asked to move again but the hotel was fully booked and even if we could have moved  packing and unpacking wasn't worth the hassle

The only good thing about this hotel is the food at Wolfgang but that was it. Friends kept talking about MGM and I remember when MGM was opened so thought why not try it for mother's weekend. I took my mother, her best friend and her mother to MGM 2 queen bed suite. We met up with my mother's other friends who came so it was nice weekend for her. 

The service was rude from nearly the beginning. There was only one great woman at check in when we arrived early but she was replaced by a man who had no clue what to do and couldn't find our reservation, he needed help and was so slow. He took at least half hour. Not only that, my mother overhead him talking about us on the phone nastily like he thought we were making it up about our suite, she got so displeased and I had her to walk away. Then I had to get a manager to try to finish the check in process. Then went to the luggage section so they can check in our bags and the guy said no u have to go to other line but the couple behind us in the other line went to the guy and he checked in their bags! 

There was construction and no signs pointing where the strip was or anything else. It was very time consuming to ask workers how to get on strip or get to a specific location. Some of them pointed to the wrong way. 

We had to call twice and go down in person to request more clean towels. It was a suite yet no coffeemaker in the room. We had to go to Starbucks. 

The pool was nice but hotel should do more to clean up glass\/beer can\/bottles that fall in the lazy river. My mom gambled a bit and we ate in hotel, yet when I called the M life reward I found out NOT one was credited to my players card. It is as if we never were at MGM Grand. 

Next time I would stay in their sister hotels like New York (where I have stayed at least four times) or Mandalay Bay. Even Excalibur offered better services and was so friendly. There is an expo happening end of July and I already informed my friends NOT to go to this hotel. They will be staying at Luxor, Treasure Island, Planet Hollywood instead. MGM needs to implement a plan to improve their  customer service.
TRES bien mais TRES (TROP) grand :p

On my first trip out to Vegas this is where I called home.  The waves of hotels come and go.  There are the oldies, the semi-new, and the new.  MGM fits in with the semi-new batch.  It's not state of the art by all means but it's a classic that still stays classy.  I like the location of MGM as it's not far from most other casinos and there are trams to take you else where.  The sports book here is really relaxed and there is a Lion exhibit right next to it.

Definitely my favorite place to stay when I'm in Vegas. Good price, and very clean. The MGM has a fresh smell whenever u walk in, and undoubtedly has a lot of amenities as well. The casino is a good size and they also Have some dope ass lions behind the glass. Me and my wife also make sure to eat at their buffet whenever we get a chance. Overall my stay at the MGM is always bomb.com lol

What can I say, the celebrity suite was unquestionably the worst hotel experience i have ever had. We ordered a non smoking room and as soon as we walk in, there literally was smoke coming out of the room. We complained and they said they would take care of the problem by sending up a machine to clean everything.  Well I didn't realize that this machine would be a young bell boy with a can of febreeze that honestly did not work. Also, I did not enjoy the 19 inch Panasonic tv from the mid 90's. This hotel did not live up to it's name.  Never again.

My wife and I stayed at the new "Grand King Room" that was recently remodelled. It was beautiful and clean.

I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. We visited some other hotels while we were in the area and some of them (not saying names) seemed dirty\/old\/smelly\/dark. 

When my wife and I went, it was during election week.. and Vegas was not very 'busy' as it had been when I had gone 4 or 5 years ago. There was no waiting for anything. 

The reason I took off 1 star for this hotel is during our last night there, the fire alarm went off for a good 15 minutes at 11pm. since we had an early flight, it was kind of annoying. 

I also find it funny that most hotels in Vegas try to get your money through any means possible. No fridge in the room for personal use (unless you ask housekeeping and it is like $35 a night or something?).. the fridge that is there is stocked with drinks.. but don't touch! you move them and you'll have to pay for them.

Very smoky and stinky hotel. On a cold winter day and walking in. OMG. well they have the heat on high which means that when you walk in the smoky smell and stuffiness don't go well. Its a bit disgusting. I personally can't stand this. I say air circulation should be a concern.

Just too damned big for me. Thanks for the choices but my room in the west wing faced a block wall, my bathroom was smaller than a motel 6, the miles of freaking hallways were just plain annoying. It should not take sneakers and 25 minutes to get coffee on the morning.

Pros: 
We had a nice room (but we were upgraded to an executive suite due to someone being in our room when we walked in after checking in!!! What?! The original room didn't look that great though - very small. The suite was nice, minus the broken sink and light).
Big casino with cool decor. Bathrooms clean.
Pool bartenders were nice.
Deal or no deal interactive machine! It's soooo fun and I'm so thankful they had it (I didn't see it at other casinos). I don't gamble except God this fun game!
Wolf gang puck was yummy and service was sooo good! I got the burger and it was very good! 
Emerald happy hour was pretty good deal and food samples
Bell hop taking our bags to be held for our checkout day was very nice and the guys getting us cabs outside were also.
Check in sucked. I did read other reviews before I left so I was prepared. We got in at 1 am so it wasn't too bad. About 30 min in line. But getting to our room and having it be occupied was a joke. 

Cons:
Casino is too large
Buffett was terrible! Expensive and gross
Starbucks packed every day so NEVER can get a dang coffee. It's so rude as there are no machines in the rooms (of course)
Drinks at the pool were expensive and sometimes not strong at all
Lazy river (why I booked this hotel) was packed and we couldn't get tubes the whole stay. The store and rental sold out   Way too many kids anyway
Pools were gross as too many people were in them by 1. Hair, oil, etc
They had a pharmacy convention the last few days of our stay and therefore closed the pools early and two pools all day to set up for their party at night so the other pools were even more crowded! Sucks when you book the hotel it doesn't tell you that since you won't be getting what they advertise.
Monorail escalators never worked   No one even trying to fix them
$25 a day to unlock n use hotel fridge. What?! So can't eat your left overs that you spent $100-200 on dinner earlier 
Next door suite had a SCREAMING kid - not baby- the first three days of our stay and then the last night were two young girls who left their BLARING music on all night and THEY WEREN'T EVEN IN THERE! Security did come and go in and turn it off but they weren't told because they continued to be obnoxiously loud the rest of the night and day. 
Cocktail servers came by once in an hour of playing and one was very rude

I read reviews after I booked and I was disheartened to say the least. I stayed at MGM 10 years ago and liked it. Wow it's changed. I would not stay here again.

We stayed here Easter weekend and it was good, not great. I mean the hotel is beautiful inside and the rooms are really nice, but we had a problem with one of our rooms.  After checking in, we went up to our room to find that one of the room's floors was soaking wet.  We had two rooms, and our other room next door was absolutely fine.  I called down to the front desk to complain, and there was nothing they could do but offer us free dinner buffet for two.  Too bad we had a party of 8 people.  I asked to be switched to a different room, but they weren't able to accomodate us because they claimed the only rooms they had available were smoking rooms.  I kinda didn't believe them, and wanted to at least get the room discounted, but they said they couldnt discount the room further because I had already been set up with a casino rate.  Oh well.  

There is a monorail stop at the hotel, so it made it really convenient to go to other hotels without having to take a taxi or drive ourselves. There was a March special and an all day pass was $9.  The all day pass was for 24 hours following the purchase (we bought ours at 8pm, so it was valid til 8pm the next night)  

There are a lot of places to eat at the hotel, from fine dining to casual eats like Mcdonalds and Nathan's hot dogs.  They also had a Haagen Daz which i loved!  There is also a fat tuesday, which is nice, even though I didn't get anything from there (but i wanted to)  I know that you can buy a yard long margarita and then just bring the cup down and pay less for refills. :)

The lion habitat is something definitely worth checking out if you've never seen it.  

The casino is HUGE, so please be prepared to do some walking if you want to go from one end of the casino to the other. The poker room is always pretty busy, and the tables usually have $10-$15 minimums.  

Join their players club and play some slots, because that way you will be able to get rated and get cheaper rates on their rooms.  :)

I get casino rate at mgm and luxor and like both, it all just depends on you.  :)

the bed was loverly, nice sheets, comfy to hop around on. the tv was old school clunky and had terrible basic basic cable.  the view was of the hooters hotel and some of the airport. the towels were LINTY. but i did enjoy their soap and lotion line. room service was impeccable and i did enjoy having my dirty sheets remade daily.

My family and I stayed here for 3 nights from 7\/12 to 7\/15. My sister from New Jersey met up with us via San Francisco.

We got in pretty late Sunday night. I think our check in was after 9pm so we were too tired to do anything. The check-in was pretty swift. There was no line since it was late so the process took less than 3 minutes. We were assigned a room on the 7th floor in the West area. As soon as we got inside our room, we all detected a cigarette smoke scent. It was just a hint, but it was enough for all of us to get a wiff of it and know that someone obviously smoked in the room. Upon further inspection we noticed a band aid at the foot of the bed and also that the bathroom counter was super dusty. My sister said she was too tired to complain, but my other sister did call the front desk to tell them about our dissatisfaction with the room. The person in the front desk told my sister that she would tell the next cleaning lady to do a thorough job with cleaning it the next day.

Cut to the next day....We left the room to grab breakfast downstairs. We got back to our room and saw the beds were made and everything fully restocked. So my sister checks on the band aid we found and IT WAS STILL THERE. My sister and I marched downstairs and told them what's happening. We were assisted by Jeannie who was training Ryan. She was very apologetic and moved us to a different floor at our request. For the inconvenience, she also comped our buffet. Three free buffets. All we really wanted was to be moved, so the added treat was nice. We were moved to the 25th Floor. As soon as we walked in, it smelled fresh and clean and the view was far nicer.

The rest of our stay was wonderful. My sisters went to Wet Republic while I napped. They said it was great. They went right before the sunset so it wasn't too crowded. Meanwhile, I enjoyed the quiet room and checked out a movie that was playing.

We had dinner at the Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill. The food was great. We also did a little bit of walking around in the casino as well as checking out a show. My aim was to not leave the casino. Basically it was to see if they really had literally everything you need that you didn't feel the need to go to the strip. They do. I ate there, did a bit of gambling, used the gym and enjoyed what they had to offer.

I've stayed at all the other casinos on the strip at least once and I'd have to say MGM is up there with the best. The facilities are great, the rooms spacious, great view wherever you are and lots of fun activities and shows. We also saw KA and loved it. It was quite an impressive show.

Bottom line, I think I've found my go to. I'm definitely staying here for the rest of time that I come visit the city of sin.
The casino we allways go back to everytime guests come to town. Its the best for everything on the strip. The Skylofts are great if you want to spend like a whale....Have funnnnnnnnnnnn

We came to the MGM Grand to celebrate our sons 16th birthday and wow did they deliver. We had a beautiful suite and the friendliest staff. Jeepette was so nice and even bought my son a birthday cake from corner cakes. The restaurant Crush was wonderful, the hazelnut salad was excellent as were the pizza's. The only complaint I have is how dark the rooms are.

We stayed at the MGM recently for President's weekend. We reserved 4 rooms, and I called 3 different times prior to the trip to request that our rooms all be on the same floor. I already assumed with a long weekend coming up it wasn't going to be likely that we would be able to get 4 rooms right next to each other. The agent on the phone told us that it was pretty likely our request could be accommodated since we agreed the rooms could be scattered as long as we had them all one one floor, so we didn't worry about it. Once we checked in, it turns out that 2 of our rooms were on one floor and 2 were on another floor. I told the front desk I had called several different times to make the request and he could care less. He didn't seem sympathetic toward our disappointment whatsoever. When we were still standing at the front desk I hear the lady next to us checking in another guest and she said loud enough for us to hear "oh across the hallway okay?" and the guest responded "yeah that's fine as long as the rooms are next to each other." To me that sounds like the guest was being accommodated for her needs and we were not. We didn't let it ruin the trip though and thought "hey at least its one floor apart from each other". Then when one of the couples in our group got inside their room, they said it smelled repulsive like mold and had to change rooms, and was then placed on ANOTHER completely different floor. So in total 4 of our rooms were on 3 different floors. It wasn't how we thought our stay would be and I expected better customer satisfaction. Probably will try something else out next time.

Wifi doesn't work half the time. Skip the overpriced room service ($28+ for yogurt and berries??) and the overpriced watered-down drinks. No bathrobes in the room. 

Worst part was a staffmember trying to enter and then INSISTENTLY banging on the door as I was trying to take a nap to ask if I wanted the room cleaned. The room had already been cleaned AND the Do Not Disturb sign was on the door. 

If the Do Not Disturb sign is up you don't try to come in and you definitely don't bang insistently on the door!!!

This is the type of crap I would expect at Motel 6, not a supposed 4 or 5 star hotel on the Las Vegas strip. 

Skip this place. There are much better options on the strip for similar pricing.
Suites don't come with a coffee maker and microwave.  For the big bucks you pay, it should not come with a bill for a hot pot.

Este es un hotel que lo tiene todo, las habitaciones son muy cómodas, apartadas del ruido y bien iluminadas. Mi experiencia aquí ha sido agradable. El servicio es muy eficiente, siempre hay alguien que te brinde atenciones, y la limpieza es de lo mejor. 

Si te hospedas en este hotel tómate un tiempo para recorrer sus instalaciones, te gustará y descubrirás que en Las Vegas vivir de noche es algo que no sólo se mira en las películas.

El movimiento es constante, hay mucha gente en el lobby, pero no te abrumes, es parte de la fiesta.

Great rates online for some comfy rooms.

The rooms at The MGM Grand are small but nice. The rooms were really clean and the beds were really comfortable. We had a strip view but its only of The New York York hotel. Meh. 

The room service here was surprisingly tasty especially at three in the morning. 

Good: Clean rooms with good rates.

Bad: Close those curtains or you'll get a green glow, all night long.

Final:

I play MyVegas slots so I was able to get 2 free comp nights to MGM. We decided to go on Super Bowl Sunday and stay for 2 nights.  Once we got there, we followed the signs to parking lot. The parking lot is so huge and the elevators were super confusing as some only went up and some only went down. ( good tip is once you park start walking towards the hotel and there should be an escalator that leads to the entrance at the end of the parking lot). The good thing is the lobby is near the parking lot.

I knew that our comp room entitled us to the dreaded West Tower.  I heard about people slipping the employee who is checking you in a $20 for a upgrade. I have never tried it before but after some liquid courage, we slipped the employee a $20 and asked about an upgrade. She said she would check and she obliged us with a room in the main tower (sweet!). The room itself was pretty nice and it seemed renovated. The pool was closed for us as it is open from May to September, which was fine because it was too cold to swim.

My only complaint was that on our last night there, there was some drilling that was going on at 2 am in the morning and didn't stop until 4 am!! We called down to the lobby and they said they had to do some constructions, but it was pretty annoying that they were doing this in the middle of the night.

Overall, pretty decent hotel to stay at and I would come back again.

Does not honor reservations.  Given that the room was reserved thru Vegas slots.  Then they sent me an email offering an upgrade to a tower spa suite for an additional price - which I took advantage of.  They sent me an email confirming this. This was in Feb.

A few days before our trip, they emailed saying we have a West wing room reserved.  I called them up and explained that I paid for an upgrade but they said that's not how their system works and would not budge.  I call BS on their explanation and basically feel discriminated upon because I booked thru My Vegas Slots which is their partner!

Hey MGM, if you do not honor your affiliates specials and offers, then do not make a deal with them.  Don't put out any offers you will not honor.

I had had two drinks and the slot lady cut me off! I had two drinks after 5 hours, the security guard found nothing wrong with me and the cocktail waitress told me I was only able to drink water!!! This place is cheap as heck and found every reason to nickel and dime me through out our stay. STAY AWAY!!!!!

The room and the pool was just average (altough the "lazy river" was really long), nothing special here. Concierge service was not very helpful. A better bet for the "south strip" would be Mandalay Bay (or THE hotel, if your wallet can take it)

I love this hotel and always stay at the MGM Grand but this time was a nightmare.   I arrived in the lobby only to find chaos.  The was no way to tell what line was what, people either not understanding or something it took me over 25 minutes to check in to my room.  Then I was shocked to find out only 3 out of the 8 elevators were working  which took another 25 minutes to get to my room.   The room was nice,clean and renovated.   I only have two complaints about the room which are the shower water pressure was not there & the air conditioner  should blow air out harder..    On checking out I stood in the elevator area for another 35 mins  only 4 working.   finally took an elevator up and then back down to get to the lobby.  The whole elevator thing was something I do not think they really cared about, It was no way to treat your  guest,  to make people wait just to go to and from your room.   Yes the hotel is under renovations but still the elevators should all be working, since they are for 8 floors of guest.   I was so disappointed in my stay this time.
Wir waren im Theater des MGM Grand Hotels in der Cirque du Soleil Show "Ka", einem chinesischen Märchen. Tolle Akrobatik, tolle Bilder, tolle Musik....man wird verzaubert.

I don't think you can beat the MGM when you consider the price of rooms and the amenities.  This is the best second tier hotel on the strip (top tier being the luxurious dens of excess like the Venetian).  I've managed to stay at pretty much every hotel on the strip and the MGM is where I prefer to leave my luggage.  The rooms are modern and well appointed.  The casino is huge.  The selection of restaurants fits all budgets.  There are two big clubs in the hotel (Tabu and Studio 54).  And they have a lion show a few times a day where you can watch two lions interact with trainers and have their pictures taken.  

Sure you may be able to find a nicer room on the strip, but you're going to pay much more for it...and you shouldn't be going to Vegas to spend tons of time in your room anyway...
 
Let's one thing straight from the get go...  People smoke in Vegas casinos.  I hate hearing people complain that the casinos are smokey.  That's like complaining that a bar smells like booze or that your local gym doesn't smell like a flower field.  It's just part of the program and you have to deal with it.
 
That said, it is always nice when your room actually gives you some sense of being on vacation.  It can be pretty discouraging staying at a hotel where the rooms are tired or only qualify as a room because they have a bed, a bathroom, and tv.  The basic rooms are very nice with tasteful art on the walls (pictures of movie stars and Vegas icons from the 40's and 50's), plenty of marble in the bathroom, and towels that actually have some thickness to them (I hate those paper thin towels some places give you).  Move up to a Spa Suite and you get a huge room with cavernous bathroom and a spa tub.

I really like the feel of the casino.  It winds on forever and there is no shortage of tables.  The poker room is pretty large too and you will find a variety of players from all over the world in there (not just locals like some rooms).  The kicker is that they have one of those Sigma Derby mechanical horse racing machines over by the sports book.  You pick the horses that will come in first and second and get odds on your quarter bets...fun fun fun.

The one knock that I have about the MGM is that it is so big, the walk from your room to the pools is a journey.  
 
Oh and beware staying in one of the new towers, otherwise known as The Signature at MGM Grand.  We had some friends stay there during our last visit and it is a lengthy walk to and from the casino floor.  The front desk even mentioned a shuttle service to and from that part of the property, so you know it's out there.
 
MGM MONEY SAVING TIPS (because we are all cheap bastards at heart):
 
You can get a good sized deli sandwich for $7.25 at the Stage Deli over by the sports book and poker room.  They also have hot dogs, soups, and other snacks that won't bruise your wallet too badly.  Grab a quick bite here after your late night carousing, as it is open until 2:00 or 3:00AM on the weekends.
 
A nice cheap snack - If you go to the food court where the McDonald's and the Nathan's are located, there is a Chinese fast food place on the left side where you can get a "side" of chow mein or fried rice for $1.50.  A side is a plate full.  The chow mein is a good snack, as you get noodles and veggies (bean sprouts, onions, and some cabbage).  That could actually be one of the more healthy meals that you have while you are in Vegas.
 
If you play slots, you have to join their Players Club.  It is one of those group things, since the MGM is owned by the same company that also owns a host of other hotels on the strip like New York New York, Bellagio, and Mandalay Bay.  Put that card into the machine and take your shot at winning 1,000 nickels.  The benefits are huge, ranging from receiving great room deal (you have to opt in online to get them) to very generous comps.  My wife just likes to play penny and nickel slots, but we always get some kind of great perk.  Call the players club before you check out and ask if you qualified for any comps.  We have gotten one or two nights of our stay comp'd or at the very least all of our food charges comp'd.  Not bad.

Not bad if you can get a deal.  We got it for $99\/night and for that price it was worth it.  The main gripe I had with it was that everything seemed a bit dated... the TV was an older tube-tv (non-flat screen), the showers seemed old, etc.  All-in-all, not very luxurious, but for $99 I won't complain too much.  Just a little.

The casino itself is pretty decent, but being on the South end of the strip makes it a bit less convenient to walk to other casinos.  For me, it didn't matter because I've been to Vegas too many times, and I'm so over visiting each and every casino.

The restaurants downstairs are decent, but there are a couple of Wolfgang Puck restaurants that were completely devoid of customers.    Overall, if you can get it a deal when booking, I don't think you will be dissatisfied by the experience at all.

Awesome place to get a good price room, great service and were kind enogh to find my gf a non smoking room when they said they did not have any. I always like staying here on the strip as I can always get a good price when booking early and signing up for their special offers

This is the first time I have ever stayed at the MGM. The front desk lady was extremely welcoming and referred us to the bell desk to have our desk at while we waiting for our room to be ready. After 3 hours, we got a call saying that our room was ready. After about 5 minutes of being in the room we got a call from the mechanic that our toilet handle is broken to which we respond I don't know what your talking about we just checked in. Come to find out it was broken so we had to call them back. The shower water took 30 minutes to get hot which I thought was ridiculous. Come to find out that MGM neglected to say that the pool was closed for the season which is suppose to be included in the $15 daily resort fee. We did dine out in the Emeril restaurant that did not meet on expectations like it did the first time we came here last year.  I was not impressed with the quality of the room and I vented my frustrations in the survey of my stay. I was credited the $15 resort fee but that does not change the fact of the complications of the room and the amount of money spent on this hotel. I like visting the MGM maybe for a fight but I dont think I will be staying here again!

The room was decent and clean, nothing special.  However the hallways were a mess.  The same service trays from two rooms near ours sat outside our room for three days.  The pool area was a mess with inadequate clean up of beer cans throughout the day.  You pay $39 a day for a resort fee for things like Wifi and the wifi keeps disconnecting.  On top of all that, beware using one of their bottles of water I expected to pay a bit extra, but $12 for a single bottle of water in the room.  By the way their tap water is not drinkable.  Stop and buy water, 6 for 2 dollars at Target.

They've got a lot to do here and I appreciate that. What I don't appreciate is the lack of service on the casino floor.

I was playing the slots and the cocktail waitresses would pass me by and never offer a drink...whenever I tried to establish eye contact, they'd just walk on by. 

Then this random manager type comes up to me to see "how I'm doing" but something about her questioning made me feel like I was doing something wrong.

I won't return to the casino here.

I stayed here with a bunch of friends and I was really impressed with the service and property. Everything was modern and on point. It felt luxurious and comfortable.  I picked the hotel because we knew we were going to hakkasan. We actually got comped a few tickets as well. We called for housekeeping a few times because we needed more towels, etc and every time they were speedy and friendly. Besides the rooms,  the casino is huge and the property just sprawls out. Because I go to vegas so often I don't even walk around and explore anymore so there were a lot of areas that I didn't see but I'm sure you can walk around this place for hours and be entertained.
The hotel is Wonderful but when I went to their mc Donalds in the food court the managers were very rude, some of the employees were nice, food was ok, no $1 drinks though and only 1 refill

I have always been a fan of the MGM-Mirage properties having stayed at both the Mirage and Treasure Island (TI) on previous trips. I have to say that the MGM Grand rates much lower in comparison. 

Being an MGM-Mirage Players Club member, I was offered a promotional rate via email: $59.99 (Monday - Thursday) and $79.99 (Friday). This was much such a good deal that I couldn't pass it up, in the past I usually booked through either Expedia, Orbitz, or Travelocity. 

I have one of the MGM-Mirage credit cards which offers certain perks such as earning Gift Certificates, Invited Guest Check-In, and Early\/Late Check-Out. 

During this visit I was able to use the Invited Guest Check-In, which you think would be more efficient since this is the line that people with Casino Hosts use. I was only the third person in line, and it took longer than if I would've waited in the normal check-in lines 5 or 6 people deep. 

The room was nothing too special, it had a view of the parking garage and Koval Lane. The TV was outdated (TI had upgraded to LCD TVs in 2006). The best part of the room was the bed, which was surprisingly comfortable. 

I'm not sure if it was isolated to our room but there was an adjoining door to the room next to us that seemed as if it was paper thin, we could hear normal conversations being carried out late at night and early in the morning. 

The pool is a mystery to find. I am thinking that the pool was more accessible in the past before the hotel did renovations in connecting the MGM Grand to the MGM Signature Towers. From the elevator,  you need to walk through some shopping areas down a long corridor to the pool. 

I almost think that the casino is too big at the MGM Grand. If you want to visit any of the other casinos in the area: NY NY or Excalibur it is a very long walk from the elevators to the walkways of these casinos. Also, some of the slots are very dated, especially the quarter slots. We had a slot machine malfunction twice in about a 30 minute time frame. Also, with the casino being so big, the cocktail waitresses are nowhere to be found in the slots areas. 

I would wait for a room renovation before staying here again.

This hotel is a nice option. I feel its comparable to places like the Bellagio and Caesars without the higher price tag. I stayed here when I got married and chose the MGM because I could get a s suite with jacuzzi for the same price I could get a regular room at other places. I'm a non-smoker and found this hotel to be clean and fresh smelling. The ambience is nice too and it has an overhead walkway to the New York New York which is a really fun casino. The only drawback is that its near the south end, so not right in the middle of the action like the bellagio, mirage, or flamingo. Still, it is pretty close with the deuce bus and the southern end of the strip is still better than the northern end. Id rather be in the MGM than anywhere near of ceasar palace when the casinos start spreading out more. I would definately stay here again, or perhaps the mirage with is an MGM casino as well. Really good bang for your buck. After walking through places like caesars, manadalay, bellagio, I found them to be overrated. The MGM gives an upper class feel for less money.

A little too far south for my taste, but CraftSteak is here as well as the Lion's Share slot.

I've never stayed here, here but the MGM has become a part of our trip because of the legendary Lion's Share slot machine. The rumor is that this is part of an old bank of progressive slots and the casino can't remove it until it pays out. The jackpot was up to $2M in Sept 2012. To find it, go to the high-limit slot area and ask the attendant there where it is (it moves around the floor). Also, CraftSteak is near the top of our Vegas steakhouses list.

For our latest trip to Las Vegas, we stayed here at the MGM Grand.  This is my most frequently used hotel on the Strip, this trip was extra special.  When I booked my reservation online, I noted that my wife & I were spending our 5th wedding anniversary here.  On our second day, one of the hotel staff delivered a bottle of champagne and a tray of chocolates to our room, along with a hand-written note from the director of hotel operations.  This was a very nice and unexpected touch!

The stay here was bitter-sweet. We initially arrived to find our reservation had been cancelled without notice, but they found us a slightly larger room upgrade for no extra cost to make up for their screw up. Our friends that also stayed here had to deal with lots of construction noise (jack hammers at 9am) because of the heavy renovations going on. The room was nice, and we did get a food and drink credit as part of our booking deal but I continually had to remind them about it during arrival and checkout to make sure it was applied. In the end though they still screwed up the charges to my credit card (which didn't match the receipt from checkout) and when I called to ask about it the front desk clerk was incredibly rude and patronizing and wouldn't let me get a complete sentence out before cutting me off. I'm a stickler for service and this kind of service will keep me from staying here ever again. It's just not worth the hassle.

The MGM Grand is my "go to" hotel in Vegas. I've been to a few others and have always enjoyed this hotel. Good mixed crowd, accommodating staff and service is great! For the first time I actually went out to the pool and was blown away with the "view." The restaurants are good and there's a variety for any price point. The only downside I'll say is the quality of their buffet has gone down. Something to work on?

This is my first time staying at the MGM and most likely the last. I'm use to staying at the Venetian suite. I'm very disappointed with the time spent in line at the check in desk, the rooms are standard but clean and  the pool area is to far from my room.  Whats funny about that is concierge  said we have a pool view. Lol what a joke that was. Every one looked like ants. And that's not all my resorts fees are 56 dollars a day on top of the price I already paid for rooms $$$.Oh yeah they gave us a 50 dollars dinning credit a day. But if you add the resort fees I have really payed for my own dinning credit. I gave it two stars only because the
 room was clean.At this point I'm not a very happy customer.

Stayed in the remodeled spa suite...very nice they now have plugs to charge your stuff all over the room. Also the sectional sofa and big mirrors were a plus for having friends over to get ready together
The bad side: Everything in the mini bar (beer\/water) was hot and there were blood stains on the comforter...gross...also our sinks regurgitated and black stuff came out of one glad we only stayed here one night
i have not stayed here, and jus didnt like the atmosphere of the hotel
Great hotel, although a bit further down on the strip.  I do like how they have a large food court with a lot of choices.  We got a suite here for a very reasonable price for Vegas.

Stayed here for a night on a little weekend getaway with my old lady. There are a good variety of restaurant options to eat for a non rich people, and lots of penny slots to choose from! I found a cool little video blackjack game that I had a good time playing multiple times during the stay.

Our hotel room on the other hand was disappointing. The walls are seriously paper thin, you could hear the people next door talking and joking around until like 4 in the morning. We called guest services around 2 and they sent someone up to ask them to keep it down. The noise never stopped, loud tv and chatter for another hour, had to call guest services again. They sent another person up and asked our neighbors to keep it down. They didn't offer to move us or apologize for the noise, nothing.

When we checked out they asked how our stay was and we told them that we got no sleep because the walls were so thin, had to call them multiple times, they didn't really care, didn't give a discount or really do anything apart from finally saying "I'm sorry to hear that.."

The best part about this place is 'Ka' the Cirque show, best Cirque show I've seen yet, can't miss it. But, do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Hotel is clean and the rooms were a good size. Went to the Wolfgang restaurant , pizza was good and then to hakkasan Friday night which was great. One down side of hotel was I ordered sparkling wine for friends who just got engaged . The hotel charged almost 60$ for a 9$ cheap bottle of cava. Disappointing trick for a hotel that as nice as it is.

went on vacation here with my 2 friends and mom a few months ago! LOVED IT! Great service. It is not like those other glitzy Vegas hotels, but it works. Great customer service and the studio cafe is great. 

Some place I would definitely check out again...but first, I need to visit the Bellagio :-)

I have never stayed here, but I reserved a room for my parents as a birthday present for the both of them because they were attending a concert at MGM. I was told they would be put on a higher floor and that the hotel would do something nice for them since they were celebrating two birthdays. When my parents got there they were given a room on the 3rd floor in a location where they had to walk a very long distance just to get to the elevator. My mom has a bad knee and that walk was not reasonable for her. When they asked to get their room changed, they were put on the 13th floor but were charged an extra $20 per night. When they checked out, the hotel had a fee charged to them because they had arived early and left their bags with the conceirge. After my dad complained the fee was removed. 

I called MGM to let them know how upset and embarrassed I was that they charged my parents for a room that they were suposed to get for free. They acknowledged the fact that the notes said to put them in a higher floor room and its their birthdays but said higher floors are based on availability and they do not do anything special for birthdays. They had no regard for the fact that their rep had promised me these things when I was making the reservation. The room was obviously available since they put them on the 13th floor, and they had the note in their system with instructions, so why did they have to pay for it? The manager denied they did anything wrong, said she would "have a talk" with the rep for saying they would do something nice for the birthdays, and denied the attempted charge for leaving the bags with the conceirge. All she had to do was say sorry or refund the $40 charged to my parents. I'd even refrain from writing this review if they refunded my parents and charged me instead. But the fact that they did nothing and showed no remorse and did not care when I told them I would never book a room with them again, made me write my first review on yelp. There are so many better hotels in vegas who treat their customers in a way to make them happy and keep coming back, why stay with an old crappy hotel who doesnt care about you or their reputation.

I stayed at the MGM Grand for 1 night last Sunday. We had a standard room with 2 beds (they claim they're queens, but they are more like doubles). It was pretty small and in need of an update, but it was clean. The TV was the old-fashioned, non-flat screen kind.  The beds were super comfortable and the pillows were the best I've ever had. They seemed like overstuffed down pillows. I'd like to find out what they are and buy some for my bed at home!

The pool area was very nice, if crowded. We particularly enjoyed the lazy river.  This hotel seems to attract mostly people in their 20's bent on drinking and having a good time.

Full review at http:\/\/marga.voxpublica.org\/2011\/08\/mgm-grand-hotel-casino-las-vegas-review\/

I recently stayed here for Memorial Day Weekend and had a good time. The hotel and casino itself were great, but when i needed to speak with customer service over the phone for a general question they were extremely rude. I wish I would've gotten her name so I could include it in this review as well. I know customer service can be challenging at times for some but taking it out on a customer and then hanging up is extremely rude. I won't be wasting any money here again.
We are checking in now and Nilvia is AMAZING!! She made it so easy, let us check in early and genuinely cared about us having a good experience!

I go to LV at least once a year to go to see Jimmy Buffett.  MGM is the only place to stay as far as I'm concerned.  Feels like home!  Excellent restaurants, always clean and great service.  I've made myself make reservations at other places trying to get out of my rut, and always end up checking out and checking back into "my" MGM room.

Whenever I go to Vegas I normally like to stay at a hotel I haven't already stayed at, but I actually have stayed here twice. The first time was for my bachelorette party so we got a suite. It was the perfect! There were 12 girls and suite was able to accommodate all of us comfortably and ALL our luggage! The suite was clean and the service was prompt. Our suite had two king beds, a sectional in the living area, and a pull out bed. I think the only thing missing was a kitchenette and since originally we only planned on 8 girls staying in the suite, we didn't think we needed to opt for that (another option was the penthouse suite at  PH). But when we landed the other girls wanted to stay with us and it's always more fun when you have ALL your girls with you in one room right? So they cancelled their reservations at their hotel and it was a 3 day slumber party at the MGM!! I'd definitely recommend looking in their suites if you are coming with a larger party. 

The second time I stayed here was for my birthday. It was just me and a girlfriend of mine. Since I'm actually the one that booked the hotel and checked in, I can give you insight on my experience in that process. I booked through the hotel's site and it was an easy process and I was able to pick and choose the room I wanted. Upon arrival and checkin, the man that checked us in was so nice and we were able to get early check in, late check out, and a room upgrade all comped!! Now, for our room. Very clean, very spacious, and a great view. We got two queen beds and room service again was very prompt. Honestly, it was a lot of room for just two people but I'm not complaining. I really like the hotel's location on the strip as well and I would probably stay here again regardless of my Vegas hotel rule. Lol.

well what can I say. I  wanted  to give it one more try . Well I get there and there is no king beds after ask twice  before I came. so strike one .Then got to room and it was remolded but took forever for hot water too get to shower  and my friends also in next room over. water barley came out of shower so that suck. 3rd thing is they were hammering every am from upstairs. 4th thing is  looking at dirty dirty windows looking at view. 5th thing, I love pool area that was closed and had to walk with all my stuff to go to MGM not cool. 6th  most of food area were closed so had to go some were else. So I would love to go Back to Vegas  but stay some were else or in a suit owned by MGM ,because what I had to pay for  me and friends is wrong for what we got. So Monte Carlo \/ MGM  you get  a one star at this time and I will tell all my friends and pass the word on unless you can make this right.  MGM \/ Monte Carlo   Please read my last stay  2015  also 1 star So I Really think MGM  you should make this right thank you

I'm on this MGM thing now and I've stayed here, oh, about the last 5 times now. They keep sending me free rooms and I always have fun here. Yes, I'm losing a buttload of cash, but hey, it's only money... 

I don't think the rooms are bad, mainly because I don't spend much time in them. But it's not like they're horrible and you just absolutely can't spend a minute there. The WW is nicer, but the rooms are smaller. The older rooms are fine, but the huge face pics of old time stars is kinda scary to me. I guess I just don't like people or pictures watching me sleep. Oh and the always empty concierge desk they have on some of the floors is kinda annoying. Just remove the stupid things already. 

I've gotten great service and my trips have been fun so far. I also like that the casino is so big, and it's not "the" place to be like Wynn, so you have a pretty good chance of finding the right table\/slot\/bar\/club for you.

We booked this 4 star hotel and arrived at 10:30 am. Despite the 3:00 pm check in, our room was not ready until 4:00. Our room was in the West Wing which was absolutely awful and separate from the other rooms in this hotel. I stayed here a few years ago in a different wing and the rooms were totally different. We were excited that the hotel had an adults only pool. Unfortunately, that pool along with 2 other pools were closed to us for 5 of the 6 days we were there because the hotel hosted special events on them. They played very loud rap music at the pool so napping poolside was not an option. 

We had to pay $168 in resort fees for our 6 night stay. The WiFi worked sporadically & it did not include access to the gym. You had to pay $10 to use it. Do not stay here!

After my first stay with the jacuzzi and strip view I was unable to stay in any of the other rooms with less. I enjoy my stays here. Staffs our always courteous. Rooms are always nice and appealing. Will always recommend if you don't mind spending a few pennies. You will always leave with a great experience
Went through here on my way from the fountain to Joel Robuchon. I can't wait to stay here; it's amazing.

First time staying at this hotel, and so glad we chose to stay here!  

Pros: 
Many delicious places to eat
Fun atmosphere 
A good amount of gaming tables (kuddos  to Art who made playing roulette that much more fun!) 
Nice rooms and friendly staff

Cons: 
The only thing I can complain about is the linens and towels. It might just be my sensitive skin but whatever soap they chose to wash with does not feel too clean and is very rough. 

Loved our stay and will be staying again!

How one bad incident can change a f review to a 1 star. Enjoyed our stay until the last night. On that night we were off resort and were retuning and we unfortunate to return after a concert ended. We got caught up on traffic for 20 minutes or so to travel two blocks. When we finally reaches the entrance to the hotel they would not allow us to enter main entrance to hotel. Circle block to another 15 min later get  but can not get to valet parking. Valet will not allow us into area. He suggest going to east valet parking. Circle esprit again. 20 min later get to east valet parking and it is ropes of no valet. Finally park in garage after 1 hour of just try to get into resort. Call to talk to manager. She says there is nothing she can do about traffic. Let's see MGM concert caused traffic issue. MGM security was
Directing traffic. MGM security would not allow cars to turn into resort. Seems to me like MGM was in control and choose a terrible solution.  Not to allow guests to enter resort. Manager offered us a late check out since our flight was at 6 am that was of little help and why we were trying to return a little early. We did make it to our rooms a 1am. Do not plan to come back to resort again

This review is for the CASINO only. I have not stayed at the hotel.  I have been to vegas 2 times in the past 2 months and visited the MGM casino both times I was there.  I like that they have nickel video poker, and the Rainforest Cafe is cute. BUT THE ODOR OF WHAT SMELLS LIKE CHEAP PERFUME IS OVERWHELMING. When I came here in Feb. 2015, the smell was so bad I could taste it in my mouth after being in there about an hour. This last time in March it wasn't as strong, but was still pretty powerful.  It's so bad it cancels out any tobacco smell, but is almost worse in my opinion.  People with allergies to fragrance, avoid this place like the plague!  MGM, you're a multi-million or billion dollar business, please invest in an air purification system instead of covering odors with cheap smelling fragrances. I wanted to gamble longer but couldn't take the smell.

OMG I love this place!!! It got everything you need in one place. They got a lot of things to see and do  such as the Lion Habit, which I recommend for families; CBS Television City, for those who are interested in viewing shows from Nickelodeon, Spike, etc; KA by Cirque del Soleil, and other things. One thing you need to do for sure is visit their  massive pool complex, its huge!! They have five pools, including a pool for adults only, as well as a lazy river and a whirlpool. They also have a snack bar near the pool that have hamburgers, nachos, etc. Hungry? This place have a variety of dining options to offer from upscale restaurants, such as Emeril's , to more casual restaurants like Studio Cafe. They also have a McDonald's  and a Starbucks for those who want something quick to eat. They  have nightclubs, like Studio 54, which is great for those who want to have a  date night out. If you are staying at the MGM Grand then I recommend you staying at the Grand Tower. The rooms are much larger and nicer than the rooms in the West Wing Tower. I got a great deal on the room rates by joining their fan page on their website. The rooms does not have flat screen tv  like other hotels on the strip but who comes to Vegas just to watch tv?  The staff were very accommodating in assisting your needs and the lines were not that long when I was checking in\/out. 

I forget to mention if you are going to see the KA Cirque del Soleil show, I highly recommend you wait and purchase your tickets when you arrive here. Guests who are staying at the hotel receive 40% percent off on tickets to the show so don't book online!!

Overall, I think this is a nice place for families and adults to stay and visit. It's located at the south end of the strip near New York New York Hotel but in a great location! Close to Denny's, M&M World, Coca-Cola store, and Gameworks.

Check-in process is terrible. Two hour wait in line. Not a great experience as a first timer to MGM. One MGM member in a green shirt stated I quote "this is the busiest we've been here". Find that hard to believe considering they have major events that are heavily attended.

This place was a total FAIL. Stayed there a few weeks ago. Was booked for a suite and told I was to go to VIP check-in. Upon arriving, I was met by a young woman who was assigning everyone into their proper registration line. When I told her I needed to go to VIP check-in she looked me up and down (was wearing jeans and a polo) with a condescending look and stated she did not think I needed to be in VIP check-in. Instead, was sent into the herd with everyone else. 

While in line, I was approached by another employee and was asked if I needed any help. When I told her that I was to go to VIP check-in, she brought me to the back of yet another line. No drinks while waiting, no Mr., Sir, etc... The agent checking me in did not appear to know what was going on. At one point she went in the back room for 5 minutes or so without saying when she would be back. I saw another employee pass by and asked him if my original agent would be back. Apparently he was a Concierge because he pointed towards that desk and walked off. So much for Customer Service.

When the agent finally came back, I was informed there was a $500 deposit because it was a suite. Not being a rockstar who wrecks hotel rooms I was a little confused why it would be required. I used a credit card to hold the room, so they already knew how to find me if something happened.

The room itself was not particularly impressive. The bathroom was about half the size of the room and covered in marble that became slippery when wet. Fired up the jacuzzi tub and a strong smell of bleach permeated the room. We had to turn it off after a few minutes as it was too much to handle.

During the stay I ordered the "Shrimp Noodle Bowl" from room service. It cost approximately $30 JUST FOR THAT. When it arrived it was two large pieces of shrimp with Noodles below them. What surprised me most was that the noodles themselves were Beef Ramen. It wasn't that it just looked like Beef Ramen, smelled like Beef Ramen, or tasted like Beef Ramen. IT WAS BEEF RAMEN. 30 G-D DOLLARS FOR BEEF RAMEN. AHHH!!

The only shining light the entire stay was the bellman on the way out. Very professional and helpful. I am sure the poorly managed organization at the MGM will ensure he is never promoted, praised, nor rewarded. 

Overall, I would stay far away from this hole. It is already one of the older properties on the strip and it shows. Spend a few more dollars (literally) and stay at the Encore or something. The MGM is played out.

**UPDATE**: Still pissed.

Bring your hotel map. And bring a flashlight. 

1. The map will help you find the door out.

2. The flashlight will help you light your room.

Check in was 10 mins, nice friendly service, got into my room at 11am. Room was very clean comfortable. MGM is huge! We only ate at Avenue and Hecho, both had good service and food. I liked being down on that end of the strip, we always stay in the middle of the strip and tend to venture out to the normal casinos there so it was fun wandering around this end of the strip for a change. Never made it to the pool it was "chilly" :( 

My only complaint about mgm is that I kept winning and then losing $ in their slots but that is because I don't know when to quit - clearly! 

Tip to MGM - get bigger cups for the free yummy fruit infused water at the front desk :) those little Dixie cups are not big enough for the desert :)

That is all!

Price was great but, we got a "renovated "room for $20 more per day and it was not worth it. TV didn't work, Shower was broken, sink over flooded, hairdryer didn't work,room was very small. Mgm being one of the greatest hotels my stay wasn't what I expected. I was celebrating my wedding anniversary and couldn't enjoy a nice room with many things not working.

Hotel is nice and has alot going on from clubs to shows to bars
 However my complaints is the abnormally long check in lines , dirty towels, charges on my account I was not supposed to have, my sink smelled like piss.
The bathrooms here are so clean and smell good. The staff is so kind and they all say hello!! Here for our Coldwell Banker Premier Realty conference   Thank you

Compared to a lot of the Vegas hotels, I think MGM stands right at the midpoint--not terribly bad, but not memorable either.  I actually just came back this past weekend and I didn't realize it was also spring break for a lot of college kids so that could have made a big difference.  What was absolutely excruciating was the check in\/check out line.  I would have to say that was the worst part of Vegas I've experienced all weekend long.

I do have one advice as far as checking in\/checking out.  You can somewhat skip the checkin\/checkout line by standing in the "Invited Guests" line.  That's what my boyfriend ended up doing while I stood in the other line in case if they rejected him, but they didn't.  Makes sense since the hotel doesn't want to rub off the wrong way to a hotel guest.  

Also, beware--their checkout system via T.V. didn't work either so when you do check out, try and look for the ladies who are carrying the little pads, they are able to check you out if you don't want to stand in that 20-30 minute line...  Checking out via those individuals with the pads is that you can't see the charges that have been charged to your room but if you didn't mess with the censored goodies or charged a restaurant bill to your room, you should be good to go.

Hope that helps and have a great time in Vegas if you stay at the MGM!!!

Lina Chen

LOVE this place!  You can literally stay at this place and not go anywhere else!  Studio 54 and Tabu' are here for dancing.  Lots of nice eats from sushi to steak.  And cheap eats from New York Pretzel, Nathan's Hot Dogs and let's not forget Fat Tuesday pina colada smoothies served in what could be used as a portable urinal for both sexes.  Gross!  But true....

Pools are awesome!  A pool for everyone.  First there's the party pool where dance music is playing while the 20's crowd bob up and down in the pool with plastic beer bottles.  Go early since that's the only time you'll be able to swim.  The 30's pool, still close enough to the party pool but if you have stretch marks and a belly this is the one to go to.  The central pool, usually for those who don't venture out into the other pools.  The back pool, I noticed for seniors and much more quiet than the other pools.  Then the FUN POOL!!  There's a lazy river  here that has a current AND there are waterfalls!!  Great for kids but fun for just lazing around....

Rooms are comfortable, stylish and have standard amenities.  They had a cool stylish sofa that is great to sit on and feels like therapy having a conversation on it.  Marble floors in the bathroom that I almost slipped on, but nice toilet paper.  The lotion was actually really nice too!  I'm big on lotion!

This hotel has a Monorail station that goes clear across the North part of the Strip and ideal for staying out of the heat.  A 24 hour pass is $9.  Not bad for cruising through the hotels on the strip.

I would probably stay at this hotel again!

www.MGMGRAND.com
Check was smooth an everyone was really friendly. Valet is a Lil slow but everything else mgm had to offer is amazing

Beds and linens still good - check.
Staff still accomodating - check.
VP pay schedules still meh - check.
Great strip view from the room - check.
Room TVs still old with very few channels - check.
Best way to make a long night fade away - go to the amazing pool complex (yeah, the area where there are no kids), have one of the pretty waitresses bring you a few jello shots and a fruity, icy cocktail and get a poolside mini-massage!  Made a new woman out of me....
MGM - still a fan, yes I am!

Worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Been here for 2 days and haven't been able to sleep at all. The beds are uncomfortable, the pillows suck, and the walls are paper thin. Ive been hearing the neighbors next door which seems to be a zoo full of monkey. It's impossible to sleep.
