The wallpaper is peeling (I mean, really?) -we can overlook this but it just added to the disrepair of the room. 
To go back to sleeping in the dark: the blinds were broken and wouldn't close all the way. You're in vegas. You should have working blinds!  Blackout preferred! 

We ended up going to the front desk to see if we could change rooms or at least get things fixed. It started really well with a very kind woman at the desk but  unfortunately, she passed us up to a manager who was rude and unaccommodating. He said he had no rooms outside of the west wing (fine, they're busy. I can understand that) and the only other rooms would cost us 200 more per night. We clarified that we should not have to pay so much just to have a working room. We explained we would at least like the issues to be addressed even if they didn't have another room available for us.  He was rude and didn't want to fix any of the problems in the room. He eventually caved and said he'd have things looked at....which never happened. 

It's extremely disappointing to go from great every single visit to such awful service and room quality. 


We'll be looking at other hotels from now on.

My friends and I came up with a drunk nickname for our hotel by the end of the Vegas trip... MGM BLEAH!  Okay, it wasn't that bad, but there were a few annoying moments.

For the most part, we received really friendly service at the front desk (+); however, we ended up spending way too much time at the front desk in the first place, because of MGM's mistakes (-).  We checked in really late, and were told our original rooms were not available that night (we just booked a regular room with two doubles)... as a result, we were getting a MAJOR upgrade to a two bedroom, two bathroom suite (++++).  This was great luck, and the suite was just baller...double doors entrance, bathtub with jets and 3 showers, etc.  

However, we were told that we had to switch rooms the next day.  The woman told me this at check-in, and that I could come in at any time the following day to receive my new keys.  But the following morning, I receive an annoying phone call informing us that we had to be out of the suite immediately... no communication there between customer service employees.  I had to tell them that we were told we could check into the new room at any time, and the woman on the phone just said "Oh, okay"...overall, it was all just a hassle.  I get that we were getting a free upgrade so we should be appreciative, but it was just inconvenient to have to take the time and move our stuff to another room because of overbooking on MGM's part.  Also, the regular room we moved into was mediocre at best.  Walls were very thin, rooms smaller than expected, no full couch.

I probably walked 5 miles total going back and forth between our rooms and the front desk...first, they gave us the wrong keys, then the keys demagnetized, etc.  To compensate us for our troubles, they offered us free late check-out and complimentary buffets.  But then the rude employees at the buffet told us we couldn't use our comp!  At the end of our trip, we just said f*** it, let's go to In-n-Out.

Overall, I got tired of having to deal with the service people at MGM Grand.  I would have preferred to just check-in, and that be that.  The suites are really nice, but the regular rooms just mediocre.  The hotel is located in the middle of strip but not particularly close to any of the nightclubs, so we had to cab everywhere.  I probably wouldn't stay here again unless it were ridiculously cheap.

Upon checking out of the hotel, we were told there was no sign of any of the spoilings offered the day before. He had to talk to a manager for about ten minutes before coming back and saying they would honor it, but he said it as if it were a big imposition. We didn't ask for the nice things offered to us; we felt lucky to receive them, in fact. Then we were made to feel as if we were trying to pull a fast-one. Completely changed our thoughts on returning.

I'm not just throwing up five stars. I sincerely believe they deserve them. I have stayed here  many times and I can honestly say that I've never had a bad stay. They've always gone above and beyond. Even my very first trip and stay they were GREAT! On that same trip (my first one) I went to check out and get my bill and the lady says to me Mr.Thrasher your room has been compt and proceeded to give me a card with a number on it and told me to call the next time I was planning on coming . From that day on I have yet to pay for a room there and you might be thinking *oh yeah, they give away rooms all the time. Their the cheap-o rooms though* but not true. In fact I walked in to my room on my 2nd trip and my jaw dropped in amazment . It was big and beautiful. Way more then I had ever expected. As far as the staff , I was to busy doing what you're suppose to be while in vegas , enjoying myself to really have the need to gripe or nit pick to them about anything. So the dealers , front desk lady and someone on the other end of the phone for room service were all I had the need to talk too and each one was fantastic. Like I said I've been many times and since that first stay I've never felt the need or want to stay anywhere else. They've always took really good care of me. Thank you  MGM

The check in girl has some serious attitude, but we got an upgrade so I was immediately happy. 

We also received free late check out till 3, which helped our hang-overs. 

The pool's and lazy river are really lush - I would love to live there forever.  The room service food was delicious and super quick. Everything was good, nothing to complain about here. 

ahh, the lions thing, not cool - better off in the wild.

Clean rooms, but value and service are lacking.

I booked a Grand Tower room for several nights in Vegas and about the only thing I was pleased with is the room itself. It was very clean and everything was in decent working order. For this, three stars is fair as the room was not luxurious or top-notch by any means. Just a standard room.

Mobile check-in has potential but is annoying. You're supposed to be able to walk in, scan your QR code, get your room keys out of the machine, and walk away without any human intervention. However, there was a lady hovering around the area who insisted on getting involved and asking me to repeat answers to questions, etc. She also wrote the wrong room number in my key folder that caused me confusion when I got up to the floor. Her involvement in the process made it worse.

The casino is pretty dirty (cleaning staff ignore messes, piles of ashes sitting on gaming machines, etc.), it's hard to get drink service, and there are a lot of annoying drunk people on the floor. I also noticed on Friday night that there are a lot of "ladies of the night" skulking around looking for marks, and the staff seemingly doesn't have a problem with allowing this (or they aren't trained to recognize it; a problem either way).

Overall I don't think you get what you pay for at this hotel. NYNY across the street is cheaper and about the same level of service. Staff needs training and facilities need updating.
Room was great. I feel well taken care of. I ordered a steak medium  rare and it was well done. They fixed the issue very quick. Thank you for making my stay very enjoyable.

Im not even sure where to begin with how bad of an experience we had at the MGM Grand. I was beyond excited to stay at this hotel and I just left feeling angry. 

1) To start with they did not have the room that we had reserved with a deposit when we arrived for checking. The clerk apologized and said she would upgrade the room for us. I said that's great but we requested a wheelchair accessible room for a reason and the "upgrade" room wasn't accessible. So we had to wait around at 2am while housekeeping rushed to get a room read for us.

2) We get to the room and it was rather small but after getting in from such a late flight we didn't care. The next morning I start to unpack our things and the entire closet smells horribly of weed....more on this point later.

3) I turn the water on to brush my teeth and there is no hot water....ok what ever cold water works, right?....Until I run the shower for 20 minutes and still cant get hot water in the room. 2 hours later engineering comes in and replaces our hot water valve and then says oh just let it run it will work now. It took me calling the front desk and engineering multiple times to get someone to come fix our hot water and we have lost half of the day.

4) Leaving we saw housekeeping working on the room next to ours and though "oh good, they will do ours next".....we come back early the next day and housekeeping never came. I call my friends at the front desk again very upset about this and they were just like well did you have the do not disturb sign on the door? I said no and not only that we saw them next door to us as we were leaving so there was no reason for them to not clean our room. So they sent up towels and agreed to have the manager call me at 11AM because of how upset I was over our visit.

5) So it is now 11:40 am and no call from the manager. I call the front desk and ask for the manager myself since it was too much for them to call me. I tell her everything once I get a hold of her and she does the same routine of asking if the do not disturb sign was on the door and then offers me an air freshener to get rid of the smell of weed in the closet. Seriously? This is your solution? I paid over $1K for a 4 night stay to be offered a car air freshener to get rid of the smell of weed in our closet? No hot water, no housekeeping, no club writs bands for free entry that is supposed to come with our Mlife membership cause the room that had them was locked. On top of everything I bring up that I was supposed to receive a call at 11AM and the manager tells me that yeah she sees that in the notes.....So the manager was notified to call me but just didn't give enough of a $%&* to follow through. I also had to fight tooth and nail to get them to refund the resort fees.

Final Thoughts: I wont be back. We have already booked another week long trip for work and to catch a show in April and MGM Grand just lost that reservation to another hotel.

I once spent five consecutive days inside of the MGM Grand without ever leaving the premises AND I enjoyed every bit of it! Impressive, right?! (I am not a hermit, this place seriously just has it all!)

I've had many business trips to Vegas (40+ days in Vegas last year) and MGM definitely is on my top hotel list. Why? It has everything I could ever want. The rooms are modern, comfortable, clean, and spacious. Wifi, great TV, and the cardio room are all included in the resort fee. While these aren't necessary for a crazy Vegas time, they definitely make the stay more comfortable. 

What really makes this place top-notch is the variety of dining and entertainment. 

There is an excellent combination of restaurants- everything from fast food and pizza to top-rated restaurants. It was great! I was able to save some cash on breakfast and lunch so I had more money for the fun stuff. As for entertainment, there are shows, a beautiful pool, places to drink, gamble, and the kind of people watching only Vegas could offer.

The hotel has a very young and fun feeling. If I was bringing a bunch of friends out,  MGM Grand would be my top choice. My stay was excellent.

We have a room on the grand tower side of the hotel. Newly remodeled. Rooms are very nice and clean. Staff has been great. There is a great compliment of food options ranging from a food court to higher end options (Wolfgang Puc and Emerils). Plenty of tables and slots. 3 pools plus an event pool with DJ. also several shows: Cirque De Sole KA, JabberWakee Dance show and Brad Garret's comedy show. It does lack an overall theme compared to other hotels and is aged, but we would return.

It was our first time to vegas. We upgraded our room to a spa suite. The hotel seemed nice and the staff helpful. Our room was nice except for the spa. It had not been cleaned and was slimy with hair in the bottom. There was a dent  in the ceiling and a big white stain on the wall. I'm sure you can guess what it was. Disgusting. We went to the lobby and told the manager. They were very understanding. They waived the resort fees for the trip and gave us $50 in resort credit. They sent a cleaning crew and said it would be clean before we got back from dinner. When we got back the tub was clean but not the stain. So back to the lobby we went to complain. They apologizes and gave us another $125 in resort credit. We then met the floor supervisor and showed him the stain which he had promptly cleaned.  They need to have their cleaning crews do a better job.

Excellent location.  Huge Resort, Casino, Pool, dining selection within (but u shouldn't limit yourself) and great entertainment options.  

Resort rooms are ok, large and comfortable.  But you can find that anywhere in Vegas.  Price may be an issue for Friday & Saturday nights.  

Don't forget it's Vegas and lots & lots of walking (night\/day) even if you're not planning on leaving the resort.  Why rent a car?  Unless you're there for biz.  If you share cab fares you'll save more and not run the risk of end up on Cops, Taxi Cab Confessions is more likely...  jeje

Did not do Studio 54 but Tabu was great, sexy\/hot and some stargazing is possible although pricey drinks for Vegas.  Great Dancers up on the stages\/tables but it can get a bit crowed at peek 12mid + pretty much every night, they close Tuesdays.   Check them out: http:\/\/www.mgmgrand.com\/nightlife.

I did not know the $20 trick, I'll try it next time cuz I'm coming back to the MGM Grand.  Thanks Michael P!

Yelp's 365 Review Challenge 2014 #138 - #365

One word to describe MGM GRAND and that is "MASSIVE!" That's right, this hotel and casino is one of the biggest hotels on the strip and formally in the world until the hotel in Thailand broke the record. This formally housed the, Wizard of Oz theme from 1993 - 1999 and ended it because the studio sold the rights to the movie. The only thing left that resembles the theme is the Emerald skin on the MGM hotel tower. 

Valet here takes forever to park and the registration area is huge! The check in clerk was pleasant and gave the upgrade skit as every other clerk I've encountered. We in the Grand Tower and it took about 5-8 minutes to get to the elevator from the lobby. Our room overlooked Excalibur, Luxor, Tropicana, and Mandalay Bay. The room was completely renovated and was impressed with the furnishings, floor to ceiling windows, comfy beds, and a high tech area to charge your gizmos. 

The casino is just as massive as the hotel and casino you can easily get lost unless you can read the signage. Pool is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel room and is layed out on a grand scale. Sadly, the lion exhibit is gone and replaced by TAP, Studio 54 is now Hakkasan, and they now have a 24\/7 café, called Avenue 24. 

Staff here are very friendly and most are all smiles. I did have a pleasant experience here it's just too big for my taste. Preferably I would stick with my home base hotel, the Mirage. MGM is nice to visit, I just wouldn't want to stay here again in this ginormous cluster!

The Mirage FTW!!

We stayed at this hotel a month ago for the WFG convention. We had a suite but we were totally disappointed. 
The room was dark, the carpet was musty & stained. The TV should be in the museum. The web bar drainage was clogged. The fridge is not cold, we can hear some weird noises coming through some pipes in the wall at night ... 
We went to the advertised Happy Hour, and after a long wait to be seated, we were only then told the Happy Hour is only for the bar area. 
The pools are nice but I got ripped off at the pool bar. I bought one of those huge margaritas (totally diluted down to sugar water) and was told I could get free refills; of course I found out the truth the next day when I went back for the refills.

I guess I am not the best person to review a Los Vegas hotel because I don't gamble, drink heavily, stay up late, overspend, overeat, and I am frugal. The hotel is your typical big-name casino hotel. 

Pros:
Complimentary fitness center with your "Stay-Well" room
Free apples and granola bars and water in the fitness center
The curtains in the stay-well rooms make the room pitch dark 24\/7

Cons:
Starbucks and every other restaurant has literally jacked up their prices by something ridiculous. My regular latte which is $2.95 at starbucks was $6 out the door here.
No coffee makers in the rooms
No microwave\/mini fridge in rooms
Long lines for EVERYTHING. If you aren't going to have coffee makers in rooms, you shouldnt make people wait in line for 45 min at starbucks!
Pool is so crammed you can't even see the water

You get what you pay for... but that isn't always a bad thing.

There are nicer hotels on the strip that I prefer to stay at.  However, if I'm looking to do it on the cheap or those hotels are booked out, MGM Grand is just fine.  Their cheapest room is a little too small for me - felt like I was in a cheap cruise ship room.  The $20 upgrade from the grand tower is well worth it!

I just sleep here - I haven't done the whole pool thing or treated it like a resort so I can't speak to that.  It does house the Craftsteak restaurant which does have the greatest steak I've ever eaten, so that's something in the win column.

You want to do the Vegas strip on a budget, MGM is a good option.

I belong to an organization that holds one of their two annual conferences at the MGM Grand every fall.  I generally try to save a few bucks and stay off site but, thought I'd give the MGM a try this year. I wasn't disappointed.  

With over 5,000 room, this place is enormous!  It is spotlessly clean and the rooms are good sized and very nicely decorated.  Each and every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful. The service is top notch. 

There aren't many hotels with offerings so numerous that it's practically an entire vacation under one roof. With such a wide variety of things to do and see at the MGM Grand, don't be the least bit surprised if it takes more than one visit to experience it all. I know there are parts of the hotel I missed.  While large, the hotel is pretty well organized and easy to find your way around.

The pool area is pretty amazing. The lobby bar is a great spot to people watch, especially later at night.  Drinks aren't cheap but, nothing is in Vegas 

The choice of restaurants is varied.  From high end (think $200 or so for one) to McDonald's at the food court.  

Self and valet parking is free. Be sure to take advantage of the airport check in and beat the line at the hotel. They will also check your bags for you upon departure for a nominal fee. 

The only negative comment I have is that the wireless Internet service (which you pay for in your resort fee) is as bad as I've experienced at any hotel.  When traveling for business, this is important to me and the MGM fails badly here.

Rates vary dramatically depending on the day of the week, time of the year or current promotion so, it pays to shop around.  I've stayed at a number of hotels in Vegas and would place the MGM near the top of my list on a price vs. value scale.
The MGM never disappoint$. :)

First time in Vegas and decided to stay at MGM because a friend of mine suggested it. What a good choice. It's a perfect location because it's at the beginning of the strip so u could just walk up and down as opposed to starting in the middle of the strip. 

I had booked a regular room and upon check in the lady asked if we wanted to upgrade for $30 a night. I'm glad we did. The room was decently sized, and we had found out the room we originally booked was 100 square feet smaller! The overall room was nice though, clean, everything looked modern and new. Our view sucked though. 

Went to hakkasan on Friday night for calvin Harris and Sunday night for dada life. Would def recommend this club. Would def stay here again.

I expected a little more from the room. My blanket and pillow had blood on them. I threw them on the floor and used my own personal blanket and pillow. This was one time I was glad we were on a road trip and had them readily available. Other than that issue. The stay was pretty good. I was there for a concert. It was nice to be able to just walk right upstairs when the concert was over. The buffet was actually pretty good. All you can eat crab legs. The person at the desk checking me in was very nice and helpful. You do have to pay for parking if you drive in. Its not expensive though. Overall, had my room been a little cleaner, the stay would've been perfect.

I belong to their Reel Access Club so me and the Mr get some great deals from here.. this last time was 79 weekend and 59 weekday a night.. for the quality of the hotel to some of the best places on the strip to eat its a real treat staying here. Plus going to the LV Convention Center is a cinch with the monorail. I wouldn't stay anywhere else but here when I'm working at the convention center. 

Be sure to get Grand Tower rooms.. the West Wing rooms bathrooms are way to small!
You would think with  the thousands of people departing for the airport they would have an organized system, but no, there is complete chaos. It took over 30 minutes to get a ride.

Beautiful resort. One of the more well known casinos. I didn't actually stay here, just gambled a bit and walked around. I think next time I'm definitely gonna stay here. They bathrooms are super clean!

Even though we usually are more selective about where we stay, we picked MGM for our last minute trip because of the good price and the option to go to Wet Republic. 

When we got here, The line to check in was long and slow. But once we got that taken care of, we only encountered helpful and friendly staff from that point forward. We walked around and couldn't find our way to our room, and there are actually people around to help!

MGM being one of the "older" hotels on the strip, we only hoped for a clean place to stay. We we were surprised that, although the decor is simple, the room DID NOT smell like a hotel room (not even like a stinky Vegas room!), and was clean. Decent bed linens and pillows. 19" regular ol' tv. Bathroom counter top that would fit 2 women getting ready at the same time. Normal shower\/bathtub. 

No bells and whistles but good enough to call it home for 2 days!

I only gave it 3 stars because I feel like every hotel on the strip needs to at least have a flat screen and mini bar or fridge. This room did not. Also, albeit clean with marble floors and accents, the bathroom showed the age of the hotel, as it clearly had not been updated very much at all. 

Overall clean, good location, nice staff. I wouldn't mind coming back again if I was seeking a good deal.

Who though that I and my lady would ever stay at this fine hotel? I sure didn't think so & we did and enjoyed it! 
It's a palace. It is close by the airport. The check-in and Concierge along with the baggage hold do offer very good service. Everyone gave us a VIP treatment and I sure was not expecting that much. 
Food courts within as well as fine dining. Not much for the dancing scene here but it was well decent. 
Located rite on the strip. They offer promotions so check on that before making your reservation. I would love to return here again.

What a tired, sad excuse of a formerly good (though never great) hotel.  So many better properties have met the wrecking ball but this behemoth keeps chugging along like a locomotive from hotel hell.  Service woes begin at check in and continue throughout your stay.  Seriously, unless someone else is paying for your stay, you're better off sleeping in your car.

My daughter, myself and her MIL, stayed at MGM West Wing,10th floor.  I would have to say it will be our last time staying there. It was horrible, they are so worried about the money coming in they forgot about the service going out. My daughters MIL, called about her room every hour and every time they said just 15 minutes more. Finally at 5:00 she got her room, when she opened her door the room was disgusting and hadn't been clean, when the housekeeping supervisor finally came after 30 minute wait, he said the room wasn't clean because she needed a room quick, when she asked why she never got her room when promised, which is 1:00 (we had ours at 12:45) they said they weren't told her was a rush job. We went to eat at 6:00 and got back at 7:00 and it was finally clean, she had no trashcans and asked for 1 daily but still didn't have 1 when we checked out. The hotel is filled with moths everywhere, we had to kill at least 10 moths nightly in our room. The reason I gave 2 stars is the beautiful lazy river and the little store right outside our hotel. Just a bad experience and I would advise people to stay elsewhere because it's not worth the hassle for the money.

This place does not care about their customers at all.

We booked a room online, and their website says to show your AAA card at check-in for a discounted rate. Well, when I did just that, the girl at the front desk told me they can't do discounts at the front desk. I asked her where to do it online, and she told me you have to call in to get the discount. I said, "Well, they don't make that clear online." "I guess not", she said, and shrugged her shoulders. 

She put us in a room on the 3rd floor that could have passed as a closet. There was only one tiny window above the bed, the sink was the size of a drinking fountain, and there wasn't even a door into the bathroom. There is no privacy whatsoever. I do not understand why they even have rooms like this!!

On top of that, she did not even bother to tell us that there was construction going on the 1st floor of our wing. It took us half an hour to even find the wing, and then we had to take the only elevator that was open to the 4th floor (it only went up to the 4th floor. Why? I have no idea), and then we had to take the stairs back down to the 3rd floor. Isn't that considered some sort of fire hazard? 

This was the worst experience ever. We talked to three other people before they finally did something about it and "upgraded" us to a normal room. And they tried to make us pay an extra $30 for this upgrade! It took another 15 minutes of negotiating before they brought it down to $10. By that time I was just so over this whole experience. 

I am a long-time MGM customer, since I go to Vegas at least 3 times a year and they own half the hotels there. At this point, I'd rather stay in a Motel 6 than another MGM hotel ever again. 

By the way, I double checked their website and it doesn't say ANYTHING about calling in for the AAA discount. It clearly states to show your membership card during check-in.

About two months ago, I booked two tickets to Andrea Bocelli concert at MGM Grand Arena. Since I thought it'd be convenient to stay at MGM, I also booked a room - king size, non smoking. The prices for two nights were $149 (Friday night), $179 for Saturday night. They charged me $166. When I got there, I was told the room wasn't available. If I wanted, I got "the option" to upgrade (which I'd have to pay for). I got slightly upset, although I never raised my voice. 

I asked why I'm being charged $166 for something I'm not getting and why I was forced to pay for something I don't want? The manager came over and immediately said "She's just doing her job!" No s**t Sherlock! I'm not upset at the receptionist, I'm upset at the situation. Not fair to be charging customer for something he\/she's not getting. On top of that, they place a pending charge on your CC (for me, it was $500 pending charge). 

So they offered comp buffet and $50 off drinks. This is great for someone who eats at buffets and drinks, but I'm not a drinker and I don't eat at buffets, but when I said it to the manager, she said "well, that's your only option." In regards to rooms, they are spacious, clean. The TV was working occasionally, the bathrooms were nicely remodeled. I must say the concert was fabulous!

When I was checking out, I don't know what I was expecting, but I got "how do you wish to pay for your bill" question. This kind of floored me. So the rooms were $328 total minus the $166 charge (this would be around $162 total)+ the upgrade fee. You are already placing $500 charge on my CC, I guess I'm expecting you to say what you are going to give back to me. 

Anyway, long story short, the 2 nights cost me total $502. They charge you for upgrade you didn't want, they also charge your for something called "remodeled room", "remodeled room tax" (these charges are for every day you are staying) on top of your regular resort fee. I'm assuming that is normal, but quite frankly....for $250\/night - it is NOT worth it.

I received a complimentary two nights Im one of there general rooms. The room was nice (average size.) The bathroom is descent too. I love that they have a roulette table that's smokeless (That's rare in vegas.) a little disappointed with some of the Customer service. I was at the table for 5 hours playing 100 bucks a hand (don't worry I was up $$$) and could not get in touch with a host or anything (didn't even have one on staff when I was there.) Not worth playing there. There're no perks for playing there. Did love everything else besides that

The room stunk like smoke even though it was a non smoking room.  They also charge you a resort fee of $25 or so to use their pools and business center. The sad part about that was,  we weren't told that we were being charged.  We left with a very sour feeling of the MGM Grand.  

Also, very low water pressure for shower.

Big hotel, HUGE Lobby.
i hate how the parking lot is so goddamn big and you'll never be able to park close to the elevator or enter the  lobby quickly. this is a downer since the heat in the parking complex is horrible. 

As you enter the lobby, you see a huge lobby of emptiness. huge panoramic looking screens behind the counters displayin commercials of there shows and restaurants. 

I also hate how the place is dark @ all areas. do they have to keep everything so so goddamn dark? it feels like it's nighttime all time when your here. 

another thing that i don't like about this place is that it doesn't have any shopping places. 

i've never stayed in this hotel but i've visited for the buffet, can't really give it high ratings if i haven't stayed in the hotel. i've never experience there service. 3 stars @ best. i prefer venetian, mandalay bay, mirage, bellagio. etc. msot people prefer the newer places, but they are more expensive

MGM, where do I start?

The boy and I always stay at the MGM. We were last there for NYE and it wasn't as terrible as I expected (as in uber crazy drunks, a gazillion people everywhere, etc.)

I love your old school mobster-esque craps dealers! They are pretty friendly and "help you out" as much as they can. True, while the casino is older compared to other hotels on the strip, there is a nice quality to it. I wouldn't say classic...maybe homey? As homey as a casino can get. Does that make me sound like I have a gambling problem?! Moving on...

Personally, I have experienced solid customer service. For New Years we were put up on the 22nd floor overlooking the strip. This is probably because we were nice to the host and the guy next to us who started checking in before us was acting like a whiny b*tch requesting what we had been given. Karma, my friend! Lesson here: be nice to everyone, but especially to those who can hook it up in Vegas! 

The beds are great! Very comfy. If I recall our TV wasn't a flat screen (like that matters) but for those of you TV-freaks out there, be prepared to be taken back to 2000 when the flat screen wasn't standard. The bathrooms are A-OK and IDK what it is about their lavender toiletries, but DAMN! My hair always looks like a million bucks after using them. 

I can't wait to go back! Show me the moneeeeey!

The only reason this is even getting one star is because the staff in charge of the KA Circ de Soleil show was fantastic they were very professional and willing to help . My problem was with the casino and the Lobby Bar. I am disabled and in a wheel chair the bar area is not handicap friendly at all not one of the accessible tables were cleaned the only two available were dirty and covered with glasses two bartenders made eye contact yet no one cleaned off or offered to clear off tables our party decided to leave and take our business elsewhere

In their defense, they agreed to a late checkout and the room was nice. Otherwise, the service in the casinos and the room service was horrible. I asked for more than three managers, just to get a drink (after an hour) at a black jack table. Then we ordered room service. For two expensive drinks, it took more than 45 minutes. When we finally got service, it was great every time. That's the only reason I gave more than one star.

Overall the room was clean and we did have a nice view even though the hotel is located at the end of the strip. However, a few things happened that accounted for the 3 star rating first off the TV did not work, we notified them and they indicated that they would come up and fix it...well a few hours went by and finally at about 1am when we were sleeping..they wake us with a ph call and ask if we want them to come and fix it...of course our answer is No! we are sleeping. The next day my friend calls and speaks to management about the inconvenience, they end up giving us a credit of $50 which we can use before 4pm (our late checkout time) in food or drinks. 2nd issue..it's a little after 3pm and we go to one of the restaurants to order some food, and have it added to our room acct..as they requested us that we do, however, at this point the waiter notifies us that he cannot do that as we have already been checked out of our room, now we have to go walk to the front desk and speak to them so that they may resolve it...we stand there for a total of about 45 min. until they finally resolve the issue and give us the credit...it was just a hassle, and took up our time that we could of spent doing better things.

Stayed there in 2009, the room was old, dark and ugly. If you're planning on staying there, better  to go to Signature MGM, which is much nicer. Just 5 mins walk from the MGM Grand. At least it's at a great location.

Cons:

*Found a razor blade on the bathroom floor upon checking in to our "cleaned" room. Luckily, we saw it before we stepped on it with our bare feet. My mom was quick to pick it up with a napkin and throw it in the trash. We were rushing to get to dinner so we didn't have time to call downstairs and tell them about it until the next day, and they didn't even pretend to care... They brushed it off saying it was too late for them to do anything about it... I don't think they would have cared any more or done anything differently if we called any sooner...  

*We were woken up by a couple fighting very loudly in the hallway... They were out there for a quite a while... I understand Vegas gets crazy, but what little sleep I'm able to get, I'd like to get without hearing people's loud but boring arguments.

*No restock of toiletries when room was cleaned. 

Pros: 

*Spacious room on the strip. 

*Lazy river.

Not much to complain about.  Friendly staff, nice rooms, a huge selection of fantastic restaurants, decent casino, and a great location as the entry to the Strip. I look forward to going back during the warmer months, to try out their pools -- I've heard they are really nice. My only complaint was the slightly rude bellhop that gave me attitude for the tip I gave him.

i love you mgm. everytime i go to las vegas, i'm here for the stay. this place is huge! i always feel like a vip here. i love the top floors, good view, good services, and the room is big. my experience here was awesome! thank you and i will come back again!

been here a few times and always happy to come to a clean room. Check and can be a little chaotic there are usually a long line of people trying to transact at the counter but the process was quick and simple although sometimes the room is not ready and you have to check your bags in storage. I was lucky this time in my room was readyon my arrival. Always a good time.

I always stayed here when I was in high school, we paid $400 for 2 nights and then an extra $200 because our flight was canceled. Our room was so run down and crappy. The first room the bathtub wasn't draining and we had to call someone to fix it, the door knob was broken on the closet- we were up all night because people were stomping around up stairs. Instead of having a bathroom the toilet and shower are seperate by glass and you can see in each. Thank goodness we are married. You have no privacy and the rooms are so old and run down. The hotel is great, but $600 for 3 days is ridiculous. We went to the front desk to complain and the manager couldn't even space 3 minutes to come and speak to us. $100 off $600 and shitty service. $38-60 for 2 people at the buffet that doesn't even serve breakfast food, it's just deep fried crap. Then, the cafe has horrible service and even worse food.  I'm not impressed MGM, we've spent a lot of money here this weekend, but we will not be back to your hotel.  On top of all of that the tv signal is lost about every 10 minutes, granted you aren't in the room much, but relaxing in bed watching TV and not being able to watch one thirty minute tv show is so ridiculous.
Love this place the grand rooms are great. Lots of restaurants.  We come here frequently.

YELP DELETED my entire review when I updated it.   
So I am trying to recreate from memory.

First gave the MGM 1 STAR.  Check in was 45 minutes and this did not look atypical given the queues set up.  One I checked in I realized this hotel in EVERY was was trying to extract more money from me.
    NO fridge.  The had a completely stocked mini bar with items that automatically charge your room if you move them.   I asked if I could have a real fridge - you know the kind Motel 6 or Hampton in has the courtesy to give you complementary.  It would cost me an additional $25\/night.
   NO way to make hot water.  
   NO complimentary coffee.  I had to buy $4 starbucks cups.
In the morning it became apparent they had far to few vendors in the hotels.  LInes for breakfast were at least 30 minutes long - and for overpriced food to boot.

**********************************************

Updating review to two stars, as I now realize the behavior of this hotel is typical for the Las Vegas strip.  

Positives i didn't mention before were they let me connect 4 devices to the wifi and didn't have to reregister wifi each day.  Also price of room was not bad.

The MGM Grand is a great place to visit. An even better place to party. But a lousy place to stay. Booked 5 nights. Checked out after 1. 

Huge disappointment. Check in line was 2 hours. Told by bellman to drop off bags and come back in two hours and it would be gone. Came back in 2 hours and told check in line was now 3 hours. Asserted my dissatisfaction and told I "should have known" before I booked the wait was very long at the MGM Grand. 

However due to unique business circumstances it was imperative I get to my room as fast as possible. I further confronted them about the situation. When that did not work I then raised my voice to the hotel employees. I started cursing and making a scene. I continued to raise my voice. The entire line started starting at me. That got their attention and they immediately moved me to the platinum line for fast check in. 

My room is literally a mile walk from lobby at the farthest end of the hotel. Cheap inadequate insulation means you can hear everyone's conversations on both sides of the room and many doors down in the hall. Internet didn't work. Fought with staff for hours before it worked. Console didn't work. Ethernet line didn't work. Constant noise from street. Ugly bathroom with ugly marble and a small tub. Staff explained they installed "green" shower heads to "save water" (in corporate speak =  save money) so there is wimpy water pressure in shower. 

Fighting with front desk all night. Huge dips in bed. Banged shin on bed foundation. Dangerous edges on bed with marks from drunk people banging shins. Woke up at 3am to mooing in my room. Realized it was just two old fat people having sex next door. "Forced" to hear every drunken disgusting detail (no sound insulation). Last but not least - there were com stains dripping off the corner the bed foundation. How disgusting! I took photographic evidence. . . 

And THAT is what I got for $300\/night.

I gave them a piece of my mind and checked out as fast as possible the next day. I then spent the next four nights at  LUXOR in an amazing room with Jacuzzi overlooking the strip. I will NEVER stay at the MGM Grand again!

My husband and I usually schedule a Las Vegas trip a couple times a year.  In the past we have stayed at Bellagio, Wynn, Cesar's Palace, Luxor and Harrahs. I would say this hotel is comparable to the Luxor. With the exception of the hotel customer service. We originally booked a King room. Upon check in we decided to pay for an upgrade to the newer renovated towers it was a couple hours before check in. The desk clerk said we would call when our room was available. We never received a call so we waited until after check in time. We arrive to our room and it wasn't clean. After waiting 20 minutes we walk into a room with 2 double beds. I call the desk and the clerk was like sorry you weren't told you were upgraded to a room with double beds. She could send us back to the original room I booked in the other tower. I told her I was disappointed. Especially since I paid for the upgrade. She replied with "Well that's your opinion."  Here's my opinion. Don't waste your money for the renovated rooms at MGM. They obviously could care less about customer service.

Our one and only vacation this year so we splurged on a "tower" spa suite. Apparently this more expensive suite is on the third floor over looking the taxi drop off. Umm, hello "tower spa suite" plus extra cost does not equal 30 feet off the ground with a view of taxis and no black out shades!!!! Feeling super ripped off :( we would have been better off at Motel 6. Thanks mgm for ruining our vacation. Of course we bought a package deal rather than booking hotel separately, so no refunds. They won't even give us or money back. We called tried to switch rooms and were told they over booked so other people who paid for tower suites so they had to stay in regular rooms. News flash mgm.... This IS A REGULAR ROOM!!!! This is absolutely not worth the $200 extra we paid.

I checked into the MGM Grand yesterday afternoon for a convention. Due to multiple conventions the hotel is completely booked. The room I have on the first floor is dark and damp with no windows. The lighting is so poor I can't see to put makeup on. I woke up heavily congested, possibly from the dampness of the room. 

When I inquired about changing rooms they said there was a note on my reservation that said  "do not move guest". The reservation was booked more than 3 months ago. 

I have been at the MGM Grand less than 12 hours and I am quite disappointed in the accommodations and the service. I will be here two more nights, and will not be returning in the future.

I do not like that they are charging for valet parking 0-4 hours is $13.00. Your spending your money eating & playing in the casino & then they charge you $13.00 minimum plus the tip you give the valet person, who by the way takes their sweet time getting your car! Bad idea MGM

I would like to review their bar on the floor.  We literally waited for a very long time after watching the bartender grovel at 2 customers and then bypassed my husband and I for prettier girls.  So discriminatory of him.  He didn't deserve a tip.  MGM will never get my business again!!

This is the second time to Vegas and we stayed at the MGM, it was a perfect place to stay located at a good area on the strip.  We enjoyed the pools and the parking is easy to access.  Would stay again.

It gets a five star rating for me primarily because of the pool.  And what a pool it is - the lazy river is a ton of fun.  They also have that "club" pool, Wet Republic, which attracts many a frat boy\/sorority girl.  Honestly one of the best hotel pools on the Strip, very hard to compare.

The MGM Grand is about 15 years old now.  Compared to the surrounding hotels, it's pretty dated.  But it's still a massive draw.  And a massive complex.  It will literally take you a good 20 minutes to walk from the parking structure to your hotel room (ok, maybe exaggerating a little bit - but it IS a bit of a walk.  Tack on an extra 10 for the pool)

The standard rooms are pretty decent; watch out for dirty towels, though, and the housekeeping service knocking at your door at an ungodly hour (at least for Vegas... I mean, 9am?  seriously?)  The beds are quite comfy though.  

There are 3 clubs of note - the aformentioned Wet Republic, Studio 54, and Tabu.  Of the three, we tried to go Tabu, which is considered the "after hours club" - we went at around 3AM on a Sunday, and the place was closed.  How can you be an after hours club when you're closed at 3AM? Granted, it was a Sunday, but still.  LV is the fucking city that never sleeps, just like New York.  What the hell?

Food options are great here - there's a Joel Robuchon restaurant, Tom Colicchio (of Top Chef fame) has both his Craftsteak and Wichcraft restaurants on the premises, and some others here and there.  There's even a food court with Nathan's, McDonalds', etc. in the "Studiowalk" area.

Then there's the lions.  Yep, the freakin' lions.  Whatever.

I still enjoyed this hotel for it's convenient location on the strip.  Will come back again.

I have stayed at this hotel periodically for the last 15 years. This last stay over the weekend will probably be my last time I visit. There was no place suitable to eat in the hotel after 11 p.m.
The only thing open was McDonald's. Nobody eats McDonald's. 
HousekeePing skipped us one of our three days and by the time we got back into the room late night it was too late to call for someone so we just let it go. 

We paid a daily resort fee for amenities. But yet we were charged additional fees to use the treadmills. So ridiculous. Total cheapskates. That is outrageously offensive.

On our last night on Sunday valet wait was over 30 minutes and that was in 107 degree heat. 
Their nightclub Hakkasan should be shut down by the Health Department and fire department immediately. It is a cancer on the mgm brand.

There is no longer anything grand about this property. They run a bare-bones staff and the staff that are there are no longer engaged in customer service.  

We hit the buffet a couple of times but it was overpriced for what you get. They had three aisles of food and every aisle had  identical items. Powdered eggs and bacon in pools of grease. 

Typically in most casinos you can float through the gaming area and hear screams of joy with multiple jackpots being won at different slot machines. Over the 4 days and 3 nights that we were there we never saw one person hit anything big. Not once. 

It is unfortunate that this hotel is nothing more than a oversized Holiday Inn with a Best Western mentality of service. So disappointing.

So since I got to my room two nights ago, I had no hot water, said something and was told it was fixed during the day while I was working. Got back to the room and it was still not fixed. The next evening I called about the hot water and the lady told me to try turning the sink on and the bathtub on at the same time to try and get hot water for the shower. I shouldn't have to do that, and it didn't even work anyway. At this point I just switched rooms because I need hot water. Get to the room and yes I had hot water but the sink and the bath were both clogged and wouldn't drain. On top of that, the towels in the room were stained and disgusting. My wife took the towel down and showed a manager who apologized and said he would refund the resort fees, but I am here on work and the room was provided to me through my employer. Tonight I get back to the room and there is a bath towel with an even bigger nasty yellow stain. I don't recommend this place to anyone choosing where they stay. Very disappointed and I'm still here for 3 more nights. Can't wait to see what I find tomorrow. I have called about a problem every single night.

ok, i realize we got our room off bookit.com for a good price, but this room was unacceptable.  looked nice, clean, comfy bed, but it was so noisy we couldn't sleep.  i think we had the worst location in the place...first floor, west wing, directly at the end of the hallway T off the west wing bar.  at one point, i opened the front door to ask the party in the hall to quiet down, then realized they were outside our bedroom window.  it sounded like someone was dropping rocks in the room above us.  earplugs should come with this room.  better yet, they should turn it into a second west wing public restroom.

we loved centrifuge and the grand buffet.  if it weren't for the noise, i'd be leaving 4 stars.
I stay at Mgm grand on Nov 30 - Dec 4 ,2014.Our room is Stay Well grand queen.We like Vitamin C infused shower and Air Purification in our room.Bed is very comfy.

**CASINO ONLY**

You know...I have never stayed here.  But I sure have given this casino a tidy pile of money over the years.  Still, I enjoy coming here all the time.  The dealers are pretty swell and on this particular occasion, the cocktail waitress was coming back very frequently.  She was nice too.

Also, if you dudes want to treat yourself to something before you blow your wad of dough on gambling, get a shoe shine.  The rumor is that for $10 ($7 plus tip), you can get a million dollar shine.  BEST DEAL ON THE STRIP!

I booked the west wing room and was pretty disappointed. The room was small and had no view being on the 3rd floor. The air was musty and the towels were not clean.The hotel does not provide drinking water and the water on the tap was bad and should be avoided.
There are better hotels on the strip at the same price.

I've stayed here twice, and as the 3 star rating says, it's A-OK.  The regular rooms can be very very cheap and are clean, although no fridge, which is a bummer.  Although I guess it doesn't really matter since most of the Vegas hotels with fridges keep them stocked with overpriced room service items anyway.  

I've stayed in the regular rooms, which, like I said, are fine for a cheap stay on the strip.  I also stayed at the Tower Spa Suite last time and it was very nice.  Tons of space, a large king bed and a pull out queen sofa bed that was comfy enough.  

No fridge yet again and terrible lighting, although that seems to be common in the area.  Why don't Vegas hotels have good lighting in the rooms??  It's so bizarre.  With that being said, the bathrooms at the MGM have THE best lighting for makeup.   Like, I want it in my own place.  

Also the place has fantastic dining options.  I had one of the best meals of my life at L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon.

The room was nice & the staff was friendly.  My friends & I came here for a bachelorette party & planned to stay both days at the pool.  The problem with the lazy river, is that it was not very lazy because jets of water kept hitting you in the face while you were floating.  Don't even try & get in here and not expect to get DRENCHED. Its definitely not relaxing.  The lazy river would have been so fun if those jets weren't on.

A nice casino with a lot to explore but I have a few issues with it. First is the price. It's a little more expensive than nearby casinos and I didn't really feel like the room I got was anything special for what I paid. Second, I'm not a huge fan of the casino's layout. It takes a long time to get from one end to the other and it'll be very easy to get lost if you haven't been here before.

The MGM Arena was also difficult for me to find. The arena is too compacted and therefore the seats aren't too comfortable.

Bed bugs! Let me start with the check in. We got into Vegas around 2pm thinking we were a little early and would have some time at the pool before we hit tables. 
We got to the lobby and check in area and the line was wrapped around 4 or 5 times. It took 2 hours to check in and all the lady checking in said to us was we are short on staff. Parking fees. Resort fees. Your looking at 400$ a night on a weekend at least for a regular room. Then we get to the room. Old out dated. Then comes the night and the creepy crawlers come out to get you. I woke up one night and felt something crawling on my hand. Thought nothing of it went back to bed. When I woke up in the morning I had little bumps all over my hands feet arms and legs. Once again I brushed it off thinking it was something from the pool. Next morning even more bites all over my body. Told the staff about it they said they email security and so forth that all the managers were to busy to help me. They climbed on my luggage and brought them home. I had to have an exterminator come to my house and he told me I picked them up a hotel because they were in my luggage mostly. I suggest you never stay here. Ever! Stay clear. Don't even gamble here! Worst experience ever in Vegas!

This place was horrible.  The room was a deluxe.  No coffee maker.  Dirty bathroom and you can hear people from the rooms on both sides talking.  The water was shut off from 11 AM till 4PM with no notice up front.  We went into the room after gambling all night to get a voice mail at 4 AM.  The manager was rude and disrespectful,  We had not used the room but, she refused to refund if we left.  She lied and said the hotel was fully booked and when we told her the clerk said there were rooms available she said, "Oh, that was nice of her."  What a joke.

Tried to save a buck.  You get what you pay for.  Low rates = Low class service.  Motel Six MGM!  Never go budget again!

While the MGM Grand is a huge hotel that has a lot to offer, they obviously lack a certain attention to detail. We had 4 rooms here for our friend's birthday for 3 nights and we all noticed the little things that MGM lacked that other hotels had.

1. There is 1 ice machine per floor. Seeing as there is 150+ rooms per floor, it was not surprising that the machine could not keep up. When we called down to the front desk to let them know, they initially argued that a tech would look into the issue. After some time, they finally agreed to send up a "complimentary" bucket of ice. Glad that staying in a suite, they could shell out for ice for us! The bucket arrived one hour later.

2. One of the worst sportsbook\/cashier setups I have experienced. We bet on March Madness and when we tried to cash in our tickets after dinner, the sportsbook was closing so they said to check in with cashier. When we got there, they said we couldn't cash in our tickets until 1130. Seeing as how we were going to bet the tables we didn't mind at the time. When we came back at midnight, they said come back at 130. We came back then and they said come back at 330. Finally at 330 they admitted that their ONE machine to cash in sports bets was not working. Really ONE machine for a casino this big? Almost makes me wonder if they purposely try to discourage you from cashing in bets.

3. We got a suite so we would have a place to watch the March Madness games. Unfortunately the cable constantly cut out (at least 6 times during Kansas\/Michigan game).

4. Shower drains at extremely slow rate so plan on standing in your dirty water throughout your shower.

5. When using the iron on the first night, it spewed brown water all over my shirt. Not sure if it was from previous starch or just old water but was nice to start the trip with a stained shirt.

6. There are no lights besides 4 lamps in the 2 bedroom suite. They had a weird spotlight in the corner that was more for show than anything but you really were walking around in the dark, well unless you opened your shades and wanted to get blinded by green lights on outside of hotel.

7.  The suite is pretty nice but lacks certain features that other hotels has. We were looking for the mini fridge to put some stuff in and found out that it's a $35 charger per night to have a fridge.

8. There advertising is deceiving. Yes, every casino now charges you resort fees without any choice, but it's annoying that they say you have free Wi-Fi when you are paying an extra $30\/day in resort fees to cover that. And don't even think about using the business center unless you want to take out a loan.

We've been coming to Vegas annually for past 10 years and stayed at a number of casinos including Treasure Island, Mirage, NY NY, and Aria. This was the first time we stayed at MGM Grand and while it's obvious they have done some upgrades, overall I wasn't impressed, especially for the price. Next year's trip we will be staying elsewhere.

This place is massive and when you check in its more confusing than a French fry in ur onion ring order at bk (how did that get in there). Let's be honest once u check in the room it is only there for sleep, shower and maybe a little boom boom. All I was looking for was it to be clean, which it was.  The hotel itself you can get lost in. We had meetings here which were completely on the otherside which made a great workout. Speaking of workout, the gym was tiny. For the amount of rooms this place has I have a better home gym. Some advantages are that this place has a McDonald's, Nathan's, several bars lounges and a very large casino floor. I say those fast food places are an advantage because at 3am no need to search the strip for a quick bite. It's right here. Otherwise this place is ok. I wasn't all that impressed.

We stayed here for our group's Vegas trip. We got a special deal for 3 nights from Hotwire and got a suite. The suites here run small - surprisingly small. It's just a regular room size (1 king or 2 queens) and that's pretty much it. Lame if you ask me. And for all the people in our room, they still only gave us 1 king and kinda ignored our 2 queens request. 

The hotel is nice. As an old Vegas hotel, it's pretty kept up and not lame looking like the others. It is no longer in the prime Vegas strip location. It was like 15 years ago but now the prime location is by TI and Venetian. 

Love their lazy river in the pool area. That was real nice and we spent a good part of the afternoon there. 

Love that they have a Fat Tuesday in their hotel. 

Their concierge, front desk, and room service are all nice and efficient. Although they bring up the requests kinda slow but we didnt urgently need anything so that was ok. 

Try 'wichcraft - a sandwich place here. It's so good.

I was very disappointed with MGM Grand Hotel in Las Vegas. I originally requested a room without feather beddings due to severe allergies. My husband and I entered the room and in 15 minutes my nose started getting stuffy and itchy. I was perfectly fine prior to entering the room. First thing I checked were the pillows. Felt them and got poked. Opened it and lo and behold feathers galore. Called the front desk and they sent  someone to change the beddings. It helped a bit, but as long as we remained in the room, my nose remained  stuffy. Another issue was mold in the shower. A no no for a highly allergic person. We never expected this from MGM. Thank you, MGM for the most unpleasant stay in your hotel. 

I failed to also mention that there were bed bugs. My son came home with bites all over his arms and legs. 

The standards of the MGM Grand Hotels have gone down the drain. The hotel makes so much money yet they can't keep the showers clean and spray the beds and room regularly.

This behemoth of a hotel is nice, but starting to show her age. Valet is awkward. Everything is incredibly far apart. I mapped my walk from one end of the hall to the other, it was .3 miles and took 4 minutes at a very brisk pace! 15 minutes to get to the pool from my room, and over half a mile away. Main pool is closed for the season, but when you book your room, it is still being advertised as an amenity. While there is a pool available, it is so far away, and down so many corridors, you will give up before you get there. You have to 'run the gauntlet' through shops. There is no logical layout. No sense to this massive space. However, it is quite clean. Courteous and friendly staff. Prompt service when we had an issue. Relatively affordable, and the best location in Las Vegas.

So Over rated and over priced. The room and amenities were ok. The pool was nice but service pool side is extremely slow. Beverages were overpriced $9 for a  beer at the pool.  My room key stopped working one day for no reason and I had to go all the way back to the front desk. The restaurants on the premises are over priced. But really irked me is the $142 charge for the mini fridge for items I never consumed, yes I may have moved them but to be charged for something I never consumed or took home is ridiculous. There is many choices for your hotel stay in Vegas and MGM is one I would not recommend.

Stayed for 2 nights in the worlds second largest hotel. We opted to stay in the executive king suite. It wasn't really much more than a standard room. It was great! We had a nice, very spacious room with a great view. I especially like the automatic blinds and decor. It was very clean and comfortable. They also have free internet, but at 1mb, it's a little slow at times. Enjoyed the room and the casino very much. We will be back!

I may be partially bias in this review because I stayed here during the World Championship Rodeo, so you may want to take that into account a bit. 
This place is uh-mazing!!! There are a plethora of restaurants, entertainment options, and so much more here! You can even go watch TV shows and get paid for it! HAKKASAN is the bomb.com here as well! That was probably the best night club in vegas willing that Pure was not having a party or famous DJ there. I will definitely stay here again! I used to stay at the Cosmopolitan, mainly because of past referrals, but MGM knocks the Cosmo out of the water for a far less price! If you want more relaxation go to the Cosmo, but MGM is where the party is!

Just an okay experience for what used to be a premier hotel to stay in Las Vegas 20 years ago. The standard room was clean, but the restroom was a major inconvenience. It is located right outside of the front door and there is nothing to separate the room itself with the restroom. I pray for groups of people that are sharing the room. Be prepared to be very intimate with whoever you are staying with as you will be able to hear every fart that is made.

The cleaning staff also completely ignored the fact that we had our Do Not Disturb sign up on the morning that we were supposed to check out. They were banging on the door at 9 for room service. In addition to that, they were being very obnoxiously loud while cleaning the other rooms along the hall.

AMAZING SHOW!!! Seeing a David Copperfield show has always been on my to do list.  During this visit to Vegas, I finally got tickets stage side (amazing). I could literally touch the stage and got a few high fives in with David during the show. All seats are great as he is very interactive and is in the audience during nearly half of the show. There are no bad seats, if in the farther sections that are cheaper, your chance of becoming part of the show is greater because he throws items in the audience to get random participants selected, sitting next to the stage eliminates that possibility.   Well, worth the price.  For those who are drinkers, you must purchase drinks prior to entering the show, there is no option to purchase anything.  Also, cell phones will be locked up during the show so get your calls and texts in before entered but the entire process is made into the show and that is awesome!!

I went for Valentine's day in 2008 and because I'm a modern & contemporary kinda guy, this modern & contemporary kinda hotel was my kinda place :) The room was flossy with all the glitz & glamour you'd expect: Stainless steel, Glass, Stone, TV in the mirror, flat screens, sexy walk in shower, a view, etc. Really good for setting a romantic mood if that's what your goal is.
The restauants and shops are handy, parking is free & of course the gambling is there for those that's into that kinda thing (me).  If you're looking for a nice place to stay off the strip, this is one of the best.

When I checked in speaking with Carmen and promised view of strip with upgraded room. That did not happen. We received view of back of MGM. Very disappointed. Here with my parents and wanted them to enjoy there stay. Refrigerator was stocked with beverage and snacks overpriced. 2.5oz Pringles, Smart water  $8.00 . Room was dirty. Candy rapper's in nightstand,  mildew on shower ceiling. Not good for me. We will not be coming back.

Just based on the name's reputation, I thought the MGM would be the place to be on the strip. I was wrong. Besides the fact that our hot water didn't work the four nights we were there (even after they sent a tech to fix it), our TV went out for a night, our phone would only dial to the front desk instead of directly to other service areas, the location isn't ideal. I would have much rather stayed somewhere closer to the middle of the strip, like the Cosmo or Aria. The casino dealers were the rudest people around, and when we inquired about this at other casinos they told us that the MGM had a reputation for this. Thought I went to the front desk 3 times to complain about our accommodations, the manager never came out to speak to me. It was always the receptionist running out back to "talk to the my manager and see what we can do". At the end, and only after arguing with them, they waived the resort fee, though a night or two should have been comped. If I return to the strip, I won't be staying at MGM.

I want to thank the MGM Grand hotel, staff & events for giving me the WORST 3 days, of my life.

Arrived Friday night to a huge line and less than half of the kiosks with an employee to check you in. On a Friday night? EDC weekend? We weren't the only patrons to feel irritated.

The front desk clerk was nice, and offered us a room upgrade for $10 a night, after seeing the photos, we agreed. Oh & don't forget about the $33 extra dollars a night, resort fee after the immense bill you've already paid for your room.

We finally get to our room, and I had to call the front desk to make sure we weren't given the original smaller room we had booked first, because the room was TINY, no couch like the pictures, and I would hate to see what a smaller room looks like. While I must say, the room decor and bathroom were superb, the room itself was not. The bed was comfy, the pillows were awful.
The joke of the century is the fact that you don't have a coffee maker, microwave or anything - but oh wait, you do have a fridge that can only be opened by code for $25 a day!?!!! What the hell is that. Why not just make it empty, and charge the fee if you want mini bar service? Went downstairs to buy 2 medium water bottles and a small Sprite - $15+?!?!?!!? Are you kidding? 
The maid came only one of the 3 days, had to call twice for someone just to bring towels!!

The buffet - you always hear about the Las Vegas buffets, and i remember them growing up. The buffet at the MGM is a single step up from hometown buffet, it was awful. 

Now the kicker - our first technical day in Vegas, we bought tickets to see Calvin Harris at the hotel night club, and tickets to a pool party with Tiesto the DJ. 
One drink each later, five hours of missing memory, and my boyfriend in the hospital, our items missing, and two drugged drinks. Yes, the stories you hear in movies about Vegas - can happen. & while I do not blame the MGM themselves for this travesty, because it was neither there fault, nor ours - it was a horrendous experience. We apologize from the bottom of our hearts for the scene we caused on whatever was slipped in to our drinks, and for however inappropriate we treated the security staff. We are hardworking young parents, and feel violated for not having control of our actions.
we never got our money back for the show at the nightclub, we lost our belongings, our memories, and our money. We stayed in our hotel room the next two days, except to play one casino game, and to eat. The worst experience of my life, and MGM Grand will forever have the worst taste in my mouth.

Great hotel!  The staff is very professional and friendly.  The room was very clean and had a new feel to it.  The casino is great because it is not too busy and they have newer machines.  The location could be better but still pretty close to the center of the strip.

Stayed for 5 days here. Got a good deal with flight package and they threw in some Cirque de Soilel tickets. The staff at the concierge and front desk were courteous and helpful. Our room wasn't available until 3pm and we checked in at 9am, but they were kind enough to stash our luggage until our room was ready. Smelled like perfume trying to cover up smoke, but what do you expect from a casino in Vegas. 

Spent that time getting to know the hotel and casino. As with pretty much any of the large casino's, be sure you have good walking shoes. It seemed to go on for miles. There was enough in terms of food and entertainment that you wouldn't have to leave the hotel if you opted. 

Did alot of gambling on the poker machines located at each bar stool, mainly because I could drag out $20 for a few hours on .25 bets and get comp beers. As far as the rest of the casino, it had pretty much every kind of slot and table you could ask for. There were a few trendy clubs there too, but not my thing so couldn't tell you what they were like. Also skipped the buffet. 

Just got a regular room, but it was plenty nice and the bed was very comfy. We were on the 26th floor overlooking mostly the airport, but you could see Tropicana, Excalibur, Luxor, and Mandilay Bay. I would've preferred to be on the other side of the hotel to get a view of the other side of the strip at night. 

One of the better points was a lion habitat. They had one male and two females that were on display for most of the day. 

Quite a walk to the other side of the strip or Fremont St., but buy an all day ticket on the Deuce bus that runs up and down the strip and at least you can sit in some air conditioning getting to your destination. 

I can't say I'd be completely loyal to this hotel when I return to Vegas, pretty much depending if I get a better deal elsewhere, but I definitely wouldn't mind. Having checked out most of the other big casinos there, I think this is nicer one.

My friends and I stayed at the MGM Grand two weeks ago, and it was not as great as I expected. It was average, nothing extravagant. For $210 per night, I expected more than average.  

Upon entering, my friends and I had to walk a great deal. Checking in and out was a long process. Even though it wasn't crowded, it took a long time. The lobby area is huge, spacious, and has nice decor. In fact, you can practically get lost. The staff was kind and courteous. Housekeeping was so prompt and always available daily ... a bit too available. Sometimes they just knock once, and as I go to open the door, they already let themselves in ... which I'm not a big fan of. Next, the rooms were not as spacious as I expected, just average. It's a bit small, and plain. However, some perks are ... the pool is gorgeous, and is an also great place to relax. You get a 15% discount to shows and spa services. And the shuttle ($6 per person) is located right outside of the hotel, and can take you straight to the McCarren International Airport. 

Overall, I'd give the hotel three stars. It was a nice experience staying at the MGM Grand. But next time, I rather stay at The Mirage or Mandalay Bay.

Okay Yelp, I apologize; I know, I've been bad. I've neglected you for weeks. But I'll make it up to ya, I return baring gifts of reviews--Just in time for Christmas. 

The first & last time I was in Vegas was when I was about 16 years old with my family for one day. I've always always always wanted to go back after always hearing my friends talk about going to Vegas with their families for the weekend ever since--so jealous that I couldn't even though it was but a 5hr drive from home. 

Boyfriend and I had planned a trip to Vegas since we turned 21 earlier this year; We never got the chance until the middle of winter Dec. 14-17th. 

MGM had a deal going on and we decided to take advantage. When we arrived, Ryan somehow worked his charm and got us bumped up into the 13th floor of the West Wing with Strip views; Really nice. 

--Down comforter covered KING sized bed 
--Two TV's, one embedded in the mirror in the bathroom area 
--Phone next to the toilet; very tempting to call people while peeing. 
--Pretty nice view of Excalibur & New york, New york
--West Wing bar! 
--Really friendly housekeeping staff

I really don't have any other frame of reference when it comes to Vegas hotels, but the "weekend" was fun while staying here. Winning money and losing it three hours later... I miss Vegas. 

Thanks to a tip from research online, our room was less than $60 a night. I enjoyed our stay here, I can't wait to come back!

Obviously, I knew coming in to it that this is an older hotel and I did not have high expectations. I want to start off by saying that they really need to create a better valet service - it took us over thirty minutes to get our car after we checked out. The bathrooms in this place are old, dingy, and plain terrible. The shower and tub we had was broken; the water would get stuck going down the drain and the shower head was shooting water everywhere. 

We were stuck with a room on the 7th floor. It was the first time that I woke up in the middle of the night due to the street noise... in Vegas. All in all, you get what you pay for. This hotel is okay if you are just looking for a cheaper place to stay at while in Vegas. If you are going to the strip to experience the full-on Vegas experience, then I recommend going to another hotel.

From the moment we arrived we were treated very well.  It was very busy during check-in but the attitude of the staff helped improve the situation.

Our room was great, and the in room dining brought to us by Violet was fantastic.  She gets 5 stars for customer service.

I stayed in one of the suite with a large jacuzzi tub and the price was great. studio 54 was fun. Ate at wolfgang was also good. I recommend that if you want to drink don't go to the bar because the drinks can be pricey. Just put some money in a slot machine and they'll serve you drinks save some money that way. Or just go to the convenient store they have one by the entrance and buy a bottle to mix it up in your room.

Ok...so I stay here only when I get comp rooms.
And I think there's a reason why...I never had a good stay here.

Now...this place kinda sucks even for someone who doesn't pay for the room.
For my visit last month....
I always confirm my reso over the phone and basically the front desk had no information about my arrival until I was transferred to VIP services.
The desk girl was so stupid and made the process 1000 times worse than it should have been.
VIP service was emaculate. No problems there...hence VIP.

So we get there and the bell desk fails to bring our bags for hours.
Then I find out they sent it to the wrong room! 
Next time, bring all bags in myself. 
I never self park at MGM b\/c of their stupid parking lot.

We get a non smoking room, but guess what?
Everyone is smoking on this No smoking floor.
In the hallways and in front of the elevators.
Obviously the management here doesn't care...staff passes by the smokers and don't say a peep or report it.
Let's just say MGM guests are below class...and they can't read or interpret the NO smoking signage?

Room service...terrible.
The person comes and goes with a tude...really? Guess you're not working for tips today.

Check out..a pain..the tv just spazzed out and I wasn't able to really confirm checkout.
Had to go do it physically...aiya and even that was a pain.

Casino floor...dingy and not well ventilated.
The cocktail servers are scary and horrible...

Seems like everyone working here are not happy to be there...

The only thin GREAT here are the restaurants!
They have the best restos than any other hotel I've stayed on the strip.
I can skip JRA though.

Lobby Check In process needs improvement. Guests are shuffled from one line to another. There are several lines and no line designators so it looks like a mob. Managements needs to improve this service by making it easy, quick, and organized.

I used to try a new hotel every time I visited Vegas but I've stuck to the MGM Grand the last five times I went. Two words: LAZY RIVER. More on that in a second. 

"In this economy?" You know what I mean? You're stressed and need a vacation but you're broke. You don't want to stay at a recoil-enducing dump. Enter MGM Grand. 

I keep getting emails from them with these stupid deals: Around $70 a night with a few extra perks like club admission and $25 free play thrown in. Come on. Really? Of course I'm going to get in on that action. 

The only negative things I have to say about this hotel is that checking in is a friggin bear and the food options are nothing to write home about. Other than that, the rooms are comfortable and clean, it's centrally located and it has THE LAZY RIVER. I'm not even kidding, I have spent hours floating in that thing with a bloody Mary in my hand. Stress? What stress? If you don't like lazy rivers (what is WRONG with you?) there are, like, 156 other pools too choose from, including the salt water pools at Wet Republic. 

OH! And there's a Fat Tuesday's there. Get the pineapple amaretto yard and thank me later.

The Good:
Beds are comfy.
TV is big and nice.
Clean room.
Good amount of channels.
 
The Bad:
Premium view rooms extremely rare.
Wifi is horrible.
Outside noise comes in.
Ethernet doesn't work.
2 lamps didn't work.
Television loses connection a lot.
Televison remote is double clicks and is slow.
Extra fridge for rent is around 20 a night.
Ice machine empty at times. 
The green lights on the mgm at night are blinding and also make pictures impossible.
Tech support wait is long.
Busy hotel.

I have stayed here a couple times now. And what I have learned is that this hotel is not worth the price.
They will get you to love it the first time. But after that it goes down hill.
Out of all my stays here, I have never received a premium view. One trip I asked almost every week day for one. Come to find out that it is rare to get one without booking through their website. Wifi disconnects and tech support takes forever to get ahold of.

Took my husband here for his 30th birthday just a week ago and we had such an amazing time.  We tried visiting other casinos, but the strong smell of smoke was horrible, the MGM was completely different and actually control the smell of smoke.  

The food selection was amazing from expensive to cheap.  The pool area was beautiful and would have been more enjoyable if we went when it was hot, but we still enjoyed the hot tubs with a bunch of others.
