Our room was perfect.  We stayed in the MGM Grand King and it was great.  I've been to Vegas a couple of times and have stayed at other places....next time we go, I will continue to stay at the MGM :)

I went to Vegas last weekend for my birthday (my god, what a blur) and we stayed in one of the West Wing King Suites. After telling everybody where I was staying, the responses were excited and lots of, "it's so nice!" I didn't feel the same way, however. The lobby and the casino and the hotel itself? Very nice. HUGE. So many food options, and so many drink options. Love that they have a Fat Tuesdays! The pool was amazing... So big. So the hotel itself is super cool, definitely one to explore. The rooms were lacking.Our view was of a roof... Super cool. The bed was probably the best part, but that could be because I was drunk the whole time. Right when we got into our room, though, we noticed our toilet was broken. Wouldn't flush. So that was cool. Our shower looked super cool and modern, it was all frosted glass and a was a walk-in. The downside? It leaked. Considering we weren't in the room that much, I guess my complaints aren't that big of a deal. But seriously? If you're going to charge people that much, maybe check on how everything is working and maybe make sure there aren't other people's hairs in the bottom of the shower! 

P.S. If it's your first time going to Vegas, don't stay at MGM - walking up and down the strip is a JOURNEY.
I haven't stayed here before but yet been there. The food is good and shops too. The only bad\/sad thing is that they got rid of the lions

Waited 20 minutes to check in. Waited 20 minutes for our baggage to be kept at the bell desk. Not so great casino service and staff certainly not there to be personable. 

Besides that, it was fair.. Oh no, there's more... No lions anymore? What happened to THE MGM, perhaps they got bit by Peta. Touche!

The rooms are nicer than Luxor, I thought. They just reconstructed some of the floors so if you're lucky you'll get the flatscreen tv and the shnazzy contemporary interior design.

There's a not so bad bar in the center of the back entrances called Centrifuge. I would rate it borderline but the bartenders get up on the bar and brings the energy by what looks to be like homebrewed choreography.  http:\/\/www.mgmgrand.com\/nightlife\/centrifuge-bar.aspx

This has been the worse experience EVER! My husband and I checked in on Friday, 9\/15 at the Platinum desk and received our room keys, only to get to our room and it not be ready.  We were told to wait in the hall.  15 min later, we were allowed to enter our room only to have a wet floor.  After that I though ok a little snag but I'll get pass it despite the fact we had plans at Top Golf with friends who were out here.  The next morning my husband and I had had to take a cold showers.  After to speaking with a manager:Justin, I was told engineering was coming and for my inconvenience a $50 credit would be applied so we could order in the room whatever.  So now here we are another day into our trip, only to still have COLD water.  When I spoke to Issa another manager on the property, she suggested I go to the spa to take a shower and told me that was the best she could offer.  How dare you all treat any patron that is staying at your property that way.  As a platinum member, I'm good if I NEVER stay at MGM again and believe me ALL will know if my experience and how my husband and I were treated.  Offering someone money off or free buffet tickets is all well and good but I came expecting to spend money because I'm on vacation, you can't think that free food is going to make it better!  It's completely UNACCEPTABLE!!
One more thing to ad to my last review. Bar tenders are rude and un  professional . Customers don't mean a damn. Management needs to take control and revamp asap

Stayed here for a work event. Loved the hotel; rooms were clean and cozy. The food at the hotel is amazing - a great selection of upscale places to enjoy an excellent meal.

But, if you are holding a conference there - be warned the walk from room to conference center is a hike. It gives you time to walk off the drinks from the night before if you party it up. But, be sure to wear shoes that do well with lots of walking. Four inch pumps - not such a good idea! 

The room walls could be a bit thicker (but, that is with most hotels). I got to enjoy a annoying conversation had by 21 year olds on their last night of their first trip to Vegas from 4-6 am. I now know every detail of their "adventures".... annoying!
Good hotel with SMS big service , safety and clean room them food is good and need more organized house keeping

First time in Vegas and we got the MGM Grand.  The lobby was bustling when we got there.  Many people there were commenting that this was busier than usual.  I am assuming because it was Cinco de Mayo. The concierge desk is professional and outgoing.  Never a dull moment in the casino, at the food court or even on our way up to the room in the elevator!

The reason for four stars instead of five... room 8-419.  I called it "the room that was bangin'."  You get my drift.  It was funny at first but they were just loud and we even saw people roll their eyes.  Also, across the hallway, some guys decided it would be a great idea to smoke many bowls each night because all of the fumes went into the hall.

Regardless of those two things, it was a great time.  We were across the hallway from the other people in our group which was super convenient.  Checking out was simple: You had your option of TV, internet or phone (via text message).

I look forward to coming back to the MGM Grand next time I'm in town!

MGM Grand is the best place to stay. They got awesome restaurants, great bars\/lounges, nice rooms, excellent pools, and good place to gamble. Rooms are modern, clean, better than a few other places I've stayed at. 

I'm adding my Centrifuge review here because they weren't listed on Yelp yet. I LOVE it here. Good hip hop, good drinks. It's located across from Studio 54 which is not one of my favorites but when you're drunk and not ready to go to bed F it! Studio 54 was open until 8am that night. Since Centrifuge closed at 4am  we went in and kept the party going.  What sucks about Centrifuge were the bathrooms that are a huge walk away so for those that were really under the influence had a long stumble to go through. 

MGM Grand Hotel- 5 stars
Centrifuge-5 stars
Studio 54- 3 stars

I recently stayed at the MGM Grand and my stay was everything I expected.  When visiting Vegas I want a hotel that has a few essential benefits.  #1: location.  It's on the strip so that is a plus.  #2: food.  the MGM has great restaurants and when you want something faster and less formal there is a great stir fry place in their food court called Asian Fresh.  #3 Room.  The room had adequate space and a clean well maintained bathroom.  When I go to vegas I find myself out of my room 90% of the time so room size is generally not a concern of mine. 

The MGM has been a steeple in Vegas for a LONG time... they know what they're doing and the staff is always very helpful.

3 stars is pretty hard to believe. I've stayed here about three times in the past two years, and I have never had a bad experience.
The line to check in was crazy (Friday around 3pm), but once we got through that, I was received warmly by the front desk attendant. We opted to upgrade to the Grand Wing, and it was an incredible decision. Huge room, view of the strip, clean, sharp. Excellent stay definitely.
The gaming downstairs is solid (had a negative experience at another hotel, so the MGM staff working at craps and blackjack were great).
Stayed until Sunday, and really appreciated every aspect of the hotel. 
Also, the complaints about the hotel being too large is hilarious. It's not that big, and even if you think it is, you get decent fitbit steps.

I loved the location of the MGM. Coming from the airport, the taxi ride was about 10 bucks because it's at the beginning of the strip. We checked in close to noon and we were charged a 25 dollar fee for early check in. I didn't care, because I had waited in line to check in for about half an hour.  The lobby was nice and the check in went smooth. 

The room was located on the 14th floor but not part of the "well being" rooms. We had to walk down this long hallway that looked Newly renovated. We knew we were getting close to our room once the carpet changed to the old dingy carpet. We had a king bed. We only had two pillows on the bed. This was upsetting because I sleep with two. There was no fitted sheet on our bed, just a flat sheet to cover the mattress. This was terrible. The sheet kept slipping down the bed revealing the bare mattress. Gross. Our room just looked super outdated with stains in the carpet and wallpaper was coming off the wall. There was a huge footprint on the back of the door. There was no mini fridge either. 

Overall, the location was my favorite thing about staying here. There are better rooms than the one I stayed in. Next time I go back to Vegas, I'll be staying somewhere else because of the amount of money I paid; I expected to get a better room. They offered to upgrade my room to two queen beds, for a 35 dollar fee per night. I just didn't want to spend the extra money to upgrade my room when I knew I wouldn't spend that much time in there.

I have such a love for this place because its the first place I ever stayed in Vegas. The casino must be seen to be believed so large you will get lost, lions roam around in a habitat, the whole thing is great. If you are seeing a boxing match and it is at The MGM Grand, stay here, there is absolutely no reason not to. Lots of great restaurants and my favorite cirque show in Vegas, KA. Always been lucky there, always had a great time, always a food experience!

This isn't a review on the room more on the service of the booking,checking out and my deposit not being returned. I waited for over 3 extra hours for my room to be ready and was given no compensation. Honestly I've stayed here 3 times and this was by far the worst in service. It's also been over a month and have no received my deposit back from them. Disappointing!!

I've stayed here a couple of times in the past and now I remember why I stopped staying here. First off, I love the rest of the MGM - the restaurants, the gambling, the bars, even the pool. But the room we had was not up to my standards. The walls are so thin you can hear everything your neighbors are doing. EVERYTHING. The minibar was not stocked so now I'm worried that I'm going to be charged for the missing items.  The bed is comfortable enough but the bathrooms are starting to look dated. 

I guess it was Spring Break or something but there were constantly kids just partying and smoking pot at all hours in the hallways. There were fall-down drunk chicks everywhere. One was so drunk she crashed into me at the pool and her friends had to get her a wheelchair since she could no longer walk. Another time there was a girl throwing up by the elevators. Security should have a better handle on this.

As aforementioned, I love the restaurants here - We ate at L'Atelier, Taps, Emeril's and Shibuya. Except for Taps, they were excellent.  

So I guess the bottom-line is this: I'll continue to frequent MGM for the restaurants and gambling, but for the price of our room, I think we'll be sleeping elsewhere.

when did the makeover occur?

for such a classy-looking place, you sure do attract the douchebags.

i'm being sarcastic.

to roulette: thanks for the money!  actually, thanks for dinner!

Pretty awesome hotel!! Haven't stayed at the hotel itself for it's rooms, but been here a few times for dinner and shows. Must see KA -- worth every cent!!

The parking is ready to get in and get out of. Confusing to leave for beginners, but there is a back garage that leads you to where Uber drivers have standard pick up zones and it's actually pretty brilliant. 

Hotel itself seems really nice and clean which is surprising since its allot older then most places. Dining spots have been a hit every time!

The show KA was excellent and a definite must see for all audiences!!

The suites are nice and although the lines are long it moves fast. The check in person we got had no personality which sucked...but I have to say thanks as we missed our flight so came a day later and they still accepted our online booking. What I disliked the most about gambling here was that every time I lit a cigarette at a smoking table, the pit managers would come by and make a rude comment. Such as " hey [dealer name] do you smoke?" She said no he turns back and says looking directly at me "well you do now".... And similar remarks were made such as" that smells disgusting how can you do that" ??!!!???!!! Had I known MGM was so anti smoking I would've gladly gambled elsewhere!!! It's a nice hotel so I'll give it 3 stars but I've never encountered such rude floor managers in Vegas!

This review is for THE GOLDEN WOK inside of the MGM Grand. Great asian place.  We sat at the sushi bar and ordered pot stickers (THEY WERE SOO GOOD! ) and a couple of rolls. The food was delicious and the service was fine.  Not too bad priced, a little high but thats to be expected since its a restaurant in a casino.

We had booked a non-smoking room but upon arrival, and seeing how large the hotel was, we decided to get a smoking room at the last minute. The front desk agent was incredibly helpful and allowed us to do so which was pretty nice. The resort fee of $15\/day is  ridiculous, but I'm pretty sure they all charge this now (for use of the safe & internet).

The room was amazingly clean for a smoking room. The bathroom was super clean and has excellent lighting for getting ready. The only thing wrong with our room was the safe didn't work (got security to fix it within half an hour after we called). The casino is pretty boring, I enjoyed the one at the New York across the street and at The Flamingo. This hotel looks close to everything, but it really isn't. Even with the monorail station there it feels like everything takes forever to get to and it doesn't help the monorail is $5 per a use. 

DONT TAKE A CAB IN THIS CITY...the drivers are rude and drive recklessly. I saw lots of other tourists freaking out after getting out. Ours told us to f*** off (wtf?)

All in all it's a very average hotel, it's pool is top notch but the rooms are very plain (with no laundry rooms available, weak air conditioners and $3 pop machines). If you're looking for cheap accommodations without the frills I would definitely suggest staying here.

I stayed here for a conference in June 2015, and had a great experience. It's a beautiful hotel. Doesn't reek of cigarettes like other hotels on the strip. Great customer service and food! I don't gamble so I can't give my opinion on that...

There are only two good things about staying at the MGM Grand hotel in Vegas. The location and the bed. First of all the super gay employee who checked us in had an attitude when he told us there was a $200 fee to check in and we only had cash. I had no idea of the fee to begin with. Then we were never able to log in with their WiFi connection. Super complicated and it never worked not even offline my phone couldnt connect. I dont know if they have a signal jammer or what. The walk to the room was half a mile. I guess we made the mistake of staying when that loser miley cyrus was booked so the hotel and the parking lot was jam packed with the fall of americas future clogging up the hallways, elevators and parking garage. Spent over $500 for a 3 night stay which was really worth maybe $200. Im Definitely choosing a better place next year.

MGM grand is the best bang for your buck in Las Vegas. 

Every time we come to Vegas, this is the hotel we compare all others to. Yes, the architecture of the building is not as fun and NY NY, nor as elegant as the Venitian, but once you get inside the feeling changes.

The check in process is the smoothest.  The loyalty program is the most inclusive. The casino layout is the most fluid. The staff is friendly, the games are varied, and the play ranges from penny slots to a respectable high rollers area. The lion habitat is free to view. The rooms are a little dated, but there are so many great deals if you look around.  The shows are wonderful (one trip we saw Robin Williams, another Ka), but the best, the best is the food.  From celebrated fine dining to great grab and go; when it's time to eat, I head to the MGM.
the staff at this place were very nice despite the all star nba thing.  their valet service was efficient...it was a very busy weekend for them...i commend them...

I'm a local so I don't venture to the strip much. Since the M properties decided to start charging for parking I've since avoided M properties whenever possible. MGM Grand is connected to the Arena so when events come I end up having to park at the MGM. I haven't seen much of the property since not venturing to it much except from the parking lot to the arena. 

This review is mainly on the gambling aspect of the property. After an event I decided to try my luck at one of my favorite games ZUMA. They had a couple machines. I sat down and played. I sat at the machine for 90 minutes NEVER hitting a bonus OR any of the jackpots. VERY hard to believe when I've played this machine at other casinos and I at least hit a bonus 10-15 minutes into playing. Nope not on this occasion. I played different amounts all throughout my game time. I don't think I ever won more than $20 on a good spin. I put in $200 of my own money and cashed out w\/ zero. Very disappointing to see just how tight the machine was. I should've stuck to my guns and not played, but I figured I've done well on the machine before so why not take a crack.

We just got back from a pretty nice stay for 3 days. The hotel is in a great location of the strip as far as being close to the Monorail and walking to other casinos. New York, NY is across the street and easy to get to. The casino here is pretty nice, its very large and has something for everyone. We booked a deluxe room and thought it was a little stripped down as far as amenities; no mini bar?! The room could use a sitting chair. Also, the TV and shower were pretty dated, but we weren't here to watch TV, just expected something a little more modern. 
We loved the Nobhill Tavern inside-great service and excellent menu.
I think if we stay in Vegas again, I would stay here, but in the West Wing or a upgrade to a suite.

MGM Grand Hotel in Las Vegas cares very little about the cleanliness and quality of their rooms.  I  was scheduled to stay at the property for 3 nights, but check out after the first night.  The room quality has plummeted but that doesn't prevent the prices from continuing to rise.  I don't gamble so when I come to Vegas, I am either coming on business or to relax.   After spending 1 night in my room, I was horrified to find black mold all over the shower.  I was even more horrified to think that I had been exposed to it for over 15 hours.  I visited the front desk to request another room and a refund for the room, tax and resort fee for the previous night.  The front desk representative refused and offered to credit resort fees which were lower then the cost of the one night stay.  I escalated this issue to the manager to basically refused to "comp" the night.  Can you believe they had the nerve to use that term to describe an unsatisfactory and unhealthy room.  Needles to say, I check out of the hotel.  I will never stay there again.

I honestly wasnt impressed with this hotel, I've seen a lot better and its always very crowded everywhere you go! The service is good, we got lost once and they were very helpful in helping us get to where we needed to be.

MGM is my Vegas home away from home... they always take care of us and we have never had any problems with the rooms, check in or any of the restaurants.... one time I had a complaint about housekeeping not changing our towels and the front desk gave us resort credit to use at any of their restaurants... perfect since it was my birthday weekend!  so we use it at the Wolfgang Puck restaurant which was good and they gave us birthday cake on the house...

we use the players card every time we gamble or play slots and we receive offers year round for discounted rooms and complimentary upgrades.. Casino is great, people watching all over the place...

I will admit MGM is not the newest hotels on the strip but it is definitely not old and dingy at all. People may have an impression that its old just because they know its been there a while. Our room was much larger compared to our room at PH, I dont know if its standard but it had a pretty large sitting  area (we didn't do any upgrades or anything). The room was probably almost twice the size as PH. The bathrooms were nicer and larger too. 

I think MGM has a beautiful lobby area but I agree with one of the comments that its a bit of a walk to your room. The elevator area on each floor is also very beautiful.

Got to stay here for the first time ever after being to Vegas many times. The room was nicely decorated and it was pretty spacious. The room was modern and I was please to see many posters hanging on the wall including Patrick Stewart. 

The reason it was "okay" and not a "fan" was because the outlet in the rooms SUCKED! Anything I plugged in the room would not stay in...I would have to prop something below it so it would stay in. The second was the shower head....how does one really going to be able to shower under that...there was no pressure and any way you want to turn it, it didn't make a difference.

PRESSURE IS OFF!

Oh how far MGM fallen. For hosting all these events and for all the money you make, your rooms are disgusting and cheap looking. We booked through hotel.com and ended up in a room in the West Wing. 

I thought I entered the Twilight Zone. Dark grey walls, plain dark carpet in the hallway. Furniture was faded and I have seen restrooms bigger than this King sized room. I wished I had stayed in there long enough to take pictures but I had to get out of there. I felt like I was in a motel 6. 

We called the front desk and asked to move to a room in the Grand. They accommodated but charged me a $15 a day "upgrade fee". Want to know the kicker? The new room was on the same floor just a mile down the hall. You can almost feel a switch turn on once you crossed the "line" out of the twilight zone. It is so hard to explain but those rooms are not Vegas standard. I expect more out of MGM and they did not deliver.

New room is barely any better. Stains on the towels, stains on the window shades. Shower had no water pressure and the water was lukewarm.

I come to Las Vegas about four times a year and have stayed everywhere. I will never stay here again. SLS, Delano, even the D in downtown is classier than what MGM has become. 

I only picked MGM this time because it is closer to the start line for the marathon I am running. I heard they had "remodeled" there rooms too so I took a chance. 

Guess you do live and learn.
It is grand.  Best part is all the things that the teens can do.  Lots of pools, arcade and then they can run across to NY, NY and do the roller coaster.
Great bang for the buck! I've stayed here several times. No complaints. Most of the time they will upgrade your room when you check in.

The first time I went to the MGM, I was pleased with everything. The second time I went, the service was not very good. Thinking that this was a fluke, I stayed there again. Big mistake. 

We got there after 3 a.m. because of really bad traffic. Obviously not the MGM's fault. We got to our room and one of the window coverings was broken. I was concerned that somehow I would get blamed for breaking the window covering so I wanted to inform the front desk. I figured they may change our room or just say "don't worry about it." What I got was attitude. They said "It's 4 a.m., what do you want me to do about it?" Okay, well at least they know that the window covering is broken. 

Fast forward to 5 a.m. I wake up to someone OPENING OUR DOOR. So far, I had only one hour of sleep. I wake up in alarm wondering if they double booked the room. According to my spouse, they knocked first. It was Engineering. They were there to fix the window covering. Who sends maintenance into a booked room at 5 a.m.?! How is this okay?

Then, a few hours later, they wake us up again with a phone call. They asked us if we had checked out because the maid service reported that we did. We had not checked out. At the end of our stay, we called the front desk and checked out. We asked them if any further action needed to be taken and they said that everything was taken care of.

They double charged us. We paid for the room online. When we had first got there they asked to see the credit card and they charged us again without our knowledge. My spouse called them to rectify the situation after our stay and they insisted that we had stayed two nights! I appalled at how awful this entire situation has been.

Actually I'm giving "Zero" stars! You're forced to give one!

So, I'm about to check into MGM Grand for the first time and is very excited to be there. I just love Las Vegas! Well, the lady who was standing in front of us was called up to the desk to register a complaint about bugs and or roaches in her bed. I heard her asking for another room  and the employee couldn't seem to make a decision. The desk employee called their supervisor "Katherine" over to handle the situation, and Katherine was so rude and nasty to the young lady. I'd never seen anything like it before in any time I've checked into a Vegas hotel! So, me and my wife saw and heard what was going on with how Katherine treated this lady and couldn't accommodate her with another room, we left. We didn't want to go up to our room and be forced to sleep with bugs and roaches. We checked into a nearby hotel that resembled a pyramid and had a much better experience with our check-in and room. So glad we witnessed that at MGM. Katherine should be ashamed of herself.

But hey, if you like bed bugs and roaches in your expensive stay and rude unaccommodating service by a supervisor, then MGM is the place for you because they have plenty of it!

I had the opportunity to stay here last weekend because I won a free night from a contest the hotel had on Twitter. I had been waiting with bated breath to come here, and I wasn't disappointed. The MGM's motto is "Maximum Vegas", and it delivers! It's probably the largest hotel on the strip. Our room was on the 27th floor and had an amazing view of Mandalay Bay and the desert. The hotel room was super posh too. Amazing bed, bathroom, everything was just awesome! My favorite thing about the MGM was the pool area. And if I could add +2 stars for the fact that the slot machines here were kind to me, I totally would! The MGM should be a staple in everyone's trip to Vegas, even if you don't stay the night here. Enjoy!
MGM grand hotel is by far my favorite hotel in Vegas. It's new, it's clean, it's huge. The casino is great. All in all you can't go wrong staying at this hotel. Highly suggest staying here!

We decided to stay at the MGM due to the recommendation. When we arrived the check in was a breeze. The checkout is also a breeze as you can check out from the TV screen. 
We got an upgrade with $20 more a day to the Tower Suites. I would say it's not worth it. 
The room we got was very spacious, the bed was comfortable but other than that it's very basic. I've stayed in hotels all around the world. They didn't even have a shower cap provided in the room, nor a care kit provided with the amount of money we paid. 
Where we stayed the guests around us was screaming in the middle of the night. 
There were people leaving glass bottle in the middle of the walkway to our room either. We weren't to impressed. 
Would I return to stay at MGM again? Maybe not. Think twice before you book with them. There are other new hotels on the strip which looks much better.

This is the worst hotel I've stayed in for the last eleven years. Check-in experience was poor and the up sale pressure was comical. The only way to checkin before 3 pm was to upgrade. The room is borderline disgusting. The room and hallways have not been vacuumed and they are stained. The drawers are dusty and the sink is slow to drain. 
The rooms are poorly insulated: we could hear people talking in adjoining rooms and the street noise from the alley at 5:23 am woke us up. 
On a good note, the Ká show was amazing and the restaurants we tried were great. My advice is to stay anywhere else and go to the MGM for dinner and the show.

Where do I begin..don't stay here.i booked a room on hotels.com for a grand king with views of the strip.upon checking in.mgm told me they don't have that room available.they gave me supposely a grand queen with the view of a nasty roof with 2 queen beds.that killed the romance for me and my wife.for 430 a night plus 37.50 for resort fee.the rooms looks nothing like the pictures online.the room looked old and out dated.so they ripped me off for about $120 .they did not want to discount me for giving me a cheap ass room that they said that is all they got.mgm does not honor any bookings with hotels.com.also don't use hotels.com
No one could give me answer why this happened or how this was gonna get fixed...I will never come to this hotel again and will tell anyone I know not to come here.

Nicely appointed rooms at a good price, but terribly overpriced food in the hotel, and the rooms don't have microwaves, refrigerators, or even coffee pots! I know it's all in their plan to gouge as much money out of you as they can, but jeeze. Of course, they'll offer to bring you any of the above if you ask... for a completely outlandish daily fee. Free parking is nice, but don't be surprised at a 15-20 minute wait for the valet. Decent show offerings at again, outlandish process. We paid $200 to see David Copperfield. But that's Vegas, right?!?

I have stayed at the MGM twice now. 

The first time I stayed July 2010....I had a pleasant experience and this past time in May 2011 it was okay. 

Things I like about the hotel:
The Casino is good

Went to a really great comedy show there that was reasonably priced. 

LOVE the pool.... so many options and the lazy river is fun!!

Beds are comfy, and rooms are a good size.

Also the price is reasonable and they have fairly good deals.

Do NOT like:

Asked to extend our time and the kicked us right out because they had an event 

Most of the rooms smell like smoke even if they are non smoking. 

Restaurants are not great.

Out dated TV's

And the showers are for people under 5'4"....so uncomfortable.

Overall not a bad deal but next time I go to vegas I will try another hotel.
My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at MGM  Our room had a great view and it was very spacious, clean and comfortable. They have a great staff!

This is my favorite hotel ,been coming here for years, you can always catch me in their sports book, for some reason i win here, it's a cool place to visit, if your a boxing fan, then you got to visit the mgm. i enjoy everything about the mgm, its close to everything on the strip.

My wife and I just returned from a weekend here at this hotel and it was disappointing.  To start with, we know it's Vegas and we tend to focus less on the little things and more on the general stay as a whole.  That said, this is not going to go down as one of our favorite hotels by any means.  

To start with, the hotel is so massive that they really need to refine their signage.  There is far too much looping around only to end up where you started and that is purely due to very poor directional signage.  It's not going to be perfect but it's not effective at all and you get led astray easily.  This is coming from a person who has stayed in almost every major hotel in Las Vegas.

As far as the rooms are concerned, when we arrived, I always check to see if there are things missing from the mini-bar or fridge that we are going to get dinged for and sure enough, there was a missing Smart Water and a back of M&M's that the housekeeping team missed re-stocking.  I mean, how hard is it not to see a tall Smart Water that isn't there when you are prepping a room for a new guest?  

The hot water is terrible here.  It's the worst I have seen in Vegas.  At two separate times(Saturday at 6pm and Sunday at 1pm) there was no hot water for at least 15 minutes.  That's just ridiculous and inexcusable. 

The beds were fine and the room stayed dark which is always a plus in this town if you are a late riser.  When we checked out, of course there are two charges for....drum roll please:  Smart Water and M&M;s.  They took them off but it's just an annoyance that was caused by an employee who doesn't know how to do their job. 

Those were the main points that made the stay underwhelming.

Wait too long to check in and to check out at visa signature desk. They charged us additional fees... Even though we already paid online. The check in girl from yesterday around 3pm has the worst attitude. Doesn't care about the customer. She was patronizing us the whole time.

An oldie but goodie when it comes to restaurants and shows but not the best place to stay for too long if you don't like the smoke. The hotel is somewhat old (propbably why it's so smokey in there) but it's still filled with asians.  Generally I only come to the MGM for it's food (Shibuya) or it's shows (Ka) otherwise the smoke is a little too much for me.

NEVER STAY HERE! I stayed in the grand tower this week and a FIRE started in my room from an electrical outlet! Apparently there was a water leak upstairs in the unit above me. Around 2p on Friday we noticed that we had no water. We were never notified of a water shut off until WE called the front desk to ask what was going on. They said "oh yeah, we have an emergency water shut off". I would think it'd be courteous of them to call our room and let us know that we wouldn't have water for and even then offer some sort of monetary refund. However, that didn't happen. Then, after the water returned and my partner and I were getting dressed for a show at Planet Hollywood, all of a sudden, we hear a loud buzzing-bang and I look into the bathroom and saw there there was a FIRE coming from the wall where the outlet was! No joking! About a foot of flames. I had my partner leave the room and I quickly called the front desk, told them, and then hung up and left.

When I got to the front desk demanding an explanation the manager, Justin, offered to comp one night and move us into a suite. I'm sorry but this was 1 hour before our show we were going to, affecting our schedules, and did I mention A FIRE STARTED IN OUR ROOM! So no, I don't want a night comp'ed I would like a full refund!

We settled on two nights refunded and moved into a suite. Then at check out there were still fee's associated to the two night due to be refunded on our bill in which that check-out women then went to her manager to have removed.

Still not seeing ANY charges on my bank statement I called MGM about 5 hours later and asked why I hadn't seen anything. They informed me that it was going to take a few days. 

However, it's not all showing and they are cheating us for the first nights stay, and parking fee's. I'm sorry but when a fire happens in someone's room and they are 5 inch's away from it, YOU COMP THE ENTIRE STAY!

MGM I hope you see this because we will NEVER be returning to your hotel and this entire episode will be shared with friends, family, and social media. All it would have taken was to respect paying customers and provide a full refund out of your millions. However, it seems as though your staff isn't humbled enough for such.
Loved  our room. Casino was big with good ventilation. Lots of nice bars and fantastic pools. Food wasnt bad but skip the buffet. I think it's my fav place to stay now.

We loved this place. Great view fron the 21th floor. Big room, very clean. We went to David Copperfield show in this hotel, the show was amazing. Every services are very expensive, included the most expensive water bottle the intire trip.

We stayed at the mgm signature! Absolutely loved it! We didn't know we had a pent house suite until we got on the elevator. Very clean room. View was awesome. Everything about the mgm was worthy of coming back. We went to the pools only one day while there, stayed in the lazy river most of the day. It was relaxing floating around in the tubes and a very fun environment! Wonderful customer service too!

The MGM is huge and certainly impressive with the live animals and history. However, it is quickly losing it's luster to all the other more glittery, themed casinos that keep popping up. I had lunch at the rainforest cafe and it was pretty standard burgers an salads type deal (not unlike ordering from Applebees or Ruby Tuesdays). There's lots of little shops and inside the main lobby there is a large habitat with white tigers. You may think this is cool, I firmly do not. i am staunchly afraid of large, carnivorous animals that have the ability to ingest me. Obviously i was a gazelle or zebra in a past life because the mere sight of them sent me running to the other side of the room. **(UPDATE: One of those scary bastards just attacked someone in spring of 2010 at the MGM. Who's silly for thinking them frightening instead of cool now? That's right.)***

The saving grace, as far as I am concerned, is Studio 54 where there are the sky dancers who hang from the ceiling and dancers who perform on lighted pedestals. Every time I have gone to Vegas I have stopped there because it is such a good time and that's me talking, not the six vodka and cranberries I had.

My friend and I met someone for dinner so I did get to sneak a peek at the rooms, nothing special really, exactly like a Comfort Inn. Also, I was informed by the occupant that because of the outside lighting (take a look at any picture of this casino) the room permanently glows ooze green at all times, it looked like someone needed to call Ghostbusters.

Overall, great place to VISIT but I'd suggest actually staying at another casino.

I was super excited about staying here. our honeymoon was going to be awesome we got a suit and.... let me tell you i dont think i will be coming back! never in my life has some random person opened my hotel room! I mean i havent stayed any many hotels but if small ones are more careful then this place it says alot. it was like 8 am on a tuesday that someone knocking on our room woke me up. since no one answered obviously me and my husband were asleep the guy that by the way did not work there opened our room!!! a stranger had the key to our room my husband got up and went after him to see if it was an employee and he wasnt he was wearing street clothes. and when he went down to complain all they did was change our room key! what if i would of been in the room alone! never again MGM. i had an awesome time but that was just not right. i loved your pool and your customer service but i doubt that we will be back.

For a hotel, the MGM Grand was a fine place to lay our heads after our wild nights in Vegas (okay they weren't too wild, but still...) We got great rates because we booked early and in the winter. Also, we had NO issues with check in lines, everything went smoothly.

One thing I will say is don't drink the water...it's gross, but I think that's just a Vegas thing overall. It tastes like chlorine. Stick to bottled agua if you can!

The casino was pretty typical. I won $32 on the slop machines, but people sweat this casino has bad luck.

The Lion exhibit was a little lacking...I thought the lions looked sad like they wanted to be set free. Lol.

We dined at the Rainforest Cafe one afternoon, it was a pretty cool restaurant although a bit generic. 

Overall, I think the MGM Grand was like a lot of other Vegas hotels that appear to have lots of glitz and glamor, but when you pull back the curtain, it's just an average hotel! :)
this hotel has been there for a while.. I do think the interior is pretty old. The rooms are pretty small. The whole place is not my style.

I was pleasantly surprised here after an uncomfortable stay at the Luxor. I stayed in a grand tower room on the 23rd floor. It was beautifully designed, well-decorated and renovated. Some surfaces were dusty but overall it felt clean. Service was thorough but not intrusive, and every staff member I saw greeted me by name and with a smile. I did miss having a fridge and microwave, but I suppose that's too much to ask of a room on the Strip. Overall a great stay.

Sadly,no longer one of my "go to hotels" managment sucks! They have false advertising, this is actually the second time this has happend .If you are planning to get the night with wet republic entrance please call and ask first because they have black out days and dont tell the customer anything even after you buy the tickets. Im no longer coming here

I had a wonderful time. The place was beautiful and the service was superior. Friendly atmosphere and professional staff. The prices are reasonable, yet you still get the full Vegas life experience. The food is excellent. It's an all in one package here at the MGM. You get it all. 
 I will definitely come back here.

Hotel too big and too crowded.  Very smokey in the lobby and casino as smoking is allowed.  We paid $139 first night and $169 second night.  No fridge, microwave, or coffee maker in room.  Room was clean.  Staff is nice.  It's not a classy casino.  A lot of slutty dressed women and drunk rowdy early to mid twenty aged men.

I'd go back. The room was nice, the location awesome, and for the price it hit the spot. I shared a room with 3 other people, and it didn't feel insanely cramped as it easily could have.
However, two major problems:
1. The toilet kept clogging (maybe 4 people in one room was too much?)
2. Every day at least twice the maids would knock and want to get in, despite the "Do Not Disturb" sign being out. What the hell?

My first trip to stay at MGM Grand was so full of disappointment we left after a few hours.  Long queue to register, our room given to someone else so we got downgrade in bed size with no upgrade in room, rowdy guests, near brawl in elevator over it being too full, elevator door attempted to close 3 times as a malfunction coming and going, room AC did not cool room, room fan not available or given upon multiple requests.  When we considered walking through to the pool we opted to just leave due to crowds.  After checkout we stored bags and went to event.  This was ok but at end of concert they closed bathrooms in order to shoo us all like cattle through the venue exit doors.  Appalling to not let patrons use the bathroom at end of concert!  We walked out in tiny cross legged baby steps grateful to be making our exit.

My family checked in on july 22 2012. My mom had a conference here so our room was Free: ) Wet republic was not that crowded and the lazy river was fun. Renting tubes was $10 for the day. Also we attented the cirque do soleil production ka. It was amazing especially the stage. Overall our rooms were clean and we enjoyed our stau.

5 stars as far as hotels go. Nothing fancy about it compared to the other Vegas hotels. It was clean, cozy, and comfortable. I slept on the roll out bed that was super comfortable. AND the comforters in the rooms are the BEST in the whole wide world! Bathroom was spacious, which I appreciate b\/c nothing drives me crazier then having my knees hit the tub when I am releasing my 24 gin and tonics from the evening. I did wish they had mirrors within the room and not just restricted to the bathroom. Makes it difficult to get ready when you are sharing the space with friends. I also appreciate the double curtains on the windows that shields us from daylight in the morning. Especially on the mornings after an eventful night at Badda Bing. http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/badda-bing-las-vegas#hrid:vQ06lAyg8UIM3ZN0EDy_GQ

I would strongly advise anyone to avoid staying at the mgm. Our room was very small with poor lighting. The bathroom looks like a bathroom you'd fine on an airplane. Extremely cramped. I was stunned at how uncomfortable the bed was as well. You'd think that the mgm would be nice to stay in, but they just try to cram in as many gamblers as they can which leads to small, uncomfortable rooms. Awful experience.

This place is my home base in the Vegas strip.  When you think about it and you will as soon as you read my review, you'll see why I see it as my base.

First off, if you're an MMA or boxing fan (btw, SCREW MAYWEATHER), you'll know this is the only casino that has the dedicated fighting ring.  So if you expect to see fights, it's going to be at MGM.

Second, they have several decent places to eat from the cheap (McDonalds) to the pricy (Emerill).  

Third, I just had to see the pool at Mandalay Bay to be sure, but I definitely ended up enjoying the design and overall environment at MGM Grand's pool.  I love their lazy pool and how they're just several pools to choose from when you just can't stand to be around certain crowds.

Fourth, the room and the beds are very comfortable.  Probably the only beds more comfortable are at Caesar's Palace\/Hotel Nobu.

Fifth, they have impeccable front desk service. I always got to check out late at no charge and when the shower didn't do hot water, not only did they fix it within an hour, they waived my entire stay's resort fee.  It was totally unnecessary, but totally appreciated!

Sixth, they have a rail that can take you to other casinos at not only a much cheaper rate than a taxi, but without the traffic.

Lastly, for those that love to party, Wet Republic is among the best pool parties and Hakka-San is among the best (and largest) nightclubs.  If you end up going to both, you might as well stay at the same hotel, right?  Both clubs have been good to me in more ways than one.

The overall hotel rates is in the middle of all the strip hotels.  It's not quite expensive like the Cosmopolitan or Bellagio, but not lower end like Harrah's or Flamingo's.

Perhaps my only complaint is unless you get the SkyLoft, you're not going to get a good view.  I got a good view from Mandalay Bay, but honestly, I didn't think it was worth it.  

MGM Grand just feels like a man's hotel.  Probably the only thing I haven't done is gamble there (except for slots).  I have to change that.

MGM BLAND! If you like old decor at a high price, the MGM Grand is the place for you. I stayed here March 2015 and the room looked the same as it did back in 2005. Come on, hire an interior designer! Almost all hotels this age are dirty to the point that they cannot be cleaned unless they close the doors for a complete remodel. If you want proof, go into any room and look inside the air vent. You will find a coating of dirt that is several years in the making. 
Plan to pay at least $50 (after tip) to have breakfast for two either at the cafe or the buffet. We went to the cafe and I had Eggs Benedict which was served without garnish, very plain and unexciting. Potatoes were okay but not what I expected. The ham that was on the english muffin was thin and tasteless. The waitress saved me from having a really bad morning by bringing me several ham slices after I mentioned this to her. My wife had plain scrambled eggs, potatoes with toast and they managed to make it plain with a capital "P" I thought Las Vegas made everything with a great amount of flare. If you are looking for excitement don't stay at MGM Grand. I just changed their name to MGM BLAND! Don't even get me started about the resort fee, $25 extra per night and they put tax on top of that! All hotels are charging this fee in Las Vegas so ask when you are booking how much extra you will have to pay once they apply this fee.

This is the worst of the Las Vegas hotels at which I've stayed.  The rooms are tiny, it feels relatively old, and it's dirty.  

The layout is terrible.  We spent half our trip walking from place to place within the hotel.  Our shower leaked.  Someone was sleeping in the hallway outside our room for an entire night.  The furniture in our room fell apart.  And these are the best things about the hotel.

They must draw people in because it's a bit cheaper than the nearby hotels, but it's not at all worth it.  Definitely will not return.

Stayed here for a weekend for the first time and was surprised how kept up this place is. The lobby is real spacious, nice and conveniently close to the elevators.

We stayed in a standard room and overall it was nice. The bed is really comfortable and the pillows are very soft and fluffy.
The restroom is large enough. Double sinks! Unfortunately besides for the body mirror in the restroom there isn't a body mirror in the room itself. The water pressure for the shower is pretty good too.
Ooh the rooms doesn't come with a mini refrigerator, but you can rent one for a charge daily fee.

The people working the storage lockers are really nice or just the day I used it.

review of standard 2 queen bed room in grand tower (non-smoking)

THE +'s: clean. friendly staff. you get what you pay for (average 90 bucks a night). location is best though -- in the summertime, this means it's walking distance to everywhere.

THE -'s: personally i can't stand the boisterous noise. stayed at the signature version of mgm and that was real swell. here, you have to walk through the ginormous casino every time you need to get to the taxi\/valet area. ugh.

SUM: a place i'd stay at for werk reasons. if i was looking for my usual indulgence of living in the lap of luxury, i'd book their signature rooms.

The only reason I rated this casino so high was because of...
1. Craft Steak - restaurant owned by Tom Coliccio from Top Chef. 
2. Ka- Cirque du Soleil show
3. The lions who were energetic and lively in comparison to the sleepy lions at the Zoo who just lay around all day. 

My family and I stayed here (VIP style) for free thanks to my dad's vendor. We had the suite, which was OKAY. I expected a little more, since it was a suite; but it was definitely not as nice as the suites in the Hotel at Mandalay Bay. 

Room service was okay and the food was blah. We ordered the gourmet cheese platter which was $30 for crackers, 6 diff cheeses, and nuts. Totally not worth it. The buffalo wings were whatever- seemed like it was the frozen kind, but not the good ones that they sell at Costco. 

Anyways, I ended up winning $50 at the Wheel of Fortune slot machines so that improved my experienced with MGM. 

MGM would not be my 1st choice to stay, mainly because of the location ( I like to be in the middle of the strip) but Id like to come back and visit the other restaurants in this hotel.

Today I arrived at the MGM hotel in Vegas and have to say that Rachel was amazing! We went to check in and she helped us our with all of questions and got us a suite deal and make sure all the rooms were close and on the same floor! Definitely a 5 star experience, hire more staff members with her customer service mentality! She's phenomenal!

Booked in MGM Grand this week for a conferences This hotel is way too big. Crazy long walk to get to conference center. Hotel service bad. No hot water in the shower this morning! Internet so slow, it's unusable. Sat on hold for over 10 minutes trying to notify them of the issue. Finally got through. They didn't seem to care and did not offer any solution or compensation. VERY disappointed!

We had a King signature suite room on the west wing, and boy did me and my boy friend LOVE this place! It's so spacious with a huge bed and great bathroom with a tone of mirrors everywhere. Our view wasn't too great but the staff was excellent! Not only to mention my boy friend and I even won money from their casino! Way better than some of the other hotels I've been to in vegas!

Das MGM Grand gehört zu den ältesten Vertretern der Mega-Resorts am Strip. Entsprechend ist die Gesamtqualität und die Ausstattung im Vergleich zu den neueren Resorts auch nur als mittelmaß zu bezeichnen.
Allerdings gehören die 3 Türme des ebenfalls zum MGM gehörenden Signature at MGM Grand (nur Suiten) zum Besten das Las Vegas zu bieten hat!
Aktuell startet des MGM eine Rundumsarnierung der Zimmer. Bei meinem letzten Besuch im Dezember war eine der neuen Zimmerausstattungen ausgestellt. Diese machte einen sehr hochwertigen Eindruck. Es bleibt also die Hoffnung das dadurch die Qualität des MGM wieder deutlich angehoben wird.

Beware ....housekeeping will steal anything they can while cleaning your room & hotel does nothing to stop it or even acknowledge it. The bed had disgusting stains on the side. Never go barefoot. Tub drained so slow my wife's $82 spray tan stained the shower curtain bottom. Lines for everything were ridiculous . Check in alone took over an hour. My company will never hold another convention here again. Can't wait to come back to Vegas and stay anywhere but MGM.

Worse hotel ever! I have spent a total of about 4 hours fighting with them over the past 3 days apparently there is no general manager. I spoke to Dominique, Scott, and James. Scott wand the only helpful one the rest of the front desk Manager's were horrible. I have never experienced such bad customer service in my life. I will never stay here again.

I stayed at MGM Grand last weekend for my first & very likely last time. I was excited to try it & assumed the pretty penny that it cost would be returned to me in at least a mostly enjoyable experience. I was wrong.

The Good: 
1. We chose to pay the $30 for the express check-in feature because Friday check-in lines are ridiculous & painful. We were helped after just a few moments. 
2. The young woman who checked us in was delightful. When I asked about upgrading to a two queen room she took care of it for us without hesitation. 
3. Our room was modern & clean, albeit small (We were in a Grand Queen Room). 
4. The Lazy River was the best part of the vacation, while it lasted. We had fun, the water was heated to the perfect temp for an overcast day, & the bartenders at the Casting Call bar were friendly. We were asked to exit the water after about an hour for "cleaning" which cut the fun short & we ended up just heading back to our room because it was too cloudy to hang out outside the water. This threw a wrench in the most enjoyable part of the stay. 

The Bad: 
Where do I start? 
1. The cords, from what I can only guess was a window cleaner, banging against our window first thing in the morning on a Saturday? That was horrible & lasted nearly two hours. News Flash MGM Grand, people stay up late in Vegas, the last thing they want is to be woken up by cords bouncing against their window & making a racket early in the morning. 
2. After being awoken so early I went down to the Starbucks to pick up some coffee. Bad idea, there were at least 75 people in line. Insanity. I gave up & headed back to Corner Cakes since their line was smaller. After being told they do not accept the coupon that was in my room I paid $31 for 4 donuts (not cronuts, just 4 regular donuts), 2 drip coffees, a milk & an orange juice. 
3. On my way up from Corner Cakes I find the elevator bay full & see that one of the lifts is stopped halfway between floors, full of people, & employees on the ground asking them to remain calm. That inspires confidence right? I head up on the next working one only to find, with everyone else stuffed into it, about half way, all of the buttons were suddenly unlit & now we're going down.
4. There was also Rainforest Cafe, where after waiting forever to be seated, we were told by our server he would be "right with us" only to wait over an additional 10 minutes to have our drink order taken. Then only 3 of our 4 meals came out together. I was left waiting 5 extra minutes for mine. The choice was for everyone else at the table to allow their food to get cold waiting for mine, or be half finished when mine arrived. Not a mention the server spilled root beer on my husband when refilling a cup. Totally worth the $120 we paid for the meal. 
5. The buffet. Wow. My husband went to use the restroom right after we were seated to wash his hands, & was directed out of the buffet, by a buffet employee, to a men's room on the casino floor. Upon his return the other employees at the front of the buffet weren't going to allow him back in, after we had JUST paid, & gave him a very bad attitude about the situation. Luckily the gentleman who had directed him out to the restroom to begin with noticed & came over to clear it up so he could eat the meal he paid for. I almost wish he hadn't. We both ended up with immediate stomach issues from the buffet & I ended up with terrible stomach cramps, vomiting, a headache...full blown food poisoning for days afterward. 
6. Then there was the issue of the sink & the toilet in the room. After running the water in the sink for more than a few seconds a sewer smell emanated out of the drain & then it would make a gurgling sound. That made me gag when brushing my teeth. The toilet had a sewer like smell whenever it was flushed as well.
7. It didn't help that our  itemized receipt would not load on the TV check out (2nd page had a failed to load error repeatedly) so I had to stop at the desk to get a print out before leaving to assure our charges were accurate (they were). 
8. Another concern was the Valet. When walking through the East Valet on our 2nd day we found the Valets driving the cars through the lot so fast & dangerously that they literally would honk the horn the entire time they were driving them from the drop until the cars were parked. After getting back into our vehicle at the end of our trip we found anything & everything we had left, from water bottles in cup holders to plugs or snacks in pouches or on the seats strewn throughout the car, having been thrown around by their careless driving. Everything was a mess. 

If just one, or maybe even two, of the problems had occurred I might have overlooked it, but this was just too much in 2 days. We are thoroughly disappointed. I wouldn't recommend the MGM Grand at this point. For the cost you can get better, or for the same experience you can pay less. It entirely ruined our weekend. We came home upset instead of rested.

I booked a 4 night stay here for my 1 year anniversary with my husband, on vegas.com. We picked this hotel because of the rate. When we got to the hotel, we were notified about a $22 daily maintenance fee. For what you might ask? Well, pretty much nothing.  
There is no provided drinkable water and no small refrigerator. My shower turned into a bath. There is not exhaust fan, so after you took a shower, the whole room felt damp.
The hotel was beautiful, but I rather spend my money in Cancun. Nothing stood out about this hotel. Don't waste your money here.

Really enjoyed ourselves here. Love the little shops and the Lion fountain. We were staying just over the road at Excalibur. Went to see a show at Brad Garret's Comedy Club which is a really nice club, check the line up before heading in.

Our gambling extravaganza, if you want to call it that, extended to one of the blackjack tables where we really enjoyed ourselves. We're not huge gamblers but it's Vegas and it's the MGM!

West wing rooms are very basic, no coffee, nothing, but a TV really, bathroom design is really badly laid out, towels above the toilet which cannot be reached from the shower, very little space to put anything, room was shabby, paint pealing off the ceiling, outside view was a wall and a load of construction going on, got woken 5am with the noise, complained to the front desk who basically didn't offer any solution and blamed the City.  Don't stay in the west wing, and on the lower floors.

Overview- We stayed in a Bungalow King Suite June 30-July 5th that we booked directly through the hotel website but had a promotion code.  If you have never been to Vegas google Vegas promotion codes as there can be some awesome deals available.  Our promotion included all day access to the buffet everyday, 2 cocktails at the pool, 2 passes to Studio 54 or Tabu and 25% off spa services.

Check-In- Counter was busy but wait was only about 5-10 minutes.  Our room type was not available with a King so we had to settle for 2 queens with the promise of switching the following day to a King with a strip view. We checked in and arrived at our room to find the door slightly open and not cleaned.  We went back down and was switched to a second room and upon arrival found the door slightly open but clean this time. We were uncomfortable with accepting this room so went back down to check in and asked for a third room.  We were helped by Joey and she was able to get us a $60 dining credit for our troubles.  After this little problem everything went smoothly and we switched to a KIng Room with a view as promised the next day.

Room- As people have stated the decor and the TV is a little dated but how often are you in your room or watching TV, it's Vegas people.  Room was very spacious, comfortable bed, large closet, nice marble bathroom with double vanity and plenty of space.  Plumbing was a little slow but not a huge deal.

Casino-Massive is an understatement.  I think it is the largest gaming floor in the world.  Can't really comment on the gambling here as we are thrifty and chose to gamble at places with cheaper table minimums such as Bill's Gamblin Hall (they have 99 cent margaritas at the bar), Imperial Palace, Casino Royale and O'Sheas.  All of these places are not as fancy but you can find $5 roulette all day and even on weekends.

Food-Buffet was fine especially since it was free but if you had to pay it is not worth it.  Best buffets are at Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, Paris and Mirage.  Most restaurants here are very expensive.  We ate at Diego and Studio Cafe which are 2 of the cheaper sit down restaurants.  Both were pretty good.  There is also a small food court with a McDonald's, Nathan's and a pizza place on the way to the pool area.

Pool Area-  Awesome just like everyone says.  4 pools and a lazy river.  We stayed at the lazy river everyday as there is more shade and it's a lot of fun to just hop in the river and float around whenever you need to cool off.  There is quite a few kids with floats at the river everyday but there is plenty of room for everyone.  If you want good chairs get there by 11 on weekdays and 10 on Saturday as it is a lot busier on the weekend.  There is also seperate pool area called Wet Republic that is pretty much just for partying and functions like a nightclub with a cover charge and over priced drinks.  We did not go here as the lines can be enormous especially around the weekend and there is no shade and you have to pay for loungers.  If you are bringing kids I must warn that we saw 2 women with thongs at the lazy river on Saturday.

Entertainment- We saw Ka and it was good but we like "O" better on our last visit to Vegas. Also saw Crazy Horse Paris, it was okay. See Jubilee instead.  Best show we saw was Terry Fator at the Mirage, he is hilarious.  Keep in mind that you get discounts on shows at MGM if you are a guest.  We did use free passes to Studio 54 and it's best days are behind it.  If you want to go to clubs I recommend Tryst or XS or even LAX if you are okay with being shoulder to shoulder throughout the entire club.

Overall- Enjoyed our stay very much and the price was right for those on a budget.  If money were not an issue I would stay at the Venetian, Wynn or Encore as they appear to be immaculate.

Stayed at the west wing for four days.  Room was great and my stay was outstanding. The room was clean and organized. The staff was friendly and helpful with everything. I will definitely stay here again next year.

Just wanted to start of mentioning that this hotel is absolutely huge. Its also amazingly clean and very well lit.  I booked this hotel months ago for EDC week and after reading many reviews I was a bit skeptical. After staying for EDC week I'd have to say that it exceeds expectations. One downfall was the check-in process took what seemed like forever... Maybe it was edc week and everyone tried to check in at the same time. So I knew that there would be a wait regardless. Once I got to the counter the gentleman helping me was amazing. He was extremely nice and very resourceful. He made the check-in process a breeze. Took less than 5 minutes. We stayed in the Grand Tower Kings on the 21st floor. Which on the map looked far away but the elevator was literally right by check in. Our room was huge. Amazingly clean. A very modern look to the room. I also love that the window blinds actually block out the sun. From looking of the the window we had a clear view of the grand canyon I believe. As a frequent visitor to Las Vegas the last thing you want to happen was to wake up at 6am with the sun when you went to bed at 4am. I was able to call down to the front desk to get clean towels within minutes. Highspeed Wifi was a great plus I had very spotty phone reception and was able to make calls right through the Wifi connection without being dropped. Room Service? The menu is superb. Depends on the wait sometimes less than 20 mins and sometimes in the early morning (3am) the wait is a bit longer. For that weekend I believe it was 2 hours or so.There also is a food court area and a plethera of restaurants pretty much to cater to any kind of cuisine that you fancy  I love that there were two Starbucks located in MGM and one was just literally a few steps away once you go down to the main lobby.  As many as there is restaurants MGM has tons of things too do from WetRepublic, Hakkasan, TopGolf and their lazy river, you'll never be bored or out of things to do. I didnt have a cnance to experience these during my stay but conversations made with other hotel stayers in the elevators mentioned that MGM's pools are the best on the strip. As for late checkout that was a breeze. I was able to call the front desk the day beforehand and ask if it was available and it was so I was able to check out at 3pm! Checking out was probably the best part you can checkout from your phone your tv or waiting simply at the desk. I chose the option to checkout on the TV and was emailed a receipt of all that was charged straight to my email. This was my first stay at MGM Grand and from the Staff and the experience I had it definitely wont be my last.
Never going to stay here again. They want to charge me 25 bucks to check in early. They refuse to cancel my reservation. Never again

Wet Republic pool party today followed by live UFC 197 tonight! Feeling like Jon Jones is going to polish up his belt for a long term relationship! Rooms are clean and nice here. Upgrade recommendations include: bathroom fan, amenities with towel service, phone charger upgrade from iPhone 4 to 5 jack. pillow option. Staff were all great and bed comfy.

I really liked staying here this past weekend.  There was the big fight with Pacquia and Marques and you would think it would be crazy and out of control, but it was actually not bad.  After the fight, people left quickly and in control.  I didn't see any fights, which I expected.  A lot of celebrities were walking through and nothing got out of hand.  

The rooms were clean and had the softest beds ever.  I swear, it was like sleeping on a cloud.  The only weird thing was that we were on the 13th floor and usually, there isn't one in a hotel.  Unlucky 13 turned out to be our lucky number.  Won on the tables, won on machines, saw celebrities, had a great time.

The tables in the day are around $10 and slowly move up as the day goes on.  Around 2pm, it goes to around $15-25 and around 5pm most table minimums are at least $25.  This is good and bad depending on how much money you want to gamble with.  As I say, bet more win more.  I would stay here again because everything went really smooth and it is close to all of the other hotels on the strip.

Rooms were nice and the beds were comfortable but keep in mind they are only full size beds in double bed rooms.  They are very strict when it comes to access to the hotel rooms and they even patrol the hallways.  I saw a bunch of families here.  If you want a more adult crowd the Hard Rock \/ Palms might be good for you.

I'd stay here again if the price is right.  If you are into the night life you are probably better staying at Caesar' for Pure, Venetian for Tao so it's easier to get in, go back to the hotel room for a break or just get back to the room.

For a grand king, I was expecting a little more. Still, the MGM is a pretty solid hotel on the strip, and it's not overly expensive either. $133 for the grand king, and you get quite a view. Amenities include the usual health club, entry into Hakkasan, and of course, access to all of MGM's fantastic restaurants. I was expecting a fitness center, but I'm guessing Vegas goers aren't exactly worried about that. They also have self parking, so you don't have to pay for valet.

One of the dirtiest hotels I have ever stayed in.          
The atmosphere is nice, however it's really dirty.

First time staying & last !

I can't hate because I paid $250 for a trip from SFO to LAS for room and flight.  

Hotel was just OK for me.  Maybe, I'm bitching cause I didn't win a single dime here.  Room was more like 3 1\/2 stars for me.  It was clean with decent decor.  TV sucked big time though.  It took forever just to change the damn channel.  No refrigerator, no sofa.  I'm a bit of a hotel whore and I do expect much from a 4 star hotel.  Regardless it was comfy and they had decent room service and the non smoking rooms are really "non smoking".  I didn't smell a hint of smoke perhaps because they designate the whole entire floor as "non smoking".  

I didn't check out the pool so I can't speak for that but I'd definitely check out another spot when I come back to Vegas.  However, if the deal is as sweet as what I got for a two night stay, I'd stay here again.

MOST rooms have been renovated, so when we booked our most recent Vegas trip we thought we would stay here since we were attending an event at the arena. What are the odds that of all their rooms we would get stuck on the ONE section that has not yet been renovated? Yep, that's where they stuck us. My husband works for one of the largest travel companies and booked our room through their employee booking site, so it was QUITE disappointing to get there and find out we were in the West tower, especially considering how much business he sends there way year round due to business travel and conventions. We get to our room (which is a HIKE from the main casino floor) and it was nice enough, until we discovered around 1 AM that the roman shades are broken, and considering our room faced the strip and that GIGANTIC video board at the Aria it was about as bright as mid-day in the room. After two different folks came up to our room to check the shade they finally decided to just break the pulley system so that the shades would stay down and said they would come back in the morning to replace them, but that never happened. At random times throughout our stay we would get an overwhelming stench of sewage coming from the restroom, and whenever we used the shower it would leak all over the floor. But hey, we didn't come to Vegas to sit in a hotel room, we came to gamble, right?! IT WAS CLOSER FOR US TO WALK TO NEW YORK NEW YORK's CASINO TO GAMBLE THAN IT WAS TO WALK TO MGM GRAND'S OWN CASINO. That's how far out of the way our rooms were.
Overpriced hotel!  You can hear your neighbors from the hallway, through the walls, etc.  Food court doesn't take room charge... stupid.  I would stay at Cosmo any day of the week.
